FXUS64 KMRX 010523

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1223 AM EST SUN JAN 1 2012

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. EXPECT A
FEW SHOWERS AROUND...WILL CARRY VCSH A FEW HOURS. LOW LEVEL JET
INCREASES SHARPLY LATE TONIGHT/EARLY SUN...AND WITH SURFACE WINDS
STILL ON THE LIGHT SIDE WILL CARRY LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR FOR A BRIEF
PERIOD. ALSO EXPECT SOME BRIEF MVFR CONDITIONS DURING SUNDAY...WITH
CONDITIONS IMPROVING BACK TO VFR LATER DURING THE DAY.

105 
FXUS64 KMRX 010210
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EST SAT DEC 31 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A SIGNIFICANT AIR MASS CHANGE IS IN STORE IN THE SHORT TERM AS A 
STRONG COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE AREA AROUND MIDDAY TOMORROW. 
ANOTHER NIGHT OF UNSEASONABLY MILD TEMPERATURES IS EXPECTED...WITH 
LOWS IN THE MID 30S TO MID 40S. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE FROM 
WEST TO EAST WITH THE ADVECTION OF HIGHER THETA-E AIR AT 850 MB 
BETWEEN 09Z-12Z. NO PRECIP IS EXPECTED AS THE MOISTURE IS VERY 
SHALLOW AND THE LIFT IS WEAK. THIS WINDOW OF MOISTURE IS ONLY OPEN 
FOR A SHORT TIME AS ADVECTION OF COLDER AND DRIER AIR KICKS IN 
BETWEEN 15-18Z. TEMPERATURE GRIDS WILL FEATURE A NON-STANDARD 
DIURNAL CURVE WITH TEMPS WARMING LATE TONIGHT...PEAKING IN THE 
MORNING...THEN FALLING SLIGHTLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. WENT BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES. IT WILL ALSO BE BREEZY TOMORROW WITH 
WEST WINDS AT 15-25 MPH AND HIGHER GUSTS. THIS SHOULD STAY JUST 
BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...BY THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD THE COLD FRONT HAS PASSED AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS 
BUILDING INTO THE REGION.  ALOFT...THE UPPER TROUGH OVERHEAD WITH A 
COUPLE OF WAVES TO MOVE THROUGH THE OVERALL FLOW.  THE FIRST WAVE 
SWINGING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...HAS MOST OF ITS ENERGY TO OUR NORTH.

THE SECOND WAVE MOVING THROUGH ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WILL PLOW 
DEEP INTO THE CWA...BUT ITS AXIS LOOKS LIKE IT WILL EXIT THE AREA BY 
DAYBREAK TUESDAY.  LIGHT SNOW AMOUNTS ARE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS WITH FLURRIES IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS.

HOWEVER...THE OVERALL TROFFINESS ALOFT LINGERS...AND ANOTHER WEAKER 
SHORT WAVE RACES THROUGH WEDNESDAY OR WEDNESDAY EVENING...BUT THE 
AIR MASS LOOKS TOO DRY TO OFFER ANY PRECIP.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING STRUGGLES TO BUILD IN FOR A COUPLE OF 
DAYS...THEN AT THE END OF THE PERIOD THE NEXT SYSTEM IS 
APPROACHING.  GFS MOS SEEMS TOO WET IN COMPARISON WITH ENSEMBLES 
AND EURO...SO CUT BACK ON POPS WITH THIS SYSTEM.  ALSO...LOOKS LIKE 
POPS WILL HAPPEN PRIOR TO COOL-DOWN...SO LEAVING WEATHER AS ALL 
LIQUID FOR NOW.

VERY COLD TEMPS ON THE WAY FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK...WENT 
PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             43  59  27  44  21 /   0  10   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  56  25  39  18 /   0  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  54  26  40  18 /   0  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              34  55  23  36  16 /   0  10  20  20  20

THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. TRI MAY ALSO SEE A FEW WIND GUSTS UNTIL

SHOULD SEE CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE AREA WITH LIGHT AND VARIABLE
WINDS. BROKEN VFR CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN LATE TONIGHT AROUND 10-12Z
AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. FRONTAL PASSAGE IS
EXPECTED LATE IN THE TAF PERIOD...AROUND 16Z...AND WILL BE FOLLOWED
BY WIND GUSTS AROUND 25 KTS.

004 
FXUS64 KMRX 310934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
434 AM EST SAT DEC 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BRIEF DAY OF HIGH PRESSURE AS WE
FIND OURSELVES BETWEEN THE DEPARTING SYSTEM AND THE NEXT ONE TO
COME SUNDAY. WITH FAIRLY LIGHT WINDS AND LOTS OF SUN TODAY...TEMPS
WILL BE PRETTY MILD WITH MID TO UPPER 50S FOR HIGHS FOR MOST OF THE
VALLEY. FROPA OVERNIGHT TONIGHT MAY BRING MORE SPRINKLES...BUT WILL
LEAVE OUT A MENTION OF RAIN TONIGHT AT THIS TIME.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH MIGRATES EAST TO
THE GREAT LAKES AT THE START OF THE PERIOD WITH DEEP SURFACE LOW
OVER NORTHERN LAKE MICHIGAN AND COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS
MIDDLE TENNESSEE. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW ONLY A NARROW RIBBON OF
70 TO 80 PERCENT MEAN RH IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FROPA AND ALMOST
NON-EXISTENT POPS. STAYED WITH THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS
WITH THIS VERY LIGHT IF NOT TRACE PRECIP EVENT. THE FRONT MOVES
THROUGH DURING THE MORNING WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING MUCH OF THE AREA
BY AFTERNOON. STRENGTHENING COLD AIR ADVECTION DEVELOPS LATE IN THE
DAY AND THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AS JET ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF
THE GREAT LAKES AND ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. DEEPENING MOISTURE WILL
ACCOMPANY THE AMPLIFYING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
AND MAINTAINED THE HIGHER TERRAIN...SLIGHT THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE
POPS INITIALLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE NORTHERN
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES WITH EXPANSION LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT EVERYWHERE BUT SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS SHOULD RESULT IN
OROGRAPHIC SNOWFALL ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN BUT WITH EXTREMELY
COLD AIR ALOFT BUILDING IN ACROSS THE REGION...MUCH OF THE GREAT
VALLEY COULD SEE SNOW FLURRIES BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND POSSIBLY
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS MONDAY EVENING. THE UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED
DEEP MOISTURE GRADUALLY LIFT OUT ON TUESDAY BRINGING AN END TO THE
WINTRY PRECIP. STILL DON'T EXPECT ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL WITH
SOME LIMITATION TO AVAILABLE MOISTURE. THE POSSIBILITY OF ONE OR
TWO INCHES OF SNOW EXISTS FOR SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS FOR
THE DURATION OF THE EVENT.

MODELS INDICATE ANOTHER COUPLE SHORTER WAVELENGTH TROUGHS SWING 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
BUT MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LIMITED WITH THESE SYSTEMS SO KEPT A DRY
FORECAST GOING MID WEEK. ANOTHER...MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM
APPROACHES THE AREA ON FRIDAY BUT DOES NOT APPEAR TO IMPACT THE
FORECAST AREA UNTIL SATURDAY.

STAYED CLOSE TO TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE THROUGH MONDAY BUT HAD TO TRIM 
A FEW DEGREES OFF MAX TEMPS AFTER MONDAY WHILE ADDING A DEGREE OR 
TWO TO SUGGESTED MINS.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  40  56  30  43 /   0  10  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  37  53  29  38 /   0  10  20  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  37  52  29  38 /   0  10  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  35  51  25  35 /   0  10  20  10  10

424 
FXUS64 KMRX 310235
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EST FRI DEC 30 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A FEW SHOWERS DEVELOPING IN KY. WILL 
LEAVE CURRENT POPS FOR TONIGHT AS IS. WILL REMOVE EVENING WORDING. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES...WITH THE 
ASSOCIATED TROUGH AXIS AND SURFACE FRONT CROSSING OUR AREA TONIGHT. 
MIDLEVEL COOLING AND VORTICITY ADVECTION WILL PROVIDE SOME WEAK 
LIFT...BUT MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED TO A SHALLOW LAYER BELOW 800 MB. 
SOME LIGHT SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES MAY DEVELOP...BUT ONLY A A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH OF PRECIP AT MOST. WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP NORTH AND SPRINKLES OVERNIGHT. LEANED TOWARD THE WARM 
SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPECTED EXTENSIVE CLOUD 
COVER. ADVECTION OF DRIER LOW LEVEL AIR SHOULD GIVE MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES BY SATURDAY MORNING...AND WITH NEARLY FULL SUN WE SHOULD SEE 
TEMPS RISE WELL INTO THE 50S. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY PUSH THROUGH THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. MOISTURE IS QUITE
LIMITED AND HAVE KEPT POPS LOW AND CONFINED TO SUNDAY. MUCH COOLER
AIR MOVES IN FOR MONDAY. THOUGH MOISTURE REMAINS
LIMITED...NORTHWEST FLOW MAY GENERATE A FEW ISOLATED AREAS OF LIGHT
SNOW OR FLURRIES OVER NORMAL FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS AROUND THE
MONDAY TIME FRAME. SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR THE REST OF THE
PERIOD FOR GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS AND COLD TEMPERATURES ON
TUESDAY WILL SEE A SLOW WARMING TREND WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  59  40  56  30 /  10   0  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  56  37  53  29 /  10   0  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  56  37  52  29 /  10   0  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              40  53  35  51  25 /  20   0  10  20  10

450 
FXUS64 KMRX 301712 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1212 PM EST FRI DEC 30 2011

.AVIATION...
A MIXTURE OF CLOUDS AT VARIOUS HEIGHTS IS OBSERVED FROM NORTHERN AL
TO KY...SO CONFIDENCE IN THE EXACT CEILING FORECAST IS LOW. SOME
MVFR CEILINGS ACROSS NORTHERN AL/GA MAY MOVE IN TO CHA IN THE NEXT
FEW HOURS...AND WILL CARRY A TEMPO THERE TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.
ELSEWHERE...CEILINGS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN VFR THROUGH THE
PERIOD...BUT THERE ARE SOME INDICATIONS FROM MODELS THAT LOW CLOUDS
MAY DEVELOP OVERNIGHT AS A TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE CROSSES THE AREA.
CONFIDENCE IN THIS OCCURRING IS TOO LOW TO MENTION IT IN THE TAF
YET. WE SHOULD SEE SCATTERED OR CLEAR CONDITIONS RETURN TOMORROW
MORNING AT ALL SITES.

NC...NONE.

348 
FXUS64 KMRX 301444 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
944 AM EST FRI DEC 30 2011

.DISCUSSION...
A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW IN THE UPPER LEVELS WILL BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED
THROUGH THE DAY AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT
LAKES. SHALLOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HAS ADVECTED NORTHWARD IN THE SW
LOW LEVEL FLOW AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. MOISTURE WILL REMAIN SHALLOW
AND LIFT VERY WEAK THROUGH THE DAY...BUT BOTH WILL INCREASE THIS
EVENING AS THE FLOW AMPLIFIES AND THE UPPER JET MOVES INTO A MORE
FAVORABLE POSITION TO OUR NORTH. AS A RESULT...AND CHANCE OF
SPRINKLES OR LIGHT PRECIP IS LIKELY TO COME THIS EVENING...AROUND
OR AFTER 00Z.

WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE THE MENTION OF SPRIKLES THIS AFTERNOON...AND
MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUD COVER AND TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

837 
FXUS64 KMRX 300940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
440 AM EST FRI DEC 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... A BRIEF WINDOW OF S/SW LOW LEVEL FLOW
WILL HELP PROVIDE A MILD DAY TODAY WITH INCREASING CLOUD COVER AND
SOME AFTERNOON/EVENING SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES. THE CULPRIT...A FAST
MOVING SHORTWAVE THAT WILL CLIP THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES
TODAY/TONIGHT...ACCOMPANIED BY SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AND TRAILING
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. FLOW WILL TEMPORARILY BECOME WESTERLY DURING THE
PRE-DAWN HOURS SATURDAY MORNING BEFORE THE NEXT FAST MOVING FRONT
APPROACHES FOR SUNDAY. SATLT SHOWING LOW CLOUDS ALREADY KNOCKING ON
CHATTANOOGA/S DOOR AS SHALLOW GULF MOISTURE IS CARRIED NORTHWARD
AHEAD OF TODAY/S FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...IT APPEARS WINTER WILL 
BEGIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THIS PORTION OF 
THE FORECAST AS DEEP LONG WAVE TROUGHING FINDS A HOME OVER THE 
EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS WERE 
RELATIVELY CLOSE THROUGH TUESDAY BUT DIVERGE DURING THE LAST COUPLE 
DAYS OF THE LONG TERM. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE ECMWF THROUGH 
THURSDAY. THE PERIOD STARTS OUT WITH AN EXITING NORTHERN OHIO 
VALLEY/EASTERN LAKES SHORT WAVE. STAYED WITH PREVIOUS THINKING ON 
THIS SYSTEM WHICH ALLOWS FOR A RAPID EXIT AND DRY ADVECTION ACROSS 
THE VIEWING AREA SO NEW YEAR'S EVE SHOULD BE QUIET WEATHER DAY. 
HOWEVER...NEXT SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL BE RAPIDLY 
APPROACHING THE REGION AND BY 12Z SUNDAY THE FRONT WILL BE ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS SYSTEM WILL NOT HAVE MUCH MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE FOR LIFTING SO KEPT POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY FOR 
RAIN SHOWERS AND APPLIED ONLY ON THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES 
INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS FOR SUNDAY. TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND ASSOCIATED 
MOISTURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON SUNDAY NIGHT IMPACTING 
MAINLY THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS. MUCH COLDER...ARCTIC AIR WILL STREAM SOUTH ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL LEAD TO THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS. KEPT POPS AT SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR THIS EVENT. THE CHILLY AIR WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD SOUTH 
OUT OF CANADA MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT AND MODEL FORECASTS INDICATE 
A STRENGTHENING SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND DEEP MOISTURE WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. PLACED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWERS 
WITH THIS FEATURE. COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE TO POUR INTO THE REGION ON 
TUESDAY BUT THE AIR SHOULD BE DRY. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL 
GRADUALLY DEAMPLIFY SHUTTING DOWN THE ARCTIC CHILL BY WEDNESDAY BUT 
TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. STAYED WITH 
A DRY THURSDAY AS RIDGING BUILDS EAST FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 
CONCERNING TEMPS WENT FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE NEW MEX MOS.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  37  56  38  54 /  10  10   0  10  10

201 
FXUS64 KMRX 300252
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 PM EST THU DEC 29 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL TONIGHT AS AN UPPER TROUGH MOVES 
OFF THE EAST COAST. PLENTY OF DRY AIR UPSTREAM SUGGESTS A CLEAR 
NIGHT WITH GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. HOWEVER A TIGHTENING 
PRESSURE GRADIENT MAY HELP KEEP SOME MIXING GOING...AND THUS HELP 
KEEP TEMPS UP A BIT AND PREVENT MUCH FOG FORMATION. 

A CLOSED LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TOMORROW AND TOMORROW 
NIGHT. THE DEEP SURFACE LOW TO OUR NORTH WILL CREATE A 10-20 MPH SW 
WIND TOMORROW...WHICH SHOULD HELP TEMPERATURES RISE INTO THE MID AND 
UPPER 50S IN THE VALLEY DESPITE INCREASING CLOUD COVER THROUGH THE 
DAY. A STRONG UPPER JET STREAK AND 500 MB VORTICITY WILL PROVIDE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES BY THE AFTERNOON IN THE NORTH...BUT DEEP LIFT 
AND MOISTURE ARE BOTH LACKING. THE NAM...GFS...AND SREF ALL PUT OUT 
A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH OF PRECIP LATE FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BUT THIS SEEMS A BIT OVERDONE. WILL CONFINE THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP TO NORTHERN SECTIONS ON FRIDAY EVENING WHEN FROPA WILL 
OCCUR...AND MENTION JUST SPRINKLES FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NOT MUCH CHANGE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST. WE WILL FIND OURSELVES IN A
FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN THIS WEEKEND THROUGH NEXT
THURSDAY...PROGRESSIVE ENOUGH THAT THE GULF WILL REMAIN CUT OFF.
MOISTURE WILL BE INHIBITED FROM RETURNING TO ANY EXTENT THAT COULD
RESULT IN CONSEQUENTIAL PRECIP.

A SECOND COLD FRONT IN AS MANY DAYS WILL SWING THROUGH SUNDAY...
USHERED IN BY FAIRLY LARGE UPPER TROUGH. A QUICK SHOT OF LIGHT
RAIN WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT...WILL GO WITH 20 PERCENT POPS
SUNDAY. FLURRIES OVER THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS POSSIBLE MONDAY AND
MONDAY NIGHT. THE COLD AIR COMING IN WITH THE LARGE UPPER TROUGH
MAKES THE COMING WORK WEEK LOOK TO BE THE COLDEST OF THE SEASON SO
FAR...WITH HIGHS IN THE 30S AND 40S. MAY SEE LOWS IN THE TEENS
ACROSS THE VALLEY FROM KNOXVILLE NORTHEASTWARD THROUGH TRI-CITIES
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY MORNINGS. A SUBSEQUENT WEAKER DISTURBANCE
MAY PROVIDE INCREASING CLOUDS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY BUT NO
PRECIP IS IN VIEW AT THIS TIME.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  59  38  59  38 /   0  10  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  57  37  56  36 /   0  10  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       34  57  36  56  37 /   0  10  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              29  57  36  52  30 /   0  10  20   0  10

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

774 
FXUS64 KMRX 290826
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 AM EST THU DEC 29 2011

.SHORT (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO TRACK 
THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT REMAINS TO THE NORTH 
SO WILL KEEP A DRY FORECAST FOR TODAY. BUT SHOULD SEE AN INCREASE IN 
HIGH CLOUDS FOR TODAY ASSOCIATED WITH THE DISTURBANCE. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TONIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES 
LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE EXTENDED WILL BE
CHARACTERIZED WITH RELATIVELY DRY WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH
A SERIES OF FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE TROUGHS MOVING FROM THE NORTHERN
PLAINS TO THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. FIRST WAVE MOVES THROUGH
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. LIMITED MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS SHOW ONLY
INCLUDED SLIGHT POPS NORTH WITH SPRINKLES POSSIBLE ELSEWHERE.

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH FOR LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH A
FRONTAL PASSAGE EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. AGAIN LIMITED MOISTURE AND
DYNAMICS SO ONLY INCLUDED A CHANCE OF SPRINKES.

THE UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS EARLY NEXT WEEK ACROSS THE NORTHEAST
UNITED STATES AND SOUTHEAST CANADA WITH FAIRLY DECENT COLD AIR
ADVECTION INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHAINS. AGAIN...DUE TO LIMITED
MOISTURE...UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE MOUNTAINS WILL NOT PRODUCE MUCH IN
THE WAY OF SNOW. HAVE INCLUDED A CHANCE OF FLURRIES FOR THE MOUNTAINS.
MAIN FEATURE WILL BE THE COLDEST AIR SO FAR THIS WINTER WITH VERY
CHILLY MORNING LOWS IN THE TEENS AND LOWER 20S.

846 
FXUS64 KMRX 290303
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST WED DEC 28 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
A BROAD CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT WILL BE IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN
CONUS THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE NW LOW LEVEL FLOW AND COLD
ADVECTION THAT WE HAD LAST NIGHT AND THIS MORNING WILL TRANSITION
TO A W-SW FLOW WITH NEAR NEUTRAL ADVECTION. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE REGION TONIGHT...SHIFTING EAST
TO THE CAROLINA COAST TOMORROW.

SOME THIN HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
TROUGH AND JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THIS EVENING...OTHERWISE CLEAR
SKIES ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD. WINDS WILL BE CALM
TONIGHT...THEN PICK UP DURING THE DAY TO 10-15 MPH AS A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION. MOS GUIDANCE
TEMPERATURES WILL BE FOLLOWED CLOSELY TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...WITH
LOWS IN THE 20S TO LOWER 30S AND HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A PROGRESSIVE WEATHER PATTERN EXPECTED FOR THE EXTENDED. EARLY IN
THE PERIOD THE MAIN FEATURES ARE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WITH A LOW TO OUR
NORTH. THIS WILL BRING IN A FEW CLOUDS OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND
POSSIBLY A STRAY LIGHT SHOWER OVER FAR NORTHERN LOCATIONS THURSDAY
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL ON SATURDAY. A COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH ON SUNDAY. MOISTURE LIMITED AND LIFT RATHER WEAK AND WILL
KEEP POPS LOW AS THE FRONT TRACKS THROUGH. AN UPPER TOUGH WILL BE
OVER THE REGION MONDAY AND TUESDAY WITH COOLER AIR MOVING IN. WITH
NORTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE AND MINIMAL MOISTURE...A FEW FLURRIES FROM
UPSLOPE FLOW IS POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN ON MONDAY/MONDAY
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

ACCORDING TO THE RUC AND NAM. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE ALL POPS...AND
WILL ALLOW THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY TO EXPIRE AT 10AM. ONLY
MINOR ADJUSTEMENTS WILL BE MADE TO HOURLY TEMPERATURES AND SKY
GRIDS FOR THE UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EST WED DEC 28 2011

.SHORT (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT TODAY. 
WITH SOME LINGERING MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE CONDITIONS BEHIND THE 
FRONT...EXPECTING SNOW SHOWERS TO CONTINUE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
SO EXTENDED THE ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM. THE REST OF AREA SHOULD BE DRY 
TODAY. CLOUDS SHOULD BE DECREASING TODAY AS THE FRONT EXITS THE 
AREA. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL TODAY. THE PRESSURE 
GRADIENT HAS RELAXED SO WINDS WILL BELOW ADVISORY TODAY. HIGH 
PRESSURE PUSHES IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TONIGHT ALONG WITH NEAR 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE EXTENDED WILL BE
CHARACTERIZED BY DRY WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW WITH FAST MOVING
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND
GREAT LAKES. GFS DOES SHOW A MORE PRONOUNCED UPPER TROUGH
DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHEAST CANADA/NORTHEAST UNITED STATES LATE THIS
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT CONFIDENCE LOW ON STRENGTH AND
LOCATION OF UPPER TROUGH.

MOST PLACES WILL REMAIN DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT HAVE INCLUDED
A SLIGHT POP FOR NORTHEAST SECTIONS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. GFS SHOWS A
FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY. SPRINKLES/LIGHT RAIN
POSSIBLE...BUT CONFIDENCE OF MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION LOW...SO KEPT
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.

FOR LATE THIS WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK...COLD TEMPERATURES IN STORE
NORTHEAST UPPER LOW DEEPENS.

&&

.SHORT TERM  (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL

DIMINISHING AND EXPECT THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE 
AT 23Z.  COOLER AIR MOVING IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM WILL CHANGE RAIN TO 
SNOW OVER MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN.  THE HIGHEST ELEVATION COULD SEE 
ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES BY MORNING AND A SNOW ADVISORY IS IN 
PLACE.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR WEDNESDAY AS PRECIP ENDS 
AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR DECREASING CLOUDS AND WINDS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE AREA AT BEGINNING OF PERIOD. SURFACE RIDGE GRADUALLY 
SUPPRESSES SOUTH THROUGH FRIDAY AS WEAK IMPULSES SLIDE SE THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY. SOME CLOUDS...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS WITH DAY 
TIME TEMPS SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. GFS STRAYS SIGNIFICANTLY FROM CMC 
AND ECMWF SO HAVE LEANED AWAY FROM FASTER GFS FOR REMAINDER OF 
FORECAST. LOW CONFIDENCE DAYS 5-7. WARM UP SHOULD CONTINUE INTO 
WEEKEND WILL RISING HEIGHTS OVER AREA IN ADVANCE OF NEXT COLD FRONT. 
THIS SYSTEM EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE ON 
SUNDAY WITH SOME RAINSHOWER ACTIVITY. DID NOT BUY FULLY INTO VERY 
COLD ECMWF SOLUTION EARLY NEXT WEEK.

.AVIATION...

THIS MORNING. PERIODS OF RAIN WILL PERSIST AT ALL TAF SITES 
THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE DAY...BUT COVERAGE AND INTENSITY WILL 
DECREASE. RAIN WILL END FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING.

FROPA IS OCCURRING AT CHA AND IS EXPECTED AT TYS AROUND 13Z AND TRI 
BY 15Z. WINDS WILL BECOME SOUTHWEST AND INCREASE TO SUSTAINED WINDS 
OF 12-18KTS WITH GUSTS BETWEEN 20 AND 25KTS.

FXUS64 KMRX 270903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EST TUE DEC 27 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN IMPRESSIVE SYSTEM WILL MOVE
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT. WATER VAPOR
ALONG WITH PVU ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG TROPOPAUSE FOLD HELPING TO
STRENGHTEN SYSTEM THIS MORNING. SYSTEM BECOMES NEGATIVE TILTED WITH
STRONG PRESSURE FALLS AHEAD OF THE SHORT-WAVE TROUGH. THE STRONG
PRESSURE FALLS IS STRENGTHENING THE BOUNDARY LAYER JET. LATEST 06Z
NAM SHOWS 75-80KT 850MB JET OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT
FOOTHILLS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS CONDUCIVE FOR A STRONG
MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT THIS MORNING. CAMP CREEK WIND TOWER IS ALREADY
REPORTING WIND GUSTS UP TO 80 MPH. HAVE ISSUED A HIGH WIND WARNING
FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...WASHINGTON-RUSSELL
COUNTIES OF VIRGINIA AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS UNTIL 15Z.

AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...WINDS WILL BECOMING SOUTHWESTERLY WITH
WINDY CONDITIONS ANTICIPATED AREA-WIDE UNTIL LATE THIS
AFTERNOON...THUS HAVE ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY AREA-WIDE.

BESIDES THE WIND...STRONG SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A
BAND OF SHOWERS PUSHING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH
WRAP- AROUND SHOWERS (MAINLY NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA AND
MOUNTAINS) FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

FOR TONIGHT...WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW WILL
CONTINUE PRECIPITATION MAINLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. COLD AIR
ADVECTION WILL COOL VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE TO ALLOW RAIN TO
CHANGE TO SNOW. LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES
ANTICIPATED FOR THE FAVORED NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL AREAS...THUS A
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKING OUT OF THE AREA. STILL A FEW FLURRIES POSSIBLE INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. BUT 
ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL WILL BE LIMITED. HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO AREA 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. A SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE 
AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH STILL MODELS DIFFERENCES...WILL KEEP FRIDAY 
DRY AND ONLY KEEP THE LOW POPS INTO FRIDAY NIGHT OVER SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. MODELS INDICATING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY. SOME 
DIFFERENCES FOR THE TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT IN THE SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY TIME FRAME. GFS IS MUCH QUICKER ON BRINGING PRECIPITATION 
INTO SUNDAY THAN THE ECMWF. WILL GO THE SLOWER ECMWF AND HOLD OFF 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

384 
FXUS64 KMRX 270222 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 PM EST MON DEC 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...
00Z OHX SOUNDING FEATURES A VERY DRY LAYER BELOW 700 MB AND A
STRONG INVERSION UP TO 850 MB. EVAPORATIVE COOLING FROM PRECIP
FALLING INTO THE DRY LAYER WILL BE OFFSET BY STRENGTHENING WARM
ADVECTION TO MAINTAIN THE INVERSION OVERNIGHT. ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE
NEEDED TO TEMPERATURE GRIDS TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. 

POP/WX GRIDS LOOK GOOD AS PRECIP IS ON OUR DOORSTEP...THOUGH SOME
MAY EVAPORATE BEFORE REACHING THE GROUND. DEEP LIFT REALLY BEGINS
TO STRENGTHEN AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND CATEGORICAL POPS WILL BEGIN
AROUND THAT TIME.

SO FAR WINDS HAVE BEEN UNDER 20 KTS IN THE MOUNTAINS...BUT AS SEEN
IN THE 00Z BMX SOUNDING...A STRONG LLJ IS DEVELOPING. WILL KEEP THE
WIND ADVISORY GOING AS IS...BUT ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS WILL LIKELY
HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...
     SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

253 PM EST MON DEC 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WEATHER SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH 
THE REGION THIS SHORT TERM WILL BRING WIDESPREAD RAIN ACROSS THE 
AREA.  TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT SHOULD KEEP THE VAST MAJORITY OF 
PRECIP AS RAIN.  HOWEVER...A FEW POCKETS OF MIX PRECIP INCLUDING 
LIGHT SNOW OR EVEN FREEZING RAIN IS POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
OF OUR NORTHEAST CWA.  THIS IS EXPECTED TO BE QUITE ISOLATED AND NO 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED.  THE MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS WILL EXIT THE 
AREA TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH ONLY SCATTERED SHOWERS EXPECTED BY LATE 
IN THE DAY.  AS THE SYSTEM APPROACHES OVERNIGHT...WILL SEE THE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTEN WITH STRONG...GUSTY WINDS EXPECTED OVER 
THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS.  WILL ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THIS AREA 
TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING.  A BRIEF LULL IN WIND STRENGTH 
EXPECTED AS THE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH AND SHIFTS WINDS TO THE 
NORTHWEST TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  THEN...WILL SEE WINDS INCREASE ONCE 
AGAIN ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA...HOWEVER THIS WIND FIELD SHOULD 
REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...QUICK SHOT OF LIGHT SNOW 
TUESDAY NIGHT. GOOD CONDITIONS WILL BE BRIEF WITH A TOUCH OF CAPE 
AVAILABLE ALONG WITH LINGERING MOISTURE AND MODERATE UPSLOPE NW 
FLOW. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND WEAK WARMING. SHORT WAVE MOVING 
THROUGH OHIO VALLEY FRIDAY SUPPRESSES RIDGE OVER MRX CWA. WILL SEE 
AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER...FAVORING NORTHERN AREA. LOW CHANCE FOR 
PRECIPITATION ACROSS SW VA FRI NGT. WARM UP FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WEEKEND. NEXT COLD FRONT MAY MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY THOUGH 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON TIMING.

FXUS64 KMRX 260747
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 AM EST MON DEC 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREAS OF DENSE FOG REMAINS
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE ALONG AND
SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. HAVE EXPANDED ADVISORY TO COVER THE ENTIRE
VALLEY UNTIL 13Z. DRIER AIR OVER THE PLATEAU WILL EVENTUALLY ERODE
THE FOG...SO VISIBILITIES SHOULD IMPROVE TOWARD SUNRISE.

FOR TODAY...RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL KEEP CONDITIONS
DRY...BUT A GOOD DEAL OF HIGH CLOUDS ANTICIPATED.

FOR TONIGHT...UPPER TROUGH ACROS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL APPROACH
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS BECOMING SOUTHERLY
AND INCREASING TOWARD DAYBREAK TUESDAY. THE INCREASING SOUTHERLY
WINDS WILL PRODUCE MODERATE TO STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT. ALSO
INCREASING DIVERGENCE ALOFT AND QG FORCING TOWARD DAYBREAK WILL
PRODUCE WIDESPREAD RAIN SPREADING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST.

SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL BE AT OR CLOSE TO FREEZING OVER THE FAR
NORTHEAST SO A CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN (POSSIBLY ICE PELLETS)
POSSIBLE...BUT NO ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE TO TWO COOLER THAN GFS MOS GUIDANCE DUE TO
PERFORMANCE THE PAST COUPLE DAYS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SYSTEM PULLS OUT BY LATE 
TUESDAY WITH COLDER AIR WRAPPING IN BEHIND DEPARTING SYSTEM. PRECIP 
MAY BRIEFLY END AS LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY 
OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. A SERIES OF WEAK NORTHERN STREAM SHORT 
WAVES TRANSLATE ACROSS THE NORTHERN CONUS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF 
THE WORK WEEK...BUT IMPACT EXPECTED TO BE MINIMAL ON THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. MODEL AGREEMENT DETERIORATES BY LATE IN THE LONG 
TERM. MADE ONLY A FEW MINOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST FOR 
THAT TIME FRAME. FOR TEMPS... GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CLOUDS DECREASING STEADILY FROM

LAYER MAY BE JUST MOIST ENOUGH FOR PATCHY FOG MAINLY NEAR/ALONG AREA 
LAKES. GFS MOS MINS LOOKED QUITE REASONABLE PROVIDED DEW POINT TEMPS 
FALL AFTER SUNSET. 

FOR MONDAY...12Z MODELS ONCE AGAIN SUGGEST NO SHOWERS UNTIL AFTER 
27/00Z...SO I OPTED TO DROP OUR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SE TN MONDAY 
AFTERNOON. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AND THERE IS LESS ESE 
DOWNSLOPE FLOW INDICATED FOR THE NRN/CENTRAL VALLEY...SO I BLENDED 
MAX TEMPS WHERE ANY SLIGHT MOS DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WET BEGINNING OF THE 
EXTENDED AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE REGION.  THIS 
WILL BEGIN WIDESPREAD SHOWERS INTO THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WITH 
COOLER AIR MOVING IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM...RAIN MAY MIX WITH OR CHANGE 
TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH THE SYSTEM EXITING THE 
AREA.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  
MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR BY THE END OF THE PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE 
LESSENS...BUT COULD SEE A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDE THROUGH AROUND 
FRIDAY TO SATURDAY.  BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT APPEAR TO STAY NORTH AND 
WILL KEEP SOME 20 POPS FOR THIS PERIOD.  BIGGER QUESTION ON SUNDAY 
BUT WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST SAT DEC 24 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN FEATURE FOR TONIGHT
WILL BE VARYING AMOUNTS OF HIGH CLOUDS...AHEAD OF THE SW U.S. UPPER
LOW. EXPECT CLOUDS TO BE THINNER OVER SW VA AND NE TN...SO WENT
CLOSER TO COOLER MOS MINS THERE. CLOUDS SHOULD SLIGHTLY AFFECT MINS
OVER SRN AREAS...WHICH FAVORS WARMER NAM MOS MINS.

GULF COAST SYSTEM SHOULD MAINLY BRING SOME SHOWERS TO GULF COAST
STATES...BUT I SAW NO REASON NOT TO KEEP OUR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON
CHRISTMAS DAY FOR SE TN AND SW NC. DECREASING CLOUDS SUNDAY NIGHT
WITH MIN TEMPS VERY NEAR SEASONAL NORMALS. MOS TEMPS CLOSE FOR
THESE 2 PERIODS AND I GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS NUMBERS.

FOR MONDAY...MODEL TREND IS TO SLOW DOWN SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE SW
UPPER LOW...BUT I KEPT OUR LOW POPS IN FOR SE TN AND SW NC IN THE
AFTERNOON FOR NOW. LOW LEVEL FLOW SETS UP FOR ESE DOWNSLOPE INTO
NRN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS...SO IF CLOUDS ARE NOT TOO THICK...
THEN HIGHS MIGHT EXCEED MOS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON IN THOSE AREAS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODEL FORECASTS CLOSE 
IN DEPICTION OF FIRST SYSTEM WHICH BUILDS NORTHEAST FROM THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY AND ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS BY TUESDAY NIGHT. 
SHOULD BE ANOTHER WARM SYSTEM WITH DECENT RAINFALL AMOUNTS. PRECIP 
BASICALLY COMPLETED PRIOR TO STRONGEST COLD AIR ADVECTION SO NO SNOW 
EXPECTED. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD SO TOOK A BLEND OF THE ECMWF AND GFS WHICH ALLOWS FOR A LOW 
AMPLITUDE UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE ABOUT WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY TIMEFRAME. 
THIS SYSTEM APPEARS HARMLESS AT THE MOMENT AND MAINTAINED A DRY 
FORECAST MID WEEK UNTIL THE APPROACH OF A STRENGTHENING UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH WHICH IMPACTS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AROUND THE LATE 
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY TIME PERIOD. ONCE AGAIN TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
RELATIVELY MILD STAYING SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL SO STAYED WITH 
A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...FOCUS OF LONG TERM REVOLVES 
MAINLY AROUND SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE LATE MONDAY TO EARLY TUESDAY TIME FRAME 
PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS GENERALLY 
DEPICT UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER THE SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO REGION TO 
SLOWLY ADVANCE EASTWARD BEFORE WEAKENING INTO AN OPEN WAVE AND 
ACCELERATING NORTHEASTWARD BY TUESDAY. BASED ON THE VERY NATURE OF 
CUT-OFF LOWS...TIMING IS STILL SOMEWHAT OF AN ISSUE. HOWEVER... 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD ENOUGH AGREEMENT...ALONG WITH A MAJORITY OF 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS...TO HAVE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO BUMP UP POPS TO 
LIKELY LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. BALANCE OF LONG TERM 
APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME WITH THE POSSIBLE EXCEPTION OF FRIDAY NIGHT 
WHEN ANOTHER SYSTEM AS DEPICTED BY THE ECMWF MODEL APPROACHES. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY WITH A 
FEW EXCEPTIONS WHERE THOSE VALUES WERE ADJUSTED BASED ON TRENDS IN 
THE LATEST ENSEMBLE DATA.

FXUS64 KMRX 232010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST FRI DEC 23 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH CHRISTMAS DAY)...MAIN CONCERN FOR
TONIGHT IS HOW MUCH CLOUDS DECREASE. CLOUDS ARE ERODING OVER THE
OHIO VALLEY WHERE DRY AIR AND SUBSIDENCE ARE AT WORK. SEEMS
REASONABLE TO BUY INTO AT LEAST PARTIAL CLEARING IN LINE WITH
PREVIOUS GRIDS...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AND IN SOMEWHAT AGREEMENT
WITH THE GFS MOS. HOWEVER...I COULD SEE CLOUDS HOLDING IN AT
BROKEN IN COVERAGE FOR SW VA AND NE TN...WHICH COULD AFFECT MIN
TEMP FORECAST. OTHERWISE...DID NOT PUT ANY FOG IN GIVEN CLOUDS.
MOS MISSED MINS BY SEVERAL DEGREES LAST NIGHT (TOO COOL)...BUT TOO
MUCH UNCERTAINTY TO STRAY VERY FAR FROM SIMILAR NAM/GFS MOS MINS
TONIGHT.

KEEPING SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT DRY WITH BOTH MAX AND MIN TEMPS
JUST A FEW DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS. 12Z GFS MODEL RUN LOOKS
MORE CONSISTENT WITH OTHER MODELS (INCLUDING SREF) IN THE NEXT SRN
STREAM SHORTWAVE TO MAINLY SPREAD SOME CLOUDS ACROSS FORECAST AREA
ON SUNDAY. LIMITED RAIN CHANCES TO AREAS SOUTH OF I-40...AND ALSO
MAINLY FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. NUDGED EXTREME SE TN AND SW NC
COUNTIES UP TO LOW CHANCE TO MESH BETTER WITH FFC'S GOOD CHANCE
POPS. UNLESS SNOW WAS PREFERRED FOR CHRISTMAS DAY...PARTLY SUNNY
WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S SHOULD PLEASE MOST FOLKS...ESPECIALLY THOSE
WITH TRAVEL PLANS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE LONG TERM STARTS
OUT WITH RELATIVELY DECENT FORECAST CONFIDENCE BUT TYPICALLY
DEGRADES FROM ABOUT WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THE PERIOD STARTS OUT
DRY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING WHILE NEXT SOUTHERN STREAM
SHORT WAVE SHIFTS EAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THE UPPER
FEATURE WILL INDUCE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER THE TEXAS GULF COAST
EARLY MONDAY. THE LOW WILL BUILD NORTHEAST INTO WESTERN TENNESSEE
BY 12Z TUESDAY WITH SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION AND
ISENTROPIC LIFT TO PRODUCE LIGHT RAIN ACROSS WESTERN PARTS OF THE
REGION LATER IN THE DAY MONDAY WITH PROGRESSION ACROSS THE ENTIRE
FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS MOISTURE ADVECTION
INCREASES ALONG WITH STRENGTHENING SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT. RAISED POPS
TO MEDIUM CHANCE FOR THE EARLY WEEK SYSTEM WHICH EXITS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT. UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL BY
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AND MAINTAINED A DRY PERIOD WHILE THE
FORECAST AREA AWAITS A MORE AMPLIFIED SYSTEM ON FRIDAY. STILL LOOKS
TOO WARM FOR MUCH MENTION OF FROZEN PRECIP AT THIS TIME. ADJUSTED
MAX/MIN TEMPS A CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN MOS IN
THIS LATE DECEMBER "MILD PATTERN".

OF THE AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT...AND EXTENDED THUNDERSTORM MENTION 
THROUGH THIS EVENING.

SHOWERS SHOULD END QUICKLY FRIDAY MORNING THEN AT LEAST PARTIAL 
CLEARING DURING THE DAY. HIGH CLOUDS MAY BE ON THE INCREASE LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MORE LIKELY SATURDAY. KEPT SATURDAY DRY LEADING 
INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH ONLY ECMWF ADVERTISING MUCH IN THE WAY OF 
PRECIPITATION (LIGHT) FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE 
AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

WILL ISSUE AFTERNOON PACKAGE PRODUCTS...THEN RE-ISSUE ZFPMRX WHEN/IF 
TORNADO WATCH IS ISSUED...AFTER 3PM EST. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SOUTHERN BRANCH OF 
THE JET STREAM REMAINS ACTIVE AND WILL OFFER ANOTHER IN A SERIES OF 
SHORT WAVE FEATURES TO BRING A SHOT OF RAIN TO THE FORECAST AREA. 
KEPT THE PROBABILITY IN THE SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE RANGE FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THIS WAVE MOVES AWAY FOLLOWED BY SOME DRIER AIR 
AND RIDGING FOR A QUIET PERIOD WHICH SHOULD LAST THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TRAVERSES THE MID SOUTH TUESDAY INTO 
TUESDAY NIGHT SO ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS WITH THIS 
RATHER WEAK SYSTEM FOLLOWED BY A DRY THURSDAY. TRENDED TEMPS CLOSER 
TO THE MORE LOGICAL HPC DEPICTION FOR THIS FORECAST.

EAST EARLY FRIDAY WILL POSITIVE TILTED MEAN TROUGHING REMAINS TO THE 
WEST WHICH ALLOWS FOR LINGERING LIGHT PRECIPITATION INTO FRIDAY.

VISIBILITIES SHOULD GRADUALLY LOWER THIS EVENING AS THIS SYSTEM 
SLOWLY APPROACHES...WITH SHOWERS BECOMING MORE WIDESPREAD AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. THE BULK OF THE SHOWER AND SCATTERED TSTORM ACTIVITY IS 
EXPECTED BETWEEN 12Z AND 18Z...WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED AROUND 
18Z TO 20Z. WESTERLY WINDS BEHIND THE FRONT WILL BE GUSTY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON...WITH CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES GRADUALLY IMPROVING.
&&

NC...NONE.

930 
FXUS64 KMRX 201950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST TUE DEC 20 2011

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER CENTRAL 
PLAINS AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FEATURES CONTINUE TO SLOWLY APPROACH 
FROM THE WEST. EACH MODEL RUN HAS GENERALLY SLOWED THE EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM. NOW APPEARS BEST COVERAGE OF PRECIP FOR 
OUR AREA WILL OCCUR LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD AND INTO EARLY SECOND 
PERIOD. TENDED TO FAVOR SREF SOLUTION WITH RESPECT TO TIMING. CUT 
BACK POPS IN NORTHEASTERN ZONES TO LIKELY OVERNIGHT BASED ON THIS 
SLOWER PROGRESSION. BUMPED UP POPS TO CATEGORICAL FOR THE EARLY 
PORTION OF THE SECOND PERIOD. SYSTEM PULLS OUT BY LATE IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR MET GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A FRONT WILL BE STALLED FROM THE SOTUHERN APPALACHIANS TO EAST TX TO 
START THE PERIOD. A SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH WILL MOVE FROM BAJA CA TO 
TX BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A WEAK LOW FORMS ALONG THE FRONT AND CROSSES 
THE TN VALLEY THURSDAY TO THURSDAY NIGHT. STRONG GULF MOISTURE 
ADVECTION FROM A 45 KT LLJ WILL ARRIVE THURSDAY. CATEGORICAL POPS 
WILL SPREAD FROM SOUTH TO NORTH ON THURSDAY AND CONTINUE INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT. WITH A STRONG JET AND SOME ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY...RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES...AND WILL MENTION A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF THUNDER IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. PRECIP SHOULD 
END FRIDAY MORNING WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED DRYING ALOFT...BUT WITH A WEAKLY AMPLIFIED FLOW 
ALOFT...THE FRONT IS SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH AND CLOUDS MAY LINGER 
THROUGH THE DAY.

THERE IS CONSIDERABLE DISAGREEMENT AMONG THE MODELS CONCERNING THE 
WEEKEND. THE CANADIAN AND ECMWF SHOW A DEEP TROUGH DROPPING OUT OF 
CENTRAL CANADA/NORTHERN PLAINS. THE ECMWF HAS PRECIP WITH THIS 
TROUGH MAINLY SAT-SAT NIGHT...WHILE THE CANADIAN SHOWS PRECIP SAT 
NIGHT-SUN NIGHT. THE GFS SHOWS NO PRECIP AT ALL WITH RIDGING OVER 
THE AREA. A FEW GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DO SHOW SOME PRECIP IN THIS 
TIME FRAME...BUT THE ENSEMBLE SPREAD IS LARGE. WITH CONFIDENCE BEING 
LOW...CHANGES WILL BE MINOR...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP STAYING IN 
THE FORECAST SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AND A COOLING TREND FOR MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY.


&&

AFTERNOON AND THEN BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY JUST TO THE EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY EVENING. ACTIVE PATTERN CONTINUES AS LOW 
PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER LOWER MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY 
MORNING WITH RENEWED SHOWER ACTIVITY SPREADING INTO THE EASTERN TN 
VALLEY THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. THEN ANOTHER SHORTWAVE BRINGS 
ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS THROUGH THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES REMAIN MILD THROUGH SATURDAY WITH HIGHS IN 
THE 60S WEDNESDAY AND 50S THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. COOLER SATURDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY AS UPPER TROUGH DIPS SOUTH OVER THE CENTRAL PART OF 
THE COUNTRY. SOME SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
SUNDAY AND ALSO SUNDAY NIGHT BUT NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED AS 
TEMPERATURES ONLY FALL INTO THE LOWER 30S EACH NIGHT. HIGHER
PRESSURE BUILDS IN MONDAY.

245 PM EST MON DEC 19 2011

APPALACHIAN REGION AT LEAST THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. SYSTEM

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
LIFT AND MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE PLAINS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
INCREASE QUICKLY TUESDAY NIGHT. UPPER DIVERGENCE NEAR THE NOSE OF 
THE UPPER JET AND A 40-50 KT LLJ WILL RESULT IN CATEGORICAL POPS 
ACROSS THE WHOLE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY SUGGESTS AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER. 
NORTHEAST MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM WILL BRING DECREASING POPS 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 

THE SURFACE FRONT STALLS JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...THEN BEGINS TO LIFT BACK TO THE NORTH ON THURSDAY IN 
RESPONSE TO A SHORTAVE TROUGH MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
FAVORABLE POSITIONING OF THE UPPER JET AND STRONG MOISTURE ADVECTION 
FROM THE GULF WILL ARRIVE LATE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL 
RAISE POPS TO LIKELY WITH THIS SYSTEM...WITH DECREASING POPS ON 
FRIDAY.

THERE IS MUCH UNCERTAINTY FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW. THERE IS CONSIDERABLE SPREAD AMONG THE GFS 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. THE ECMWF AND GFS ARE QUITE DIFFERENT IN THEIR 
DEPICTIONS OF A CLOSED LOW TRACKING ACROSS THE PLAINS AND OHIO 
VALLEY/GREAT LAKES. AT THIS TIME...A DRY FORECAST IS PREFERED. BOTH 
MODELS DO GENERALLY AGREE THAT THERE WILL BE A SURGE OF COLD AIR 
ARRIVING EARLY NEXT WEEK.

APPROACHES BY LATE TUESDAY. BUMPED UP POPS TO LIKELY FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS MODELS AND MOST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS NOW GENERALLY AGREE ON THIS 
TIME PERIOD AS HAVING THE BEST COVERAGE. THIS SYSTEM PULLS OUT ON 
WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED BY A BRIEF DRY PERIOD IN THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY TIME FRAME. ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT. MODELS HAVE EXHIBITED SIGNIFICANT DISAGREEMENTS AND GENERALLY 
POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY WITH RESPECT TO THIS SYSTEM HOWEVER. 
THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES FOR THIS EVENT. PRECIP WITH 
BOTH SYSTEMS APPEARS ALL LIQUID AT THIS TIME...ALTHOUGH TRACK OF 
LATTER SYSTEM WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID 
NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

AIRMASS COOLS A BIT MORE.

PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TO TAPER OFF BEFORE THE END OF THE TAF 
PERIOD. IFR CIGS WILL LIKELY RISE TO MVFR AS DRIER AIR BEGINS TO 
FILTER INTO THE REGION. 
&&

NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
630 PM EST THU DEC 15 2011

.AVIATION...INITIAL PATCHES OF VERY LIGHT RAIN HAVE MOVED ACROSS AND 
OUT OF THE REGION. THE COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST APPEARS TO BE ABOUT TO 
MOVE OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES...WITH SOME MODERATE 
SHOWERS INDICATED BETWEEN OHX AND HUN NE TO NEAR CSV. THESE SHOWERS 
SHOULD AFFECT AT LEAST CHA AND TYS AFTER 02Z TO 04Z...WHILE I EXPECT 
PATCHY LIGHTER RAINS FOR TRI. 

MVFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT FOR CHA AND TYS...WITH TRI 
PROBABLY STAYING ON THE EDGE OF VFR TO MVFR. CONDITIONS WORSEN 
SIGNIFICANTLY ON FRIDAY FOR ALL 3 TAF SITES...AS AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE DEVELOPS ALONG THE COLD FRONT. TRENDED EACH TAF SITE DOWN 
TO IFR BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...AS RAIN CONTINUES AND THE AIRMASS COOLS 
A BIT MORE.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...THE COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST WILL 
PUSH THROUGH TONIGHT BEFORE STALLING FOR A WHILE JUST TO OUR 
SOUTHEAST.  SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL TRAVERSE THE AREA ON FRIDAY.  
WILL CARRY HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS FOR TONIGHT...BUT MORE 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIP SHOULD BE FRIDAY WITH THE SHORT WAVE SO WILL 
CARRY 90 TO 100 POPS FOR FRIDAY. LOOKS LIKE AN ALL RAIN EVENT 
THROUGH FRIDAY...ALTHOUGH LATE IN THE DAY COOLING OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS NORTH WILL BEAR WATCHING.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...LATE WEEK SYSTEM 
DEPARTS FRIDAY NIGHT WITH PRECIP ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST. UPCOMING 
WEEKEND APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME WITH COOLER TEMPS IN STORE ON 
SATURDAY BEFORE A MODERATING TREND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK AS WEAK 
RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE REGION. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY LATE 
MONDAY OR EARLY TUESDAY...WITH SIGNIFICANT TIMING DIFFERENCES 
DEPICTED BY VARIOUS MODELS/ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. HAVE CONTINUES TO 
SPREAD POPS ACROSS SEVERAL PERIODS TO ACCOUNT FOR UNCERTAINTY WITH 
TIMING. DRY WEATHER ONCE AGAIN RETURNS BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM WITH 
TEMPS REMAINING SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO GENERALLY. FOR TEMPS...MADE 
MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV/MEX GUIDANCE BASED ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST THU DEC 15 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NORTHERN PLAINS UPPER TROUGH WILL 
PROGRESS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE 
NATION THROUGH THE PERIOD DRAGGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION BY 12Z FRIDAY. BEST LIFT WILL BE RIGHT ALONG THE 
FRONT IMPACTING MAINLY THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THROUGH EARLY 
AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...LIGHT TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATE SHOWERS WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 00Z FRIDAY. THE 
BEST LIFT AND DEEPEST MOISTURE WILL SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST WITH 
FRONTAL MOVEMENT TONIGHT. GENERALLY STAYED WITH LIKELY POPS FOR MOST 
OF THE AREA TONIGHT. WENT WITH A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS IN 
THE SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A SURFACE FRONT WILL REMAIN 
STALLED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH FRIDAY...WHILE A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH AT 500 MB MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. THE NAM HAS THE 
GREATEST PRECIP DISPLACED TO THE NORTH ACROSS KY IN A ZONE OF 
MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS...WHILE THE GFS PLACES ITS MAX QPF OVER EAST 
TN CLOSER TO THE SURFACE FRONT. THE GFS HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT IN 
ITS PLACEMENT AND HAS SUPPORT FROM THE ECMWF AND SREF...SO WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE GFS. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS EVERYWHERE ON FRIDAY. DRY 
AIR ALOFT AND COLD ADVECTION FOLLOW QUICKLY BEHIND THE PRECIP FRIDAY 
NIGHT...SO POPS WILL DROP BACK SHARPLY TO NONE/SLIGHT CHANCE EAST 
AFTER 06Z. 

THE FLOW WILL BE NEARLY ZONAL THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WHICH SHOULD 
RESULT IN TRANQUIL CONDITIONS AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES. A CLOSED 
LOW TRACKS FROM THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES TO THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THE 00Z GFS IS SHOWING THE SYSTEM MOVING 
SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS AND SLOWER THAN THE ECMWF. ISENTROPIC LIFT 
AND A WARM FRONT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM MAY BRING PRECIP INTO NORTHERN 
AREAS MONDAY NIGHT WITH STRONGER LIFT WITH THE UPPER JET STREAK 
COMING ON TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL DROP THE POPS BACK SLIGHTLY 
FOR MONDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY SOUTH...WITH CHANCE POPS CONTINUING 
FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

MOVES DOWN FROM THE NW TUESDAY WITH RAIN SPREADING INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. THEN A SOUTHERN SYSTEM MOVES IN TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES REMAIN IN 40S AND 50S WITH ONLY RAIN 
EXPECTED.

FOG AS STRATUS AND MID DECK APPEARS TO HAVE DISSIPATED TO A LARGE 
DEGREE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE FOG 
IS LOCALLY DENSE IN SPOTS AND MAY HANG AROUND FOR A FEW HOURS EARLY 
THIS MORNING BEFORE LIFTING. WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO MAINTAIN A DRY 
FORECAST IN THE SHORT TERM. RADAR SHOWS A FEW SPRINKLES IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS 
KENTUCKY AND SOME OF THIS ACTION MAY PASS JUST NORTH OF EXTREME 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. PARTLY SUNNY SKIES SHOULD BE THE RULE AS HIGH 
LEVEL MOISTURE STREAMS IN FROM THE PACIFIC OVER THE TOP OF THE UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE. AS THE LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES SOUTHWESTERLY 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD JUMP INTO THE 60S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE OVER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
PART OF THE GREAT VALLEY AHEAD OF THE WESTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH BUT 
NOT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE SE 
COAST ALONG WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING FROM THE PLAINS INTO 
ONTARIO WILL GIVE A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW OF MOISTURE INTO 
THE AREA ON THURSDAY. INCREASING LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE AND AN APPROACHING UPPER JET WILL SPREAD PRECIP ACROSS 
THE AREA ON THURSDAY...ARRIVING MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON IN THE 
PLATEAU AND INTO THE VALLEY BY EVENING. THE FRONT SLOWS AS IT MOVES 
EAST AND BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT. A 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH BRINGS ANOTHER SURGE OF 
PRECIP TO THE AREA ON FRIDAY...EXITING BY FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY POPS FOR THE WHOLE AREA EACH PERIOD. WILL ALSO 
MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AFTERNOON IN THE 
PLATEAU AS THE LLJ WILL BE NEAR 50 KTS AND 850 THETA-E VALUES AROUND 
320K. 

ONLY SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES FOLLOW THE FRONT AS THE UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW IS NOT VERY AMPLIFIED. A RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THE GFS 
SHOWS A CLOSED LOW TRACKING FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO THE OHIO 
VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE ECMWF ALSO SHOWS PRECIP IN THE 
AREA AT THIS TIME BUT WITH AN OPEN SHORTWAVE TROUGH. WILL BUMP UP 
THE POPS A BIT FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  47  66  51  56 /   0   0  70  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  46  64  49  54 /   0   0  60  70  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  46  62  48  53 /   0   0  70  60  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  40  65  46  53 /  10   0  60  70  70

260 
FXUS64 KMRX 140236
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST TUE DEC 13 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. CLOUD COVER HAS 
ERODED FOR THE TIME BEING. RELATIVELY HIGH DEW POINTS IN PLACE. 
TEMPERATURES DROPPING ON SCHEDULE. FOG FORMATION CONTINUES TO BE A 
GOOD BET OVERNIGHT. CLOUD COVER INVASION FROM THE WEST WILL 
DETERMINE EXTENT AND DEGREE OF FOG DENSITY BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. 
SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...SATELLITE SHOWS LOW 
CLOUDS SLOWLY ERODING FROM THE SOUTH AND EAST. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 
TRAPPED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FINALLY DISSIPATING. BOUNDARY LAYER 
WESTERLY WINDS WILL HELP ERODE THE CLOUDS INTO THE VALLEY...BUT 
CONSIDERABLE HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL REPLACE. 
HOWEVER...ENOUGH RADIATIONAL COOLING COMBINED WITH LOW DEWPOINT 
DEPRESSIONS WILL ALLOW FOG TO DEVELOP. SURFACE RELATIVE HUMIDITY 
VALUES APPROACH 100 PERCENT...SO WILL CALL FOR AREAS OF FOG SOUTH 
AND PATCHY NORTH WHERE MORE CLOUDS ARE ANTICIPATED. SOME OF THE FOG 
WILL LIKELY BECOME DENSE.

LATER SHIFT MAY NEED TO ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY.

FOR WEDNESDAY...UPPER AND SURFACE RIDING WILL PRODUCE AN 
UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY WITH PARTLY-MOSTLY CLOUDY SKY.  FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST ALLOWING SOUTHERLY WINDS TO 
INCREASE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER. TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY BE WARMER 
JUST OFF THE SURFACE AS SURFACE WINDS DECOUPLE.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THIS FORECAST PERIOD BEGINS 
WITH THE UPPER LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OVERHEAD...BUT STARTING TO 
FEEL THE SQUEEZE FROM THE TROUGH IN THE PLAINS THAT IS ENCROACHING 
FROM THE NORTHWEST...WITH THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT CLOSING IN ON 
MEMPHIS.  FRONT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL PASS THROUGH E TN THURSDAY 
NIGHT...BUT SHOWERS LOOK TO BE WELL IN ADVANCE OF FRONT WITH A GOOD 
THREAT OF SHOWERS BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON IN OUR NWRN AREAS.  FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY DOES NOT INITIALLY MAKE IT VERY FAR AWAY...WILL NEED TO 
KEEP SOME POPS IN FOR FRIDAY AS WELL.  BY SATURDAY...RAIN SHOULD BE 
OUT OF THE AREA...AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE FILLS IN.  

CHOPPED HIGH TEMP FORECASTS IN THE NERN SECTION ON SATURDAY BY A FEW 
DEGREES...AS STRONG UPPER LEVEL WAVE MOVES THROUGH...WOULD EXPECT IT 
TO GENERATE THICK DECK OF CIRRUS OVER NERN HALF OF THE AREA FOR AT 
LEAST PART OF THE DAY...MORE SIGNIFICANT NEWD. EVEN THOUGH THIS WAVE 
IS PRETTY STRONG IN THE UPPER LEVELS...THERE IS NO MOISTURE IN THE 
LOWER TO MID TROPOSPHERE TO WORK WITH...SO JUST THE CIRRUS.

SUNDAY LOOKS LIKE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...BUT BY MONDAY CIRRUS WILL BE 
THICKENING WITH WARM ADVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH RETURN FLOW 
ISENTROPIC LIFT.  HAVE SOME LIGHT POPS IN THE NWRN AREAS FOR MONDAY 
FOR THIS LIFT.  THEN HAVE POPS IN FOR TUESDAY AS NEXT FRONT PUSHES 
THROUGH.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  66  46  64  50 /   0   0  10  40  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  64  45  62  48 /  10   0  10  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  64  45  61  47 /  10   0  10  60  60

FXUS64 KMRX 130856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST TUE DEC 13 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
REMAINS TRAPPED BELOW AN INVERSION AROUND 850 MB...WHICH WILL KEEP 
CLOUDS IN PLACE THIS MORNING. SOME WEAKENING OF THE INVERSION COMES 
IN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH DECREASING CLOUDS EXPECTED THROUGH THE DAY. 
A RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN US TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY...PROVIDING TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL. AN EASTWARD 
SHIFT OF THE RIDGE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BRING INCREASING MOISTURE 
ADVECTION TO THE AREA. PRECIP AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
WILL COME MAINLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS FOR THOSE PERIODS. MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT HAS TRENDED SLOWER 
WITH THE MORE RECENT MODEL RUNS...SO WILL KEEP HIGH CHANCE POPS 
GOING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE PERIOD BEGINS WITH A 
TRAILING LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER TROUGH WHICH COAXES A LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY SURFACE WAVE NORTHEAST ALONG THE SURFACE COLD FRONT. THIS 
WILL REQUIRE A CONTINUATION OF MEDIUM THROUGH HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS ON FRIDAY AS THE WAVE SLOWS FRONTAL PROGRESS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. UPPER TROUGH DOES NOT EXIT THE REGION UNTIL 
LATER FRIDAY NIGHT SO APPLIED SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS FROM 
WEST TO EAST AWAITING THE DEPARTURE OF THIS SYSTEM. A MOISTURE 
STARVED SHORT WAVE DROPS HARMLESSLY SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION ON SATURDAY WHILE A COLD SURFACE 
RIDGE SETTLES INTO THE SOUTHEAST STATES. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
STRENGTHENS ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AS ANOTHER 
CLOSED LOW SHIFTS SLOWLY NORTHEAST FROM THE DESERT SOUTHWEST TOWARD 
THE GREAT LAKES. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING OF THIS 
SYSTEM MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT. TRENDED MAX/MIN TEMPS TOWARD NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE FOR THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SOUTHERLY FLOW OF BOUNDARY 
LAYER MOISTURE CONTINUES TO ADVECT NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA

UPPER RIDGING DEVELOP ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN RESPONSE TO 
ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TUESDAY. THE 
UPPER RIDGING AND LOSS OF ISENTROPIC LIFT DUE TO FLOW BECOMING 
WEST-NORTHWEST WILL ALLOW SKY TO BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY AREA-WIDE.

MORE SUNSHINE AND WARMER 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL PRODUCE AN 
UNSEAONABLY WARM DAY FOR TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THIS FORECAST PERIOD 
BEGINS WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL AND QUIET WEATHER...BUT THE 
HIGH MOVES QUICKLY TO THE EAST AND A WEAK COLD FRONT SLIDES THROUGH 
THE AREA AROUND THURSDAY NIGHT.  HAVE FORECAST DRY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...WOULD PROBABLY WAIT A PERIOD LATER TO INTRO POPS...BUT HAVE 
POPS INCLUDED FOR THURSDAY DUE TO POSSIBLE SPEEDING UP OF SYSTEM.  
HIGH PRESSURE FILLS IN OVER THE WEEKEND AND DRIES THINGS OUT. RETURN 
FLOW BRINGS MOISTURE BACK INTO THE AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK.  MODELS 
SOMEWHAT DIFFERENT WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PLACEMENT...BUT BRING 
A SYSTEM CLOSE ENOUGH TO US BY MONDAY TO INCLUDE SOME POPS.

FOR TEMPS...WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...A LITTLE COOLER ON 
INITIAL PUSH OF COLD AIR...PER HPC PRELIM EXTENDED DISCUSSION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

569 
FXUS64 KMRX 120906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
406 AM EST MON DEC 12 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
AN 850 MB HIGH OFF THE NC COAST WILL PROVIDE A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW OF WARM MOIST AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. WEAK 
ISENTROPIC UPGLIDE WILL PROVIDE SOME SHALLOW LIFT WITHIN THE MOIST 
LAYER. THE MODELS ARE IN DISAGREEMENT WITH THE DEPTH OF THE MOIST 
LAYER...WITH THE NAM SHOWING DEEPER MOISTURE AND THUS MORE PRECIP 
THAN THE GFS. BASED ON THE 00Z FFC SOUNDING WHICH SHOWS A VERY DRY 
LAYER ABOVE 800 MB...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE DRIER GFS AND SREF 
SOLUTIONS. MUCH OF THE AREA WILL SEE OVERCAST CLOUDS AND AREAS OF 
DRIZZLE TODAY. DUE TO THE SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE AND WEAK 
LIFT...MEASURABLE PRECIP WILL BE DIFFICULT TO ATTAIN...AND WILL 
CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP ONLY IN THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN ZONES. 
CLOUD COVER SHOULD ALSO HOLD HIGH TEMPS IN THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS. 
TONIGHT THE 850 MB FLOW BECOMES MORE WESTERLY...WITH MOISTURE 
DECREASING FROM THE TOP DOWN. HOWEVER THE MODELS INDICATE QUITE A 
BIT OF NEAR-SURFACE MOISTURE...SO WILL KEEP CLOUD COVER HIGH TONIGHT 
WITH LOWS ON THE WARM SIDE OF GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION IN THE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TIME 
FRAME BRINGING A CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOWERS. WILL KEEP HIGHEST ON  
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WHEN THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT IS 
ANTICIPATED. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. GFS  
IS FASTER THAN THE ECMWF IN TIMING WITH THE FRONT. GFS HAS A DRIER 
WEATHER MOVING INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WHILE THE 
ECMWF HAS THE FRONT LINGERING OVER THE AREA. WITH STILL MUCH 
UNCERTAINTY REGARDING FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WILL LEAVE THE CURRENT 
CHANCE POPS GOING AS IS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

353 
FXUS64 KMRX 111945
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST SUN DEC 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
ATLANTIC REGION...WITH A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD OVER THE 
WESTERN ATLANTIC TONIGHT...WITH A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW DEVELOPING ON 
THE BACK SIDE OF IT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MODELS INDICATE 
THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME VERY LIGHT PRECIP DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHWEST 
NC AND SOUTHEAST TN TOWARDS SUNRISE...AS ISENTROPIC LIFT SLOWLY 
INCREASES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH SURFACE TEMPS POSSIBLY STILL 
LINGERING AROUND THE FREEZING MARK IN THE VALLEY AREAS OF SOUTHWEST 
NC...THERE MIGHT BE SOME LIGHT FREEZING RAIN TOWARDS SUNRISE. RIGHT 
NOW...IT APPEARS THAT LIMITED MOISTURE SHOULD KEEP ANY PRECIP VERY 
LIGHT IN INTENSITY...AND CURRENT DEWPOINTS ARE HIGHER THAN FORECAST 
WHICH SHOULD LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF ADDITIONAL EVAPORATIVE COOLING 
POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. THUS...WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OVER SOUTHWEST NC TONIGHT. AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
THEN BEGINS TO DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY TUESDAY...WHICH 
SHOULD HELP TO WARM TEMPS ABOVE NORMAL. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... 
AND WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT 
SINCE DEWPOINTS ARE CURRENTLY HIGHER THAN EXPECTED AND CLOUDS ARE 
EXPECTED TO INCREASE TONIGHT. OTHERWISE...WILL TREND TOWARDS A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO GUIDANCE SETS AFTER TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WE WILL BEGIN THE EXTENDED 
WITH A SHORT-WAVE MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAIN STATES TOWARD 
THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BEFORE BECOMING NEAR 
STATIONARY ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES BY FRIDAY. AS UPPER FLOW 
REMAINS WEST TO SOUTHWEST FOR FRIDAY...ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL HELP TO 
KEEP A CHANCE OF RAIN FOR THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER STRONG UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT BASIN/SOUTHWEST FRIDAY-SATURDAY... 
THEN PULL NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAIN STATES SUNDAY. WEAK ISENTROPIC 
LIFT OVER THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE GULF COASTS WILL KEEP 
CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA NEXT WEEKEND...BUT RAIN CHANCES 
WILL BE SLIM. CONFIDENCE FOR THE EXTENDED LOW DUE TO MODEL 
INCONSISTENCIES FROM MODEL RUNS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

VALLEYS. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE

CONDITIONS. A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WILL DEVELOP SUNDAY NIGHT OVER THE

OF SOME VERY LIGHT PRECIP DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHWEST NC AND SOUTHEAST 
TN TOWARDS SUNRISE ON MONDAY MORNING...AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH COLD SURFACE TEMPS EXPECTED EARLY 
MONDAY MORNING...THERE MIGHT BE A CONCERN FOR SOME FREEZING DRIZZLE 
IN A FEW VALLEY AREAS. HOWEVER...RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT TEMPS 
SHOULD BE ABOVE FREEZING BY THE TIME ANY LIGHT PRECIP DEVELOPS OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...WITH MOISTURE LIMITED ENOUGH TO 
PREVENT MUCH EVAPORATIVE COOLING. THUS...WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR LIGHT RAIN. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM WILL BE UPPER 
TROUGH MOVING NORTHEAST OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES/SOUTHERN 
PLAINS TUESDAY TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES BY THURSDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL 
PHASE WITH A NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH. CORRESPONDING COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT PRODUCING 
A BAND OF SHOWERS. PERSISTENT RIDING INTO THE GULF STATES WILL LIMIT 
GULF MOISTURE/INSTABILITY RETURN...SO THUNDER IS NOT ANTICIPATED.

UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME ZONAL AGAIN AFTER SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST OF 
THE AREA FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
&&

BUT PRECIPITATION NOT EXPECTED. UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS EAST AS SW-NE 
UPPER JET MOVES INTO TN VALLEY THURSDAY. BACKED OFF ON CLOUDS AND 
PRECIPITATION FOR THURSDAY AND MAIN RAINSHOWERS EVENT EXPECTED EARLY 
FRIDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. ABOVE NORMAL PREFRONTAL

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EST THU DEC 8 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...DURING THIS PERIOD THE UPPER 
FLOW IS CONTROLLED BY THE GREAT POLAR VORTEX OVER HUDSON BAY.  THE 
SHORTWAVE THAT BROUGHT THE SNOW YESTERDAY HAS MOVED OFF TO THE 
NORTHEAST...WHILE THE NEXT SHORTWAVE IS A CLIPPER HEADED SEWD TOWARD 
THE AREA.  BY THE END OF THIS PERIOD THIS CLIPPER IS STILL 
UPSTREAM.  AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE FILLS IN QUICKLY AND 
LOOSENS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT.

DISSIPATING...BUT VERY SLOWLY.  WILL INCLUDE MORE CLOUD COVER OVER 
UPSLOPE AREAS IN THE APPALACHIANS AND INTO SW VA.

FOR TEMPS...WENT VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS FAIRLY CONSISTENT 
WITH WEATHER PATTERN OUT TO EARLY NEXT WEEK...SHOWING A DRY PERIOD 
WITH TEMPS RECOVERING BY SUNDAY AND ACTUALLY A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
CLIMO BY MONDAY TO WEDNESDAY. A NRN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
PASSING OVER GREAT LAKES AND OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL BRING A FEW 
CLOUDS FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MAIN EFFECT WILL BE TO KEEP TEMPS ON THE 
COOL SIDE FOR SATURDAY. 

SLIGHTLY DIFFERING PATTERN BY LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
WITH ECMWF MORE AMPLIFIED AND GFS MORE ZONAL ACROSS THE SE STATES. 
GFS STILL ADVERTISES A DEEPENING SHORTWAVE TROUGH/LOW OVER THE SRN 
PLAINS FOR DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY). EITHER PATTERN SEEMS TO ONLY SUPPORT 
VERY LOW SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW...AND FOR CONTINUITY I KEPT 
THESE POPS JUST FOR TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT AND AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE SLIGHTLY FOR BOTH DAYS 6 
AND 7...WITH THIS REFLECTED IN THE TRENDS FROM 07/12Z GFSX TO 08/00Z 
GFSX MOS GUIDANCE.

001 
FXUS64 KMRX 072022
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST WED DEC 7 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH COLDER TEMP IN THE 30S 
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AXIS OVER THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL CONTINUE TO SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIP 
EXPECTED CHANGING TO SNOW BEFORE ENDING. THE MAIN QUESTION FOR OUR 
AREA INVOLVES HOW MUCH SNOW WILL BE ABLE TO ACCUMULATE WITH WARM 
GROUND TEMPS...AND AIR TEMPS ACROSS THE VALLEYS IN THE UPPER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S. EXPECT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 2000 FEET... 
TO BE ABLE TO COOL ENOUGH TO ALLOW SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS... 
SO WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES FOR THESE AREAS. IN THE 
VALLEY AREAS...WARMER GROUND AND AIR TEMPS SHOULD LIMIT ANY SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS TO THE GRASSY SURFACES AND KEEP THEM AROUND AN INCH OR 
LESS...SO WILL NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY FOR THE GREAT TN VALLEY AT THIS 
TIME. IT APPEARS THE MAIN POTENTIAL THREAT FOR ROADWAYS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME AREAS OF BLACK ICE DEVELOPING 
OVERNIGHT...AS TEMPS FALL BELOW FREEZING LATER THIS EVENING. WILL 
PLAN TO ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT OUTSIDE OF THE ADVISORY 
AREAS TO ADDRESS THIS POSSIBILITY. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY...BRINGING COOLER BUT 
DRY CONDITIONS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE 
LIMITED WITH ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL KEEP 
THE FORECAST DRY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS APPEAR 
TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...STAYED CLOSER TO AN 
ECMWF/CANADIAN SOLUTION FOR THE LONG TERM. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL BE EXITING THE REGION EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH BUILDING HEIGHTS 
TO FOLLOW. THIS SHOULD KEEP A NICE DRY FORECAST GOING RIGHT THROUGH 
THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK. A NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT ARE PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY HOWEVER....MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT 
WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THIS FEATURE AND DEPTH OF MOISTURE SO STAYED 
WITH CONTINUITY AND KEPT PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE RANGE FOR THIS FROPA. THE UNSETTLED WEATHER SHOULD BE OUT OF 
THE PICTURE BY WEDNESDAY AS A SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH AMPLIFIES OUT 
WEST. THIS MAY ALLOW FOR ANOTHER DRY DAY ON WEDNESDAY. TRENDED 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST CLOSER TO HPC WHICH FOLLOWS THE EUROPEAN 
CANADIAN MODEL FOR THE LONG TERM.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 071451
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EST WED DEC 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH COLDER AIR MOVING INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPS ALREADY IN THE UPPER 30S OVER THE 
PLATEAU. A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WAS PRODUCING AN EXTENSIVE AREA 
OF SNOW OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH TWO TO 
THREE INCHES OF SNOW ALREADY BEING REPORTED ACROSS WEST TN AND 
NORTHERN MS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH AND 
ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL QUICKLY SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH RAIN EXPECTED TO CHANGE SNOW IN MOST 
LOCATIONS. THE MAIN QUESTION FOR OUR AREA INVOLVES HOW MUCH SNOW 
WILL BE ABLE TO ACCUMULATE WITH WARM GROUND TEMPS...AND AIR TEMPS IN 
THE VALLEYS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE UPPER 30S TO NEAR 40 BY THE TIME 
THE UPPER TROUGH SWINGS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. IT APPEARS THAT THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET...WILL BE ABLE TO COOL 
ENOUGH TO ALLOW SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. 

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO EXPAND THE WINTER WX 
ADVISORY TO INCLUDE THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHERE AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ABOVE 1500 FEET...BUT WARMER TEMPS IN THE SEQUATCHIE VALLEY 
MAY PREVENT ANY ACCUMULATIONS THERE. ALSO...WILL INCLUDE THE REST OF 
SOUTHWEST VA IN THE ADVISORY...BUT WILL NOT INCLUDE NORTHEAST TN AT 
THIS TIME SINCE SNOWFALL MAY HAVE A TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING IN THE 
LOWER ELEVATIONS. HOWEVER...THIS AREA MAY NEED TO BE ADDED TO THE 
ADVISORY THIS AFTERNOON...DEPENDING ON THE AFTERNOON TEMP AND PRECIP 
TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 AM EST WED DEC 7 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES 
IN ADVANCE OF AMPLIFIED AND POSITIVELY-TILTED UPPER TROUGH CURRENTLY 
STRETCHING FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO TEXAS. COLDER AIR EXPECTED TO 
FLOW INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY AS UPPER TROUGH 
SWINGS EASTWARD. TEMPS WILL GENERALLY FALL THROUGH THE DAY AS TROUGH 
AXIS AND SURFACE FRONT SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS 
DEPICT MOISTURE DEPARTING QUITE RAPIDLY BEHIND TROUGH AXIS. THIS ALONG 
WITH RELATIVELY WARM GROUND TEMPS SHOULD LIMIT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS AS 
PRECIP TRANSITIONS TO SNOW THIS AFTERNOON. NEVERTHELESS...WILL 
CONTINUE ADVISORY AS CURRENTLY CONFIGURED AS SNOWFALL MAY BECOME 
BRIEFLY HEAVY BEFORE DEPARTING...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
FOR TEMPS...MAV AND MET GUIDANCE GENERALLY CLOSE AND LOOKS 
REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE UPPER TROUGH EXITS
ACTUALLY BEFORE THURSDAY MORNING...SO WEATHER SHOULD MAKE A RAPID
IMPROVEMENT TOWARD DAYBREAK. SOME ZONAL FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS FOR
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...WITH A NRN STREAM SHORTWAVE PASSING TO OUR
NORTH ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO RIVER VALLEY REGIONS BY
FRIDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER FOR OUR AREA...BUT A FEW CLOUDS EXPECTED. 

ZONAL FLOW OR WEAK RIDGING ALOFT IS SHOWN FOR THE WEEKEND INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK. SURFACE TO 850 MB RIDGING LOOKS TO KEEP ANY GULF
MOISTURE SHUT OFF...SO DRY WEATHER FOR THESE PERIODS. GFS AND ECMWF
DIFFER SLIGHTLY ON HOW ANY PRECIPITATION MIGHT DEVELOP MONDAY NIGHT
INTO TUESDAY...WITH A GOOD BET FOR MORE DRY WEATHER. HOWEVER...PER
COORDINATION WITH NWS NEIGHBORS...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN
FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...GFSX MOS MAX/MIN TEMPS LOOK CONSISTENT OVER THE PAST 2
TO 3 RUNS. TEMP GRIDS WERE CLOSE TO THESE VALUES AND JUST SOME VERY
MINOR TWEAKS NEEDED.

.DISCUSSION...
IR SATELLITE TRENDS SHOW COOLING CLOUD TOPS ACROSS NORTHERN AL INTO

PRECIP COVERAGE AND INTENSITY. 00Z BMX SOUNDING SHOWS DEEP
SATURATION THAT WILL BE FEEDING INTO OUR AREA THROUGH THE NIGHT.
ALL OF THE AREA WILL SEE RAINFALL...SO WILL INCREASE POPS TO 100
PERCENT EVERYHWERE. QPF AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE SIMILAR TO THE PREVIOUS
FORECAST...ON THE ORDER OF 0.5-1 INCHES. TEMPERATURES WILL NEED
SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS WITH THE EVENING UPDATE. 

NO CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE SECOND PERIOD WHEN AN INTENSE COLD
CORE 500 MB LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE AREA...CHANGING RAIN OVER TO SNOW
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. LATEST MODEL SNOWFALL FORECASTS SHOW 2-4
INCHES...BUT WITH TEMPERATURES ABOVE FREEZING AT THE ONSET AND WARM
GROUND TEMPERATURES...VALLEY ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD REMAIN LESS THAN
ONE INCH...WHILE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE 1-3 INCHES.

FXUS64 KMRX 062033

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EST TUE DEC 6 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RADAR INDICATING ACTIVITY AS 
FRONT EXITS TO THE AREA. UPPER LOW ENTERS THE AREA TONIGHT AND INTO 
INTO THURSDAY SO WILL CONTINUE CATEGORICAL POPS FOR BOTH PERIODS. 
GETTING SOME COLD AIR STREAMING INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. 
EXPECTING SOME SNOW BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. BUT TOO WARM FOR MUCH 
ACCUMULATION EXCEPT MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATION. SO WILL GO FOR 
ONLY ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATION. WITH THE RAIN...STAYED 
CLOSER TO COOLER MAV FOR TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...TREND OF MODELS HAS 
BEEN TO SPEED UP EXIT OF THE WEDNESDAY SYSTEM...SO WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS NORTHEAST TO NO HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTHWEST ZONES FOR 
THE FIRST FEW HOURS WED NIGHT...THEN WILL QUICKLY TAPER OFF TO BE 
DRY BY 06Z.  ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF AN INCH OR SO WILL BE 
POSSIBLE IN SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES AND 
NORTHEAST BEFORE THE PRECIP ENDS. A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS VERY LIMITED SO FOR NOW 
WILL KEEP CURRENT DRY FORECAST AND JUST HAVE SOME INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
AS THIS FRONT MOVES THROUGH.  SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE DRY THROUGH AT 
LEAST SUNDAY.  SOME UNCERTAINTY FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD AS 
MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS POOR.  GFS HAS NEXT 
SYSTEM MOVING IN BY TUESDAY...WITH ECMWF EARLIER ON MONDAY.  FOR NOW 
WILL LEAN TOWARD GFS...BUT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TUE.

250 
FXUS64 KMRX 061502
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1002 AM EST TUE DEC 6 2011

.DISCUSSION..RADAR INDICATING RAIN TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA. WILL 
LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK.  WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...NO 
OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...INITIAL ROUND OF SHOWERS
FIZZLED RATHER QUICKLY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. COLD FRONT SEEMS
TO BE LOCATED ACROSS THE EASTERN MOST COUNTIES OF THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU PER 07Z SURFACE MAP. AREA RADARS SHOW SHOWERS INCREASING IN
COVERAGE AGAIN TO OUR SW AND W...MAINLY FROM OHX COUNTIES EAST TO
NEAR OUR WESTERN MOST AREAS. UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT SEEMS LACKING AS
EARLIER RIGHT REAR QUAD OF UPPER JET HAS EXITED THE REGION. MAIN
REASON FOR THE INCREASE IN SHOWERS SEEMS TO BE MOST LIKELY DUE TO
AN INCREASE IN FRONTOGENETIC FORCING FROM SURFACE TO 850 MBS. NAM
MODEL SHOWS THIS FORCING TO LINGER AS FRONT SLIPS FURTHER EAST
TODAY...BUT IS NEVER REALLY IMPRESSIVE ANY MORE THAN CURRENTLY.
THUS...SHOWERS WILL AFFECT MOST OF THE REGION TODAY...BUT QPF
SHOULD BE LESS THAN FORECAST EARLIER.  

FOR TONIGHT...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL APPROACH WITH SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPING ON THE FRONT...WHICH WILL SPREAD SOME SLIGHTLY MORE
SIGNIFICANT RAINS IN LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. NEW HPC QPF WAS
USED...WITH RAINFALL TOTALS FOR THESE PERIODS AROUND 1.25 TO NEAR
2.0 INCHES. SINCE RAIN THIS MORNING HAS BEEN ON THE LIGHT TO
MODERATE SIDE...I DON'T ANTICIPATE MUCH FLOODING CONCERNS.

MOS POPS GENERALLY FOLLOWED...AND I DID NUDGE WEDNESDAY POPS UP TO
100 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD...AT LEAST FOR THE MORNING HOURS. HIGH
TEMPS TODAY ARE TRICKY GIVEN THE EXTREMELY MILD MID TO UPPER 50S
CURRENTLY. THINK HIGHS TODAY WILL OCCUR IN THE 15Z TO 18Z PERIOD...
THEN TRICKLE DOWN AS COLD FRONT SLIPS EAST. OTHERWISE...MOS MINS
TONIGHT AND MAXES WEDNESDAY LOOKED VERY GOOD.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN
REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH HIGH AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVE WHICH
PUSHES RAPIDLY THROUGH THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SIGNIFICANTLY
COLDER AIR ACCOMPANIES FEATURE...BUT MOISTURE ALSO CUTS OFF
ABRUPTLY. THUS IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT SIGNIFICANT SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS ARE LIKELY AT THIS TIME. NEVERTHELESS...PRECIP
EXPECTED TO END AS SNOW SHOWERS WITH SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING INTO
THURSDAY MORNING IN OUR EASTERN ZONES. BALANCE OF LONG TERM DRY
ALBEIT COOL WITH TEMPS GENERALLY AVERAGING BELOW CLIMO BEFORE
SLOWLY MODERATING TO NEAR CLIMO BY THE END OF THE LONG TERM.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  43  47  27  48 /  90  80 100  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  44  47  26  44 /  90  80 100  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  42  46  25  45 /  90  80 100  40  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              64  46  50  23  42 /  90  80 100  60   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
635 AM EST TUE DEC 6 2011

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT EASING INTO THE TN VALLEY AT THIS TIME. 
SHOWERS CONTINUE TO INCREASE FROM NE AL ACROSS SE TN. THESE SHOWERS 
ARE MOVING NE AT AROUND 45 MPH...AND WILL PRODUCE IFR OR LOWER 
CONDITIONS AT CHA FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. EXPECT CONDITIONS TO 
ALSO WORSEN AT TYS AS THESE SHOWERS REACH THERE SHORTLY AND BRING 
MVFR CEILINGS OR VISBYS. TRI WILL STAY VFR FOR A FEW HOURS LONGER
THEN ALSO TREND DOWNWARD...AS SHOWERS REACH NE TN AND SW VA.

THERE IS SOME HOPE FOR A SLIGHT IMPROVEMENT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT 
LATER THIS AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING. HOWEVER...AS LOW PRESSURE 
DEVELOPS ON THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AGAIN TONIGHT...LOOK FOR IFR OR 
LOWER CONDITIONS FOR ALL 3 TAF SITES AGAIN THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY.

.AVIATION...WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION OVERNIGHT AND ALSO DURING MUCH OF THE 
TAF PERIOD. HOWEVER...THE SHOWERS REALLY WEAKENED AS THE COLD FRONT 
EASED CLOSER TO THE TN VALLEY AROUND MIDNIGHT. DIMINISHING COVERAGE 
AT THE PRESENT TIME MAY ALLOW VISBYS TO DROP WHERE RAIN HAS FALLEN 
EARLIER. 

SHOWERY TYPE OF PRECIPITATION TODAY WILL TRANSITION TO MORE OF A 
LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN LATER TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. AS THESE 
SHOWERS OR RAIN FALLS ACROSS THE REGION EXPECT CONTINUED LOWERING TO 
MVFR OR BRIEFLY LOWER VISBYS AND CEILINGS. CONDITIONS MAY WORSEN 
EVEN MORE AFTER 06Z WEDNESDAY.
