560 
FXUS64 KMRX 182011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST FRI NOV 18 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE HAS ALREADY
SHIFTED EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON...WITH SOME OF THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS ALREADY EXPERIENCING SE WINDS. THESE WINDS
SHOULD DIMINISH THIS EVENING AND I EXPECT MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS
OTHER THAN SRN VALLEY...TO SEE WINDS FALL OFF TO NEAR CALM. LOW
CLOUDS MAY ADVECT INTO SE TN AND POSSIBLY SW NC BEFORE DAYBREAK...
AS RH INCREASES ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE 850 MB RIDGE. THUS...I KEPT
MOST LOWS IN THE 20S AGAIN TONIGHT...EXCEPT FOR A FEW AREAS IN THE
LOWER 30S WHERE THESE CLOUDS AND LIGHT SE WINDS MAY BE A FACTOR.

SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY GRIDS APPEARED TO BE ON TRACK...AS RIDGING
GRADUALLY GIVES WAY TO A CHANCE OF SHOWERS...MAINLY ON SUNDAY. KEPT
POPS BELOW LIKELY EVEN FOR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES FOR NOW...UNTIL THE
FRONT DRAWS A BIT CLOSER BY SUNDAY NIGHT. MOS TEMPS CLOSE TO OUR
PREVIOUS GRIDS AND JUST TWEAKED SLIGHTLY IN LINE WITH 18/12Z GFSX
MOS AND NEIGHBORS GRIDS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS 
ALOFT SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WITH SEVERAL SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES RIDING ACROSS THE REGION 
DURING THIS TIMEFRAME. A SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL DROP SLOWLY 
SOUTH INTO THE AREA KEEPING A DECENT CHANCE OF RAIN IN THE FORECAST. 
PERHAPS THE BEST CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE 
TUESDAY NIGHT AS A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE WAVE RIDE ALONG THE BOUNDARY. THE UPPER FEATURE EXITS 
QUICKLY DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY BUT KEPT A SMALL CHANCE FOR WRAP 
AROUND SHOWERS GOING WITH EMPHASIS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS 
OROGRAPHICALLY FAVORED NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS. REMAINDER OF THE 
FORECAST INCLUDES DRY ADVECTION WITH BUILDING HEIGHTS. TWEAKED 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST CLOSE TO...BUT NOT QUITE AS MILD...AS THE NEW 
MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST THU NOV 17 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A CHILLY AFTERNOON BUT 
WEATHER HAS IMPROVED AS DRIER AND MUCH COOLER AIR CONTINUES TO FLOW 
INTO THE REGION. COLD AIR ADVECTION IS CREATING A STEEP LAPSE RATE
AND HAS ALLOWED SOME CUMULUS/STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS TO DEVELOP FROM SE 
KY ACROSS SW VA/NE TN. THESE CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET...
FOLLOWED BY CLEAR SKIES AND DECREASING WINDS AS SURFACE RIDGE
SETTLES OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY DAYBREAK FRIDAY. THE
COOLER MOS MINS LOOKED VERY REASONABLE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

OTHERWISE...A DRY PERIOD IS EXPECTED RIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. WILL 
IGNORE THE NAM MOS POPS FOR SATURDAY...BUT ALLOW A SLIGHT INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS SW FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF THE 
NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM. SURFACE HIGH LOOKS TO BE ANCHORED ENOUGH TO 
KEEP WINDS LIGHT AND VARIABLE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...SO VALLEY WINDS 
SHOULD STAY LIGHT NE RATHER THAN SWITCH TO SW (UP VALLEY) FLOW. THIS 
SHOULD FAVOR THE 12Z MOS MINS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH WERE A FEW TO 
SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER THAN PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID. MOS HIGHS CLOSE 
AND FOLLOWED FOR FRIDAY...BUT NAM MOS HIGHS LOOKED TOO COOL FOR 
SATURDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. A FRONT TRACKS 
INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND LINGERS OVER THE REGION UNTIL WEDNESDAY. 
WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE EXPECTED...CONTINUED THE CHANCE POPS 
FOR THE SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME. IT SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR 
THURSDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
COLD FRONT HAS NOW MOVED INTO THE CAROLINAS WITH UPPER TROUGH
ABOUT TO MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING AROUND
TROUGH IS SETTING OFF SOME LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE NW HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES ARE MUCH WARMER THAN
ORIGINALLY FORECAST MOSTLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S WITH A FEW
LOCATIONS IN SW VA IN THE UPPER 30S. WIND SPEEDS HAVE INCREASED
DURING THE PAST HOUR OR SO AND DEW POINTS HAVE BEGUN TO DROP AS
COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT HAS INCREASED. THE CURRENT
SHOWERS SHOULD MOVE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA IN ABOUT 6 HOURS BUT
THERE MAY BE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. REDUCED
SNOWFALL TOTAL TO A COUPLE TENTHS BUT EVEN THAT MIGHT BE TOO MUCH.
WITH CURRENT GROUND WARMTH NOT EXPECTING ANY REAL ACCUMULATION
BEFORE PRECIPITATION ENDS. CLOUDS SHOULD DECREASE LATE THIS MORNING
OR EARLY AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES NOT EXPECTED TO RISE MUCH FROM
MORNING LOWS AND MAY ACTUALLY FALL DURING THE AFTERNOON AS COLD AIR
ADVECTION CONTINUES. TONIGHTS LOW LOOK TO BE ABOUT THE COLDEST SO
FAR THIS SEASON WITH LOW TO MID 20S LOWER ELEVATIONS NORTH AND
CENTRAL TO UPPER 20S SOUTH. WINDS WILL LIKELY STAY UP THROUGH THE
EVENING WITH GOOD PRESSURE GRADIENT THEN DECREASE LATER TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER AND COOL
TEMPERATURES THROUGH SATURDAY. WARM UP BEGINS SATURDAY NIGHT AS
RIDGE SLIDES EAST AND LAYER FLOW BECOMES INCREASING SW. WEST TO
EAST FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDES SE AND INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY.
PRECIPITATION CHANCE RETURNS LATER SUNDAY AND LOOKS GOOD FOR
MONDAY. RAIN CHANCE CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY
RETURNS NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. BEST PRECIPITATION CHANCE ON
WEDNESDAY AND COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE EAST THROUGH THE AREA.
TIMING IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD SUBJECT TO CHANGE PENDING TRACK
POSITION OF UPPER LOW EJECTING FROM MEXICO EARLY NEXT WEEK. LEANED
TOWARD GFS TEMPS BEING COOL OVER THE WEEKEND AND WARM NEXT WEEK.

.DISCUSSION...
THE PRIMARY SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS MOVED EAST OF THE
MOUNTAINS...BUT A SECOND FRONT IDENTIFIED BY A STRONG DEWPOINT
GRADIENT APPEARS TO BE LOCATED FROM CNTL KY ACROSS MIDDLE TN THIS
EVENING. BETWEEN THESE FRONTS AND AHEAD OF THE UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH...SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS AND DRIZZLE ARE OCCURRING.
WEAK LARGE SCALE LIFT...DIAGNOSED BY Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE AND
POSITIVE PRESSURE ADVECTION ON THE 1.5 PVU SURFACE...WILL CONTINUE
ACROSS THE AREA UNTIL THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH IN THE
MORNING. THE UPDATE WILL SCALE BACK POPS TO MENTION SCATTERED LIGHT
RAIN SHOWERS AND DRIZZLE. SLIGHT DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO
TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE NEEDED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

326 PM EST WED NOV 16 2011

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD FRONT HAS SLOWLY 
WORKED EAST OF THE PLATEAU COUNTIES THIS AFTERNOON...AND A DRY SLOT 
IS AT LEAST BRIEFLY DIMINISHING THE SHOWERS OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER WEAK DISTURBANCE SHOULD PASS ACROSS THIS 
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...SO WE CAN'T RULE OUT THE HIGH MOS POPS FOR 
TONIGHT. NAM MODEL IS NOW SLOWER IN ENDING PRECIPITATION AND ALSO 
BRINGS IN COLDER AIR AFTER 06Z THURSDAY...VERY MUCH IN LINE WITH THE 
LATEST GFS MODEL. THUS...POPS WERE TWEAKED SOME MAINLY FOR LATE 
TONIGHT AND INTO THURSDAY MORNING. BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS AND 1000-850 
MB THICKNESSES LOOK A BIT TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW IN THE VALLEY OR 
LOWER ELEVATIONS. HOWEVER...I DID INTRODUCE SNOW SHOWER WORDING 
BEFORE DAYBREAK THURSDAY ACROSS SW VA...NRN MTNS AND SMOKY MTNS...
WITH A VERY LIGHT ACCUMULATION (UP TO 1 INCH). COORDINATED WITH RNK 
AND GSP ON THIS...PLUS UPDATED HWO PRODUCT.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST GRIDS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY LOOKED GOOD 
WITH VERY LITTLE CHANGES MADE. THE TORNADO WATCH FOR CHEROKEE AND
CLAY COUNTIES WAS CANCELLED WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE...WHILE TN
COUNTIES WERE ALREADY DROPPED AROUND 2 PM EST.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT. A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND LINGERS OVER THE 
AREA UNTIL WEDNESDAY. WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
EXPECTED...CONTINUED THE CHANCE POPS FOR THE SUNDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME. IT SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION.   
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

LECONTE. CURRENTLY THE HEAVIER RAINS ARE JUST WEST OF OUR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES...ALONG OR NEAR THE SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT. COULD SEE THE 
NEED FOR AN URBAN AND SMALL STREAM FLOOD ADVISORY LATER TODAY...
BUT PROBABLY JUST IN A FEW SPOTS AT BEST.

THE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE AND FRONT SHOULD MOVE EAST FAST ENOUGH 
THIS EVENING...TO ALLOW MOST OF THE RAINS TO END OR GREATLY DIMINISH 
BY 06Z THURSDAY. ANY QPF AFTER 17/06Z IS JUST A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN 
INCH...AND MODEL SOUNDINGS LOOK TOO WARM TO ALLOW ICE NUCLEATION FOR 
SIGNIFICANT SNOW DEVELOPMENT. HOWEVER...PROBABLY WILL ADD A CHANCE 
OF SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES ABOVE 3000 FEET ACROSS SW VA AND NRN 
MTNS OF E TN LATE TONIGHT...IN THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE. 

OTHERWISE...FORECAST GRIDS LOOK GENERALLY ON TRACK THIS MORNING...
BUT HOURLY GRIDS WILL BE TWEAKED IF NEEDED AROUND 11 AM EST.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT

TN PRODUCING MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL. OTHER SHOWERS AND EMBEDDED

CURRENT MODELS SHOW LOW PRESSURE MOVING NE FROM THE TEXAS/LOUISIANA
REGION ALONG THE FRONT WITH IT BEGINNING TO MOVE EAST. SHORTWAVE
ENERGY AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL PRODUCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
SOME POSSIBLY STRONG WITH HEAVY RAINFALL AT TIMES THIS MORNING AND
AFTERNOON. BEHIND THE FRONT SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THIS EVENING AND
THEN DECREASE LATE THIS EVENING OR EARLY MORNING. FREEZING LEVELS
WILL DROP BY EARLY MORNING BUT STAY HIGH ENOUGH THAT PRECIPITATION
SHOULD BE MOSTLY RAIN. CAN NOT RULE OUT A LITTLE SNOW HIGHEST
ELEVATIONS BUT HAVE NOT INCLUDED SINCE AIR MASS WILL HAVE DRIED OUT
BY THURSDAY MORNING. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES WILL BE
COMMON WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS. DO NOT THINK THERE WILL BE ANY
FLOODING WITH RIVERS LOW AND NO SIGNIFICANT HEAVY RAINS THE PAST
TWO WEEKS OR SO. BEST INSTABILITY WILL BE THIS MORNING THEN
DECREASING WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE THIS AFTERNOON. BEST CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS FROM ABOUT 09 TO 21Z. TEMPERATURES STILL MILD THIS
MORNING IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MET
GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS. LOWS TONIGHT MOSTLY LOWER 40S BUT UPPER 30S
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HIGHER MOUNTAINS MAY REACH LOWER TO MID 30S. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ADVECTION OF COLD DRY
AIR WILL BEGIN IN EARNEST THURSDAY MORNING...BRINGING A QUICK END
TO ANY PRECIP CHANCES. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE QUICKLY SETTLES OVER
THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT...AND TEMPS WILL BE BELOW FREEZING AREA
WIDE. CLEAR SKIES WILL PREVAIL THROUGH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS THE
RIDGE MOVES EAST AND THE AIR MASS BEGINS TO MODERATE EACH DAY.

A RETURN FLOW OF MOISTURE ON THE WESTERN SIDE OF THE ATLANTIC RIDGE 
WILL ARRIVE ON SUNDAY. THE GFS AND ECMWF HAVE BEEN IN REASONABLY 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN DEPICTING A FRONT STALLING AROUND THE OHIO VALLEY 
REGION. A MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...AND WITH A NEARLY ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW.
LOWER FORECAST CONFIDENCE NEAR END OF PERIOD AS ANOTHER UPPER LOW 
SWINGS INTO NORTHERN MEXICO WHICH WILL LIKELY CAUSE TIMING PROBLEMS

840 PM EST TUE NOV 15 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
GENERALLY ALONG A MEMPHIS TO NASHVILLE TO PIKEVILLE KY LINE...WITH A 
VERY MOIST AND UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS OCCURRING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH STRONG TSTORMS OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE. THIS SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TOWARDS SUNRISE. WHILE THIS SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO 
WEAKEN OVERNIGHT...IT SHOULD HELP TO DESTABILIZE THE AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...LEADING TO THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME TSTORMS 
TOWARDS SUNRISE. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE VERTICAL WIND FIELD WILL 
STRENGTHEN SOME OVERNIGHT...SO THINK THAT SOME STRONG TSTORMS WITH 
GUSTY WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE TOWARDS 
SUNRISE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

ANYWHERE UNTIL LATE TUESDAY WHEN A TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. 
WHILE THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES LOOK TO BE ACROSS KY...WILL HAVE A 
CHANCE POP NORTH AND A SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTH FOR SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH TUESDAY. WILL FORECAST ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EACH 
DAY...HIGHS NEAR 70 IN THE TN VALLEY...WITH THE FRONT EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN NORTH OF THE AREA.

THE REGION.

SKIES BY LATE THURSDAY. RIDGING REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
BUT MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
WITH INCREASING MOISTURE BY MORNING. WILL INCREASE CLOUDS...MAINLY 
SOUTHERN AND WESTERN AREAS SATURDAY MORNING WITH PARTLY-MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKY ANTICIPATED SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. ANOTHER FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY AND MONDAY BEFORE STALLING. WILL 
HAVE CHANCE POPS NORTH AND SLIGHT POP SOUTH FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.

.AVIATION...VFR CONDITIONS WILL BE THE RULE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...EXCEPT FOR MARGINAL MVFR AT CHA EARLY TUESDAY MORNING. A 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS KENTUCKY TUESDAY WITH MOIST 
SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY. THE MOIST SOUTHERLY WINDS 
WILL CONTINUE TO PULL A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUD COVER INTO THE REGION 
WITH CEILINGS GENERALLY BETWEEN 3500-5000 FEET. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
ANTICIPATED WITH THE BEST COVERAGE AND INTENSITY TUESDAY

FXUS64 KMRX 141930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST MON NOV 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
CONTINUES IN ADVANCE OF SLOWLY APPROACHING SYSTEM CURRENTLY LOCATED 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. UPPER FLOW REMAINS SLIGHTLY ANTICYCLONIC 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH MAIN PRECIP AXIS REMAINING TO 
OUR NORTHWEST. AS SUCH...HAVE CONTINUED A PRECIP GRADIENT FROM 
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST TONIGHT. CONTINUED LIKELY POPS FOR MOST 
LOCATIONS TOMORROW AS MODELS INDICATE A SHORT WAVE WILL APPROACH IN 
THE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO 
FAVOR A BLEND OF THE MAV AND MET GUIDANCE. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
LARGE SCALE QG FORCING WILL INCREASE TUESDAY NIGHT AS A SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH THAT LIFTS NE OUT OF TX/LA. STRONG MOISTURE 
ADVECTION AND GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE JET ENTRANCE REGION WILL 
RESULT IN CATEGORICAL POPS AND QPF EXCEEDING 1 INCH TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. THERE WILL ALSO BE SOME INSTABILITY 
PRESENT TO WARRANT A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. WHILE PRECIP MAY BE 
LOCALLY HEAVY AT TIMES...DRY ANTECEDENT CONDITIONS AND THE WEAKENING 
TREND OF THE SYSTEM AS IT APPROACHES DIMINISH THE NEED FOR A FLOOD 
WATCH AT THIS TIME. THE 850 MB TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON...THEN STRONG DRY ADVECTION ALOFT SHOULD END ALL PRECIP 
CHANCES WEDNESDAY EVENING. THE COLD AIR LAGGING BEHIND THE DRYING 
SHOULD PREVENT ANY CHANGE TO FROZEN PRECIP WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

COLD ADVECTION THURSDAY WILL RESULT IN HIGH TEMPS IN THE 50S IN MOST 
SPOTS...WITH LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE 20S TO LOWER 30S AND CLEAR 
SKIES. THE WEEKEND WILL BRING A NICE WARMING TREND AS THE ATLANTIC 
RIDGE BECOMES DOMINANT AND PROVIDES A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY 
FLOW...WITH HIGHS WELL INTO THE 60S AGAIN. ON SUNDAY THE 12Z GFS 
SHOWS A LOW TRACKING ACROSS THE UPPER MS VALLEY TO THE UPPER GREAT 
LAKES WITH A FRONT TRAILING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND STALLING. THE 
UPPER JET ALSO BECOMES POSITIONED OVER THE REGION SUNDAY AND MONDAY. 
THE ECMWF SHOWS A FAIRLY SIMILAR PATTERN...AND THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN 
PUTS OUT SOME PRECIP NEARBY...SO WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR 
BOTH DAYS WITH TEMPS WELL ABOVE NORMAL.

MUCH MORE THAN SOME VERY LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE WHICH MAY HAVE A HARD 
TIME REACHING MEASURABLE AMOUNTS...BUT HAVE BEEN ADVERTISING LOW 
POPS SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR MONDAY ALL ZONES. NOT 
MUCH ARGUMENT WITH MAV TEMPS.  OBSERVATIONS INDICATE WINDS HAVE BEEN 
BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA...SO PLAN TO DROP THE ADVISORY A COUPLE 
OF HOURS EARLY FOR THE PLATEAU. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
CONTINUE TO EXHIBIT POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY AND DUBIOUS MODEL 
AGREEMENT WITH APPROACHING SYSTEM. AS A RESULT...TIMING OF ONSET AND 
DEPARTURE OF ASSOCIATED PRECIP REMAINS UNCERTAIN. MOST MODELS HAVE 
SLOWED DOWN PROGRESSION OF FRONT WITH FROPA THROUGH OUR FORECAST 
AREA PROJECTED TO OCCUR SOMETIME EARLY WEDNESDAY. APPEARS PRECIP 
WILL LINGER THROUGH WEDNESDAY AND HAVE SLIGHTLY INCREASED POPS FOR 
THAT PERIOD. BALANCE OF LONG TERM CONTINUES TO LOOK DRY AT THIS 
TIME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE... ALTHOUGH MODEL UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO FRONTAL 
PROGRESSION LOWERS CONFIDENCE IN THOSE ALSO.

TN/SW VA WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY DRY TODAY SO WENT ABOVE MOS 
TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE FOR THOSE AREAS. CLOUDS INCREASE TONIGHT WITH 
WARMER OVERNIGHT TEMPS.

THE APPROACH OF AN INCOMING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.  HAVE LOWERED POPS 
SLIGHTLY FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...AND INCREASED POPS TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  THE SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO GENERATE WIDESPREAD 
RAINFALL AND WITH A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACCOMPANYING THE 
SYSTEM...SHOULD SEE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS AS THE ASSOCIATED FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH.  A WARM...MOIST AIR MASS WILL ALSO BE IN PLACE WITH 
THE PASSAGE OF THE SYSTEM.  BY THURSDAY...THE SYSTEM WILL HAVE 
EXITED THE REGION...WITH DRY...COOL AIR MOVING IN FOR FOR THE REST 
FOR THE PERIOD.

WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS...BUT WILL STAY DRY FOR 
THE SHORT TERM.  MAV TEMPS AGAIN LOOK REASONABLE SO ONLY A FEW MINOR 
TWEAKS.  


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT 
SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY IN THE 
WORK WEEK REMAINS MAIN FOCUS FOR THE LONG TERM. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
COME INTO SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT...WITH THE CONSENSUS NOW 
PROJECTING THE MAIN EVENT TO OCCUR TUESDAY. STILL SOME DISAGREEMENT 
ON DEPARTURE TIME LINE. BALANCE OF LONG TERM APPEARS DRY AT THIS 
TIME. TEMPS MODERATE TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW INCREASES BEFORE FALLING BEHIND FRONT. TEMPS 
PROJECTED TO SLOWLY REBOUND TO NEAR OR ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE IN THE 
LONG TERM.

ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN ADVANCE OF

PRIOR TO COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE TUESDAY NIGHT. CONFIDENCE IN LATER 
PART OF FORECAST FALLS OFF SOME AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY HANG ACROSS 
SOUTHERN PART OF MRX CWA. KEPT WITH A DRIER SOLUTION BANKING ON HIGH

STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WILL 
FEATURE CLEAR SKIES AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND AS A LOW LEVEL 
RIDGE SHIFTS FROM THE WESTERN GULF COAST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST. THE 
850 MB THERMAL TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA ON FRIDAY...RESULTING IN 
HIGH TEMPS IN THE MID/UPPER 40S NORTH TO LOWER/MID 50S SOUTH. A 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL BRING HIGHS INTO THE MID 60S IN 
MOST SPOTS BY SUNDAY. 

GFS AND ECMWF ARE SHOWING A LARGE DISPARITY IN THE TIMING OF PRECIP 
FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH CONSIDERABLE SPREAD IN THE 
ENSEMBLES AS WELL. THE GFS FAVORS TWO SEPARATE SYSTEMS...ONE FOR 
MONDAY FOLLOWED BY A SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH ON WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF 
SHOWS A DEEP TROUGH PASSING THROUGH ON TUESDAY. GIVEN THE HIGH 
UNCERTAINTY THIS PERIOD...WILL NOT MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE 
FORECAST...KEEPING CHANCE POPS IN MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  28  56  34  65 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  28  52  33  63 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  28  52  32  62 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  26  47  26  62 /   0  10   0   0   0

249 
FXUS64 KMRX 092331
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
630 PM EST WED NOV 9 2011

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT MOVING STEADILY EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY WITH 
AT LEAST SCATTERED -SHRA TO AFFECT MAINLY TYS AND TRI FOR THE NEXT 2 
TO 5 HOURS. POOR CONDITIONS AT CHA (MVFR TO IFR) SHOULD IMPROVE 
SHORTLY WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. TYS WILL EXPERIENCE MVFR OR LOWER FOR 
ANOTHER 1 TO 3 HOURS THEN ALSO IMPROVE WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE.  

CONDITIONS WILL BE TRENDING DOWNWARD AT TRI AS RAIN HAS FINALLY 
REACHED THE SURFACE...BUT PROBABLY NO LOWER THAN MVFR.

SECOND HALF OF THIS TAF PACKAGE WILL SEE VFR CONDITIONS DOMINATE 
WITH SOME BREEZY W-NW SURFACE WINDS ON THURSDAY. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSIONS FOLLOW...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP THROUGH 
THIS EVENING.  MOISTURE LIMITED AND SO WILL JUST SEE SOME MAINLY 
LIGHT SHOWERS.  WILL CARRY NO HIGHER THAN CHANCE POPS TONIGHT.  
COLDER AIR WILL PUSH IN LATER TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...AND UPPER 
TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE AREA.  MODEL SOUNDINGS LOOK RATHER 
UNFAVORABLE FOR ANY UPSLOPE SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS LATE TONIGHT AND 
THURSDAY...SO WILL CARRY NO MORE THAN SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF NORTH AND MOUNTAINS THU MORNING.  MAY BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
SOME SNOW SHOWERS HIGHEST TERRAIN LATE TONIGHT/EARLY THU.  NOT MUCH 
ARGUMENT WITH MAV TEMPS SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH
FOLLOWING TONIGHTS SURFACE FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THURSDAY NIGHT. A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY
INTO THE MIDDLE APPALACHIANS AND SPREAD SOME CLOUD COVER TO
NORTHEAST SECTIONS OVERNIGHT BUT NO PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED.
OTHERWISE SKIES WILL BE CLEAR SE TO PARTLY CLOUDY NE. LOWS SHOULD
BE THE COLDEST OF THE YEAR EXCEPT ACROSS THE NE WHERE SOME WINDS
AND CLOUDS WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 20S TO NEAR 30.
AREAS NEAR TRI AND SW NC VALLEYS SHOULD DROP TO THE MID 20S AND
HIGHER MOUNTAINS IN THE TEENS. FRIDAY NOT MUCH WARM UP WITH SOME
COLD AIR ADVECTION STILL CONTINUING. HIGHS SIMILAR TO THURSDAY MID
40S TO MID 50S. NICE WARM UP SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY AS SURFACE HIGH
SETTLES OVER THE SE STATES AND RIDGING ALOFT MOVES ALONG THE EAST
COAST. GFS BEGINS TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AHEAD
OF SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND MS VALLEY. WITH
STRENGTH OF RIDGE TO THE SOUTH MODELS HANG THIS SYSTEM UP OVER OHIO
VALLEY AND SHEAR OFF MOST OF THE ENERGY TO THE NORTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA. MAIN SYSTEM TO AFFECT FORECAST AREA LOOKS TO BE ONE
OVER MEXICO AND THE SOUTHWEST STATES MONDAY THAT MOVES INTO THE MS
AND OH VALLEYS TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY WARM IN THE 60S TO
POSSIBLY LOWERS 70S WITH SOME AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS. MODELS NOW FASTER WITH THE SYSTEM
MOVING IT EAST RAPIDLY TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. WILL
LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN WEDNESDAY FOR NOW.
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST WED NOV 9 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MIDWEST SHORT WAVE TROUGH MOVES
NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES TODAY WHILE ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE
ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF MANITOBA LATE IN THE SHORT TERM. AT
THE SURFACE...LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS WHILE HEADING NORTHEAST ACROSS
THE MIDWEST ENDING UP IN NORTHEAST ONTARIO LATE TONIGHT. MOISTURE
IS SOMEWHAT LIMITED AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT AND LOW
LEVEL CONVERGENCE NOT TOO IMPRESSIVE AS THE BOUNDARY MOVES TOWARD
THE APPALACHIANS LATE TODAY. THEREFORE...KEPT POPS IN CHECK
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS SHOWERS
WILL BECOME WIDELY SCATTERED HERE. THE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION
WILL BE RATHER LOW AND LIMITED TO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE CLOSER TO THE
BEST INSTABILITY. PRECIP WRAPS UP FAIRLY QUICKLY TOWARD 00Z
THURSDAY AND MAINTAINED SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE POPS FOR A SMALL SECTION
OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DURING THE EVENING.
STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS IN THE SHORT
TERM.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT
BUT AHEAD OF THE 500 MB TROUGH...THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SOME RAIN SHOWERS ON THURSDAY. FALLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS AND AN
UPSLOPE 850 MB WIND AROUND 30 KTS WILL ENHANCE PRECIP CHANCES IN
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...ALTHOUGH MOISTURE WILL BE VERY LIMITED.

FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WILL FEATURE DRY AND CLEAR CONDITIONS AS A LOW 
LEVEL RIDGE MOVES ACROSS THE SE CONUS WITH A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT. A GRADUAL WARMING TREND CAN BE EXPECTED EACH DAY...WITH HIGHS 
FRIDAY ONLY IN THE MID 40S TO MID 50S...RISING TO THE MID/UPPER 60S 
BY MONDAY. THE FLOW BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED ON SUNDAY...AND THE 
POSITION OF THE RIDGE NEAR THE ATLANTIC COAST WILL ADVECT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. LOW PRESSURE WILL TRACK FROM THE PLAINS TO 
THE GREAT LAKES EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK. THE ECMWF AND GFS HAVE SOME 
TIMING DIFFERENCES REGARDING THE ONSET OF PRECIP WITH THE ECMWF 
PREFERRING MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT AND THE GFS PREFERRING TUESDAY. WILL 
HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR MONDAY BUT LEAN TOWARD THE GFS AND ITS 
ENSEMBLES AND HAVE THE HIGHER POPS ON TUESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 090258
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 PM EST TUE NOV 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO GRIDS OVERNIGHT. INCREASED CLOUDS LATE 
ACROSS WESTERN AREAS. RAISED TEMPS AND DPS...MAINLY ACROSS CENTRAL 
AREAS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...SYSTEM TO OUR WEST 
HEADED THIS WAY...BUT LOOKING A LITTLE SLOWER NOW. MOST OF THE 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED BETWEEN ABOUT 16Z AND 06Z TOMORROW AND TOMORROW 
NIGHT. INSTABILITY LOOKS PRETTY MINIMAL...JUST GOING WITH SHOWERS 
VERSUS THUNDER FOR THIS EVENT.

LOOKS LIKE COLD AIR WILL ARRIVE LATE ENOUGH THAT FROZEN AND
FREEZING PRECIP WILL NOT BE AN ISSUE IN THESE PERIODS EVEN IN THE
MOUNTAINS. 

FOR TEMPS...WENT A LITTLE ON THE WARM SIDE OF GUIDANCE
FOR WEDNESDAY...ESPECIALLY EAST THINKING THAT PRECIP WILL HOLD OFF
LONG ENOUGH TO GET ALMOST MAX HEATING IN SOME AREAS. 


LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY AND THURSDAY 
EVENING WITH THE BRUNT OF THE DYNAMICS NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...ENOUGH BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE AND INCREASING NORTHWEST 
FLOW WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF UPSLOPE PRECIPITATION INTO SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA MOUNTAINS AND NORTH AND CENTRAL FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. VERTICAL PROFILE 
BECOMES COLD ENOUGH TO SUPPORT A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY 
NIGHT. LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION ANTICIPATED.

UPPER TROUGH EXITS AREA EARLY FRIDAY WITH MORE ZONAL FLOW AND 
SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT. DRY WITH CHILLY MORNINGS AND MILD AFTERNOON ANTICIPATED.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...SURFACE RIDGING MOVES EAST ALLOWING 
FOR INCREASING MOISTURE FLOWING NORTH FROM THE GULF INTO THE WESTERN 
TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS. INCREASING CLOUDS FROM WEST TO EAST 
SUNDAY. A SERIES OF FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE EAST NORTHEAST 
ACROSS PLAINS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. GFS AND ECMWF BOTH SHOW A 
MOISTURE PLUME OF SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE ADVECTING ACROSS THE WEST 
AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND OHIO VALLEY WITH A SLOW MOVING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. A HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT IS 
POSSIBLE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT BEST FRONTAL GENETIC 
FORCING AND UPPER JET DYNAMICS STAY WEST OF THE AREA THROUGH 
TUESDAY. WILL ONLY INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE - CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MEX MOS LOOKS REASONABLE THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

SUNDAY. A SERIES OF FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE EAST NORTHEAST 
ACROSS PLAINS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. GFS AND ECMWF BOTH SHOW A 
MOISTURE PLUME OF SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE ADVECTING ACROSS THE WEST 
AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND OHIO VALLEY WITH A SLOW MOVING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. A HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT IS 
POSSIBLE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT BEST FRONTAL GENETIC 
FORCING AND UPPER JET DYNAMICS STAY WEST OF THE AREA THROUGH 
TUESDAY. WILL ONLY INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE - CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MEX MOS LOOKS REASONABLE THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

989 
FXUS64 KMRX 080847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EST TUE NOV 8 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
THE RIDGE THAT HAS DOMINATED THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FOR THE 
PAST FEW DAYS WILL FINALLY GIVE WAY AS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
TRACK NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS TODAY. INCREASING MOISTURE 
ADVECTION WILL BEGIN TODAY WITH A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW. HIGH 
CLOUDS WILL NOT KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM RISING WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL...INTO THE LOWER 70S ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY. 

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THAT ONSET OF PRECIP WILL HOLD OFF 
UNTIL WEDNESDAY AS MOISTURE DEPTH INCREASES RAPIDLY FROM WEST TO 
EAST. LIFT BECOMES WEAKER AS THE FRONT TRACKS EASTWARD DUE TO THE 
UPPER JET BEING POSITIONED OVER THE GREAT LAKES. INSTABILITY IS 
LACKING AS WELL AS LI STAYS POSITIVE AND 850 MB THETA-E VALUES ARE 
AROUND 325K. WILL HAVE JUST A CHANCE OF THUNDER IN WESTERN PORTIONS. 
WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS IN THE WESTERN HALF WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON...DECREASING TO A CHANCE EAST WEDNESDAY EVENING. PRECIP 
AREA SHOULD BE NARROW ALONG THE FRONT WITH RAPID DRYING BEHIND...SO 
WILL DROP POPS QUICKLY AFTER 06Z THURSDAY. WILL KEEP A LOW POP IN 
THE NORTH ON THURSDAY AS THE 500 MB TROUGH AXIS SWINGS BY. A MUCH 
COLDER AIR MASS BUILDS IN THURSDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S AND LOWS 
THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT AT THE START OF THE LONG TERM BUT
DIFFERENCES EMERGE BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND GFS BY SUNDAY. THE LONG
TERM STARTS OUT RATHER NICE AS TRAILING GREAT LAKES AND
NORTHEASTERN U.S. SHORT WAVE PROGGED TO DEPART THE APPALACHIANS BY
12Z FRIDAY WITH BUILDING HEIGHTS ALOFT ALONG WITH SURFACE RIDGING
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. AN AMPLIFIED PATTERN DEVELOPS AGAIN DURING
THE WEEKEND AS AN UPPER TROUGH FORMS OVER THE WESTERN STATES. THE
GFS TRIES TO BRING A SHORT WAVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND
GREAT LAKES SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AND GENERATES A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS
THE OHIO VALLEY BUT THE WAVE IS SLOWER AND MORE SUBTLE WHEN VIEWED
ON THE OPERATIONAL EUROPEAN MODEL. STAYED CLOSER TO THE ECMWF
DEPICTION CONCERNING THE WEEKEND WAVE AND STAYED THE COURSE WITH
SHORT WAVE ENERGY WHICH RIDES NORTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS
AND ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. GFS/ECMWF
RELATIVELY CLOSE WITH TIMING OF THIS FEATURE WHICH DRAGS A
WEAKENING COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED SHOWERS TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS
AS ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPS INTO A DEEPENING WESTERN
STATES LONG WAVE TROUGH. DID NOT MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO
TEMPERATURES FROM THE PREVIOUS PACKAGE.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST MON NOV 7 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATING THE 
SCENE THIS AFTERNOON AND SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY.  VALLEY 
FOG IN SOME LOCATIONS THIS MORNING...AND WOULD EXPECT GREATER THAN 
OR EQUAL TO THIS MORNING'S AMOUNT TOMORROW MORNING.  WINDS ARE VERY 
LIGHT NOW...AND SHOULD CONTINUE LIGHT OVERNIGHT...WITH EXCEPTION OF 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE WINDS WILL START TO PICK UP SLIGHTLY 
OVERNIGHT.  BEST WINDS LIKELY TO BE ON PLATEAU WHERE RETURN FLOW IS 
MORE ESTABLISHED.  ALSO THIS MORNING DRAINAGE THAT COOLED VALLEY 
LOCATIONS TO FORM THE FOG WERE COOLER THAN SURROUNDING MID TO HIGH 
TERRAIN IN MANY CASES.  THINK THE SAME SCENARIO WILL OCCUR 
TONIGHT...SO HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL HAVE WARMER TEMPS LATE TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST TUESDAY NIGHT AS DEVELOPING 
FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO MS VALLEY. CLOUDS SHOULD SLOWLY INCREASE 
OVERNIGHT AND THEN BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY BY AFTERNOON EXCEPT ACROSS 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS. THE BEST INSTABILITY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE ACROSS THE LOWER TN VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT AND THEN 
ALONG THE GULF COAST WEDNESDAY SO DID NOT INCLUDE THUNDERSTORMS. 
HOWEVER A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT 
WEDNESDAY. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE REGION 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY WITH RAIN SHOWERS LIKELY. AS THE 
AN UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS THURSDAY THERE WILL BE SOME LINGERING 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF THE CWA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD BACK IN FOR THE WEEKEND FOR DRY AND WARMING CONDITIONS. 
TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN TUESDAY. MUCH 
COOLER THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES MONDAY WITH 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING AND MOVING INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
ATLANTIC STATES...WHICH EXTENDS OVER THE ENTIRE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING THIS SURFACE HIGH 
AROUND THE EAST COAST THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS STATES ON TUESDAY. A SOUTHWESTERLY 
WIND FLOW AHEAD OF THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY BY MONDAY...BRINGING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND TEMPS 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT ANY PRECIP 
ASSOCIATED WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY ON 
TUESDAY...WILL STAY WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL TRACK 
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING A CHANCE 
FOR RAINSHOWERS. WITH AN WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS...COULD SEE A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING TOWARD 
A DRIER AIRMASS WITH STRETCHING SYSTEM. UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS ON 
THURSDAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS...MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA. TIMING OF UPPER TROUGH STILL IN QUESTION BUT 
GFS APPEARS TO MOVE IT THROUGH TOO FAST. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR YET ANOTHER FALL WEEKEND. STAYED NEAR

MOVING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY.

UPDATE TO REMOVE SOME MORNING WORDING.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST SUN NOV 6 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A SURFACE RIDGE REMAINS ANCHORED TO THE EASTERN SLOPES OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...WHILE A MID/UPPER LEVEL RIDGE SITS OVER THE AREA. 
OVERCAST CLOUDS ARE NOTED ACROSS UPSTATE SC AND NE GA THIS MORNING. 
AN EASTERLY BOUNDARY LAYER WIND WILL TRANSPORT THIS MOISTURE INTO 
THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TODAY. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN AT LEAST PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES IN THE CHATTANOOGA AREA AND IN SW NC. A DOWNSLOPE WIND 
COMPONENT SHOULD KEEP THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY MOSTLY CLEAR. 
UNCERTAINTY IN THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER WILL MAKE FOR A TRICKY 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT...WILL STAY WITHIN 
THE MOS GUIDANCE WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 60S IN MOST SPOTS AND LOWS 
TONIGHT IN THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. A COLD FRONT 
WILL TRACK THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING A CHANCE FOR RAINSHOWERS. WITH AN WEAKLY UNSTABLE 
AIRMASS...COULD SEE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP ON WEDNESDAY. UPPER 
TROUGH FOLLOWS ON THURSDAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS...MAINLY 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

PATTERN DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WITH A DEEP 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN HALF. A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY...AS THIS SURFACE HIGH 
AND UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD. THESE SOUTHWEST WINDS 
WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND A WARMING TREND THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING ACROSS 
THE AREA BEGINS TO WEAKEN EARLY IN THE PERIOD. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES NE TO NEAR MO BY EARLY WED. ADJUSTED TEMPS UPWARD SLIGHTLY IN 
ADVANCE OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT WHICH MOVES INTO THE TN RVR VLY ON 
WED. CONVECTION LIKELY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT MOVING EAST INTO THE AREA 
ON WED AND CONTINUING WED NGT. COLD FRONT SLOWS AS UPPER TROUGH 
DEEPENS THROUGH THE TN VLY INTO THU. UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL LIKELY 
MOVE EAST THROUGH MRX CWA BY THU EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
WEAKLY THROUGH THE REMAINED OF THE PERIOD. ADJUSTED TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
COOLER BEHIND FRONT.

CLEAR SKIES. COLD AIR ADVECTION BECOMES NEUTRAL OVERNIGHT AND WARM ADVECTION
BEGINS TOMORROW. LEANED ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE WITH DRY AIRMASS
IN PLACE SATURDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE REGION WILL SLOWLY SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA EARLY IN THE 
EXTENDED.  THE HIGH WILL DOMINATE OUR WEATHER THROUGH TUESDAY FOR 
DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS.  A COLD FRONT PUSHES IN ON WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING IN A BAND OF SHOWERS AND WITH A WEAKLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT...A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
POSSIBLE AS WELL.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO THURSDAY 
MORNING...OTHERWISE...AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK IN FOR LATE 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

AN OCCLUDED LOW OVER THE AREA WILL TRACK TO THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH
THE DAY. SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ARE
ASSOCIATED WITH A TROWAL ON THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF THE LOW. THE
SHOWERS WILL LIKELY CONTINUE INTO THE MORNING...THEN END EARLY IN
THE AFTERNOON ONCE THE TROWAL EXITS TO THE EAST. WILL HAVE LIKELY
POPS BETWEEN 12-15Z...FALLING TO A SLIGHT CHANCE BETWEEN 15-18Z.
SHOWERS WILL BE LIGHT WITH LESS THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH EXPECTED
THROUGH THE MORNING. BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS SHOULD COME IN THE EARLY
AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR ALOFT BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH. TEMPS WILL
BE TRICKY AND HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON HOW QUICKLY THE CLOUDS
RECEDE...WILL HAVE HIGHS IN THE MID 50S TO AROUND 60 IN MOST SPOTS
OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. A BUILDING RIDGE PROVIDING CLEAR SKIES AND
FALLING DEWPOINTS WILL LEAD TO LOWS IN THE 30S ACROSS THE AREA
TONIGHT.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. A COLD 
FRONT WILL TRACK THROUGH THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING A CHANCE FOR RAINSHOWERS. WITH A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS... 
COULD SEE THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP ON WEDNESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO MEX/HPC GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT THU NOV 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A DEEP AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEAST ALONG 
AN OWENSBORO KY TO NASHVILLE TN TO HUNTSVILLE AL LINE. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN AHEAD OF THIS 
COLD FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
COINCIDENT WITH THIS DEEP SURFACE LOW WILL DRIFT ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY TONIGHT...PROVIDING ENOUGH LIFT TO GENERATE AREAS OF LIGHT 
RAIN OR DRIZZLE BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL THEN SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD 
OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE 
WEEKEND...BRINGING TRANQUIL AND COOL CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES ON BOTH 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. FOR NOW...WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE SHIFTING EAST OF 
THE AREA WILL DOMINATE WEATHER MONDAY AND TUESDAY FOR DRY AND WARM 
CONDITIONS. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN FOR THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY 
NIGHT...PROVIDING A ROUND OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE MRX CWA. A WEAKLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL ALLOW A CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORM THURSDAY AFTERNOON. AN UPPER RIDGE AND BENIGN 
CONDITIONS RETURNS FOR THURSDAY.

660 
FXUS64 KMRX 030640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT THU NOV 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL GIVE WAY TO AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE MID-SECTION
OF THE NATION. THIS TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST TO SOUTHEAST INTO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE TODAY THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING.
STRONG UPPER JET (300MB AROUND 110KTS) WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER MODERATELY STRONG
DIVERGENCE ALOFT. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL
CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE JET AND FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WILL
PRODUCE A SOLID BAND OF SHOWERS. INSTABILITY IS QUITE LIMITED...SO
ONLY INCLUDE ISOLATED THUNDER FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

AS UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THURSDAY NIGHT...A 
MODERATELY STRONG DEFORMATION ZONE AND TROWAL WILL KEEP THE 
RAIN/SHOWERS GOING FOR THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...THEN EXIT FRIDAY MORNING.

UPPER TROUGH IS FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE AND WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA 
FRIDAY WITH CLEARING SKY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. WENT WITH A COMPROMISE 
OF MET/MAV TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE STILL 
LOOKS TO PROVIDE AN EXTREMELY NICE FALL WEEKEND...WITH PROLONGED SW 
FLOW ALOFT AS TROUGH IN THE CENTRAL/SRN ROCKIES HOLDS TO OUR WEST. 
I LIKED THE PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WHICH DELAY THE ONSET OF SHOWERS 
AS LONG AS POSSIBLE...WITH ECMWF AND GFS SIMILAR IN HOLDING OFF 
SIGNIFICANT SHOWERS (POSSIBLE TSRA) UNTIL WEDNESDAY. 

MAX AND MIN FORECAST IS SOMEWHAT CHALLENGING AS GFSX MOS HAS BEEN 
TRENDING SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH HIGHS FROM 02/00Z TO 03/00Z MODEL RUNS 
AND SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH MINS AS WELL. SW FLOW ALOFT SHOULD KEEP 
TEMPS ABOVE CLIMO...BUT SURFACE HIGH PLACEMENT AND DRY AIR MAY LET 
SHELTERED VALLEYS DECOUPLE AND GET CLOSE TO COOLER MOS MINS...WHILE
PLATEAU AREAS AND HIGHER TERRAIN BENEFIT MORE FROM THE SW FLOW AND 
WARM AIR ALOFT. THIS LOOKS ESPECIALLY TRUE UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN 
SURFACE HIGH PRESURE SHIFTS EAST AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT. 

FOR NOW...I KEPT SOME CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS AND 
HPC MAX/MIN TEMPS...PLUS I STAYED CONSISTENT WITH NEIGHBORING NWS 
OFFICES AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. ANYWAY...NET RESULT FROM WEATHER 
PATTERN WILL BE DRY WEATHER LIKELY UNTIL WEDNESDAY...AND TEMPS 
GENERALLY ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS FOR EARLY NOVEMBER.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  42  63  40  67 /  90  30  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  44  60  39  65 /  90  80  20   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  44  60  38  65 /  90  70  10   0   0

312 PM EDT WED NOV 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE TONIGHT WILL GIVE WAY TO AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE
MID-SECTION OF THE NATION. THIS TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST TO SOUTHEAST 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. STRONG 
UPPER JET (300MB AROUND 110KTS) WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER MODERATELY STRONG DIVERGENCE 
ALOFT. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THURSDAY-THURSDAY EVENING. THE AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE JET AND FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WILL PRODUCE A SOLID BAND OF 
SHOWERS. INSTABILITY IS QUITE LIMITED...SO ONLY INCLUDE ISOLATED 
THUNDER FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

AS UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THURSDAY NIGHT...A 
MODERATELY STRONG DEFORMATION ZONE AND TROWAL WILL KEEP THE 
RAIN/SHOWERS GOING FOR THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE THURSDAY NIGHT...THEN EXIT FRIDAY MORNING.

UPPER TROUGH IS FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE AND WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA 
FRIDAY WITH CLEARING SKY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. WENT WITH A COMPROMISE 
OF MET/MAV TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NICE AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE AND ASSOCIATED PLEASANT WEATHER ARRIVES IN TIME FOR THE 
WEEKEND KEEPING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DRY INTO THE BEGINNING OF 
THE WORK WEEK. A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL BE PRESSING SLOWLY EAST FROM THE SOUTHWESTERN STATES ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE SYSTEM AMPLIFIES 
WITH A DEEPENING CLOSED LOW FORMING DURING THIS PERIOD. KEPT A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS GOING TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND BY WEDNESDAY...THE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION INCREASES AS 
STRONG MOISTURE TRANSPORT OCCURS AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE 
FRONTAL SYSTEM. PERHAPS THE BEST CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH SYSTEM FROPA. TWEAKED MAX 
AND MIN TEMPS CLOSER TO THE NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH FEATURES A 
NICE WARMING TREND WITH THE MERCURY CLIMBING TO AROUND 70 DEGREES 
FOR HIGHS MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH INCREASINGLY 'MILD' LOW 
TEMPERATURES AS SOUTHERLY WINDS STRENGTHEN PULLING WARMER...MORE 
HUMID AIR INTO THE REGION.

&&

.AVIATION...PLAINS STATES STORM SYSTEM MOVES STEADILY EAST ACROSS

WILL NOT ARRIVE IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY UNTIL LATE IN THE AFTERNOON
SO FLIGHT WEATHER SHOULD REMAIN VFR AT THE TERMINALS THROUGHOUT THE
FORECAST PERIOD. WEATHER MAY DETERIORATE TOWARD MVFR CONDITIONS AT
CHA AROUND 17-18Z AS THE STRONGER LIFT AHEAD OF THE FRONT MOVES
OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU PRODUCING A LINE OF LIGHT TO MODERATE
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM.

FXUS64 KMRX 020650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT WED NOV 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY AND PLEASANT CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS RIDGING SURFACE AND 
ALOFT PERSISTS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. HEIGHT RISES 
ASSOCIATED WITH BUILDING UPPER RIDGE SUGGEST THAT TEMPS WILL 
MODERATE TO ABOVE CLIMO TODAY. GUIDANCE TEMPS GENERALLY CLOSE AND 
APPEAR REASONABLE BASED ON EXPECTED SCENARIO. THUS DID NOT DEVIATE 
MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM IS THE UPPER LOW 
AND COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE TN VALLEY BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. BEST 
RAIN CHANCES STILL APPEAR TO BE THURSDAY AFTERNOON IN THE WEST AND 
PERHAPS THURSDAY EVENING IN THE EAST. INSTABILITY IS LACKING...SO 
WILL JUST CARRY SHOWERS AT THIS POINT. UPPER RIDGE IS SHOWN TO BE 
BUILDING ACROSS WRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE FRIDAY...SO 
DECREASING CLOUDS LOOKS GOOD. NAM MODEL IS SLOWEST WITH SYSTEM... 
WITH GFS AND ECMWF SUPPORTING PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. THUS...LITTLE 
CHANGES MADE FOR THURSDAY THRU FRIDAY GRIDS. 

DRY WEATHER RETURNS FOR THE WEEKEND WELL INTO MONDAY...AS SW FLOW 
ALOFT DEVELOPS BETWEEN UPPER RIDGE OVER SE STATES...AND THE 
DEVELOPING UPPER TROUGH OVER ROCKY MTN STATES. NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN 
COULD HOLD OFF AS LATE AS TUESDAY NIGHT OR WEDNESDAY (NEW DAY 7)...
SO FOR NOW PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOK FINE WITH NO CHANCE OF RAIN 
UNTIL TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. OTHERWISE...A FEW MAX/MIN TEMP 
GRIDS TWEAKED UP SLIGHTLY FOR SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY...IN LINE WITH 
02/00Z GFSX MOS (WHICH HAD GOOD CONTINUITY WITH 01/12Z GFSX MOS).

WILL ARRIVE THURSDAY AND LINGER INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...SO WITH 
CONFIDENCE HIGHER WILL GO WITH CATEGORICAL TO HIGH LIKELY POPS ALL 
ZONES AT SOME POINT THU OR THU NIGHT.  MAY STILL BE A FEW SHOWERS 
INTO EARLY FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY NORTH...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THERE.  RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THIS 
SYSTEM...SO SHOULD BE DRY FOR THE WEEKEND.  SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT 
HOW FAST NEXT COLD FRONT WILL PUSH IN.  MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO 
RUN CONSISTENCY NOT GOOD...SO WITH LOWER THAN AVERAGE CONFIDENCE 
WILL KEEP MON DRY AS IN CURRENT FORECAST AND GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR TUESDAY.  WILL GENERALLY GO CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...BUT WILL 
BLEND IN SOME COOLER MEN GUIDANCE TO BUMP DOWN MEX TEMPS FOR MANY OF 
THE LATTER PERIODS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EDT TUE NOV 1 

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION BRINGING A SUNNY AND 
WARMER DAY TODAY. FOG SHOULD DISSIPATE SHORTLY. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EARLY 
GROUP. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE REGION
THIS MORNING WITH A FEW SPOTS OF VALLEY FOG...MAINLY AT OQT...BUT
ALSO DEVELOPING AT TRI AND RHP. SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BUILD EAST
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT...SO DRY WEATHER
WITH HIGH TEMPS WARMING UP TO OR A FEW DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL
NORMALS. CLOSELY FOLLOWED SIMILAR NAM/GFS MOS MAXES.

FOR TONIGHT...SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST TO ALLOW LIGHT S-SW WINDS
ACROSS PLATEAU AND WARMING 850 MB TEMPS. THIS SHOULD ALLOW A FAIRLY
LARGE RANGE IN MIN TEMPS FROM PLATEAU/HIGHER TERRAIN TO SHELTERED
VALLEYS...WHICH IS BETTER INDICATED IN GFS MOS MINS.  


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GENERALLY PLEASANT WEATHER 
IN STORE THROUGH THE LONG TERM WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A PROGRESSIVE 
SYSTEM THAT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY. BUMPED UP POPS TO 
LIKELY CATEGORY FOR MOST SECTIONS. SYSTEM EXITS THE AREA BY FRIDAY 
WITH UPPER RIDGING BUILDING IN BEHIND. AMPLITUDE OF UPPER RIDGE 
SUGGESTS SIGNIFICANT WARMING WITH TEMPS RISING TO ABOVE CLIMO 
THROUGH THE LATTER HALF OF THE LONG TERM. HOWEVER...DID UNDERCUT MEX 
GUIDANCE VALUES SLIGHTLY BASED ON TRENDS IN GEFS ENSEMBLE DATA.

CONTINUE TO BE BELOW NORMAL. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD 
OVER THE AREA EARLY ON...THEN WILL SHIFT EAST ALLOWING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM TO MOVE IN THURSDAY.  DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THERE WILL BE MUCH 
INSTABILITY THIS SYSTEM...SO NO MENTION OF THUNDER FOR NOW.  MODELS 
HAVE SOME DISAGREEMENT ABOUT HOW FAST THIS SYSTEM WILL EXIT...WITH 
12Z GFS SIGNIFICANTLY FASTER THAN 00Z ECMWF.  GIVEN UNCERTAINTY WILL 
LEAN TOWARD ECMWF AND CONTINUITY AND KEEP LOW POPS NORTH FRIDAY 
EARLY.  HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD REGAIN CONTROL FOR SATURDAY. FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE FAIRLY LOW FOR SUNDAY/MONDAY TIME FRAME GIVEN MODEL 
DISAGREEMENT/LACK OF RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY.  LATEST GFS HAS SHIFTED 
TOWARD A FASTER SOLUTION IN HANDLING NEXT FRONT...BRINGING 
POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS TO THE FORECAST BY SUNDAY.  00Z ECMWF IS 
SLOWER AND KEEPS THINGS MAINLY DRY THROUGH MONDAY.  GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY AM HESITANT TO PUT POPS BACK IN SUNDAY AFTER MID SHIFT 
PULLED THEM OUT...SO TO AVOID FLIP FLOPPING WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY 
SUNDAY AND CONTINUE DRY INTO MONDAY.

POPS FOR SWRN VA AND SPRINKLES FOR NRN MTNS OF E TN...JUST FOR THIS

OFFSET BY WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION AT 850 MBS. SIMILAR MOS HIGHS GOOD 
FOR SRN AREAS...AND A BLEND FOR NRN AREAS DUE TO MORE CLOUDS. 

ANOTHER CHILLY NIGHT AS SKIES CLEAR AND SURFACE HIGH SETTLES BACK 
OVER THE REGION BEFORE 12Z TUESDAY. DIFFERENCE IN MOS MINS HARD TO 
DISCERN...WITH COOLER GFS MINS OR A MOS BLEND SEEMINGLY A BETTER 
CHOICE OVER MILDER NAM MOS. NO FROST OR FREEZE HIGHLIGHTED AS ALL 
COUNTIES HAVE EXPERIENCED FREEZING TEMPS AT THIS TIME FOR THIS FALL 
SEASON.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WITH ZONAL
FLOW TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL WITH
LOWS IN THE 30S AND HIGHS IN THE 60S. NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT FORECAST
AREA THURSDAY WITH CANADIAN AND GFS SEVERAL HOURS FASTER. SPED UP
PROGRESSION BY INCREASING POPS THURSDAY. MAIN TIME FOR SHOWERS
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. MODELS BRING LOW PRESSURE FROM
MID MS VALLEY EARLY THURSDAY ACROSS OHIO VALLEY INTO MID ATLANTIC
FRIDAY. SOUTHERN SECTIONS SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR FRIDAY AFTERNOON.
THE REST OF THE REGION HAVE PRECIPITATION EXIT WITH UPPER TROUGH
FRIDAY NIGHT. ON SATURDAY HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT
BUILDS IN STRONGLY FOR ANOTHER SUNNY FALL DAY. DELAYED NEXT SYSTEM
ANOTHER 12 HOURS AS RIDGE REMAINS STRONG. TOOK OUT RAIN IN FORECAST
SUNDAY FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
438 AM EDT MON OCT 31 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW/TROUGH MOVING ACROSS 
ILLINOIS THIS MORNING...WILL MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
BY THIS AFTERNOON. SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AND WEAK LIFT... 
BUT MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED. OPTED TO RE-INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR SWRN VA AND SPRINKLES FOR NRN MTNS OF E TN...JUST FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE...INCREASE IN CLOUDS OVER NRN AREAS WILL BE 
OFFSET BY WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION AT 850 MBS. SIMILAR MOS HIGHS GOOD 
FOR SRN AREAS...AND A BLEND FOR NRN AREAS DUE TO MORE CLOUDS. 

ANOTHER CHILLY NIGHT AS SKIES CLEAR AND SURFACE HIGH SETTLES BACK 
OVER THE REGION BEFORE 12Z TUESDAY. DIFFERENCE IN MOS MINS HARD TO 
DISCERN...WITH COOLER GFS MINS OR A MOS BLEND SEEMINGLY A BETTER 
CHOICE OVER MILDER NAM MOS. NO FROST OR FREEZE HIGHLIGHTED AS ALL 
COUNTIES HAVE EXPERIENCED FREEZING TEMPS AT THIS TIME FOR THIS FALL 
SEASON.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WITH ZONAL
FLOW TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL WITH
LOWS IN THE 30S AND HIGHS IN THE 60S. NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT FORECAST
AREA THURSDAY WITH CANADIAN AND GFS SEVERAL HOURS FASTER. SPED UP
PROGRESSION BY INCREASING POPS THURSDAY. MAIN TIME FOR SHOWERS
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. MODELS BRING LOW PRESSURE FROM
MID MS VALLEY EARLY THURSDAY ACROSS OHIO VALLEY INTO MID ATLANTIC
FRIDAY. SOUTHERN SECTIONS SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR FRIDAY AFTERNOON.
THE REST OF THE REGION HAVE PRECIPITATION EXIT WITH UPPER TROUGH
FRIDAY NIGHT. ON SATURDAY HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT
BUILDS IN STRONGLY FOR ANOTHER SUNNY FALL DAY. DELAYED NEXT SYSTEM
ANOTHER 12 HOURS AS RIDGE REMAINS STRONG. TOOK OUT RAIN IN FORECAST
SUNDAY FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST.
&&

STRENGTH AND TIMING...WILL ADD ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW.

294 
FXUS64 KMRX 301453
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SUN OCT 30 2011

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING OVER THE AREA. MILD 
WARMING WILL BEGIN THIS AFTERNOON AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS NE. SOME 
LOCATIONS OFF TO A SLOW TEMP RISE THIS MORNING DUE TO FOG BUT SHOULD 
REACH FORECAST MAX. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FREEZING TEMPS GENERALLY NOTED 
ACROSS ALL BUT PARTS OF THE SRN VALLEY THIS MORNING...WHILE SITES 
SUCH AS CHA/TYS/OQT STILL RUNNING IN THE MID 30S. HOWEVER...RURAL OR 
OUTLYING AREAS LIKELY DOWN TO 32 DEGREES OR LOWER...SO FREEZE 
WARNING WILL RUN THROUGH 10 AM EDT AS ISSUED. THE OTHER CONCERN IS 
SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG AND LOW CLOUDS AT TRI.

WARMER MOS HIGHS LOOKED GOOD FOR SRN AND PLATEAU AREAS...BUT KEPT SW 
VA AND NE TN AREAS CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MOS HIGHS. NAM 
MODEL IS QUITE DRY WITH THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY UPPER TROUGH 
AND ASSOCIATED WEAK FRONT MONDAY...WHILE GFS AND ECMWF BRING LIGHT 
SHOWERS INTO NRN AREAS MONDAY MORNING. HOWEVER...EVEN THOSE MODELS 
SUPPORT DRY FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. AREAS THAT KEEP NEAR CALM WINDS 
TONIGHT COULD SEE AREAS OF FROST...WHILE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS LOOK 
TO BE NO COOLER THAN MID TO UPPER 30S. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK SYSTEM MOVES INTO RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE EAST COAST MONDAY. PARED DOWN AREA OF 
SHOWERS TO JUST EDGE OF NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES AND 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. PRECIPITATION VERY LIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
SIMILAR TO TODAY WITH A FEW MORE CLOUDS NORTH. ANOTHER SEASONABLY 
COLD NIGHT WITH NORTHERN AREAS NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING AND MID 30S 
SOUTH. HIGH PRESSURE STRENGTHENS AGAIN FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BUT 
TEMPERATURES ONLY A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER. THURSDAY A SURFACE LOW 
MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND TO THE MID ATLANTIC BY FRIDAY. 
CANADIAN AND GFS WEAKEN SYSTEM FRIDAY WITH RIDGING STRENGTHENING BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. ECMWF IS MUCH STRONGER WITH THURSDAY 
SYSTEM AND KEEPS MAIN AREA OF RAIN OVER OHIO VALLEY. DELAYED START OF
SHOWERS THURSDAY WITH BEST CHANCES THURSDAY NIGHT WEST AND FRIDAY 
NORTHEAST. SKIES BEGAN TO CLEAR FRIDAY FROM THE SW. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS BACK IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WITH FLOW MOSTLY ZONAL 
KEPT HIGH TEMPERATURES SIMILAR TO EARLIER IN THE WEEK UPPER 50S TO 
MID 60S THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. SLIGHTLY WARMER ON SATURDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

1100 AM EDT SAT OCT 29 2011

.DISCUSSION...A FEW FLURRIES AND SPRINKLES TAPERING OFF ACROSS NE 
AREAS. CLOUDS WILL DECREASE IN COVERAGE THIS AFTERNOON. ADJUSTED 
TEMPS/DP SLIGHTLY DOWNWARD. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MEASURABLE LIGHT PRECIPITATION 
LINGERS OVER SW VA AND NE TN THIS MORNING...TAPERING OFF TO DRIZZLE 
OR SNOW FLURRIES TO THE WEST OF ANY RADAR ECHOES. RNK 06Z SOUNDING 
QUITE INTERESTING WITH A WARM LAYER FROM 850 TO 750 MBS...THEN NEAR 
OR BELOW FREEZING TO THE SURFACE. SURFACE TEMPS FROM A VARIETY OF 
SOURCES SHOW MOSTLY MID 30S TO LOWER 40S OVER OUR FORECAST AREA. 
THIS SUGGESTS ANY SNOW WOULD BE LIMITED TO ELEVATIONS OF 3500 OR 
4000 FEET AND UP...MOSTLY OVER SW VA AND NRN MTNS OF E TN...PER 
LATEST 850 MB UPPER AIR PLOTS AND LATEST RUC MODEL. SURFACE TEMPS 
PROBABLY TOO WARM FOR ACCUMULATIONS ANY MORE (PROBABLY LESS) THAN 
PREVIOUS SNOW GRIDS FOR EARLY TODAY.

TURNING ATTENTION TO TONIGHT...CLEARING SKIES AND COLD AIR SHOULD 
ALLOW REMAINING AREAS IN OUR FREEZE PROGRAM TO EXPERIENCE A FREEZE.
THE COOLER MAV/GFS MOS MINS LOOKED BEST AND WERE IN LINE WITH 
PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID. SEEMED A BETTER OPTION TO JUST GO AHEAD AND 
ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING FOR ALL BUT EXTREME EASTERN COUNTIES...AND 
WASHINGTON/RUSSELL COUNTIES OF SW VA...WHERE A FREEZE ALREADY 
OCCURRED. COORDINATED WITH SEVERAL OF OUR ADJACENT NWS OFFICES ON 
THE FREEZE.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE SUNDAY WILL 
BRING A WARMING TREND TO THE FORECAST AREA WITH MOST LOCATIONS 5 TO 
10 DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. SUNDAY NIGHT SLIGHTLY WARMER 
TEMPERATURES WITH INCREASING CLOUDS LATE OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS AS 
WEAK FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE 
SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST ALOFT WHICH WILL ADD TO WARMING AT HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND ACROSS THE NORTH. MONDAY WEAK SYSTEM PASSES THROUGH 
WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY NORTH AND PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES SOUTH. TEMPERATURES 
ABOUT THE SAME AS SUNDAY. KEPT LOW POPS MONDAY. TUESDY AND WEDNESDAY 
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S AND 
LOWS IN THE 30S TO NEAR 40. MODELS DEVELOP NEXT TROUGH AND FRONTAL 
SYSTEM OVER THE ROCKIES AND PLAINS STATES WEDNESDAY. GFS BRINGS 
SYSTEM QUICKLY ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY WITH ECMWF FARTHER SOUTH AND 
WITH ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT ON THE BACK SIDE. FOLLOWED THE ECMWF 
MODEL WITH POPS LINGERING INTO FRIDAY. &&

AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA WITH THE NORTHEASTERLY FLOW.  FREEZING 
LEVEL PROGGED TO DROP TO NEAR 3000 FEET BY DAY BREAK. RAIN WILL MIX 
WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS NE AREAS OF MRX CWA. SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIMITED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A WET SNOW 
IS EXPECTED WITH WARM GROUND TEMPERATURES TO HINDER ACCUMULATIONS. 
STRONG JET SEGMENT DIVING SE INTO THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT SHOULD HELP 
HOLD UP AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND KEEP PRECIPITATION GOING ACROSS 
EASTERN AREAS UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
FROM THE WEST AND MOVES THROUGH THE MRX CWA ON SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL SATURDAY WITH WIDESPREAD FROST AND FREEZES 
EXPECTED SATURDAY NIGHT. A WEAK WARM UP IS IN STORE FOR SUNDAY.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE 
LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. DRY WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED TO RETURN BY TUESDAY. A FRONT ENTERS TO THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY ON  
STRENGTH AND TIMING COMPARED TO THE ECMWF...WILL CONTINUE WITH JUST 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. IT SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION. 
ECMWF HAS THE FRONT LINGER INTO EARLY FRIDAY. WILL GO WITH THE DRIER 
GFS AND KEEP FRIDAY DRY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT RANGE MODELS IN CLOSE

HAS 1 TO 3 INCH SNOWFALL TOTALS LATE TONIGHT FOR MY SW VA AND NRN TN 
MTN COUNTIES...BUT SREF AMOUNTS ARE LOWER. TEMP PROFILE AND MOISTURE 
DEPTH IS FAVORABLE FOR A SLEET AND SNOW MIX AFTER 06Z SATURDAY...
MAINLY ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA AND NRN MTNS OF E TN. FOR NOW 
I KEPT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS FROM AROUND 0.5 TO 1.5 INCHES...AND WILL 
WORD AS HIGHER TERRAIN. THIS WILL BE HIGHLIGHTED IN OUR HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK PRODUCT...PLUS ZFPMRX.

OTHERWISE...TEMPS NOT LIKELY TO RISE MUCH TODAY AS SHOWERS MOVE BACK 
INTO THE REGION THIS MORNING...AND THEN COLDER AIR FLOWS IN TONIGHT. 
MOS TEMPS AND POPS CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...PRECIPITATION MOVES OUT
OF NE TN AND SW VA DURING THE MID MORNING HOURS. NO SIGNIFICANT
ADDITIONAL RAIN OR SNOW EXPECTED. UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST WITH
DEEPENING LOW MOVING OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST. AS HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST SKIES WILL CLEAR IN THE NE AND BE
ALREADY SUNNY ELSEWHERE. HIGHS ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA WILL STAY
COLD IN THE 40S TO NEAR 50. FARTHER SOUTH TEMPERATURES WILL WARM
INTO THE MID 50S TO NEAR 60. SATURDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL DROP
TO FREEZING OR BELOW OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. A FREEZE
WARNING WILL LIKELY BE ISSUED FOR AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS. A WARMING TREND SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH
SHIFTS EAST. A QUICK MOVING WEAK SYSTEM APPROACHES SUNDAY NIGHT
WITH INCREASING CLOUDS AND A A FEW SHOWERS NORTHERN PLATEAU AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY. SKIES CLEAR MONDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY ANOTHER QUICK MOVING SYSTEM BRINGS ANOTHER
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS DURING THE DAY THURSDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVING

WAVE ENERGY WILL INFLUENCE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. 
STRONG JET SEGMENT OVER THE OH RVR VLY WILL MOVE OFF TO THE NE EARLY 
TONIGHT. WILL SEE A DECREASE IN LIFT OVERNIGHT AND A TAPERING OF THE 
LIGHT SHOWER ACTIVITY. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH DEVELOPS RAPIDLY 
TONIGHT AS SHORT WAVE APPROACHES FROM THE SW. MINIMUM TEMPERATURES 
MAY BE OVERDONE PENDING THE SE ADVANCE OF THE COLD AIR ADVECTION 
EARLY. LIFT AND AVAILABLE MOISTURE INCREASES ON FRI. PUMPED UP POPS 
TO ADJUST TO TREND WHILE EXPECTING RELATIVELY LOW AMOUNTS. AS THE 
LONG WAVE TROUGH TRIES TO CARVE INTO THE TN VALLEY ANOTHER JET 
SEGMENT APPROACHES FROM THE NW. INCREASED POPS EARLY FRI NIGHT TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS LIFT. DEEPER MOISTURE SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST LATE 
FRI NGT WITH A DECREASE IN PRECIPITATION COVERAGE. BRIEF SNOW MAY 
OCCUR EARLY SAT MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS BUT CHANCES 
TOO LOW FOR MENTION IN THIS PACKAGE. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
FROM THE WEST SAT. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO DECREASE BUT AIRMASS 
REMAINS RELATIVELY COOL WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE EARLY PORTIONS OF THE EXTENDED. A 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE 
LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. DRY WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED TO RETURN BY MONDAY NIGHT. A FRONT ENTERS TO THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY ON STRENGTH AND 
TIMING COMPARED TO THE ECMWF...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR 
NOW. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 271447

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EDT THU OCT 27 2011

.DISCUSSION....FORECAST ON TRACK. COLD FRONT MOVING INTO MRX CWA 
THIS AFTERNOON. SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL BE FAIRLY LIGHT. A STRAY 
THUNDERSTORM POSSIBLE. TEMPERATURES FALLING WITH EVAPORATIVE COOLING 
AND POST FRONTAL. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM  (THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...SHOWERS WILL MOVE INTO 
THE MRX CWA TODAY AHEAD OF AN ADVANCING COLD FRONT.  MOST LOCATIONS 
SHOULD SEE AT LEAST SOME PRECIP AND HAVE KEPT POPS AT LIKELY TO 
CATEGORICAL.  INSTABILITY IS MINIMAL BUT A STRAY THUNDERSTORM IS 
POSSIBLE AND HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER WORDING IN GRIDS.  WITH 
LINGERING SHOWERS FROM THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND ADDITIONAL SHOWERS 
MOVING IN AS A SHORT WAVE PUSHES IN...WILL KEEP CHANCE POP TONIGHT.  
ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS IS EXPECT ON FRIDAY AS THE SHORT WAVE MOVES 
IN FOR CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS.  DECREASING POPS FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE 
SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION. 

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD...THE UPPER TROF AXIS HAS JUST PAST...WHILE AT THE SURFACE A 
WEAK COLD FRONT IS PASSING THROUGH.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING 
IN DURING THE DAY.  

BY MONDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL BE APPROACHING THE 
AREA...THERE IS SOME DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MODELS WITH TIMING. 
GFS MOS GUIDANCE KEEPS WANTING TO PAINT POPS OVER THE AREA.  WILL GO 
WITH MINIMAL POPS IN NERN SECTIONS FOR MONDAY...INCLUDING KTRI...BUT 
WILL KEEP IT DRY FARTHER SOUTH.  SHAVED BACK MAX TEMPS ON MONDAY 1-3 
DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUD COVER...COOLER 
AND MORE CLOUD COVER EXPECTED IN NERN SECTIONS.  IF SYSTEM DOES LOOK 
SLOWER...FUTURE FORECAST PACKAGES MAY NEED TO EXTEND POPS TO LATER 
PERIODS.  EXPECTING CONDITIONS TO BE DRY AREA WIDE IN WAKE OF THIS 
SYSTEM.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT WED OCT 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WARM SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WEAKENS 
AND MOVES EAST OF THE AREA. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE TONIGHT INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. UPPER PATTERN REMAIN COMPLEX THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM. STRONGER JET SEGMENT CARVING LONGER WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGH THE OHIO RIVER VALLY ON THURSDAY. SEPARATE SHORT WAVE 
SEGMENT WILL SLIDE SE INTO TX. SHALLOW COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE INTO 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY EVENING. GOOD LAYER SHEAR WITH 
ABOVE NORMAL LAYER MOISTURE WILL BE SUFFICIENT FOR GOOD 
PRECIPITATION COVERAGE ALONG FRONT. INSTABILITY WILL BE LOW BUT LEFT 
ISOLATED MENTION OF THUNDER BUT CHANCES ARE LOW. WARM TONIGHT AND 
EARLY THURSDAY IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. DEEPER MOISTURE SHIFTS EAST 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS COLD AIR ADVECTION SLOWLY GETS UNDERWAY. 
ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES ACROSS TN VALLEY ON FRI. THIS 
LIFT WILL HELP SOME POST FRONTAL RAIN TO DEVELOP. WENT ON THE HIGH 
SIDE FOR POPS FAVORING THE EAST WHILE EXPECTED AMOUNTS TO BE LIGHT. 
TEMPS BELOW NORMAL ON FRIDAY.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SECOND HALF OF LONG 
TERM REMAINS LOW CONFIDENCE AS MAIN MEDIUM-RANGE OPERATIONAL MODELS 
PROFOUNDLY DISAGREE DURING THAT TIME FRAME. THE CANADIAN MODEL AND 
MOST GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS TEND TO SUPPORT THE DRIER GFS SOLUTION 
OVER THE ECMWF. HAVE DISCOUNTED ECMWF SOLUTION AS AN ANOMALY FOR 
NOW. THUS HAVE CONTINUED GENERALLY DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM. FOR TEMPS...DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE WHICH 
DEPICTS TEMPS SLOWLY RECOVERING TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG 
TERM AFTER A BELOW-CLIMO REGIME THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND EARLY WORK 
WEEK.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXITING THE 
AREA WILL PROVIDE ONE MORE DAY OF DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS.  THE 
WEATHER PATTERN WILL CHANGE OVERNIGHT AS A WEAK COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES THE AREA.  IN ADVANCE OF THIS FRONT...MID AND HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FROM WEST TO EAST WITH A FEW SHOWERS POSSIBLY 
REACHING INTO THE FAR NORTHERN AND WESTERN AREAS TOWARDS MORNING.  
WILL KEEP POPS AT 20 TO 30 OVER THESE LOCATIONS AND CONFINED PRECIP 
TO AFTER 06Z.  AT FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK 
REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...OVERALL FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
FAIRLY HIGH EARLY ON...BUT DETERIORATES RATHER QUICKLY FROM FRIDAY 
ON AS MODEL AGREEMENT BECOMES RATHER POOR.  FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE 
AREA ON THURSDAY AND SHOULD SHIFT TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  NAM PUSHES FRONT FURTHER SOUTH AND EAST THAN GFS BY 
FRIDAY...WHILE GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH UPPER TROUGH THAT MOVES IN 
FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT.  FOR THURSDAY WILL KEEP MENTION OF SLIGHT 
CHANCE THUNDER...ALTHOUGH INSTABILITY LOOKS QUITE LIMITED AT 
BEST...AND LIKELY POPS.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY 
INTO EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT WITH UPPER TROUGH MOVING IN.  FOR NOW WILL 
NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO DRY FORECAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY WHICH AGREES FAIRLY WELL WITH DRIER GFS SOLUTION...DESPITE 
THE FACT THAT ECMWF BRINGS MUCH MORE AMPLIFIED TROUGH AND 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIP TO THE AREA IN THE MONDAY/TUESDAY TIME FRAME.

TO HOURLY GRIDS...AND LOWER THAN 24 HOURS AGO. THUS...FOG SHOULD BE 
VERY SPARSE...AND ONLY VERY CLOSE TO LARGER BODIES OF WATER.

WILL FRESHEN HOURLY GRIDS AND ANY AFFECTED WEB PRODUCTS...BUT ZFPMRX 
IS ON TRACK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   47  77  52  66  45 /   0   0  10  70  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     46  75  51  65  42 /   0  10  10  70  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN             45  75  51  65  42 /   0  10  10  70  50

FXUS64 KMRX 251843
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE OCT 25 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE 
AND ALOFT WAS LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON. PLEASANT FALL WEATHER TO CONTINUE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
LOW PRESSURE WAS OVER IOWA AHEAD OF A TROUGH DIGGING SOUTH OVER THE 
NW PART OF THE COUNTRY THIS AFTERNOON. THE SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE 
SLOWLY EAST NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. A 
COLD FRONT WILL DROP INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WEDNESDAY. THERE WILL BE 
LITTLE AFFECT FROM THIS SYSTEM TONIGHT EXCEPT THAT MID SLOPE AREAS 
WILL PICK UP SOME SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WIND AND STAY WARM...FROM NEAR 
50 TO THE MID 50S. OUTSIDE OF THOSE AREAS LOWS WILL DROP TO THE MID 
TO UPPER 40S EXCEPT NEAR 40 IN THE TRI CITIES AIRPORT AREA AND THE 
COLD AIR DRAINAGE VALLEY LOCATIONS OF SW NC. WEDNESDAY CONDITIONS 
SIMILAR TO TODAY BUT INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS NORTH AND WEST. SW WINDS 
WILL ALSO INCREASE AS PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS BETWEEN LOW 
PRESSURE IN OH AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SE STATES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
SLOW DOWN THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED CONVECTION WEAKENING AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
ON THURSDAY. THIS WEAKENING TREND IS DUE TO MOST OF THE UPPER-LEVEL 
DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION AND REMAINING NORTH OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE MS 
RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY...WITH THE ECMWF MODEL REVEALING A MORE 
AMPLIFIED TROUGH THAN THE GFS MODEL...RESULTING IN A STRONGER 
SURFACE LOW OVER THE SOUTHEAST ON FRIDAY AND MORE PRECIP OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY 
CONSISTENT WITH THEIR DIFFERING SOLUTIONS FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE 
WEEK...SO WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE SOLUTION BY KEEPING A 
LINGERING CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY 
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS AND UNSEASONABLY 
COLD TEMPS. THIS HIGH THEN SLOWLY DRIFTS EAST BY EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
WITH A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AND 
BRINGING MODERATING TEMPS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER 
THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST...WHICH 
IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 240812
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT MON OCT 24 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DEPARTING UPPER TROUGH WILL GIVE 
WAY TO RIDGING DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WEAK SURFACE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL SAG SOUTH TOWARD THE AREA AND MAY BRING A FEW MORE 
CLOUDS NORTH LATER TODAY/EARLY TONIGHT...BUT SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR 
OVERALL.  TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE FAR FROM SEASONAL NORMS.  WILL 
STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT 
WITH NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE TROUGH RIDING STEADILY SOUTHEAST OUT 
OF THE CANADIAN ROCKIES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AND ARRIVING IN THE 
MIDWEST U.S. BY 12Z THURSDAY. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
CONFIGURED A LITTLE MORE EAST THROUGH WEST AS IT DROPS SLOWLY 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. ADJUSTED POPS BACK A 
BIT WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH BETTER TIME RESOLUTION 
INDICATED BY MODELS. THE MAIN EVENT SHOULD OCCUR ON THURSDAY WITH 
COLD FRONT PROGRESSING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. RAISED POPS TO LIKELY CATEGORY FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
AS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FORM ALONG THE BOUNDARY. SUCCESSIVE 
MODEL RUNS HAVE DOWNPLAYED THE TRAILING SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH WHICH WOULD CONCEIVABLY SLOW THE FRONT DOWN AND KEEP PRECIP 
IN THE AREA FOR A LONGER PERIOD OF TIME. THEREFORE...DROPPED 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIP BACK SUBSTANTIALLY FROM WEST THROUGH EAST 
LATER IN THE DAY THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. STAYED THE COURSE 
WITH NEIGHBORING WFOS IN DISCOUNTING A TRAILING CLIPPER TYPE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM FOR LATE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. THUS THE FORECAST 
REMAINS DRY RIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TRIED TO INCORPORATE THE NEW 
MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE WHICH WAS RELATIVELY CLOSE TO THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST.

&&

TURNING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKY. DUE TO

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BRING SUNNY WARM DAYS 
AND COOL NIGHTS TO THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THEN WEDNESDAY 
AN ELONGATED TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES AND THE PLAINS DIGS SOUTHWARD 
AND SLOWLY DRAGS A COLD FRONT INTO THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY. MODELS DIFFER ON FRIDAY WITH THE GFS SHOWING A SECONDARY 
SHORTWAVE MOVING IN THE SOUTHERN STREAM FROM THE FOUR CORNERS AND 
DEVELOPING A SECONDARY SYSTEM MOVING IN FRIDAY WITH THE ECMWF 
SHOWING A SECONDARY SHORTWAVE DEEPENING THE TROUGH AND BRINGING A 
COLDER AIRMASS INTO THE REGION. WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT. COLD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE WARM AHEAD OF FRONT AND THEN COOLING THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY WITH RAINFALL AND COLD FRONT. BEST RAIN CHANCES 
WILL BE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT DECREASING FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 230852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
445 AM EDT SUN OCT 23 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
AREA DURING THE PERIOD...BUT MOISTURE WILL BE VERY LIMITED SO SHOULD 
STAY PRECIP FREE.  SHOULD SEE SOME JUST SOME MAINLY HIGH/MID CLOUDS 
ESPECIALLY THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  MAY BE SOME FROST AGAIN 
NORTHERN TN VALLEY LOCATIONS THAT ARE STILL IN FREEZE PROGRAM...SO 
WILL KEEP PATCHY FROST MENTION THERE.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  CURRENT FROST ADVISORY SET TO 
EXPIRE AT 13Z THIS MORNING WILL BE LEFT AS IS.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...EARLY PART OF THE FORECAST 
MODEL SOLUTIONS ARE SIMILAR AND CONFIDENCE IS RELATIVELY HIGH WITH 
WEAKENING SHORT WAVE ENERGY PASSING EAST THROUGH THE EASTERN THIRD 
OF THE NATION ON MONDAY. MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LACKING WITH THIS 
FEATURE AND KEPT DRY FORECAST IN PLACE FOR MONDAY. RIDGING BUILDS 
INTO THE EASTERN STATES MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT ALLOWING A 
CONTINUATION OF THE DRY PATTERN WITH SLIGHTLY MILDER TEMPERATURES. 
MODELS STILL FAIRLY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF UPPER TROUGH EXTENDING 
FROM THE GREAT LAKES SOUTHWEST THROUGH THE FOUR CORNERS EARLY ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH A SURFACE WAVE OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST DRAGGING A COLD 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY STEADILY EAST FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE MID 
SOUTH BY 12Z THURSDAY. HOWEVER...THE GFS INDICATES MUCH LESS 
SEPARATION WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. AND THAT 
WHICH CROSSES THE GREAT LAKES REGION. STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO AN 
ECMWF/CANADIAN SOLUTION WHICH INDICATES A STRONGER SOUTHERN STREAM 
WAVE WHICH TRAILS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS PERHAPS SLOWING SUFACE 
COLD FRONTAL PROGRESS THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THEREFORE HELD ONTO CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. BECAUSE OF DIVERGING MODEL 
SOLUTIONS THURSDAY AND BEYOND...FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS LOWER DURING 
THIS PERIOD. MODEL TIMING IS A PROBLEM FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY BUT 
GENERALLY AGREE ON A TRAILING SHORT WAVE DROPPING SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
THE GREAT LAKES GENERATING SHOWERS FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
POSSIBLY AS LATE AS SATURDAY. THEREFORE KEPT SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE 
POPS GOING HERE WITH IMPROVING WEATHER CONDITIONS LATER SATURDAY 
INTO SATURDAY NIGHT AS THIS FEATURE DEPARTS TO THE EAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT SAT OCT 22 2011

(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO SIT OVER THE REGION THROUGH 
SUNDAY...WHILE AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND JET WILL APPROACH FROM THE 
NORTHWEST. CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
DROP INTO THE 30S ONCE AGAIN TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH DEW POINTS THIS 
AFTERNOON SUGGEST LOWS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES HIGHER THAN LAST NIGHT. 
LOCATIONS IN NE TN...SW VA...AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL SEE 
MAINLY MID 30S WITH POCKETS OF LOWER 30S TONIGHT...AND A FROST 
ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR THESE AREAS. MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY 
INCLUDING TYS AND CHA SHOULD BE IN THE UPPER 30S. PATCHY FOG IN 
VALLEYS AND NEAR WATER CAN BE EXPECTED AGAIN AS WELL. AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH APPROACHES TOMORROW...HIGH CLOUDS WILL INCREASE...BUT SHOULD 
HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ON TEMPS...WHICH WILL RISE INTO THE 60S OUTSIDE 
THE MOUNTAINS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
WEAK UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE PASSING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES SOUTH AND PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES 
NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
ESPECIALLY NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL 
KEEP AIR MIXED. STILL THE COLDER VALLEYS IN NE TN AND SW NC MAY SEE 
A LITTLE FROST. GENERALLY LOWS WILL BE LOWER TO MID 40S. TROUGH 
EXITS MONDAY AND HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
STILL MONDAY UPPER 60S TO MID 70S. MORE NOTICEABLE WILL BE LOWS 
MONDAY NIGHT IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S AS RIDGING ALOFT MOVES OVER SE 
STATES. LOW PRESSURE BEGINS TO DEVELOP OVER THE PLAINS TUESDAY. OVER 
THE SOUTHEAST EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
SHIFTING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. BIG CHANGES IN PATTERN NEAR THE 
END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AS ACTIVE FRONT DEVELOPS OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY INTO THE PLAINS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. CLOUDS INCREASE 
WEDNESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS BUT ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH DIGS 
SOUTH INTO THE FOUR CORNERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS SLOWS THE FRONT DOWN WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE FRONT NOT UNTIL THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. GFS MODEL BRINGS DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER 
REGION FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT SO THIS MAY BRING SOME STRONG WINDS 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA.
