.DISCUSSION...
12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS 1000-850 MB THICKNESS VALUES ABOUT 12M
GREATER TODAY COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. SO WITH FULL SUN...WE SHOULD
SEE HIGHS A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY...IN THE 60S ACROSS
THE TN VALLEY. THIS IS SLIGHTLY ABOVE THE LATEST MOS GUIDANCE...BUT
WELL IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST...SO NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED.

WASHINGTON AND RUSSELL COUNTIES...THE TN MOUNTAINS...AND SW NC
HAD A HARD FREEZE THIS MORNING. THESE AREAS WILL BE REMOVED FROM
THE FROST/FREEZE PROGRAM. POCKETS OF NEAR-FREEZING TEMPERATURES
WERE FOUND IN SCOTT...WISE...AND LEE COUNTIES IN VA...AND IN THE
TRI-CITIES AREA AND NORTHERN TN VALLEY. THE FREEZE PROGRAM WILL BE
KEPT ALIVE IN THESE AREAS AS THE FREEZE DID NOT APPEAR TO BE
WIDESPREAD ENOUGH. A FROST ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FOR THESE AREAS
TONIGHT...BUT WILL AWAIT THE 12Z MODEL RUNS BEFORE DECIDING.

WILL BE KEPT AS IS.

ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY...BUT MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED AND
DYNAMICS WEAK...SO NO PRECIPITATION ANTICIPATED WITH LITTLE TO
ANY CLOUDS AS WELL. ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE IN NORTHWEST FLOW WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES...BUT MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS WILL STAY NORTH 
OF THE AREA.

WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH FAST ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT.  ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY 
TUESDAY WHICH WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY FOR 
WEDNESDAY. THE FRONT WILL PULL CLOSE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS...MAINLY OVER THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. GFS AND ECMWF ARE HAVING DIFFERENCES IN 
RESPECT TO A POTENTIALLY STRONGER UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED 
CYCLOGENESIS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FOR 
LATE THURSDAY. WILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS SOLUTION WHICH BRINGS A 
STRONGER SYSTEM ACROSS THE AREA FOR FRIDAY. HAVE UPPED POPS AND 
INCREASE CLOUD COVER FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EDT FRI OCT 21 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND A DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL
PROVIDE CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT. GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING CONDITIONS WILL RESULT IN LOWS TEMPS IN THE 30S AREA-
WIDE...AND MAYBE SOME PATCHY FOG NEAR BODIES OF WATER. ELEVATED AND
SHELTERED VALLEYS WILL HAVE THE GREATEST CHANCES OF DROPPING BELOW
FREEZING. CURRENT OBSERVED DEW POINTS AND THE LATEST MODEL GUIDANCE
SUGGESTS LOWS IN THE MID 30 ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY...WITH
SOME LOWER 30S IN THE NORTHERN VALLEY...SW VA VALLEYS...AND VALLEYS
ACROSS THE TN MOUNTAINS AND SW NC. THIS LINES UP WELL WITH THE
CURRENT FREEZE WARNING AND FROST ADVISORY AREAS...SO NO CHANGES
WILL BE MADE TO THOSE PRODUCTS. A 30 DEGREE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE
SWING WILL BE POSSIBLE TOMORROW WITH A DRY AIR MASS OVER THE
AREA...WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE
CONTINUES ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.
BUT A WEAK FRONT/TROUGH WILL APPROACH SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND PASS
THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY MONDAY. MAIN AFFECT
WILL BE SOME CLOUDS ESPECIALLY NORTH BUT NO PRECIPITATION. LOWS
SATURDAY NIGHT STILL COLD WITH FROST OR LIGHT FREEZE IN PROTECTED
VALLEYS. HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL HAVE SOME LIGHT WINDS AND PROBABLY
ESCAPE A FROST. WILL LIKELY HAVE ANOTHER FROST ADVISORY. SUNDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHT SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES AND A FEW MORE CLOUDS
SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD KEEP FROST FROM FORMING. THICKNESSES RISE
MONDAY AS RIDGING BUILDS OVER REGION FROM THE WEST. HIGH PRESSURE
SETTLES OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES SO WARM TEMPERATURES CONTINUING
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE TUESDAY
NIGHT AS NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. COLD FRONT
SHOULD STAY TO THE WEST WEDNESDAY BUT SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE
THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT MAINLY PLATEAU COUNTIES THEN ALL OF THE
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. A SHARP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES
OVER THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY DROPPING TEMPERATURES AND
CLEARING OUT SKIES. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BE BELOW NORMAL IN THE UPPER
40S TO NEAR 60.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT FRI OCT 21 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
IN TODAY...ALONG WITH DRIER AIR.  CLOUDS WILL DECREASE...AND SHOULD 
BE A MAINLY CLEAR NIGHT TONIGHT.  CLEAR SKY ALONG WITH LIGHT WINDS 
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO FALL INTO THE 30S IN MOST LOCATIONS.  
WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAIN ZONES...WHERE 
SOME LOWER ELEVATION AREAS WILL LIKELY SEE TEMPS BELOW FREEZING LATE 
TONIGHT...AND A FROST ADVISORY ELSEWHERE.  WITH CURRENT SATELLITE 
SHOWING CLOUDS HANGING TOUGH AND OBS SHOWING TEMPS RUNNING WELL 
ABOVE EARLIER FORECAST...WILL CANCEL CURRENT FROST ADVISORIES/FREEZE 
WARNINGS FOR CURRENT PERIOD.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...PRESSURE WILL BE HIGHER ON 
SATURDAY WITH A SURFACE RIDGE SETTLING OVER THE APPALACHIANS AND 
MUCH OF THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. LEADING TO A DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY DAY. 
BY SUNDAY A SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL BE MAKING ITS WAY EAST ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE MODELS SHOW A VORT MAX BUILDING ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES LATE IN THE DAY INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS WHILE ANOTHER 
WEAKER IMPULSE MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. MODELS STILL 
INDICATE MOISTURE WILL BE RATHER LIMITED IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS 
SYSTEM SO KEPT THE DRY FORECAST IN PLACE FOR NOW. HEIGHTS BUILD 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS A 
LONG WAVE TROUGH GRADUALLY DEEPENS ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. THIS 
ALLOWS FOR A CONTINUATION OF DRY WEATHER WITH MODERATING 
TEMPERATURES. THE AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE 
FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BUILD EAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. MODELS HAVE GENERALLY SLOWED THIS SYSTEM DOWN 
FROM THE 12Z MODELS SO ADJUSTED POPS BACK TO KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY 
ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION WITH A GRADUAL PROGRESSION OF POPS FROM 
WEST TO EAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DID NOT RAISE POPS HIGHER THAN 30 
PERCENT AT THIS TIME DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING WITH THIS HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED SYSTEM. IT APPEARS THAT HIGHEST POPS MAY OCCUR ON THURSDAY 
WITH COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE OCCURRING AT THIS TIME. MAINTAINED A 
DECENT CHANCE FOR POST FRONTAL SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT. CONCERNING 
TEMPERATURES GENERALLY UNDERCUT SUGGESTED MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH 
LOOKS A LITTLE TOO WARM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
352 PM EDT THU OCT 20 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
CLOUDS AND WIND WILL BE DIMINISHING THROUGH THE EVENING AS COLDER
AND DRIER AIR SETTLES OVER THE REGION. LINGERING LIGHT RAIN OR
DRIZZLE IS EXPECTED TO HAVE LITTLE IMPACT TONIGHT OVER THE
NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF CWA. DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH THE WIND DROPS AND
HOW CLEAR THE SKIES GET...THERE IS A POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING TEMPS
TONIGHT OVER PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS. TO BLEND WITH SURROUNDING WFO/S WE HAVE GONE WITH A
FREEZE WARNING TONIGHT FOR THOSE AFOREMENTIONED AREAS. FRIDAY
SHOULD BE A COOL BUT FAIR DAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A WEAK FRONT WILL PASS BY MAINLY TO THE NORTH 
LATE SUNDAY INTO EARLY MONDAY WHICH WILL BRING SOME CLOUDS AND SOME 
SPRINKLES OF RAIN BUT FOR NOW THINK AIR MASS TO DRY FOR RAIN IN THE 
FORECAST AREA. COLD TEMPERATURES FRIDAY NIGHT OVER THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AND VALLEYS WILL CAUSE AREAS OF FROST TO DEVELOP SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY MORNINGS WITH A FREEZE WATCH FOR THAT AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. 
HIGHS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WILL BE WARMING FROM FRIDAY WITH WINDS 
BECOMING LIGHT SOUTHERLY SUNDAY AHEAD OF WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. 
STRONGER RIDGING ALOFT MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AHEAD OF A STRONGER COLD 
FRONT AND TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS TUESDAY. THIS NEXT 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FORECAST WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMER MONDAY INTO WEDNESDAY THEN COOLER 
THURSDAY BEHIND COLD FRONT.

FXUS64 KMRX 200827
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
427 AM EDT THU OCT 20 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING 
THROUGH THE REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT. KEPT THE HIGHEST CHANCE POPS 
FOR NORTHERN AREAS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. WITH A COLD AIRMASS 
AIRMASS IN PLACE...WILL SEE SOME WINTRY PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING THE MORNING HOURS. SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS 
ARE NOT ANTICIPATED. WITH A STRONG GRADIENT AROUND THE LOW IT WILL 
BE A BREEZY DAY TODAY. ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS FOR TODAY. ALREADY RECEIVING A GUST TO 48 KTS AT THE 
ENGLISH MOUNTAIN TOWER. AREA OF LOW PRESSURE EXITING THE REGION  
TONIGHT...SO KEPT THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. WILL
SEE BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AGAIN TODAY AND TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES
NEARING FREEZING MARK TONIGHT. BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON A FREEZE
WARNING FOR NOW. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK...BUT THEN REVEAL SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE APPROACH OF
ANOTHER SYSTEM BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE IS PROGGED
TO SETTLE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS WEEKEND...WHICH
WILL LIKELY LEAD TO AREAS OF FROST DEVELOPING AROUND SUNRISE ON
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY MORNINGS. AN FAIRLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH
WILL THEN PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY
NIGHT...WITH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT IT
SHOULD BE PRECIP-FREE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER STRONGER COLD
FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL THEN
MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA BY MID TO LATE WEEK. GFS MODEL IS
FASTER WITH THIS COLD FRONT THAN THE ECMWF MODEL...MAINLY BECAUSE
THE ECMWF MODEL REVEALS A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER
THE WESTERN STATES. FOR NOW...WILL MAINTAIN FORECAST CONTINUITY BY
KEEPING LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT TIME
FRAME. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST...WHICH IS IN BETTER
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

723 
FXUS64 KMRX 191839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EDT WED OCT 19 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS PROGRESSED TO NEAR THE TRI-CITIES 
AREA...WITH THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS TRAILING SLIGHTLY BEHIND AT THE 
BACK EDGE OF THE PRECIP NEAR MORRISTOWN. AN AREA OF LIGHT RAIN AND 
DRIZZLE EXTENDS FROM MIDDLE TN TO IL ON THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN 
PERIPHERY OF THE CLOSED UPPER LOW. A SLOW NORTHEAST MOVEMENT OF THE 
LOW WILL BRING THIS AREA OF LIGHT PRECIP INTO OUR AREA TONIGHT AND 
TOMORROW. MODEL CROSS SECTIONS OF RH AND TEMPERATURE SHOW MOISTURE 
CONFINED BELOW THE -10C LEVEL WITH NO SIGNIFICANT LIFT. THUS EXPECT 
AREAS OF DRIZZLE OVERNIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF MEASURABLE PRECIP. THE 
FREEZING LEVEL DROPS TO AROUND 3500 FT OVERNIGHT...SO WILL MENTION 
FREEZING DRIZZLE ABOVE THAT LEVEL FOR JUST A FEW HOURS LATE TONIGHT 
AND TOMORROW MORNING. 

PRECIP CHANCES WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH TOMORROW 
AS THE UPPER LOW PULLS FARTHER TO THE NORTHEAST. AGAIN...SHALLOW 
MOISTURE WILL RESULT IN MAINLY DRIZZLE AND ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF 
AN INCH OF RAIN ACCUMULATION. SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS IN SOUTHERN 
AREAS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE MID/UPPER 50S...BUT OVERCAST 
CLOUDS NORTH WILL HOLD TEMPS IN THE 40S. A TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT 
WILL PRODUCE BREEZY AND GUSTY W-SW WINDS THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
DAY...BUT SHOULD STAY BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO PULL 
AWAY ON FRIDAY WITH STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN EARLY 
IN THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS WITH A WARMING 
TREND FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  A COLD FRONT SLIDES THROUGH 
AROUND MONDAY.  MODELS DIFFER ON DETAILS OF THIS FEATURE BUT 
GENERALLY DEPICTED AS RATHER WEAK FRONT WITH LITTLE MOISTURE.  FOR 
NOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY.  SURFACE HIGH 
REBUILDS IN FOR TUESDAY.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT BY THE END OF THE 
PERIOD BUT MOST GENERALLY HINT AS A STRONGER FRONT MOVING IN AROUND 
WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY.  FOR NOW...WILL INTRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FOR WEDNESDAY.

MORNING UPDATE WILL ADJUST POP AND WX GRIDS TO BETTER MATCH THE

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EDT WED OCT 19 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING A COLD FRONT 
TRIGGERING SHOWERS INTO THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. COVERAGE 
SHOULD INCREASE MAINLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS AS FRONT TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION. SO WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS FOR TODAY. WITH 
THE COLD ADVECTION...AND THE CLOUD COVER. AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD NOT RISE MUCH DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE MOVING THROUGH THE REGION TONIGHT. WITH A COLD AIRMASS 
MOVING IN TONIGHT...WILL SEE BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. COULD SEE 
LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT NO SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATION IS ANTICIPATED. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT 
REVEAL SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AND POSSIBLE 
PRECIP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEKEND. A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL 
LOW WILL BE MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION ON 
THURSDAY...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW AND WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE CREATING A 
FEW SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY 
IN THE NORTHWEST-FACING UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL A VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILE THAT IS NOT ENTIRELY 
CONDUCIVE TO SNOW PRODUCTION...WITH THE PRECIP INITIATION REGION 
POSSIBLY WARMER THAN -5 CELSIUS ON THURSDAY. THUS...WITH TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO BE BELOW FREEZING IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 
FEET...SOME FREEZING RAIN MAY BE POSSIBLE THURSDAY MORNING INSTEAD 
OF SNOW. IN EITHER CASE...ANY PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT. BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT...UPPER-LEVEL TEMPS ARE ACTUALLY PROGGED TO RISE BACK 
ABOVE FREEZING AS UPPER-LEVEL WINDS BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH. A STRONG INVERSION IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH...WITH SURFACE TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE 30S BY SUNRISE 
FRIDAY MORNING RESULTING IN AREAS OF FROST. ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT 
IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH THE GFS 
MODEL INDICATING SCATTERED SHOWERS DEVELOPING ALONG IT. HOWEVER... 
BOTH THE ECMWF AND CMC MODELS KEEP THIS FRONT PRECIP-FREE OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...SO WILL LEAVE THE SUNDAY NIGHT FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED FORECAST...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.

330 PM EDT TUE OCT 18 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRENGTHENING MIDWEST STORM 
SYSTEM TO BRING RAIN AND MUCH COLDER AIR TO THE REGION AFTER AN 
EXTENDED DRY AND WARM REGIME. SOME CONVECTION ALREADY DEVELOPING OUT 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OF ALABAMA. BANKING ON THIS AREA TO HOLD 
OFF ON ENTERING THE WESTERN REACHES OF THE FORECAST AREA TOWARD 
EVENING BUT IT MAY MOVE A LITTLE QUICKER. WENT WITH CATEGORICAL POPS 
FOR THE BIG EVENT TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SHIFTS 
NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY WHILE DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE 
WEDNESDAY. NARROW AXIS OF INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT MAY ALLOW 
FOR A PERIOD OF CONVECTION TONIGHT FOLLOWED BY A LENGTHY PERIOD OF 
SHOWERS AS DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST. TRIED TO 
INDICATE A DRY PERIOD FOR NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE GREAT VALLEY 
WHERE MODELS SHOW A NICE SOUTHEASTERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW CROSSING THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. PRECIP SHOULD SPREAD 
ACROSS THIS AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE LARGE STORM 
SYSTEM MAKES ITS WAY EAST. TEMPERATURE FORECAST A LITTLE CHALLENGING 
WITH TIGHT GRADIENT EVIDENT BEHIND WESTERN TENNESSEE COLD FRONT. 
JUST STAYED IN THE MIDDLE OF GUIDANCE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. ON 
WEDNESDAY STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL CAUSE TEMPERATURES TO 
STRUGGLE TO RISE THROUGH THE DAY WITH LITTLE PROGRESS SO A COLD AND 
BREEZY DAY IN STORE.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW MOVING 
SLOWLY NE THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. STRONG UPPER 
JET SWINGS WELL SOUTH...THROUGH N FL..UNDER UPPER LOW. SURFACE LOW 
WOBBLES WESTWARD THROUGH OH WED NGT THEN N OF OH ON THU. MRX CWA 
WILL SEE COLD AIR ADVECTION ESPECIALLY ABOVE THE BOUNDARY LAYER WITH 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. WINDS WILL BECOME BREEZY ON THU. PRECIPITATION 
TYPE STAYS MAINLY LIQUID WITH LITTLE OR NO MOISTURE IN THE SNOW 
GROWTH REGION. THE FREEZING LEVEL IS COMING IN A BIT HIGHER THIS 
MODEL RUN AT ABT 4500 FT THU. SOME OF THE HIGHEST ELEVATION COULD 
SEE SNOW BUT THE MAIN ELEMENTS WILL BE MODERATE TO POSSIBLY HEAVY 
ICING FROST ACROSS THE HIGHLANDS. WENT BELOW MOS TEMP GUIDANCE INTO 
THU. LOW PRESSURE MOVES NE AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS NE INTO 
THE REGION THU NGT AND SETTLES OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL AND WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW MOS 
GUIDANCE. MODEL AGREEMENT HAS VARIED INTO NEXT WEEK. STAYED HIGH AND 
DRY...HOWEVER THE GFS HA BEEN TRYING TO BRING A FRONT IN BY END OF 
THE PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...COR
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
148 PM EDT TUE OCT 18 2011

.AVIATION...STORM SYSTEM MAKING ITS WAY ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN THROUGH THE
PERIOD. THE DEEPENING SYSTEM WILL DRIVE A SURFACE LOW...CURRENTLY
OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT
AND INTO THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY BY MID DAY WEDNESDAY. INITIALLY DRY
AIR MASS WILL MOISTEN SUFFICIENTLY AS THE FRONT APPROACHES CHA AND A
FEW SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM COULD BE IN THE VICINITY
OF CHA EARLY THIS EVENING FOLLOWED BY A PREVAILING PERIOD OF
SHOWERS THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. PRECIP MAY END HERE SHORTLY
AFTER 13Z WED BUT HEDGED WITH A VCNTY GROUP THROUGH THE END OF THE
FORECAST. FLIGHT WEATHER COULD BE MUCH BETTER IN TERMS OF CEILING
HEIGHT AND VSBY AT TYS AND TRI THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT DUE TO A
NICE DOWNSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. FINALLY BRING
CEILINGS/VSBY DOWN TO MVFR AT TYS AROUND 11Z WHILE WAITING UNTIL
15Z WEDNESDAY TO FORECAST DETERIORATING CONDITIONS AT TRI.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT TUE OCT 18 2011

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SLOWLY STRENGTHENING ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL U.S. WITH SURFACE WAVE BUILDING NORTHEAST THROUGH THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. LINE OF SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
ADVANCING STEADILY EAST ALONG SYSTEM COLD FRONT. MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY THROUGH EARLY EVENING AS THE BEST 
LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE WITH THE STRENGTHENING STORM SYSTEM WILL 
NOT ARRIVE UNTIL LATER TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. HOWEVER THERE 
IS A SMALL CHANCE FOR A COUPLE SHOWERS BUILDING ONTO THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD SO CURRENT POP FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. 
THE REGION WILL SEE A FAIR AMOUNT OF CI TODAY AS HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE 
STREAMS ACROSS AHEAD OF THE TROUGH. THERE IS SOME QUESTION AS TO HOW 
MUCH THIS WILL AFFECT WARMING THIS AFTERNOON BUT RAOBS INDICATE 
ANOTHER VERY WARM DAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 70S TO AROUND 80 SO WILL 
STAY THE COURSE. GOING FORECAST LOOKS GOOD BUT WILL UPDATE ZONES FOR 
COSMETIC CHANGES.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG A NASHVILLE TO PIKEVILLE KY LINE...WITH AN 
UNSEASONABLY MILD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN NORTH OF THE TAF SITES TODAY...WITH 
VFR CONDITIONS CONTINUING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS (EXCEPT MVFR 
VISIBILITIES DUE TO SOME EARLY MORNING FOG AT KTRI). HIGH CLOUDS 
WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE DAY...AS A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM SLOWLY MOVES EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. SHOWERS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT KCHA AROUND SUNSET 
THIS EVENING...KTYS AROUND MIDNIGHT...AND KTRI AROUND SUNRISE 
WEDNESDAY MORNING.

201 
FXUS64 KMRX 180803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT TUE OCT 18 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG A NASHVILLE 
TO PIKEVILLE KY LINE...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY MILD AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN NORTH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY CREATING ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. HIGH CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY...AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE OZARKS REGION 
SLOWLY MOVES EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS 
RIVER VALLEY WILL HELP TO STRENGTHEN THIS LOW AS IT MOVES INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING. MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATE A 
DECENT VEERING WIND PROFILE OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE NAM 
MODEL NOW INDICATING SOME MODERATE LEVELS OF INSTABILITY DEVELOPING 
OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY LATE AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO MENTION TSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...WITH SOME POSSIBLY BECOMING STRONG TO SEVERE. MEANWHILE... 
A MORE STABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO RESIDE AROUND THE MOUNTAINS 
THIS EVENING...AS SOUTHEASTERLY LOW-LEVEL WINDS INCREASE AHEAD OF 
THE APPROACHING LOW. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT CONDITIONS WILL BECOME 
FAVORABLE TONIGHT FOR SOME MOUNTAIN-WAVE ACTIVITY AROUND THE 
FOOTHILLS. OVERALL WIND PROFILE DOES NOT LOOK TOO STRONG....SO THINK 
WINDS IN THE FOOTHILLS WILL BE AROUND ADVISORY-LEVEL STRENGTH. THESE 
MOUNTAIN-WAVE WINDS SHOULD DIMINISH AROUND SUNRISE WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...AS A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AND 
SWITCHES WINDS TO THE NORTHWEST. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LARGE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
IS EXPECTED TO WRAP AROUND THE REGION DURING THE EARLY PORTIONS OF 
THE PERIOD. ABUNDANT MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE SO KEPT THE HIGH POPS AS 
IS. COLD AIR ADVECTION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY COULD BRING 
LIGHT SNOW AND ISOLATED FREEZING DRIZZLE ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. BUT ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIMITED. THE COLD 
TEMPERATURES COULD RESULT IN FROSTING AND ISOLATED FREEZES ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED 
FOR THE HALF OF THE PERIOD WITH A WARM UP STARTING DURING THE 
WEEKEND. GENERALLY STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   83  51  55  41  54 /  30 100  60  20  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     81  54  56  41  54 /  10  90  80  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             81  52  53  41  54 /  10  90  80  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    80  54  58  40  51 /  10  90  80  60  20 
&&

467 
FXUS64 KMRX 171931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT MON OCT 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
BE DROPPING SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE CENTRAL ROCKIES INTO THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE SYSTEM WILL 
ENCOURAGE A TROPICAL LOW...CURRENTLY OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO...TO MAKE A MOVE TO THE NORTHEAST. THE AIRMASS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IS RELATIVELY DRY AND MAY ACTUALLY TAKE 
A WHILE TO MOISTEN TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS INFLOW FROM THE GULF IS 
IMPACTED BY THIS LOW. MUCH OF THE MOISTURE ADVECTION AND LIFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE EASTERN SEABOARD WHILE 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AWAITS THE ARRIVAL OF THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL WAVE. MODELS CONTINUE TO ADJUST THE 
HIGHEST POPS BACK IN TIME SO STAYED WITH THE CATEGORICAL PROBABILITY 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT 
PRESSES QUICKLY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY FLOWS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE MIDWEST TROUGH DEEPENING THE SYSTEM INTO A CLOSED LOW WHILE 
GENERATING WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WELL THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY. STAYED 
FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH FEATURE A NICE MILD DAY 
RETURNING ON TUESDAY AND A RATHER DRAMATIC AND NASTY CHILL DOWN ON 
WEDNESDAY AS MAX TEMPS STRUGGLE TO RISE THROUGH THE DAY. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD...LARGE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES TO MOVE NE OF THE 
AREA. GOOD WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND COLD AIR ADVECTION TAKES PLACE 
WED NGT AND THU. FREEZING LEVEL DROPS DOWN TO AROUND 3500 FEET. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE NOT FAVORABLE FOR MUCH SNOW PRODUCTION. MOST 
OF THE AVAILABLE MOISTURE IS BELOW THE SNOW GROWTH REGION. THE 850 
MB WIND DIRECTION IS ALSO MORE WESTERLY THAN BEST CASE UPSLOPE 
CONDITIONS. THERE WILL BE SOME OROGRAPHIC SNOWFALL BUT RIME ICING 
AND FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL LIKELY BE THE MAIN WEATHER ACROSS THE 
HIGHLANDS INTO THU. PROLONGED SUPER SATURATED WATER WILL LIKELY 
RESULT IN HEAVY FROSTING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. PATCHY FROST 
AND SPOTTY FREEZES DOWN IN THE VALLEYS BY FRIDAY MORNING. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE MOVES NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NOTICEABLY BELOW NORMAL. MILD WARM UP 
BEGINS LATE SUNDAY AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH SOUTHERLY RETURN 
FLOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             55  82  52  55  41 /   0  30  80  60  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  81  53  56  41 /   0  10  80  80  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       54  80  52  53  41 /   0  10  80  80  20

796 
FXUS64 KMRX 170755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT MON OCT 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST OVER WV AND KY. THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY TODAY 
AROUND THE SOUTHEAST KY AND SOUTHWEST VA VICINITY...AND SHOULD ONLY 
PRODUCE JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS DUE TO THE VERY DRY 
AIR MASS IN PLACE. SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS AHEAD OF THIS FRONT SHOULD 
HELP TO CREATE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT. WILL 
PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS TONIGHT WITH A 
STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS 
PERIOD...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT MAY BE DRAPED ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA...WILL BE LIFTING NORTHWARD...AS A WARM 
FRONT...WITH THE APPROACH OF THE MAIN COLD FRONT.  THE APPROACH OF 
THIS COLD FRONT HAS SLOWED IN LATER MODEL RUNS...WITH PRESENT MODEL 
CONSENSUS...BEING THAT THE FRONT WILL BE SOMEWHERE IN THE WESTERN 
CWA AT 00Z WED [8PM TUE]...WITH A NNE-SSW ORIENTATION.  SSWLY WINDS 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL LIKELY BRING DEW POINTS OF 55-60 DEG INTO 
THE WESTERN CWA...LIFTED INDICES OF -1 TO -3...CAPE VALUES 500-1000 
J/KG...ONCE AGAIN IN THE WESTERN CWA.  AS IT STANDS NOW...EASTERN 
AREAS WOULD HAVE LESS INSTABILITY DUE TO EVENING COOLING.  WOULD 
STILL EXPECT A THREAT OF THUNDER INTO THE EASTERN AREAS TILL 
MIDNIGHT DUE SLOW WEAKENING AFTER SUNSET.  WILL SEE HOW TIMING 
PROGRESSES WITH LATER MODEL RUNS.

FOR WEDNESDAY...NAM KEEPS FRONT IN TRI-CITIES AREA...BUT SURFACE 
LOW PLACEMENT OVER GA/SC IS NOT FAVORED BY HPC FORECASTERS...SO WILL 
PLAN ON THE FRONT SWEEPING ON THROUGH THE AREA...WITH COLD ADVECTION 
ALL DAY. FOR TEMPS...WENT ON LOW SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR WED AND 
THU...OTHERWISE STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS.

COLUMN COOLS OFF ENOUGH TO ALLOW FOR LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE APPALACHIANS AND IN SW VIRGINIA.  ALTHOUGH 
THERE COULD BE MANY HOURS OF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS IN THE SMOKIES...WILL NOT ENTER AN ACCUMULATION...DUE TO 
WARM GROUND AND SUCH LIGHT PRECIP.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT SUN OCT 16 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF 
SIGNIFICANT WEATHER UNTIL TUESDAY. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WITH A WEAK COLD 
FRONT EXPECTED TO SAG SOUTH AND EXTEND E-W ACROSS SRN KY AND SW VA 
BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. THIS MAY PRODUCE A FEW CLOUDS BUT NO 
PRECIPITATION...WITH DRY WEATHER LASTING AT LEAST THROUGH DAYBREAK 
TUESDAY. MOS GUIDANCE HINTS AT VALLEY FOG TONIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT 
BUT BOUNDARY LAYER LOOKS TOO DRY AND I EXPECT SOME LIGHT MIXING TO 
LINGER EACH NIGHT. 

NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND STRONG COLD FRONT WILL AFFECT MOST OF THE 
REGION BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. GFS MODEL IS SLOWEST IN PRODUCING 
CONVECTION WITH THIS SYSTEM...WHILE NAM AND PREFERRED ECMWF STILL 
SPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE TN VALLEY BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON. THUS...I SLOWED DOWN THE ARRIVAL OF CONVECTION TUESDAY 
BUT KEPT POPS AROUND 60 PERCENT...FOR BOTH CONTINUITY AND TO MESH 
WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. 

ANOTHER CLEAR AND MILD NIGHT WITH WARM AIR ALOFT SUPPORTING MOS MINS
OVERALL. WARM AND SUNNY MONDAY...BUT FORECASTED HIGHS ARE JUST BELOW 
RECORD HIGHS FOR OCT 17TH...CHA - 86...TYS - 85...TRI - 84...AND 
OQT - 84. MOS MINS CLOSE AND FOLLOWED FOR MONDAY NIGHT...THEN COOLER 
MOS HIGHS BEST IN THE WEST AND WARMER MOS HIGHS IN THE EAST WHERE 
SHOWERS ARRIVE LATER IN THE DAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES TO DEEPEN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY WITH CONVECTION TRANSITIONING TO SHOWERS. ADDITIONAL
SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDES SOUTHEAST AROUND THE SLOWLY NORTHEASTWARD
SHIFTING LOW CENTER KEEPING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS GOING THROUGH
THE DAY WEDNESDAY. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL STREAM SOUTH ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AND WITH THE
SHORT WAVE LIFT IN PLACE A COLD RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND
LIFT WILL SHIFT FARTHER NORTH AND EAST WITH IMPACT ONLY ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND MUCH OF THE HIGHER
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. THE AIR MAY BE COLD ENOUGH
FOR A LIGHT SNOW SHOWER IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA WILL BE DRY ON THURSDAY HOWEVER...HELD ONTO A SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ACROSS THE THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF VIRGINIA
EXTREME EASTERN TENNESSEE. HIGHER PRESSURE RETURNS FOR THE WEEKEND
WITH A RELATIVELY DRY AIRMASS IN STORE SO KEPT POPS BELOW FIFTEEN
PERCENT HERE.

TEMPS...CERTAINLY ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS...BUT BELOW ANY RECORD
HIGHS. MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS VARIED SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT IN SOME SPOTS
WITH A BLEND CHOSEN. MOS HIGHS FOR SUNDAY CLOSE AND GENERALLY
FOLLOWED.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG INTO THE EASTERN CONUS BY TUESDAY...DRIVING A 
STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. SEEMS 
PRECIP IN CWA WILL HOLD OFF THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT BUT MOVE IN QUICKLY 
DURING THE DAY TUESDAY WITH LIKELY POPS TUESDAY AFTERNOON. AFTER 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH WITH HEAVIER PRECIP ALONG WITH IT...WE WILL FIND 
OURSELVES UNDER THE COOL LARGE UPPER LOW...WITH LOW POPS FOR LIGHT 
PRECIP LINGERING ON OVER PORTIONS OF CWA THROUGH THURSDAY. AFTERWARD 
DRY AND FAIR WEATHER RETURNS...WITH COOL TEMPS REMAINING THROUGH END 
OF PERIOD...STILL 5 DEG BELOW NORMAL EXPECTED BY NEXT SATURDAY.

TUESDAY MORNING AS EVEN SLOWER GFS DEPICTS SOME PRECIP ENTERING 
NORTHERN AND WESTERN ZONES BY THEN. UPPER TROUGH LINGERS OVER AREA 
THROUGH THURSDAY RESULTING IN WEATHER REMAINING UNSETTLED. BALANCE

FXUS64 KMRX 141855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT FRI OCT 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER TROUGH
ACROSS THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE UNITED STATES WILL PRODUCE
WEST-NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AIRMASS WILL BE
FAIRLY DRY WITH PWS GENERALLY BETWEEN 0.5 AND 0.75 INCH. A WEAK
FRONT WILL PULL INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT
WILL STAY NORTH OF THE AREA.

MAIN CONCERN WILL BE THE DRY AFTERNOONS WITH RELATIVE HUMIDITIES
APPROACHING 25 PERCENT MOST LOCATIONS...HOWEVER...WINDS WILL BE
BELOW RED FLAG WARNING CRITERIA. 

PATCHY FOG IS POSSIBLE AT/NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS EACH NIGHT.
ALSO...PATCHY FROST POSSIBLE SATURDAY NIGHT OVER THE HIGHER
MOUNTAINS VALLEYS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AMPLIFIED LONG WAVE TROUGH 
ESTABLISHES ITSELF OVER THE EASTERN U.S. DURING MUCH OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. HOWEVER...WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO SQUEEZE OUT ONE MORE REALLY 
NICE DAY ON MONDAY WITH SUNSHINE AND HIGH TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO TEN 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL IN THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S. BY TUESDAY 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL BE DIGGING FROM THE PLAINS STATES INTO THE 
MIDWEST DRIVING A SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT PRESSING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. TWEAKED POPS UP 
TO LIKELY CATEGORY FOR TUESDAY WHILE TRYING TO TREND HIGHEST 
PROBABILITY OF CONVECTION FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON MUCH OF THE AREA AND 
THE EXTREME EASTERN SECTION OF THE FORECAST TUESDAY EVENING. TYPICAL 
OF THE CHANGING SEASONS THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE A SLOW MOVER AS 
ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE IMPULSES DROP THROUGH THE BASE OF THE TROUGH 
WITH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND LIFT KEEPING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS 
GOING WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. KEPT THE HIGHER CHANCE POP OVER 
THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH EMPHASIS IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AS A NORTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS. BY 
THURSDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH WILL HAVE INCHED FAR ENOUGH TO THE EAST 
TO KEEP DRY CONDITIONS IN PLACE THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. 
STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT BUT WITH AMPLIFIED TROUGH IN PLACE HAD TO TRIM SEVERAL DEGREES 
OFF SUGGESTED MEX MOS GUIDANCE FOR MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EDT FRI OCT 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE PIEDMONT REGION OF THE CAROLINAS...WITH A MILD 
AIR MASS STILL LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS LINGERING OVER THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATING THE BACK EDGE OF 
POST-FRONTAL CLOUDS QUICKLY MOVING INTO THE GREAT TN VALLEY. THE 
MAIN STORY FOR TODAY WILL BE THE GUSTY WESTERLY WINDS EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP BY THE AFTERNOON...BUT IT APPEARS THAT SUSTAINED WIND SPEEDS 
SHOULD REMAIN BELOW THE WIND ADVISORY THRESHOLD OF 26 MPH. THESE 
WINDS SHOULD QUICKLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET...WITH AREAS OF FOG 
LIKELY DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT DUE TO YESTERDAY'S RAINFALL. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AFTER PLEASANT CONDITIONS 
THROUGH THE UPCOMING WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK...MODELS 
AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT AN AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE 
COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY TUESDAY. 
HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT BEFORE 
TAPERING ON WEDNESDAY. HAVE ALSO CONTINUED TO MENTION THUNDER IN THE 
WEDNESDAY PERIOD BASED ON THE PROJECTED STRENGTH OF THE AMPLIFYING 
UPPER TROUGH. DRY CONDITIONS RETURN BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS 
UPPER TROUGH DEPARTS AND ZONAL FLOW FOLLOWS. TEMPS SIGNIFICANTLY 
COOLER BEHIND FRONT HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE 
MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

271 
FXUS64 KMRX 131924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT THU OCT 13 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CONVECTION STARTING TO 
INCREASE IN COVERAGE OVER THE PLATEAU AND IN INTENSITY GENERALLY 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THIS IS LIKELY DUE TO THE 
COOLING OF MID LEVEL TEMPS AS COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURS WITH 
APPROACH OF UPPER TROUGH. SPC MESO PAGE SHOWS POSITIVE CAPE NEARING 
500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES AROUND -2 DEGS CELSIUS. STRONGEST CORE 
OVER UNICOI COUNTY PRODUCED SOME VERY SMALL HAIL (BELOW PEA SIZE) 
RECENTLY AND A RUMBLE OF THUNDER WAS HEARD AT MRX IN THE PAST 30 
MINUTES WITH A GOOD DOWNPOUR OF 0.40 OF AN INCH OF RAIN (NO HAIL).

PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE GENERALLY ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT...BUT I DID NUDGE 
POPS UP JUST A BIT FOR THIS EVENING WITH AREAL QUALIFIER INSTEAD OF 
CHANCE WORDING. OPTED TO CARRY ISOLATED TSRA THROUGHOUT THE EVENING
FOLLOWED BY DECREASING POPS AND JUST SHOWERS. 

SHOWERS SHOULD END EARLY FRIDAY...BUT ANOTHER SHOT OF VORTICITY DOES 
SKIRT THE NRN FORECAST AREAS. SW-W WINDS MAY BE BRISK DURING THE 
DAYTIME FRIDAY...BUT FOR NOW I STAYED BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.
WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT EXAMINE THIS AGAIN. 

OTHERWISE...DRYING OUT NICELY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH 
SEASONAL LOWS AND HIGHS. MOS GUIDANCE WAS CLOSE FOR ALL PERIODS AND 
FOLLOWED WITH A BLEND WHERE DIFFERENCES IN MAXES WERE NOTED. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...EASTERN STATES UPPER 
TROF WILL BE ON ITS WAY OUT EARLY IN THE PERIOD ALLOWING FOR RISING 
HEIGHTS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. THE FLOW BECOMES ZONAL WHILE A 
NICE...DRY SURFACE RIDGE SETS UP OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF 
THE NATION. THE FORECAST REMAINS DRY UNTIL TUESDAY WHEN THE NEXT MID 
LATITUDE CYCLONE BUILDS ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TOWARD THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RAISED POPS TO GOOD CHANCE ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AS DEPICT SYSTEM COLD FRONT BUILDS THROUGH 
THE REGION. AMPLIFIED SYSTEM SHOULD HAVE ENOUGH INSTABILITY 
AVAILABLE FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY 
NIGHT. BY WEDNESDAY THE UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO AMPLIFY WHILE 
SHIFTING VERY SLOWLY EAST AS ADDITIONAL PIECES OF SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
AND DEEP MOISTURE DROP SOUTH INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER SYSTEM. 
THIS WILL KEEP THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ALIVE WELL THROUGH THE DAY 
WEDNESDAY AND EVEN KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ACROSS THE 
HIGHER NORTHERN TERRAIN AREAS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HIGHER PRESSURES 
EDGE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY ALLOWING A RETURN TO DRY 
WEATHER AND EVEN SOME SUNSHINE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
144 PM EDT THU OCT 13 2011

.AVIATION...ENERGETIC UPPER LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES TO PRESS EAST
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON GENERATING SCATTERED TO
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND EVEN A BIT OF THUNDER AT TIMES DUE TO CHILLY
AIR ALOFT. TRIED TO USE SOME TEMPO GROUPS WITH MVFR VSBY REDUCTION
IN SHOWERS AT THE SITES. TRI IS THE ONLY SPOT WITH A CONTINUATION
OF BKN-OVC IFR CEILINGS. DON'T BELIEVE THIS WILL LAST TOO LONG WITH
SOME INSOLATION AND MIXING UNDERWAY. MORE ENERGY AND DEEP MOISTURE
CONTINUES TO SPILL IN BEHIND THE SURFACE FROPA TONIGHT SO HAD TO
KEEP A FEW SHOWERS GOING IN VICINITY FASHION AT TYS AND EVEN
PREVAILING AT TRI THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. NOT ENTIRELY SURE HOW
MUCH FOG WILL DEVELOP BUT TRIED TO KEEP THE FOG AT A MINIMUM AT CHA
AND TYS AS IT LOOKS LIKE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH TO
KEEP SOME WIND GOING AT THESE TERMINALS. HOWEVER...BELIEVE TRI
COULD SEE LIGHT OR EVEN CALM WIND DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT SO APPLIED
AN IFR VSBY AND CEILING HERE. WESTERLY SURFACE FLOW REALLY KICKS
IN ON FRIDAY WITH DRIER AIR STREAMING INTO THE REGION BEHIND
DEPARTED SYSTEM SO EXPECT VFR FLIGHT AROUND 13-14Z AT ALL THE TAF
SITES.

TEMPS RISE THROUGH LATE MORNING AND SEE IF MAX TEMPS NEED TO BE 
LOWERED SLIGHTLY IN A FEW AREAS. WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX TO DROP MORNING 
WORDING AND FRESHEN HOURLY GRIDS AS NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
919 PM EDT WED OCT 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPDATE WILL BE ISSUED TO PUSH BACK THE ONSET OF PRECIP TONIGHT.
RADAR TRENDS OF PRECIP OVER WEST TN SHOWS A NORTH-NORTHEAST MOVEMENT
AND LITTLE EASTWARD COMPONENT. THE RUC AND NAM SHOW PRECIP COMING
INTO THE PLATEAU AT OR AFTER 09Z. 00Z RNK SOUNDING SHOWS VERY DRY
AIR ALOFT THAT MUST BE OVERCOME...SO WILL REMOVE THE POPS IN THE NE
TN AND SW VA ZONES FOR TONIGHT...AND PUSH BACK THE CHANCE POPS IN
THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TO AFTER 08Z. TEMPERATURES

EVENT...WITH COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE MOST LIKELY BY 12Z TO 15Z FRIDAY. 
DUE TO TIMING DIFFERENCES AND TO BETTER FIT WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS
...I KEPT POPS IN NE AREAS AND SMOKIES JUST A BIT FOR EARLY FRIDAY. 

OTHERWISE...MOS MINS NOT BAD FOR TONIGHT OR THURSDAY NIGHT. I 
FAVORED A MOS BLEND FOR THURSDAY HIGHS DUE TO AN EARLY ONSET OF 
CONVECTION. MOS HIGHS QUITE CLOSE AND REASONABLE FOR FRIDAY.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RIDGE BUILDING INTO 
THE REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. A 
FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH ENTERING THE REGION ON THE TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY 
WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS INDICATED. STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

OUR AREA...BUT THE FASTER SOLUTION HAS SUPPORT FROM THE SREF. PRECIP

THE STRONGEST LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH 500 MB PVA AND UPPER DIVERGENCE 
AT THE NOSE OF THE JET STREAK COMING THURSDAY AFTERNOON. MORNING 
CLOUDS WILL PREVENT MUCH DESTABILIZATION...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT 
SOUTHERN AREAS SHOULD SEE CAPE OVER 500 J/KG AND LI AROUND -2. WILL 
CARRY LIKELY POPS EVERYWHERE THURSDAY WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDER SOUTH 
AND A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH. PRECIP BEGINS TO EXIT TO THE NE THURSDAY 
EVENING. FOLLOWING THE FASTER GFS...WILL END ALL POPS BEFORE 12Z 
FRIDAY.

COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE TROUGH PASSAGE IS WEAK AS THE JET STREAM 
REMAINS NORTH OF THE AREA. HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WILL BE IN THE 
MID 60S TO LOWER 70S WITH FULL SUN...THEN RISE INTO THE 70S 
EVERYWHERE SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS A RIDGE SITS OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
CONUS. THE GFS HAS BEEN HINTING AT AN APPROACHING TROUGH FOR 
TUESDAY...THOUGH THE RUN-TO-RUN CONTINUITY ON THE DETAILS HAS BEEN 
POOR. WILL INTRODUCE TUESDAY WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT WITH HANDLING

IT AND THE MET GUIDANCE.

REMNANTS OF A SUBTROPICAL LOW WILL BEGIN PULLING AWAY TO THE 
NORTHEAST ON TUESDAY NIGHT. POPS WILL DECREASE QUICKLY FROM 
CATEGORICAL TUESDAY EVENING TO A CHANCE IN SW VA BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. ON THE HEELS OF THIS SYSTEM IS A DEEPENING 
NEGATIVELY-TILTED MIDLATITUDE TROUGH. WE SHOULD SEE A DRY PERIOD 
FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY EVENING BEFORE POPS RISE LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THIS TROUGH. GFS AND NAM HAVE TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE PRECIP...PREFER THE FASTER GFS WHICH HAS BETTER 
SUPPORT FROM SREF AND ECMWF. GIVEN THESE MODEL DIFFERENCES AND THE 
LACK OF A GOOD FEED OF GULF MOISTURE...WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE FOR THE MOMENT. GOOD DIVERGENCE ALOFT WITH THE 
NEGATIVELY-TILTED TROUGH AND APPROACHING 300 MB JET WILL GIVE A 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS ON THURSDAY...THOUGH INSTABILITY IS 
MARGINAL. A DRY NW FLOW DEVELOPS WITH THE TROUGH PASSAGE ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT. 

WEAK COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE TROUGH BEGINS ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUES THROUGH FRIDAY. WE DO NOT SEE A CANADIAN AIR MASS COME 
THIS FAR SOUTH AS THE UPPER JET STAYS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY REGION. 
THUS HIGHS FOR THE WEEKEND WILL BE MAINLY IN THE MID 60S TO MID 
70S...WITH LOWS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S. A SLIGHT WARMING TREND IS 
EXPECTED SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS A RIDGE MOVES ACROSS THE SE CONUS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  67  53  77  54 /  80  90  40  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  68  53  74  53 /  60  90  70  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  68  52  74  54 /  50  80  50  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  67  51  72  51 /  50  80  90  30  10 

&&

NC...NONE.

TEMPERATURES.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODEL CONSISTENCY IMPROVED BUT 
STILL SHOWING DEFINITE DISCREPANCIES WITH SYSTEM MOVING IN FROM THE 
EAST COAST TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  TUESDAY CURRENTLY LOOKS THE 
BETTER DAY FOR MORE WIDESPREAD LIGHT RAINFALL AND HAVE CONTINUE WITH 
GENERALLY LIKELY POPS NORTH AND EAST AND CHANCE POP ELSEWHERE.  
DECREASE CHANCES ON WEDNESDAY WITH CONTINUE 20 TO 30 POPS ACROSS THE 
AREA AS THE SYSTEM TO PULLS AWAY.  A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON 
THURSDAY FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE A STRAY 
THUNDERSTORM.  HAVE ADDED A FEW POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT OVER FAR 
NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR DRIER AND COOL AIR 
ON FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT FRI OCT 7 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE WILL

NORTHEAST WILL BUILD BACK TOWARD OUR AREA.  SHOULD BE MAINLY CLEAR 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.  MAV TEMPS LOOK TO BE IN THE BALLPARK...BUT WILL 
MAKE SOME TWEAKS...MAINLY UP A BIT. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE LONG 
TERM CONTINUES TO BE POTENTIAL FOR UNSETTLED CONDITIONS BY MID WEEK 
NEXT WORK WEEK. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO EXHIBIT POOR 
AGREEMENT AND RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY RESULTING IN CONFIDENCE THAT IS 
RELATIVELY LOW. TROPICAL SYSTEM EXPECTED TO FORM OFF THE FLORIDA 
COAST IS PROJECTED TO DRIFT INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. THE TRACK OF THIS FEATURE IS STILL UNCERTAIN. LATEST 12Z 
GFS RUN HAS A PRECIP AXIS OVER THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN PORTION OF 
OUR CWA BY TUESDAY...WHEREAS PREVIOUS RUNS HAD TAKEN THE AXIS EAST 
OF THE APPALACHIANS. THE LATEST EUROPEAN RUN KEEPS MOST OF THE 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIP EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WHILE THE CANADIAN MODEL 
DEPICTS MUCH OF THE PRECIP SLIGHTLY WEST OF OUR CWA. GEFS ENSEMBLES 
NOT MUCH HELP AS THEY ALSO EXHIBIT A WIDE SPREAD AMONG ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS. AS SUCH...HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT FRI OCT 7 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE TO ONGOING FORECAST.
DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUE AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ACROSS THE REGION. 
MINOR TWEAKS TO TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS. WENT A TAD WARMER THAN
GUIDANCE TODAY. DRIER AND COOLER THAN GUIDANCE TONIGHT ACROSS NE 
AREAS AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTER SHIFTS SLIGHTLY SW. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE WEEKEND FOR DRY...SUNNY AND 
WARM DAYS.  MODEL BEGIN TO DIVERGE ON MONDAY AND RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY QUITE POOR...WITH DIFFERENCE BECOMING SIGNIFICANT FOR 
MUCH FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW THROUGH 
THIS PERIOD.  WILL SEE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS 
THE AREA ON MONDAY WITH A SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH.  FOR 
NOW...HAVE LOWER POPS FOR A DRY FORECAST AS CURRENT MODEL RUNS 
TRENDING TOWARD ASSOCIATED PRECIP STAYING TO OUR SOUTH.  MAIN 
QUESTION FOR THE EXTENDED IS THE POTENTIAL OF REMNANTS OF A TROPICAL 
SYSTEM TRACKING INTO THE EASTERN U.S.  HAVE COMPROMISED BETWEEN 
MODELS BRINGING THE SYSTEM INTO THE MRX AREA AND OTHERS KEEPING THE 
SYSTEM TO OUR EAST.  AS SUCH...HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS OVER EASTERN 
ZONES AND LOWER POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE TO THE WEST FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY.  BY THURSDAY...WILL BE DEALING WITH AN APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT.  AGAIN CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING OF FRONT AND HAVE LEFT POPS 
AT SLIGHT CHANCE.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE LOOKS OK AND 
STAYED CLOSE.

EASTWARD BY EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK ALLOWING INCREASINGLY MOIST 
SOUTHWESTERLY RETURN FLOW. MOISTURE FROM A POTENTIAL TROPICAL SYSTEM 
MAY ALSO BECOME ENTRAINED IN THE RETURN FLOW...BUT MODELS GENERALLY 
DISAGREE ON THE EVENTUAL EVOLUTION OF THIS TROPICAL SYSTEM. 
NEVERTHELESS...HAVE SLOWLY INCREASED POPS THROUGH MID WEEK BEFORE 
TAPERING OFF BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS UPPER TOUGH PULLS THROUGH 
THE REGION. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE. OVERALL...DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO 
PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST.

CLOUD COVER AND LOWERING TEMPERATURES JUST A BIT. GFS AND ECMWF 
CONTINUE TO SHOW A TROPICAL LOW AFFECTING THE SOUTHEAST CONUS IN THE 
TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY TIMEFRAME...WHICH GETS ABSORBED INTO A

FXUS64 KMRX 052331
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
730 PM EDT WED OCT 5 2011

.AVIATION...CLEAR SKIES ABOUND ACROSS THE FORECAST ARE WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE IN CONTROL ALOFT AND AT THE SURFACE. BOUNDARY LAYER MAY BE 
MOIST ENOUGH AT TRI FOR PATCHY DENSE FOG AGAIN TONIGHT. HOWEVER...
KEPT AN OPTIMISTIC OUTLOOK AND KEPT 3SM BR AND JUST A SCATTERED LOW 
DECK FOR NOW. FOG LIKELY TO BE MORE PREVALENT NEAR ANY BODIES OF 
WATER THAN ACTUAL TAF SITES OTHER THAN TRI.

VFR DOMINATES FOR SECOND HALF OF THIS TAF PACKAGE WITH LIGHT WINDS.

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN 
CONTROL. SHOULD BE MAINLY CLEAR THROUGH THE PERIOD...WITH LIGHT 
WINDS.  WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG MENTION FOR LATE TONIGHT.  WILL BUMP 
MAV MIN TEMPS UP A FEW DEGREES MOST LOCATIONS...BUT LESS SIGNIFICANT 
TWEAKS PLANNED FOR HIGHS THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...PERSISTENT
FORECAST AS UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IS ANCHORED OVER THE
EASTERN STATES WITH TROUGH SLOWLY DEPARTING TO THE EAST AND UPPER
LOW MOVING FROM THE NW STATES INTO THE ROCKY MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN
PLAINS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS EAST TO THE EAST
COAST BY SATURDAY. FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. OLD FRONTAL
BOUNDARY ACROSS THE NORTHERN CARIBBEAN AND EASTERLY FLOW IN THE
GULF WILL BRING INCREASED MOISTURE INTO FLORIDA AND GEORGIA
BEGINNING FRIDAY AND MOVE NORTH SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. EXPECT THE
MOISTURE WILL STAY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
THERE MAY BE SOME INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND
SOUTH SUNDAY BUT THIS SHOULD HAVE LITTLE AFFECT ON TEMPERATURES.
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY GFS/ECMWF AND CANADIAN BRING A SURFACE LOW
FROM SOUTHERN FL NORTH INTO THE NW GULF WITH PLENTIFUL MOISTURE
NORTH ACROSS THE SE STATES. CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY INCREASE WITH
RAIN HOLDING OFF UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY. THIS SURFACE
LOW SHOULD THEN MOVE SLOWLY NORTH TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH
RAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS DIFFER ON THE EXACT TRACK AND
TIMING BUT THE SYSTEM MAY MOVE THROUGH BY WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH
IMPROVING CONDITIONS BY LATE IN THE DAY. FOR NOW WILL KEEP SKIES
MOSTLY CLOUDY AND SHOWERS CONTINUING THROUGH THE DAY. HIGHS TUESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH RAIN AND CLOUDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

315 AM EDT WED OCT 5 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL

MORNING FOG DISSIPATES. SHOULD BE ANOTHER CLEAR SKY AND CALM WIND 
ENVIRONMENT TONIGHT WITH A JUST A BIT OF FOG AROUND THE RIVER 
VALLEYS. STAYED VERY CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE BLEND FOR THE 
SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AN OMEGA BLOCK OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS WILL KEEP DRY AND UNSEASONABLY WARM WEATHER OVER THE 
AREA THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. HIGHS EACH DAY WILL BE IN 
THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE 
MOUNTAINS...WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. A 
SLIGHT EASTWARD DRIFT OF THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BRING IT TO A POSITION 
OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY SUNDAY...AND THE RESULTING 
SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING ADDITIONAL MOISTURE TO THE AREA 
FOR SLIGHTLY MORE CLOUD COVER EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE GFS AND ECMWF 
SHOW A TROPICAL SYSTEM AROUND THE GULF COAST IN THE MONDAY-TUESDAY 
TIMEFRAME...BUT WITH SIGNIFICANT TIMING AND POSITION DIFFERENCES. AT 
THIS POINT WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY BUT WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER 
FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1030 PM EDT TUE OCT 4 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO CONTROL AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  THIS WILL 
KEEP THE WARMING TREND GOING WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS FALLING INTO THE 
UPPER 30S AND 40S TONIGHT AND HIGHS ON WEDNESDAY IN THE 70S AND 
LOWER 80S.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A STRONG RIDGE...BOTH 
SURFACE AND ALOFT..WILL BE IN CONTROL OVER MOST OF THE EXTENDED. 
AIRMASS WILL BE QUITE DRY WITH PWS GENERALLY BETWEEN 0.5 AND 0.75 
INCH. THE DRY AIRMASS ALONG WITH STRONG DAYTIME HEATING WILL PRODUCE 
FAIRLY LARGE DIURNAL SWINGS IN TEMPERATURES. GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX 
MOS NUMBERS CLOSELY...BUT WENT A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER FOR HIGHS.

BY LATE IN THE EXTENDED...A SUB-TROPICAL LOW OVER THE FAR SOUTHEAST 
WILL BEGIN TO PULL NORTH-NORTHWEST ALLOWING MOISTURE AND CLOUDS TO 
RETURN. FAIRLY BIG DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS/CANADIAN MODELS AND 
ECMWF. WILL TREND TOWARD THE DRIER GFS...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 040746
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 AM EDT TUE OCT 4 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
MUCH WARMER WEATHER IS IN STORE FOR THE AREA FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS 
AS A STRONG BLOCKING RIDGE SETS UP OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. ASIDE 
FROM THE CLOUDS IN SW VA AND NE TN EARLY THIS MORNING...SKIES WILL 
BE CLEAR THROUGH THE ENTIRE PERIOD THANKS TO SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE 
STRONG RIDGE. HIGHS TODAY WILL BE MAINLY IN THE 70S...WITH HIGHS 
TOMORROW RISING INTO THE LOWER 80S IN MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY. MID 80S 
WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE CHATTANOOGA AREA ON THURSDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS 
WILL GENERALLY BE IN THE 40S IN THE DRY AIR MASS...WITH SOME LOWER 
50S BY THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE FLOW TAKES ON A MORE SOUTHERLY 
COMPONENT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE PLEASANT DRY REGIME CONTINUES RIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH
MODELS DEPICTING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS SHIFTING FROM THE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TO AN OHIO VALLEY THROUGH MID ATLANTIC STATES
CONFIGURATION AS LOWER PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE FLORIDA PENINSULA
EARLY IN THE WEEKEND. THE LOW DRIFTS WEST OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO
BY SUNDAY EVENING. BROAD EASTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS ALOFT BETWEEN THE
TWO PRESSURE SYSTEMS WITH MODELS INDICATING INCREASING MOISTURE
ADVECTION ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH AS THE WEEKEND PROGRESSES. EXPECT
MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA TO REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY DURING THIS PERIOD
IN DOWNSLOPE FASHION WITH A FEW MORE CLOUDS APPEARING ACROSS
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA BY MONDAY. STAYED
WITH A DRY FORECAST THROUGHOUT... ALTHOUGH MODELS (ECMWF IN
PARTICULAR) GENERALLY POINT TOWARD INCREASING MOISTURE ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON MONDAY AS THE GULF LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM DRIFTS NORTHEAST TOWARD THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IN
RESPONSE TO A SHORTWAVE LIFTING NORTHEAST FROM THE WESTERN STATES
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS. STILL QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY AT
THIS TIME STEP SO BEST TO STAY THE COURSE HERE. EDGED MAX TEMP
FORECAST A COUPLE DEGREES HIGHER THAN MEX MOS SATURDAY THROUGH
MONDAY WITH RIDGE HOLDING NEAR THE REGION WHILE GOING A FEW DEGREES
HIGHER THAN SUGGESTED MIN TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT MON OCT 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS ON THE PERIPHERY OF THE UPPER LOW OVER VA HAVE 
CLEARED OUT OF THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. WITH 
THE CLEARING...OBSERVED TEMPERATURES IN THIS AREA ARE IN THE UPPER 
30S TO MID 40S AND FALLING...SO SOME AREAS OF FROST ARE STILL 
POSSIBLE...AND WILL KEEP THE FROST ADVISORY GOING AS IS. FULL SUN 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE LOWER 
70S IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY...WITH 60S ELSEWHERE 
EXCEPT 50S IN THE MOUNTAINS. THE UPPER LOW BEGINS TO PULL AWAY TO 
THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD BRING FURTHER CLEARING AND GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. PATCHY FROST WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE 
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SW NC. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY BRINGING WARMER AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR TUESDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY. A WARMING TREND SHOULD BRING TEMPERATURES BACK TO NEAR 
SEASONAL LEVELS. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 021844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SUN OCT 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS LINGERING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A FEW SCATTERED CUMULUS 
CLOUDS LINGERING OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...BUT THE BULK 
OF THE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE 
MID ATLANTIC REGION REMAINS NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...IT 
APPEARS THAT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL DEVELOP OVER 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL 
INTO THE 30S IN SOME AREAS. THE BEST CHANCE FOR FROST DEVELOPMENT 
APPEARS TO BE OVER SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...THE MOUNTAINS AND 
SOUTHWEST NC...SO WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS 
TONIGHT. ELSEWHERE...WILL ONLY MENTION PATCHY FROST SINCE TEMPS MAY 
REMAIN TOO WARM FOR WIDESPREAD FROST DEVELOPMENT. THE UPPER LOW IS 
PROGGED LINGER OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT... 
AND THEN SHOULD SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD OVER THE ATLANTIC ON TUESDAY. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL REMAIN IN A QUIET 
WEATHER PATTERN WITH STRONG HIGH PRESSURE THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY WITH 
MINIMAL CLOUDS AND NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 AM EDT SUN OCT 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE UPPER CHESAPEAKE REGION WILL MOVE 
LITTLE IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS...SO A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WILL BE 
FOLLOWED FOR THE SHORT TERM. A NW FLOW OF MOISTURE BELOW 800 MB WILL 
CONTINUE TO PROVIDE BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS AND ISOLATED SHOWERS 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN TODAY AND TONIGHT. A SLIGHT SOUTHWARD WOBBLE 
OF THE UPPER LOW WILL BRING A VORTICITY LOBE AND JET STREAK ACROSS 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS EVENING...AND THE RESULTING 
COOLING ALOFT MAY SLIGHTLY INCREASE SHOWERS COVERAGE TONIGHT...BUT 
STILL JUST A LOW CHANCE POP WILL BE FORECAST. 

OBSERVED TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE GENERALLY RUNNING HIGHER THAN 
FORECAST...BUT AREAS IN THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE SKIES ARE CLEAR 
COULD STILL DROP INTO THE 30S. WILL CONTINUE THE FROST 
ADVISORY...AND ADD A MENTION OF FROST POTENTIAL FOR TONIGHT AS WELL 
AS ADDITIONAL CLEARING IS EXPECTED TO EXPAND THE AREA OF LOWS IN THE 
30S. WILL CONTINUE THE SPS FOR LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE ADVISORY AREA 
TO MENTION THE POTENTIAL FOR FROST TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TO THE 
NORTHEAST OF THE CWA TRIGGERING A SHORTWAVE TRACKING ACROSS THE 
NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON MONDAY. WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS 
FOR MONDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH. THE RIDGE BUILDS 
BACK IN ON TUESDAY BRINGING WARMER AND DRY CONDITIONS ON TUESDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED ON MONDAY 
THEN A WARMING TREND SHOULD BRING TEMPERATURES BACK TO NEAR SEASONAL 
LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES PLANNED. FORECAST AREA REMAINS UNDER THE

OF THIS SYSTEM. AS A RESULT...UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR CONTINUES TO
FLOW INTO THE REGION AROUND FEATURE FROM THE NORTHWEST. ANTICIPATE
CLOUDS TO PERSIST OVER THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS WHICH SHOULD
PRECLUDE FROST FORMATION THERE. ANY CLEARING IS EXPECTED TO BE
CONFINED TO THE WESTERN ZONES. THUS WILL CONTINUE FROST ADVISORY
FOR NORTHERN PLATEAU. REMAINDER OF FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK PER
LATEST MODEL DATA. NO CHANGES WARRANTED AT THIS TIME.

FXUS64 KMRX 011855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT SAT OCT 1 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS 
OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ASSOCIATED 
WITH A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION.
THIS UPPER LOW IS PROGGED LINGER OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF CLOUDS AND A 
FEW LIGHT SHOWERS MAINLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. 850 MB TEMPS ARE PROGGED TO FALL BELOW FREEZING TONIGHT OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT 
THE SATURATION REGION FOR PRECIP INITIATION MAY REMAIN WARM ENOUGH 
(AROUND -5 C) FOR ANY PRECIP IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO HAVE A HARD 
TIME CHANGING OVER TO SNOW. IN EITHER CASE...ONLY A DUSTING OF SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS SEEMS POSSIBLE SINCE THE GROUND TEMPS SHOULD ALSO BE 
FAIRLY WARM. TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE 30S TONIGHT AND 
AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH MAY LEAD 
TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME FROST AROUND SUNRISE EACH MORNING. THE 
AMOUNT OF CLOUDS WILL COMPLICATE THIS POSSIBILITY...SO FOR NOW... 
WILL ONLY MENTION PATCHY FROST FOR MOST AREAS. HOWEVER...WILL ISSUE 
A FROST ADVISORY ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE FROST 
MAY BE MORE WIDESPREAD. WILL NOT ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS SINCE ANY FREEZING TEMPS SHOULD MAINLY AFFECT THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATION ABOVE 4500 FEET...BUT WILL CONTINUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THESE COLD WEATHER ISSUES. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...QUIET EXTENDED PERIOD ON TAP 
WITH A STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN. THIS WILL KEEP 
CONDITIONS DRY WITH ONLY A FEW CLOUDS AND ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM 
TO NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   41  66  42  72  47 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     38  61  39  67  44 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             38  60  39  66  44 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    38  57  39  63  41 /  20  20  20  10   0 
&&

WILL BE BREEZY AND GUSTY BUT SHOULD STAY BELOW WIND ADVISORY 
CRITERIA.

DRYING ALOFT AND REDUCING PRECIP CHANCES AND CLOUD COVER. ADDITIONAL 
CLEARING AND DIMINISHING WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO 
THE 30S IN MANY LOCATIONS. LOWS WILL BE MAINLY IN THE UPPER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S...BUT SOME MOUNTAIN LOCATIONS AND SHELTERED VALLEYS WILL 
SEE LOWER TO MID 30S.

NORTHEAST OF THE CWA PRODUCING SEVERAL WAVES TRACKING ACROSS THE 
NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE CWA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL GO WITH 
CONTINUITY AND KEEP SUNDAY AND MONDAY DRY. THE RIDGE BUILDS BACK IN 
ON TUESDAY BRINGING WARMER AND DRY CONDITIONS ON TUESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
WITH A WARMING TREND BACK TO NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS DURING THE END OF

FXUS64 KMRX 301842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT FRI SEP 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH A COOLER AND 
DRIER AIR MASS MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND IT. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE UPPER OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ASSOCIATED AN AMPLIFYING 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER 
TROUGH IS NOW PROGGED TO EVENTUALLY BECOME ANOTHER CUT-OFF LOW OVER 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY SATURDAY...AND POSSIBLY BECOME QUASI- 
STATIONARY THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS A RESULT...CLOUDS AND A FEW 
UPSLOPE-GENERATED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO 
ADVECT UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING THAT IT MAY BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME LIGHT 
SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET. RIGHT 
NOW...IT APPEARS THAT THE PRECIP INITIATION REGION MAY REMAIN WARMER 
THAN -10 C...SO ANY PRECIP IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT MAY HAVE 
A HARD TIME CHANGING OVER TO SNOW. IN EITHER CASE...ONLY A DUSTING 
OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SEEMS POSSIBLE SINCE THE GROUND TEMPS SHOULD 
ALSO BE FAIRLY WARM. THE COLDEST AIR IS EXPECTED TO SETTLE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH TEMPS FALLING INTO THE 30S 
ACROSS MANY AREAS LEADING TO SOME PATCHY FROST DEVELOPMENT IN THE 
VALLEYS BY SUNRISE ON SUNDAY MORNING. WITH A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW NOW 
EXPECTED TO LINGER A WHILE LONGER OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES... 
CLOUDS MAY KEEP FROST FROM BECOMING TOO WIDESPREAD FOR AN ADVISORY. 
FOR NOW...WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF FROST AND A LITTLE SNOW 
OVER THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS IN A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO PULL 
AWAY FROM THE REGION ON MONDAY. AS IT DOES...THE LOW MAY ROTATE 
THROUGH A FEW MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS OVER NORTHERN AREAS...BUT 
LITTLE OTHER IMPACT EXPECTED. OTHERWISE...WILL SEE STRONG HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILD IN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...PROVIDING GENERALLY 
CLEAR SKIES AND WARMING TEMPERATURES TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

SHOULD RESULT IN THE REDEVELOPMENT OF CU IN THE AFTERNOON. THESE 
CLOUDS ALONG WITH COLD ADVECTION WILL KEEP TEMPS IN THE 60S NORTH 
AND CENTRAL TO LOWER 70S SOUTH...WITH 50S IN THE MOUNTAINS. 

THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES THIS MORNING WILL TRACK 
TOWARD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TODAY...WITH A TRAILING VORTICITY 
LOBE AND VERY COLD 500 MB TEMPS PUSHING INTO SW VA AND NE TN 
TONIGHT. AN UPSLOPE 925-850MB WIND AROUND 25 KTS ALONG WITH STEEP 
LAPSE RATES AND LOW LEVEL CAPE OF 50-100 J/KG WILL GENERATE SOME 
SHOWERS IN SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS TONIGHT. WITH TEMPERATURES 
DROPPING INTO THE 30S IN THESE AREAS...EXPECT PRECIP TO BE SNOW IN 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 3000 FT. WITH THE GROUND STILL 
RELATIVELY WARM...ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIGHT. AREAS SUCH AS HIGH 
KNOB...ROAN MTN...AND NEWFOUND GAP COULD SEE A DUSTING TO A HALF 
INCH ACCUMULATION. A FREEZE WARNING MAY BE NEEDED FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
TONIGHT...WILL HOLD OFF ON THIS FOR NOW AS THE EXTENT OF FREEZING 
TEMPS OUTSIDE THE HIGHEST PEAKS IS UNCERTAIN FOR THE SECOND PERIOD 
OF THE FORECAST. WINDS TONIGHT MAY ALSO APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA 
IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO MENTION THE EARLY SEASON SNOW 
POTENTIAL...AND THE COLD TEMPS AND WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS 
TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE CWA ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL 
CONTINUE THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE AREA. 
IT WILL BE CHILLY OVER THE WEEKEND. MAY SEE A FEW FLAKES EARLY 
SATURDAY MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. BUT THEY SHOULD BE TOO 
BRIEF TO INCLUDE IN THE FORECAST. THE RIDGE BUILDS BACK IN ON SUNDAY 
BRINGING WARMER AND DRY CONDITIONS ON SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 AM EDT THU SEP 29 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL MOVE NORTHEAST THIS MORNING. A SHORT-WAVE
ROTATING AROUND THIS LOW IS CURRENTLY PRODUCING SCATTERED SHOWERS
OVER THE NORTHEAST THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS ACTIVITY WILL
END SOON AFTER SUNRISE. HAVE INCLUDE EARLY MORNING SHOWER WORDING. A
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA TODAY ALLOWING
SKIES TO BE MOSTLY SUNNY. A WARM DAY IS ON TAP AS WELL.

FOR TONIGHT...ANOTHER AND STRONGER UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE
GREAT LAKES AND UPPER OHIO VALLEY. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. MOISTURE IS LIMITED...BUT ENOUGH TO
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. WILL ALSO INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SPRINKLES
ELSEWHERE. A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY EARLY WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY TO
PARTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT. FOLLOWED MOS GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...GOOD CONTINUITY WITH MODELS 
FROM 12Z RUN...AND GENERAL AGREEMENT ON TIMING THE DEPARTURE OF THE 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS EARLY SATURDAY. UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE THEN 
GRADUALLY BUILD EASTWARD...BRINGING DRY WEATHER AND COOLER THAN 
NORMAL TEMPS. HOWEVER...THE DRYNESS OF THE AIRMASS PLUS THE BUILDING 
UPPER RIDGE SUPPORTED INCREASING MAX TEMPS JUST A BIT BY MON THRU
WED. THIS ADJUSTMENT WAS IN LINE WITH 29/00Z MOS AND A BETTER MESH 
WITH NEARBY NWS GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...CONTINUED THE LOW POPS FOR MAINLY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY...MAINLY FOR SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN. LATER SHIFTS MAY WANT 
TO DROP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY...WHICH I KEPT MOSTLY FOR 
CONTINUITY. QPF SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT...AND PERHAPS NOT 
UNTIL AFTER 06Z SATURDAY...WHEN MOISTURE DEPTH IS GREATEST. THE ZERO 
DEGREE ISOTHERM AT 850 MBS WILL DIP ACROSS SW VA BY 12Z SATURDAY... 
BUT SOUNDINGS ARE NOT FAVORABLE FOR ANY SNOW. MINS DROP INTO THE MID 
TO UPPER 30S OVER SW VA...BUT WINDS SHOULD INHIBIT ANY PATCHY FROST 
FROM DEVELOPING ON SATURDAY MORNING.

FXUS64 KMRX 281926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT WED SEP 28 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE 
CAROLINAS AND THE DEEP SOUTH...WITH A SURFACE TROUGH OVER THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH A LARGE CUT-OFF UPPER- 
LEVEL LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THIS SURFACE TROUGH IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY ROTATE EASTWARD TOWARDS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...GENERATING A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS WITH IT. A 
STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE UPPER 
MS RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...WHICH WILL EVENTUALLY PUSH THIS UPPER 
LOW EASTWARD AND WILL ALSO PUSH A STRONG COLD FRONT INTO THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY NIGHT. ALTHOUGH MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO BE 
LIMITED WITH THIS COLD FRONT...WILL PLAN TO KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
A FEW SHOWERS ON THURSDAY NIGHT OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THE UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN THEN BECOMES HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
BY FRIDAY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH THE GFS AND NAM 
MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A FEW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
POSSIBLE ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST 
TN. UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF THIS COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BASICALLY WENT WITH AN 
ECMWF/GFS COMBO CONCERNING THE EXTENDED FORECAST. NEXT CUT OFF LOW 
SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS ON SATURDAY. MODELS INDICATE A POSSIBILITY OF SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE WRAPPING AROUND THIS FEATURE 
GENERATING A SHOWER OR TWO ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND A SMALL PART OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NEAR THE 
TENNESSEE BORDER ON SATURDAY SO ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER 
HERE. THE LOW AMBLES EAST LATER SUNDAY INTO MONDAY MAKING ROOM IN 
THE FORECAST FOR DRY WEATHER THROUGH MID WEEK AS AN UPPER RIDGE 
AMPLIFIES FROM THE CENTER OF THE NATION INTO THE EASTERN STATES. THE 
BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD (SATURDAY AND SUNDAY) WILL BE RATHER COOL AS 
CHILLY CANADIAN AIR STREAMS SOUTH BEHIND THE DEPARTING UPPER LOW. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOUT TEN TO FIFTEEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR 
EARLY OCTOBER. MAX TEMPERATURES START TO MODERATE ON MONDAY AND BY 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...HIGHS SHOULD BE BACK IN THE NORMAL RANGE. 
LOW TEMPS WILL TAKE A LITTLE LONGER TO RETURN TO NORMAL DUE TO 
EFFICIENT RADIATION IN THE DRY AIR AND LIGHT WIND REGIME.

.AVIATION...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS EXPECTED THROUGH MOST OF 
THE TAF PERIOD. PATCHY FOG SHOULD DEVELOP AGAIN TONIGHT...SO WILL 
KEEP MVFR VIS AT TRI FOR THE MORNING HOURS. DRY WEATHER WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD.

683 
FXUS64 KMRX 271350
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EDT TUE SEP 27 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING NO ECHOES ACROSS THE CWA. WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN...WILL REMOVE THE PRECIPITATION CHANCE FOR THE 
MORNING HOURS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS HAVE EXITED THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING...BUT HIGH DEW POINT TEMPS AND SOME CLOUDS LINGER 
OVER CENTRAL VALLEY AND EASTERN SECTIONS OF E TN...AS WELL AS ALL OF 
SW VA AND SW NC. CARRIED AN EARLY MORNING PERIOD THEN MOSTLY SUNNY 
FOR TODAY AFTER 12Z. 

UPSTREAM DEW POINT TEMPS AND WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS SHOW VERY
DRY AIR ON THE WAY...WHICH SHOULD HELP TEMPS REBOUND TO AT LEAST
THE WARMER MOS HIGHS WHERE ANY MINOR DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

LIGHT TO CALM WINDS TONIGHT WOULD LEND SOME SUPPORT TO PATCHY FOG
LATE TONIGHT...BUT FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL
DRY OUT. ANOTHER FACTOR AGAINST MUCH FOG IS THE POSSIBILITY OF
CLOUDS INCREASING LATE DUE TO THE UPPER LOW TO OUR N-NW. FOR NOW
I JUST INTRODUCED SOME PATCHY FOG NEAR AREA LAKES. DUE TO THIS
UNCERTAINTY...I WENT WITH A MOS BLEND FOR LOWS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...COMPLEX UPPER LEVEL LOW 
REMAINS KEY FEATURE OF INTEREST FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
AS IT SLOWLY DRIFTS EASTWARD THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES REGION THROUGH 
THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NORTHERN 
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND 
AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT AS A SERIES OF VORTS CONTINUE TO ROTATE AROUND 
THE UPPER LOW. TEMPS ALSO EXPECTED TO COOL BY THE WEEKEND AS 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SETS IN BEHIND DEPARTING UPPER LOW. GENERALLY DRY 
WEATHER EXPECTED HOWEVER AS SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS IN. MODELS DEPICT 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE REGION BY EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK 
ALLOWING TEMPS TO REBOUND BACK TO NEAR CLIMO. GENERALLY DID MAKE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST AS THOSE APPEAR 
GENERALLY ON TRACK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  58  82  59  83 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  79  56  79  59  80 /  10  10  20  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       78  53  79  58  80 /  10  10  20  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              79  50  77  53  78 /  20  10  20  20  10

AT TRI AND TYS...BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO INCLUDE AT THIS POINT.

CLOUDS INCREASE LATE TONIGHT.

SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND VFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR LATER TODAY.

PATCHY VALLEY FOG COULD DEVELOP LATE TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT MAY BE 
LIMITED TO VALLEY LOCATIONS NEAR BODIES OF WATER...IF BOUNDARY LAYER 
DRIES OUT ENOUGH TODAY.

438 
FXUS64 KMRX 261936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT MON SEP 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A FRONT PASSING THROUGH THE AREA 
TRIGGERING SHOWERS A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING 
FOR TONIGHT WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. SEVERE 
STORMS SHOULD BE ISOLATED. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON TUESDAY BEHIND THE 
FRONT. WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE EASTERN PORTIONS ON THE CWA FOR 
TUESDAY MORNING...BUT MOST AREAS SHOULD BE DRY ON TUESDAY. GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...SO DIDN'T 
STRAY TOO FAR.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT
AGREEMENT ON THE OVERALL PICTURE...WITH FIRST UPPER LOW FORECAST TO
LIFT NORTHEAST FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER DIVING INTO THE EASTERN US.
HOWEVER...THERE ARE DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS THAT LEAD TO A NO
BETTER THAN AVERAGE FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD.
WILL GENERALLY LEAN TOWARD AN 00Z ECMWF/12Z GFS BLEND FOR NOW. WITH
VICINITY OF FIRST UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH WED AND WED NIGHT WILL
HAVE TO CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH FOR SOME POSSIBLE
SHOWERS...THEN DRY THURSDAY BEFORE A COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH
THURSDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE AND FORCING LOOK LIMITED WITH THIS
FRONT...SO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THU NIGHT. AS MENTIONED
EARLIER...HOW CLOSE UPPER LOW...AND ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE...GETS
TO OUR AREA SOMEWHAT PROBLEMATIC ESPECIALLY DURING THE WEEKEND. FOR
NOW LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE FAR ENOUGH AWAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS...BUT
WITH COOLER TEMPS...FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY.
