777 
FXUS64 KMRX 261417
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1016 AM EDT MON SEP 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...FRONT TRIGGERING SHOWERS TO THE WEST. COVERAGE SHOULD 
INCREASE DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS FRONT TRACKS THROUGH. WILL 
LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONCERN EARLY THIS MORNING IS THE 
STRENGTH OF THE LOW LEVEL JET AHEAD OF THE UPPER LOW AND COLD FRONT. 
SURFACE OBSERVATIONS FROM THE PLATEAU AREAS SHOW SPEEDS OF 15 TO 25 
MPH WITH A LITTLE HIGHER GUSTS. CONSIDERED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THOSE 
AREAS...BUT HELD OFF AFTER COORDINATION WITH NEIGHBORS. THE 
STRONGEST 850 MB WINDS ARE PROGGED TO STAY MAINLY TO OUR WEST TODAY 
...ALTHO LOW LEVEL JET AXIS WILL BE LOCATED FROM OUR NRN PLATEAU 
COUNTIES NNE INTO KY BY 18Z TODAY. 850 MB WIND SPEEDS ARE PROGGED TO 
DROP SOME BY THE AFTERNOON AS MIXING OCCURS...SO WILL LET DAY SHIFT 
MONITOR WINDS FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...MAIN AREA OF CONVECTION THIS MORNING IS STILL OVER 
MIDDLE TN WITH SPOTTY/ISOLATED TSRA POPPING UP ACROSS OUR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES AND WRN MOST VALLEY AREAS. LIKELY POPS WEST TO CHANCE EAST 
LOOKED GOOD FOR EARLY TODAY...THEN CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY BY THIS 
AFTERNOON AS COLD FRONT APPROACHES. WON'T RULE OUT A STRONG STORM OR 
TWO BUT THREAT OF SEVERE LOOKS MINIMAL...PER DAY ONE CONVECTIVE 
OUTLOOK. NUDGED POPS UP JUST A BIT FOR THIS EVENING AND KEPT POPS 
LIKELY FOR NE TN/SW VA UNTIL FRONTAL PASSAGE.

MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY LOOKED REASONABLE...FAVORING COOLER MOS MAXES IN 
THE WEST AND HIGHER MAXES IN THE EAST. CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT SW-W 
WINDS LED ME TO TREND TOWARD A MOS BLEND FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE EAST OF
THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY MORNING BUT UPPER LOW HANGS BACK
ACROSS WESTERN GREAT LAKES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THE UPPER LOW FINALLY
MOVES EAST THURSDAY. DRIER AIR MASS MOVES INTO FORECAST AREA BEHIND
FRONT WITH ONLY A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY ACROSS NE TN AND SW
VA TUESDAY MORNING. INCREASED MOISTURE ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF
FORECAST AREA AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW WILL
ALLOW A FEW SHOWERS TO DEVELOP WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EVENING.
THURSDAY UPPER LOW WILL BE FINALLY TO FAR NE FOR ANY EFFECT. NW
FLOW AND DRY AIR MASS KEEPS FORECAST AREA MOSTLY SUNNY. NW FLOW
WILL BE REINFORCED WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT EARLY
FRIDAY. A NARROW BAND OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT.
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN STATES AND
UPPER FLOW OUT OF ALMOST DUE NORTH MUCH COOLER AIR MASS MOVES INTO
THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S. FRIDAY WILL BE
SLIGHTLY COOLER. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY HIGHS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER
70S AND LOWS FALLING INTO THE 40S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             79  56  81  56  83 /  80  30  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  58  79  54  79 /  80  40  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       78  56  79  54  79 /  80  40  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              80  58  78  51  77 /  60  60  20  10  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
735 AM EDT MON SEP 26 2011

.AVIATION...SHOWERS HAD DIMINISHED OVER OUR AREA FROM EARLIER 
COVERAGE...BUT STILL LOOK FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES THIS MORNING 
AND AFTERNOON.

NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE TO TAFS FROM 06Z PACKAGE...EXCEPT TO 
EXTEND THE LLWS AT TRI UNTIL SURFACE WINDS PICK UP A BIT AND THE
LOW LEVEL JET DIMINISHES. GUSTY SW WINDS MOST LIKELT AT TYS DURING 
THE DAY. 

ONCE AGAIN KEPT CONDITIONS MAINLY VFR...BUT I WILL POINT OUT THAT 
ANY TSRA COULD BRIEFLY PRODUCE MVFR CEILING OR VISBY.  

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS:

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONCERN EARLY THIS MORNING IS THE 
STRENGTH OF THE LOW LEVEL JET AHEAD OF THE UPPER LOW AND COLD FRONT. 
SURFACE OBSERVATIONS FROM THE PLATEAU AREAS SHOW SPEEDS OF 15 TO 25 
MPH WITH A LITTLE HIGHER GUSTS. CONSIDERED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THOSE 
AREAS...BUT HELD OFF AFTER COORDINATION WITH NEIGHBORS. THE 
STRONGEST 850 MB WINDS ARE PROGGED TO STAY MAINLY TO OUR WEST TODAY 
...ALTHO LOW LEVEL JET AXIS WILL BE LOCATED FROM OUR NRN PLATEAU 
COUNTIES NNE INTO KY BY 18Z TODAY. 850 MB WIND SPEEDS ARE PROGGED TO 
DROP SOME BY THE AFTERNOON AS MIXING OCCURS...SO WILL LET DAY SHIFT 
MONITOR WINDS FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...MAIN AREA OF CONVECTION THIS MORNING IS STILL OVER 
MIDDLE TN WITH SPOTTY/ISOLATED TSRA POPPING UP ACROSS OUR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES AND WRN MOST VALLEY AREAS. LIKELY POPS WEST TO CHANCE EAST 
LOOKED GOOD FOR EARLY TODAY...THEN CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY BY THIS 
AFTERNOON AS COLD FRONT APPROACHES. WON'T RULE OUT A STRONG STORM OR 
TWO BUT THREAT OF SEVERE LOOKS MINIMAL...PER DAY ONE CONVECTIVE 
OUTLOOK. NUDGED POPS UP JUST A BIT FOR THIS EVENING AND KEPT POPS 
LIKELY FOR NE TN/SW VA UNTIL FRONTAL PASSAGE.

MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY LOOKED REASONABLE...FAVORING COOLER MOS MAXES IN 
THE WEST AND HIGHER MAXES IN THE EAST. CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT SW-W 
WINDS LED ME TO TREND TOWARD A MOS BLEND FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE EAST OF
THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY MORNING BUT UPPER LOW HANGS BACK
ACROSS WESTERN GREAT LAKES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THE UPPER LOW FINALLY
MOVES EAST THURSDAY. DRIER AIR MASS MOVES INTO FORECAST AREA BEHIND
FRONT WITH ONLY A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY ACROSS NE TN AND SW
VA TUESDAY MORNING. INCREASED MOISTURE ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF
FORECAST AREA AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW WILL
ALLOW A FEW SHOWERS TO DEVELOP WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EVENING.
THURSDAY UPPER LOW WILL BE FINALLY TO FAR NE FOR ANY EFFECT. NW
FLOW AND DRY AIR MASS KEEPS FORECAST AREA MOSTLY SUNNY. NW FLOW
WILL BE REINFORCED WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT EARLY
FRIDAY. A NARROW BAND OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT.
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN STATES AND
UPPER FLOW OUT OF ALMOST DUE NORTH MUCH COOLER AIR MASS MOVES INTO
THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH

THURSDAY UPPER LOW WILL BE FINALLY TO FAR NE FOR ANY EFFECT. NW
FLOW AND DRY AIR MASS KEEPS FORECAST AREA MOSTLY SUNNY. NW FLOW
WILL BE REINFORCED WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT EARLY
FRIDAY. A NARROW BAND OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT.
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN STATES AND
UPPER FLOW OUT OF ALMOST DUE NORTH MUCH COOLER AIR MASS MOVES INTO
THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S. FRIDAY WILL BE
SLIGHTLY COOLER. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY HIGHS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER
70S AND LOWS FALLING INTO THE 40S.

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
442 AM EDT SUN SEP 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TWO WEATHER CONCERNS THIS MORNING

CONVECTION IS MOVING NE AT 20 MPH AND JUST SKIRTING JOHNSON/CARTER
TN AND NEAR ERN WASHINGTON COUNTY VA...SO I ADDED SOME MORNING POPS
FOR EXTREME NE TN AND OUR ERN MOST COUNTIES OF SW VA. THE FOG SEEMS
VERY LOCALIZED AND WAS NOT ADDED TO FORECAST GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE ON THE INCREASE ON THE SRN 
END OF THE UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER W CENTRAL ILLINOIS THIS MORNING. 
NAM MODEL MOVES THE CONVECTION OUT OF AREA BEFORE THIS AFTERNOON...
AND I EXPECT PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 70S 
TO LOWER 80S LOOKS GOOD WITH MOS NUMBERS QUITE CLOSE.

FOR TONIGHT...INCREASED CLOUDS A BIT MORE FROM THE WEST...AND SPREAD 
AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EASTWARD TO COVER ALL OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA. 25/00Z MOS POPS WERE HIGHER THIS RUN AND THE NEW POP GRIDS 
MESHED BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. MIN TEMP GRID WAS ALSO 
ADJUSTED UP A FEW DEGREES DUE TO INCREASING CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW EXPECTED TO BE
OVER UPPER MS VALLEY WITH SURFACE LOW ACROSS INDIANA AND COLD FRONT
EXTENDING SOUTHEAST THROUGH MIDDLE TN AND SOUTHWEST INTO LOWER MS
VALLEY AT 12Z MONDAY. INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF THE FRONT MONDAY. AIR MASS WILL BE
MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY. THE FRONT WILL MOVE
THROUGH BY EARLY TUESDAY. NAM MODEL KEEPS UPPER LOW BACK OVER THE
SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. PREFER GFS MODEL THAT MOVES UPPER
LOW OUT FASTER INTO THE EASTERN LAKES BY LATE TUESDAY. CONTINUED
CHANCE OF SHOWERS TUESDAY THEN CLEARING SKIES FROM SOUTHWEST TO
NORTHEAST TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. NW FLOW AND DRIER AIR MASS
WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. A WEAK
DRY FRONT EARLY FRIDAY WILL REINFORCE DRY AIRMASS AND BRING COOLER
TEMPERATURES TO FORECAST AREA FOR SATURDAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1110 AM EDT SAT SEP 24 2011

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER NE AREAS. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PARTIAL CLEARING HAS OCCURRED 
OVER WRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...BUT FOG HAS BEEN 
SPOTTY DUE TO MIXING OF DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION AND LINGERING 
CLOUD COVER IN ERN AREAS. VERY LOW CLOUDS COVER MUCH OF THE PLATEAU 
NE INTO ERN KY...WHILE SLIGHTLY HIGHER LOW CLOUDS PERSIST FROM E TN 
INTO SW VA AND SW NC. TWEAKED FORECAST GRIDS TO REFLECT THESE CLOUDS 
EARLY THIS MORNING...THEN PARTLY OR MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. THE DRY AIR 
SHOULD ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH NEAR THE MILDER GFS MOS MAXES.

HIGH CLOUDS MAY INCREASE LATE TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE WOBBLING UPPER 
LOW OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION...BUT THE POSSIBILITY OF 
PATCHY FOG WILL EXIST WHERE SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR. NAM AND GFS 
MOS DIFFER CONSIDERABLY ON HOW COOL TEMPS DROP...AND I NUDGED THE 
PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID DOWN TO AT LEAST A BLEND FOR NOW. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW ACROSS MS VALLEY 
WILL BRING CLOUDS INTO THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY BUT POCKET OF DRY AIR 
WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH PART OF THE DAY. BY 
AFTERNOON SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS PLATEAU...SW VA AND EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AS FRONTAL SYSTEM AHEAD OF UPPER LOW MOVES INTO TN VALLEY. 
SUNDAY NIGHT BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS. MONDAY INCREASED CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WITH SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW TEMPERATURES 
WARMER SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S. MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS THOUGH DECREASING AS UPPER 
LOW ONLY SLOWLY MOVES EAST ACROSS SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES DRY AIR WILL 
BE ADVECTED INTO TN VALLEY BUT LINGERING MOISTURE AND COLD AIR ALOFT 
WILL DEVELOP SOME SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS NORTHERN AND EASTERN PARTS 
OF FORECAST AREA. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE AND 
DRIER AIR MASS BRING SUNNY SKIES TO REGION. WEAK FRONT APPROACHES 
FRIDAY WHICH MAY BRING A FEW SHOWERS. NOT MUCH MOISTURE TO WORK WITH 
SO WILL KEEP DRY FOR NOW. &&

CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WITH SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW
TEMPERATURES WARMER SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S.
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS THOUGH
DECREASING AS UPPER LOW ONLY SLOWLY MOVES EAST ACROSS SOUTHERN
GREAT LAKES DRY AIR WILL BE ADVECTED INTO TN VALLEY BUT LINGERING
MOISTURE AND COLD AIR ALOFT WILL DEVELOP SOME SHOWER ACTIVITY
ACROSS NORTHERN AND EASTERN PARTS OF FORECAST AREA. WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIR MASS BRING SUNNY SKIES TO
REGION. WEAK FRONT APPROACHES FRIDAY WHICH MAY BRING A FEW SHOWERS.
NOT MUCH MOISTURE TO WORK WITH SO WILL KEEP DRY FOR NOW.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
732 AM EDT FRI SEP 23 2011

.AVIATION...SHOWERS CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTH ACROSS MOST OF WRN NC AND 
OVER NE TN AND SW VA. HEAVIER SHOWERS DEVELOPING TO OUR WEST OVER 
MIDDLE TN. SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON...SO OPTED TO CONTINUE 
TO CARRY VCTS OR A SHORT TEMP GROUP WITH TSRA.

CURRENTLY...TYS STARTS OUT WITH MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS AND MVFR FOR 
CHA. LIGHT RAIN AT TRI BUT VFR VISBY/CEILING FOR NOW. MVFR LATER 
TODAY IS CERTAINLY POSSIBLE AT ANY TAF SITE IF CONVECTION MOVES 
ACROSS...AND ALSO SOME THREAT FOR MVFR OR LOWER TONIGHT AT TYS/TRI 
WITH ANY SIGNIFICANT CLEARING.

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION INCREASING TO OUR SOUTH 
OVER MUCH OF GA AND SW NC SEEMS TO BE ENHANCED BY RIGHT REAR QUAD OF 
THE UPPER LEVEL JET. WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROVIDING SOME LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONVERGENCE...AND SHORT RANGE MODELS GENERALLY AGREE 
ON AT LEAST SCATTERED -TSRA ON TAP FOR TODAY. WEATHER AND RAIN 
CHANCE GRIDS WERE ADJUSTED UPWARDS...IN LINE WITH 23/00Z MOS POPS.

KEPT SOME LINGERING LIGHT SHOWERS THIS EVENING...MAINLY OVER SW VA 
AND EXTREME ERN TN COUNTIES...WHICH FITS WELL WITH LATEST MOS AND 
ADJACENT NWS OFFICES GRIDS. 

OTHERWISE...CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH MORNING CONVECTION SHOULD KEEP 
FOG PATCHY IN COVERAGE...WITH JUST SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG POSSIBLE.
MOS TEMPS VERY CLOSE AND FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY WITH LINGERING MOISTURE
NORTHEAST EARLY. DRIER AIR AND WEAK HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO
SATURDAY. SKIES SHOULD BECOME SUNNY. UPPER LOW OVER SOUTHERN GREAT
LAKES AND MS VALLEY WILL SPIN IN PLACE WITH MOISTURE NEAR THE
CENTER. KEEPING SATURDAY NIGHT DRY BUT EVENTUALLY THE MOISTURE WILL
ROTATE AROUND IT INTO THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY. THE UPPER LOW MOVES
SLOWLY EAST WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AND
TUESDAY AS IMPULSES ROTATE AROUND THE UPPER LOW. FROM TUESDAY NIGHT
THROUGH THURSDAY HIGH PRESSURE AND NW FLOW BRINGS IN DRIER AIR MASS
AND SUNNY SKIES. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL WITH LOWS
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

AND UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE 
BULK OF THE CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE COLD FRONT WILL STAY 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE SUNRISE...WITH MAINLY SCATTERED 
ACTIVITY IN THE LOCAL AREA OVERNIGHT. THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE 
FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION OVERNIGHT... 
AND WILL MENTION SOME PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT. THINK 
THAT MORE CLOUD COVER TONIGHT SHOULD KEEP ANY FOG FROM BECOMING AS 
WIDESPREAD AS THIS MORNING. TEMPS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO CHANGE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 AM EDT THU SEP 22 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AHEAD OF AN ADVANCING COLD FRONT

OVER THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON.  BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION WILL BE 
OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND ACROSS NORTHERN LOCATIONS WHERE A 
WEAK IMPULSE IS EXPECTED TO SLIDE THROUGH.  CHANCES INCREASES 
OVERNIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL LOW IS MAIN 
WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE LONG TERM...BUT UNFORTUNATELY...AS IS OFTEN 
THE CASE WITH UPPER LOWS...UNCERTAINTY ABOUT WHERE IT WILL TRACK IS 
HIGH GIVEN VERY POOR MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY.  IT 
DOES APPEAR THAT THE CENTER WILL TRACK TO OUR NORTH...WHICH USUALLY 
RESULTS IN LESS PRECIP FOR US.  WILL TRY TO AVOID BIG SWINGS IN THE 
FORECAST...AND WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS THIS 
PACKAGE.  RESULT WILL BE CHANCE POPS SOUTH TO LIKELY NORTHEAST FOR 
FRIDAY...DRY SATURDAY...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS SUNDAY 
INTO MONDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH TUESDAY. NOT MUCH ARGUMENT WITH 
MAV TEMPS FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT WILL TRIM MEX TEMPS SOMEWHAT 
FOR LATER PERIODS IN AN ATTEMPT TO LESSEN BIG RUN TO RUN TEMP 
SWINGS.

SLIGHTLY INCREASED POPS TO HIGH CHANCE AND EVEN LIKELY FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT. ANOTHER WEAK VORT ROTATES AROUND THE PARENT UPPER LOW BY 
LATE SUNDAY. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME AS 
UPPER LOW SLOWLY PULLS AWAY. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED MAV/MEX 
FAIRLY CLOSELY.

DESCENDS...WITH THE ECMWF SHOWING MORE SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT THAN THE 
GFS/CMC.  WILL LEAN TOWARD A BLEND FOR NOW AND KEEP THE CENTER TO 
OUR NORTH.  ASSUMING THE LOW STAYS CENTERED TO OUR NORTH...WE SHOULD 
NOT BE OVERLY WET...BUT WILL HAVE TO KEEP POPS IN THE FORECAST MOST 
PERIODS.  WILL CARRY CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EXCEPT SAT/SAT 
NIGHT...WHEN MODELS CONTINUE TO AGREE WE SHOULD HAVE DRIER AIR OVER 
THE AREA. BY TUESDAY ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH ZONES AS UPPER 
LOW STARTS TO PULL AWAY.  WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH GFS MOS 
TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL.

.AVIATION...SATELLITE PICS SHOW A SPEED OR VORT MAX MOVING NNE FROM

BE FIRST TAF SITE AFFECTED...WITH CONDITIONS TRENDING DOWN TO 
BETWEEN MVFR AND IFR OVERNIGHT. SHOWERS AND LOWERING CONDITIONS 
SHOULD REACH TYS WELL BEFORE DAYBREAK...BUT I SLOWED DOWN THE 
SHOWERS AND MVFR CONDITIONS SOME FOR TRI.

SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO LINGER FOR MOST OF WEDNESDAY...BUT 
CONDITIONS SHOULD IMPROVE A BIT IN THE AFTERNOON.

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES COVER THE 
FOUR STATE REGION THIS AFTERNOON WITH A FEW MORE BREAKS FROM 
KNOXVILLE NE INTO SW VIRGINIA. SINCE THE EARLY MORNING HOURS MOST OF 
THE RAIN WHICH HAS BEEN VERY LIGHT AND ISOLATED HAS OCCURRED OVER SE 
TN. TEMPERATURES FAIRLY UNIFORM IN THE 60S SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND 
HIGHER MOUNTAINS TO 70S VALLEYS. A LITTLE MORE SUN THAN EXPECTED 
RAISED TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES HIGHER. FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
A WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA ALONG DISSIPATING FRONT OVER MS AND WEST TN 
COMBINED WITH UPPER LEVEL IMPULSE NOW OVER NORTH AL BECOMES MORE 
DEVELOPED TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS IT MOVES NE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA. HAVE INCREASED POPS GOING INTO TONIGHT AND TOMORROW TO LIKELY 
TO ABOUT 80 PERCENT. DURING THE AFTERNOON WEDNESDAY SHOWERS SHOULD 
DECREASE DURING THE AFTERNOON. ACTIVITY MAY DEVELOP TO WEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA LATE WEDNESDAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER THE 
PLAINS STATES WITH CLOSED OFF UPPER LOW MOVING INTO THE WESTERN 
GREAT LAKES. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN BY 00Z THU. 
INSTABILITY VERY LOW RIGHT NOW BUT SHOULD INCREASE A LITTLE AS 
IMPULSE MOVES NE TONIGHT. WEDNESDAY WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY SHOW A WET AND COOL PATTERN INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE SLOWLY EASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BECOMES HIGHLY AMPLIFIED OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY. MODELS AGREE THAT SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA ALONG AND AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...WITH 
SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY. THE DEEP UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO BECOME CUT OFF OVER THE MID WEST BY THE 
WEEKEND...AND SHOULD PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA AGAIN ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND 
COOLER THAN THE GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO 
THE EXPECTED MOSTLY CLOUDY AND WET CONDITIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1051 AM EDT TUE SEP 20 2011

.DISCUSSION...A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS WERE OCCURRING ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY AND BREAKS MORE
NOTICEABLE ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. A WEAK UPPER LOW WAS TRYING TO
FORM NEAR THE CENTRAL MS/AL BORDER. INCREASED VORTICITY ACROSS N AL
WAS CAUSING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP THERE BUT ONLY A
FEW SHOWERS FARTHER NORTH ACROSS SE TN. EXPECT ONLY SPARSE ACTIVITY
ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH BETTER COVERAGE SW CORNER OF
CWA AS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN AL MOVE SLOWLY NORTH AND EAST.
MUCH LESS COVERAGE NE SECTIONS WITH PARTIAL CLEARING CONTINUING.
RAISED POPS A LITTLE SW AND DECREASED CLOUDS NE. LEFT HIGHS ALONE.
UPDATED FORECAST ALREADY SENT.

&&

754 
FXUS64 KMRX 200645
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT TUE SEP 20 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR 
WEST WILL DISSIPATE. CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL LINGER OVER THE 
AREA...AND SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL BRING SHOWERS TO THE 
AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM.  WILL CARRY MOSTLY CHANCE POPS.   
CONVECTIVE ENERGY STILL LOOKS RATHER LIMITED TODAY AND TONIGHT...SO 
WILL JUST MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
SETTLE INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...POSSIBLY BRIEFLY SLIDING TO 
OUR EAST DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL KEEP 
LIKELY TO HIGH CHANCE POPS OVER THE MRX CWA WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  
THE BOUNDARY SLOWLY BECOMES DIFFUSE DURING THIS TIME FRAME WITH 
ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA ON FRIDAY.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
IN PLACE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.  MODEL CONSISTENCY CONTINUES TO 
ERODE DURING THE REST OF THE PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE  LOW.  
THEREFORE...MADE FEW CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF POPS NORTH AND OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS ON SATURDAY AND LOW 
POPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH ANOTHER FRONT POSSIBLY MOVING IN.

&&

.AVIATION...WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR WEST WILL

POSSIBLE LATER TODAY/TONIGHT...BUT PROBABILITY STILL LOOKS FAIRLY

602 
FXUS64 KMRX 200122
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 PM EDT MON SEP 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATED LIGHT RAIN TRACKING FROM THE WEST 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT. NO THUNDER IN THE AREA. CURRENT POPS LOOK 
GOOD. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING GROUP...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE MAP HAS A 
COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE MS AND LOWER OHIO VALLEY WITH AN AREA OF 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER MIDDLE TN THESE SHOWERS HAVE BEEN MOVING 
SLOWLY EAST DURING THE DAY. SKIES HAVE BEEN MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS 
SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AND PARTLY CLOUDY NORTHEAST. 
TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN TO THE UPPER 60S TO MID 70S. FOR TONIGHT AND 
TUESDAY THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN AND DISSIPATE AS A NEW 
STRONGER SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWERS BECOMING MORE NUMEROUS BY THIS EVENING AND CONTINUING 
OVERNIGHT INTO TUESDAY BUT DECREASING CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOON. HAVE 
INCREASED RAIN CHANCES TO LIKELY LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING 
AND INCREASED POPS TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO CHANCE. INSTABILITY WILL BE 
MARGINAL INTO THIS EVENING AND TUESDAY BUT WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF THUNDERSTORMS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT. HAVE LOWERED HIGHS 
A FEW DEGREES TUESDAY DUE TO CLOUDS AND SHOWERS. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS SHOW AIRMASS 
BECOMING MARGINALLY UNSTABLE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT WITH DIURNALLY DRIVEN
CONVECTION ANTICIPATED DURING THE EVENING.  FOR WEDNESDAY...A SLOW
MOVING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY PRODUCING 
LIKELY CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. AIRMASS WILL BE 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE...BUT DO NOT SEE A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM CONCERN.

THIS FRONT BECOMES QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY OVER THE EASTERN COUNTIES.

FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...MAINLY FORECAST CONCERN WILL BE HOW 
DEEP/LOCATION OF UPPER TROUGH DROPPING INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS. THERE ARE SOME FAIRLY DIFFERENT SOLUTIONS BETWEEN THE GFS 
AND ECMWF.  THE ECMWF WANTS TO CUT-OFF THE UPPER LOW NEAR THE AREA 
WHILE THE GFS KEEPS THE CUT-OFF LOW OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES. 
WILL TREND FORECAST TOWARD THE GFS SOLUTION...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW 
GIVEN THE LARGE SPREAD IN THE ENSEMBLE SOLUTIONS.

WILL KEEP BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR LATER HALF OF THE WEEK/EARLY NEXT WEEK DUE TO 
CLOSER PROXIMITY TO THE UPPER LOW.

AFTERNOON AFD RESENT PER MEDIA REQUEST...

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  79  65  81  63 /  50  40  60  50  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  76  63  81  63 /  60  40  40  70  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  76  62  80  61 /  60  40  40  70  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              57  76  58  78  58 /  60  50  30  80  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

GH/TD/DH/TG

.DISCUSSION...PRE-FRONTAL SHOWERS AHEAD OF SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT
NOW APPROACHING MIDDLE TN WITH A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS ALREADY SEEN IN
AREAS FROM KNOXVILLE WEST BUT ONLY TRACE AMOUNTS HAVE OCCURRED SO
FAR TODAY. WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL MOVE INTO
THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH
INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS THERE. MAIN SHORTWAVE AHEAD OF THE
FRONT MOVES INTO MIDDLE TN LATE THIS AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING SO
THINK SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION WILL NOT MOVE INTO WESTERN SECTIONS
UNTIL ABOUT 21Z AND EASTERN AREAS AFTER 00Z. CURRENT FORECAST FOR
RAIN CHANCES...HIGH TEMPERATURES AND SKY COVER LOOK ON TRACK SO NO
UPDATE PLANNED.

375 
FXUS64 KMRX 190805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON SEP 19 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH THE AREA DURING THE PERIOD.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER 
THE AREA...AND SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL ENHANCE PRECIP CHANCES 
LATE TODAY INTO TONIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES ACROSS WEST AND NORTH 
ZONES WHERE WILL CARRY LOW LIKELY POPS.   CONVECTIVE ENERGY LOOKS 
LIMITED AT BEST...SO WILL ONLY MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER. MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.      

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS FOR 
THE EXTENDED WHICH SEEMED TO BE A LITTLE MORE REALISTIC WITH BETTER 
DETAIL TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF BROAD BRUSHES QPF ESPECIALLY 
ON TUESDAY WHERE POPS APPEAR TO BE A TAD TOO HIGH WITH DEPARTURE OF 
WEAKENING SHORT WAVE AND WEAK FRONT STALLED WEST OF THE REGION. BY 
WEDNESDAY MODELS INDICATE INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION AND 
INSTABILITY ALONG WITH SLOWLY STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE 
AHEAD OF DEEPENING GREAT LAKES LONG WAVE TROUGH. HOWEVER STILL 
ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY HERE TO KEEP PROBABILITY OF PRECIP FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN A MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY. BETTER CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION OCCURS LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AS 
DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. RAISED POPS TO LIKELY FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AS 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT PRESS EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY THE UPPER TROUGH LUMBERS VERY 
SLOWLY EAST WITH UPPER LOW FORMING IN THE VICINITY OF THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY AND EASTERN LAKES. QUITE A BIT OF MOISTURE CONTINUES TO WRAP 
AROUND THE UPPER LEVEL FEATURE AND KEPT THE SLIGHT THROUGH MEDIUM 
CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER GOING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY 
WHILE DROPPING FRIDAY NIGHT AS SOME DRIER AIR ADVECTS INTO THE 
REGION. MODELS TRY TO KEEP THE CUT OFF LOW AROUND THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY THROUGH SUNDAY BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME JUST 
MAINTAINED THE CURRENT DRY FORECAST. CONCERNING TEMPS EDGED TOWARD 
THE WARMER MAXES ON TUESDAY WHILE EDGING SLIGHTLY BELOW SUGGESTED 
HIGHS ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH A BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP EACH 
DAY. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPS FOR THE REMAINDER OF 
THE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             75  61  83  64  79 /  50  50  20  20  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  76  60  80  62  79 /  40  50  30  20  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       74  59  80  62  78 /  50  50  30  20  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              76  56  78  58  78 /  30  50  40  20  40

272 
FXUS64 KMRX 190128
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
928 PM EDT SUN SEP 18 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. FRONT APPROACHING 
LATE TONIGHT. MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 
12Z SO WILL CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE ALOFT MOVES
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS MONDAY MORNING AS TROUGH APPROACHES MS RVR 
FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS. FLOW ALOFT BECOMES SWRLY OVER E TN ALLOWING
FOR CONTINUED INCREASE IN MOISTURE. PRECIP WILL OCCUR ALONG AND AHEAD
OF TROUGH...AND LEADING EDGE OF PRECIP SHOULD BE NEAR NASHVILLE AROUND
12Z...KNOXVILLE AROUND 18Z...AND MOST OF REMAINDER OF E TN BY
SUNDOWN MONDAY. MAX TEMPS COULD BE A LITTLE LOWER MONDAY DUE TO
CLOUDS AND PRECIP...BUT WE WILL REMAIN IN THE WARM AIR MASS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
MONDAY NIGHT COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE TN VALLEY WITH MOST OF THE 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY CONCENTRATED TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. NAM 
MODEL HAS A LOT OF LIFT MONDAY NIGHT THEN DRIES AIR MASS OUT RAPIDLY 
TUESDAY. GFS SIMILAR BUT NOT AS MUCH WITH SOME LOW LEVEL LIFT 
CONTINUING. HAVE BEST CHANCES AND QPF AMOUNTS MONDAY NIGHT AND THEN 
DROP POPS TO ABOUT 20 PERCENT TUESDAY WITH LOW QPF AMOUNTS. MODELS 
THEN STRENGTHEN SYSTEM OVER NORTHERN MS VALLEY AND BRING IT SE 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH NEW FRONT DEVELOPING OVER THE MS VALLEY 
WEDNESDAY AND MOVE IT THROUGH THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. THE SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO BECOME A CLOSED LOW WHICH WILL 
SLOW IT DOWN AS IT MOVES EAST. TUESDAY NIGHT WILL CONTINUE LOW POPS 
WITH INCREASING RAIN CHANCES WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT. IF THE SYSTEM DEEPENS 
TROUGH AND EXTENDS SOUTH INTO THE TN VALLEY AND CLOSES OFF LIKE THE 
GFS SHOWS EARLY FRIDAY THE CLOUDS AND RAIN MAY LAST LONGER. RIGHT 
NOW HAVE RAIN CHANCES DECREASE FROM SW TO NE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH HIGHER PRESSURE NO POPS AND COOLER TEMPERATURES WITH DEEP 
TROUGH FOR THE WEEKEND. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  77  61  83  64 /  10  40  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  77  60  81  62 /  10  30  40  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  76  60  81  62 /  10  40  40  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  77  56  78  57 /  10  20  40  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

DROP POPS TO ABOUT 20 PERCENT TUESDAY WITH LOW QPF AMOUNTS. MODELS 
THEN STRENGTHEN SYSTEM OVER NORTHERN MS VALLEY AND BRING IT SE 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH NEW FRONT DEVELOPING OVER THE MS VALLEY 
WEDNESDAY AND MOVE IT THROUGH THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. THE SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO BECOME A CLOSED LOW WHICH WILL 
SLOW IT DOWN AS IT MOVES EAST. TUESDAY NIGHT WILL CONTINUE LOW POPS 
WITH INCREASING RAIN CHANCES WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT. IF THE SYSTEM DEEPENS 
TROUGH AND EXTENDS SOUTH INTO THE TN VALLEY AND CLOSES OFF LIKE THE 
GFS SHOWS EARLY FRIDAY THE CLOUDS AND RAIN MAY LAST LONGER. RIGHT 
NOW HAVE RAIN CHANCES DECREASE FROM SW TO NE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH HIGHER PRESSURE NO POPS AND COOLER TEMPERATURES WITH DEEP 
TROUGH FOR THE WEEKEND. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  77  61  83  64 /  10  40  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  77  60  81  62 /  10  30  40  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  76  60  81  62 /  10  40  40  20  20

838 
FXUS64 KMRX 180819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT SUN SEP 18 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE 
AHEAD OF WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH.  SHOULD SEE VARYING AMOUNTS OF 
CLOUDS DURING THE PERIOD...BUT SHOULD BE MAINLY DRY.  WILL ONLY 
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS LATE TONIGHT FOR PLATEAU COUNTIES 
AS SYSTEM APPROACHES.  MAV TEMPS LOOK A BIT HIGH FOR MAX TEMPS 
TODAY...SO WILL LEAN MORE TOWARD A MAV/MET BLEND. MAV TEMPS FOR 
TONIGHT LOOK REASONABLE SO NOT MUCH ARGUMENT THERE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD ALTHOUGH A LITTLE DIVERGENCE OF OPINION 
BY DAYS SIX AND SEVEN. THE SCENARIO BASICALLY REMAINS WITH WEAKENING 
UPPER TROUGH DRAGGING A COLD FRONT SLOWLY TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
DRIVING EAST ACROSS THE REGION BY 12Z TUESDAY. KEPT THE WEST THROUGH 
EAST POP GRADIENT IDEA GOING MONDAY WITH HIGHEST POPS WEST WHILE 
TWEAKING UP SLIGHTLY AREA WIDE FOR MONDAY NIGHT AS WEAK BOUNDARY 
TRIES TO EDGE CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA. BEST CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION WOULD BE OVER THE WESTERN HALF DURING THIS PERIOD. THE 
WEAK BOUNDARY STALLS SOMEWHERE ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND TRIED TO 
KEEP THE POPS A LITTLE LOWER ON TUESDAY AS AREA AWAITS DEEPER LONG 
WAVE TROUGH WHICH DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO 
THE GREAT LAKES AND MIDWEST WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. MODELS MORE 
ROBUST WITH MOISTURE ADVECTION/INSTABILITY WITH THIS SYSTEM AND 
ADJUSTED POPS FROM 40 PERCENT ON WEDNESDAY TO 50 PERCENT LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. SHOULD BE A BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION AREA WIDE 
WITH THIS BOUNDARY. MODEL SOLUTIONS START TO DIVERGE THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY AS JET ENERGY FILLS IN ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER TROUGH 
WHICH SHOULD END UP SLOWING DOWN FRONTAL BOUNDARY. WITH UNCERTAINTY 
BUILDING DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST JUST GRADUALLY DROPPED 
POPS BACK TO MEDIUM CHANCE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. BY FRIDAY MODELS 
COMING MORE INTO AGREEMENT ON A MIDWEST CUT OFF LOW DEVELOPING 
PROVIDING A BETTER CHANCE FOR AN UNSETTLED WEATHER LATE IN THE WEEK. 
THEREFORE USED A SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POP WITH SHOWERS POSSIBLE 
AS SHORT WAVE FEATURES ROTATE AROUND THE UPPER LOW. POSSIBILITY 
EXISTS FOR A FEW MORE SHOWERS ON SATURDAY IN THIS PATTERN BUT KEPT 
OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR NOW. TRIED TO ADJUST MAX/MIN TEMPS A LITTLE 
HIGHER THROUGH MID WEEK WITH PERSISTENT SOUTHERLY FLOW AND HIGHER 
DEWPOINTS AVAILABLE FOR TEMPERATURE MODERATION AT NIGHT.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  62  77  62  83 /  10  10  40  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  60  77  60  82 /  10  10  30  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  59  77  60  81 /  10  10  40  40  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 PM EDT SAT SEP 17 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RIDGING ACROSS THE 
REGION PROVIDING ANOTHER DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...WEAK AND TEMPORARY RIDGING 
WILL HELP KEEP THE AREA FAIRLY WARM AND DRY...HIGHS SUNDAY AROUND
80 GENERALLY. MAY SEE ISOLATED SHOWER ACTIVITY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
OVER HIGHER PEAKS THANKS TO LINGERING MOISTURE ALOFT. SFC WINDS
WILL TRY TO BECOME SOUTHERLY OVER THE WESTERN THIRD/HALF OF AREA
NEAR AND WEST OF I-75...BUT NOT STRONG. GC

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MODELS COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE LATEST ECMWF/GFS MODELS 
BRINGING WEAKENING SYSTEM INTO THE TN AND OH VALLEYS SUNDAY NIGHT 
AND MONDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHERN PLATEAU BEFORE 
MORNING MONDAY. THEN SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES ACROSS FORECAST AREA 
LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS WITH SMALL 
AMOUNT OF PRECIPITATION. WEAK FRONT WASHES OUT BY LATE TUESDAY OR 
EARLY WEDNESDAY BUT NEW SYSTEM DIGS SOUTH INTO PLAINS STATES TUESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY. CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY. THE SECOND SYSTEM CLOSES OFF INTO 
UPPER LOW OVER GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY AND THIS SLOWS SYSTEMS PROGRESS 
AS IT MOVES EAST INTO THE NE STATES. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN WITH 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS ENDING RAIN LATER FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. AT 
END OF FORECAST PERIOD GFS/ECMWF KEEP A CLOSED LOW JUST TO THE WEST 
OF FORECAST AREA DISCONNECTED FROM THE UPPER FLOW BUT FOR NOW WILL 
DISCOUNT IT AND KEEP THE END OF THE FORECAST DRY. TD

989 
FXUS64 KMRX 170821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
421 AM EDT SAT SEP 17 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...A WEAK UPPER LEVEL 
DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
THIS MORNING. MODELS SHOW WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT...WHICH IS HELPING TO
ALREADY PRODUCE SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS/SPRINKLES. FEEL CHANCE OF 
MEASURABLE RAINFALL IS LOW DUE TO RELATIVELY DRY AIRMASS...SO WILL 
CALL FOR SCATTERED SPRINKLES. THIS WAVE EXITS THE AREA BY 
MID-AFTERNOON.

BESIDES THE WEAK WAVE...SURFACE RIDGING WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH SUNDAY. RETURN 
FLOW OF SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL INTRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS ACROSS MAINLY THE PLATEAU COUNTIES.

SLOW WARM-UP WILL CONTINUE AS RIDGING BEGINS TO MOVE EAST.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN 
AGREEMENT DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST BUT GENERALLY FOLLOWED 
THE 00Z ECMWF WHICH FEATURES A DEAMPLIFYING UPPER LEVEL TROF. THIS 
TROF PROGRESSES EAST TO THE APPALACHIANS IN A GREATLY WEAKENED STATE 
BY 12Z TUESDAY WHILE ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT BARELY MAKES IT INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA STALLING OR WASHING OUT ON TUESDAY. TWEAKED POPS 
UP TO LOW AND MEDIUM CHANCE FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON INTO MONDAY EVENING AS MODELS INDICATE DEEPER 
MOISTURE AND LIFT BUILDING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH INTO THE 
APPALACHIANS AHEAD OF THE FRONT. BASICALLY KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP IN PLACE FOR TUESDAY WITH THE FRONT LOSING IDENTITY OVER THE 
REGION. WITH WEAKENING FOCUS BUT LINGERING MOISTURE/INSTABILITY 
TRIED TO INDICATE A POSSIBILITY FOR OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED 
CONVECTION ON TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY MUCH STRONGER SYSTEM WILL BE 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND WESTERN LAKES 
AMPLIFYING INTO A CLOSED LOW. MORE ROBUST SURFACE COLD FRONT SHOULD 
ACCOMPANY THIS TROF AND MAINTAINED A GRADUAL INCREASE IN POPS 
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR A BETTER CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION AT THIS TIME. DEEPENING SYSTEM MAY LEAD TO SLOWER FRONTAL 
MOVEMENT SO HELD ONTO LOW CHANCE POP FOR THURSDAY WHILE DROPPING OFF 
TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD DUE TO 
DIVERGING MODEL SOLUTIONS WITH THE DEEP EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

532 
FXUS64 KMRX 170105
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EDT FRI SEP 16 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A HODGEPODGE OF CLOUDS WILL BE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. 
COLD AIR DAMMING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS HAS WRAPPED AROUND THE 
SOUTHERN END OF THE MOUNTAINS INTO NORTH GA AND THE SOUTHERN TN 
VALLEY. A SOUTHERLY FLOW ABOVE THE COLD DOME WILL KEEP BROKEN TO 
OVERCAST CLOUDS IN THIS AREA THROUGH THE EVENING. THE MODELS SHOW 
THE 850 MB FLOW GOING SLACK LATER TONIGHT...WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR 
THESE CLOUDS TO DISSIPATE. HOWEVER...A 300 MB JET STREAK NOW OVER 
THE OZARKS WILL MOVE EAST AND BRING MIDLEVEL CLOUDS TO THE AREA 
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. SO OVERALL...MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES CAN BE 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. THESE VARIOUS LAYERS OF MOISTURE 
ARE THIN AND WITH NO SYNOPTIC LIFT AND NO LOW LEVEL FORCING...NO 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED. FOR TEMPS...WENT ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS TONIGHT 
AND THE COOL SIDE OF MOS TOMORROW BASED ON EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER...BUT UNCERTAINTY IS HIGH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEAST EXTENDS DOWN INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AND THEN BEGINS TO RETREAT TO THE EAST 
MONDAY AS A NEW UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY. MODELS 
INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA BUT NOT MUCH TRIGGER FOR 
PRECIPITATION UNTIL MONDAY. WILL KEEP AREA DRY WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
SOUTHWEST NC ADDING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THEN MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. DUE TO CLOUD COVER NIGHTS WILL BE MILD WITH 
HIGHS IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S. LATE MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY SOUTHWEST 
FLOW INCREASES AHEAD OF COLD FRONT SO INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. THIS FRONT WEAKENS TUESDAY AS NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS 
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. REMNANT MOISTURE FROM FIRST SYSTEM TEAMS 
UP WITH SECOND SYSTEM AND BRINGS MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONT THROUGH THE 
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. HIGHER PRESSURE AND COOLER 
CONDITIONS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH SUNNY SKIES AGAIN FRIDAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT FRI SEP 16 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A HODGEPODGE OF CLOUDS WILL BE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. 
COLD AIR DAMMING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS HAS WRAPPED AROUND THE 
SOUTHERN END OF THE MOUNTAINS INTO NORTH GA AND THE SOUTHERN TN 
VALLEY. A SOUTHERLY FLOW ABOVE THE COLD DOME WILL KEEP BROKEN TO 
OVERCAST CLOUDS IN THIS AREA THROUGH THE EVENING. THE MODELS SHOW 
THE 850 MB FLOW GOING SLACK LATER TONIGHT...WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR 
THESE CLOUDS TO DISSIPATE. HOWEVER...A 300 MB JET STREAK NOW OVER 
THE OZARKS WILL MOVE EAST AND BRING MIDLEVEL CLOUDS TO THE AREA 
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. SO OVERALL...MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES CAN BE 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. THESE VARIOUS LAYERS OF MOISTURE 
ARE THIN AND WITH NO SYNOPTIC LIFT AND NO LOW LEVEL FORCING...NO 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED. FOR TEMPS...WENT ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS TONIGHT 
AND THE COOL SIDE OF MOS TOMORROW BASED ON EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER...BUT UNCERTAINTY IS HIGH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEAST EXTENDS DOWN INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AND THEN BEGINS TO RETREAT TO THE EAST 
MONDAY AS A NEW UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY. MODELS 
INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA BUT NOT MUCH TRIGGER FOR 
PRECIPITATION UNTIL MONDAY. WILL KEEP AREA DRY WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
SOUTHWEST NC ADDING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THEN MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. DUE TO CLOUD COVER NIGHTS WILL BE MILD WITH 
HIGHS IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S. LATE MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY SOUTHWEST 
FLOW INCREASES AHEAD OF COLD FRONT SO INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. THIS FRONT WEAKENS TUESDAY AS NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS 
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. REMNANT MOISTURE FROM FIRST SYSTEM TEAMS 
UP WITH SECOND SYSTEM AND BRINGS MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONT THROUGH THE 
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. HIGHER PRESSURE AND COOLER 
CONDITIONS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH SUNNY SKIES AGAIN FRIDAY.

WILL CONTINUE TO SEE E TO NE WINDS...WITH CHA VEERING TO A MORE

253 
FXUS64 KMRX 160810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT FRI SEP 16 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD/WEDGE SOUTH EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS TODAY AND
TONIGHT WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE PLATEAU. THE WEDGE OF
COOLER AIR WILL PULL LOW CLOUDS AND SOME LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE INTO
THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHAINS. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN
OVER THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA. LOW CLOUDS FROM THE COOLER WEDGE WILL PULL INTO THE
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND PLATEAU LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. 

ELSEWHERE...A WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE MOVING FROM THE NORTHERN
PLAINS TO THE GREAT LAKES WILL PULL A GOOD DEAL OF HIGH/MID LEVEL
CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA LATER TODAY AND OVERNIGHT. MOISTURE IS QUITE
LIMITED SO WILL KEEP VALLEY AND PLATEAU DRY.

FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...UPPER DISTRUBANCE PULLS EAST
TOWARD THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH CLOUDS DECREASING.
GENERALLY COMPROMISED BETWEEN GFS/MET MOS NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES 
SOUTHWESTERLY BY SUNDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MAKES ITS WAY 
STEADILY EAST FROM THE PLAINS AND ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. THE TROUGH 
DEAMPLIFIES AS IT MOVES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN STATES AROUND 12Z 
TUESDAY. DURING THIS PERIOD THE LOW LEVEL FLOW GRADUALLY SHIFTS TO A 
MORE SOUTHERLY DIRECTION WITH INCREASING TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE 
ADVECTION AHEAD OF A WEAKENING COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHICH BARELY 
MAKES IT TO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY TUESDAY EVENING. KEPT POPS AT 
SLIGHT CHANCE IN THIS SCENARIO WHILE THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS A 
STRONGER SYSTEM WHICH AMPLIFIES AS IT DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
MANITOBA ON TUESDAY AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH MID WEEK. A 
STRONGER FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL ACCOMPANY THIS FEATURE WHICH WILL 
RESULT IN HIGHER PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY 
INTO THURSDAY. AT THIS TIME PLACED THE HIGHEST CHANCE POPS IN THE 
PERIOD FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FRONTAL 
TIMING SOMEWHAT IN QUESTION AT THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST SO 
MAINTAINED THE BROAD BRUSHED LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR THURSDAY 
DECREASING TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY THURSDAY NIGHT. TWEAKED MAX/MIN TEMPS 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER BASED ON NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.   

&&

021 
FXUS64 KMRX 160054
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EDT THU SEP 15 2011

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM THE NORTH. DRIZZLE
OR LIGHT RAIN HAS TAPERED OFF. NW EDGE OF CLOUD COVER REMAINS A 
CHALLENGE FOR THE TONIGHT PERIOD. APPEARS CAP WILL HOLD STRONG 
OVERNIGHT TRAPPING CLOUDS MOST AREAS. LEANED TOWARD A CLOUDIER 
SOLUTION. COLD AIR ADVECTION UNDERWAY AND TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S 
WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE MRX CWA. SON  

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA IS MARKED BY A THIN LINE OF LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWERS FROM AROUND TRI TO EAST OF TYS. EXPECT THAT THE FRONT AND 
MOST OF RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA BY 00Z...SO WILL CARRY 
NO POPS OVERNIGHT BUT WILL MENTION SOME PATCHY DRIZZLE NORTH IN THE 
EVENING. THE BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS ACROSS CENTRAL KY AND WEST TN WILL 
ENTER THE AREA IN THE EVENING...SO A PERIOD OF CLEARING IS EXPECTED 
TOWARD MIDNIGHT. THIS WILL HELP TEMPERATURES DROP INTO THE 50S WITH 
SOME UPPER 40S NORTH AS LOWER DEWPOINTS ADVECT SOUTHWARD. MIXING 
FROM GRADIENT WINDS SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM GOING MUCH LOWER AND 
PREVENT FOG DEVELOPMENT. 

LATE TONIGHT A SOUTHEASTERLY 850 MB FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS 
SC/GA...WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT AND AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH BRINGING 
INCREASING CLOUDS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH ACROSS THE TN VALLEY TOMORROW 
MORNING. MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE CONFINED TO A THIN LAYER AROUND 850 
MB WITH DRY AIR ABOVE...SO NO PRECIP IS EXPECTED UNDER CLOUDY SKIES. 
THE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER AND COOL AIR MASS IN PLACE BEHIND THE 
FRONT SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL...AND ON THE COOL 
SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE...WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S. 

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
INVERTED TROUGH REMAINS ACROSS THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
SO CLOUD COVER WILL LINGER AND THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS MAINLY EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA HIGHER CHANCE 
MOUNTAINS. NAM MODEL MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN MAV WITH CLOUD 
COVER...CHANCE POPS AND COOL TEMPERATURES SATURDAY. SHORT RANGE 
ENSEMBLE MODELS MOVE TROUGH OUT SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL FOLLOW COOLER 
MAV GUIDANCE FRIDAY NIGHT AND GENERALLY A BLEND SATURDAY. HIGHER 
PRESSURE OVER THE NE STATES WILL EXTEND DOWN INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MOST OF MONDAY. A SLOW MOVING FRONTAL SYSTEM 
WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA LATE MONDAY OR MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY AS IT MOVES FROM THE PLAINS AND THE GREAT LAKES INTO 
THE TN VALLEY. THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL BE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL 
AFTER THE WEEKEND.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  69  53  75  57 /  10  10  20  10  10

328 
FXUS64 KMRX 150802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EDT THU SEP 15 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH AREA
EARLY TODAY SO KEPT THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE MORNING AND EARLY
AFTERNOON. MODELS STILL INDICATING SOME INSTABILITY DURING THE MORNING
HOURS SO WILL LEAVE THE THUNDER IN THE FORECAST FOR EARLY TODAY. NO
SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED TODAY. COOLER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED
TODAY AND TONIGHT AS THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION TONIGHT. IT SHOULD
BE MAINLY DRY TONIGHT...BUT WITH SOME LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE
MOUNTAINS...WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS FOR THOSE AREAS. GUIDANCE
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT CONTINUE TO SHOW DIFFERENCES WITH THE AMOUNT 
OF MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT 
PRODUCING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND LIGHT STRATIFORM RAIN. LOW CHANCE 
POPS FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT APPEAR GOOD...SINCE THE MODELS 
AGREE THAT ANY PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY LIGHT AND SCATTERED. A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WILL THEN DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY 
SUNDAY...AS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEAST DRIFTS 
EASTWARD. MODELS INDICATE THAT MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA EACH AFTERNOON BEGINNING ON SUNDAY...WITH 
SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON OVER THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. THIS CONVECTION WILL THEN BECOME POSSIBLE AREAWIDE 
BY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES 
THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.



.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             75  57  72  56  77 /  40  10  20  20  10


674 
FXUS64 KMRX 150211
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EDT WED SEP 14 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MADE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO NEAR TERM
DEW POINTS. CONVECTION SHOULD WEAKEN OVERNIGHT WHILE MOVING INTO THE 
AREA FROM THE WEST. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN UP IN THE 
PRE-FRONTAL AIRMASS. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL GIVE WAY TO A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM TRACKING ACROSS TN OVERNIGHT. CONVECTION NOW CROSSING WEST TN 
WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST AND DAYTIME HEATING IS LOST. 
500 MB VORTICITY AND 850 MB CONVERGENCE WILL PROVIDE THE BEST LIFT 
ACROSS EAST TN AROUND THE 09-12Z TIME FRAME. THERE IS SOME WEAK 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SO WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS ALONG WITH LIKELY POPS. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
PRECIP IS CLOSELY ALIGNED WITH THE SURFACE FRONT...SO POPS WILL 
BEGIN TO DECREASE FROM WEST TO EAST WITH THE FROPA THURSDAY MORNING. 
HOWEVER PLENTY OF SHALLOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS IN PLACE BEHIND 
THE FRONT...AS WE ARE CURRENTLY SEEING ACROSS MO/IL. THIS SHOULD 
GIVE A MOSTLY CLOUDY DAY ON THURSDAY...WITH TEMPERATURES ON THE LOW 
SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S IN MOST SPOTS. SOME 
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS MAY COME IN THE LATE AFTERNOON AND IN SOUTHERN 
AREAS. GUSTY NORTH WINDS CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT 
TOMORROW...WITH GUSTS IN THE 20-30 MPH RANGE.  

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THIS PERIOD STARTS 
WITH THE EVER-PERSISTENT RIDGE TO OUR SOUTH...OVER THE GULF...AND 
THE GREAT LAKES TROUGH EXITING TO THE EAST...RESULTING IN A ZONAL 
FLOW ACROSS THE AREA. A POST-FRONTAL SURFACE RIDGE IS BUILDING INTO 
THE AREA...FROM A HIGH CENTERED IN THE NORTH-CENTRAL U.S.  
HOWEVER...THE INFLUENCE FROM THE HIGH IS CHALLENGED BY A DEVELOPING 
INVERTED/LEE TROUGH OVER THE AREA...AS DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE ALONG 
THE GULF INDUCES EASTERLY DOWNSLOPING WINDS OFF THE 
APPALACHIANS...AND FURTHER DEVELOPS THE LEE THE TROUGH OVER THE 
UPPER TN VALLEY...WHICH DRAWS MOISTURE VERY QUICKLY BACK INTO THE 
AREA. FOR PRECIP CHANCES...PRETTY LOW EXCEPT OVER THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS...BUT ELSEWHERE MOISTURE LOOKS LIKE IT IS NOT DEEP ENOUGH 
TO GIVE A SIGNIFICANT THREAT TO MEASURABLE PRECIP...SO DRY TO LOW 
POPS THROUGH FRIDAY.

AS THE GREAT LAKES TROUGH GETS FARTHER AWAY...ONE MORE SHORTWAVE 
RACES ACROSS FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MOST OF THE ENERGY STAYS TO OUR 
NORTH.  HAVE GOOD COVERAGE OF LOW POPS FRIDAY NIGHT.

OVER THE WEEKEND...THE GULF RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA ALOFT AND 
TRIMMED BACK POPS EVEN MORE AND SUBSIDENCE ERODES MOISTURE FROM 
ABOVE...FOR SATURDAY ONLY HAVE POPS IN HIGHER TERRAIN IN THE EAST.  
THEN TURNING DRY ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH MONDAY.

EARLY NEXT WEEK...HEIGHTS OVER THE AREA START TO FALL AS THE 
NEXT GREAT LAKES TROUGH AND A SHORT WAVE FROM THE NORTHERN ROCKIES 
COME INTO PHASE AND BUILD A TROUGH INTO THE GULF...THEREBY SHUNTING 
THE UPPER RIDGE INTO THE DESERT SOUTHWEST.  NO FRONTAL PASSAGES 
THROUGH NEXT WEDNESDAY...BUT MODELS SHOW A SHORTWAVE HEADED TOWARD 
THE AREA...AND WOULD NOT DOUBT THERE WILL BE SOME WEAK SHORTWAVES 
EMBEDDED IN THIS NWLY FLOW.

HAVE GONE A LITTLE ON THE COOL SIDE OF TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE FOR THE 
FIRST FEW DAYS...UNTIL UPPER TROUGH BUILDS NORTHWARD...THEN NEAR 
GUIDANCE FOR THE REMAINDER.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  77  58  73  58 /  50  40  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  71  55  68  56 /  50  50  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  72  53  67  56 /  50  50  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              60  67  54  63  50 /  40  50  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$


.AVIATION...
VFR CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE MOST OF THE NIGHT BEFORE A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES THE AREA TOMORROW MORNING. INCREASING HIGH AND MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS CAN BE EXPECTED THROUGH THE EVENING...THEN SHOWERS WILL ENTER 
THE AREA AFTER 06Z. WITH LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN PLACE...EXPECT THAT 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE LIGHT AND CIGS/VIS WILL REMAIN VFR DESPITE THE 
RAIN. HOWEVER PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL FOLLOW THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE BETWEEN 12Z AND 16Z. WILL FORECAST OVERCAST MVFR CIGS ALONG 
WITH GUSTY NORTH WINDS BEHIND THE FRONT.

1014 AM EDT WED SEP 14 2011

.DISCUSSION...
SUBSIDENCE UNDER A LOW TO MIDLEVE ANTICYCLONIC CIRCULATION WILL
KEEP SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY THROUGH THE DAY. 1000-850 THICKNESS VALUES
FROM THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING ARE A BIT HIGHER COMPARED TO
YESTERDAY...THOUGH HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING THIS
AFTERNOON...SO TEMPS SHOULD SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN WHAT WE HAD
YESTERDAY. THIS IS IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST...SO NO
UPDATE IS PLANNED.

986 
FXUS64 KMRX 140808
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EDT WED SEP 14 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA WILL
PROVIDE DRY WEATHER FOR TODAY. A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ENTER
THE REGION LATE TODAY BUT WITH THE DRY AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS...
WILL HOLD OFF RAIN CHANCES UNTIL TONIGHT. WILL PROBABLY SEE AN
INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS LATE IN THE DAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT...BUT
STILL EXPECTING ANOTHER WARM DAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES.
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE FOR TODAY
AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN THROUGH THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT REVEAL SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE AMOUNT OF
MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WETTER ECMWF SOLUTION FOR FRIDAY
AND SATURDAY...SINCE THIS SOLUTION HAS BEEN VERIFYING BETTER
LATELY. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA
ON THURSDAY MORNING...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED ALONG AND
AHEAD OF IT. AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP
OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH ISENTROPIC
LIFT STRENGTHENING OVER THE REGION RESULTING IN SOME STRATIFORM
RAIN. A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW THEN DEVELOPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY
SUNDAY...AS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEAST DRIFTS
EASTWARD. MODELS INDICATE THAT SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL
DEVELOP OVER THE REGION BY TUESDAY...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME
ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE
ENSEMBLE MEANS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  63  76  53  72 /  10  40  40  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       86  62  76  53  72 /  10  40  40  30  30

510 
FXUS64 KMRX 140150
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EDT TUE SEP 13 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ATMOSPHERE WILL BE SLOW TO 
TRANSITION FROM PLEASANT DRY REGIME AS A LEADING FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
LIMPS THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY LATER IN THE DAY WEDNESDAY. THE FRONT 
WILL REQUIRE ASSISTANCE FROM A STRONGER SHORT WAVE CURRENTLY OVER 
ONTARIO. THE CANADIAN UPPER TROF WILL AMPLIFY AS IT SWINGS SOUTHEAST 
INTO THE GREAT LAKES. MOISTURE RETURN/CONVERGENCE WILL BE VERY 
LIMITED AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON WEDNESDAY. THEREFORE...KEPT A DRY 
FORECAST IN PLACE DURING THE SHORT TERM AWAITING BETTER LIFT AND 
DEEPER MOISTURE LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. EDGED MIN TEMPS 
CLOSER TO MILDER MET MOS WHICH HAS VERIFIED BETTER IN RECENT DAYS 
WHILE STICKING CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR WEDNESDAY.     


LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS HAVE NOT BEEN 
TOO CONSISTENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD AND MODEL AGREEMENT IS FAIR 
AT BEST FOR THE DETAILS...CONTRIBUTING TO FORECAST CONFIDENCE THAT 
IS BELOW AVERAGE. COLD FRONT FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...SO WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS FOR THOSE 
PERIODS AND WILL MENTION THUNDER...ALTHOUGH CONVECTIVE ENERGY LOOKS 
TO BE UNIMPRESSIVE AT THIS POINT.  GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY AND INVERTED TROUGH THAT AFFECTS THE AREA FOR 
FRIDAY...BUT ENOUGH SUPPORT TO WARRANT SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE 
POPS.  MODELS SHOW SOME MOISTURE HANGING AROUND FOR THE WEEKEND INTO 
MONDAY AND CERTAINLY COULD SEE AN IMPULSE OR TWO BRING SOME 
SHOWERS...BUT GIVEN POOR MODEL AGREEMENT/CONSISTENCY AND 
DIFFICULTIES TIMING ANY SUBTLE FEATURES THAT FAR OUT WILL KEEP 
CURRENT DRY FORECAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  NEXT FRONT MAY BE 
APPROACHING NEXT TUESDAY...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.    


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  90  66  78  58 /   0  10  30  40  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  87  64  76  56 /   0  10  30  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  86  63  75  57 /   0  10  30  40  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              55  85  57  73  54 /   0  10  30  40  20

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING DRY CONDITIONS TODAY AND TONIGHT 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. OUTSIDE OF SOME MORNING FOG AT KTRI...VFR

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT TUE SEP 13 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS... 
WHICH WAS CREATING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS OVER THE 
REGION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
BRING DRY CONDITIONS TODAY AND TONIGHT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A 
COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT... 
BUT IT AND ITS ASSOCIATED CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL BASICALLY TREND CLOSE TO 
A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...SINCE THE AIR MASS IS 
NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE MUCH BEFORE THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLD FRONT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A COLD FRONT ENTERS 
THE REGION ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE 
POPS GOING WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON THURSDAY WHEN THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT ARRIVES. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY NEAR 
SEASONAL FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD. MEX/HPC GUIDANCE LOOKED REASONABLE 
SO DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR.

FXUS64 KMRX 121924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT MON SEP 12 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SOME WEAK INSTABILITY 
PRESENT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. IT APPEARS THE 
ISOLATED CELLS INITIATE ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES BUT STRUGGLE 
OFF THE HIGH TERRAIN. THIS ACTION SHOULD BE COMPLETE BY 00Z TUE SO 
NO POPS MENTION IN THE TONIGHT PERIOD. TROUGH EXITS TONIGHT ALLOWING 
FOR A QUIET PERIOD WITH A SLIGHT RISE IN HEIGHTS ALOFT. SO 
MAINTAINED DRY FORECAST TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AWAITING SLOW 
AMPLIFICATION OF A GREAT LAKES/MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TROUGH. AS THE 
UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY DEEPENS A COLD FRONT WILL SHIFT INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY BY 00Z THU. CONVECTION MAKE TAKE A WHILE TO DEVELOP OUT AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT WITH VERY WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AVAILABLE FOR 
LIFTING. THEREFORE TRIMMED POPS TO WESTERN/NORTHERN SECTIONS FOR 
WEDNESDAY AWAITING BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATER 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND 
CONCERNING TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LARGE UPPER RIDGE 
REMAINS ANCHORED OVER NE MEXICO WITH PROGRESSIVE PATTERN ACROSS 
NOAM. GFS CONTINUES TO DEVELOP CUT OFF LOW OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS 
LATE IN THE PERIOD. WILL IGNORE THIS SOLUTION FOR NOW. COLD FRONT 
LINGERS ALONG S TN RIVER VALLEY ON THU. UPPER TROUGH AXIS REMAINS 
WEST OF MRX CWA INTO FRI. THIS WILL ALLOW CHANCE OF CONVECTION ALONG 
AND NORTH OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO FRI. LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES EAST ACROSS NE U.S. OVER THE WEEKEND. RIDGING EXTENDS THROUGH 
THE APPALACHIANS WITH RELATIVELY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE. TEMPS CLOSE 
TO NORMAL WITH COOL NIGHTS AND WARM DAYS.

871 
FXUS64 KMRX 120649
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT MON SEP 12 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH A WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE CAROLINAS. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING...RESULTING IN 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR MOST OF THE DAY INTO 
TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THAT SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP 
BY THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL MENTION SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION FOR TODAY. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO TONIGHT...WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT 
WINDS ALLOWING FOR SOME PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP AFTER MIDNIGHT... 
MAINLY AROUND THE WATERWAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL BASICALLY TREND 
TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WITH 
MAXES A DEGREE WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AS EXPECTED A COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY LATE TUESDAY AND REACH THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY. UPPER LEVEL WINDS WILL BECOME ZONAL BETWEEN A 
BROAD TROF OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND A RIDGE OVER THE GULF...THUS 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED NOT ONLY WITH THE FRONT BUT ALSO POST FRONTAL. A 
SHORTWAVE WIGGLING THROUGH THE ZONAL FLOW WILL HELP FOCUS BETTER 
RAIN CHANCES FOR LATE THURSDAY/EARLY FRIDAY. DRY BY SATURDAY EXCEPT 
POSSIBLY FOR ISOLATED MTN PRECIP. WARMEST DAYS STILL TUES/WED...THEN 
NOTABLY COOLER DURING THE LATE WEEK.

447 
FXUS64 KMRX 111928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EDT SUN SEP 11 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS
SHIFTING GRADUALLY EAST THIS AFTERNOON...AND CONVECTION IS FORMING
ALONG A WEAK AXIS OF CONVERGENCE AT THE SURFACE ACROSS ERN PARTS OF
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NE INTO SW VA AND W VA. SCATTERED COVERAGE
MAY BE NOTED ALONG AND JUST EAST OF THE AXIS INTO THE EARLY EVENING
HOURS...SO I NUDGED POPS UP JUST A BIT IN THE 00-04Z GRID WITH
AREAL QUALIFIER. KEPT SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AFTER
MIDNIGHT AND COULD SEE SOME PATCHY FOG IN THE VALLEYS AGAIN...WITH
AN INCREASED LIKLIHOOD WHERE ANY RAIN OCCURS TODAY OR TONIGHT.

UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS IS PROGGED BY GENERALLY ALL MODELS TO BE
EAST OF OUR WRN COUNTIES MONDAY...AND THERE APPEARS TO BE LESS
FORCING FOR CONVECTION. I OPTED TO FOLLOW THE FAVORED GFS/ECMWF
MODELS AND KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR HIGHER TERRAINS AREAS BUT
DRY FOR MOST OF THE VALLEY ON MONDAY.

OTHERWISE...W TO NW FLOW ALOFT ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH DRY
FORECAST GOOD. BLENDED A LITTLE CLOSER TO COOLER GFS MOS FOR MINS
WHILE THE MOS MAX TEMPS WERE CLOSE EACH DAY AND FOLLOWED.

 
.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROF BEGINS TO 
AMPLIFY INTO THE EASTERN STATES TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WHILE 
DRAGGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. GRADUALLY INCREASED 
POPS FROM SLIGHT CHANCE WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY SLIDES EAST ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH BEHIND THE SURFACE BOUNDARY. HAD TO MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD FRIDAY AS MODELS 
CONTINUE HINT AT INVERTED TROF FORMATION EXTENDING FROM THE DEEP 
SOUTH NORTH ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE. LOOKS LIKE SOME ISENTROPIC 
LIFTING MAY BE AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME. STAYED WITH THE DRY FORECAST 
FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT BEHIND THIS ACTION WITH RISING 
PRESSURES. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS FIRST COUPLE DAYS 
BUT FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND ADJUSTED FORECAST MAX/MINS A FEW DEGREES 
BELOW SUGGESTED NUMBERS AS COOL CANADIAN AIR INVADES THE EASTERN 
STATES. 


&&

688 
FXUS64 KMRX 110650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT SUN SEP 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH 
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE CAROLINA COAST. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD TODAY...TRIGGERING ISOLATED CONVECTION 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AS THE AIR MASS BECOMES 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST 
MOST EVERYWHERE FOR TODAY...EXCEPT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
WHERE INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL BE A LITTLE HIGHER...SO WILL 
MENTION SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TROF AXIS PASSES TO OUR EAST 
MONDAY ALTHOUGH MODELS SUGGEST LINGERING MOISTURE MAY TOUCH OFF 
ISOLATED ACTIVITY MONDAY. NOT SURE IF IT IS ENOUGH TO WARRANT A 
MENTION EXCEPT THAT IT IS ALREADY IN THE GRIDS SO WILL LEAVE IT 
THERE FOR MONDAY. OTHERWISE DRY MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. 
THE NEXT RAIN CHANCE COMES IN ON WEDNESDAY WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE AND 
A SOMEWHAT ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AS HIGH PRESSURE IN GULF OF MEXICO AND 
LOW PRESSURE GREAT LAKES WILL KEEP MOISTURE TRAVERSING AREA THROUGH 
FRIDAY. ACCORDING TO PREVIOUS RUNS OF DGEX AND ECMWF...THERE IS 
POTENTIAL FOR A SHORTWAVE TO ENTER THE BASE OF THE EASTERN TROUGH 
AND ORGANIZE PRECIP A LITTLE BETTER FOR FRIDAY...ALTHOUGH THE LATEST 
GFS DOESN/T SUPPORT THIS SO MUCH. BUT A DRY SATURDAY SEEMS TO BE 
SHAPING UP. WARMEST TEMPS OF THE WEEK SHOULD BE TUES/WED BEFORE THE 
NEXT COOL DOWN OCCURS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD 
TODAY...TRIGGERING ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. FOR NOW...WILL NOT MENTION ANY THUNDER IN THE TAFS SINCE 
THE PROBABILITY OF OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES IS LOW. CLEAR SKIES 
AND LIGHT WINDS THIS MORNING SHOULD AGAIN LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
FOG AT KTRI AND KTYS...WITH LIFR CEILINGS/VISIBILITIES EXPECTED AT 
KTRI AND IFR CEILINGS/VISIBILITIES EXPECTED AT KTYS (MAINLY DUE TO 
CLIMATOLOGY). OUTSIDE OF THE MORNING FOG...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT 
WINDS ARE EXPECTED AT ALL THREE TAF SITES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
&&

NC...NONE.

MINS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.

SOUTH FRONTAL BOUNDARY. PERHAPS SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE 
AVAILABLE IN THIS AREA. TOO MUCH UNCERTAINTY AT THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST ON SATURDAY TO APPLY PROBABILITY OF PRECIP SO KEPT 
IT DRY. WENT A DEGREE OR TWO LOWER THAN MEX MOS FROM WEDNESDAY 
FORWARD AS COOL CANADIAN AIR INVADES THE EASTERN STATES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT SAT SEP 10 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE 
REMNANT LOW OF TROPICAL SYSTEM 'LEE' CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE PIEDMONT REGION OF 
THE CAROLINAS. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS THAT MOST OF THE MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH LEE WAS LOCATED FURTHER WEST OVER CENTRAL KY AND 
MIDDLE TN...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES DEVELOPING OVER MOST OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THESE CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS 
SHOULD RESULT IN SOME AREAS OF DENSE FOG DEVELOPING THIS MORNING... 
SO WILL MONITOR FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A DENSE FOG ADVISORY TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. MODELS AGREE THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL PATTEN ASSOCIATED WITH 
LEE WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY AMPLIFY AND DRIFT EASTWARD THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH MAY RESULT IN SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU DUE TO SOME WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER 
MIDDLE TN. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS A 
COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...BROAD CLOSED LOW ALOFT WILL 
OPEN UP THIS WEEKEND AND DRIFT EASTWARD. THE TROF AXIS WILL CROSS 
THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS MONDAY MORNING...THUS SOME LOW POPS 
WILL REMAIN IN FCST SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...THEN DRY FOR A COUPLE DAYS. 
ON WEDNESDAY A WEAK FRONT WILL FLIRT WITH E TN AND THE 09/18Z DGEX 
AND LATEST GFS KEEP A LITTLE UNSETTLED WEATHER FOR WED/THURS... 
THOUGH DGEX MOVES THE FRONT/PRECIP TO OUR EAST WITH A SHARPER TROUGH 
PASSAGE THURSDAY. GFS KEEPS UNSETTLED WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY... 
MEANWHILE 09/12Z ECMWF ENDS THE PRECIP CHANCE EARLY ON THURSDAY. 
WILL STICK WITH A DRY FRIDAY FOR NOW.

TEMPS WILL WARM UP OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS WITH WARMEST DAYS TUES/WED.

334 PM EDT FRI SEP 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS
CONTINUE TO SHOW DRY AIR ADVECTING ACROSS THE REGION...BUT SURFACE
TO AROUND 750 MB LEVEL REMAINS QUITE MOIST. THIS HAS RESULTED IN

KEEPING MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW MOS FOR YET ANOTHER DAY.
KMRX RADAR BACK ON LINE AFTER MAINTENANCE SHOWS SPOTTY LIGHT
SHOWERS OVER SW VA...SO I WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE EVENING
POPS FOR SW V/NE TN AREAS...DRY ELSEWHERE.  

THERE IS A FAIRLY HIGH POTENTIAL FOR AT LEAST PATCHY DENSE FOG
OVERNIGHT...IF SKIES PARTIALLY CLEAR. WENT AHEAD AND MENTIONED THIS
IN ALL FORECAST GROUPS. THE CLOUDS AND POSSIBLE FOG DEVELOPMENT DO
NOT FAVOR THE COOL MOS MINS...SO I TRENDED ABOUT 2 TO 4 DEGREES
ABOVE MOS FOR TONIGHT'S MINS.

OTPED TO KEEP SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT MAINLY DRY...WITH
POSSIBLE PATCHY FOG AGAIN SATURDAY NIGHT. MOS HAS BEEN A FEW
DEGREES TOO WARM FOR HIGHS...SO FOLLOWED JKL LEAD AND STAYED BELOW
THE GFS MOS FOR HIGHS BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

TEMPS WARM TO JUST ABOUT CLIMO ON SUNDAY WITH AT LEAST SLIGHT
INSTABILITY...AS MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
TO OUR WEST. NO REASON NOT TO KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS
FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LEANED A LITTLE BIT 
CLOSER TO THE GFS WHICH SHOWS A STRONG UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BUILDING 
SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. AT THE START OF THE PERIOD. KEPT 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION THROUGH MONDAY WHILE 
MAINTAINING THE DRY PERIOD MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS 
DRIER AIR AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN BEHIND THIS FEATURE. TWEAKED 
POPS UP SLIGHTLY FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH GRADUALLY AMPLIFIES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN STATES DRIVING A 
COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE MID SOUTH. FRONTAL MOVEMENT WILL BE 
RATHER SLOW AS ADDITIONAL UPSTREAM ENERGY RIDES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THEREFORE...ADDED SOME SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
A COUPLE MORE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. EXPECTING A NORTHWEST FLOW TO DEVELOP ALOFT ON 
FRIDAY WITH SURFACE RIDGING ENDING ANY CHANCE OF RAIN BY FRIDAY.

A TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE PIEDMONT REGION OF THE CAROLINAS. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER 
THE TN AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS ASSOCIATED WITH THE REMNANTS OF LEE. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE MID-LEVEL INVERSION TRAPPING THIS 
MOISTURE OVER THE REGION WILL WEAKEN BY TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW 
FOR SOME MIXING OUT OF THIS MOISTURE. WITH SOME CLEARING EXPECTED... 
THINK THAT PATCHY FOG WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. WILL PLAN TO LEAVE A MENTION OF ISOLATED SHOWERS 
FOR THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA...SINCE THE NAM AND 
GFS MODELS AGREE THAT SOME LIGHT RAIN MAY DEVELOP IN THESE AREAS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE WHERE SOME 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...REMNANTS OF T.S. LEE STILL 
IN THE PICTURE AT THE START OF THIS PERIOD...THEN FINALLY AN UPPER 
TROUGH ROTATING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES DIGS DEEPLY ENOUGH TO PHASE 
WITH LEE AND GET HIM MOVING BY SUNDAY.  THIS TROUGH THEN SLOWLY 
PASSES THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AND ACTUALLY GETS 
FAIRLY WELL ORGANIZED AS IT PUSHES THROUGH. FOR POPS ON SUNDAY... 
MOISTURE LOOKS TO BE QUESTIONABLE...BUT WILL GO WITH HIGHER NAM MOS 
FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON. TROUGH LOOKS LIKE IT COULD DRAG ITS HEEL 
GETTING OUT OF AREA BY MONDAY...SO LEAVING SOME LIGHT POPS IN FOR 
MONDAY.  KEEPING THINGS DRY MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... 
THEN NEXT SYSTEM COMES ROLLING INTO THE REGION AROUND WEDNESDAY.  
PRESENTLY EXCELLENT AGREEMENT BETWEEN MODELS WITH THE TIMING OF THIS 
SYSTEM.  DEW POINTS SHOULD RETURN BACK INTO THE LOWER TO MID 60S 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT.  DEPENDING ON TIMING...THIS SYSTEM MIGHT 
OFFER SOME SEVERE STORMS IF FRONT HITS DURING MAX HEATING. WILL KEEP 
MINIMAL POPS IN FOR THURSDAY...IN CASE FRONT MOVES SLOWER.

FOR TEMPS...WILL KEEP SUNDAY A LITTLE COOLER THAN GUIDANCE DUE TO 
EXPECTING MORE CLOUD COVER THAN MODELS SUGGEST.  WENT COOLER THAN 
GUIDANCE FOR MINS NEXT THU AND FRI AS GFS LOOKS TO BE OVERLY 
HESITANT TO BUILD IN DRIER AIR.  OBVIOUSLY, HAVE GONE BELOW GUIDANCE 
FOR DEW POINTS IN LAST FEW PERIODS...AFTER FRONT HAS PASSED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   79  56  83  56  83 /  10   0  10  10  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     77  56  81  57  81 /  20  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             77  56  82  56  80 /  20  10  10  10  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    75  55  80  53  78 /  20  20  10  10  30

992 
FXUS64 KMRX 081941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 PM EDT THU SEP 8 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...PESKY REMNANTS OF T.S.
LEE HAVE CONTINUED TO CIRCULATE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE REGION
THIS AFTERNOON...TO REPLACE ANY THAT HAS MIXED OUT. THE RESULT HAS
BEEN PROLONGED MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY SKIES...AND MAX TEMPS THAT
HAVE STRUGGLED TO REACH EVEN THE COOLER MOS HIGHS. 

MOS GUIDANCE TRIES TO ERODE THE LOW CLOUDINESS IN SOME SPOTS
OVERNIGHT...BUT THIS SEEMS TOO OPTIMISTIC TO ME GIVEN THE DEPTH OF
MOISTURE AND CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT. I EXPECT SKIES TO STAY MOSTLY
CLOUDY WHICH WILL HAVE 2 EFFECTS...1) WARMER MIN TEMPS THAN MOS AND
2) INHIBIT ANY SIGNIFICANT/DENSE FOG FROM DEVELOPING. THUS...KEPT
MINS ABOVE THE COOLER GFS MOS AND CLOSER TO NAM. 

DON'T SEE MUCH MORE THAN PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE TONIGHT
...WHICH I WILL COVER WITH A 20 PERCENT POP WITH SRN AREAS DRY.

OTHERWISE...LITTLE CHANGES MADE FOR LATER PERIODS AS CLOSED UPPER
LOW DRIFTS W-SW FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. I DON'T SEE MUCH IF ANY
FORCING FOR SHOWERS BY SATURDAY...WITH LITTLE IF ANY INSTABILITY IN
SPITE OF MAX TEMPS WARMING BACK UP TO CLIMO. THUS...I REMOVED ALL
POPS FOR SATURDAY. TRENDED TOWARD A MOS BLEND ON MINS FRIDAY NIGHT
AND ALSO FOR HIGHS BOTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...STAYED A LITTLE 
CLOSER TO THE GFS AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH FILLS IN BEHIND THE 
SLOWLY DEPARTING UPPER LOW. THUS WITH ADEQUATE MOISTURE AROUND AND 
BROAD SCALE LIFT WITH THE APPROACHING TROUGH...MAINTAINED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY DAYTIME PERIODS. SOME INSTABILITY 
WILL BE PRESENT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION. WAS ABLE TO KEEP 
TUESDAY DRY WITH FORECAST AREA IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS. BY WEDNESDAY TAIL 
END OF TRAILING GREAT LAKES UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL DRAG A COLD 
FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING THE BEST CHANCE FOR A 
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION GOING ON THURSDAY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH FRONTAL 
TIMING WITH POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER WAVE OF LOW PRESSURE RIDING ALONG 
BOUNDARY. TRENDED MAX TEMPS A LITTLE BELOW MEX MOS NUMBERS WHILE 
ADDING A DEGREE OR TWO TO MINS.

CHANCE POPS GOING FOR THE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY TIME FRAME. 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY. A FRONT 
ENTERING THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. WITH ADEQUATE MOISTURE AND LIFT 
EXPECTED...WILL ADD LOW CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

THE SURFACE LOW. LOW CLOUDS WILL BE AROUND MOST OF THE DAY AND INTO 
THE NIGHT WITH ONLY PARTIAL CLEARING. LOW POPS TONIGHT AS SURFACE 
LOW MOVES FARTHER NORTH WITH DRY CONDITIONS EXTREME SOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES STAYING COOL TODAY IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S AND LOWS 
TONIGHT EVEN COOLER THAN THIS MORNING IN THE 50S.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN FOCUS FOR THE
EXTENDED WILL BE UPPER LOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THURSDAY THROUGH
SUNDAY KEEPING A CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON-EVENING
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM. MODELS SHOW AIRMASS DRYING OUT
WITH PWS BLO 1 INCH AND VERY LIMITED CAPES...SO WILL CALL FOR ONLY
LOW POPS.

BY MONDAY...UPPER LOW MOVES EAST AND SHEAR OUT AS ANOTHER UPPER
TROUGH MOVES INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS-GREAT LAKES AREA. AGAIN...PWS
AND INSTABILIY MARGINAL...SO ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS. WILL CALL FOR
DRY CONDITIONS FOR TUESDAY AS SHORT-WAVE MOVES EAST.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPERATURES. DID GO A DEGREE OR SO COOLER
THAN MOS HIGHS GIVEN SATURATED GROUND.

&&
