568 
FXUS64 KMRX 061910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE SEP 6 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE LOW WITH T.S. LEE
REMNANTS WAS LOCATED ACROSS THE SRN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON.
THE MOST PERSISTENT LIGHT RAINS HAVE BEEN ROTATING SOUTHWARD ON THE
BACKSIDE OF THE LOW PRESSURE AREA...ALTHO NEW SHOWERS HAVE ALSO
DEVELOPED OVER THE CENTRAL AND NRN TN VALLEY WHERE SOME BREAKS IN
CLOUD COVER OCCURRED. LIGHT SHOWERS SEEM POSSIBLE GENERALLY
ANYWHERE OVERNIGHT...AS THE REMNANTS LIFT NE. BEST RAIN CHANCES
APPEAR TO BE OVER THE NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES...SO I KEPT POPS AT LOW
END OF LIKELY THERE AND JUST HIGH CHANCE ELSEWHERE. WINDS SHOULD
STAY UP ENOUGH PLUS CLOUD COVER TO KEEP FOG JUST PATCHY OVERNIGHT. 

ANY RAINFALL SHOULD BE LESS THAN 1/10 OF AN INCH PER HOUR...SO I
OPTED TO CANCEL THE FLOOD WATCH WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

LINGERING SCATTERED SHOWERS WEDNESDAY LOOKED ON TRACK...AS DID MIN
AND MAX TEMP GRIDS. DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM SIMILAR MOS TEMPS...
BUT I DID FAVOR THE SLIGHTLY COOLER NAM MOS FOR HIGHS WEDNESDAY.
 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A CLOSED CYCLONIC CIRCULATION WILL BE LINGERING OVER THE OHIO VALLEY 
FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD TO SUNDAY. THE PRESENCE OF 
THIS LOW SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES A BIT BELOW NORMAL WITH BROKEN TO 
OVERCAST CLOUD COVER. HOWEVER THE CHANCES OF PRECIP LOOK LOW...NO 
GREATER THAN A LOW CHANCE...AS A GOOD MOISTURE FEED IS LACKING TO 
OVERCOME MIDLEVEL DRY AIR...AND LIFT IS WEAK. THERE IS SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY UNDER RELATIVELY COOLER MIDLEVEL TEMPS WHICH MAY 
GENERATE SOME ISOLATED DAYTIME SHOWERS FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. POPS 
WILL BE LOWERED THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD. THE LOW TRANSITIONS INTO 
A PROGRESSIVE OPEN WAVE ON SUNDAY...AND DRY NW FLOW DEVELOPS. THIS 
SHOULD LEAD TO MORE SUNSHINE AND SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY.


&&

.DISCUSSION...DRY SLOT ON WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS HAS NEARLY 
ENDED RAINS ACROSS THE BULK OF OUR FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...AND 
WAS LIKELY AIDED BY SOME ESE DOWNSLOPE FLOW EARLIER. SURFACE LOW HAS 
MOVED NE INTO NW GA AND WINDS IN GENERAL HAVE DECREASED...ALTHO 
PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS RATHER TIGHT ACROSS SW VA AND THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REGIONS. BASED ON LATEST OBSERVATION TRENDS...
PLAN TO LET THE WIND ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 15Z.

WATCHING A COUPLE OF RIVERS IN SE TN...WHERE AS MUCH AS 8 TO 12 
INCHES OF RAIN FELL OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS...WITH 2 AREAL FLOOD 
WARNINGS ALSO IN EFFECT FOR SE TN. THE THREAT OF ADDITIONAL FLOODING 
HAS GREATLY DIMINISHED...BUT WILL LET THE FLOOD WATCH CONTINUE FOR 
NOW...WITH THE OPTION TO CANCEL THE WATCH WITH THE AFTERNOON 
PACKAGE.

OTHERWISE...POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WILL BE UPDATED IN LINE WITH 
LATEST RADAR TRENDS...ALTHO MOISTURE SHOULD CONTINUE TO WRAP AROUND 
INTO OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES...AND ALSO NEW DEVELOPMENT IS POSSIBLE 
OVER NE TN AND SW VA WHERE SKIES HAVE BRIEFLY CLEARED. KEPT A 
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS (ISOLATED) WHERE WARMER HIGHS ARE EXPECTED 
IN NE TN AND SW VA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EDT TUE SEP 6 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMNANTS OF LEE CONTINUES TO
SPIN ACROSS NORTHWEST GEORGIA. THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT AROUND
THIS LOW HAS PRODUCED WINDY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...GRADIENTS WEAKENS THIS MORNING...SO
WILL ONLY CONTINUE THROUGH 15Z.

WATER VAPOR SHOWS A DRY SLOT MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHAINS WHICH WILL DIMINISH THE CONCERN FOR ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINS.
ALSO...DEVELOPING SOUTHEASTERLY OVER THE MOUNTAINS WILL INCREASE
THE INFLUENCE OF DOWNSLOPE DRYING INTO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL
VALLEY. AREAL COVERAGE OF SHOWERS WILL DIMINISH THIS MORNING WITH
SKIES BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY AT TIMES BETWEEN MRX AND TRI BY THIS
AFTERNOON. EVEN THOUGH SHOWERS WILL DIMINISH...DECIDED TO KEEP
FLOOD WATCH GOING DUE TO EXPECTED ADDITIONAL RIVER FLOODING
PROBLEMS.

MODEL DO SHOW THE DEFORMATION ZONE OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE COMING
CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE LATER TODAY TO
KEEP POPS LIKELY FOR TODAY.

DUE TO THE EXPECTED BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...HAVE WARMER TEMPERATURES
FOR THE MRX AND TRI AREAS FOR TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE PLATEAU
AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE CLOSER TO DEFORMATION ZONE. ONLY SCATTERED
SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER THE CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS. DUE TO
LIGHT WINDS...SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...AND MOIST GROUND...AREAS OF
FOG IS EXPECTED TOWARD WEDNESDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LEES REMNANT LOW STAYS 
OVER TN AND OH VALLEYS WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY BEFORE MOVING NW 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. EVEN THEN THE FORECAST AREA WILL ON THE EASTERN 
BORDER OF THIS SYSTEM. CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND OCCASIONAL  
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE EXTENDED. BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL 
BE DURING THE HEAT OF THE DAY...DECREASING AT NIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
WILL STAY COOL WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND LOW OVERHEAD. A 
SLOW WARMING TREND BEGINNING THURSDAY BUT CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL 
THROUGH THURSDAY AND THEN NEAR NORMAL FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST. SATURDAY THE UPPER LOW REMNANT OF LEE WILL BE OVER THE MID 
MS VALLEY BUT FINALLY SHIFT EAST AND OPEN UP INTO A TROUGH SUNDAY 
MOVING BACK OVER THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY.

843 PM EDT MON SEP 5 2011

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST IN GOOD SHAPE WITH PLUME OF TROPICAL
MOISTURE STREAMING NORTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING
MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL. ALL TIME RECORD FOR 24 HOURS HAS
ALREADY OCCURRED AT CHA WITH OVER SIX INCHES OF RAIN RECORDED DUE
TO THE COLLISION OF A TROPICAL STORM'S DEEP MOISTURE SUPPLY WITH A
SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY. FLASH FLOOD WATCH CONTINUES WITH AN
ADDITIONAL TWO TO TWO AND HALF INCHES POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WITH AROUND AN INCH
AND A QUARTER TO AN INCH AND THREE QUARTERS ACROSS CENTRAL EAST
TENNESSEE. RAIN SHADOW IS WORKING OUT NICELY ACROSS NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE EVENT RAINFALL TOTALS HAVE
BEEN AROUND ONE TO TWO INCHES THUS FAR. HOWEVER...AMOUNTS WILL BE
INCREASING HERE AS RADAR IS REVEALING A MASS OF MODERATE RAINFALL
EXPANDING ACROSS THIS AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT MON SEP 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH TD LEE CONTINUES TO OVERRUN SURFACE BOUNDARY 
CURRENTLY NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS. THIS 
HAS RESULTED IN IMPRESSIVE RAINFALL AMOUNTS WITH SOME AREAS IN OUR 
SOUTHERN TIER ALREADY EXCEEDING SIX INCHES. ANTICIPATE THIS ACTIVITY 
TO CONTINUE MORE OR LESS UNABATED THROUGH THIS EVENING BEFORE DEEP 
TROPICAL MOISTURE ABRUPTLY CUTS OFF FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST PER 
MODEL TIME HEIGHTS. ANTICIPATE WIDESPREAD MODERATE TO OCCASIONALLY 
HEAVY PRECIP TO DECREASE IN INTENSITY IF NOT COVERAGE AS THIS 
PROCESS UNFOLDS. HAVE CONTINUED CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT AND 
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS TOMORROW. HAVE ALSO CONTINUED FFA AS
CURRENTLY CONFIGURED. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR BLEND OF MAV AND
MET GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...REMNANT LOW OF LEE 
WILL MEANDER ABOUT THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BEFORE PULLING OUT BY 
LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD. THIS WILL CONTINUE THREAT OF SCATTERED 
CONVECTION THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. HAVE GENERALLY MADE ONLY 
MINOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST AS MODELS HAVE GENERALLY 
SETTLED ON THIS SCENARIO.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT MON SEP 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN ACTIVE 24-36 HOURS ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHAINS. ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE FROM THE
REMAINS OF TROPICAL STORM LEE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
COLLIDING WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE LIFT WILL BE ENHANCED BY
THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 80+KT JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. THE
DIRECT CIRCULATION AROUND THIS JET WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTEGENETIC
FORCING ACROSS THE EASTERN-SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

PERSISTENT AREA OF RAIN (MODERATE TO HEAVY) WILL TRAIN NORTHEAST
ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. PWS AT OR ABOVE 2 INCHES WILL BE NEAR
THE 99 PERCENTILE DUE TO THE ABUNDANT TROPICAL MOISTURE. THE
PRECIPITATION POTENTIAL PLACEMENT MAXIMIZES OVER THE EASTERN AND
SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA GIVEN GOOD PRECIPITATION
EFFICIENCY. HPC QPF QUANTITY AND PLACEMENT LOOKS GOOD AND HAVE
FOLLOWED CLOSELY WHICH PLACES 7-8 INCHES OF RAINFALL FOR THE
SOUTHERN-EASTERN AREAS AND 4-5 INCHES FOR THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE VALLEY. LOCALLY HEAVIER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE AS
CENTER OF THE REMAINS OF LEE MOVE ACROSS THE AREA LATE TODAY AND 
OVERNIGHT.

WILL MAINTAIN CURRENT FLASH FLOOD WATCH WITH EXTENSIVE FLASH
FLOODING AND STREAM FLOODING ANTICIPATED BEGINNING LATER TODAY
THROUGH AT LEAST TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE MAIN BAND OF MOISTURE FROM 
TS LEE WILL BE PULLING AWAY FROM THE AREA ON TUESDAY BUT WILL STILL 
BE PROVIDING WIDESPREAD LIGHT TO MODERATE RAINFALL ACROSS THE 
REGION.  BEYOND THAT...THERE CONTINUES TO BE SOME DISCREPANCIES IN 
MODELS BUT OVERALL PATTERN POINTS TO THE REMNANTS OF THE LOW CUTTING 
OFF AND CONTINUING TO MEANDER AROUND THE REGION FOR MOST OF THE 
EXTENDED.  THIS WILL KEEP THE MRX CWA IN AN UNSETTLE PATTERN 
PROVIDING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE AREA BASICALLY 
FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...THOUGH HAVE LEFT ONE DRY 
PERIOD...SATURDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT SUN SEP 4 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR 
CINCINNATI SOUTHWEST TO NEAR MEMPHIS...WITH THE CENTER OF TROPICAL 
STORM LEE OVER SOUTHERN LA. AREA RADARS REVEAL A WIDESPREAD AREA OF 
RAIN WITH SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WHICH 
EXTENDS NORTHEAST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT FROM SOUTHERN LA UP INTO 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT TROPICAL 
MOISTURE FROM LEE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION OVERNIGHT. 

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE MOST PART...BUT HAVE 
ALREADY UPDATED EARLIER THIS EVENING TO TWEAK POPS AND TEMPS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE 
FLOOD WATCH WITH NO CHANGES TO THE EXPECTED RAINFALL AMOUNTS.

650 
FXUS64 KMRX 041848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT SUN SEP 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE 
SOME DIFFERENCES RUN TO RUN AND BETWEEN MODELS...SO CONFIDENCE ON 
THE DETAILS OF PRECIP AMOUNTS AND AXIS OF HEAVIEST PRECIP STILL HAS 
CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY.  NAM SOLUTION OF MOVING THE FRONT THROUGH 
FAIRLY QUICKLY IS AN OUTLIER...SO WILL TREND TOWARD MORE OF AN 
ECMWF/GFS SOLUTION WHICH IS MORE IN LINE WITH THE OFFICIAL "LEE" 
FORECAST.  AT ANY RATE REMNANTS OF LEE FORECAST TO SLOWLY MOVE NORTH 
AND NORTHEAST...AS COLD FRONT PUSHES IN FROM THE NORTHWEST.  THE 
INFLUX OF TROPICAL MOISTURE SHOULD BRING VERY HEAVY RAINS TO THE 
AREA...WITH FLASH FLOODING AND EVENTUALLY RIVER FLOODING POSSIBLE.  
CONFIDENCE FAIRLY HIGH FOR HEAVY RAINS LATER TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE LOWER FOR TUESDAY AS MOST MODELS INDICATE 
HEAVIER RAINS WILL EITHER BE SHIFTED EAST...OR DRIER AIR MAY BE 
WRAPPING IN.  HOWEVER...GIVEN UNCERTAINTY...FOR NOW WILL KEEP FFA IN 
EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AS IT CURRENTLY IS.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY 
WITH ULTIMATE TRACK/FATE OF REMNANT LOW OF TS LEE. WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF THE NAM MODEL...WHICH CLEARS MOST MOISTURE AND LEE 
REMNANTS OUT OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY TUESDAY NIGHT...MOST 
MODELS AND ENSEMBLES DEPICT FEATURE TO REMAIN CUT OFF FROM UPPER 
FLOW AND MEANDER AROUND THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION THROUGH THE 
BALANCE OF THE WORK WEEK AND EVEN INTO NEXT WEEKEND. THUS...HAVE 
ESSENTIALLY DISCOUNTED NAM SOLUTIONS AND CONTINUED CHANCE TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM. TEMPS ALSO IN QUESTION AS 
DEGREE OF CLOUD COVER AND INFILTRATION OF COOLER AIR FROM THE NORTH 
WILL BECOME PREDOMINANT FACTORS. TENDED TO UNDERCUT MAV/MEX GUIDANCE 
TEMPS SLIGHTLY ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE LOW WITH REGARD TO TEMPS.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 040738
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EDT SUN SEP 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. FOR TODAY...MAIN
FORCING WILL REMAIN LOCAL TERRAIN. ENOUGH MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY
TO PRODUCE SCATTERED CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. MAIN CONCERN WILL REMAIN STRONG GUSTY WINDS...FREQUENT
LIGHTNING...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS. FOR TONIGHT...FRONTAL BOUNDARY
WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA WITH MOISTURE FROM REMAINS OF TROPICAL
STORM LEE ENHANCING RAINFALL CONCERN...ESPECIALLY BEGINNING EARLY
MONDAY MORNING. HAVE INCLUDED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WORDING IN
FORECAST WITH FFA BEGINNING AT 12Z TUESDAY.

FOLLOWED THE WARMER NAM MOS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN THREAT THIS EXTENDED 
CONTINUE TO BE THE COLLISION OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WITH THE 
APPROACH OF THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM LEE.  THIS WILL BRING 
WIDESPREAD HEAVY RAIN INTO THE MRX CWA ON MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AND 
HAVE INCREASED POPS FOR THIS.  THERE REMAINS SIGNIFICANT MODEL 
DIFFERENCES...ESPECIALLY FOR LOCATION OF AXIS OF HEAVIEST RAINFALL.  
RAINFALL AMOUNT ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN 3 TO 6 INCH RANGE.  DEPENDING 
ON AMOUNTS AND TIME PERIOD IT FALL THIS COULD GENERATE AREAS OF 
FLASH FLOODING.  WILL ISSUE A FLASH FLOOD WATCH TO COVER THE 
POTENTIAL.  MODELS DIVERGE EVEN FURTHER DURING THE LATER PART OF THE 
EXTENDED.  WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER LOW 
MEANDERS AROUND THE REGION...AND KEEP LOW POPS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY 
THEN DRY SATURDAY AS MODEL CONFIDENCE LOWERS AND THE REMAINING LOW 
WEAKENS OR PULLS AWAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT SAT SEP 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
EARLY ON...BUT BEGIN TO DIVERGE BY SUNDAY AS GFS MUCH QUICKER 
BRINGING MOISTURE/SIGNIFICANT PRECIP INTO THE AREA. CONVECTION THIS 
EVENING EXPECTED TO DISSIPATE...THEN WILL GO DRY REMAINDER OF 
NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACHING SUNDAY...AND 
MOISTURE FROM TS "LEE" WILL BE PULLED UP AHEAD OF APPROACHING 
FRONT.  THIS WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS...AND WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH WILL TWEAK MAX TEMPS UP A BIT FOR 
SUNDAY SINCE THINK GFS IS A BIT QUICK BRINGING PRECIP INTO THE 
AREA.   


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL QUITE A BIT OF 
UNCERTAINTY REGARDING UPCOMING SIGNIFICANT PRECIP EVENT STARTING 
SUNDAY NIGHT AS MODELS CONTINUE TO EXHIBIT POOR RUN-TO-RUN 
CONSISTENCY AND GENERAL DISAGREEMENT ON THE ONSET TIMING...MAXIMUM 
PRECIPITATION AXIS AND EVENT DURATION. THERE IS GENERAL AGREEMENT 
HOWEVER OF EVENT TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF BETWEEN THREE AND FOUR 
INCHES GENERALLY FOR OUR FORECAST AREA WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS 
ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHERN TIER. WILL CONTINUE ESF HIGHLIGHTING 
POTENTIAL EVENT. DUE TO THIS UNCERTAINTY...HAVE NOT MADE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST PACKAGE OTHER THAN 
TO BUMP UP POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AS IT APPEARS WIDESPREAD 
PRECIP WILL OCCUR DURING THESE PERIODS. APPEARS MONDAY PERIOD WILL 
LIKELY EXPERIENCE THE BEST RAINFALL RATES AND ACCUMULATIONS. KEPT 
LAST FEW PERIODS OF LONG TERM DRY FOR NOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED MAV/MEX GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SAT SEP 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL CONTINUE TO WEAKEN TODAY AND TONIGHT.
FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS BECOMING A LITTLE MORE MOIST AND
UNSTABLE FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL CALL FOR WIDELY
SCATTERED-SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN
THEN MOVING INTO THE VALLEY LATE. MORE HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS
STREAMING NORTH FROM TROPICAL STORM LEE...SO GENERALLY A PARTLY
CLOUDY-SUNNY DAY. NEAR RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES POSSIBLE ACROSS THE
TRI-CITY AREA. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN FORECAST CHALLENGE DURING 
THE EXTENDED REMAINS THE POTENTIAL FOR AN APPROACHING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO DRAW IN SIGNIFICANCE MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF 
TROPICAL STORM LEE AS IT MOVES INLAND FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO.  
THESE TWO FEATURES COULD COMBINE TO GENERATE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL 
OVER THE REGION.  HOWEVER...THERE DOES CONTINUE TO BE MODEL 
DIFFERENCES WHICH WILL STRONGLY INFLUENCE THE AXIS OF HEAVY RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS.  HAVE INCREASES POPS A BIT...MAINLY ON MONDAY WHEN CURRENT 
MODELS INDICATE OUR BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP.  HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY 
POPS EITHER SIDE OF MONDAY WITH CHANCE POPS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
AND SLIGHT CHANCE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS THE RESIDUAL UPPER LOW 
MEANDERS AROUND THE REGION.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE FOR 
THE LONG TERM IS POTENTIAL FOR PROLONGED RAIN EVENT DURING THE 
UPCOMING WORK WEEK RESULTING FROM INTERACTION OF APPROACHING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY AND REMNANT MOISTURE FROM TROPICAL STORM LEE CURRENTLY 
MEANDERING AROUND THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. MODELS IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT THE TROPICAL MOISTURE WILL BE CAUGHT UP IN THE 
APPROACHING FRONT/UPPER TROUGH. HOWEVER...THERE REMAIN DIFFERENCES 
IN WHERE THE AXIS OF HEAVIEST PRECIP WILL SET UP. THEREFORE...SOME 
UNCERTAINTY EXISTS WITH TOTAL PRECIP POTENTIAL FOR OUR FORECAST 
AREA. NEVERTHELESS...HAVE SIGNIFICANTLY BUMPED UP POPS FOR EARLY TO 
MIDDLE WORK WEEK. EXPECTED PROLONGED RAIN EVENT LIKELY TO HOLD TEMPS 
DOWN NEXT WEEK TO BELOW CLIMO BEFORE THEY CLIMB BACK TO NEAR CLIMO 
BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM. GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

EARLY IN THE WEEK.  THE QUESTION REMAINS HOW LONG THE REMNANTS OF

TUESDAY BUT CONFIDENCE BECOMES QUITE LOW FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY.  FOR NOW...HAVE OPTED TO NOT CHANGE CURRENT FORECAST AND 
HAVE CONTINUED TO LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR THE END OF THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 311912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT WED AUG 31 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE REGION. WITH JUST SOME MINOR MOISTENING OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE...LOOKS LIKE INSTABILITY/MOISTURE WILL STILL BE LIMITED 
ENOUGH TO KEEP THINGS DRY THROUGH THURSDAY.  WILL GENERALLY GO 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE MAV TEMPS FOR TONIGHT...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT WITH 
HIGHS FOR THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHORT RANGE
ENSEMBLE MODELS KEEP ELONGATED RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE
SOUTHEAST AND TENNESSEE VALLEY WESTWARD TO THE SOUTHWESTERN STATES
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE
CENTERED ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD AND LOW PRESSURE OVER THE NW
GULF HAS SOME POTENTIAL TO BECOME A TROPICAL SYSTEM BY THE WEEKEND.
AS SW FLOW BRINGS IN A MORE MOIST AIRMASS FRIDAY A FEW SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS COULD FORM IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN OF EASTERN TN AND
SW NC AND POSSIBLY INTO SW VA. THIS CONVECTION SHOULD DIE DOWN BY
EARLY EVENING. LOWS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70 WITH
HIGHS SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FROM NEAR 90 TO THE MID 90S AT
LOWER ELEVATIONS. SATURDAY GULF SYSTEM MAY BECOME MORE ORGANIZED
AND TAKE ON TROPICAL CHARACTERISTICS WHILE A LITTLE MORE MOISTURE
SHOULD BRING MORE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM COVERAGE BUT STILL
ISOLATED. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL ALSO BE DROPPING INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY BUT SHOWERS WILL STAY NORTH. FROM SUNDAY ON THE FORECAST
BECOMES MORE UNCLEAR WITH GFS MODEL BRINGING COLD FRONT AND UPPER
TROUGH INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH TROPICAL SYSTEM DEEPENING AND
SPINNING ALONG THE COAST NEAR NEW ORLEANS...THEN COMBINING WITH THE
FRONT AND TROUGH TO CREATE AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF SHOWERS FROM
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY WITH FRONT AND TROPICAL SYSTEM SLOWLY
LIFTING NE THROUGH THE SE AND TN VALLEY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE
ECMWF PUSHES THE TROPICAL SYSTEM WEST INTO TX WHILE THE COLD FRONT
MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WITH HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDING
IN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. FOR NOW DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WILL KEEP
RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED. HIGHS WILL BE MUCH
COOLER AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY NIGHT EARLY MONDAY BUT NIGHTS
WILL STAY WARMER IF CLOUDS LINGER WITH TROPICAL SYSTEM.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 310700
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT WED AUG 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE MAIN STORY WILL BE AN 
EXPANDING RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. A SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH WILL RIDE HARMLESSLY EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY TODAY WITH VERY LITTLE IMPACT OTHER THAN SOME CI AND A BIT OF 
AC. THE RIDGE IN COMBINATION WITH LATE SUMMER INSOLATION WILL KEEP 
THE MINI HEAT WAVE INTACT WITH HIGHS NEARLY TEN DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
AGAIN TODAY. ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT IS IN STORE AS THE MASSIVE RIDGE 
CONTINUES TO SHIFT SLOWLY EAST. STAYED CLOSER TO THE WARMEST MAX 
TEMP GUIDANCE TODAY WHILE ADDING A DEGREE TO THE MILDEST SUGGESTED 
MIN TEMPS TONIGHT AS DEWPOINTS EDGE SLIGHTLY HIGHER.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A STRONG AND DEEP RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVER THE TN VALLEY REGION FOR THURSDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. THIS WILL PROVIDE CONTINUED HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS 
THE AREA...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S EACH DAY. WITH 
VERY DRY SOIL...WILL HAVE TEMPS ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS LOOK QUITE STABLE WITH A WARM MIDLEVEL LAYER THAT 
WILL SUPPRESS CONVECTION THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. SLIGHTLY MORE 
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE ON SATURDAY MAY LEAD TO A FEW ISOLATED 
SHOWERS. MORE ORGANIZED LIFT COMES ON SUNDAY AS THE RIDGE BREAKS 
DOWN AND A TROUGH/FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH 
FROPA EXPECTED ON MONDAY AND COOLER TEMPS ARRIVING ON TUESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 310208
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 PM EDT TUE AUG 30 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...QUIET SHORT TERM WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  WILL SEE DEW POINTS SLOWLY INCREASE THROUGH 
THE PERIOD FOR SLIGHTLY WARMER OVERNIGHT LOWS.  OTHERWISE... 
CONTINUED GENERALLY CLEAR SKIES WITH ANOTHER HOT DAY ON WEDNESDAY.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RISING 500 MB HEIGHTS 
AND LIMITED MOISTURE AT LEAST INTO FRIDAY...DON'T OFFER MUCH HOPE OF 
SIGNIFICANT RAINS. THUS...I OPTED TO KEEP WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT DRY...PLUS SHAVED POPS BACK CONSIDERABLY FOR THURSDAY 
WITH MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NEAR GSP AND RNK. CAN'T SEE MUCH THAN 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH MOST OF 
THE CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY AREAS KEPT DRY.

FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND HAS BECOME MUCH LESS CLEAR...AS SUNDAY'S 
COLD FRONT HAS SLOWED...AND MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY ON HANDLING LOW 
PRESSURE MOVING NORTH FROM THE CENTRAL GULF OF MEXICO. GFS/ECMWF 
BLEND IS PREFERRED OVER NAM/UKMET...WHICH PUSH GULF COAST LOW 
FURTHER NORTH (AND ALSO DEVELOP IT MORE). BASED ON THIS...DECIDED TO 
KEEP POPS BELOW CLIMO/GFSX MOS FOR SATURDAY...AND KEPT LOW TO MID 
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY. BEST CHANCE POPS APPEAR TO BE SUNDAY NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY...WITH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY DRY PER GFS/ECMWF 
SOLUTIONS.

OTHERWISE...30/12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS AND 
30/00Z NUMBERS...SO GENERALLY FOLLOWED WITH VERY MINOR CHANGES.

790 
FXUS64 KMRX 300719
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EDT TUE AUG 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING WILL 
STRENGTHEN AND SHIFT SLIGHTLY EASTWARD THROUGH TODAY. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN A LOW LEVEL E-SE FLOW ACROSS THE SE CONUS...WHICH WILL 
ADVECT ATLANTIC MOISTURE INTO THE TN VALLEY REGION. THUS WE SHOULD 
BEGIN TO SEE RISING DEWPOINTS AND A GREATER CU DEVELOPMENT TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON...BUT WITH A BUILDING MIDLEVEL RIDGE PROVIDING SUBSIDENCE 
ALOFT AND A GOOD CAPPING INVERSION...NO SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED. A 
WEAKNESS IN THE MID/UPPER RIDGE MOVES THROUGH ON THURSDAY AND THE 
CAP IS A BIT WEAKER...BUT MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LIMITED SO WILL 
JUST CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP. HIGH TEMPS WILL BE IN THE MID 80S TO 
LOWER 90S EACH DAY...WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 60S WITH SOME LOWER 
70S THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE PERIOD BEGINS WITH A LARGE RIDGE WHICH COVERS MOST OF
SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE A LITTLE
MORE UNSTABLE HAVING BEEN SUPPLIED WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE DUE TO
INCREASING SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW BEHIND A SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC LOW
LEVEL RIDGE AND EVOLVING WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM. THEREFORE...EXPECT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR
THUNDERSTORM MAINLY ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES BOTH FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. BY SUNDAY AN UPPER TROUGH WILL BE PROGRESSING EAST ACROSS
THE UPPER MIDWEST. THE SYSTEM WILL BE DRAGGING A COLD FRONT TOWARD
THE FORECAST AREA LATER IN THE DAY SUNDAY WITH FROPA SUNDAY NIGHT.
TWEAKED POPS BACK TO LOW CHANCE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND APPLIED THE
MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION SUNDAY NIGHT AS FRONT MAKES ITS
WAY SLOWLY SOUTH AND EAST ACROSS THE REGION. DUE TO MODEL DEPICTION
OF SLOW SYSTEM MOVEMENT AND UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING MAINTAINED THE
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE DAYTIME PERIOD ON MONDAY. STAYED
CLOSE TO NEW MEX MOS MAX GUIDANCE TEMPS SUGGESTED FOR FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY BUT UNDERCUT BY A FEW DEGREES SUNDAY AND MONDAY. ADJUSTED
MINS A LITTLE HIGHER THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD DUE TO
HIGHER DEWPOINT AIRMASS AND GREATER CLOUD COVER EXPECTED WITH
SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPPING SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT MON AUG 29 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... 
AN INCREASINGLY AMPLIFIED MIDLEVEL TROUGH WILL BE CROSSING THE
AREA TODAY. UPSTREAM SOUNDINGS AND SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOW NEAR
SATURATION IN THE 700-500 MB LAYER...WITH A DRY LAYER BELOW. THE
MODELS DEPICT VERY LITTLE LIFT AT ALL WITH THE TROUGH...AND THE LOW
LEVEL FLOW REMAINS DIVERGENT THROUGH THE DAY. SO THE MAIN IMPACT OF
THIS TROUGH WILL BE INCREASING MIDLEVEL CLOUDS...MAINLY ACROSS
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AND MAINLY THIS MORNING. THIS SHOULD
KEEP HIGH TEMPS BACK A COUPLE DEGREES FROM YESTERDAY. THE TROUGH
AXIS IS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS IN THE EVENING...SO WE SHOULD HAVE
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S
IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY. MODELS INDICATING WEAK
SHORTWAVES RIDING OVER THE RIDGE FOR THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
TIME PERIOD. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY LOW
CHANCES. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY ENTERS THE REGION ON SUNDAY. WITH AN
INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND LIFT...WILL CONTINUE THE HIGHER CHANCES
FOR SUNDAY. GENERALLY NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE
ANTICIPATED. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

856 
FXUS64 KMRX 281859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT SUN AUG 28 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...ENOUGH BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE
TO PRODUCE SCATTERED-BROKEN CU ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA
THIS AFTERNOON. BY SUNSET...THE CU WILL DISSIPATE GIVING WAY TO
MOSTLY CLEAR SKY. CLEAR SKY...LIGHT-CALM WINDS DUE TO BUILDING RIDGE...
AND RELATIVELY WARM AREA LAKES-STREAMS WILL ALLOW STEAM FOG TO DEVELOP.
WILL INCLUDE PATCH FOG IN THE FORECAST AREA-WIDE FOR TONIGHT. SOME
OF THE FOG COULD BECOME LOCALLY DENSE.

FOR MONDAY...A WEAKENING SHORT-WAVE WILL DIVE INTO THE EASTERN
TROUGH. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS QUITE DRY WITH PWS AROUND
0.75 INCH OR LESS. MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LACKING...SO WILL ONLY
CALL FOR SCATTERED SPRINKLES ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE
FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER CONCERN IS THE EXPECTED LOW AFTERNOON
RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES WITH SOME LOCATIONS (SUCH AS SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA) DROPPING INTO THE MIDDLE
AND UPPER 20S. HOWEVER...WINDS WILL BE LIGHT...SO NO FIRE WEATHER
STATEMENT NEEDED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WILL THEN MOVE INTO A MILDLY UNSETTLED 
PATTERN AS A SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES TRACK THROUGH THE REGION.  
MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS WILL BE LIMITED BUT EACH IMPULSE COULD 
GENERATE ISOLATED CONVECTION.  ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY THIS WILL 
MEAN BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL MAINLY BE OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND 
HIGHER TERRAIN DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  CONFIDENCE IN DETAILS 
LESSEN BY THE END OF THE WEEK AND WILL HAVE LOW POPS ON FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON AND AGAIN ON SATURDAY.  A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION. 
TEMPS WILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TO FINISH OUT THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT FRI AUG 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
OVER MIDDLE TN WILL SLOWLY PROGRESS EASTWARD OVER THE AREA TONIGHT.  
AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY...ISOLATED EVENING CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN 
QUITE LIMITED WITH BEST CHANCES OVER NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
LOCATIONS.  HURRICANE IRENE MOVING ALONG THE COAST WILL TIGHTEN THE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER THE REGION AND ALLOW WINDS TO INCREASE A BIT 
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY.  BY SATURDAYS AFTERNOON...THE BOUNDARY AND 
IRENE WILL BE PULLING AWAY FROM THE AREA PLACING THE MRX CWA IN A 
QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...ONCE IRENE MOVES THROUGH 
THE NORTHEASTERN U.S...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES WILL 
BUILD EASTWARD. EXPECT A CONTINUATION OF VERY WARM DAYS. EVEN 
SO...LONG RANGE MODELS ARE STRUGGLING TO ACHIEVE CONSENSUS IN OUR 
AREA CONCERNING WHETHER AND HOW DIRTY THE RIDGE WILL BE LOCALLY. GFS 
HOLDS ONTO A WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE THAT PERMITS SOME DAILY QPFS OVER 
E TN AND W NC/VA BEGINNING TUESDAY. MEANWHILE THE 26/00Z ECMWF HAS A 
STRONGER AND DRIER RIDGE UNTIL IT SPLITS AND OPENS A SOUTHERLY FETCH 
NEXT WEEKEND...WHILE THE 26/06Z DGEX SPLITS THE DIFFERENCE WITH A 
PROGRESSIVE BACKDOOR TROUGH THAT BRINGS SOME PRECIP FRI. THUS HAVE 
ADDED AFTERNOON/EARLY EVE SLIGHT CHC POPS INTO THE LATTER PORTION OF 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD OVER THE MOUNTAINOUS AREAS. DRIER SURFACE AIR IN 
THE EARLY EXTENDED PERIOD WILL PROVIDE SOME PLEASANT OVERNIGHT TEMPS 
MON/TUES BEFORE DEWPOINTS BEGIN TO INCREASE AND BRING THE MIN TEMPS 
UP WITH THEM WED ONWARD IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE ISOLATED MOUNTAIN 
CONVECTION.

358 AM EDT FRI AUG 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... BASED ON A DEWPOINT GRADIENT...A

NIGHT...AND WITH THE FRONT IN THE VICINITY ALONG WITH UPPER 60S
DEWPOINTS...AN ISOLATED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM CANNOT BE RULED OUT
DURING THE DAY. DEWPOINTS SHOULD LOWER INTO THE LOW TO MID 60S
TONIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT. WE WILL ALSO SEE SOME ADDITIONAL
SUBSIDENCE AND SOME CIRRUS CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE OUTER FRINGES
OF IRENE. WENT WITH TEMPERATURES ABOVE GUIDANCE AS IT WAS A BIT TOO
COOL YESTERDAY...AND VERY DRY SOIL CONDITIONS WILL HELP BOOST
TEMPERATURES UP. WE SHOULD STAY A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY
WEATHER FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH HURRICANE IRENE EXPECTED
TO TRACK EAST OF OUR AREA. WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE
REGION ON TUESDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT THU AUG 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT IS MOVING ACROSS
THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY. THIS FRONT IS ASSOCIATED WITH SHORT-WAVE
TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST UNITED
STATES. UPPER DYNAMICS FROM THIS TROUGH WILL STAY WELL NORTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA...HOWEVER...FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS EVENING.
MODELS SHOW MARGINAL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY. WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE
POPS NORTH AND SLIGHT POPS SOUTH. BESIDES THE CONVECTION...ANOTHER
HOT DAY IS IN STORE FOR THE AREA.

CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE UNTIL AROUND MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...OTHERWISE
CLEARING. GENERALLY COMPROMISED BETWEEN GFS AND MET MOS NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...EXPECTED TRACK OF
HURRICANE IRENE HAS CHANGED LITTLE OVER PAST 24 HOURS...STILL NO
WEATHER OR WINDY CONDITIONS TO AFFECT OUR REGION IF IRENE STAYS ON
TRACK. SUBSIDENCE ON WRN SIDE OF IRENE WILL INHIBIT ANY
PRECIPITATON...SO KEPT A DRY FORECAST UNTIL THOSE 20 PERCENT POPS
EARLY NEXT WEEK ON TUESDAY. I DID TWEAK MAX AND MIN TEMPS DOWN JUST
A BIT FOR THE WEEKEND SINCE NORTHERLY FLOW IS EXPECTED AS IRENE
MOVES NORTH THROUGH THE NEW ENGLAND STATES. THESE NEW SLIGHTLY
LOWER HIGHS AND LOWS ALSO MESHED BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS
GRIDS...AS WELL AS 25/00Z GFSX MOS.

ALL IN ALL...GRIDS WERE IN GREAT SHAPE AND ANY CHANGES WERE QUITE 
MINOR.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL CONSENSUS TAKES 
IRENE VERY NEAR THE OUTER BANKS AROUND MID DAY SATURDAY. MODELS 
GENERATE A LITTLE QPF OVER THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER TERRAIN BUT 
STILL BELIEVE THIS IS OVERDONE. THE HURRICANE SHOULD HAVE A DECENT 
AREA OF SUBSIDENCE WORKING AGAINST PRECIP DEVELOPMENT EARLY IN THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. A SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
BUILD SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SUNDAY BUT THE RATHER HEALTHY NORTHERLY FLOW...COMPLIMENTS OF 
IRENE...SHOULD STARVE THIS SYSTEM OF NEEDED MOISTURE. THE NEXT SHOT 
AT PRECIP WILL BE ON TUESDAY AS ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROUGH DRIVES 
SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES REGION WITH A SURFACE WAVE RIDING 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. PLACED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION 
WITH THIS SYSTEM. MODELS VARY ON TIMING/STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE SO 
SOME ADJUSTMENT MAY OCCUR IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS. KEPT WEDNESDAY DRY 
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM. DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE 
TEMPS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
156 PM EDT WED AUG 24 2011

.AVIATION...ATMOSPHERE APPEARS TO BE A BIT CAPPED TODAY WITH
LIMITED MOISTURE. A FEW SHOWERS HAVE FORMED ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU
BUT FALL APART AS THEY MOVE OVER THE GREAT VALLEY. THE NEXT SHORT
WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES TONIGHT INTO
THURSDAY. ACCOMPANYING COLD FRONT SHIFTS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE OHIO
VALLEY AROUND 12Z AND BUILDS TOWARD THE TAF SITES LATER IN THE
AFTERNOON. LOOKS LIKE CONVECTION WILL NOT AFFECT THE TERMINALS
UNTIL AFTER 18Z. SHOULD BE VFR FLIGHT THROUGHOUT EXCEPT FOR THE
POSSIBILITY OF A BRIEF PERIOD OF MVFR VSBY REDUCTION IN FOG AROUND
SUNRISE AT TRI.

708 
FXUS64 KMRX 240650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT WED AUG 24 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS 
SLOWLY EASTWARD TODAY ALLOWING SLIGHTLY MORE MOIST RETURN FLOW. 
STILL EXPECTING DRY CONDITIONS TO PREVAIL HOWEVER. WEAK SURFACE 
BOUNDARY APPROACHES LATE TONIGHT. MOISTURE AND LIFT NOT TERRIBLY 
IMPRESSIVE PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS...BUT WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION 
IS POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHERN TIER. FOR TEMPS...MAV AND MET 
GUIDANCE CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE
MUCH FROM MAV VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS SEEM IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT ON SOME MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION FALLING AHEAD OF THE 
UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY. HOWEVER...NOT SURE HOW MUCH 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN OCCURS WITH HIGHEST CHANCE POPS MORE 
JUSTIFIED FOR SW VA AND NE TN AREAS. NUDGED POPS UP JUST A BIT FOR 
THOSE AREAS TO FIT BETTER WITH LOW LIKELY POPS FROM RNK AND RLX. 

THERE IS A CONSISTENT TREND WITH GENERALLY ALL MODELS (PERHAPS LESS 
SO WITH ECMWF) TO TAKE IRENE SLIGHTLY FURTHER EAST EACH MODEL RUN. 
THE OFFICIAL NHC TRACK HAS ALSO SHIFTED IRENE SLIGHTLY MORE EAST 
FROM EARLIER TRACKS. THIS ALL LEADS ME TO PREFER KEEPING FRIDAY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND DRY FOR OUR AREA...NEXT TO GSP AND RNK SLIGHT 
CHANCE OR CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE PERIODS. FLOW SHOULD BE PARALLEL TO 
OUR TERRAIN SO I DON'T FORSEE DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS TO WARM MAX TEMPS 
ABOVE MOS. HOWEVER...DRY AIR IN PLACE PLUS SOME LIKELY SUBSIDENCE ON 
BACK SIDE OF THE TROPICAL SYSTEM SUPPORTS AT LEAST LATEST GFSX MAX 
TEMPS.

OTHERWISE...ECMWF OFFERS LESS AMPLIFIED FLOW MONDAY INTO TUESDAY 
NIGHT BEHIND EXITING TROPICAL IRENE SYSTEM...WHILE GFS SUGGESTS 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH DROPPING SE FROM THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO 
VALLEY REGION. GFS SOLUTION SUPPORTS LOW POPS TUESDAY. I'LL STAY DRY 
FOR NOW AND WAIT FOR MORE MODEL RUNS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             94  69  94  71  94 /  10  10  30  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  91  67  91  69  92 /  10  10  30  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       92  68  90  68  91 /  10  20  30  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              88  61  89  63  88 /  10  20  50  20  10

FXUS64 KMRX 231903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT TUE AUG 23 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
REMAINS IN CONTROL FOR TONIGHT. A WEAK SHORT-WAVE IN NORTHWEST FLOW
ALOFT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY...BUT
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY ARE LIMITED. ALSO...WAVE WILL WEAKEN AS IT
APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA...SO HAVE KEPT FORECAST DRY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS NUMBERS CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOME SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY FORECAST TO AFFECT THE AREA LATE WED NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES IN.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH 
AND WEST ZONES LATE WED NIGHT...THEN CHANCE ALL ZONES THURSDAY.  
STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH THE TRACK OF "IRENE"...ALTHOUGH TREND OF 
THE MODELS AND HURRICANE CENTER FORECAST HAS BEEN TO SHIFT THE TRACK 
A BIT FURTHER EAST.  WITH THIS IN MIND...AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS 
LIKELY THAT THERE WILL BE LITTLE IMPACT ON OUR AREA.  WILL PULL ALL 
MENTION OF PRECIP FROM THE FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND...SO WILL HAVE A 
DRY FORECAST FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

686 
FXUS64 KMRX 231124
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
723 AM EDT TUE AUG 23 2011

.AVIATION...HIGH PRESSURE PLUS DRY WEATHER EQUALS ZERO CLOUDS AND 
EXTREMELY LOW CHANCE OF ANY LATE NIGHT FOG. 

THUS...VFR CONDITIONS ON TAP FOR AT LEAST THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HOURS.

PREVIOUS AFD...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED
OVER THE SRN OHIO RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING IS PROVIDING A DRY AND
PLEASANT AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE
DROPPED OFF INTO THE 50S TO AROUND 60...POSSIBLY 40S IN HIGHER
TERRAIN OF NORTHERN AREAS. BOUNDARY LAYER IS MOST LIKELY TOO DRY
FOR SIGNIFICANT FOG FORMATION THIS MORNING. 

THUS...LITTLE CHANGES REQUIRED TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. THE DRY
AIR SHOULD ALLOW A QUICK RECOVER UP TO THE GFS MOS MAX TEMPS. THE
SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE DOES SHIFT EAST TONIGHT...AND A WEAK
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW MAY DEVELOP ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 
HOWEVER...EXPECT VERY LIGHT AND VARIABLE WINDS TONIGHT WITH DRY AIR
WHICH FAVORS THE COOLER GFS MOS MINS...WHERE ANY SLIGHT DIFFERENCES
WERE NOTED IN MOS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY 
WITH TRACK OF IRENE RESULTS IN LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST FOR THE 
UPCOMING WEEKEND. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHIFT TRACK OF IRENE SLIGHTLY 
EASTWARD WHICH IMPLIES LESS EFFECT FROM THIS FEATURE FOR OUR 
FORECAST AREA. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH TRACK...HAVE NOT MADE TOO 
MANY CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST PACKAGE. HOWEVER...IT'S 
LIKELY THAT THE CURRENT TRACK AS DEPICTED BY GFS WILL HAVE MINIMAL 
IMPACT ON OUR CWA.

OTHERWISE...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHES BY THURSDAY. CONTINUED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY AS MOISTURE APPEARS LIMITED WITH THIS 
FEATURE. BALANCE OF LONG TERM APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             95  64  94  69  94 /   0  10   0  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  61  91  66  91 /   0  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       88  60  92  67  90 /   0  10  10  10  20

851 
FXUS64 KMRX 221857 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT MON AUG 22 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SCATTERED CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA 
SHOULD SCATTER THIS EVENING AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION. 
CLEAR TO MOSTLY SKIES ARE EXPECTED TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. A STABLE AND 
DRY ATMOSPHERE WILL STIFLE ANY CONVECTION TONIGHT AND TUESDAY SO WILL 
KEEP A DRY FORECAST GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS. FOG TONIGHT SHOULD BE 
LIGHT AND ISOLATED SO WILL NOT MENTION IN THE FORECAST. GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED RELATIVELY 
CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT IS NOT 
TOO BAD OVERALL...ALTHOUGH RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY SOMEWHAT 
LACKING...SO FORECAST UNCERTAINTY IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THE LONG 
TERM.  HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION WILL SHIFT EAST EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD...WITH A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY FORECAST TO SAG TOWARD THE 
AREA THURSDAY BEFORE GRADUALLY DISSIPATING.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY EVENING WITH FRONT IN THE 
VICINITY.  FRIDAY SHOULD BE DRY...THEN FORECAST BECOMES COMPLICATED 
DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE TRACK OF HURRICANE IRENE.  MODEL AND 
HURRICANE CENTER FORECASTS HAVE BEEN GENERALLY TRENDING EAST...AND 
AT THIS TIME IT LOOKS LIKE WE MAY SEE LITTLE...IF ANY...PRECIP FROM 
THIS SYSTEM.  WILL GENERALLY DRY FORECAST OUT QUITE A BIT LATTER 
PART OF THE PERIOD...AND FOR NOW WILL JUST KEEP LOW POP IN FOR 
SATURDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE EASTERN MOUNTAINS SAT NIGHT.  DRY MONDAY 
FOR NOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO JUST SOME MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS.

637 
FXUS64 KMRX 221410
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT MON AUG 22 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION PROVIDING A MOSTLY SUNNY SKY WITH NO PRECIPITATION 
EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS ON 
TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT IS SLIPPING INTO 
SW VA AND NRN PLATEAU AT 07-08Z WITH SCATTERED ASSOCIATED CONVECTION 
MOVING SE INTO WRN NC. CLOUDS AND THE CONVECTION WILL BE LONG GONE 
BEFORE DAYBREAK. THUS...REMOVED THE MORNING POPS FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS 
FOR TODAY. DRIER AIR FILTERS IN AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE NORTH...BUT 
MAX TEMPS SHOULD STILL BE MOSTLY 80S TO LOWER 90S IN LINE WITH 
22/00Z MOS.

CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AND I CHOSE TO IGNORE THE FOG SUGGESTED BY BOTH 
NAM AND GFS MOS FOR NOW. N-NE WINDS WILL PROVIDE SOME LIGHT MIXING
PLUS THERE WAS LITTLE WIDESPREAD RAIN AHEAD OF THE FRONT. PLEASANT 
MIN TEMPS IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER
OHIO VALLEY WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA MOSTLY SUNNY WITH DRIER AIR
MASS TUESDAY. HIGHS WILL STILL BE NEAR NORMAL TO ABOVE NORMAL TUESDAY
AND CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO THE
LOWER 60S TUESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE INCREASES LATE WEDNESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF SHORTWAVE FIRST ALONG THE EAST SLOPES OF
THE APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY COLD FRONT MOVES INTO SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY.
THEN FRONT BECOMES STATIONARY ACROSS FORECAST AREA FOR CONTINUED
RAIN CHANCES FRIDAY. AT THE SAME TIME MODELS BRING TROPICAL
SYSTEM...IRENE NORTH TO THE CAROLINAS SATURDAY AND INTO MID
ATLANTIC BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND. INCREASED POPS A LITTLE FOR THE
WEEKEND. TRACK OF IRENE FARTHER EAST THOUGH WILL BRING LESS CLOUDS
AND MOST SHOWER ACTIVITY EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             94  64  90  64  92 /  10   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  60  87  61  90 /  10   0  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT SUN AUG 21 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER SUPPORT....DAY TIME 
HEATING AND FRONTAL CONVERGENCE DID NOT PHASE WELL TODAY. SURFACE 
FRONT A FEW HOURS BEHIND SCHEDULE. CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED ALONG 
FRONT THIS AFTERNOON. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO GET SOME UPPER 
SUPPORT AS IT MOVES SE INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. MOST OF THE ACTIVITY 
WILL BE NORTH OF I-40. FRONT WILL PUSH SOUTH THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY MONDAY MORNING. DRIER AND COOLER AIR WILL BUILD INTO 
THE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE 
NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TO BELOW NORMAL ON MONDAY NIGHT. DRY 
AIRMASS WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD AFTERNOON WARMING MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING 
DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ENTERS THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY. WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE 
POPS GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. A TROPICAL FEATURE TRACKS IN FROM THE  
SOUTH DURING THE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY TIME PERIOD. ECMWF HAS BECOME 
MORE IN LINE WITH GFS FOR THE TRACK. WILL FOLLOW GFS ON ITS TRACK 
AND KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES IN OUR EASTERN ZONES WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT IS 
EXPECTED. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

780 
FXUS64 KMRX 211129
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
730 AM EDT SUN AUG 21 2011

.AVIATION...SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
EAST AT 25 MPH THIS MORNING...AND SHOULD AFFECT AT LEAST TYS AND 
TRI. HOWEVER...THINK THIS INITIAL CONVECTION WILL ONLY PRODUCE A 
BRIEF MVFR PERIOD. STRONGER CONVECTION LATER TODAY INTO THIS EVENING 
COULD LOWER VISBYS/CEILINGS TO MVFR OR LOWER.

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP 
AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT THIS MORNING...MORE IN LINE WITH 
THE GFS MODEL SOLUTION. THIS IS AN ODDITY...SINCE GFS MOS POPS ARE 
LOWER THAN NAM MOS POPS. AIR MASS IS ALREADY SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE AND 
SHOULD FURTHER DESTABILIZE AS TEMPS WARM INTO THE 80S TO LOWER 90S 
LATER TODAY. THUS...I KEPT POPS FOR TODAY IN THE 60-70 PERCENT RANGE.
MAX TEMPS SATURDAY WARMED TO OR JUST ABOVE THE HOTTER MOS 
MAXES...BUT EARLY CONVECTION AND MORE CLOUD COVER SHOULD FAVOR A MOS 
BLEND FOR HIGHS TODAY.

FRONT APPEARS TO HAVE SUFFICIENT PUSH TO MOVE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE 
REGION BEFORE 12Z MONDAY. PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT 
WITH JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS EARLY MONDAY AND IN MOUNTAINS DURING THE AFTERNOON AFTER
PASAGE OF COLD FRONT. HIGHS SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN TODAY. DRIER
AIRMASS MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE AND NW
FLOW SET UP BEHIND FRONT. LOWS SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER MONDAY NIGHT.
TUESDAY MOSTLY SUNNY AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OVER SOUTHERN
APPALCHIANS. SUFACE HIGH SHIFTS EAST TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.
ANOTHER COOLER NIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY INCREASING CLOUDS
WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATE WEDNESDAY AS MOISTURE
INCREASES WITH SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO TN VALLEY. NEW COLD FRONT
EXPECTED TO APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THURSDAY. THE FRONT
MAY THEN BECOME STATIONARY NEAR THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SATURDAY.
AT THE SAME TIME HURRICANE IRENE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE OVER CUBA BY
THURSDAY AND THEN MOVE INTO FLORIDA FRIDAY AND COULD APPROACH THE
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. WINDS COULD INCREASE
SATURDAY BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WILL NOT CHANGE WINDS YET.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT AUG 20 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AIRMASS REMAINS RELATIVELY 
DRY TONIGHT BUT MOISTENS UP RAPIDLY EARLY SUNDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES 
IN FROM THE NW. PWAT VALUES INCREASE TO NEAR 2.00 BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. WIND SHEAR AND LAPSE RATES DO NOT POINT TO SEVERE STORMS. 
SUNDAYS MAX TEMPS MAY BE CHALLENGED BY CLOUD COVER BUT KEPT TEMPS 
NEAR GUIDANCE BLEND. AIRMASS DRIES OUT QUICKLY SUNDAY EVENING AS 
COLD FRONT MOVES SE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN THROUGH MONDAY. POST FRONTAL COOL DOWN APPROACHES NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING 
DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY ENTERS 
THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. A TROPICAL FEATURE APPROACHES THE REGION 
FROM THE SOUTH ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR 
BOTH DAYS WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE EAST WHERE THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE IS EXPECTED. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES

&&

830 
FXUS64 KMRX 201456
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SAT AUG 20 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. ISOLATED AFTERNOON CONVECTION 
POSSIBLE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS AND 
STORMS HAVE DISSIPATED OR MOVED EAST OF THE REGION...AND PATCHY 
AREAS OF FOG SHOULD DEVELOP WHERE RAINS OCCURRED. NOT A CLEAR FOCUS 
FOR TSRA DEVELOPMENT LATER TODAY...OTHER THAN TERRAIN. THUS...KEPT 
MOSTLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EXCEPT FOR LOW CHANCE NEAR RNK AND GSP 
THIS AFTERNOON. MOS HIGHS WERE QUITE CLOSE AND FOLLOWED.

SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TONIGHT LOOK SUFFICIENT AS CONVECTION SHOULD 
DISSIPATE AFTER MIDNIGHT...LIKE PAST FEW NIGHTS. MODELS GENERALLY 
SUPPORT THIS THINKING UNTIL COLD FRONT EASES CLOSER ON SUNDAY. A 
BLEND OF MOS MINS CHOSEN...ALTHO NUMBERS WERE FAIRLY CLOSE.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION WILL 
LIKELY MOVE INTO THE REGION SUNDAY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY COOLER SUNDAY. KEPT POPS AT ABOUT 50 PERCENT 
WITH BETTER CHANCES NE SECTIONS AND LOWER SOUTHERN SECTIONS. FRONT 
MOSTLY THROUGH THE AREA BY MONDAY MORNING. WILL FOLLOW COOLER MET 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS MONDAY ABOUT THE SAME AS SUNDAYS HIGHS. COOLER 
AND DRIER AIR MASS MOVES IN MONDAY BEHIND COLD FRONT. STILL WITH 
MORE SUNSHINE TEMPERATURES ONLY A FEW DEGREES COOLER AND STILL ABOVE 
NORMAL. HIGHER PRESSURE CONTINUES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY 
UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS AGAIN OVER EASTERN STATES WITH UPPER LEVEL 
SYSTEM TRIGGERING MORE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. REPEATED 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL BRING CONTINUED CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH FRIDAY. SATURDAY THERE STILL LOOKS TO BE 
ENOUGH MOISTURE IN THE FORECAST AREA FOR A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             96  72  93  71  94 /  20  20  40  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  93  70  91  69  90 /  20  20  50  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       92  70  91  69  90 /  20  20  50  30  20

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT FRI AUG 19 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL LOSE IDENTITY THROUGH TOMORROW. BETTER 
DEFINED COLD FRONT TAKING SHAPE NW OF THE AREA WILL SLIDE SE INTO 
THE EAST TN VALLEY BY SUNDAY. WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY ALOFT WILL MOVE 
SE THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. ONGOING SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL MOVE 
THROUGH REGION THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS INTO 
THE AREA FROM THE WEST ON SATURDAY. AIRMASS SHOULD BE SOMEWHAT 
CAPPED SO CONVECTION COVERAGE EXPECTED TO BE ISOLATED. PRE-FRONTAL 
CONVECTION LIKELY TO BE WELL ORGANIZED ON SUNDAY AS IT MOVES INTO 
THE AREA. MOS GUIDANCE REMAINS RELATIVELY LOW FOR SUNDAY AND POPS 
MAY HAVE TO BE INCREASED WITH LATER PACKAGES. TEMPERATURES REMAIN A 
FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL AND LEANED TOWARD HIGH END OF GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FRONT ENTERS THE 
REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO MONDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE 
POPS GOING. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON TUESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. THE FRONT MAY LINGER INTO EARLY FRIDAY. BUT 
STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...KEPT FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

150 
FXUS64 KMRX 191437
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1035 AM EDT FRI AUG 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. AFTERNOON 
DESTABILIZATION SHOULD LEAD TO SCATTERED CONVECTION. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME ONGOING CONVECTION LINGERS  
THIS MORNING OVER SE KY AND SW VA WITH MOVEMENT MAINLY EAST AT 
AROUND 20 MPH. HIGHER POPS FOR THOSE AREAS IN THE PRE 12Z GRIDS AND 
THEN CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE AREAS LATER TODAY. MOSTLY ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY THIS MORNING...THEN SLIGHTLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. KEPT POP GRIDS A BIT HIGHER THAN EITHER GFS 
OR NAM MOS POPS...GIVEN EARLY MORNING COVERAGE. 

NAM MODEL HINTS AT A MESOSCALE COMPLEX DROPPING SE ACROSS THE AREA 
TONIGHT...WHICH IS POSSIBLE BUT NOT A CERTAINTY. KEPT CHANCE POPS 
GOING TONIGHT FOR ALL BUT SE TN AND SW NC. MOS MAX TEMPS QUITE CLOSE 
AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. GFS MOS MINS LOOKED A BIT LOW FOR TONIGHT
SO I TRENDED MORE TOWARD A BLEND WITH THE MILDER NAM MOS. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LOWER RAIN CHANCES SATURDAY 
AS RIDGING STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF COLD FRONT WHICH WILL BE MOVING INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY. STILL ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
TEMPERATURES STILL ABOVE NORMAL WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S. 
SUNDAY INCREASING RAIN CHANCES AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO TN VALLEY 
AHEAD OF UPPER TROUGH. ECMWF AND NAM MODELS BRING SYSTEM THROUGH BY 
SUNDAY NIGHT BUT GFS SLOWER SO KEEPING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH MONDAY. DRIER AIR MASS AS UPPER TROUGH AND NW 
FLOW OVER REGION MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. NEXT SYSTEM 
WILL AFFECT THE REGION WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH TROUGH STILL 
OVER THE REGION AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE STAYS CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN 
STATES. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER FROM MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

GENERAL. AFTERNOON CONVECTION TODAY SHOULD FADE THIS EVENING...BUT
LOOKING BACK TO LAST NIGHT...GOOD COVERAGE OF ELEVATED CONVECTION
OCCURRED IN OUR NORTHERN AREAS AND UPSTREAM INTO KY. MODEL SOUNDING
SHOWING THIS POTENTIAL LATE TONIGHT OVER THE NORTHEASTERN 1/2 TO
1/3 OF THE AREA...SO PUTTING IN HIGHER POPS THERE TONIGHT. WEAK
WAVE WASHES THROUGH...WITH WINDS TO SURFACE VEERING...THAT WILL
LESSEN POPS FOR FRIDAY. STAYED VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS
THROUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP THE
HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA WHERE THE
BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT IS EXPECTED. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON
SUNDAY AND LINGERS INTO MONDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR
BOTH DAYS. MODELS DIVERGE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. WITH
STILL MUCH UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...KEPT TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
DRY FOR NOW. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.


&&

1250 PM EDT THU AUG 18 2011

.AVIATION...
ELEVATED STORMS FROM THIS MORNING HAVE JUST ABOUT GIVEN UP...SO NOW
TURNING MORE TO THE DIURNAL REGIME...CUMULUS NOW BUILDING RAPIDLY
IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWED A VERY WEAK CAP OVER
THE PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON. WITH A STEADY NWLY MID-LEVEL FLOW AT
10-15 KT...STORMS THAT DEVELOP OVER THE PLATEAU WOULD SLOWLY MOVE
OUT OVER THE VALLEY. VALLEY AND EASTERN SECTIONS HAVE A STRONGER
CAP...SO THESE STORMS MIGHT STRUGGLE SOMEWHAT...EVEN MORE SO NORTH.
MODEL SUGGESTED THAT SOUTHERN STORMS MIGHT GET A LITTLE STRONGER
THAN AVERAGE...GENERALLY KCHA AREA...BUT SHOULD STILL STAY BELOW
SEVERE THUNDERSTORM CRITERIA. HAVE NOT INTRODUCED TSRA TO
KCHA...DUE TO LIMITED AREAL COVERAGE EXPECTED OVER THE VALLEY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 AM EDT THU AUG 18 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOISTURE CONTINUES TO INCREASE 
ACROSS THE REGION WITH DEW POINTS NOW IN THE 60S.  THIS COMBINED 
WITH A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND A MINOR DISTURBANCE MOVE 
THROUGH...EXPECT TO SEE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOP AND 
MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS REGION THIS AFTERNOON INTO 
TONIGHT.  COVERAGE SHOULD BE MINIMAL AND WILL KEEP POPS AT 20 TO 30 
FOR THE PERIOD.  OTHERWISE...CONTINUED WARM WITH HIGHS ONCE AGAIN 
EXPECTED TO PUSH INTO THE UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S ACROSS VALLEY 
LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY AND AGREEMENT HAS WORSENED SINCE 24 HOURS AGO...SO 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS NOW BELOW AVERAGE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
OVERALL PATTERN KEEPS US IN FAIRLY FLAT BUT STILL NORTHWEST 
FLOW...AND LIKELY TO BE SOME IMPULSES MOVING THROUGH ALTHOUGH 
DETAILS ON TIMING/STRENGTH SOMEWHAT HAZY.  WILL GENERALLY HAVE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EARLY PERIODS EXCEPT NORTH FRIDAY NIGHT WHEN IT 
LOOKS LIKE MORE SIGNIFICANT WAVE MAY BE MOVING THROUGH. 
MODELS...ESPECIALLY GFS...HAVE BACKED OFF IDEA OF MORE SIGNIFICANT 
TROUGHING IN THE EAST WITH FAIRLY STRONG FRONTAL PASSAGE AROUND 
MONDAY.  HOWEVER...STILL SOME MODEL SUPPORT FOR A WEAKER FRONTAL 
PASSAGE AND...GIVEN UNCERTAINTY...FOR NOW WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY FOLLOWED BY DRYING FOR TUE AND WED.  WILL MAKE 
ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT WED AUG 17 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER SWRN US
AND TROUGH OVER EASTER US...SETS US UP FOR AN ACTIVE UPPER LEVEL
FLOW. AT THE LOWER LEVELS...INCREASING SOUTH WINDS SHOULD GET
MOISTURE RETURNING OVERNIGHT AND ON THURSDAY. DEW POINT READINGS
ACROSS THE AREA NOW ARE GENERALLY 55-60...BUT BY THIS TIME THURSDAY
WILL LIKELY BE IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S UP AND DOWN THE VALLEY.
EXPECTING THUNDERSTORMS TO BEGIN DEVELOPING AROUND NOON IN THE
HIGHER TERRAIN...EAST AND WEST. THE WESTERN STORMS SHOULD MOVE OFF
THE PLATEAU DURING THE AFTERNOON...CONSIDERING THE NWLY MID-LEVEL
FLOW OF 15-20 KT. 

WENT ABOUT A DEGREE OR SO BELOW GFS MOS ON THE MAX TEMPS
THURSDAY...THINKING THE ENERGY RELEASE IN THE FORM OF CUMULUS
BUILD-UPS SO EARLY IN THE DAY WILL DISSIPATE HEAT IN THE LOWER
LEVELS...PLUS SHADING OF CLOUDS WILL KEEP THE GROUND SLIGHTLY
COOLER.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED 
WEATHER IN THE OFFING THROUGH THE EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM PER 
MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS AS A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES 
TRANSLATES THROUGH THE PERSISTENT NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. MOST 
SIGNIFICANT EVENT CURRENTLY POISED TO AFFECT THE REGION IN THE LATE 
SUNDAY THROUGH EARLY MONDAY TIME FRAME. CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR 
THE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT PERIODS BEFORE SLOWLY TAPERING POPS ON 
MONDAY. BALANCE OF WORK WEEK APPEARS GENERALLY DRY AT THIS TIME AS 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND EARLY-WEEK FRONT. TEMPS 
SHOULD FALL BACK TO NEAR CLIMO BEHIND FRONTAL PASSAGE. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE. OVERALL...MADE 
ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST PACKAGE.

ITSELF OVER THE REGION SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING 
THROUGH SOMETIME AROUND THE MONDAY TIME FRAME.  WILL GO DRY 
SATURDAY...THEN CHANCE POPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  WILL DRY THINGS OUT 
TUESDAY BEHIND THE FRONT.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK

318 
FXUS64 KMRX 162328
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
727 PM EDT TUE AUG 16 2011

.AVIATION...HIGH CLOUDS FROM MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY CONVECTION WILL 
LIKELY THIN OUT...LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT. AREAS OF 
DENSE FOG THIS MORNING...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER SHOULD BE A BIT DRIER 
TONIGHT. THUS...WILL ONLY FORECAST A BRIEF MVFR PERIOD FOR TRI AND 
TYS BEFORE DAYBREAK. VFR IN GENERAL WITH LIGHT AND VARIABLE WINDS.

OTHERWISE...PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES ARE PARTLY TO MOSTLY 
MOSTLY SUNNY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 70S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NE TO 80S 
ELSEWHERE DURING THE LAST HOUR. DEW POINTS ARE STILL RATHER LOW IN 
THE 50S. FAIR WEATHER CU WILL DISSIPATE DURING THE EVENING WITH 
SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY CLEAR. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN GREAT 
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY WILL KEEP AREA DRY ANOTHER 24 HOURS. IT WILL 
SHIFT SLOWLY EAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

CLOUDS OVER THE MID MS VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON ASSOCIATED WITH A 
SHORTWAVE AND AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT. 
SOME OF THESE CLOUDS WILL MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY BUT SHOULD BE 
MOSTLY HIGH LEVEL AND DISSIPATE AS THEY MOVE EAST INTO THE DRIER AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. LOWS STILL COOL TONIGHT IN MID 50S TO 
LOWER 60S. NAM MODEL TRIES TO BRING IN MOISTURE LATE AFTERNOON 
TOMORROW WITH  SHOWERS DEVELOPING BEFORE 00Z THURSDAY. PREFER SLOWER 
GFS WHICH  KEEPS DEEPER MOISTURE FROM NEXT SYSTEM TO THE WEST OF THE 
AREA UNTIL AT LEAST WEDNESDAY EVENING AHEAD OF COLD FRONT MOVING 
INTO OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY EVEN WARMER WITH MAV TEMPS 
ABOUT RIGHT.     

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
DURING THIS PERIOD THE SEMI-PERMANENT RIDGE OVER THE SWRN US AND 
TROUGH OVER FROM EASTERN CANADA...THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES...AND 
EASTERN SEABOARD CHANGE VERY LITTLE.  THIS KEEPS US ON THE EDGE OF 
AN ACTIVE FLOW WITH A COUPLE OF FRONTAL PASSAGES TO COME...LOOKING 
LIKE FRIDAY MORNING AND AGAIN ON MONDAY.

LOOKS LIKE CHANCES OF RAIN AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SENDS SYSTEMS OVER 
US.  IN GENERAL...BETTER CHANCES WILL BE IN THE NORTHEASTERN AREAS 
VERSUS SOUTHWESTERN AREAS AS SOUTHWESTERN AREAS ARE SLIGHTLY 
PROTECTED BY UPPER RIDGE.

NOT MUCH TWEAKING TO TEMPS...WENT PRETTY COOL FOR MIN FORECAST IN 
LAST PERIOD...SHOULD BE COOLER AIR WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN.

AREA UNTIL AT LEAST WEDNESDAY EVENING AHEAD OF COLD FRONT MOVING 
INTO OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY EVEN WARMER WITH MAV TEMPS 
ABOUT RIGHT.     

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
DURING THIS PERIOD THE SEMI-PERMANENT RIDGE OVER THE SWRN US AND 
TROUGH OVER FROM EASTERN CANADA...THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES...AND 
EASTERN SEABOARD CHANGE VERY LITTLE.  THIS KEEPS US ON THE EDGE OF 
AN ACTIVE FLOW WITH A COUPLE OF FRONTAL PASSAGES TO COME...LOOKING 
LIKE FRIDAY MORNING AND AGAIN ON MONDAY.

LOOKS LIKE CHANCES OF RAIN AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SENDS SYSTEMS OVER 
US.  IN GENERAL...BETTER CHANCES WILL BE IN THE NORTHEASTERN AREAS 
VERSUS SOUTHWESTERN AREAS AS SOUTHWESTERN AREAS ARE SLIGHTLY 
PROTECTED BY UPPER RIDGE.

NOT MUCH TWEAKING TO TEMPS...WENT PRETTY COOL FOR MIN FORECAST IN 
LAST PERIOD...SHOULD BE COOLER AIR WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

600 
FXUS64 KMRX 160115
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT MON AUG 15 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW STILL SPINNING
OVER PA AND THE MID ATLANTIC THIS AFTERNOON WITH CONSIDERABLE LOW
CLOUD COVER ROTATING BACK THROUGH THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. SHOWER ACTIVITY HAS BEEN JUST TO THE NE IN WV AND
WESTERN VA. CHALLENGE FOR TONIGHT WILL BE CLOUD COVER AND LOW
TEMPERATURES. LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE DOES SHOW SOME DECREASE IN
CLOUDS OVER NORTHERN TN AND THE TN VALLEY AS DRIER AIR BEGINS TO
WORK SOUTH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY. EXPECT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE
THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH SKIES BECOMING
MOSTLY CLEAR AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES NE AWAY FROM THE REGION.
EXCEPTION MAY BE IN THE EXTREME NE WHERE CLOUDS COULD LINGER UNTIL
AROUND SUNRISE. TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON RUNNING A FEW DEGREES
COOLER THAN EXPECTED BECAUSE OF COLD AIR ADVECTION AND CLOUD COVER
SOMEWHAT UNUSUAL FOR MID AUGUST. LOWS TONIGHT NEAR DEW POINTS IN
THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S WITH MID 50S HIGHER VALLEYS NE AND
MOUNTAINS. PATCHY FOG POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY AROUND AREA LAKES.
TUESDAY WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER WITH NW FLOW IN DRIER AIR
MASS...NEARLY FULL SUN AND INCREASING THICKNESSES.

&&

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS INDICATE A
SIMILAR SCENARIO IN PUSHING TWO UPPER TROUGHS AND SURFACE COLD
FRONTS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST
PERIOD. FIRST FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO TENNESSEE
VALLEY REGION BETWEEN 12-18Z FRIDAY BY GFS...WHILE ECMWF MODEL IS
SLIGHTLY FASTER WITH ITS SOLUTION. FOR NOW...WILL TREND TOWARD A
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS/ECMWF SOLUTION...AS EXPECT SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND STORMS TO BECOME POSSIBLE TOWARD FRIDAY AM...AS PER THE
GOING FORECAST. WILL KEEP IN CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY...AND SLIGHT
PROBABILITY FOR FRIDAY EVENING. EITHER WAY...THE BOUNDARY SHOULD BE
WEAK...AND DON'T EXPECT MUCH CHANGE...IF AT ALL INVOLVING TEMPS
FOR THE FORECAST AREA AFTER ITS WEAK PASSAGE. 

SECOND BOUNDARY LOOKS TO HAVE BETTER UPPER AIR SUPPORT INVOLVING
THE TROUGH THAT IS EXPECTED TO BUILD SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA ON
MONDAY. WILL INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS FOR FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AND
INTO MONDAY EVENING. WILL KEEP FORECAST TEMPS CLOSE TO GFS NUMBERS
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIODS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  89  63  91  66 /   0   0   0   0  10

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH

TUESDAY. AIRMASS WILL BE QUITE DRY FOR LATE SUMMER WITH PWS BELOW 
0.75 INCH. FOR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...DRY CONDITIONS WILL 
PREVAIL WITH NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

FOR THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING...A WEAK NORTHWEST FLOW 
SHORT-WAVE ALONG WITH A RE-ENFORCING COOL FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. SINCE GULF MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED DUE TO CONTINUED 
RIDGING INTO THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES...WILL CALL FOR ONLY CHANCE 
POPS.  

FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL ONCE 
AGAIN MOVE INTO THE AREA. WILL MAINTAIN MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS INTO 
NEXT WEEKEND.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...REDUCED HIGHS A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW MEX MOS 
HIGHS DUE TO PAST PERFORMANCE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT SUN AUG 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED JUST AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT THAT IS 
LOCATED NEAR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AT THIS TIME. THE FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO BE EAST OF THE AREA SHORTLY AFTER 00Z. THE UPPER TROUGH 
IS SLOW TO MOVE OUT...AND WILL LINGER THROUGH TONIGHT. THIS WILL 
KEEP A SMALL TO SLIGHT CHANCE IN NORTHERN SECTIONS OVERNIGHT...WITH 
PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER AS WELL INTO MONDAY MORNING. DECREASING 
MOISTURE DEPTH AND A LACK OF LIFT BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
SHOULD MEAN A DRY MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABNORMALLY COOL WITH 
HIGHS IN THE 70S NORTH TO MID 80S SOUTH. DEW POINTS IN THE 50S TO 
LOWER 60S AND A WEST WIND AROUND 10-15 MPH WILL MAKE FOR A VERY 
COMFORTABLE DAY FOR MID AUGUST.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER LOW SHIFTS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
WITH SHOWERS ENDING AND SKIES CLEARING. TUESDAYS LOWS COOL FOR MID 
AUGUST IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S REGION WIDE WITH MID 60S AROUND 
CHA. WITH RISING HEIGHTS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY TEMPERATURES WILL 
WARM A FEW DEGREES TO THE UPPER 70S TO NEAR 90 TUESDAY AND MID 80S 
TO LOWER 90S WEDNESDAY. WEDNESDAYS LOWS SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN 
TUESDAY. THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH BEGINS TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY BUT DOES NOT APPROACH THE 
FORECAST AREA UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY. CUT POPS BACK 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH MAIN INCREASE IN MOISTURE THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS NEXT TROUGH BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST LATER SATURDAY 
INTO SUNDAY. KEPT RAIN CHANCES EASTERN SECTIONS SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH RIDGING MOVING IN SUNDAY STILL KEPT IT 
DRY.

THE EVENING...EXPECT MVFR CEILINGS TO RETURN OVERNIGHT AT TRI AND
TYS AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA. MVFR CEILINGS AND NW
WINDS AROUND 10 KTS WILL CONTINUE BEHIND THE FRONT THROUGH MOST OF
MONDAY MORNING...BEFORE SOME CLEARING BEGINS BY NOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

212 
FXUS64 KMRX 141343 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
943 AM EDT SUN AUG 14 2011

.DISCUSSION...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS LOCATED OVER OHIO WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD
FRONT STRETCHING ACROSS CENTRAL KY TO WEST TN THIS MORNING. THE 12Z
REGIONAL SOUNDINGS SHOW PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...WITH A GOOD AMOUNT OF CAPE AVAILABLE. ON THE
OTHER HAND...THE UPPER JET STREAK IS OVER THE AREA THIS
MORNING AND WILL PUSH EASTWARD THROUGH THE DAY...AND INCREASING
DRY AIR ALOFT WILL INHIBIT CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT BY ENTRAINMENT.
LIFT WILL ALSO BE WEAK TODAY WITH NO SIGNIFICANT VORT MAXES NOTED
UPSTREAM IN WV IMAGERY. SO EXPECT THAT CONVECTION WILL BE MAINLY
SCATTERED NORTH TO ISOLATED SOUTH...WHICH IS IN LINE WITH THE
CURRENT FORECAST. TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY DUE TO HIGHLY
VARIABLE CLOUD COVER. WILL LOWER TEMPERATURES A LITTLE AND INCREASE
CLOUD COVER SLIGHTLY BASED ON THE AVAILABLE INSTABILITY AND LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 140737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT SUN AUG 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
AREA TODAY...AS UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DEEPEN.  BEST SUPPORT FOR 
CONVECTION WILL BE NORTH...SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS FAR 
NORTH...WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE FAR SOUTHWEST.  WITH UPPER TROUGH 
LINGERING OVER THE AREA TONIGHT MAY CONTINUE TO SEE SOME 
SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLY EVEN SOME THUNDER...OVER NORTHERN AREAS 
TONIGHT.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS GOING NORTH AND 
CENTRAL.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...ALTHOUGH WILL TRIM A 
FEW DEGREES FROM HIGHS FOR NORTHERN AREAS TODAY.    


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW GRADUALLY SHIFTS 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS MONDAY INTO TUESDAY BUT NOT BEFORE 
ENCOURAGING A FEW MORE SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM OR TWO ACROSS 
AREAS GENERALLY NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40. THE CHANCE FOR RAIN RETREATS 
FARTHER NORTH AND EAST ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS BEFORE 
ENDING. HEIGHTS BUILD TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH DRY WEATHER ALONG 
WITH A WARMING TREND WHICH WILL RESULT IN MAX TEMPS CLOSER TO NORMAL 
AFTER A COOLER START TO THE WORK WEEK. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH WILL 
HAVE MADE PROGRESS INTO THE MIDWEST BY 00Z WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE WILL 
BE ON THE INCREASE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AS THE LOW LEVEL 
FLOW BECOMES SOUTHERLY. MODELS INDICATE POSSIBILITY OF AT LEAST A 
COUPLE SHORT WAVE FEATURES DROPPING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. THEREFORE STAYED WITH AN UNSETTLED PERIOD 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY 
FOR CONVECTION EDGING HIGHER TO CHANCE CATEGORY THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY WHILE DROPPING BACK TO A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. 
TRIED TO KEEP MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA DRY ON SATURDAY WHILE 
AWAITING BETTER CHANCE OF RAIN AROUND THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.


&&

268 
FXUS64 KMRX 140138
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EDT SAT AUG 13 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING 
UPSTREAM AHEAD OF THE FRONT. CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD...WILL LEAVE THE 
LIKELY AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. 
WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL BE INCREASING THROUGH THE EVENING AS AN UPPER
TROUGH NOW OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY WILL SWING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. FALLING 500 MB HEIGHTS AND THE POSITION OF
THE 300 MB JET OVER KY-WV WILL BRING THE BEST LIFT INTO THE AREA
AFTER MIDNIGHT. SO AFTER THIS INITIAL ROUND OF SCATTERED DIURNALLY-
DRIVEN CONVECTION ENDS IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS...EXPECT THAT SHOWERS
WILL REDEVELOP TOWARD MIDNIGHT. THE PASSAGE OF A SURFACE COLD FRONT
LOOKS TO BE DELAYED UNTIL LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. WITH THE
UPPER TROUGH SLOWING DOWN AND LINGERING OVER THE APPALACHIANS...WE
WILL CONTINUE TO SEE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS THROUGH SUNDAY...WITH THE
BEST CHANCES NORTHEAST. BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUD COVER NORTH SHOULD
HOLD TEMPS BACK TO THE 70S AND LOWER 80S...WITH MID TO UPPER 80S
SOUTH WHERE MORE SUN MAY BREAK THROUGH. THE TROUGH AXIS AND THE
SURFACE FRONT MOVE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS SUNDAY NIGHT...LOWERING
POPS BACK TO A LOW/SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH WITH NO POPS SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES SLOWLY EAST MONDAY TO THE EAST COAST BY 
MONDAY EVENING. COLD AIR ALOFT AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY ON THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE TROUGH COMBINED WITH SOME INSTABILITY WILL BE ENOUGH FOR A 
FEW SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH MONDAY 
MORNING AND JUST EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA LATER IN THE DAY. COOLER 
TEMPERATURES ONCE AGAIN MONDAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...ABOUT THE
SAME AS SUNDAY. CLOUD COVER AND A PRECIPITATION ACROSS NE TN AND SW
VA WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES IN THE 70S. MONDAY NIGHT AXIS OF TROUGH
FINALLY REACHES EAST COAST WITH SKIES CLEARING. LOWS ACROSS MOST OF
THE FORECAST AREA 50S MOUNTAINS AND UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S VALLEYS
EXCEPT MID 60S AROUND CHATTANOOGA. RIDGING ALOFT WITH HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN TUESDAY FOR SLOW WARMING TREND. HIGH SHIFTS QUICKLY EAST
WEDNESDAY AS OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIFTS BACK NORTH TOWARD TN VALLEY.
INCREASE IN MOISTURE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WILL BRING BACK
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. NEW TROUGH DIPS SOUTHEAST FROM
GREAT LAKES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY AHEAD MOVING
INTO THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF ANOTHER COLD FRONT. THIS WILL
TRIGGER SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY THEN DRYING
ACROSS WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  88  66  87  65 /  50  30  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  83  65  84  62 /  60  40  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  83  64  83  61 /  60  40  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              66  79  60  81  58 /  70  60  30  30  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
949 AM EDT SAT AUG 13 2011

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS OVER MIDDLE TN THIS MORNING ARE MOVING EAST TOWARD OUR
AREA...BUT WITH THE ENVIRONMENT MORE STABLE IN EAST TN...DO NOT
EXPECT THAT THE COVERAGE OR INTENSITY OF THESE SHOWERS WILL
INCREASE. COMPARING THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING TO RUC SOUNDINGS AT CHA
AND TYS...THE MIDLEVELS ARE WARMER AND DRIER OVER EAST TN. CAPE IS
WEAK THIS AFTERNOON AND SOME CIN REMAINS IN PLACE. EXPECT THAT
PRECIP TODAY WILL BE MAINLY ON THE EASTERN AND WESTERN FRINGES OF
THE CWA. SO THE CURRENT FORECAST OF LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE PLATEAU
AND MOUNTAINS WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE VALLEY LOOKS GOOD.
OBSERVED TEMPS AND THE LATEST MODEL GUIDANCE ARE IN LINE WITH THE
CURRENT FORECAST...SO NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT SAT AUG 13 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL DIG 
IN...AND A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH IN TONIGHT.  INSTABILITY LOOKS 
LIMITED TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE VALLEY...SO WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS VALLEY AND CHANCE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR TODAY.  
BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP COMES TONIGHT AS SHORT WAVE MOVES ACROSS 
AND COLD FRONT PUSHES IN.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS MOST ZONES 
TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY 
FAR.  
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...EASTERN GREAT LAKES UPPER 
TROUGH DIGS SOUTHEAST INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE FIRST PART OF THE DAY. LAPSE 
RATE SHOULD INTENSIFY WITH COLDER AIR BUILDING IN ALOFT WITH THE 
RATHER DEEP UPPER SYSTEM. THIS WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. ADDITIONAL ENERGY BUILDS SOUTH THROUGH 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY SO HELD ONTO 
THE CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM WITH THE SLOWLY EXITING 
COOL/WET PATTERN. MODELS TRY TO BREAK DOWN THE RIDGING FOR MID WEEK 
A BIT BUT HELD ONTO A DRY PERIOD TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WHILE 
AWAITING GRADUAL ADVANCE OF LONG WAVE TROUGH BUILDING EAST ACROSS 
THE NORTH CENTRAL U.S. SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES ARE PROGGED TO 
SWEEP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH EVENTUAL ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER 
SYNOPTIC COLD FRONT LATE IN THE PERIOD. TRIED TO TIME ONE OF THESE 
FEATURES ON THURSDAY BY USING A LOW CHANCE POP. TRIMMED BACK THE 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION TO SLIGHT BY FRIDAY. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO 
THE A BLEND OF MET/MAV NUMBERS SUNDAY AND MONDAY WHILE HOLDING NEAR 
THE NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
