341 
FXUS64 KMRX 130127
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
927 PM EDT FRI AUG 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR INDICATING 
ISOLATED ACTIVITY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS WITH LINGERING WEAK 
INSTABILITY. WILL LEAVE CURRENT LOW POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS AS 
IS...BUT MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)... 
SOMEWHAT ZONAL PATTERN AS UPPER LEVEL HIGH OVER THE SW STATES IS
ALLOWING A SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THIS
TROUGH WILL BE THE NEXT EVENT ON OUR HORIZON. EXPECT A FAIRLY
TRANQUIL NIGHT TONIGHT EXCEPT FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION
MAINLY OVER THE NC MTNS. LIGHT UPSLOPE FLOW OVER UPSTATE SC MAY
HELP SOME CONVECTION LINGER OVER THE NC MTNS TONIGHT. FOR
SATURDAY...THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE AXIS WILL CROSS THE MS RVR AND
SWLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL DEVELOP OVER THE CWA. GFS AND EC MODELS
ARE HOLDING BACK ON THE ONSET OF THIS SYSTEM/S PRECIP TIL LATER IN
THE DAY...SO WE CUT BACK A BIT ON THE POPS FOR SATURDAY...SLGT CHCS
W IN THE AFTN...CHC POPS EAST OVER THE MTNS. MAIN PRECIP WILL OCCUR
SATURDAY NIGHT.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...  
DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT. A LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE SOUTHERN 
GREAT LAKES WITH COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY MORNING. EXPECT 
PRE-FRONTAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO BE INCREASING SATURDAY 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. ORGANIZED STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE IN THE 
WESTERN TN VALLEY EARLY IN THE EVENING BUT EXPECT THE STORMS TO 
WEAKEN AS THEY APPROACH THE PLATEAU LATER SATURDAY NIGHT. 
FORECASTING LOWS ON HIGH SIDE OF GUIDANCE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S WITH 
NEARLY OVERCAST CLOUD COVER. DIGGING TROUGH OVER FORECAST AREA 
SUNDAY WILL ALLOW UPPER LEVELS TO COOL AND KEEP CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REGION SUNDAY. BEST DYNAMICS FOR SEVERE STORMS 
WILL BE EAST OF APPALCHIANS SUNDAY BUT A FEW SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. RAIN CHANCES DECREASE SOUTHEAST 
SECTIONS BUT STILL LIKELY NE. UPPER TROUGH WILL ONLY SLOWLY SHIFT 
EAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE 
POPS. LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER WITH 50S IN THE 
HIGHER MOUNTAINS AND LOW TO MID 60S ELSEWHERE. MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT TEMPERATURES NEAR AVERAGE SOUTHEAST AND BELOW NORMAL NORTHEAST 
AS TROUGH KEEPS CLOUDS AND A FEW SHOWERS AROUND. TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS AS TROUGH MOVES EAST A SLOW 
WARMING TREND. NEW UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES WITH A FRONT APPROACHING FROM 
THE OHIO VALLEY. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY.

BACK TO VFR BY 13Z. A FRONT WILL BE APPROACH THE AREA ON SATURDAY 
RESULTING IN INCREASING PRECIP CHANCES AFTER 18Z.

&&

NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT FRI AUG 12 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)... 
SOMEWHAT ZONAL PATTERN AS UPPER LEVEL HIGH OVER THE SW STATES IS
ALLOWING A SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THIS
TROUGH WILL BE THE NEXT EVENT ON OUR HORIZON. EXPECT A FAIRLY
TRANQUIL NIGHT TONIGHT EXCEPT FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION
MAINLY OVER THE NC MTNS. LIGHT UPSLOPE FLOW OVER UPSTATE SC MAY
HELP SOME CONVECTION LINGER OVER THE NC MTNS TNGHT. FOR
SATURDAY...THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE AXIS WILL CROSS THE MS RVR AND
SWLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL DEVELOP OVER THE CWA. GFS AND EC MODELS
ARE HOLDING BACK ON THE ONSET OF THIS SYSTEM/S PRECIP TIL LATER IN
THE DAY...SO WE CUT BACK A BIT ON THE POPS FOR SATURDAY...SLGT CHCS
W IN THE AFTN...CHC POPS EAST OVER THE MTNS. MAIN PRECIP WILL OCCUR
SATURDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...  
DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT. A LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE SOUTHERN 
GREAT LAKES WITH COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY MORNING. EXPECT 
PRE-FRONTAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO BE INCREASING SATURDAY 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. ORGANIZED STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE IN THE 
WESTERN TN VALLEY EARLY IN THE EVENING BUT EXPECT THE STORMS TO 
WEAKEN AS THEY APPROACH THE PLATEAU LATER SATURDAY NIGHT. 
FORECASTING LOWS ON HIGH SIDE OF GUIDANCE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S WITH 
NEARLY OVERCAST CLOUD COVER. DIGGING TROUGH OVER FORECAST AREA 
SUNDAY WILL ALLOW UPPER LEVELS TO COOL AND KEEP CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REGION SUNDAY. BEST DYNAMICS FOR SEVERE STORMS 
WILL BE EAST OF APPALCHIANS SUNDAY BUT A FEW SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. RAIN CHANCES DECREASE SOUTHEAST 
SECTIONS BUT STILL LIKELY NE. UPPER TROUGH WILL ONLY SLOWLY SHIFT 
EAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE 
POPS. LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER WITH 50S IN THE 
HIGHER MOUNTAINS AND LOW TO MID 60S ELSEWHERE. MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT TEMPERATURES NEAR AVERAGE SOUTHEAST AND BELOW NORMAL NORTHEAST 
AS TROUGH KEEPS CLOUDS AND A FEW SHOWERS AROUND. TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS AS TROUGH MOVES EAST A SLOW 
WARMING TREND. NEW UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES WITH A FRONT APPROACHING FROM 
THE OHIO VALLEY. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 120744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT FRI AUG 12 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
NORTH WILL SHIFT EAST DURING THE PERIOD. DEW POINTS WILL BE 
RELATIVELY LOW AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...AND INSTABILITY LOOKS 
LIMITED.  LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL START TO TURN MORE TO THE EAST AND 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE MOUNTAINS...AND LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE FOR ANY 
CONVECTION WILL BE THERE.  WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  WILL GENERALLY 
GO WITH MAV MAX TEMPS...THEN SOME SLIGHT UPWARD ADJUSTMENT TO MAV 
LOWS TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH STRENGTHENS AS 
IT SHIFTS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION. 
SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE DRIVES TOWARD THE BASE OF THE TROUGH RIPPING 
THROUGH THE MIDWEST ENHANCING LIFT ACROSS A BROAD REGION. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM ALLOWING FOR INCREASING 
INSTABILITY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAY 
BREAK OUT WELL AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM ON 
SATURDAY BUT THE BETTER CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE SATURDAY NIGHT AS 
THE DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE UPPER 
MIDWEST. TWEAKED POPS UP INTO THE LIKELY CATEGORY SATURDAY NIGHT FOR 
THE DYNAMIC SYSTEM. THE UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DEEPEN ON SUNDAY 
WITH A CLOSED LOW MOVING VERY SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY AS SEVERAL SHORT WAVES ROTATE SOUTHEAST AROUND THE LOW AND 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RAISED POPS TO LIKELY FOR 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR SUNDAY IN THIS 
PATTERN AS CONVECTION FORMS AS COLDER AIR ALOFT BUILDS IN OVER THE 
TOP OF THE RELATIVELY WARM SURFACE AIRMASS. SEVERAL MORE WAVES DROP 
SOUTH AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER TROUGH DURING THE PERIOD 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND TRIED TO BROADBRUSH LOWER CHANCE POPS 
FOR SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM WITH EMPHASIS ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE CLOSER TO THE BETTER UPPER LEVEL 
DYNAMICS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION. HEIGHTS BUILD WITH DRY ADVECTION 
DURING THE PERIOD FROM TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...ANOTHER 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY INTO THE EASTERN STATES BY 
THE END OF THE LONG TERM. TIMING IS AN ISSUE SO FAR OUT IN THE 
FORECAST SO JUST MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION HERE. 
STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE BLEND THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND WHILE UNDERCUTTING MEX MOS MAX TEMPS A BIT FOR MUCH OF THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD DUE TO UNSEASONABLY STRONG EASTERN STATES 
UPPER TROUGH.

560 
FXUS64 KMRX 120246
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 PM EDT THU AUG 11 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER OH/WV/PA TONIGHT AND 
TOMORROW...AND EXTEND SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. SURFACE 
DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY LOW...MAINLY IN THE UPPER 50S TO 
LOWER 60S. HIGH CLOUDS ACROSS THE SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON WILL CLEAR 
OUT AND ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP TO UPPER 50S/AROUND 60 NORTH AND 
MID-UPPER 60S SOUTH. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES DROP TO AROUND 1 INCH 
TOMORROW IN A DRY W-NW FLOW IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS. THE SURFACE 
TO 850 MB FLOW WILL BE FROM THE EAST AS A WEAK LOW SITS OVER SE 
GA...AND THIS MAY LEAD TO ISOLATED SHOWERS DEVELOPING IN SW NC IN 
THE AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THAT AREA...WITH THE 
REST OF THE CWA REMAINING DRY. FULL SUN HIGHS SHOULD BE REACHED...IN 
THE MID-UPPER 80S NORTH AND LOWER-MID 90S SOUTH. 

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
MOISTURE WILL BE HIGHER ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS FRIDAY
EVENING WITH WEAK LOW OVER GA BUT THINK BY 00Z ISOLATED SHOWERS
ALREADY DISSIPATING SO NO POPS. LATER FRIDAY NIGHT UPPER TROUGH
MOVES INTO LOWER MS VALLEY AND LOWER TN VALLEY. SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE AND COLD FRONT MOVING
INTO MS VALLEY MAY REACH SOUTHERN PLATEAU BY MORNING SO ADDED
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE. SATURDAY THE TROUGH DEEPENS MORE AS IT
MOVES EAST WITH SURFACE LOW MOVING INTO OHIO VALLEY AND COLD FRONT
MOVING ACROSS THE TN VALLEY OVERNIGHT. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR IN THE AFTERNOON AND THEN OVERNIGHT. SOME
STORMS COULD BE STRONG TO SEVERE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
SUNDAY THERE COULD BE A BREAK EARLY BUT DEEP UPPER TROUGH BEHIND
THE FRONT WILL CREATE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS BEHIND THE FRONT...MORE NUMEROUS NORTHEAST HALF BY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. RIGHT NOW HAVE HIGHS UPPER 70S TO UPPER 80S
SUNDAY BUT MAY BE EVEN COOLER DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER AND AMOUNT
OF RAINFALL. SHOWERS WILL END FROM SW TO NE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY
WITH MUCH COOLER LOWS AND HIGHS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. TUESDAY
BEGINS A WARMING TREND WITH HIGH PRESSURE BEGINNING TO SHIFT EAST.
MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE THURSDAY SO ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EDT THU AUG 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR SHOWING A FEW SHOWERS
TRACKING MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA ASSOCIATED
WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL CONTINUE THE
20-30 PERCENT POPS FOR TODAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE SOUTH
NEARER THE BOUNDARY. CLOUDS EXPECTED TODAY SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES
A BIT COOLER THAN WEDNESDAY SO STAYED NEAR THE BLEND TEMPERATURES
FOR TODAY. THE DISTURBANCE EXITS THE REGION TONIGHT SO KEEP LOW
POPS FOR JUST THE EVENING HOURS. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT
LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN STORY BEING THE UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
DURING THE WEEKEND. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS INDICATE THAT AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO AMPLIFY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
ON SATURDAY...WHICH SHOULD TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS UPPER TROUGH FURTHER AMPLIFIES OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...PUSHING A COLD FRONT THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA EARLY ON SUNDAY MORNING. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL 
STILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH MONDAY...AS THIS HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH LAGS BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. TEMPS COULD ACTUALLY FALL 
TO SLIGHTLY BELOW-NORMAL LEVELS BY MONDAY (FIRST HINT OF FALL?)... 
WITH A NOTICEABLY DRIER AIR MASS MOVING INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION ON 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE COOLER TEMPS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS AND THE GFS NUMBERS HAVE HAD A WARM BIAS LATELY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

CONTINUE TO TRACK EAST AND CROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA
OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING...AND BRING
BROKEN TO OVERCAST HIGH TO MIDLEVEL CLOUDS. THE CLOUDS SHOULD HELP
KEEP TEMPS UP...ALONG WITH SOME LIGHT MIXING FROM WINDS NEAR THE
SURFACE TROUGH. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH TOMORROW
BEHIND THE TROUGH...SUPPLYING MORE STABLE AIR...ESPECIALLY IN
NORTHERN SECTIONS. WILL HAVE NORTHERN SECTIONS DRY WITH JUST A
SLIGHT CHANCE POP CENTRAL AND LOW CHANCE SOUTH.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A FEW RESIDUAL SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS MAY LINGER THROUGH THURSDAY
EVENING. OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY. A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY
NIGHT. WITH AN 850MB JET ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT AND A WEAK TO
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA...SHOULD SEE
AN ORGANIZED LINE OF CONVECTION DEVELOP AND TRACK THROUGH THE AREA.
ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW MOVING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON SUNDAY AND
COULD KEEP SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF
THE WEEKEND. BEHIND THE FRONT...COOLER...DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN FOR
THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  92  68  93  70 /  20  30  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  88  65  89  67 /  20  20  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  88  65  89  67 /  20  20  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              64  86  60  86  62 /  20  10  10  10  20

228 
FXUS64 KMRX 100740
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED AUG 10 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION
WILL PROVIDE A WARM AND DRY TODAY. A TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO TRACK
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. BUT MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD UNTIL
AFTER MIDNIGHT. STAYED NEAR THE MET/MAV BLEND NUMBERS FOR
TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN STORY BEING THE UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
DURING THE WEEKEND. A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED 
TO BE LOCATED OVER THE DEEP SOUTH ON THURSDAY...WITH A MESOSCALE 
CONVECTIVE SYSTEM FROM THE OZARKS REGION MOVING EAST ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE INCONSISTENT WITH THE EXACT PLACEMENT AND 
TRACK OF THIS MCS (WHICH IS USUALLY THE CASE WITH THESE SYSTEMS)... 
SO WILL KEEP ONLY LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR THURSDAY. BOTH 
THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS INDICATE THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
BEGIN TO AMPLIFY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WHICH 
SHOULD TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
UPPER TROUGH FURTHER AMPLIFIES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...PUSHING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
EARLY ON SUNDAY. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH 
MONDAY AS THIS HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH LAGS BEHIND THE 
COLD FRONT. TEMPS COULD ACTUALLY FALL TO BELOW-NORMAL LEVELS BY 
MONDAY (FIRST HINT OF FALL?)...WITH A NOTICEABLY DRIER AIR MASS 
MOVING INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...SINCE THE GFS GUIDANCE HAS HAD A WARM BIAS LATELY AND 
COOLER TEMPS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE AUG 9 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...APPARENTLY WARM AIR JUST ABOVE

FORECAST AREA WITH A NICE SOLID MID DECK WILL CONTINUE EAST WITH 
BACK EDGE NEAR THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS AROUND 00Z WEDNESDAY. 
PLACED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM IN THE HIGH 
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER THIS EVENING AS FRONT SHIFTS 
EAST. DRIER AIR SPILLING IN BEHIND FRONTAL BOUNDARY CURRENTLY 
PRESSING ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY. THE DRY ADVECTION CONTINUES ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH A WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPPING INTO THE AREA. 
STAYED RATHER CLOSE TO GUIDANCE MINS TONIGHT AND MAXES ON 
WEDNESDAY.  

&&

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FIRST IN A SERIES 
OF BOUNDARIES WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z 
THURSDAY. WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WESTERN AND 
NORTHWEST PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY 
THURSDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPECTED PROXIMITY OF WIDELY SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND/OR THUNDERSTORMS. WILL FURTHER INCREASE PRECIP CHANCES 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON THURSDAY FOR THE FORECAST AREA AS 
PER TRENDING FROM GFS/NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND EXPECTED INCREASE 
IN MOISTURE/INSTABILITY ACROSS THE AREA. WILL ONLY UP POPS SLIGHTLY 
INTO HIGHER CHANCE CATEGORY AT THIS TIME. 

UPPER TROUGH IN UPPER MIDWEST WILL ALLOW FOR VORT MAX AT 500
MILLIBARS AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONT TO MOVE SOUTHEAST IN
NORTHWEST FLOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY. HAVE UPPED POPS
SLIGHTLY AT THIS TIME INTO HIGHER CHANCE CATEGORY TO ACCOUNT FOR
CONTINUED MODEL AGREEMENT TO THIS SOLUTION. 

THE TIMING OF THE NEXT NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT MAY BE TRICKIER THAN
THE INITIAL TWO SYSTEMS. MODELS ARE NOT AS CLEAR CUT INVOLVING THE
THIRD EXPECTED NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE
PRECIP PROBABILITIES FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY TO ACCOUNT
FOR THIS FRONT. PROGRESSIVE UPPER FLOW SHOULD CONTINUE INTO NEXT
WEEK.

105 
FXUS64 KMRX 090709
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT TUE AUG 9 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID WEST...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE TOWARDS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY... 
TRIGGERING SCATTERED CONVECTION AHEAD OF IT. AREA RADARS ALREADY 
REVEAL SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING...ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. ALL OF THE 
MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF ON THEIR AMOUNT OF CONVECTIVE COVERAGE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY...WHICH SEEMS ODD CONSIDERING THAT A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON 
AHEAD OF AN ADVANCING COLD FRONT. SINCE THE MODELS ALL AGREE THAT 
CONVECTION WILL BE MORE SPARSE TODAY...DO NOT FEEL COMFORTABLE WITH 
MENTIONING LIKELY POPS FOR TODAY...BUT WILL KEEP POPS IN THE UPPER 
RANGES OF THE SCATTERED WORDING CATEGORY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL AN 
INVERTED-V PROFILE IN THE LOWER LEVELS FOR THIS AFTERNOON...ALONG 
WITH A DECENT MID LEVEL LAYER OF DRY AIR. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT 
CONDITIONS WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR PRODUCING DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS 
WITH THE CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE INITIAL COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNSET...BUT A 
SECONDARY COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY AFTER MIDNIGHT. THUS...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST 
THROUGH TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND TOWARDS A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL LEAN CLOSER TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS WITH 
LESS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY AND MORE SUNSHINE POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING DRY 
WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY. A SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE...WILL ADD ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. DRY WEATHER 
SHOULD RETURN BY FRIDAY. MODELS INDICATING A FRONT TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA ON SATURDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS FOR 
SATURDAY. A TROUGH PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY SO WILL KEEP 
THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SUNDAY AS WELL. DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED TO 
RETURN BY MONDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   91  69  92  68  91 /  50  30  10  10  20

908 PM EDT MON AUG 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...ORGANIZED CONVECTION ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF TO TWO
THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING HAS
NOW MOVED DISSIPATED OR MOSTLY MOVED OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA.

RAIN THAT OCCURRED TODAY. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE YET THIS

SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING INTO THE MS VALLEY NEAR MEMPHIS EXTENDS
EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY. GRADUALLY INCREASE POPS TO 50 PERCENT BY
12Z WITH LIKELY AFTER THAT TIME.

INDICATE BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATER TONIGHT 
AS THE MIDWEST CONVECTIVE COMPLEX SHIFTS STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH. PLACED THE HIGHEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION ON TUESDAY WITH 
THE MAIN BODY OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. RAISED POPS TO LIKELY FOR THIS EVENT. NOT ENTIRELY 
SURE THAT THERE WILL BE WIDESPREAD SEVERE CONVECTION WITH THIS EVENT 
AS MORNING TIMING WOULD LIKELY LIMIT INSTABILITY. CONCERNING 
TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE WENT A LITTLE ABOVE THE MILDEST SUGGESTED MINS 
WHILE OPTING FOR THE COOLEST MOS MAXES DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP ON TUESDAY.

&&

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS REMAIN FAIRLY
CONSISTENT IN DEPICTING FIRST OF TWO FRONTAL BOUNDARIES IN THE
FORECAST PERIOD MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN 06-12Z
WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH LOWER CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
ACROSS NORTHERN COUNTIES AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/TRI CITIES AREA
OVERNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY AM. WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGHER
CHANCE POPS FOR REST OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. 

THE FRONT IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE WITH A SOUTH/SOUTHEAST MOVEMENT ON
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL CONTINUE WITH SCENARIO OF
KEEPING AREA DRY THROUGH FRIDAY...WITH DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW
EXPECTED. 

AS UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS EAST BY SATURDAY...FORECAST AREA SHOULD BE IN
INCREASING SOUTHWEST FLOW AND INCREASE OF LOW-MID LEVEL MOISTURE AS
PER GFS FORECAST SOUNDINGS. WILL CONTINUE WITH AT LEAST CHANCE POPS
FOR THE AREA...AS NEXT COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO
AND INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BY BETWEEN 00Z-12Z SUNDAY. WILL
UP POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO CHANCE CATEGORY FOR
FORECAST AREA DUE TO EXPECTED TIMING OF FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST
THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND EXPECTED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
INCREASE.

UPPER TROUGH AND HIGH PRESSURE AT SURFACE WILL BUILD INTO THE
REGION BY SUNDAY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE REMAINING IN CONTROL OF
TENNESSEE VALLEY WEATHER THROUGH MONDAY.

272 
FXUS64 KMRX 080804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON AUG 8 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SEVERAL CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS 
MORNING...BUT THE MAIN STORY TODAY SHOULD BE THE MESOSCALE 
CONVECTIVE SYSTEM EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS MCS IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS...WITHIN THE NORTHWESTERLY UPPER- 
LEVEL FLOW OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS INDICATE THAT A 
MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL BE IN PLACE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO THINK THERE WILL BE A BETTER POTENTIAL 
FOR SEVERE WEATHER THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS. THE MAIN THREATS APPEAR TO 
BE DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
CONTINUE TO TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...SINCE TEMPS WILL BE VERY 
DIFFICULT TO PREDICT DUE TO THE DIFFERENT POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE TIMING.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON 
AMPLIFICATION OF WAVE PATTERN OVER THE U.S.  BY THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD TUESDAY MORNING...THE AMPLIFICATION HAS ALREADY STARTED... 
WITH THE UPPER RIDGE DRIFTING WWD...AND THE GREAT LAKES TROUGH 
STRENGTHENING.

TWO FRONTAL SYSTEMS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA...THE FIRST ONE LOOKS 
TO PASS TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH THE SECOND FRONT PASSING AROUND 
SATURDAY OR SUNDAY.  BOTH FRONTS PUSH WELL THROUGH THE AREA AND 
ALLOW DRIER AIR TO FILL INTO THE AREA FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS.  BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...THE FIRST FRONT HAS SETTLED TO NEAR GULF 
COAST...AND SURFACE RIDGE STILL IS HOLDING LOCALLY INTO FRIDAY 
EVENING...BUT AROUND SATURDAY THE RETURN FLOW STARTS GETTING BACK 
INTO THE AREA...AND WITH THE FRONT APPROACHING MOISTURE RETURNS 
ALONG WITH A PRETTY GOOD CHANCE OF STORMS.  SEVERITY OF STORMS WILL 
BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT UPON WHAT TIME THE STORMS WILL FORM AND FRONTAL 
PLACEMENT.  TUESDAY'S STORMS ARE LIKELY TO FORM WELL AHEAD OF 
FRONT...SIMPLY FROM DIRUNAL HEATING OF THE INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS. BY THE TIME THE FRONT ARRIVES IT MAY NOT HAVE MUCH INSTABILITY 
ALONG IT.

FOR TEMPERATURES...GENERALLY WENT AT OR BELOW GUIDANCE VALUES...MORE 
BELOW ON MINS...THINKING THAT POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS WILL COOL DOWN 
MORE THAN MODELS ARE FORECASTING.
&&

SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. MODELS SUGGEST A SHORTWAVE TROUGH BY
TUESDAY...WHICH COULD WARRANT HIGHER CHANCE OR LIKELY POPS. I CHOSE
TO WAIT ANOTHER RUN OR SO...BEFORE GOING HIGHER THAN PREVIOUS 40
PERCENT POPS. 

SOME MINOR DIFFERENCES IN MOS FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH GFS
MINS REASONABLE AND A BLEND OF MOS FOR MAXES EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH 
BUILDS EAST TUESDAY NIGHT WITH CONVECTION GRADUALLY ENDING WITH 
SOUTHWARD PUSH OF SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY. BY WEDNESDAY FRONT IS 
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. WAS ABLE TO KEEP WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
DAYTIME PERIOD FRIDAY PRECIP FREE WITH DRIER...MORE STABLE AIR IN 
PLACE. NEXT SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
TOWARD THE WEEKEND AND PLACED A LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY IN FOR 
SATURDAY WITH POSSIBLE FROPA OCCURRING SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. 
LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN FOR SUNDAY DUE TO INHERENT UNCERTAINTY 
IN SYSTEM TIMING THIS FAR OUT IN THE FORECAST PERIOD. STAYED FAIRLY 
CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS EXCEPT ON SUNDAY WHERE UNDERCUT THE 
CLIMO WEIGHTED MAXES.

AMPLIFIES. BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP APPEARS TO BE ON TUESDAY AS SURFACE 
BOUNDARY SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA. CONTINUED DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE 
LATTER PORTION OF THE WORK WEEK AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO 
THE REGION. MODELS ARE HINTING AT AN UNSEASONABLY AMPLIFIED TROUGH 
DIGGING INTO THE EASTERN CONUS BY LATE NEXT WEEKEND BUT WILL HAVE TO 
WAIT TO SEE IF THIS ACTUALLY MATERIALIZES. CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEKEND IN ANTICIPATION OF THIS PATTERN SHIFT. 
SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER AIR FOLLOWS SURFACE BOUNDARY BY MID WEEK 
RESULTING IN TEMPS COOLING SLIGHTLY BACK TO NEAR CLIMO. GENERALLY 
DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

CONVECTION AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE DIFFICULT...WILL MENTION VCTS AT 
ALL THREE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE DAY. SOME SCATTERED HIGH CLOUDS 
AHEAD OF THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT ANY FOG 
DEVELOPMENT THIS MORNING...BUT WILL MENTION SOME LIGHT FOG WITH MVFR 
VISIBILITIES AT KTRI. OUTSIDE OF SOME TSTORMS TODAY...VFR CONDITIONS 
AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE 
TAF SITES.

POPS AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS. CLOUD COVER AND ANY LINGERING CONVECTION
FAVORS MILD MOS MINS...WHICH ACTUALLY DIFFER VERY LITTLE.

PATTERN CHANGES VERY LITTLE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH WEAK
TROUGHING ALOFT KEEPING A SLIGHT NW TO SE FLOW TO STEER ANY
DEVELOPING CONVECTION. TOUGH CALL ON HOW MUCH CONVECTION DOES OCCUR
ON SUNDAY...BUT I LIKED THE CHANCE NORTH TO LOW LIKELY POPS SOUTH
LOOK OF MODELS...WHICH ALSO BLENDED BEST WITH FFC AND GSP GRIDS.

DIURNAL CONVECTION LOOKS POSSIBLE JUST ABOUT ANYWHERE ON MONDAY SO
KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS CHANCE POPS. OTHERWISE...MILD MINS
EACH NIGHT AND COOLER THAN THE GFS MOS MAXES EACH DAY (NOTE HOW
MUCH TOO WARM GFS MOS WAS FOR TODAY'S HIGHS).


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EASTERN STATES UPPER 
TROUGH AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH MID WEEK AS NUMEROUS 
SHORT WAVES DROP SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE MIDWEST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. A COOL FRONT WILL BE MAKING ITS WAY SOUTH THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AND LEFT HIGHEST CHANCE POPS FROM PREVIOUS 
PACKAGE FOR THE SLOW FRONTAL PASSAGE...REDUCING PROBABILITY TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE ON WEDNESDAY. DRIER AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION BEHIND 
THE FRONT THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK SO MAINTAINED THE DRY 
FORECAST UNTIL SATURDAY WHEN ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL IMPULSE BUILDS INTO 
THE REGION. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME RANGE KEPT THE 
PROBABILITY AT 20 PERCENT. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS

ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE THAT IS CURRENTLY ONLY 
PRODUCING SOME LIGHT AND ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER MIDDLE TN. THIS 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE SHOULD TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS THE LOCAL AIR MASS BECOMES MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE BY THIS AFTERNOON. AS THIS SHORT WAVE EXITS THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY WHICH MAY BRING SOME CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY FROM THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY INTO THE FORECAST AREA. OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE 
WITH LIKELY POPS OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH CHANCE 
POPS FOR TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
SINCE TEMPS WILL BE HEAVILY DEPENDENT ON THE AMOUNT OF CLOUDS AND 
CONVECTION.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN 
CONTINUES THROUGH MID WEEK AS A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES TRANSLATES 
THROUGH THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS. MODELS SOLUTIONS DIVERGE BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD 
BUT APPEARS THERE WILL BE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR AT LEAST A FEW PERIODS 
OF GENERALLY DRY WEATHER BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM. AS SUCH...BACKED 
OFF POPS SLIGHTLY FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...AND KEPT FRIDAY 
DRY FOR NOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE. APPEARS TEMPS ARE POISED TO COOL SLIGHTLY AS LOW-AMPLITUDE 
UPPER TROUGH INVADES EASTERN CONUS...BUT STILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY ABOVE 
CLIMO.

AREA BUT SOME UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING AND POSSIBILITY OF ADDITIONAL
WAVES BUILDING INTO THE AREA. THEREFORE KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP
FOR CONVECTION THROUGH EVENING WHILE DROPPING ENTIRELY ON FRIDAY
WITH COOL FRONT WELL SOUTH OF THE REGION. MEX MOS WAS
UNREALISTICALLY WARM CONSIDERING RE-EMERGENCE OF EASTERN STATES
UPPER TROUGH WITH ASSOCIATED ACTIVE WEATHER. WENT A FEW DEGREES
BELOW SUGGESTED NUMBERS...ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EDT FRI AUG 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE SOUTHERN 
TN BORDER...BUT HIGH DEWPOINTS IN THE 70S REMAIN NORTH OF THIS 
BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHWARD TODAY...WITH AN WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
DRIFTING SLOWLY EASTWARD ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THESE TWO 
TRIGGERING MECHANISMS SHOULD COMBINE TO PRODUCE SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
EXPECTED TONIGHT AS THE UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE FURTHER AMPLIFIES 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL AN INVERTED-V PROFILE 
IN THE LOWER LEVELS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A FAIRLY EXTENSIVE 
LAYER OF DRY AIR ALSO EXPECTED IN THE MID LEVELS. THUS...THINK THAT 
DAMAGING MICROBURST WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH ANY TSTORM THAT 
FORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS 
THE COOLER NAM NUMBERS FOR TODAY...SINCE THERE SHOULD BE PLENTY OF 
HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON EMANATING FROM THE 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY. THESE COOLER 
TEMPS SHOULD KEEP HEAT INDICES BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA OVER THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED WEATHER 
WITH A SLOW COOLING TREND IN THE OFFING THROUGH THE LONG TERM AS 
LOW-AMPLITUDE UPPER TROUGH DISPLACES NEARLY ZONAL FLOW OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS. MEDIUM-RANGE MODELS DEPICT SERIES OF WEAK UPPER 
DISTURBANCES TRANSLATING THROUGH THE FLOW. MODELS DIFFER ON DETAILS 
HOWEVER. APPEARS BEST COVERAGE OF PRECIP WILL BE EARLY IN THE LONG 
TERM (SATURDAY) AS ABUNDANT MOISTURE ACCOMPANIES INITIAL UPPER WAVE. 
BUMPED UP POPS TO LIKELY FOR OUR NORTHEASTERN ZONES ON SATURDAY. 
OVERALL HOWEVER...DID NOT MAKE MANY CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST DUE TO LOW CONFIDENCE IN TIMING INDIVIDUAL EVENTS. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE.

.AVIATION...

REMAIN HIGH NORTH OF THIS BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS A

MORNING...BUT AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF HIGH CLOUDS CURRENTLY OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY SHOULD KEEP VISIBILITIES FROM LOWERING BELOW MVFR 
RANGES. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHWARD 
TODAY...WITH AN WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE DRIFTING SLOWLY ACROSS 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THESE TWO TRIGGERING MECHANISMS SHOULD 
COMBINE TO PRODUCE SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A 
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION EXPECTED TONIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL 
HANDLE THIS SCENARIO IN THE TAFS BY MENTIONING CB CLOUDS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS AT ALL THREE TAF SITES. OUTSIDE OF SOME 
MORNING FOG AND AFTERNOON/EVENING TSTORMS...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT 
WINDS ARE OTHERWISE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 041936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT THU AUG 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
CONVECTION MAINLY TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA TODAY...WITH DEBRIS 
CLOUDS KEEPING INTENSE SUN AT BAY...SO CANCELED THE HEAT ADVISORY.

UPPER RIDGE THAT HAS BEEN THE DOMINATING FEATURE FOR MUCH OF THIS 
SUMMER OVER THE SOUTHERN U.S. IS STILL IN PLACE...WITH US LOCATED ON 
THE NORTHEASTERN EDGE.  GOING INTO THE WEEKEND...OUR PART OF THE 
RIDGE YIELDS AS WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVE INTO THE AREA.  WILL KEEP THE 
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW THROUGH FRIDAY...BUT SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY NIGHT SHOULD SPREAD SHOWERS AND STORMS ACROSS THE AREA 
AS ELEVATED INSTABILITY WILL PROVIDE FUEL.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE ON 
THE HEELS OF THIS ONE SHOULD PROVIDE LIFT FOR SATURDAY AS WELL.  FOR 
TEMPERATURES...KEEPING PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE VALUES...WITH MORE 
CLOUDS AND PRECIP...SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER ON SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...IT APPEARS THAT THE 
MOIST SUMMER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE IN THE LONG TERM AS MODELS AGREE 
HEIGHTS GRADUALLY FALL THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH MEAN UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH IN PLACE ACROSS THE MUCH OF THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION 
BY 12Z FRIDAY. IN THIS PATTERN THE JET STREAM BECOMES INCREASINGLY 
ACTIVE WITH MODELS INDICATING SEVERAL SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES 
BUILDING THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. SOLUTIONS DIFFER ON EXACT TIMING OF THESE FEATURES. COULD 
ALMOST KEEP A 30 PERCENT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION GOING THROUGH THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST BUT TRIED TO PICK A COUPLE PERIODS WITH HIGHER 
PROBABILITY. KEPT 40 PERCENT PROBABILITY IN FOR SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY AS MODEL AGREEMENT FAVORS THIS TIME WITH A LEAST A COUPLE 
CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS ACTING ON HIGH WEEKEND MEAN RH AND INSTABILITY. 
KEPT LOWER SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY WHILE 
FORECAST AREA AWAITS DEEPENING EASTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH WITH 
ADDITIONAL VORTS DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. A SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACCOMPANIES THIS ACTION LATER 
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME 
RANGE JUST KEPT A 30 PERCENT POP GOING WHILE DROPPING TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE ON THURSDAY AS BOUNDARY SLIPS SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE BORDER. 
STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO NEW MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST.

MINIMAL SHEAR. FREEZING LEVEL AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS ARE VERY 
HIGH...SO MAIN THREAT WILL BE ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS WITH STRONGEST 
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HWO PRODUCT HIGHLIGHTS THIS 
THREAT. 

CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS COULD AFFECT HOW FAST TEMPS WARM OVER SW VA 
AND NE TN...BUT PREVIOUS MAX TEMPS LOOK GOOD...AND SHOULD BE RIGHT 
AROUND RECORD VALUES. WILL TWEAK A FEW HOURLY GRIDS AROUND 11 AM EDT
...AND FRESHEN WEB PRODUCTS. WILL UPDATE ZFP TO REMOVE MORNING AND 
AFTERNOON WORDING.

HEAT ADVISORY VALUES MAY BE REACHED ACROSS SRN VALLEY THURSDAY...AS 
DEW POINT TEMPS REMAIN HIGH WITH MAXES IN THE UPPER 90S. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
426 AM EDT WED AUG 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE STILL FIRMLY IN
CONTROL OF FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. A WEAK FRONT WAS MOVING INTO
THE OHIO VALLEY WITH MCS OVER INDIANA AND OHIO. EARLY MORNING
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S WITH CLEAR SKIES AND
SOME PATCHY FOG. UPPER RIDGE WILL RETROGRADE TO THE WEST TODAY AS
FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST. MCS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO MOVE
SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES
BUT OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO SW
VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON AND COMBINED WITH THE UNSTABLE
AIR MASS FROM HEATING PROVIDE A FOCUS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
THAT SHOULD DEVELOP SOUTHWARD INTO THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS.
DAMAGING WINDS AND SOME LARGE HAIL WILL BE POSSIBLE. THICKNESS
VALUES ARE EXPECTED TO BE HIGHER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY BUT WITH
POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER WILL
FORECAST HIGHS LIKE TUESDAYS WHICH WILL BE NEAR OR AT RECORDS FOR
THE DATE. WILL ISSUE SPS FOR HEAT INDEX VALUES AROUND 100 OR HIGHER
FOR THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS BOTH TODAY AND THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LARGE UPPER RIDGE
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL U.S. GRADUALLY RETREATS TO THE
WEST THROUGH THE PERIOD. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGES INTO THE AREA
FROM THE NORTH EARLY WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND WEAK SURFACE WAVE
LINGERING ALONG SOUTHERN BORDER OF MRX THU AND FRI. SLIGHT CHANCE
OF THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE GA BORDER THU AND FRI. SLGT CHC TSTMS
ALSO FOR EASTERN HIGHLANDS FRI. AIR MASS MOISTENS UP WITH INCREASING
CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION ON SAT AND SUNDAY AS COLD FRONT DEVELOPS
NW OF THE AREA. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIFFER INTO NEXT WEEK PENDING TRACK
OF TROPICAL SYSTEM EMILY. BEST BET FOR NOW IS NW LAYER FLOW AND
DRIER CONDITIONS ACROSS TN VALLEY AND S APPALACHIANS. LOW LEVEL
THICKNESS VALUES ALSO PROGGED TO FALL. WELL ABOVE NORMAL...THOUGH
BELOW RECORD TEMPS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND THEN FALL TO
NEAR NORMAL BY END OF PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT TUE AUG 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
REMAINS IN NORTHWEST FLOW AROUND UPPER RIDGE THAT PERSISTS OVER THE 
SOUTH CENTRAL CONUS. AFTER ANOTHER DRY NIGHT...A WEAK SURFACE 
BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTHWEST LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 
MOISTURE AND LIFT NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS FEATURE PER
MODEL TIME HEIGHTS. HAVE CONTINUED ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE CWA TOMORROW AFTERNOON. MAV AND MET
GUIDANCE TEMPS DISPLAY A FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCE FOR MAX
TEMPS TOMORROW. HAVE TENDED TO USE BLEND OF GUIDANCE ALTHOUGH
TIMING OF CLOUDS/POTENTIAL PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH BOUNDARY WILL
HAVE A CRITICAL IMPACT ON THOSE TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES AND A WEAK BOUNDARY 
CROSSING THE AREA WILL KEEP CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A 850 MB TROUGH EXTENDING ACROSS THE MID ATLANTIC 
TO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WILL ADVECT DRIER AIR INTO NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA THURSDAY. THE NAM AND GFS DIFFER ON THE 
SOUTHERN EDGE OF THE DRY AIR. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WETTER GFS AND 
SREF AND HAVE POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. A SLIGHT RISE IN PW VALUES AND A 500 MB SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH CROSSING THE OHIO VALLEY COULD BRING AN ISOLATED SHOWER 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON...MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS. BETTER PRECIP CHANCES 
COME ON SATURDAY WITH A MORE SIGNIFICANT MIDLEVEL TROUGH. SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY WILL FEATURE A NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT IN WHICH 
UPSTREAM CONVECTIVE DISTURBANCES COULD BRING SHOWERS TO THE 
AREA...BUT CONFIDENCE THIS FAR OUT IS LOW...SO WILL NOT MAKE MUCH 
CHANGE TO THE FORECAST. 

TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD WILL REMAIN HOT...WITH HIGHS IN 
THE MID TO UPPER 90S IN MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY. HEAT INDEX VALUES OF 
100-105 WILL BE COMMON IN THE VALLEY THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH VALUES 
OVER 105 POSSIBLE IN THE CHATTANOOGA AREA.

THURSDAY...LOWERING DEWPOINTS A BIT BUT HOT TEMPERATURES CONTINUE. 
EXPECT HEAT INDEX VALUES OF 100-105 WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A MORE 
SUBSTANTIAL TROUGH CROSSES THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND AS THE RIDGE 
BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN. THE ECMWF SHOWS MUCH MORE PRECIP THAN THE 
GFS...FOR NOW WILL LEAN TOWARD THE DRIER SOLUTION WITH LOW TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS AND JUST A SLIGHT DOWNWARD TREND IN TEMPERATURES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT SUN JUL 31 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS CONTINUES TO SHOW HIGH DEWPOINTS IN THE 70S 
OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT SOME DRIER AIR APPEARS TO BE 
FINALLY WORKING ITS WAY INTO SOUTHWEST VA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TN. 
ISOBARIC ANALYSIS WOULD INDICATE THAT A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WAS 
LOCATED SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA OVER CENTRAL AL AND CENTRAL GA... 
BUT DEWPOINT ANALYSIS WOULD SUGGEST THAT THE PRIMARY SURGE OF DRIER 
AIR HAS ONLY JUST BEGUN TO FILTER INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THUS... 
WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR A FEW MORE HOURS 
THIS EVENING...BUT WILL THEN UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE THE 
POPS. WILL ALSO PLAN TO MENTION PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT... 
SINCE MINS SHOULD BE CLOSE TO THE DEWPOINTS BY SUNRISE. TEMP 
FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...SO WILL NOT PLAN TO 
TWEAK THIS EVENING.
&&

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL

LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.   


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO 
PERSIST THROUGH MID WEEK AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. 
MOISTURE STARTS TO INCREASE BY WEDNESDAY AS ANOTHER WEAK SURFACE 
BOUNDARY APPROACHES. THINGS BECOME LESS CERTAIN BY WEEK'S END AS 
MODELS DISAGREE AND HAVE DISPLAYED POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCIES 
OVER THE PAST FEW RUNS. HOWEVER...MINOR UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES 
GENERALLY PROJECTED TO TRANSLATE THROUGH NORTHWESTERLY...AND 
INCREASINGLY CYCLONIC...FLOW ALOFT KEEPING AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF PRECIP GOING THROUGH MOST OF THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. 
FOR TEMPS...CONTINUED TO SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT MAV/MEX MAX TEMP GUIDANCE 
AS THEY CONTINUE TO REPRESENT THE EXTREME WARM VALUES OF ALL OF THE 
ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE. NEVERTHELESS...APPEARS TEMPS WILL REMAIN FAR 
ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE PERIOD. OVERALL...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR 
CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST/GRIDS.

THE NORTH. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES SUPPORT ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES TODAY WHICH WILL BE LIMITED SLIGHTLY BY CLOUD COVER. 
MOS GUIDANCE APPEARS TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH COOLING TONIGHT SO KEPT 
FORECAST MINS ON THE WARM SIDE. RADIATION FOG POSSIBLE 
OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR MOVES IN 
BEHIND SUNDAY/S WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY PASSAGE.  STRONG UPPER RIDGE 
REBUILDS IN ACROSS THE CENTRAL U.S...PUTTING THE MRX CWA IN 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW.  THIS WEATHER PATTERN WILL PERSIST OVER THE ARA 
FOR DRY AND HOT CONDITIONS MONDAY AND TUESDAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
BEGINS TO INCREASE ONCE AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY AND COULD SEE A FEW 
DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON.  MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR ON DETAILS DURING THE LATER PART 
OF THE EXTENDED SO CONFIDENCE LOW...BUT OVERALL PATTERN SHOWS A WEAK 
SURFACE BOUNDARY MOVING IN AROUND THURSDAY...RETURNING US TO A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS.  A SHORT WAVE MOVES IN 
AROUND THE FRIDAY OR SATURDAY TIME FRAME...CONTINUING THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

SOME EXTENT AROUND THESE TERMINALS BUT AM BANKING ON THE BEST
CHANCE OF SEEING SOME PRECIP IN THE FORM OF A SHOWER AND PERHAPS A
BIT OF THUNDER AT TYS IN A COUPLE HOURS AS AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY
SLIPS SLOWLY SOUTH THROUGH NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THIS SAME BOUNDARY
APPEARS TO BE A LITTLE CLOSER TO TRI SO ADDED A LITTLE PERIOD OF
THUNDERSHOWERS HERE EARLY THIS EVENING. DECIDED TO LEAVE FOG OUT AT
TYS AND CHA WITH SCT-BKN MID AND HIGH DECK POSSIBLY KEEPING THE
SURFACE FROM BECOMING SATURATED LATE TONIGHT. SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY
SHOULD BE IN PLACE NEAR TRI AND TYS AROUND 13-14Z SUNDAY SO
MAINTAINED VCNTY TSRA AROUND THIS TIME WRAPPING UP AROUND EARLY
AFTERNOON AS THE BOUNDARY SHIFTS SOUTH TOWARD CHA. KEPT SOME
THUNDER AT CHA THROUGH MUCH OF THE AFTERNOON WHERE THE BEST CHANCE
OF A THUNDERSTORM WILL RESIDE THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

LONG TERM. FOR TEMPS...ONCE AGAIN UNDERCUT MAV/MEX GUIDANCE VALUES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT SAT JUL 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING. SURFACE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY SAGS SOUTH DURING THE PERIOD. LOW 
LEVEL RIDGING AND WEAK NORTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE AREA. THIS 
IS IN RESPONSE TO PRESSURE FALLS EAST OF THE S APPALACHIANS. THIS 
FLOW WILL NOT AID IN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TODAY. PWAT VALUES DO 
INCH UP RANGING FROM 2.00 IN THE SW TO 1.50 IN THE NE. THIS 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE COUPLED WITH AFTERNOON DESTABILIZATION AND 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES SHOULD TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION INTO THE 
EVENING HOURS. INCREASED CLOUD COVER TODAY SHOULD HOLD DOWN TEMPS A 
DEGREE OR TWO. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL BE 
CONTINUING ITS SLOW PROGRESSION THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  WITH 
PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE 
AND THE ADDED LIFT OF THE BOUNDARY MOVING THROUGH...EXPECT THIS TO 
BE OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION FOR THE EXTENDED.  SLIGHTLY DRIER 
AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THE BOUNDARY WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW FROM A 
RIDGE REFORMING OVER THE CENTRAL U.S.  THIS WILL PROVIDE DRY BUT 
CONTINUED HOT CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW BY 
THE END OF THE PERIOD...BUT WITH INCREASING MOISTURE OVER THE AREA 
AND ANOTHER APPROACHING BOUNDARY ...WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS IN THE 
FORECAST WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.

AREA...AS MODELS ARE COMING IN DRIER...AND NOT AS MUCH COVERAGE ON
RADARS TO THE NORTH AND AROUND MRX THIS AFTERNOON.

MADE ONLY VERY MINOR CHANGES TO GOING TEMP FORECAST. 


LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS STILL GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT A SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL PUSH SOUTH OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK ALLOWING FOR AT LEAST A FEW 
GENERALLY DRY DAYS. DEWPOINTS MAY FALL SLIGHTLY BEHIND BOUNDARY... 
BUT TEMPS EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO. REGION PROJECTED TO REMAIN 
IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BUT MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE AGAIN BY MID 
WORK WEEK. THUS HAVE CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE LATTER 
PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY TENDED TO SLIGHTLY 
UNDERCUT MAV/MEX GUIDANCE SINCE THE MEX GUIDANCE REPRESENTS THE 
HIGHEST VALUE OF THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS FOR THE MOST PART.

&&

WILL ACCOMPANY THIS PROCESS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO

MOST OF THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM. DID INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR NEXT THURSDAY AS MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT ANOTHER WEAK 
SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH. HOWEVER...TIMING ISSUES PRECLUDE 
GOING ANY HIGHER AT THIS TIME. OVERALL...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR 
CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT THU JUL 28 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL EXTEND 
FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SOUTHEAST OFF THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC 
COAST TODAY. THE RIDGE SHOULD SUPPRESS CONVECTION ACROSS MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...SOUTH TO SOUTHEASTERLY LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ADVECTION WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. OROGRAPHIC LIFT IN THIS AREA ALONG WITH WEAK 
INSTABILITY MAY LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED SHOWERS AND A 
THUNDERSTORM. ANY CONVECTION THAT FORMS SHOULD BE ENDING BY AROUND 
00Z FRIDAY LEADING TO ANOTHER UNEVENTFUL EVENING. THE HEAT WILL BE 
ON AGAIN TODAY WITH THE UPPER HIGH POSITIONED OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
CENTERED OVER THE CAROLINAS ON FRIDAY WILL RETROGRADE TO THE PLAINS 
THROUGH SUNDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN A NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT THAT 
WILL ALLOW DISTURBANCES GENERATED BY UPSTREAM CONVECTION TO DROP OUR 
WAY. ON FRIDAY THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE IN SOUTHERN AREAS AS 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEGINS TO ADVECT NORTHWARD. BY SATURDAY 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL BE NEAR 2 INCHES ACROSS MOST OF THE 
AREA...WHICH CONTINUES INTO SUNDAY. WILL CARRY HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. A WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA SUNDAY 
NIGHT AS THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED. DRIER AIR BUILDS IN 
ON MONDAY...WHICH SHOULD PROVIDE DRY WEATHER THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE 
GFS MOS HIGH TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN TOO WARM RECENTLY...AND ARE ON 
THE HIGH END OF THE ENSEMBLES...SO WENT WITH HIGHS A BIT BELOW 
GUIDANCE BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL VALUES.

FXUS64 KMRX 272308

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
707 PM EDT WED JUL 27 2011

AVIATION...CB AND LINGERING STRAY -TSRA NEAR EXTREME SE TN AND SW 
NC...BUT THIS SPOTTY ACTIVITY SHOULD DISSIPATE SHORTLY. BOUNDARY 
LAYER SHOULD HAVE DRIED OUT SOME TODAY...SO WILL LIMIT LATE NIGHT 
FOG JUST TO TRI.

SOME CUMULUS CLOUDS DEVELOP AGAIN THURSDAY AFTERNOON...BUT 
CONVECTION SHOULD BE WEAK...SPOTTY AND SHORT LIVED NEAR CHA.
THUS...NO REASON TO ADD CB OR EVEN VCSH FOR NOW.

THIS LEAVES MOSTLY VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS THROUGH 29/00Z. 

&&

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL SHIFT 
EAST DURING THE SHORT TERM...AND MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE A 
BIT.  STILL LOOKS LIKE ANY CONVECTION THURSDAY SHOULD BE MAINLY 
LIMITED TO THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN AREAS...ESPECIALLY SOUTHEAST...SO 
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THOSE AREAS.  WHILE NOT CONVINCED WE 
WILL SEE ANYTHING FURTHER WEST IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...CONFIDENCE 
NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO PULL SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE SO WILL KEEP IN FOR 
NOW.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART...SO JUST A FEW 
TWEAKS MOSTLY TO RAISE SOME MINS FOR TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD THE UPPER RIDGE IS IN 
PLACE...COVERING MUCH OF THE SERN U.S. WITH ITS AXIS ALMOST OVER 
KTRI.  FROM THIS POINT FORWARD FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...HEIGHTS 
ARE FALLING OVER THE AREA...AS TROUGHINESS STRENGTHENS OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES...AND THE UPPER RIDGE YIELDS...WOBBLES WESTWARD AND SETS 
UP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AGAIN.

IN THE NEARER TERM...THE HIGH POPS FOR THU NIGHT BY THE MET OVER 
PARTS OF THE AREA SEEM OVERDONE.  THINKING THAT EVEN IF THERE ARE 
SOME SHOWERS/WEAK THUNDER DURING THE DAY...THAT MOST OF THIS WILL 
FALL APART AROUND SUNSET...SO WILL KEEP THU NIGHT DRY.  WILL HAVE 
SOME POPS FOR FRIDAY...GRADIENT FROM AROUND 40 PERCENT SW TO <20 
PERCENT NE.  FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL GO BELOW GUIDANCE AS MAIN MOIST 
PLUME STAYS TO THE WEST...THINK THAT AFTERNOON CONVECTION OVER OUR 
AERA WILL DIE QUICKLY.  FRONT IS GETTING CLOSER TO CWA BY SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT MAY NOT MAKE IT YET...SO STAYED WARM ON HIGH TEMPS.  
FOR SUNDAY BROUGHT FRONT INTO AREA...AND BY MONDAY AT 12Z...HAVE THE 
FRONT AND POPS JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA.  LEAVING THINGS DRY THOUGH 
THE END OF THE PERIOD.

DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE ON TEMPS...MAIN DIFFERENCE IS 
POST-FRONTAL MINS EARLY NEXT WEEK...WENT COOLER MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
MORNINGS.

102 
FXUS64 KMRX 271918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT WED JUL 27 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL SHIFT 
EAST DURING THE SHORT TERM...AND MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE A 
BIT.  STILL LOOKS LIKE ANY CONVECTION THURSDAY SHOULD BE MAINLY 
LIMITED TO THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN AREAS...ESPECIALLY SOUTHEAST...SO 
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THOSE AREAS.  WHILE NOT CONVINCED WE 
WILL SEE ANYTHING FURTHER WEST IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...CONFIDENCE 
NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO PULL SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE SO WILL KEEP IN FOR 
NOW.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART...SO JUST A FEW 
TWEAKS MOSTLY TO RAISE SOME MINS FOR TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD THE UPPER RIDGE IS IN 
PLACE...COVERING MUCH OF THE SERN U.S. WITH ITS AXIS ALMOST OVER 
KTRI.  FROM THIS POINT FORWARD FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...HEIGHTS 
ARE FALLING OVER THE AREA...AS TROUGHINESS STRENGTHENS OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES...AND THE UPPER RIDGE YIELDS...WOBBLES WESTWARD AND SETS 
UP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AGAIN.

IN THE NEARER TERM...THE HIGH POPS FOR THU NIGHT BY THE MET OVER 
PARTS OF THE AREA SEEM OVERDONE.  THINKING THAT EVEN IF THERE ARE 
SOME SHOWERS/WEAK THUNDER DURING THE DAY...THAT MOST OF THIS WILL 
FALL APART AROUND SUNSET...SO WILL KEEP THU NIGHT DRY.  WILL HAVE 
SOME POPS FOR FRIDAY...GRADIENT FROM AROUND 40 PERCENT SW TO <20 
PERCENT NE.  FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL GO BELOW GUIDANCE AS MAIN MOIST 
PLUME STAYS TO THE WEST...THINK THAT AFTERNOON CONVECTION OVER OUR 
AERA WILL DIE QUICKLY.  FRONT IS GETTING CLOSER TO CWA BY SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT MAY NOT MAKE IT YET...SO STAYED WARM ON HIGH TEMPS.  
FOR SUNDAY BROUGHT FRONT INTO AREA...AND BY MONDAY AT 12Z...HAVE THE 
FRONT AND POPS JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA.  LEAVING THINGS DRY THOUGH 
THE END OF THE PERIOD.

DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE ON TEMPS...MAIN DIFFERENCE IS 
POST-FRONTAL MINS EARLY NEXT WEEK...WENT COOLER MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
MORNINGS.

FXUS64 KMRX 270744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT WED JUL 27 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HEIGHTS BUILD TODAY ALOFT WITH 
SURFACE RIDGE EXTENDING SOUTH FROM THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NORTHEASTERLY FLOW RESULTS IN DRIER AIR 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH NEARLY FULL INSOLATION AND NO CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION. FOG SHOULD BURN OFF BY 14Z MOST AREAS. STAYED 
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS TODAY AND 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...NOT MANY CHANGES WILL BE 
NEEDED TO THE LONG TERM PERIOD. THE GENERAL TREND OF INCREASING POPS 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK FOLLOWED BY A FROPA ON MONDAY WILL BE 
CONTINUED WITH ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS. ON THURSDAY THE MID-UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE CAROLINAS...ALLOWING INCREASING 
MOISTURE FROM A SOUTHERLY FLOW TO BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
SOUTH. THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND RETROGRADES THROUGH SUNDAY...AND A 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BRING A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES TOWARD THE AREA 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. BEST PRECIP CHANCES LOOK TO BE SUNDAY AS THE 
SURFACE FRONT DRAWS NEAR...BUT WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE 
THIS FAR OUT. DRIER AIR SHOULD FILTER IN BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH AND 
FRONTAL PASSAGE ON MONDAY. HIGH TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL 
CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL...MAINLY IN THE 90S WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS MAINLY 
IN THE 70S.

952 
FXUS64 KMRX 270159
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT TUE JUL 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND A 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLOWLY SETTLING TO OUR SOUTH...WE WILL MOVE 
INTO A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN WITH GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM.  WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE...TEMPERATURES WILL WARM 
INTO THE 90S ON TUESDAY FOR ANOTHER HOT DAY.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...NO CLEARLY FAVORED 
MODEL SOLUTION FOR THE MID TO LONG TERM PERIODS...SO I TRENDED QUITE 
CLOSE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
LIFT NE BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...THEN THE UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS EAST. MOISTURE INCREASES...ESPECIALLY OVER SRN AREAS WITH 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES THERE LIKELY TO REACH OR EXCEED 2 INCHES 
BY FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. ONE FACTOR WILL BE THE NEXT FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WHICH LOOKS TO DROP INTO NRN AREAS BY EARLY SUNDAY...AND 
OTHER FACTOR WILL BE WEAK SHORTWAVES/IMPULSES...THAT WOULD BOTH 
ENHANCE RAIN CHANCES. BEST RAIN CHANCES STILL APPEAR TO BE SATURDAY 
INTO SUNDAY...BUT I DID TWEAK POPS UP VERY SLIGHTLY ON FRIDAY TO 
MESH WITH NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS. 

OTHERWISE...KEPT MOST AREAS DRY MONDAY AND I SAW NO REASON TO 
INTRODUCE ANY RAIN CHANCES FOR NEW DAY 7 (TUESDAY). MOS MIN TEMPS 
GENERALLY QUITE REASONABLE AND FOLLOWED. HOWEVER...THINK THAT GFSX 
MOS IS TOO ROBUST WITH SPREADING MID TO UPPER 90S FOR SO MANY DAYS 
OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST...GIVEN AMOUNT OF MOISTURE IN THE 
ATMOSPHERE.

728 
FXUS64 KMRX 260725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT TUE JUL 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
DRY AIR ALOFT HAS MOVED INTO THE AREA BEHIND A SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH...BUT LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS PRODUCING PATCHY FOG 
AND LOW CLOUDS. EXPECT THAT THE CLOUDS AND FOG WILL LIFT QUICKLY 
AFTER SUNRISE...LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES BY LATE MORNING. WITH 
DAYTIME MIXING...THE DRIER AIR ALOFT WILL REACH THE 
SURFACE...DROPPING DEWPOINTS INTO THE 60S...WHICH WILL MAKE FOR A 
MORE COMFORTABLE DAY DESPITE HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S. 
SUBSIDENCE UNDER A BUILDING MIDLEVEL RIDGE WILL SUPPRESS CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT. THIS RIDGE SHIFTS EASTWARD ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...KEEPING DRY WEATHER IN PLACE WITH HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 
90S. ONCE THE RIDGE BECOMES POSITIONED OVER THE CAROLINAS ON 
THURSDAY...A RETURN FLOW OF MOISTURE WILL RAISE DEWPOINTS AND BRING 
A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO MAINLY 
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
STAYED BASICALLY WITH PREVIOUS PACKAGE FORECAST FOR THIS PERIOD.
ATMOSPHERE GETS RECHARGED WITH HIGHER DEWPOINT AIRMASS BY FRIDAY AS
MOISTURE WORKS NORTH AND EAST AROUND 85H SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC
COASTAL RIDGE. INSTABILITY ALSO EDGES HIGHER SO STAYED WITH THE
SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION ON FRIDAY. BY SATURDAY...UPPER
TROF PROGRESSES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN STATES WITH NORTHWESTERLY
FLOW DEVELOPING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MODELS REVEAL THE
POSSIBILITY OF SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES DROPPING SOUTHEAST FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE FORECAST AREA SO BROAD BRUSHED 30 PERCENT
POPS SATURDAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WHILE KEEPING THE HIGHEST
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AS SYNOPTIC COOL FRONT BUILDS TOWARD THE
REGION ENHANCING PROBABILITY OF CONVECTION. STAYED WITH THE
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR
DAYTIME PERIOD MONDAY AS BOUNDARY MAY STILL BE IN THE VICINITY.
ONLY MADE MINOR TWEAKS TO TEMP FORECAST DURING THE LONG TERM. MEX
MOS GUIDANCE ONCE AGAIN APPEARS TO BE TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH MAX TEMPS
WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND PRECIP CHANCES MOVING INTO THE
WEEKEND.

REGION.  WITH ABUNDANT LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE...CONVECTION WILL BE 
ABLE TO GENERATE HEAVY RAINFALL WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED 
MINOR FLOODING.  DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE BOUNDARY...WITH 
PRECIP EXPECTED TO END FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT.  COULD 
SEE A FEW DIURNAL SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN ON 
TUESDAY...HOWEVER MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD BE DRY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS STILL OFFERING 
SOME DRIER AIR LASTING INTO WEDNESDAY...SO LIMITED POPS TO JUST THE 
SRN AREAS TUESDAY NIGHT...AND JUST SE TN AND SW NC WEDNESDAY. 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIFTS NE OF THE REGION THURSDAY...AND 500 MB 
HEIGHTS RISE AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS EAST. THIS SHOULD SET THE STAGE 
FOR MOSTLY DIURNAL CONVECTION...PERHAPS MORE ORGANIZED ON SAT AND 
SUN...SO POPS FOR THOSE TWO PERIODS WERE INCREASED SLIGHTLY WITH 
SCATTERED WORDING. MODELS GENERALLY EASE ANOTHER WEAK FRONT ALMOST 
THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY...SO DRY EXCEPT FOR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR SE TN/SW NC NEAR GSP AND FFC FOR MONDAY. 

OTHERWISE...LOOKS LIKE HIGHS IN THE 80S AND 90S...BUT I STAYED BELOW 
THE MID TO UPPER 90S FOR NOW. MINS AROUND CLIMO THEN TREND A BIT 
ABOVE FROM FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 AM EDT MON JUL 25 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

PROVIDE NUMEROUS TO OCCASIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
AREA TODAY. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL BE WELL OVER 2 INCHES AS 
THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. TIMING OF THE 
BEST LIFT APPEARS TO BE 16-22Z...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL 
POPS IN THAT TIME FRAME...ALONG WITH A MENTION OF LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. MORNING SHOWERS AND CLOUD COVER WILL LIMIT SURFACE HEATING 
WITH HIGH IN THE 80S...AND LIMIT THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE STORMS. 
STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS CANNOT BE RULED OUT...BUT THE MAIN THREAT 
WILL BE HEAVY RAINFALL. PASSAGE OF THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AROUND 00Z 
WILL BRING A QUICK END TO PRECIP IN THE EVENING...AND WILL DROP ALL 
POPS AFTER 06Z. STILL...THE SURFACE FRONT LAGS WELL BEHIND THE 
TROUGH...SO LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL LIKELY KEEP LOW CLOUDS 
AND FOG IN PLACE THROUGH THE NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE BOUNDARY SHIFTS SOUTH BY
TUESDAY...BUT STILL CHANCE FOR SOME DIURNAL CONVECTION ON TUESDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN PROVIDING MOSTLY DRY WEATHER FOR
WEDNESDAY...MAY SEE A FEW AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP OVER
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT MOST AREAS WILL REMAIN DRY FOR WEDNESDAY. A
BOUNDARY ENTERS THE AREA THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO SUNDAY. WILL
KEEP THE LOW POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL BE DURING THE AFTERNOON
AND EVENING HOURS. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE
PERIOD. GENERALLY STAYED BELOW MEX GUIDANCE AND CLOSER TO HPC FOR

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN JUL 24 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY MOVING SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA. OUTFLOW FROM THIS UPSTREAM ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY HELP 
TO TRIGGER A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION TONIGHT OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO WILL RAISE POPS A LITTLE FOR TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY WILL SLOWLY BREAK DOWN 
TONIGHT...WITH A NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PUSH THE WEAK COLD 
FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...WITH CONVECTION BECOMING 
MORE WIDESPREAD AND ORGANIZED OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON TUESDAY...SO WILL KEEP A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION IN THE 
FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES ON MONDAY... 
AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE. OVERALL...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST (ESPECIALLY WITH MINS) SINCE THIS 
NEXT COLD FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO BRING MUCH OF A CHANGE IN THE 
LOCAL AIR MASS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY FOR GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS. HOWEVER... 
ISOLATED DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
REMNANTS OF A WEAK BOUNDARY LIFT NORTH INTO THE AREA FRIDAY AND WILL 
REMAIN POSITIONED OVER THE REGION THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. THIS 
WILL RETURN US TO AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN WITH ISOLATED 
CONVECTION POSSIBLE EACH DAY...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING HOURS.

WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WITH A SLIGHT COOLING TREND WITH MAXES DUE TO THE 
EXPECTED INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER AND COVERAGE OF CONVECTION.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY 
LINGER INTO TUESDAY WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY SETTLING SOUTH OF THE 
MRX AREA. AN UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN 
BUT EXPECT GENERALLY DRY AND CONTINUED HOT CONDITIONS. CONFIDENCE 
LOW BY THE END FOR THE PERIOD...THOUGH EXPECT THE REMNANTS OF THE 
BOUNDARY TO LIFT BACK NORTH INTO THE AREA FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... 
SLIGHTLY INCREASING THE CHANCE OF CONVECTION.
&&

CONTINUE TO BE HIGH (~2 INCHES)...SO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE 
A THREAT WITH ANY SLOW-MOVING CONVECTION.

TO REMOVE MORNING FOG WORDING.

PROVIDE SCATTERED SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND POSSIBLY MVFR 
CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON.  TIMING OF ADDITIONAL CONVECTION 
DIFFICULT AND WILL MENTION CB LATE IN THE PERIOD.

AND HUMID CONDITIONS LINGERING IN THESE 'DOG DAYS OF SUMMER'. AREA 
RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER SOUTHEAST KY AND 
NORTHEAST TN ASSOCIATED WITH A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVELY-INDUCED VORTEX 
THAT CONTINUES TO SLOWLY SINK SOUTHWARD FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS MCV SHOULD HELP TO TRIGGER A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
TODAY...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AS A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS IN THE AFTERNOON. PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES WILL ALSO BE HIGH (~2 INCHES)...SO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL 
APPEARS TO BE A THREAT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH ANY SLOW- 
MOVING CONVECTION. MAXES THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO 
WARMER THAN YESTERDAY...ALTHOUGH THE BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM RISING MUCH HIGHER.

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS 
MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS...AND 
TO REMOVE ANY MORNING PRECIP WORDING.

SHOW A WEAK DISTURBANCE MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. MAIN
DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE SHORT-RANGE MODELS IS THE AMOUNT OF
MOISTURE. GFS HAS PWS NEAR 1.5 INCHES WHILE THE NAM HAS PWS AT OR
ABOVE 2 INCHES. GIVEN BNA SOUNDING NEAR 2 INCHES AND WATER VAPOR
SHOWING PLENTY OF MID-HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE...WILL TREND TOWARD THE
WETTER NAM MODEL. PLAN OF GOING FOR HIGH CHANCE POPS WITH LIKELY
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS THE WEAK WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE REGION.

MAIN CONCERN WITH THE CONVECTION WILL BE TORRENTIAL DOWNPOURS AND
LOCALLIZED DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS.

DUE TO THE MOISTURE...TRENDED TOWARD THE NAM HIGHS AND LOWS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE LOOKS QUITE 
DOMINANT INTO AT LEAST SATURDAY...WITH MOISTURE REMAINING HIGH AND 
DAYTIME HEATING TO TRIGGER AT LEAST DIURNAL CONVECTION. HOWEVER...
LACK OF A SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURE LEAVES ME QUESTION GOING ANY HIGHER 
THAN CURRENT RAIN CHANCES INTO THE WEEKEND. SO...I STAYED CLOSE TO 
THE GENERALLY LOWER GFS MOS POPS THROUGH SATURDAY...AND BELOW THE 
21/0ZZ GFSX MOS POPS (WHICH CONTINUE TO TREND A BIT HIGHER) THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT. 

BY MONDAY...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...WHICH HELPS TO EASE A WEAK COLD FRONT SOUTHWARD 
TOWARD THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. THERE IS SOME CONTINUITY 
ON THIS FRONT DROPPING THROUGH SW VA AND NE TN BY TUESDAY MORNING. 
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED GOOD...BUT I DID NUDGE MONDAY POPS UP 
TO 50 PERCENT AND PUT MY SCATTERED AREAL QUALIFIER IN AGAIN. 
CONTINUED LOWER POPS TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY FOR NRN AREAS...AND KEPT 
WEDNESDAY DRY. 

DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM 20/12Z OR 21/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS...OTHER 
THAN TO UNDERCUT MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY ON MONDAY.

FEW DAYS...WITH TEMPS SLOWLY RISING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
OVERALL...A STAGNANT PATTERN IS EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH 
HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS LINGERING IN THESE 'DOG DAYS OF SUMMER'. 
CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVELY-INDUCED 
VORTEX OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY SINK SOUTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY TOMORROW. 
THIS MCV SHOULD HELP TO TRIGGER A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ON 
THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AS A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPS IN THE AFTERNOON. PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES WILL ALSO BE HIGH (~2 INCHES) THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...SO 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE A THREAT THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS... 
SINCE ANY CONVECTION SHOULD BE SLOW-MOVING. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...BUT THINK MAXES SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER TOMORROW 
(COMPARED TO TODAY).

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
GENERALLY MAINTAINS POSITION AND STRENGTH THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
WEEKEND SUPPRESSING WIDESPREAD CONVECTION. PROGS STILL SHOW ENOUGH

GOING FOR CONVECTION DURING THIS PERIOD. BY MONDAY...RIDGE HAS 
UNDERGONE RETROGRESSION AS UPPER TROUGH DROPS SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES ON MONDAY AND THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN STATES BY TUESDAY 
NIGHT. SURFACE FRONT AIDED BY THE STRENGTHENING NORTHERLY FLOW 
BUILDS SLOWLY INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT 
GENERATING SCATTERED CONVECTION. KEPT MEDIUM CHANCE POP JUST UNDER 
50 PERCENT FOR NOW AWAITING BETTER TIME RESOLUTION IN THE NEXT 
COUPLE DAYS. KEPT THE PREVIOUS PACKAGE IDEA OF SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
NORTH AND LOW CHANCE POP SOUTH ON TUESDAY AS FRONT SLIPS FURTHER 
SOUTH TOWARD THE GEORGIA BORDER. BY WEDNESDAY...THE FRONT MAY HAVE  
SHIFTED SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR 
CONVECTION ACROSS PART OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA DUE TO NEARBY SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY. NEW MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE 
NOT TOO FAR OFF ON THE WARM SIDE OVER THE WEEKEND BUT REALLY BECOMES 
UNREALISTIC DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. UNDERCUT BY 
SEVERAL DEGREES MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS NORTHERLY FLOW ADVECTS 
SOMEWHAT COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION.

230 AM EDT WED JUL 20 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL

MID-LEVEL DRYING...NOT SURFACE DEWPOINTS). HOWEVER...ENOUGH

AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST DUE TO DEEPER MOISTURE.

IN THE VERY SHORT TERM...WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION FROM A DYING
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX IS CONTINUING TO PRODUCE THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE
NORTH CAROLINA-TENNESSEE STATE-LINE. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY
PERSIST THROUGH 9 AM. OTHERWISE...PATCHY FOG WILL ONCE AGAIN BE THE
RULE THIS MORNING...ESPECIALLY AREAS THAT RECIEVED RAIN OVERNIGHT.

AFTERNOON HEAT INDICES WILL BECOME AN INCREASING CONCERN DUE TO THE
PERISTENT MOISTURE AND HOT AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES. HEAT INDICES
NEAR 100 DEGREES ANTICIPATED TODAY...THEN 100-105 DEGREES THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY. WE WILL ISSUE A SPS CONCERNING THE HOT TEMPERATURES
LATER THIS MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE CENTERED 
ACROSS THE MISSISSIPI VALLEY REGION WILL MOVE VERY LITTLE THROUGH 
SUNDAY. PATTERN LOOKS TO SUPPORT MOSTLY DIURNAL CONVECTION...BUT ANY 
ACTIVITY MOVING THROUGH OR AROUND THE UPPER RIDGE COULD ALSO AFFECT 
THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. I DO LIKE THE LOWER POPS ON THURSDAY... 
AS TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOW A DECREASE IN MOISTURE IN THE 700 TO 
400 MB LAYER...SO LESS UNSTABLE WITH NOT A SIGNIFICANT FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT.

POPS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY LOOKED GOOD...BUT I DID NUDGE POPS UP 
JUST SLIGHTLY FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...DUE TO THE APPROACHING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. TEMPS SHOULD STAY A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE 
CLIMO...AND PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE GENERALLY IN LINE WITH 20/12Z GFSX 
MOS. MOST MODELS SEEM TO EASE THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY JUST SOUTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY...BUT I LEFT THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH 
TO CHANCE POPS SOUTH IN FOR NOW. KEPT TUESDAY NIGHT DRY. UNDERCUT 
GFSX MOS FOR TUESDAY HIGHS...AND ALSO ON MONDAY DUE TO HIGHER POPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1011 AM EDT TUE JUL 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A CLUSTER OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TRACKING INTO KY/WV. ACTIVITY SHOULD BE IN OUR AREA BY 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS. COULD SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS 
AS THE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASES THIS AFTERNOON. CURRENT 
RAIN CHANCES FOR TODAY LOOK GOOD. TEMPERATURE AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING GROUP AND 
SWITCH TO SCATTERED WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FIRST CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS
DROPPING SOUTH AROUND THE UPPER RIDGE HAS WEAKENED...AND WILL ONLY
SPREAD A FEW HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE AREA. HOWEVER...2 MORE COMPLEXES
UPSTREAM CONTINUE TO DEVELOP OVER NORTHERN PARTS OF THE OHIO
VALLEY. THESE SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD REACH SW VA AND NE TN BY
12Z TO 15Z. PREVIOUS WEATHER/POP GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK FOR TODAY
WITH LITTLE CHANGES MADE. CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONVECTION
SHOULD KEEP HIGHS THIS AFTERNOON BELOW THE HOTTER GFS MOS (ALTHO
GFS MOS FINALLY DID WELL ON MAX TEMPS MONDAY). 

WON'T RULE OUT A STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORM TODAY...BUT WIND
FIELDS ARE RATHER WEAK. HOWEVER...INSTABILITY AND DIVERGENCE ALOFT
ARE FAVORABLE,

FOR TONIGHT...SLIGHT CHANCE EVENING POPS LOOKED REASONABLE. MOS
MINS CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AS WE START THE MEDIUM 
RANGE FORECAST A STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
DOMINATE THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION. ONLY FORCING WILL BE LOCAL 
TERRAIN...SO WILL KEEP HIGHEST POPS THERE FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. UPPER RIDGE SLOWLY WEAKENS THROUGH THE WEEK AND MOISTURE 
INCREASES...SO WILL CALL FOR A SLOW INCREASE IN POPS.

FOR SATURDAY..GFS SHOWS A WEAK FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
THEN TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY. WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN 
CHANCE POPS INTO THE WEEKEND. THIS BOUNDARY BECOMES QUASI-STATIONARY 
OVER THE AREA FOR MONDAY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS CLOSELY THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM...

BEEN ALONG THE PLATEAU BUT THAT AREA IS HAS BEEN WEAKENING. MAY SEE 
A STILL SEE A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS 
DURING THE EVENING HOURS...SO WILL LEAVE LOW POPS FOR THAT AREA. A 
SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO BRING BETTER COVERAGE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS LATE TONIGHT AND ESPECIALLY TUESDAY. HIGHEST CHANCE 
WILL BE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA WHERE THE BEST 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED. MAY SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS IN THOSE AREAS ON TUESDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT WERE CLOSE SO 
DIDN'T STRAY TOO FAR. WITH THE RAIN AND CLOUDS...STAYED NEAR THE 
MET/MAV BLEND TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE FORECAST 
TO BUILD EAST OVER THE AREA DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE 
PERIOD...WHICH MAY HELP TO LIMIT CONVECTION FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY.  STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE SOME INSTABILITY...SO WILL 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE A BIT LATE IN THE 
PERIOD...WITH ECMWF MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH EASTERN TROUGH AND 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT THAN GFS.  HOWEVER...EVEN GFS HAS FRONT 
SAGGING SOUTH TOWARD THE AREA BY MONDAY...AND DOES APPEAR 
MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ALONG WITH MORE CONVECTION...SO WILL CARRY 
LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...AND INDICATE A RETURN TO VERY HOT 
CONDITIONS AT LEAST FOR THE WED THROUGH FRIDAY TIME FRAME.  TEMPS 
MAY LOWER A BIT BY LATE IN PERIOD ASSUMING MORE CLOUDS/CONVECTION.

FXUS64 KMRX 181412
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1012 AM EDT MON JUL 18 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. RADAR INDICATING A FEW 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING ALONG THE PLATEAU. BEST CHANCES SHOULD REMAIN 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TODAY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOULD STAY RAIN FREE THIS MORNING
...THEN ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAY POP UP OVER THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE THE MAIN 
FACTOR TODAY...WITH MAX TEMPS LIKELY TO WARM BY ABOUT 1 TO 3 
DEGREES. HOWEVER...PRECIPITABLE WATER REMAINS RATHER HIGH OVER THE 
REGION...AND GFS MOS HAS PERFORMED VERY POORLY ON MAX TEMPS. SO...
WILL UNDERCUT GFS MOS MAXES AGAIN TODAY AND LEAN TOWARD THE SLIGHTLY 
COOLER NAM-WRF MOS. 

A STRAY STORM OR TWO COULD LINGER INTO THE EVENING HOUR..BUT MODELS 
DEVELOP MORE CONVECTION LATE TONIGHT TO OUR NW. THIS ACTIVITY COULD 
REACH PARTS OF SW VA AND THE NRN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU IN THE 06Z-12Z.
MINOR CHANGE FOR TONIGHT WAS TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE 
AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT. UNDERCUT SIMILAR MOS MINS JUST SLIGHTLY...
BASED ON LATEST TREND IN MOS ERROR (TOO MILD).

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FORECAST AREA STAYS NEAR
OUTER EDGE OF UPPER RIDGE WITH SHORTWAVE MOVING SOUTH FROM THE
GREAT LAKES TUESDAY. INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
TUESDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON. STEEP LAPSE RATES AND HIGH DEW
POINTS COMBINED WITH DAY TIME HEATING WILL MEAN A RISK FOR STRONG
TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND POSSIBLE LARGE
HAIL. TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AIR MASS DRIES OUT SOME BUT STILL
SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND RIDGE TO BRING CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS. CENTER OF RIDGE SHIFTS EAST TO TN VALLEY THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY SO ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. RIDGE BEGINS TO
BREAK DOWN ON THE WEEKEND SO MORE SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE INTO THE
EAST TN VALLEY. INCREASED POPS TO 30 PERCENT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT SUN JUL 17 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE THAT
PUSHED SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA AROUND PERIPHERY OF BUILDING UPPER
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA CONTINUES
TO PUSH SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THIS
AFTERNOON. WILL ACCOUNT FOR ANY REMAINING DIURNAL SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS
WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE AREA THIS EVENING. 

MODELS ARE SIMILAR IN BUILDING MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE CLOSER TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY. WITH EXPECTED
INCREASED SUNSHINE...TEMPS SHOULD WARM UP CLOSER TO GUIDANCE
NUMBERS THAN THE PAST FEW DAYS. WILL ONLY KEEP IN SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS FOR PLATEAU AND MOUNTAIN COUNTIES FOR DIURNAL SHOWERS AND
ISOLATED STORMS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEP MOISTURE IS 
LIMITED FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD...BUT INSTABILITY AND SHALLOW 
MOISTURE LINGERING UNTIL SUNDAY. SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE LOW 
CHANCE POPS. HIGHEST CHANCES WILL BE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE PERIOD... 
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

QUITE CLOSE WITH NO REASON TO STRAY FROM.

VALLEYS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT SO NOT MUCH CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND

UPPER FLOW MORE NW WITH RIDGE STILL CENTERED TO THE WEST. DRIER

TREND OF WARMER TEMPERATURES AS UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS OVER THE
EASTERN STATES. FOR TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY WILL CONTINUE 20 TO 30
PERCENT CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS.
