GO CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM.

THINK CONVECTION WILL DEFINITELY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET WITH LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HEATING...AND AS THE WEAK TROUGH SLIPS EAST AND DAMPENS OUT. 
PREVIOUS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS...MOSTLY FOR THE EVENING...LOOK GOOD. 
MOS MIN TEMPS WERE CLOSE AND FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORT TERM MODELS CONTINUE
TO STRENGTHEN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH
THE TN VALLEY BEING ON THE EASTERN EDGE. MAIN SHORT WAVE ENERGY
WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT NORTH AND EAST. THICKNESSES WILL INCREASE WITH
A GRADUAL WARMING TREND. WILL CONTINUE LOW RAIN CHANCES SW AND
SLIGHTLY HIGHER NE SUNDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE ONLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS
MONDAY. HIGHS WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER SUNDAY AND A FEW
DEGREES WARMER MONDAY. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY UPPER TROUGH SETS UP
ALONG THE EAST COAST WITH UPPER RIDGE SHIFTING WEST AGAIN. INCREASED
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK.
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY CHANCES LOWER AGAIN. TEMPERATURES STAY ABOVE
NORMAL AT THE END OF THE WEEK WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S.

OCCURRED OVER THE PAST 6 HOURS.

INCHES OF PRECIPITABLE WATER...BUT LESS THAN 1 INCH PER RNK 15/00Z 
SOUNDING. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AXIS WILL BE A FOCUS FOR 
DEVELOPMENT WITH WEAK FRONT JUST TO OUR SOUTH. NUDGED POPS UP TO 
LIKELY OR HIGHER FOR TODAY...AND MENTIONED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS FOR 
ALL BUT NE TN/SW VA AREAS. HARD TO DETERMINE WHERE TROUGH AXIS WILL 
BE OR IF OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES ARE A FACTOR...SO WENT WITH CHANCE POPS 
AND SCATTERED WORDING FOR TONIGHT.

OTHERWISE...MORNING CONVECTION SHOULD SPOIL REACHING THE HOTTER GFS 
MOS MAX TEMPS...SO WENT FOR A BLEND. MOS MINS QUITE CLOSE FOR 
TONIGHT AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
ROTATING AROUND UPPER RIDGE CENTERED TO THE WEST OVER THE PLAINS 
WILL CONTINUE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT. RIDGE STRENGTHENS SUNDAY SO KEEPING SLIGHT CHANCE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. SAME PATTERN MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
THURSDAY RIDGE NEARLY OVERHEAD SO KEPT IT DRY. TEMPERATURES WILL
SLOWLY WARM INTO THE MID TO UPPER 80S SUNDAY THEN UPPER 80S TO
LOWER 90S MONDAY WITH LOWER TO MID 90S TO THE END OF THE EXTENDED.

BECOME STRONG...POSSIBLY SEVERE.  IT WILL BE ANOTHER HOT DAY...BUT 
WITH RESIDUAL CLOUDS COVER...HIGHS SHOULD REMAIN IN THE LOWER TO MID 
90S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.  THEREFORE...HEAT INDICES SHOULD STAY 
BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL FOR THE PERIOD.  UPPER FLOW WILL BE NORTHWEST WHICH WILL BE 
FAVORABLE FOR SOUTHEAST MOVING CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES...AND WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE LINGERING NOT FAR FROM OUR SOUTHERN BORDER 
FOR THE EARLY PART OF THE PERIOD...SO SHOULD BE CONVECTIVELY ACTIVE 
INTO AT LEAST SATURDAY. MODELS INDICATE UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO 
REESTABLISH ITSELF BY THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD...SO WILL HAVE 
NO MORE THAN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...AND 
TEMPS WILL BE TRENDING BACK UPWARD.  HIGH TEMPS EARLY IN THE PERIOD 
ARE PROBLEMATIC GIVEN SENSITIVITY TO AND UNCERTAINTY ABOUT DETAILS 
OF CLOUD COVER/PRECIP. MOST MET NUMBERS MUCH LOWER THAN MAV FOR 
HIGHS BOTH THU AND FRI.  THINK MAV NUMBERS LOOK TOO HIGH...AND GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY WILL GENERALLY USE A BLEND.  NOT MUCH ARGUMENT WITH MEX 
TEMPS FOR LATER PERIODS.   


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             95  73  94  74  90 /  50  20  40  20  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  93  70  92  72  89 /  40  20  30  20  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       93  70  92  71  89 /  50  20  30  20  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              90  68  90  67  84 /  50  20  20  20  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

MJB/LDW

FXUS64 KMRX 130623
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
200 AM EDT WED JUL 13 2011

.AVIATION...CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS HAVE THINNED OUT...SO PATCHY 
FOG MAY DEVELOP BEFORE DAYBREAK WHERE HEAVIER RAINS FELL ON TUESDAY. 
THIS FOG IS MOST LIKELY TO AFFECT TRI...WHERE MVFR VISBYS ARE 
MENTIONED. OTHERWISE...NEW TSRA COMPLEX SEEMS TO BE UNDERWAY OVER 
WRN KY AND WILL BE MOVING SE OVERNIGHT. THIS FEATURE PLUS WEAK COLD 
FRONT DROPPING SOUTH...MAY LEAD TO SCATTERED CONVECTION FOR ALL 3 
TAF SITES ON WEDNESDAY. FOR NOW...CARRIED VCSH AND TEMPO SHOWERS 
WHEN MOST LIKELY...WITH CB REMARK INSTEAD OF VCTS OR A BRIEF PERIOD 
OF TSRA.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

134 
FXUS64 KMRX 130117
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT TUE JUL 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...BUT CLOSEST SHOWERS OR TSRA ARE WELL TO OUR NW. STRONG LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONVERGENCE OVER WRN KY INTO SRN MO SEEMS TO BE THE 
MOST LIKELY AREA FOR DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT. THIS ACTIVITY WOULD MOVE 
SE TOWARD OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES...SO WILL CARRY HIGHEST CHANCE POPS 
FOR THAT AREA IN UPDATED FORECAST. ELSEWHERE...SHOULD BE ABLE TO 
LOWER POPS SLIGHTLY FOR REST OF THE NIGHT.  

HEAT ADVISORY FOR SE TN HAS EXPIRED. FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS 
WILL BE UPDATED BY 10 PM EDT.

737 
FXUS64 KMRX 122340
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
740 PM EDT TUE JUL 12 2011

.AVIATION...FORECAST AREA IS VOID OF CONVECTION AT THIS TIME. WEAK 
FRONT AND WEAKENING COMPLEX OVER ERN KY WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED OVER 
THE EVENING HOURS. HOWEVER...FOR NOW JUST A VCSH FOR TRI OVERNIGHT. 
MIGHT GET MVFR CONDITIONS BRIEFLY AT TYS AND TRI...BUT ONLY IF 
CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS THIN OUT COMPLETELY LATER TONIGHT.

OTHERWISE...BEST CHANCES OF CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE OVER 
NRN AREAS...SO WILL CARRY SHOWERS WITH CB FOR TRI TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. WILL TAKE A WAIT AND SEE APPROACH FOR TYS AND CHA...AS
LOCATION OF FRONT WILL BE AN IMPORTANT FACTOR.


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...NOT AS WARM TODAY AS EXPECTED 
AS CLOUD COVER FROM MORNING THUNDERSTORMS KEPT NORTHEAST HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ONLY RISING INTO THE 80S AND PLACES FARTHER WEST ON 
THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AND MOUNTAINS HAD THUNDERSTORMS 
DEVELOP BY MID AFTERNOON IN THE VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS. TEMPERATURES 
REACHED THE LOWER 90S ONLY IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. HAVE CANCELLED 
HEAT ADVISORY FOR KNOXVILLE AREA BUT KEPT IT IN EFFECT FOR 
CHATTANOOGA AND SURROUNDING COUNTIES WHERE VALUES EARLIER TODAY 
REACHED ABOVE 100. FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL SAG SOUTHWARD LATER TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
AND BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE TN VALLEY. MCS ACTIVITY NOW 
OVER SOUTH CENTRAL KY AND A NEW AREA DEVELOPING OVER MO WILL LIKELY 
AFFECT THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING BY LEAVING OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WITH NEW DEVELOPMENT 
ON THE BOUNDARIES SIMILAR TO THIS MORNINGS STORMS. WITH THAT IN MIND 
HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND 40 TO 
50 PERCENT POP WEDNESDAY AS FRONT MOVES INTO NORTHERN TN. KEPT 
TEMPERATURES MILD OVERNIGHT AND A BLEND OF MAV AND NAM FOR HIGHS 
NEAR 90 TO THE MID 90S. WITH CLOUD COVER AND OVERNIGHT STORMS THESE 
MAY EVEN BE TOO HIGH. WILL LET SPS EXPIRE FOR THE HEAT AT 00Z BUT 
MIDNIGHT SHIFT MAY WANT TO REISSUE FOR SOUTHERN SECTIONS WHERE HEAT 
INDEX VALUES MAY REACH OVER 100 ONCE AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A STAGNANT BUT CONVECTIVELY ACTIVE PATTERN WILL 
LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AN UPPER-LEVEL 
HIGH IS PROGGED TO BECOME CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS BY 
THURSDAY...WHICH WILL CREATE A NORTH-TO-NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN WILL BE 
CONDUCIVE FOR A FEW MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS FROM THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION TO EVENTUALLY AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY AT THE SURFACE IS PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA INTO THE DEEP SOUTH BY THURSDAY...BUT THINK THAT THIS SCENARIO 
IS TOO OPTIMISTIC GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR AND THE FACT THAT THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN SHOULD SLOW ITS SOUTHWARD PROGRESS. WITH A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP EVERY AFTERNOON/EVENING AROUND 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SCATTERED CONVECTION SHOULD DEVELOP MOST EVERY 
DAY ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME MCS ACTIVITY ORIGINATING FROM 
THE NORTH. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD IN REGARDS TO MINS...BUT WILL TREND 
SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH MAXES SINCE THAT HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND 
LATELY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   75  96  75  93  74 /  20  50  20  40  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     74  93  72  92  71 /  30  40  20  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             74  93  72  92  71 /  40  50  20  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    69  90  68  90  68 /  30  50  20  30  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...WEST POLK.

VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1106 AM EDT TUE JUL 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS BEGINNING TO DECREASE THE PAST HOUR
AFTER COVERING MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND THIS
MORNING. ONLY AREA NOT AFFECTED SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND PARTS OF THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY NEAR CHA. TEMPERATURES ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL
SECTIONS WERE STILL IN THE 70S AT 10 AM. ONLY FULL SUN AREA LATE
THIS MORNING IS SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND NEAR CHA. AM RELUCTANT TO DROP
HEAT ADVISORY SO JUST SHAVED A COUPLE DEGREES OFF HIGH TEMPERATURES
AND DELAYED HIGHEST TEMPERATURES TO LATER IN THE DAY. HEAT INDEX
TEMPERATURES NEAR 105 WILL LIKELY BE FOR ONLY A COUPLE HOURS
CENTRAL SECTIONS BUT LONGER NEAR CHA. STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE THIS
AFTERNOON WITH RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES CAUSING
LOCALIZED FLOODING IN A FEW AREAS.

956 
FXUS64 KMRX 120652
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 AM EDT TUE JUL 12 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT RADAR SHOWS CONVECTION 
SINKING SOUTH OVER NORTHERN AREAS.  MODELS INDICATE UPPER RIDGE WILL 
BEGIN TO WEAKEN OVER THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  LOOKS LIKE 
CAPE VALUES WILL BE HIGHER TODAY...AND WITH RESIDUAL OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES AROUND LOOKS LIKE BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION.  WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES TODAY...AND CHANCE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS 
TONIGHT.  TEMPS PROBLEMATIC...AS WILL BE QUITE SENSITIVE TO CLOUDS 
AND ANY PRECIP. MAV TEMPS LOOK ON THE HIGH SIDE...UNLESS 
CONVECTION/CLOUDS ARE LESS THAN EXPECTED.  FOR NOW WILL GO WITH A 
MAV/MET BLEND FOR HIGHS...BUT WILL STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS FOR LOWS. 
RECORD TEMP AT TRI FOR TODAY LOOKS TO BE THE MOST VULNERABLE.  
RECORDS FOR TODAY ARE 104 AT CHA...104 AT TYS...AND 93 AT TRI. HEAT 
ADVISORY STILL LOOKS REASONABLE...SO WILL LEAVE AS IS FOR NOW...WITH 
SPS FOR OTHER AREAS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE 
FORECAST FOR THE EXTENDED.  OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN STILL ON TRACK 
WITH UPPER RIDGE SHIFTING WEST...PUTTING THE MRX CWA IN A GENERALLY 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE IN AND REMAIN  
QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD AS WELL.  THE 
END RESULT WILL BE AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.  BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL BE WEDNESDAY AS THE 
BOUNDARY SETTLES INTO THE AREA.  WITH THE BOUNDARY IN PLACE... 
DECENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND EXPECTED STRAY 
MCS MOVING THROUGH...WILL KEEP 20 TO 30 POPS OVER THE AREA FOR THE 
REST OF THE PERIOD. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  100  74  97  74  94 /  30  20  50  20  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     98  74  94  71  88 /  30  30  50  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             98  73  94  71  88 /  30  30  50  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    95  69  90  68  86 /  30  30  50  20  30

.AVIATION...CURRENT RADAR SHOWS CONVECTION TO THE NORTH SINKING
SOUTH. THIS SHOULD AFFECT TRI EARLY IN PERIOD...AND MAY MAKE IT
FURTHER SOUTH TO TYS. WILL INCLUDE VCTS AND BRIEF TEMPO TSRA AT
TRI AND JUST CB AT TYS EARLY IN PERIOD. WILL ALSO INCLUDE CB ALL
SITES FOR DAYTIME/EARLY EVENING BEFORE DROPPING AS ADDITIONAL
CONVECTION EXPECTED TODAY. MAY BE SOME FOG/HAZE FORMATION TOWARDS
DAYBREAK...BUT HOW MUCH IF ANY VIS RESTRICTION UNCERTAIN. WILL JUST
MENTION 6SM IN HAZE AT TYS AND CHA...WITH MVFR VIS FOR SEVERAL
HOURS AT TRI.

157 
FXUS64 KMRX 111917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON JUL 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...ANOTHER HOT DAY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 90S AND EXPECTED TO REACH 
THE UPPER 90S IN SOME PLACES. TRI WILL LIKELY TIE OR BREAK THE OLD 
RECORD OF 95 SET IN 1988. HEAT INDEX VALUES ARE OVER 100 AT CHA AND 
AROUND 100 IN THE KNOXVILLE AREA. LOWER DEW POINTS IN NE TN AND SW 
VA HAVE KEPT HEAT INDEX VALUES BELOW 100. VERY LITTLE SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AT MID AFTERNOON BUT WITH STRONG HEATING 
EXPECT SOME ACTIVITY TO DEVELOP NEXT FEW HOURS. MCS OVER OHIO IS 
MOVING SE AND COULD REACH SW VA OR PUT OUT OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES ACROSS 
EASTERN KY THAT WILL AFFECT SW VA OR NE TN LATE TONIGHT. HAVE CHANCE 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THAT AREA LATER TONIGHT. A FEW COULD 
BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE WITH HIGH WINDS THE MAIN THREAT. TONIGHT 
TEMPERATURES ONLY DROP TO LOW TO MID 70S. TUESDAY MORE HEAT WITH 
RIDGE STILL OVER TN VALLEY. TEMPERATURES AS HOT OR A DEGREE WARMER 
WITH HIGHER DEW POINTS EXPECTED SO ISSUED HEAT ADVISORY FOR 
KNOXVILLE SOUTH TO CHATTANOOGA. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE 
MORE NUMEROUS BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS COLD FRONT NOW MOVING INTO MID 
MS VALLEY AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY INTO 
KY. THE HOT TEMPERATURES MAY DROP BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS BEFORE 
EVENING IF THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP BY AFTERNOON IN THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A STAGNANT PATTERN WILL LINGER OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY IS PROGGED TO RETROGRADE NORTHWESTWARD INTO THE 
MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND CENTRAL PLAINS BY THE END OF THE WEEK... 
WHICH WILL CREATE A NORTH TO NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY AT THE SURFACE WILL LIKELY 
REMAIN SOMEWHAT STATIONARY AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...CREATING A CONVECTIVELY ACTIVE PATTERN FOR THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED 
EVERY AFTERNOON/EVENING AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SCATTERED 
CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE MOST EVERY DAY WITH A FEW ORGANIZED MCS 
SYSTEMS ALSO AFFECTING THE AREA FROM THE MID WEST REGION. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD IN REGARDS TO MINS...BUT WILL TREND SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH 
MAXES SINCE THAT HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

939 
FXUS64 KMRX 110757
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
357 AM EDT MON JUL 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE OVER
THE AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM...WITH VERY HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS
AGAIN TODAY. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE...SO HIGH TEMPS MAY APPROACH
RECORD VALUES. RECORDS FOR TODAY ARE 100 AT CHA...99 AT TYS...AND
95 AT TRI. WILL MENTION NEAR RECORD HIGHS ALL ZONES IN THE
FORECAST. HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL LIKELY REACH TO BETWEEN 100 AND
105 IN MANY CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS...AND MAY
APPROACH 100 IN MANY OTHER VALLEY AREAS. WHILE STILL BELOW HEAT
ADVISORY CRITERIA...THIS CONCERN WILL BE ADDRESSED IN AN SPS. WHILE
MODELS INDICATE CAPES WILL BE AGAIN BE UNIMPRESSIVE...THERE SHOULD
BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION AGAIN...SO WILL
INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE GFS/ECMWF HAVE GENERALLY
DONE WELL MAINTAINING CONSISTENCY WITH THE EXTENDED FORECAST FOR
THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. THEREFORE...HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES
OTHER THAN CONTINUING TO SLIGHTLY TWEAK PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS BACK ON TUESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE REMAINS IN PLACE WHILE
ADJUSTING POPS HIGHER DURING THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
TIME FRAME AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY CONTINUES TO BUILD THROUGH THE
NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH. TROUGH AMPLIFIES AS IT DROPS
SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY. THE
RESULTING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL PUSH THE SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY INTO
THE FORECAST AREA GENERATING THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION DURING
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. HAD TO MAINTAIN SOME SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE
POPS BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH THE HIGHER POPS SOUTH DUE TO THE
FACT THAT THERE WILL BE NO SIGNIFICANT REDUCTION IN HIGH DEWPOINT
AIRMASS BEHIND THE FRONT. ALSO MODELS PROG A WEAK SHORTWAVE
DROPPING IN BEHIND THE MIDWEEK ACTION WHICH WILL WORK WITH THE
RELATIVELY MOIST LOW LEVEL AIRMASS GENERATING WEAK TO MODERATE
INSTABILITY ACROSS THE REGION. RAISED POPS TO LOW CHANCE CATEGORY
ON SATURDAY AS THE GFS AND ECMWF MAINTAIN THE TREND OF BRINGING
MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY SOUTH ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND PART OF THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AROUND THE PERIPHERY OF THE CENTRAL
U.S. UPPER HIGH. THIS COULD MANIFEST ITSELF IN AN MCS OR TWO MOVING
ACROSS THE AREA. JUST KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY IN PLACE
FOR SUNDAY FOR ISOLATED CONVECTION. TRENDED RELATIVELY CLOSE IF NOT
A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW MAX TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGH WEDNESDAY WHILE
UNDERCUTTING SLIGHTLY MORE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. MIN
TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKED GOOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  97  75  97  75  95 /  20  20  20  20  40

479 
FXUS64 KMRX 110142
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
942 PM EDT SUN JUL 10 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR ACTIVITY HAS WEAKENED WITH DRY WEATHER MOVING 
IN. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING RAIN CHANCES. TEMPERATURES 
AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK..NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY LINGER INTO THE EVENING HOURS ACROSS 
THE AREA...BUT MAINLY IN SOUTHERN LOCATIONS. A WEAK MID LEVEL RIDGE 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY WILL SHIFT SLIGHTLY 
EAST...ALLOWING FOR A MORE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. MODELS SHOW A 
WEAK TROUGH OVER THE AREA AT 850 MB IN THE AFTERNOON...WITH 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES A BIT HIGHER THAN TODAY. SO EXPECT THAT 
ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL AGAIN DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON. 1000-850 
THICKNESS VALUES INCREASE ABOUT 5-8 METERS TOMORROW IN THE SW 
FLOW...SO TEMPS SHOULD REACH INTO THE UPPER 90S SOUTH TO MID 90S IN 
MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY. WITH DEW POINTS IN THE LOWER 70S...THE HEAT 
INDEX WILL REACH BETWEEN 100 AND 105 IN MUCH OF THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEY FOR A FEW HOURS. WILL ISSUE A SPS TO ADDRESS THIS 
CONCERN. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
MAIN CONCERN FIRST 24 HOURS IS HOT TEMPERATURES. THICKNESS VALUES
STILL HIGH TUESDAY AND WITH DEW POINTS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE LOWER
TO MID 70S...SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN MONDAY...HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL
BE OVER 100 ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA.
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL LIKELY REACH NEAR 105
AND POSSIBLY BETWEEN 105 AND 110 FOR A FEW HOURS IN THE AFTERNOON.
MAY NEED A HEAT ADVISORY FOR TUESDAY. OTHERWISE UPPER RIDGE
CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS AND LOWER TN VALLEYS TUESDAY WILL WEAKEN
AND RETROGRADE WESTWARD TO THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES WEDNESDAY.
STRONG HEATING WILL PRODUCE AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS
TUESDAY WITH SOME POSSIBLY STRONG PRODUCING GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY
RAIN. THEN WEDNESDAY WITH FLOW BECOMING NW DISTURBANCES IN THE FLOW
WILL BRING BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN SOME
STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE AHEAD OF A WEAK COLD FRONT THAT WILL
DRIFT SOUTH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER
WEDNESDAY WITH THICKNESSES LOWERING AND MORE CLOUD COVER AND
PRECIPITATION. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH WEDNESDAY
NIGHT OR THURSDAY WHICH WILL BE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN. FROM LATE
THURSDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND HIGHER PRESSURE OVER THE NE STATES
WILL BRING COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS INTO THE REGION. HOWEVER NW
FLOW AROUND RIDGE TO THE WEST WILL BRING IN SHORTWAVES PRODUCING
AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             75  97  75  98  75 /  20  20  10  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  95  74  96  74 /  20  20  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  95  75  96  74 /  20  20  10  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              69  93  70  92  71 /  20  20  10  30  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMRX 101420 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT SUN JUL 10 2011

.DISCUSSION...
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN TODAY WILL BE HEAT INDEX VALUES IN THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY. HIGH TEMPS IN THE MID 90S WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE
LOWER 70S WILL MEAN THE HEAT INDEX WILL BE AROUND 100 DEGREES FOR A
FEW HOURS THIS AFTERNOON. WILL ISSUE A SPS TO ADDRESS THIS...AND
UPDATE THE ZFP TO ADD HEAT INDEX WORDING. FORECAST TEMPS LOOK TO BE
ON TRACK. A FAIRLY STABLE TEMPERATURE PROFILE IN THE 12Z OHX
SOUNDING AND MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS ALONG WITH DRY AIR ALOFT
SHOULD PREVENT MUCH CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON. ANY
SHOWERS THAT DEVELOP WILL LIKELY STAY ANCHORED TO THE HIGHER
TERRAIN.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

325 
FXUS64 KMRX 100715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT SUN JUL 10 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE OVER 
THE AREA FOR THE SHORT TERM...WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS AGAIN 
TODAY.  WHILE MODELS INDICATE CAPES WILL BE UNIMPRESSIVE...THERE MAY 
BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION MAINLY SOUTH AND 
CENTRAL...SO WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING.  NORTHERN AREAS LOOK TO BE MORE CAPPED. TEMPS WILL RISE 
INTO THE 90S AGAIN TODAY...AND HEAT INDEX VALUES MAY RISE TO AROUND 
100 AT LEAST IN THE SOUTH.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY SEEM REASONABLE...SO 
WILL STAY CLOSE.    


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...GFS/ECMWF MODELS NOT TOO 
DISSIMILAR DURING THE PERIOD WHICH BEGINS WITH AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
OVER MUCH OF THE MID SOUTH AND SOUTHEASTERN U.S. SUBSIDENCE WITHIN 
THE INFLUENCE OF THE RIDGE SHOULD KEEP CONVECTION RATHER LIMITED 
WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ACROSS THE SOUTH HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE ON TUESDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE SOUTHEASTERN CANADA INTO THE 
EASTERN GREAT LAKES. A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL ACCOMPANY 
INCREASING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
AND OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT. KEPT HIGHEST CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR 
CONVECTION WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH BEST LIFT IN VICINITY 
OF GRADUALLY SOUTHWARD MOVING BOUNDARY. BY THURSDAY...COOL FRONT 
SHOULD BE SLIPPING SLOWLY SOUTH TOWARD NORTHERN GEORGIA SO USED A 
GRADATION OF LOWER TO HIGHER POPS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. MODELS 
INDICATE A SLOWER SOUTHWARD ADVANCE OF THE FRONT ACROSS MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE WITH BOUNDARY POSSIBLY STALLING JUST TO THE WEST SO HELD 
ONTO SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS ON FRIDAY. BY SATURDAY CONVECTION 
SHOULD BE LIMITED MAINLY TO HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS BUT JUST APPLIED A 
BROAD BRUSHED SLIGHT CHANCE EVERYWHERE. UNDERCUT MEX MOS HIGH TEMPS 
BY A COUPLE DEGREES THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED WHILE STAYING 
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO SUGGESTED MIN TEMPS.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

529 
FXUS64 KMRX 100138
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EDT SAT JUL 9 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR ACTIVITY IS LIMITED. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
EVENING RAIN CHANCES. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
SHOWERS POPPING UP IN THE TERRAIN OF WESTERN NC MAY SKIRT OUR 
SOUTHEASTERN COUNTIES...BUT OTHERWISE A DRY NIGHT IS EXPECTED ACROSS 
THE AREA. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY WILL SHIFT EAST 
TOWARD THE CHESAPEAKE THROUGH TOMORROW. THIS WILL RESULT IN A 
SOUTHEASTERLY 925-850 MB FLOW ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH A DOWNSLOPE WIND IN THE TN VALLEY. EXPECT THAT 
THIS WILL HELP REDUCE THE CHANCES OF LOW CLOUDS DEVELOPING 
OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER DEW POINTS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S THIS 
AFTERNOON MAY RESULT IN SOME PATCHY FOG FORMATION. A MORE 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS TOMORROW AS THE HIGH MOVES OFFSHORE. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS TOMORROW SHOW A WEAK CAP AND DRY AIR ALOFT THAT 
SHOULD SUPPRESS CONVECTION. SOME AFTERNOON SHOWERS MAY BE POSSIBLE 
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN..BUT SHOULD BE SHORT-LIVED AND ISOLATED. HIGHS 
WILL BE WARMER...REACHING THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S IN MOST SPOTS. 
THE HEAT INDEX COULD BRIEFLY TOUCH 100 IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
SUNDAY NIGHT ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC AS UPSLOPE FLOW ON OTHER SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS 
CONTINUES WITH NO SHOWERS IN THE TN VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
ALOFT WITH SURFACE HIGH OVER MID ATLANTIC MONDAY CONTINUES HOT AND 
MOSTLY DRY FORECAST WITH CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU 
SEEING SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. TUESDAY THE PATTERN 
BEGINS TO CHANGE AS UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES MOVE SE INTO THE OHIO 
AND TN VALLEYS AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. CHANCE OF AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM TUESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. SATURDAY HIGH MAY STRENGTHEN ENOUGH THAT DRIER 
AIR MASS MAY KEEP SHOWERS FROM DEVELOPING BUT FOR NOW STILL HAVE 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. SHORT RANGE MODELS PUSH TEMPERATURES INTO 
THE UPPER 90S MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP HIGHS A COUPLE 
DEGREES COOLER MAINLY IN LOWER TO MID 90S EXCEPT AT CHA THEN COOLING 
A FEW DEGREES LATE IN THE WEEK. HEAT INDEX VALUES SHOULD REACH OVER 
100 IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY NEAR CHATTANOOGA MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  95  73  97  74 /  10  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  93  72  93  72 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  93  72  93  72 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  90  67  91  68 /  10  10  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 091416 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1016 AM EDT SAT JUL 9 2011

.DISCUSSION...
WATER VAPOR SATELLITE AND 12Z RAOBS SHOW MUCH DRIER AIR HAS PUSHED
INTO THE AREA OVERNIGHT BEHIND A MIDLEVEL TROUGH. AT THE
SURFACE...A TROUGH OR WEAK FRONT IS LOCATED TO OUR SOUTH...WITH AN
INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE NC MOUNTAINS. THESE BOUNDARIES
SHOULD BE THE FOCUS FOR AFTERNOON CONVECTION...AND SHOULD KEEP MOST
ACTIVITY SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR AREA. AN ISOLATED SHOWER CANNOT BE
RULED OUT IN THE SMOKIES OR EXTREME SW NC...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS GOING IN THOSE AREAS. MORNING CLOUDS AND FOG ARE SLOWLY
LIFTING AND ERODING...WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO WARM INTO THE MID
80S TO LOWER 90S. NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

&&

NC...NONE.

665 
FXUS64 KMRX 090746
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 AM EDT SAT JUL 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WATER VAPOR CLEARLY SHOWS A
SHORT-WAVE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH A GOOD
DEAL OF MID AND UPPER LEVEL DRIER AIR SPILLING INTO THE FORECAST AREA.
AT THE SURFACE...SLIGHTLY DRIER AND STABLE AIR IS MOVING INTO THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA..ESPECIALLY NORTHERN PLATEAU AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE LOW CLOUDS AND FOG (SOME DENSE) IS
DEVELOPING AND SPREADING SOUTHWEST. THE DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR
WILL KEEP CHANCES OF CONVECTION CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAINS AND
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE A INVERTED TROUGH WILL HELP KEEP BETTER
INSTABILITY AND FOCUS FOR LIFT THIS AFTERNOON-EVENING HOURS.

ONCE THE MORNING CLOUDS MOVES EAST (LOWS CLOUDS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
AND PLATEAU DISSIPATE)...MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY AFTERNOON IS
IN STORE FOR MOST LOCATIONS. THE RETURN OF SUNSHINE WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO WARM UP.

FOR TONIGHT...PATCHY FOG WILL LIKELY DEVELOP AGAIN...ESPECIALLY
NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS GENERALLY 
AGREE ON A SCENARIO WHICH INCLUDES LINGERING MOISTURE/INSTABILITY 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA IN THE 
VICINITY OF A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY. BUILDING HEIGHTS ALOFT SHOULD 
LIMIT CONVECTION TO OROGRAPHICALLY FAVORED AREAS WITH ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE PROBABILITIES. THE PERIOD TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WILL 
BECOME A LITTLE MORE CONVECTIVELY ACTIVE AS UPPER TROUGH MIGRATES 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN STATES. ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDS 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY SO APPLIED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS AT 
THIS TIME REDUCING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR ALL BUT THE SOUTHERN 
TIER COUNTIES OF THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY DUE TO EXPECTED 
GRADUAL SOUTHWARD BOUNDARY MOVEMENT. REDUCED POP TO SLIGHT CHANCE ON 
FRIDAY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY INVOLVED IN POSITION/TIMING OF GREAT LAKES 
AND UPPER OHIO VALLEY SHORTWAVE. ONCE AGAIN TRIMMED SEVERAL DEGREES 
OFF RATHER UNREALISTIC MOS MAX TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             93  72  94  74  96 /  10  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  70  92  72  93 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  70  91  72  93 /  10  10  10  10  10

321 
FXUS64 KMRX 090155
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EDT FRI JUL 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR ACTIVITY HAS WEAKENED. WILL UPDATED FORECAST TO 
LOWER POPS FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
NUMEROUS SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED IN A MOIST ENVIRONMENT AHEAD OF A 
BROAD UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONT. WITH THE LACK OF DEEP 
SHEAR...PULSE STORMS WILL BE THE MODE OF CONVECTION THROUGH THE 
EVENING. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT...THOUGH 
STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE. VERY LITTLE LIGHTNING HAS
BEEN OBSERVED WITH THESE STORMS TODAY DUE TO THE HIGH FREEZING
LEVEL. FOR THE EVENING WILL HAVE LIKELY SHOWERS WITH A CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS.

DRIER AIR ALOFT WORKS INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH BEHIND THE 700 MB 
TROUGH AXIS AROUND MIDNIGHT. PRECIP CHANCES WILL DECREASE FROM NORTH 
TO SOUTH AS THE DRIER AIR BUILDS IN...AND ALL PRECIP SHOULD EXIT THE 
AREA BY SUNRISE. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERS INTO SATURDAY 
MORNING...KEEPING CLOUDY SKIES IN PLACE. DRY ADVECTION AT 850-925 MB 
AND DAYTIME MIXING SHOULD ERODE ANY LOW CLOUDS BY MID MORNING. WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE POSITIONED OVER OHIO...AN EASTERLY FLOW OVER THE 
APPALACHIANS MAY HELP SPARK A FEW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS IN THE 
AFTERNOON...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE. HIGHS WILL 
GENERALLY BE IN THE MID 80S TO LOWER 90S. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
SURFACE LOW ALONG FRONT NEAR SOUTHERN BORDER WILL KEEP SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA 
SATURDAY EVENING. RIDGING FROM THE WEST SUNDAY SHOULD KEEP WESTERN 
SECTIONS DRY BUT WITH WEAK FRONT STILL NOT FALL TO THE SOUTH AND 
LOWER PRESSURE OVER SC AND GA UPSLOPE FLOW WILL POOL MOISTURE ALONG 
MOUNTAINS AND STILL MAY CAUSE A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DEVELOP. KEEPING MONDAY DRY FOR NOW BUT RAIN CHANCES INCREASE AGAIN 
TUESDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY AS DEEPENING TROUGH OVER NE 
SHIFTS FLOW TO THE NW AND DROPS A COOL FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
BY WEDNESDAY. GFS INDICATES DRIER AIR MAY PUSH FRONT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY WITH NO SHOWERS BUT ECMWF KEEPS CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS OVER THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE WHOLE PERIOD. WILL KEEP RAIN 
CHANCES IN THROUGH FRIDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  92  72  94  72 /  50  10  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  89  70  93  71 /  60  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  89  70  93  71 /  60  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              68  88  65  90  66 /  70  10  10  10  10

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

THUNDERSTORMS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA 
SATURDAY EVENING. RIDGING FROM THE WEST SUNDAY SHOULD KEEP WESTERN 
SECTIONS DRY BUT WITH WEAK FRONT STILL NOT FALL TO THE SOUTH AND 
LOWER PRESSURE OVER SC AND GA UPSLOPE FLOW WILL POOL MOISTURE ALONG 
MOUNTAINS AND STILL MAY CAUSE A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DEVELOP. KEEPING MONDAY DRY FOR NOW BUT RAIN CHANCES INCREASE AGAIN 
TUESDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY AS DEEPENING TROUGH OVER NE 
SHIFTS FLOW TO THE NW AND DROPS A COOL FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
BY WEDNESDAY. GFS INDICATES DRIER AIR MAY PUSH FRONT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY WITH NO SHOWERS BUT ECMWF KEEPS CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS OVER THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE WHOLE PERIOD. WILL KEEP RAIN 
CHANCES IN THROUGH FRIDAY.

&&

954 AM EDT FRI JUL 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...
A MESOSCALE VORTEX IS LOCATED OVER MIDDLE TN THIS MORNING...AND IS
MOVING DUE EAST. THE RUC SEEMS TO HAVE A HANDLE ON THIS..THOUGH THE
AMOUNT OF PRECIP THE MODELS IS PRODUCING WITH IT IS WAY OVERDONE.
BROKEN CLOUD COVER OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING WILL LIMIT THE
AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE
VORTEX SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO SPARK ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER COVERAGE AND PRECIP AMOUNTS MAY NOT BE
QUITE AS HIGH AS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST...AND SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS
WILL BE MADE WITH THE MORNING UPDATE. BEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL
CONTINUE TO BE IN NORTHERN AREAS CLOSER TO THE ENTRANCE REGION OF
THE UPPER JET. TEMPS WILL HAVE TO BE LOWERED BY A FEW DEGREES AS
WELL DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND MORNING SHOWERS.

502 
FXUS64 KMRX 080731
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EDT FRI JUL 8 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WATER VAPOR AND IR SHOWS A 
SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY THIS 
MORNING. ALSO...A 60-70KT JET AT 300 MB IS MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY. THESE FEATURES ALONG WITH A WEAK WAVE MOVING ALONG A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO AND MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL FOCUS THE 
MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION
TODAY AND EARLY TONIGHT.

PWS ARE JUST BELOW 2 INCHES WITH K INDICES IN THE MID-UPPER 30S...SO
PLENTY OF MOISTURE TO WORK WITH PRODUCING LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 
LOCALIZED FLOODING PROBLEMS ARE ANTICIPATED...BUT NOT WIDESPREAD 
ENOUGH TO WARRANT A FLASH FLOOD WATCH.  BESIDES THE CONCERN OF HEAVY
RAINFALL...ENOUGH DAYTIME HEATING TO PRODUCE MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIRMASS THIS AFTERNOON-EVENING WITH STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE 
WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS.

CONVECTION WILL WEAKEN AND COVERGE WILL LESSEN OVERNIGHT DUE TO LOSS 
OF DAYTIME HEATING AND SHORT-WAVE MOVING EAST OF THE AREA.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS DUE TO BETTER
PERFORMANCE THE LAST COUPLE DAYS.

IN THE SHORT-TERM...WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG FOR THIS MORNING.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...EASTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH 
MIGRATES SLOWLY EAST TO THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD BY 00Z SUNDAY WITH 
NORTHERLY FLOW PUSHING COOL FRONT TOWARD SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE BY 
EVENING. KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE CATEGORY GRADATION FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM WEST THROUGH EAST IN THE MORNING 
MAINTAINING THE HIGHER PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION ACROSS THE FAR 
EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS DURING THE AFTERNOON AS INSTABILITY AXIS 
DRIFTS FURTHER EAST. MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL DRY OUT AS 
HEIGHTS BUILD THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK. HELD ONTO A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION IN THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER OVER THE WEEKEND WHILE DROPPING FORECAST AREA WIDE 
ON MONDAY WITH RIDGE AXIS JUST TO THE WEST. NORTHEASTERN CORNER OF 
THE BIG RIDGE YIELDS TO THE GRADUALLY DEEPENING GREAT LAKES 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. THE 
RESULTING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL PROVIDE A CORRIDOR FOR A 
THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX OR TWO ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WITH 
CONVECTION BUILDING SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY. STAYED WITH BEST COVERAGE OF CHANCE 
PROBABILITIES FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS BOUNDARY 
DROPS SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. IT APPEARS THAT THE MEX MOS 
MAX TEMP GUIDANCE IS JUST A WEE BIT TOO WARM THROUGH MOST OF THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD SO UNDERCUT BY SEVERAL DEGREES.

213 
FXUS64 KMRX 080103
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT THU JUL 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...PERSISTENT PATTERN CONTINUES. BULK OF DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WAINING WITH SUNSET. STRAY SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT.
PATCHY LATE NIGHT FOG. PRECIPITATION COVERAGE EXPECTED TO BE MORE 
WIDESPREAD AND EARLY FRIDAY. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE BROAD MID LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL AMPLIFY 
TONIGHT...INCREASING SYNOPTIC LIFT AND PRECIP CHANCES TOMORROW.
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY LINGER THROUGH THE NIGHT...BUT MOST OF
THE ACTIVITY NOW SEEN ON RADAR WILL DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET. BY
FRIDAY AFTERNOON THE UPPER JET BECOMES POSITIONED OVER THE UPPER
OHIO RIVER AND CENTRAL APPALACHIAN REGION. THE NAM SHOWS A
FRONTOGENESIS ZONE IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET OVER SW VA.
THIS AREA OF ENHANCED LIFT ALONG WITH PW VALUES NEAR 2 INCHES COULD
PRODUCE PERIODS OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN NORTH TOMORROW EVENING. WILL
HAVE POPS RISING TO CATEGORICAL NORTH IN THE AFTERNOON...AND
WIDESPREAD RAIN AMOUNTS IN EXCESS OF 1 INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE
THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING. A FLOOD WATCH WAS CONSIDERED...BUT WOULD
PREFER BETTER MODEL AGREEMENT IN PRECIP AMOUNTS AS THE NAM SHOWS
MUCH MORE QPF IN OUR COUNTIES THAN THE GFS. THE THREAT OF SEVERE
STORMS WILL DEPEND ON MORNING CLOUD COVER AND RESULTING
DESTABILIZATION...WHICH IS HIGHLY UNCERTAIN...BUT SOUTHERN AREAS
WILL LIKELY HAVE THE GREATEST THREAT. PRECIP CHANCES SHOULD BEGIN
TO DECREASE TO A CHANCE LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER JET SHIFTS
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
COLD FRONT EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA
SOMETIME SATURDAY WITH UPPER TROUGH MOVING TO THE EAST COAST AND
RIDGING BUILDING IN FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND SOUTH CENTRAL
STATES. GFS FASTER THAN NAM MODEL WHICH KEEPS SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS AT LEAST THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS MOUNTAINS AND EASTERN HALF OF SW VA AND NE TN. SUNDAY
AND MONDAY RIDGING MOVES OVER WITH HEATING PRODUCING ONLY ISOLATED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MOUNTAINS. TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY NW FLOW AROUND RIDGE WILL BRING WEATHER SYSTEMS CLOSE TO
THE FORECAST AREA AS ANOTHER FRONT DRIFTS SOUTH INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO THE LOWER TO MID 90S AFTER
TOMORROW AND CONTINUE THERE THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  91  71  93  72 /  30  60  50  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT THU JUL 7 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK TROUGH ENTERING THE AREA
TODAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE CWA.
HIGHEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE INCREASES. WILL CONTINUE THE 30 TO 50 PERCENT
POPS FOR TODAY. MAY SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM
TODAY...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. ACTIVITY
SHOULD DECREASE DURING THE EVENING HOURS. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
YESTERDAY WERE ON THE HIGH SIDE SO STAYED CLOSER TO MET/MAV BLEND
TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...BUT SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE SMALLER- SCALE
DETAILS...ESPECIALLY IN REGARDS TO CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. A WEAK
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE LINGERING NEAR THE FORECAST AREA ON
FRIDAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE
TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE
SHOULD COMBINE TO PRODUCE A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ON FRIDAY
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY STILL BE
LINGERING AROUND THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...BUT MODEL
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A CAPPING STABLE LAYER WILL BEGIN TO
DEVELOP DUE TO AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
DRIFTING EASTWARD OVER THE MID SOUTH. THUS...WILL MENTION ONLY
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY...WITH CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY LIMITED
TO THE MOUNTAINS FOR SUNDAY. THIS UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL ALSO ALLOW
TEMPS TO RISE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO
APPROACH THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND BECOME STATIONARY NEAR THE
FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY. THIS WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD AGAIN
TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS IN
REGARDS TO MINS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT WILL TREND
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN THE GFS MAXES SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE
VERIFYING TREND LATELY (LIKELY DUE TO HIGHER THAN NORMAL BOUNDARY-
LAYER MOISTURE).

712 
FXUS64 KMRX 070140
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EDT WED JUL 6 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. EVENING CONVECTION HAS ENDED. 
ADJUSTED TEMPS AND DPS IN GRIDS. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...AN ATLANTIC RIDGE AND A GREAT 
PLAINS RIDGE WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM...WITH A WEAK BROAD TROUGH OVER THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. WITH VERY LITTLE CHANGE TO THE PATTERN EXPECTED...A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST WILL BE FOLLOWED. AFTERNOON HEATING WILL 
TRIGGER SCATTERED AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MOIST 
ENVIRONMENT...WITH THE MOUNTAINS/PLATEAU AND LINGERING OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES BEING THE FOCUS FOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE ABSENCE OF 
SYNOPTIC FORCING. MOST OF THE CONVECTION SHOULD DISSIPATE NEAR 
SUNSET...WITH AREAS OF PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING LATE...ESPECIALLY NEAR 
BODIES OF WATER AND IN AREAS THAT RECEIVED PRECIP. TEMPS WILL BE 
SIMILAR TO THE PAST 24 HOURS...WITH LOWS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S 
AND HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S TO LOWER 90S. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT 
WILL HANG UP OVER THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...PROVIDING 
OUR BEST CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE EXTENDED.  A FEW STORMS 
MAY LINGER OVER THE AREA INTO SATURDAY AS THE FRONT EXITS THE 
REGION.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY...BRINGING DRIER AND HOT 
CONDITIONS WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ADDITIONAL CONVECTION OVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN FOR THE BALANCE OF THE WEEKEND.  MODEL DIFFERENCES INCREASE 
BY THE END OF THE PERIOD...ESPECIALLY ON DETAILS BUT OVERALL WILL 
REMAIN IN AN UNSETTLE PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1017 AM EDT WED JUL 6 2011

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS AND VALLEY FOG ALONG WITH 12Z RAOBS INDICATE A MOIST
BOUNDARY LAYER THIS MORNING...WHICH WILL HELP FUEL AFTERNOON
CONVECTION. HOWEVER A LACK OF FORCING SHOULD KEEP COVERAGE
SCATTERED AND DISORGANIZED. NO DISCERNABLE BOUNADRIES ARE NOTED IN
SURFACE OBS OR SATELLITE IN THE AREA. DO NOT EXPECT MUCH OF A
SEVERE THREAT EITHER AS EXPECTED AFTERNOON CAPE VALUES ARE
MODEST...BETWEEN 1000 AND 1500 J/KG MUCAPE...AND SHEAR IS VERY
WEAK. ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP WILL BE SLOW MOVING DUE TO WEAK WINDS
ALOFT...AND COULD PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THE UPDATE WILL
LOWER POPS BACK A BIT INTO THE CHANCE RANGE EVERYWHERE...AND ADJUST
TEMPERATUERS DOWN SLIGHTLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 060747
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EDT WED JUL 6 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING ISOLATED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS TRACKING THROUGH THE CWA AS A BOUNDARY LINGERS
OVER THE REGION. COVERAGE SHOULD INCREASE BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE INCREASES. WILL CONTINUE THE 50-60
PERCENT POPS FOR TODAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THIS AFTERNOON.
MAY SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM TODAY...MAINLY DURING
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. ACTIVITY SHOULD DECREASE DURING
THE EVENING HOURS. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO
STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...BUT SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE SMALLER-SCALE
DETAILS. ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION ON THURSDAY...AND BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND
THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL CONTINUE
TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. THE INTERACTION OF AN
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE ON FRIDAY SHOULD HELP TO CREATE A SLIGHTLY
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS
INDICATE THAT NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL PUSH THIS COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL
HIGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS DRIFTING EASTWARD OVER THE MID SOUTH
BY SUNDAY. THIS SCENARIO SHOULD LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF CONVECTION AND
RAISE TEMPS FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT WILL LEAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN
THE FORECAST DUE TO LINGERING INSTABILITY OVER THE AREA. ANOTHER
WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON
TUESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER INCREASE IN THE CHANCES FOR CONVECTION.
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS IN REGARDS TO
MINS...BUT WILL TREND SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS WITH
MAXES SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY.

&&

MAINLY AFTN CHANCE POPS GOING THROUGH THE PERIOD. DEGREE TO WHICH

FOR LATE IN THE PERIOD. UPPER NE NA TROUGH MAY SUPPRESS RIDGE BACK 
TO THE SW. THIS WOULD INCREASE RAIN CHANCE AND LOWER TEMPS. FAVORED 
RIDGE DOMINATING FOR THIS PACKAGE. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
EXPECTED...STAYED NEAR MEX MOS FOR TEMPERATURES.

VALLEY TODAY...HELPING TO TRIGGER AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CONVECTION 
ALONG THE COLD FRONT. THIS CONVECTION WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION LIKELY

TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT 
WITH MAXES A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN YESTERDAY...DUE TO THE 
INCREASE CLOUD COVER AND COVERAGE OF CONVECTION.

BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND 
TENNESSEE VALLEY TUESDAY WITH A WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE MOVING 
ACROSS THE AREA. FAIRLY WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THIS 
BOUNDARY REMAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH FRIDAY 
KEEPING CHANCES OF CONVECTION GOING...ESPECIALLY DURING THE PEAK 
HEATING OF THE DAY AND ALSO THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  

THIS BOUNDARY WASHES OUT BY NEXT WEEKEND...BUT A WEAKNESS IN THE 
UPPER RIDGE REMAINS ALONG WITH PLENTY OF INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE 
KEEPING CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON-EVENING CONVECTION GOING.

EACH DAY...THERE IS A CHANCE OF ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS DUE TO THE 
INSTABILITY.

AS FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT SUN JUL 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CAPPING INVERSION HAS
BROKEN OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN THIS AFTERNOON...AND ONCE AGAIN THE
MAIN AREA OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE IS ACROSS FAR WRN NC. ISOLATED
TO SCATTERED CONVECTION IN THAT AREA IS DRIFTING SOUTH. ELSEWHERE
...SPOTTY CONVECTION WAS DEVELOPING OVER SW VA...MAINLY ALONG
I-81.

WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
EVENING...THEN JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. GFS 
MOS WAS SEVERAL DEGREES OFF ON LOW TEMPS AGAIN THIS MORNING...WHILE 
NAM MOS HAS BEEN JUST ABOUT RIGHT ON THE MARK. MOS BLEND OF LOWS IS 
NEAR PERSISTENCE AND CHOSEN.

FOR LATER PERIODS...THE WEAK COLD FRONT IS SHOWN TO SAG SOUTH INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA...WHILE A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND MESOSCALE 
CONVECTION SHOULD BE APPROACHING BY MONDAY NIGHT. LOCATION OF FRONT 
AND POSSIBLE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES IS UNKNOWN FOR TUESDAY...SO HARD TO 
IMPROVE ON PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS FOR THE 4TH OF JULY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. KEPT AREAL QUALIFIER OF SCATTERED AND GOOD CHANCE POPS FOR 
NOW...AND LATER SHIFTS MAY BE ABLE TO NUDGE POPS UP TO LIKELY FOR 
SOME AREAS FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.

OTHERWISE...A BLEND OF MOS FOR HIGHS EACH DAY DUE TO INCREASING 
CLOUDS AND HIGHER POPS. THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS LOOK BEST FOR MONDAY 
NIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY 
SIMILAR IN DEPICTION OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST. INITIAL SHORT WAVE 
ALONG WITH FRONTAL ADVANCE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE SLOW 
ENOUGH TO KEEP AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MOST OF THE REGION 
WITH LOW CHANCE POPS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE NEXT WAVE 
DROPS THROUGH MEAN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH ON THURSDAY WITH COOL FRONT 
APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RAISED POPS TO 40 PERCENT FOR 
CONVECTION ON THURSDAY...EXTENDING INTO THURSDAY EVENING...ACROSS 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORCAST AREA. GRADUALLY DROPPED POPS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY DRIFTS SOUTHEAST ALONG THE APPALACHIAN 
SPINE. MAINTAINED JUST A SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POP FOR POSSIBLE 
CONVECTION ON FRIDAY AS SOME WEAK INSTABILITY REMAINS ACROSS THE 
REGION. FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD KEPT MOST AREAS DRY AS LESS 
HUMID AIRMASS BUILDS IN BEHIND DEEP SOUTH FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
MAINTAINING ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP ON SATURDAY ACROSS THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. TRIMMED MAX TEMPS BACK FROM SUGGESTED GUIDANCE 
THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM AND STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
MINS.

.DISCUSSION...NOT MUCH ONGOING CONVECTION TO OUR NW THIS MORNING...

OHX SOUNDING HAD PRECIPITABLE WATER (PW) UP TO NEAR 1/75 INCHES...
AND RNK SOUNDING NOW UP TO 1.5 INCHES. REACHING FORECASTED MAX TEMPS 
WILL BREAK THE SUBSIDENCE INVERSION (CAP). HOWEVER...WITH WEAK FRONT 
STILL TO OUR NW...WIND FIELDS REMAIN QUITE WEAK. THIS LACK OF LOW 
LEVEL COVERGENCE SHOULD KEEP COVERAGE OF TSRA ON THE ISOLATED SIDE. 
LACK OF WIND SHEAR SHOULD RESULT IN VERY WEAK CONVECTION THAT IS NOT 
VERY LONG LASTING OR STRONG. 

FORECAST GRIDS LOOK ON TRACK THIS MORNING AND THERE IS NOT MUCH NEED 
FOR AN UPDATE OF GRIDS AT THIS TIME. PROBABLY WILL UPDATE THE ZFPMRX 
PRODUCT TO REMOVE THE AFTERNOON WORDING...AND MAY ALSO WORD SRN 
VALLEY POPS AS JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE INSTEAD OF ISOLATED.

AREA BY NEXT WEEKEND...WITH DRIER AIR SUCCEEDING THE BOUNDARY. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MEX GUIDANCE AFTER

AND STORMS ACROSS OHIO AND WEST VIRGINIA. A FEW SPRINKLES MAY HAVE
OCCURRED IN SW VA AND NE TN. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPED JUST
TO THE EAST IN NORTH CAROLINA AND WESTERN SOUTH CAROLINA LATE THIS
AFTERNOON BUT MOVED SOUTH SOUTHWEST INTO GEORGIA THIS EVENING. NO
MAJOR CHANGES TO FORECAST WITH VARIABLE CLOUDINESS TO CONTINUE
OVERNIGHT KEEPING TEMPERATURES UP. WILL UPDATE HOURLY TEMPERATURE
AND DEW POINT GRIDS AND REMOVE POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS FOR UPDATE.
UPDATED FORECAST OUT SOON.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 021911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT SAT JUL 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SMALL CONVECTIVE CLUSTER HAS 
DROPPED SE INTO NE KY AND WESTERN PARTS OF W VA. CAP HAS WEAKENED 
BUT I DON'T ANTICIPATE ANY TSRA REACHING OUR NRN PLATEAU OR SW VA 
COUNTIES AT THIS TIME. BEST INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE IS 
ACROSS THE TN-NC LINE...SO WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE EVENING 
POPS FOR THAT AREA. OTHERWISE...GFS MOS MINS STILL LOOK SUSPICIOUSLY 
LOW...AND BASED ON TREND OF LATE...WILL OPT FOR LOWS CLOSER TO THE 
MILDER NAM MOS. SOME CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS WILL ALSO NEED TO BE 
FACTORED IN FOR AT LEAST SW VA AND NE TN EARLY TONIGHT.

LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY...AS WEAK FRONT 
DROPPING INTO THE REGION WILL BE THE MAIN TRIGGER. CAN'T SEE THE 
BOUNDARY DROPPING SOUTH OF SE TN/SW NC THROUGH MONDAY...WITH BEST 
COVERAGE OF TSRA LIKELY BY MONDAY DAYTIME. AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND 
SLOWLY RISING POPS DON'T FAVOR THE HOTTER MAXES...BUT DO SUPPORT 
MILDER MINS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MEAN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
FINDS A HOME ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD 
WHICH WILL BRING SOME RAIN BACK TO THE FORECAST AREA ALONG WITH A 
SLIGHT REDUCTION IN MAX TEMPS. SHORT WAVE TROUGH BUILDS THROUGH THE 
AREA MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY PUSHING COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. TRENDED POPS BACK 
FROM CHANCE CATEGORY MONDAY NIGHT WITH A NORTH TO SOUTH GRADATION ON 
TUESDAY WITH HIGHER POPS NEAR STALLED BOUNDARY. BASICALLY WENT WITH 
DIURNAL CONVECTION ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES ON WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD THURSDAY KEEPING MUCH OF THE GREAT VALLEY 
DRY AS THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS THE NEXT SHORT WAVELENGTH TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THESE FEATURES BUILD INTO THE REGION 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AND STAYED WITH AN AREA WIDE CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION FOR THIS PERIOD. AGAIN KEPT MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA DRY 
ON SATURDAY BEHIND THIS COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY FAVORING HIGHER 
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AND MUCH OF SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA FOR CONVECTIVE PRECIP. TRIED 
TO UNDERCUT MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES AND WHILE SLIGHTLY RAISING MIN 
TEMPS AS GUIDANCE DOES NOT SEEM TO HAVE A HANDLE ON THE UPPER TROUGH 
PATTERN WHICH HAS A DECENT CHANCE OF PRODUCING INCREASED CLOUD 
COVER...CONVECTION AND WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EDT SAT JUL 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH A LEE 
TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID WEST IS PROGGED TO TRIGGER CONVECTION 
NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TODAY...WITH A NORTHERLY UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW LIKELY BRINGING SOME HIGH CLOUD DEBRIS FROM THIS CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO 
MENTION PARTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR TODAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A 
LITTLE MORE MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON (COMPARED 
TO YESTERDAY)...AND IT APPEARS THAT IT COULD BE ENOUGH FOR SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION AROUND THE MOUNTAINS IN THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WITH TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER 
THAN YESTERDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT 
UPPER RIDGE WILL AGAIN RETROGRADE WESTWARD AND WILL BE REPLACED BY 
BROAD LOW-AMPLITUDE TROUGH OVER MUCH OF THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE 
CONUS THROUGH THE LONG TERM. THIS WILL RESULT IN WEAK NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW ALOFT FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. A SERIES OF WEAK 
SHORT WAVES AND ACCOMPANYING SURFACE BOUNDARIES WILL KEEP THINGS 
POTENTIALLY UNSETTLED FOR OUR REGION. MODELS PROJECT INITIAL SURFACE 
BOUNDARY WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY BEFORE STALLING OUT 
JUST SOUTH OF OUR AREA. CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY BEFORE 
DRYING THINGS OUT FOR MOST OF THE AREA TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 
THINGS MORE MURKY WITH RESPECT TO SUBSEQUENT SHORT WAVE/SURFACE 
BOUNDARY LATE NEXT WEEK AS MODELS DISAGREE WITH TIMING AND 
PROGRESSION OF SYSTEM. GENERALLY CONTINUED TO SPREAD SLIGHT CHANCE 
TO CHANCE POPS ACROSS SEVERAL PERIODS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS 
FEATURE. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED MET GUIDANCE EARLY IN THE 
LONG TERM BEFORE FOLLOWING MEX GUIDANCE CLOSELY IN THE LATTER 
PORTION OF THE LONG TERM.

528 
FXUS64 KMRX 011927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT FRI JUL 1 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CONVECTION FROM MICHIGAN
TO NW IL AND IN WILL BE SPREADING CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS SOUTH
INTO OUR FORECAST AREA INTO THE EVENING HOURS. THESE CLOUDS WILL
REALLY BE THE ONLY CHANGE FROM THE PAST TWO NIGHTS. GFS MOS MINS
WERE A FEW DEGREES TOO COOL LAST NIGHT...SO PRESENCE OF SOME CLOUDS
TONIGHT FAVORS THE MILDER NAM MOS MINS OR A BLEND.

FOR LATER PERIODS...THE STEEP UPPER RIDGE WILL FLATTEN ON SATURDAY
AND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH WILL SAG SOUTHWARD...EASING
INTO NORTHERN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY. NAM MODEL SEEMS
TO BE DOING A MUCH BETTER JOB OF HANDLING CONVECTION WITH THIS
SYSTEM. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS FOR SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WERE
MUCH IN LINE WITH NAM MODEL AND CONSISTENT WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.
THUS...ONLY MINOR TWEAKS MADE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...TRIED TO KEEP THE
EXTENDED FORECAST SIMPLE. MODEL FORECASTS GENERALLY AGREE THAT AN
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES DURING
THE PERIOD. MORE SPECIFICALLY...IT APPEARS THAT TWO SHORTER
WAVELENGTH SYSTEMS WILL DROP INTO THE MEAN TROUGH DURING THE
PERIOD...EACH ASSOCIATED WITH A SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE FIRST
BUILDS IN MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND TRIED TO SHOW A HIGHER
PROBABILITY OF PRECIP ACROSS THE NORTH HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA
DURING THE DAY FOLLOWED BY HIGHER POPS SOUTH HALF MONDAY NIGHT AS
FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM SHIFT STEADILY
SOUTH DURING THIS PERIOD. FOR TUESDAY USED LOWER POPS AND SHOWED
ANOTHER DECREASING PROBABILITY FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AS THE BOUNDARY
SLOWS DOWN STALLING NEAR THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE BORDER IN NORTHERN
GEORGIA. KEPT POPS GENERALLY LIMITED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN
WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD THURSDAY AWAITING ARRIVAL OF
SECOND SHORT WAVELENGTH SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE COOL FRONT
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. AGAIN DROPPED POPS ACROSS THE NORTH ON
FRIDAY TRENDING HIGHER PROBABILITY FARTHER SOUTH AS POSSIBLE
THUNDERSTORM OUTFLOW PRESSES FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARD EXTREME
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. CONCERNING TEMP
FORECAST...WENT A LITTLE BELOW NEW MEX MOS MAX TEMPS AND NEAR TO
JUST ABOVE MINS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.

EASTERN PERIPHERY OF PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGE THROUGH THE EARLY 
PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. A WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION 
EARLY NEXT WEEK BUT ITS EFFECT IS UNCERTAIN SINCE MODELS DISAGREE ON 
THE MOISTURE PROFILE THAT ACCOMPANIES THE FRONT. MODEL DISAGREEMENT 
BECOMES EVEN GREATER THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM WITH THE 
ECMWF PROJECTING ANOTHER BOUNDARY APPROACHING BY NEXT THURSDAY. THE 
GFS KEEP THE BOUNDARY WELL NORTH HOWEVER. BASED ON THIS 
UNCERTAINTY...GENERALLY DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT THU JUN 30 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CUMULUS CLOUDS EVEN MORE
LIMITED THIS AFTERNOON THAN YESTERDAY...WITH JUST A SCANT AMOUNT OF
CUMULUS OVER THE ERN MTNS INTO WRN NC. MAX TEMPS TODAY ARE BARELY
KEEPING UP WITH MOS/HOURLY GRIDS...SO FACTORED THIS INFO INTO HIGHS
FOR FRIDAY. THIS FAVORS A MOS BLEND WHERE SLIGHT DIFFS WERE NOTED.

SURFACE HIGH STAYS MAINLY TO OUR N OR NE THROUGH THESE PERIODS AND
KEEPS MOISTURE/CLOUDS VERY LIMITED. UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY BUILDS
EASTWARD...SO EFFECT WILL BE DRY WEATHER WITH A DEGREE OR TWO
WARMER EACH DAY. BOUNDARY LAYER LOOKS TOO DRY TO CARRY ANY MENTION
OF FOG FOR NOW. 

LIGHT N-NE WIND FOR CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY WILL FAVOR A MOS BLEND
FOR MINS TONIGHT...OVER THE COOLER GFS MOS TEMPS. A BLEND FOR MINS
AGAIN ON FRIDAY NIGHT. 
 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SOME MODEL 
UNCERTAINTY DEFINITELY AT PLAY DURING THE PERIOD BUT THE GENERAL 
TREND IS FOR A BIT MORE UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN. THE RIDGE IS 
PROGGED TO RETROGRADE BACK TO THE WEST ALLOWING FOR REPLACEMENT BY A 
MEAN UPPER TROF ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. 
PLACED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION ON THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR 
SUNDAY AND THEN TRIED TO INCREASE POPS TO LOW CHANCE CATEGORY BY 
MONDAY AS MODELS BRING A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. PROGS TRY TO ADVANCE FRONT ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA BUT AM SKEPTICAL ABOUT HOW FAST A BOUNDARY CAN MOVE 
THROUGH THE REGION. THEREFORE...GENERALLY STAYED WITH LOW CHANCE 
POPS FOR DAYTIME PERIODS WITH SLIGHT CHANCE AT NIGHT FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY IN THE AREA. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE 
TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD.

POINTS DROP INTO THE 50S DURING THE AFTERNOON. TONIGHT ANOTHER DROP
TO COMFORTABLE 50S TO LOWER 60S.

LEVEL HEIGHTS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND. A WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE IS 
PROGGED TO BEGIN TO TAKE SHAPE BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WITH MORE 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY PRESENT...WILL CONTINUE WITH AT LEAST 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE AREA. A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY DROP 
SOUTHEAST FROM KENTUCKY IN TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY...SO 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION INCHES UPWARD FOR THE FORECAST AREA NEXT WEEK.

WITH AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE AREA. WILL CONTINUE WITH

AREA BY SUNDAY.

SOUTHEAST FROM KENTUCKY IN TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY...SO
WILL STILL CONTINUE FOR NOW WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE
FORECAST AREA INTO TUESDAY...AS IT IS BECOMING APPARENT THAT THE
BOUNDARY WILL BECOME VERY DIFFUSE AND MEANDER ACROSS THE AREA.
EXPECT SAME SCENARIO FOR WEDNESDAY...AND HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS TO ACCOUNT FOR AT LEAST DIURNALLY DRIVEN WIDELY

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS

SOUTHEAST OF THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SREF

FAVORED SLIGHTLY COOLER MAV GUIDANCE TONIGHT...AND A BLEND OF 
MET/MAV GUIDANCE TOMORROW.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. THE MIDLEVEL RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED 
OVER THE OZARKS THURSDAY...SHIFTING SLIGHTLY EASTWARD TO WEST TN 
FRIDAY. THE NAM SHOWS A WEAK TROUGH DROPPING SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA 
ON FRIDAY. WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY HOWEVER AS THE GFS HAS THE RIDGE 
POSITIONED FARTHER EAST WITH THE TROUGH PASSING WELL EAST. TEMPS 
WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL EACH DAY UNDER THE RIDGE...BUT WILL UNDERCUT 
GFS MOS TEMPS WHICH ARE ON THE HIGH END OF THE ENSEMBLE MOS MEMBERS. 
ENSEMBLE MOS MEAN TEMPS WILL BE PREFERRED. 

06Z GFS AND 00Z ECMWF SHOW THE RIDGE WEAKENING ON SUNDAY...BUT THE 
12Z GFS SHOWS THE RIDGE HOLDING IN PLACE. WILL CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. BETTER PRECIP CHANCES COME MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY AS THE RIDGE SHOULD LOSE ITS GRIP BY THEN. GFS ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT SHOWING PRECIP AND A BROAD GREAT 
LAKES TROUGH FOR THESE PERIODS...AND WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS GOING 
BOTH DAYS.

397 
FXUS64 KMRX 280930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
525 AM EDT TUE JUN 28 2011

.DISCUSSION...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 568 IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT.
AREA IN WATCH IS SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND WESTWARD. GOOD INSTABILITY
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS MORNING. STORM MOTION WILL TAKE 
ONGOING CONVECTION INTO SOUTHEAST TN EARLY TODAY. MAIN THREAT IS 
DAMAGING WINDS. HEAVY RAINFALL WILL ALSO ACCOMPANY THESE STORMS. 

SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DEW POINT BOUNDARY BISECTS MRX CWA 
ACROSS NE TN. STRONG GRADIENT ACROSS BOUNDARY WITH LOW 60 DPS TO THE 
NE AND NEAR 70 OR HIGHER TO THE SW. UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES TODAY. SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE  INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY TONIGHT. ONGOING CONVECTION WILL MOVE 
INTO THE AREA IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT TODAY. SOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS THE MAIN THREAT. 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WILL SLOW OVER AREA AND TAPER OFF INTO THE AFTN. 
UNDERCUT MOS MAX TEMPS WHICH APPEAR TOO HIGH WITH ANTICIPATED CLOUDS 
AND SHOWERS. CLEARING TONIGHT WITH TEMPS FALLING TO NEAR NORMAL 
ESPECIALLY NW AREAS.   

LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT IN INITIALLY LOWERING MID LEVEL HEIGHTS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH NORTHWEST FLOW SETTING UP BEHIND COLD FRONT. MID 
TO UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION 
FROM THE WEST BY FRIDAY...RESULTING IN MORE CAPPING OF ATMOSPHERE 
AND WARMING TEMPS INTO THE 90S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

RIDGE WILL INITIALLY HOLD...BUT THERE ARE GOOD INDICATIONS THAT A
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL ATTEMPT TO MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE
AREA OUT OF KENTUCKY BY SUNDAY...AND WILL CONTINUE WITH AT LEAST
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO ACCOUNT FOR EXTRA INSTABILITY...MOISTURE AND
SLIGHTLY LESSENING CAP ACROSS THE AREA. BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO
MEANDER ACROSS THE AREA INTO MONDAY OF NEXT WEEK...AND WILL
CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS FORECAST AREA WIDE. TEMPS LOOK GENERALLY
GOOD AND WILL NOT BE MAKING MUCH IN THE WAY OF CHANGES TO THE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             89  70  91  64  93 /  50  30  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  68  88  62  90 /  50  30  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       86  67  88  62  90 /  50  30  10   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT MON JUN 27 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE IN THEIR 
DEPICTION OF A UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD 
FRONT APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON TUESDAY. THERE 
ARE STILL SOME DISAGREEMENTS ON TIMING HOWEVER...WITH THE NAM 
SOMEWHAT FASTER THAN THE GFS. HAVE TENDED TO FAVOR THE NAM TIMING 
WHICH DEPICTS THE BEST POPS GENERALLY IN THE MORNING WITH THE PRECIP 
EXITING OUR CWA BY AFTERNOON. ALSO TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER MET 
GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR TOMORROW.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A COLD FRONT WILL BE PUSHING INTO OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES TUESDAY 
EVENING...AND SHOULD BE NEAR OUR SOUTHERN BORDER BY 12Z WED. 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE EVENING SHOULD TAPER OFF 
AS THE FRONT MOVES SOUTHWARD. WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE A DRY AND 
COMFORTABLE DAY AS LOWER DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S FILTER INTO THE AREA. 
ALOFT...A STRONG RIDGE OVER THE PLAINS WILL BUILD EAST...AND KEEP 
THE REGION DRY THROUGH SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL TREND WARMER EACH 
DAY AS THE RIDGE ALOFT STRENGTHENS. 

ON SUNDAY THE UPPER RIDGE RETROGRADES SLIGHTLY...ALLOWING REMNANTS 
OF UPSTREAM CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS TO APPROACH OUR AREA IN THE NW FLOW. 
A PATTERN OF A PLAINS RIDGE AND AN EAST COAST TROUGH CONTINUES 
THROUGH MONDAY. THE FINER DETAILS OF MCS DEVELOPMENT ARE SKETCHY AT 
THIS POINT...SO WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SUNDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...WARM FRONT EXTENDS FROM THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS NORTHWEST THROUGH THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU INTO
KENTUCKY. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH NORTHEAST TN

W KY THIS MORNING. SE EXTENT AND STRENGTH OF SYSTEM REMAIN 
UNCERTAIN BUT APPEARS CONVECTION WILL SIGNIFICANTLY WEAKEN AS IT 
MARCHES DOWN THE WARM FRONT. GOOD DESTABILIZATION TODAY ALONG AND SW 
OF WARM FRONT. NEW CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT POSSIBLE BY THIS AFTN 
ACROSS MRX CWA. COVERAGE SHOULD BE MAINLY SCATTERED FAVORING NE 
TN/SW VA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL BUT DID NOT GO AS HIGH 
AS MOS GUIDANCE. COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NW TONIGHT. LINEAR 
CONVECTION A GOOD BET IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT AND WILL BEGIN TO 
IMPACT NW AREAS LATER TONIGHT. ACTIVITY MAY SLOW AND WEAKEN SOME 
ACROSS THE CWA ON TUESDAY WHILE MAINTAINING GOOD COVERAGE. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MODERATED BY CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOULD CONTINUE TO SEE 
SCATTERED CONVECTION LINGERING OVER THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE 
FRONT PULLS AWAY.  SURFACE HIGH SETTLES IN BEHIND TUESDAY/S FRONT ON 
WEDNESDAY FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS.  AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
BUILDS IN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY PROVIDING A WARMING TREND AND A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS ACTIVITY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  A 
WEAK FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA DURING THE WEEKEND.  CONFIDENCE LOW 
ON TIMING BUT SUNDAY OR LATER LOOK BEST FOR NOW...AND WILL SLOWLY 
BRING IN LOW POPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SUN JUN 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY)...A STATIONARY FRONT
REMAINS ACROSS THE WESTERN-MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY...WHICH HAS BEEN
REINFORCED BY THE SERIES OF THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXS MOVING SOUTHEAST
ACROSS THE AREA. CURRENT CONVECTIVE COMPLEX WILL AFFECT AREAS
MAINLY WEST AND SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING.

MODELS SHOW ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASING OVERNIGHT NORTH AND EAST OF
THE BOUNDARY INTO THE FORECAST AREA WHICH MAY PRODUCE SCATTERED
CONVECTION TONIGHT...GENERALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY
MORNING. ANOTHER CONCERN IS THE POTENTIAL FOG DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT
WITH LOCALLY DENSE FOG POSSIBLE.

FOR MONDAY...WARM FRONT WILL PULL NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA.
AIRMASS WILL BECOME FAIRLY UNSTABLE (2000 J/KG+)...SO AFTERNOON AND
EVENING CONVECTION IS ANTICIPATED...ENHANCED BY LOCAL TERRAIN.
ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION ON TUESDAY WITH CONVECTION ACCOMPANYING THE BOUNDARY. HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY IN THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA AS 
MODELS DEPICT BETTER MOISTURE PROFILE TO THE NORTH. HAVE CONTINUED 
WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. MID TO LATE WORK WEEK STILL APPEARS 
GENERALLY DRY PER MODEL CONSENSUS. ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
APPROACHES SOMETIME NEXT WEEKEND...BUT MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY DISAGREE ON TIMING. HAVE SPREAD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER 
SEVERAL PERIODS TO ACCOUNT FOR UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING. HEIGHT RISES 
ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SUGGEST TEMPS WILL CLIMB TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY WEEK'S END. 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

WITH THIS LINE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS. HOWEVER...GUSTS UP TO 45 MPH...
SMALL HAIL...AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING ARE ANTICIPATED. HAVE INCREASED
POPS AREA-WIDE.

TODAY A CAT OR TWO MOST LOCATIONS...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

333 AM EDT SUN JUN 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WRAPS AROUND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THEN NW THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE. BOUNDARY 
TAKING ON WARM FRONT CHARACTERISTICS. CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVING SE 
INTO W KY EARLY THIS MORNING. THE SE PROGRESSION OF THIS ACTIVITY 
REMAINS UNCERTAIN FOR TODAY. STEERING FLOW PROGGED TO SHIFT A BIT 
MORE WESTERLY BY THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...AIRMASS S OF FRONT 
INCREASINGLY MOIST THROUGH THE LAYER AND WILL HAVE TIME TO 
DESTABILIZE PRIOR TO ONSET OF CONVECTION ACROSS MRX CWA. APPEARS 
COMPLEX WILL BROADEN FEEDING ON THE MORE FAVORABLE AIRMASS TO THE SW 
WHILE BEING STEERED TO THE SE. SOME OF THESE STORMS WILL HAVE THE 
POTENTIAL TO BECOME SEVERE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. ACTIVITY SHOULD PERSIST UNTIL AROUND MIDNIGHT. SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA AROUND 2 AM MONDAY WHICH 
SHOULD FURTHER REDUCE CONVECTION. TEMPS WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
WARMER TODAY AND CONTINUE A COUPLE OF DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UNSETTLE WEATHER EXPECTED 
EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE STRETCHED 
ACROSS THE REGION ON MONDAY.  CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AND 
MOVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY...REACHING INTO THE MRX CWA MONDAY 
AFTERNOON.  ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION WILL MOVE THROUGH ON TUESDAY 
AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES IN.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND 
THE FRONT FOR WEDNESDAY.  THIS HIGH WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD...THOUGH DIURNAL CONVECTION IS 
POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN EACH DAY.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER CENTRAL EAST TN...WITH A HUMID AIR 
MASS SOUTH OF IT WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LINGER OVER THE SAME GENERAL AREAS TONIGHT... 
WITH THE MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM 
(CURRENTLY DEVELOPING OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY) WILL MOVE 
SOUTHEAST ALONG IT LATER TONIGHT. IT APPEARS THAT THIS MCS WILL 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA AFTER SUNRISE ON SUNDAY...SO WILL PLAN TO 
REMOVE POPS FROM THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. OTHERWISE...EXPECT SOME 
FOG TO DEVELOP AGAIN LATE TONIGHT...BUT HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE 
UPSTREAM MCS SHOULD KEEP IT FROM BECOMING TOO WIDESPREAD. TEMPS FOR 
TONIGHT APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL...BUT WILL PLAN TO TWEAK THEM 
A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

SEE SOME MVFR FOG AROUND 07Z DETERIORATE INTO IFR REDUCTION IN VSBY

BEYOND. MODELS CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE A SHORT WAVE TROF WHICH MAKES
THE JOURNEY FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST THROUGH THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS BY 00Z MONDAY. INSTABILITY GRADIENT SHOULD BE IN PLACE
ALONG OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY FROM THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY SOUTHEAST
THROUGH THE LOWER TENNESSEE VALLEY ON SUNDAY AND POSSIBILITY EXISTS
FOR ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO MOVE INTO THE TAF SITES OF EASTERN
TENNESSEE AROUND 16-19Z WITH CONTINUATION UNTIL LATER IN THE VALID
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT UNCERTAIN ENOUGH
AT THIS TIME TO USE THE STANDARDIZED THUNDER IN THE VICINITY DURING
THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

FXUS64 KMRX 251854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EDT SAT JUN 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY)...A STATIONARY FRONT
WAS LOCATED ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE TO NORTHERN ALABAMA. SCATTERED
CONVECTION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP ALONG AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY.
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE ALREADY ACROSS THE PLATEAU.
WILL MAINTAIN A CHANCE OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE WESTERN AND
SOUTHERN COUNTIES THIS EVENING.

PLENTY OF CLEAR SKY...LIGHT WINDS...AND MOIST GROUND WILL ALLOW
AREAS OF FOG TO DEVELOP AGAIN OVERNIGHT. LOCALIZED DENSE FOG IS
POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

FOR SUNDAY...QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY WILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY. A MCS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE CENTRAL
PLAINS THEN MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. OUTFLOW
FROM THIS MCS (LEFTOVER MCV) WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
SUNDAY PRODUCING A BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. SOME OF THESE
STORMS COULD BE SEVERE WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WINDS
AND MARGINAL LARGE HAIL.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL SOME 
INCONSISTENCIES NOTED AMONG MODELS MAINLY WITH THE TIMING OF A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY PASSAGE AROUND TUESDAY...WITH THE CANADIAN MODEL 
BEING THE FASTEST AND THE EUROPEAN MODEL THE SLOWEST. GFS REPRESENTS 
A REASONABLE COMPROMISE AND WAS GENERALLY FAVORED. UPPER RIDGE 
AMPLIFIES SIGNIFICANTLY BY LATE WORK WEEK INDUCING NORTHWEST FLOW 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. AFTER SEVERAL MOSTLY DRY 
PERIODS...THE GFS DEPICTS SOME MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION DEVELOPING 
BY LATE WORK WEEK AND INTO NEXT WEEKEND. THUS HAVE INTRODUCES SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY DAYTIME PERIODS. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING 
GRIDS AS THEY SEEM REASONABLE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...DENSE FOG HAS FORMED ACROSS RAIN COOLED AREA SOUTH OF 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY.

EXTREME SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS 
BOUNDARY WILL MOVE LITTLE ACROSS MRX CWA WHILE RETURNING AS A WARM 
FRONT WEST OF THE AREA. NORTHWESTERLY LAYER FLOW THROUGH THE PERIOD 
AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST. IMPULSE DEVELOPS TODAY IN NW 
FLOW. THIS COUPLED WITH 1000-500 MB THICKNESS DIVERGENCE TO THE NW 
WILL PROVIDE SET UP FOR ONGOING CONVECTION TO MARCH INTO THE AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON. ACTIVITY MAY BECOME STRONG WHILE INTERACTING WITH 
RICH AIRMASS ALONG AND SOUTH OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY. MODELS NOT IN VERY 
GOOD AGREEMENT ON SE EXTENT OF CONVECTION TODAY AND PREFER FAVORABLE 
SREF AND CMC. WENT WITH MODEL BLEND ON MAX TEMPS TODAY AND PREFER 
COOLER GFS MIN TEMPS TONIGHT. 

LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR WITH GFS 
TRENDING DRIER FOR THE EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE LOWERING.  BEST 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO BE SUNDAY WITH A WEAK FRONT 
LIFTING INTO THE AREA AS A MINOR IMPULSE MOVES THROUGH.  THE 
BOUNDARY WILL LINGER OVER THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY...CONTINUE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  A 
WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF 
CONVECTION.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY 
OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR RELATIVELY DRY 
CONDITIONS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

SOUTH OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THIS AREA HAS COOLED FROM EVENING 
CONVECTION WHICH HAS RESULTED IN FOG AND STRATUS FORMATION OVER CHA.
THESE IFR CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY CONTINUE THROUGH DAYBREAK. NW 
STEERING FLOW THROUGH THE PERIOD. ONGOING CONVECTION WILL MARCH 
ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND MAY AFFECT CHA THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY.

TROUGHING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS EARLY IN THE LONG TERM TO VERY 
BROAD FLAT RIDGING OVER VIRTUALLY THE ENTIRE SOUTHERN CONUS BY EARLY

HOWEVER...WITH INDIVIDUAL MODELS AND ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DEPICTING 
DISORGANIZED CONVECTION DEVELOPING PERIODICALLY. THUS HAVE NOT MADE 
ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO POPS IN THE LONG TERM OTHER THAN DECREASING 
POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
FAVORED SLIGHTLY COOLER HPC GUIDANCE.
