FXUS64 KMRX 230743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EDT THU JUN 23 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE PROBLEMS 
DECIPHERING SHORT TERM FORECAST DETAILS. LINE OF CONVECTION THAT 
LOOKS RATHER OMNIPOTENT ON SATELLITE AND RADAR IMAGERY APPEARS TO BE 
MISSING IN MODEL DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER. VERY MOIST AIR MASS 
WITH SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY WILL YIELD MORE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AGAIN TODAY. FAIRLY 
LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS ALREADY ONGOING OUT ON THE PLATEAU WITH AN 
AREA OF CONVECTION APPARENT BLOSSOMING THROUGH NORTHEAST ALABAMA AND 
NORTHERN GEORGIA HEADED TOWARD SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. 

EXPECT THIS MASS TO BE SHIFTING EAST ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE LINE OF CONVECTION IS
REALLY MOVING QUICKLY TO THE EAST...ALMOST LOOKS LIKE A GOOD OLD
FASHIONED SPRING TIME FRONTAL PUSH. NICE STRONG WESTERLY FLOW
AROUND THE GREAT LAKES/MIDWEST UPPER TROF IS MOVING THIS FEATURE
ALONG AT A RAPID PACE. WHILE THE ACTUAL SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
MAY LAG BEHIND...BELIEVE THE CONVECTION MAY BE ABLE TO CREATE SOME
NICE OUTFLOW THAT STORMS CAN FIRE ON. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE
AS THIS AREA BUILDS ONTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU. THEREFORE...RAISED
POPS TO GOOD CHANCE AND EVEN LIKELY CATEGORY NORTHERN AND WESTERN
SECTIONS AND THEN WITH THE SURFACE BOUNDARY SLIDING CLOSER TO THE
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...APPLIED A LIKELY POP GENERALLY FOR AREAS
NORTH OF I-40. NO UPDATED MAV MOS BUT STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO
PREVIOUS MAX/MIN TEMPS FOR THIS ISSUANCE.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS STILL INDICATE
THAT FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD BE WELL SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA BY 12Z
FRIDAY. HAVE DECIDED TO LOWER POPS FOR FRIDAY MORE TOWARD THE
SLIGHT CATEGORY. MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SHOULD PUSH INTO THE AREA
BY FRIDAY...WITH MORE PROGRESSIVE FLOW CONTINUING AND NEXT FRONTAL
BOUNDARY EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY
AND INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BY SUNDAY. CURRENT CHANCE POPS
LOOKS PRETTY GOOD FORECAST AREA WIDE FOR SUNDAY. CURRENT TRENDING
LOOKS GOOD AS FAR AS POPS ARE CONCERNED AS PER FORECAST SOUNDINGS
AND GFS MODEL THROUGH TUESDAY...AS MID-UPPER RIDGING AND SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA BY TUESDAY. 

IN LAST PORTION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD ON WEDNESDAY...ANOTHER COLD
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO DROP SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE AREA OUT OF THE OHIO
VALLEY REGION. FOR NOW...DUE TO UNCERTAINTY INVOLVING TIMING AND
STRENGTH OF SYSTEM...WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE
AREA.

FXUS64 KMRX 221839 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT WED JUN 22 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CURRENT RADAR SHOWS SOME WEAK 
CONVECTION OVER OUR AREA...WITH ANOTHER STRONGER AREA OF CONVECTION 
TO OUR WEST AHEAD OF A WEAK COLD FRONT AND SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY.  
THIS FRONT EXPECTED TO ADVANCE SLOWLY TOWARD THE AREA DURING THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD...WHILE SHORT WAVE ENERGY SHOULD PUSH ACROSS OUR 
AREA OVERNIGHT.  EXPECT NUMEROUS SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO AFFECT THE 
REGION OVERNIGHT...SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES.  DEEPER 
MOISTURE PROGGED TO PUSH EAST BY 12Z...BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
LINGER.  SOMEWHAT PROBLEMATIC TO FIGURE HOW QUICKLY CLOUDS WILL 
BREAK UP...SO MAX TEMPS AND AMOUNT OF ENERGY AVAILABLE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS IS UNCERTAIN.  FOR NOW WILL FORECAST SOME DECREASE IN 
CLOUDS BY AFTERNOON...AND CARRY 30 TO 40 POPS ALL ZONES.  WILL 
GENERALLY ACCEPT MAV MIN TEMPS...BUT WILL TRIM A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
FOR MAX TEMPS THURSDAY.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST 
PERIOD...AND BASICALLY SHOW A STAGNANT PATTERN THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF 
NEXT WEEK. A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY AT THE SURFACE WILL 
LINGER AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW HELPING TO GENERATE A MODERATELY TO VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
EVERY AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SCATTERED CONVECTION TO 
DEVELOP EACH DAY THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...ESPECIALLY DURING 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. IN ADDITION...BOTH THE GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS HINT AT SOME MCS ACTIVITY DEVELOPING OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE EXTENDED...WHICH WILL 
LIKELY MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH A SLIGHT WARMING TREND DEVELOPING EARLY NEXT WEEK AS 
AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS DRIFTS EASTWARD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  87  69  88  68 /  70  30  40  40  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  86  68  86  67 /  60  30  40  40  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  85  69  86  68 /  60  30  40  40  40

AREA. GFS MODEL IS DRIER FOR THE AREA FOR THURSDAY...COMPARED TO
THE NAM.

MID-UPPER FLOW TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WILL CONTINUE
WITH CHANCE POPS FOR THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON. NEXT

THE FORECAST AREA OUT OF KENTUCKY BY 00Z MONDAY...WITH CONTINUED AT
LEAST CHANCE POPS FOR THE AREA INTO MONDAY. GFS/ECMWF BOTH ARE

MONDAY...WITH RIDGING MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BY

SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY...WHICH LOOKS GOOD. TEMPS ARE IN

WILL EXTEND A TROUGH AXIS SOUTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA INTO 
SATURDAY. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LINGER IN THE VICINITY AS 
WELL...WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO A PROLONGED PERIOD OF AT LEAST SCATTERED 
ORGANIZED CONVECTION. TWEAKED A FEW POP AND WEATHER GRIDS FOR THESE 
PERIODS...BUT PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE GENERALLY ON TRACK.

UPPER LEVEL FLOW IS SOMEWHAT DIFFLUENT OR WEAK TROUGH LINGERING ON 
SUNDAY...SO I HAD TO FILL IN ANY DRY PERIODS WITH SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
CHANCE POPS OUT THROUGH MONDAY. WILL INTRODUCE NEW DAY 7 (TUESDAY) 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE DAYTIME POPS FOR NOW. 

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...TRENDED TOWARD THE GFSX MOS THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD...WHICH IS NEAR SEASONAL NORMS. THE 21/12Z GFSX MOS 
WAS QUITE CLOSE TO 21/00Z GUIDANCE...SO ANY CHANGES TO MAX/MIN TEMPS 
WAS VERY MINIMAL.

AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION GOING.

MAY SEE A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP AND MOVE 
THROUGH DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON...BUT LOOKING DRY FOR 
THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  ON 
TUESDAY...OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT...A FEW  
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE EAST TOWARDS OUR AREA.  COVERAGE 
SHOULD BE QUITE LIMITED AND MAINLY STAY TO OUR WEST BUT WILL HAVE 
SOME 20 POPS OVER WESTERN AREAS OT COVER.

.LONG TERM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...BUILDING UPPER RIDGE AND 
SURFACE BOUNDARY MOVING NE OF THE REGION WILL WORK TO LOWER POPS 
INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...INCREASING SW FLOW ALOFT AHEAD OF NEXT 
COLD FRONT WILL LEAD TO HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING INTO THE WEEKEND WITH EITHER A STALLED FRONT 
OR WARM FRONT IN OUR VICINITY...KEEPS AT LEAST ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION IN THE FORECAST. I DID KEEP SAT NIGHT AND SUN NIGHT DRY 
WITH 14 PERCENT POPS FOR NOW...SOMETHING THAT CAN BE CHANGED AS 
NEEDED. 

MODELS DIVERGE BY MONDAY (NEW DAY 7)...SO I OPTED FOR JUST SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS DAYTIME AND DRY MONDAY NIGHT FOR NOW. MOS POPS FOR 
MONDAY ARE NEAR OR BELOW CLIMO. FOR TEMPS...LOOKS TO BE A PERIOD 
WITH NEAR SEASONAL HIGHS AND A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR LOWS.
20/12Z GFSX MOS NUMBERS WERE QUITE CLOSE TO 20/00Z MOS...AND WERE 
FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 200757
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
357 AM EDT MON JUN 20 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A PERSISTENT NW FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO BRING MID-UPPER LEVEL IMPULSES 
ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TODAY. CONVECTION HAS BEEN 
BLOSSOMING OVER KY AND WILL TRACK ACROSS NE SECTIONS THIS MORNING.  
WILL RAISE POPS THERE TO LIKELY. A LOW-TO-MIDLEVEL RIDGE ACROSS 
GA/AL WILL GRADUALLY LIFT NORTHWARD TODAY...WHICH WILL SUPPRESS 
CONVECTION ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN SECTIONS THIS AFTERNOON. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SHOW CHA REMAINING CAPPED WHILE STORMS IN THE TYS AND TRI 
AREAS SHOULD BE ABLE TO TAP INTO CAPE VALUES BETWEEN 3000-4000 
J/KG...SO SOME SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. HEAVY RAIN WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE STORMS...BUT WILL LET THE FLOOD WATCH EXPIRE AS 
WIDESPREAD PROBLEMS ARE NOT EXPECTED. WITH THE BUILDING RIDGE 
THROUGH THE DAY...CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH IN THE EVENING AND EXIT 
THE AREA BY MIDNIGHT. DO NOT EXPECT OVERNIGHT CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
AS WE HAVE SEEN THE PAST FEW NIGHTS DUE TO THE RIDGE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY. A FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS 
WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT  ANOTHER 
FRONT ENTERING THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND. WITH STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ON STRENGTH AND TIMING...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR NOW. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR
TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1105 AM EDT SUN JUN 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER CENTRAL EAST TN...WITH SATELLITE AND RADAR 
IMAGERY REVEALING AN MCS MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM KY. AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF HEAVY RAINFALL WITH AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES 
HAS ALREADY OCCURRED AROUND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY THIS MORNING...WITH 
ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINFALL EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON...AND THEN AGAIN 
TONIGHT WITH ANOTHER MCS EXPECTED TO MOVE DOWN FROM THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY. THUS...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR THIS AFTERNOON 
AND TONIGHT ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN...NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THE AIR MASS OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WILL BECOME MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY VERY UNSTABLE 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SO THINK THIS MAY BE THE BEST PLACE FOR 
THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS THIS AFTERNOON. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO RAISE 
POPS...TO LOWER TEMPS A LITTLE...AND TO MENTION THE FLOOD WATCH FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.

.AVIATION...
THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAIN AND GUSTY WIDNS WILL AFFECT TRI

723 
FXUS64 KMRX 190717
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 AM EDT SUN JUN 19 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
CONVECTION HAS BEGUN TO DEVELOP ACROSS SRN KY...AND WILL TRACK EAST 
ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. AS HAS BEEN THE 
CASE THE PAST FEW NIGHTS...THE MODELS ARE HAVING A HARD TIME 
PROGGING THE DEVELOPMENT OF OVERNIGHT CONVECTION. WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS ACROSS THE NORTH THIS MORNING...AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON AS A MCS NOW OVER MO WILL APPROACH THE AREA. NORTHERN 
AREAS ARE FAVORED FOR HEAVY PRECIP...WITH AVERAGE QPF AROUND 1 INCH 
TODAY WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS EXPECTED. INSTABILITY LOOKS 
GREATER TODAY COMPARED TO YESTERDAY..ALTHOUGH MORNING CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP WILL BE A LIMITING FACTOR. STRONG TO SEVERE DOWNBURST WINDS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE AS THE LOW-TO-MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCE IS AROUND 
20-30 DEGREES K IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS. UNCERTAINTY IS HIGH IN REGARD 
TO OVERNIGHT PRECIP...BUT WILL FOLLOW PERSISTENCE AND KEEP A CHANCE 
POP NORTH TONIGHT. WENT WITH TEMPS BELOW GUIDANCE TO ACCOUNT FOR 
MORNING CLOUDS AND PRECIP...ESPECIALLY NORTH. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
REGION ON MONDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
AREAS WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT IS EXPECTED. HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY. A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS 
INTO FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW CHANCE POPS WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES FOR THURSDAY. DRY WEATHER SHOULD RETURN BY SATURDAY. STAYED 
NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT FRI JUN 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AND DIFFUSE FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING ALONG 
THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM OVER THE 
LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 850-500 MB THICKNESS VALUES...CORFIDI 
VECTORS...AND THE CURRENT INSTABILITY AXIS INDICATE THAT THIS MCS 
SHOULD MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. MODELS AGREE THAT INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAKER OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA DUE TO THE LINGERING CLOUD COVER...BUT THIS MCS SHOULD 
BE ABLE TO GENERATE SOME CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
EVENING. MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE DIFFICULTIES WITH THE PLACEMENT OF 
CONVECTION OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...BUT HAVE COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR ANOTHER MCS FROM THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY EVENTUALLY AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 
THIS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT PATTERN WILL CONTINUE TO BE CONDUCIVE FOR 
ANOTHER MCS TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...BUT MOST LIKELY 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA AS AN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE DEEP SOUTH 
BEGINS TO BUILD TOWARDS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WILL NOT MENTION 
ANY DIURNAL TIMING WITH THE CONVECTION THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...SINCE 
IT COULD OCCUR ALMOST ANY TIME OF DAY OR NIGHT WITH A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IN CLOSE PROXIMITY AND THE MOVEMENT OF MCS'S TOWARDS THE 
REGION. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT DUE TO THE DIFFERENCES IN THE 
FORECASTED COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. WILL GENERALLY LEAN TOWARDS A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH TEMPS A LITTLE 
WARMER DUE TO THE PASSAGE OF A WARM FRONT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE EASTERN U.S. WILL PROVIDE QUIET AND DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED... 
BUT OVERALL PATTERN CHANGE EXPECTED WITH A COLD FRONT PROGGED INTO 
THE REGION AROUND THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY TIME FRAME. 
CONFIDENCE LOW ON DETAILS BUT HAVE CONTINUED WITH THE CURRENT TREND 
OF INTRODUCING LOW POPS NORTH ON WEDNESDAY...INCREASING POPS 
OVERNIGHT WITH HIGHEST POPS ON THURSDAY...THEN KEEPING A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF PRECIP INTO FRIDAY. KEPT TEMPERATURES NEAR GUIDANCE.

HIGHS THROUGH SATURDAY (MAIN DUE TO THE DIFFERENCES IN THE EXPECTED 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION). WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO...BUT WILL LEAN MORE TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DISTURBANCE SLIDING THROUGH 
NORTHWEST FLOW ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT. BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT 
EXPECTED OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND HAVE KEPT HIGHER POP OVER NORTHERN 
THIRD. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR DRY CONDITION MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  
MOVING INTO AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN WITH MODELS BRINGING IN A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION LATE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. CONFIDENCE 
LOW ON DETAILS AND FOR NOW WILL KEEP POPS AT 20 TO 30. AS FOR 
TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

THROUGH AS WINDS VEER IN GENERAL TODAY.

MODELS WITH MAINLY CHANCE OR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN ORDER THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. UPPER RIDGE AXIS STAYS OUT WEST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES 
AND THE W-NW FLOW ALOFT PERSISTS OVER THE TN VALLEY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS. THIS PATTERN WILL KEEP THE POSSIBILITY OF TSRA FOR NOT 
JUST THE TYPICALLY FAVORED DIURNAL PERIODS. HOWEVER...IT SEEMS SAFE 
TO RUN LOWER OR EVENTUALLY NO POPS ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC AREAS. 

CANADIAN...ECMWF AND GFS SEEM IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON UPPER RIDGE 
SHIFTING EAST BY MONDAY...SO I WOULD PREFER TO KEEP MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW. THIS IS A BIT AT ODDS WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS 
SO I NUDGED POPS UP TO 14 PERCENT TO BE CLOSE ON TOLERANCE FOR 
DIFFERENCES. UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACHING BY WEDNESDAY... 
SO I KEPT PREVIOUS SLIGHT CHANCE AND CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH WEDNESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

FOR TEMPS...NO MAJOR STRAYING FROM GUIDANCE ON EITHER LOWS OR 
HIGHS...JUST A FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO MESH BETTER WITH 16/00Z GFSX MOS 
AND NEIGHBORS MIN/MAX GRIDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT WED JUN 15 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG A PADUCAH KY TO HUNTSVILLE AL TO 
MACON GA LINE. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE 
NORTHWARD TODAY AS A WARM FRONT...AS 850 MB SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE 
AHEAD OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID WEST. AS A RESULT... 
DEWPOINTS SHOULD SLOWLY RISE TODAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATING A MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY 
VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING BY LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING. WITH A DECENT MID-LEVEL WIND FLOW DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THIS 
WARM FRONT BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND ALSO AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT BY 
LATER THIS EVENING...IT APPEARS THAT THERE SHOULD BE A GOOD COVERAGE 
OF CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SOME SEVERE TSTORMS. THE MAIN THREATS APPEAR TO BE DAMAGING WINDS 
AND LARGE HAIL...BUT THE INCREASING WIND FLOW BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING COULD ENCOURAGE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW SUPERCELLS WITH 
THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED TORNADO OR TWO.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO RAISE 
POPS A LITTLE FOR THIS AFTERNOON...AND TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME SEVERE STORMS. WILL ALSO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE 
LATEST TRENDS.

SOUTHWEST BUILDS INTO THE AREA AND BY SUNDAY-MONDAY TIMEFRAME WE 
WILL BE GETTING OUT OF THE NW FLOW AND MORE UNDER THE RIDGE.  
HOWEVER...THE RIDGE DOES NOT LOOK AS SUBSTANTIAL AS IT DID IN THE 
MODELS YESTERDAY.  

FOR TEMPS...AM COOLING HIGHS A LITTLE AS MENTIONED BEFORE...RIDGE 
JUST NOT LOOKING AS STRONG NOW.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  89  68  90  65 /  20  50  50  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  87  67  86  64 /  20  50  40  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  86  65  86  64 /  20  50  40  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              50  81  60  81  59 /  20  50  50  30  30

761 
FXUS64 KMRX 141357
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 AM EDT TUE JUN 14 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR ACTIVITY TO THE WEST OF THE CWA...BUT MAY STILL 
INCREASE IN OUR AREA AS A FRONTAL BOUNDARY NEARS. WILL LEAVE THE 
CURRENT POPS AS IS WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN OUR WESTERN COUNTIES. 
CURRENT TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH LITTLE CHANCE OF ANY FOG DEVELOPING
BEFORE DAYBREAK...GIVEN LIGHT N-NE SURFACE WINDS AND DEW POINT
TEMPS MOSTLY IN THE 50S. 

SOMEWHAT SKEPTICAL THAT MUCH CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON
OR EVENING...EXCEPT TO OUR WEST. KEPT PREVIOUS LOW POP GRIDS FOR
CONTINUITY...WITH WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY NEARBY AND NW FLOW ALOFT.
HOWEVER...I DID LOWER POPS JUST SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT FOR ALL BUT
OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES.

OTHERWISE...DRY AIR WOULD SEEM TO FAVOR A BLEND OF MOS FOR HIGHS OR
CLOSER TO THE WARMER GFS. MINS TONIGHT ACCEPTABLE...BUT COOLER MINS
ARE A BETTER CHOICE IF CONVECTION AND ASSOCIATED CLOUDS ARE NOT
THAT SIGNIFICANT TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THAT SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL PASS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION IN THE LATE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME TRIGGERING 
POTENTIAL FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION FOR MOST OF THE CWA. UPPER FLOW 
BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY AGAIN BY LATE WORK WEEK. AT THIS POINT... 
MEDIUM RANGE MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE AS THE ECMWF MAINTAINS 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WITH PERIODIC MCS ACTIVITY TRANSLATING THROUGH 
THE FLOW. HOWEVER...THE GFS DEPICTS A GRADUAL RETURN TO DOMINANT 
UPPER RIDGE OVER MUCH OF THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS BY LATE WEEKEND 
WITH A CORRESPONDING RETURN TO WELL-ABOVE-CLIMO TEMPS. TENDED TO 
FAVOR GFS ALTHOUGH THERE ARE SEVERAL GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS WHICH 
SUPPORT THE ECMWF SOLUTION...RESULTING IN LOW-CONFIDENCE FORECAST 
FOR LATE IN THE LONG TERM.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  63  88  68  89 /  20  20  50  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  59  86  67  87 /  10  20  40  50  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       85  58  85  65  87 /  20  20  50  50  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              81  50  80  60  83 /  10  20  30  50  40

.AVIATION...VFR CONDITIONS ABOUND ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH

CONVECTION TODAY SEEMS MINIMAL...WITH FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOWING DRY 
LOW LEVELS AND LIMITED INSTABILITY. KEPT A MENTION OF CB THIS 
AFTERNOON FOR CHA AND TYS...BUT DROPPED FOR TRI. 

WOULD EXPECT VFR CONDITIONS TO LINGER OVERNIGHT...UNLESS TSRA SPREAD 
IN FROM THE W-NW LATE. RAIN CHANCES ONLY 20 PERCENT FOR THIS 
HAPPENING AT OR NEAR A TAF SITE...SO CARRIED VFR THROUGH LAST 6 TO 
12 HOURS AS WELL.

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE

885 
FXUS64 KMRX 131928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EDT MON JUN 13 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE SHOULD
KEEP THE PRECIPITATION TO THE WEST TONIGHT. IT SHOULD ALSO LIMIT
FOG FORMATION FOR TONIGHT. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO TRACK
INTO THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS ON TUESDAY. WITH
ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE WILL CONTINUE WITH THE SLIGHT POPS
FOR TUESDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE WESTERN PORTIONS
OF THE CWA NEARER THE BOUNDARY. WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY...COULD
SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES
EXPECTED TODAY AND TONIGHT...STAYED NEAR THE MAV/MET BLEND GUIDANCE
FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AT THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD...AN UPPER RIDGE IS ANCHORED FROM THE THE SOUTH-CENTRAL US 
ACROSS NORTHERN MEXICO...WITH TROUGHINESS OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND 
NEW ENGLAND...RESULTING IN A CLASSIC/BUSY NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE TN 
VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. MOST OF THIS SIX DAY PERIOD IS SIMPLY 
OSCILLATIONS ON THIS THEME.  HOWEVER...TOWARD THE END OF THE 
PERIOD...THERE IS A DEFINITE TREND OF THE RIDGE SWELLING INTO THE 
SOUTHEASTERN US...THAT PUSHES THE HEART OF THE NW FLOW MORE OVER THE 
MID-ATLANTIC INTO NEW ENGLAND.

ON THE FRONT END...IT LOOKS LIKE THE APPROACHING WARM FRONT TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...WILL SET THE STAGE FOR AN MCS TO ROLL OVER 
THE AREA LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY.  LATEST 
MODEL RUNS AND HPC DISCUSSIONS HINT ON A SLIGHTLY MORE NORTHERLY 
SCENARIO FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK...AFTER THIS INITIAL MCS ON 
WED...MEANING THAT WE WOULD EITHER ONLY GET GLANCING BLOWS OR BE OUT 
OF THE MAIN PIPELINE AND JUST GET BASIC SUMMER-TYPE BUILD-UPS.  AT 
ANY RATE...AFTER WED AM DROPPING THE POPS TO 20S AND 30S PERCENTS.

FOR TEMPS...WENT FOR A MUTED DIURNAL RANGE ON WEDNESDAY WITH 
ADVANCING CLOUDS KEEPING WED DAYBREAK WARMER...BUT RAIN AND CLOUDS 
KEEPING THE AFTERNOON COOLER.  DIDN'T GO TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE 
AFTERWARDS...SELECTIVELY BUMPING UP MAX TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO SINCE 
STORM TRACK WILL BE FARTHER NORTH.  BEST CHANCES FOR SEVERE STORMS 
LOOK TO BE EITHER FROM LEFTOVERS OF MCS TUESDAY NIGHT...OR FROM 
REDEVELOPMENT ON WEDNESDAY.  RIGHT NOW...MAIN THREAT FOR ORGANIZED 
SEVERE STORMS LOOKS NORTH OF THE AREA LATER IN THE FORECAST.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  89  64  86  67 /  10  20  20  50  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  84  61  84  65 /  10  10  30  50  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  84  61  82  65 /  10  20  30  50  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  80  52  80  59 /  10  10  20  50  40

266 
FXUS64 KMRX 131128
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
727 AM EDT MON JUN 13 2011

.AVIATION...FOG THICKENED OVERNIGHT AT TRI BUT SHOULD BEGIN TO LIFT 
AND DISSIPATE SHORTLY...WITH LIFR CONDITIONS FOR ABOUT ANOTHER HOUR 
OR SO THERE.

MINIMAL FOG DEVELOPED AT TYS ONCE THE LIGHT NORTH WINDS DIMINISED
BUT EXPECTING MAINLY JUST BRIEF MVFR. CHA LIKELY TO REMAIN VFR 
THROUGH THIS TAF PACKAGE.

OTHERWISE...NOT EXPECTING ANY CONVECTION TODAY WITH SOME LIGHT FOG 
POSSIBLE AGAIN LATE TONIGHT AT TRI.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FIRST CONCERN IS AREAS OF 
LOCALLY DENSE FOG (OR A STRATUS DECK) THIS MORNING IN AREAS THAT 
MEASURED SOME RAINFALL ON SUNDAY. LIGHT NORTH WINDS NOTED AT SEVERAL 
SPOTS WITH A CORRESPONDING DROP IN DEW POINT TEMPS. WILL KEEP FOG 
MENTION MAINLY TO THE PRE 12Z FORECAST GRIDS AND JUST COVER ANY 
DENSE FOG SPOTS IN THE SHORT TERM FORECAST.

SECOND CONCERN IS HOW SAFE IT IS TO KEEP FORECAST DRY LATER TODAY.
APPEARS THAT DEW POINT TEMPS WILL HAVE MIXED DOWN INTO THE 50S BY OR 
WELL BEFORE PEAK HEATING...SO OPTED TO KEEP A DRY FORECAST FOR TODAY.
I DID NUDGE POPS UP TO 14 PERCENT NEAR ADJACENT GRIDS FROM FFC/HUN 
AND GSP. SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER FOR HIGHS...BUT THE DRY AIR 
AND GROUND SHOULD ALLOW LOWER 90S IN SOME LOCATIONS (SUCH AS CHA). 

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT FOR TONIGHT...BUT APPEARS THAT ANY CONVECTION 
WILL BE WEST OF THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. THUS...DRY FOR 
ANOTHER PERIOD WITH LITTLE TO NO CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS.
MOS TEMPS FOR BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT LOOKED CLOSE AND REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW WILL SETTLE
ACROSS FORECAST AREA THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. UPPER TROUGH OVER NE
STATES WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST BUT OTHER UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS WILL
DROP SE FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE TN VALLEY. WEAK SHORT
WAVE ACTIVITY MOVING SE WILL CAUSE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY
AFTERNOON TUESDAY. MCS MAY FORM OVER MS VALLEY AND THEN MOVE EAST
INTO TN VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT EAST OF A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY
CONNECTED TO A LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. SW LOW
LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE EAST OF THE BOUNDARY AND HELP ENHANCE 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT WHICH MAY BRING LARGE HAIL OR DAMAGING
WINDS WITH STORMS THAT DEVELOP TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY CLOSED
UPPER LOW EXPECTED TO FORM ACROSS WESTERN GREAT LAKES WITH SURFACE
LOW OVER NE MO. A WARM FRONT MOVING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
FROM THAT LOW WILL FOCUS MORE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
SOME POSSIBLY SEVERE WEDNESDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE INTO
THE REGION THURSDAY. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL REMAIN IN THE AREA
THROUGH THE WEEKEND SO WILL KEEP SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY
COOLER THAN THE PAST WEEK BUT STILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  64  91  66  89 /  10  10  
20  30  40 KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  60  84  62  86 /  
10  10  10  30  40 OAK RIDGE, TN                       88  60  84  
62  86 /  10  10  20  30  40 TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              84  
53  80  54  82 /  10   0  10  30  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY
COOLER THAN THE PAST WEEK BUT STILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

WATCHING FOR POSSIBLE SPRINKLES, ETC. THINK THAT CLOUD DECK WILL
ERODE WEST TO EAST IN THE MORNING...LEAVING THE AFTERNOON MOSTLY
SUNNY ON MONDAY.

MODELS SEEM TO BE UNDERPLAYING STRATOCU DECK.  WILL GO CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON.

THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ENTER THE AREA ON THURSDAY

.DISCUSSION...
VERY QUIET SO FAR THIS MORNING WITH A RATHER COMPLEX SITUATION AT 
HAND. SURFACE COLD FRONT STILL TRUDGING THROUGH KY AT THIS
TIME...IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY WASH THROUGH AREA LATER TODAY. SURFACE
DEW POINTS AHEAD OF THE FRONT ARE IN THE 60S...WHICH SOUND
FAVORABLE FOR CONVECTION LATER TODAY ALONG THE FRONT...HOWEVER LEE
TROUGH IN THE CAROLINAS IS DEVELOPING AND IS EXPECTED TO GET
STRONGER AND STRONGER DURING THE DAY...WHICH WILL INDUCE MORE AND
MORE OF A WESTERLY WIND COMPONENT IN OUR AREA AHEAD OF THE FRONT.
THEREFORE LOCAL CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT WILL BE
LIMITED...GIVING WAY TO THE MORE FAVORABLE AREA NEAR THE LEE
TROUGH. THERE WILL STILL BE SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...AND THE UPPER TROUGH IS WORKING THROUGH THE AREA AS
WELL...SO FEEL THE NEED TO LEAVE 20S AND 30S POPS IN PLACE FOR THIS
AFTERNOON FOR NOW.

FOR TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON...MODEL SOUNDINGS LOOKING A LITTLE COOLER 
OVERALL.  MIXING SOUNDINGS TO SURFACE RESULTS TEMPS A FEW DEGREES 
COOLER THAN FORECAST--WILL KNOCK OFF ABOUT ONE DEGREE ACROSS THE 
BOARD FOR HIGHS...OTHERWISE NO CHANGES.

I BLENDED INTO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS BY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH

LEVELS.

OTHERWISE...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS SRN MOST AREAS THIS 
EVENING...BUT DAY SHIFT MAY GET TO REMOVE THESE POPS IN THE 
AFTERNOON PACKAGE. MOS HIGHS PRETTY CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED
WITH A PREFERENCE FOR COOLER GFS MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT WILL BE
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES
BRINGING DRIER AIR MASS INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. UPPER RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED TO THE SW AND FLOW
BECOMES NW. SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL THEN MOVE AROUND THE RIDGE INTO
THE FORECAST AREA WITH INCREASING RISK FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. SOME STORMS WILL BECOME STRONG TO POSSIBLY
SEVERE DURING THE AFTERNOON OR EVENING TUESDAY. TROUGH REMAINS
ACROSS THE EAST WITH UPPER RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH
CENTRAL STATES. LOW PRESSURE OVER MID MS VALLEY WILL ALSO TRACK NE
INTO THE GREAT LAKES TO OF THE EAST COAST FOR THE REST OF THE
FORECAST PERIOD AND DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
POSSIBLE.

546 
FXUS64 KMRX 111457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1057 AM EDT SAT JUN 11 2011

.DISCUSSION...
COUPLE OF OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES HAVE MOVED INTO NWRN SECTIONS OF THE 
CWA...WITH ENOUGH ELEVATED CONVECTION TO FIRE A FEW SMALL 
THUNDERSTORMS.  WE MAY GET TO THE SURFACE-BASED CONVECTIVE 
TEMPERATURES SOON ENOUGH BEFORE THE CONVERGENCE ALONG THESE 
BOUNDARIES FADES...THEREFORE...THEY COULD BE PLAYERS IN TODAY'S 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY.  THE TERRAIN WILL BE THE OTHER OBVIOUS PLAYER 
IN INITIAL DEVELOPMENT.  

LOOKING AT LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE AND MODEL SOUNDINGS...WOULD EXPECT 
CAPE VALUES IN THE 1000-1500 J/KG RANGE ACROSS THE AREA...WITH 15-20 
KT 0-6KM SHEAR ACROSS THE NORTH...VS LESS THAN 10 KT SHEAR ACROSS THE
SOUTH...THEREFORE...INDIVIDUAL STORM CELLS WILL PERSIST LONGER IN
THE NORTH AND HAVE A BETTER CHANCE OF BECOMING SEVERE. WET-BULB
ZERO VALUES VERY HIGH...SO MAIN THREAT LOOKS TO BE GUSTY OUTFLOW
WINDS...WITH A STRONGEST CELLS MAYBE GETTING QUARTER-SIZED HAIL AT BEST.

WILL RAISE THE POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS INTO THE 40S-50S% 
RANGE...BUT LEAVE THE SOUTHERN AREAS IN THE 20S-30S% RANGE.

WILL MAKE SLIGHT TWEAK TO HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FOR TODAY. MOS POPS HAVE INCREASED FOR TONIGHT AS WEAK COLD FRONT 
SAGS SE FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS SEEMS REASONABLE...BUT WARM 
TEMPS ALOFT AND LINGERING UPPER RIDGE...KEEP ME FROM GOING WITH

TO WEAKEN AFTER MIDNIGHT...SO KEPT POPS IN CHANCE CATEGORY WITH 
SCATTERED WORDING IN THE EVENING...THEN CHANCE OR SLIGHT CHANCE 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

WENT CLOSE TO OR A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW PERSISTENCE FOR HIGHS TODAY. 
MOS MINS TONIGHT WERE REASONABLE...WITH COOLER GFS MINS A BETTER 
CHOICE FOR ANY AREAS THAT DO GET MEASURABLE RAINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COOL FRONT MOVES ACROSS
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD
OF THE FRONT. FOLLOWED NAM/GFS BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES...A COUPLE
DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAYS HIGHS. COOL FRONT THROUGH THE REGION BY
SUNDAY EVENING WITH RAIN ENDING. HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS IN COOLER AND
DRIER AIR MASS SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGHS AND LOWS
SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER THAN THEY HAVE BEEN. HIGH PRESSURE AREA
SHIFTS EAST WEDNESDAY WITH NEXT SYSTEM MOVING INTO OHIO AND TN
VALLEYS LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. HIGHS STAY MAINLY IN THE
80S WITH UPPER TROUGH MOVING INTO EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY.
SHOWERS DECREASE FRIDAY AS SURFACE LOW WITH SYSTEM MOVES INTO
NORTHEAST STATES AND DRIER AIR MASS MOVES IN FROM THE OHIO AND MID
MS VALLEY.

DIMINISHED WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. EXPECT SOME PATCHY FOG 
TO DEVELOP IN THOSE AREAS THAT EXPERIENCED SOME RAIN THIS EVENING.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO REMOVE 
EVENING POPS AND TO MENTION PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
WILL ALSO PLAN TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
TRENDS.

DEPICT SLOW DEAMPLIFICATION OF UPPER RIDGE THROUGH LATE WORK WEEK 
AND INTO THE WEEKEND. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ALSO DEPICT WEAK BOUNDARY 
APPROACHING THE AREA BY SUNDAY...WHICH COULD POTENTIALLY TRIGGER 
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. CONTINUED CHANCE POPS ON SUNDAY FOR

UPPER RIDGE RE-AMPLIFIES OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY LATE IN THE 
LONG TERM PLACING SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
AND FAVORED PLACEMENT FOR POTENTIAL MCS  ACTIVITY...ESPECIALLY WITH 
AFOREMENTIONED BOUNDARY LURKING AROUND. CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THROUGH THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE. OVERALL...DID 
NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
FOR THE LONG TERM...BUT STILL SOME AMBIGUITY WITH THE DETAILS 
ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE PERIOD.  UPPER FLOW FORECAST TO BE MORE 
ZONAL THAN RECENT DAYS AS UPPER RIDGE WILL BE FLATTER...AND STILL 
POSSIBLE THAT UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE NORTHWEST BY 
MONDAY/TUESDAY.  COLD FRONT WILL ALSO SAG TOWARD THE AREA BY THE 
WEEKEND...BUT AM NOT OPTIMISTIC THAT IT WILL PUSH THROUGH OUR AREA.  
WILL LIKELY BE SOME CONVECTION AROUND AT TIMES DURING THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD...BUT THE DETAILS OF HOW MUCH COVERAGE EACH PERIOD IS VERY 
UNCERTAIN AT THIS POINT.  WILL GENERALLY CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS...EXCEPT FOR CHANCE POPS FRIDAY AND THE WEEKEND AS FRONTAL 
PROXIMITY MAY ENHANCE OUR CHANCES FOR PRECIP. GFS MOS TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE OVERALL.

614 
FXUS64 KMRX 072258 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
658 PM EDT TUE JUN 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...SMALL COMPLEX DROPPING SOUTH OUT OF NE KY AND W VA HAS 
GENERALLY WEAKENED...BUT SCATTERED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS DEVELOPED 
OUT AHEAD OF THE COMPLEX AND ITS ASSOCIATED OUTFLOW BOUNDARY. GOOD 
COVERAGE OVER SW VA CURRENTLY...WHICH WAS NOT COVERED WELL IN GRIDS.
SO...I DID A QUICK UPDATE OF FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS FOR THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS INTO MID/LATE EVENING...AS THIS ACTIVITY DROPS SLOWLY 
SOUTH INTO THE TRI AREA OF NE TN.


PREVIOUS AFD...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE STILL IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED A COUPLE HOURS EARLIER ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS OF NORTH CAROLINA AND ARE MOVING SLOWLY SW.  MCS OVER WV 
SLOWLY MOVING SOUTH TOWARD VA AT THIS HOUR AND COULD REACH INTO SW 
VA AND NE TN ABOUT 22Z AND BRING A FEW STRONG THUNDERSTORMS TO THAT 
AREA FOR A FEW HOURS. RIGHT NOW WILL JUST HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE. LOW 
SHEAR CONDITIONS MAY WEAKEN THIS SYSTEM MORE BUT OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES 
MAY CONTRIBUTE TO CONVECTION CONTINUING INTO THE EVENING. TONIGHT 
LOWS SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHTS NEAR AT 60 TRI AND MID TO UPPER 60S 
ELSEWHERE. WEDNESDAY RIDGE STILL NEARLY OVERHEAD BUT ADDING A LITTLE 
HIGHER POPS NE AND CENTRAL AREAS. TEMPERATURES STILL LOOK TO BE 
ABOUT THE SAME LOWER TO MID 90S CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE.    

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH BREAKING DOWN THE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY BY THE END OF THE WEEK...WITH A BERMUDA HIGH AT THE SURFACE 
BECOMING SITUATED IN ITS CLIMATOLOGICAL POSITION OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC. SOUTHERLY WINDS ALONG ITS WESTERN EDGE WILL BRING 
INCREASING AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THE END OF 
THE WEEK...WITH A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALSO BECOMING STATIONARY 
AROUND THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THE COMBINATION OF THESE TWO FACTORS 
SHOULD RESULT IN A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL 
BECOME MORE NORTHWESTERLY OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS BY THE 
START OF NEXT WEEK...WHICH SHOULD PUSH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY FURTHER 
SOUTH AND POSSIBLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY. THIS FRONTAL 
PASSAGE MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR...SO WILL KEEP 
A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. IN 
ADDITION...THIS NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW PATTERN WILL BE CONDUCIVE 
FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME UPSTREAM MCS ACTIVITY OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING THIS PERIOD. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...AND THEN WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK WHICH ARE CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   68  95  68  95  68 /  10  10   0  20  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     67  94  66  93  66 /  10  20   0  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             67  94  66  93  66 /  10  10   0  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    60  92  63  91  63 /  10  20   0  20  20

FXUS64 KMRX 070125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT MON JUN 6 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. ACTIVITY ACROSS THE 
SOUTH HAS ENDED. HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING A DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES 
NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...NOT MUCH CLOUD DEVELOPMENT TODAY 
AS OPPOSED TO SUNDAY. UPPER RIDGE IS STRENGTHENING ONCE AGAIN OVER 
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY. RUC MODEL SHOWING SHORTWAVE OVER NC AND SC 
WITH MORE MOISTURE ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALCHIANS WITH ISOLATED 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING THERE THIS AFTERNOON. MUCH LOWER DEW POINT 
TEMPERATURES IN THE 50S ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. CURRENT AIR 
TEMPERATURES A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS 
THIS AFTERNOON BUT ABOUT THE SAME NORTH AS SUNDAY. MOST UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS IS ACROSS SE TN AND SW VA MOUNTAINS. FOR THE REST OF THE 
AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY HAVE ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS LATE THIS AFTERNOON BUT EXPECT 
ACTIVITY TO BE MAINLY EAST SIDE OF MOUNTAINS. TONIGHT AND TUESDAY 
MOSTLY CLEAR AT NIGHT TO MOSTLY SUNNY WITH LOWER OVERNIGHT LOWS NE 
TN VALLEYS. EXPECTING UPPER 50S THERE WITH DRIER AIR MASS BUT ABOUT 
THE SAME CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...MID TO UPPER 60S. TUESDAY 
UPPER HIGH JUST TO THE WEST OF FORECAST AREA SO CONVECTION AGAIN 
MAINLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS LATE AFTERNOON TO EARLY EVENING. USING 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR HIGHS TUESDAY ABOUT LIKE TODAY NEAR 90 NE 
TO LOWER TO MID 90S CENTRAL AND SOUTH.

LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEK...WHICH BECOMES SITUATED OVER THE 
WESTERN ATLANTIC BY THE END OF THE WEEK. THIS UPPER-LEVEL HIGH 
SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS MOST CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ON WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY...EXCEPT AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE ISOLATED 
CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE. AS HIGH PRESSURE BECOMES SITUATED AT 
ITS CLIMATOLOGICAL POSITION OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC BY THE END OF 
THE WEEK...SOUTHERLY WINDS ON ITS WESTERN PERIPHERY WILL BRING 
INCREASING AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY. IN 
ADDITION...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO BECOME STATIONARY 
AROUND THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY THE END OF THE WEEK. THE COMBINATION 
OF THESE TWO FACTORS SHOULD RESULT IN A BETTER COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL PASS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY 
MONDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE SEEMS OVERLY OPTIMISTIC GIVEN 
THE TIME OF YEAR...SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE FORECAST 
FOR MONDAY. IN ADDITION...THINK THERE WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY FOR 
SOME MCS DEVELOPMENT FURTHER UPSTREAM OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH 
COULD THEN AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   68  95  68  94  68 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     65  93  66  93  66 /  10  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             64  94  66  93  66 /   0  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    56  91  62  91  62 /  10  10   0   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

GH/TD/DMG

671 
FXUS64 KMRX 060135
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EDT SUN JUN 5 2011

.DISCUSSION...STORMS HAVE EXITED THE AREA. REST OF TONIGHT SHOULD BE 
DRY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
ZONES TO REMOVE POPS FOR TONIGHT...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
ANALYSIS OF VARIOUS SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS SUGGEST THAT THE 
THREAT OF SEVERE WILL CONTINUE TO RISE OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS ON 
THE EASTERN EDGES OF WATCH 430. DEVELOPMENT OF STORMS TO THE EAST OF 
ONGOING CONVECTION IS EXPECTED GIVEN THE ABUNDANT INSTABILITY THAT 
IS OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INCREASING LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE 
SHOWN BY THE RUC. INVERTED-V PROFILE OF RUC SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
DOWNBURST WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. THOUGH CAPE IS PLENTIFUL 
THE FREEZING LEVEL IS QUITE HIGH...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT HAIL SIZE. 
STORMS SHOULD WEAKEN QUICKLY WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. WILL 
INCLUDE A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD IN THE FORECAST TO COVER THE STORMS. 

AN MCV FROM ONGOING CONVECTION WILL CROSS THE AREA IN THE 
EVENING...SO WILL KEEP A CHANCE POP GOING AFTER 00Z. THE MID-UPPER 
RIDGE BECOMES MORE PROGRESSIVE TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...BUILDING BACK 
OVER THE REGION. DRY AND UNSEASONABLY HOT CONDITIONS WILL DOMINATE 
UNDER THE RIDGE TOMORROW. RECORD HIGHS OF 93 AT TRI...98 AND TYS AND 
CHA...LOOK TO BE SAFE TOMORROW BY A COUPLE DEGREES. WENT WITH LOW 
TEMPS TONIGHT ABOVE GFS MOS AS IT HAS BEEN MUCH TOO COOL LATELY. 

LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
ALTHOUGH RIDGE REBUILDS ACROSS REGION SHORTWAVE ACTIVITY STILL 
MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY INTO MID ATLANTIC 
TUESDAY. EXPECT ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EASTERN MOUNTAINS 
AND SW NC WHERE TOPOGRAPHY WILL ENHANCE LIFT DURING PEAK HEATING 
HOURS. MOSTLY DRY TUESDAY NIGHT AND FORECAST ABOUT THE SAME 
WEDNESDAY. A LITTLE DRIER AIR WILL WORK IN BEHIND DISSIPATING 
BOUNDARY MONDAY NIGHT SO LOWS UPPER 50S NORTH TO MID AND UPPER 60S 
SOUTH. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY A PERSISTENT FORECAST FOR HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 90S AND LOWS IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70 SOUTHERN VALLEY. 
THURSDAY RIDGE BEGINS TO WEAKEN WITH MOISTURE INCREASING ADDED POPS 
TO ALL AREAS WITH CHANCE POP MOUNTAINS. FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY 
FLATTENED OR WEAKENED RIDGE ALLOWS SEVERAL SHORTWAVES TO MOVE 
THROUGH WITH CHANCE POPS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HIGHS WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER DUE TO MORE CLOUDS AND RAINFALL.    
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  96  67  95  68 /  30   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  93  64  93  66 /  30   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  93  63  94  65 /  30   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  90  56  90  61 /  20   0   0  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SUN JUN 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
ANALYSIS OF VARIOUS SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS SUGGEST THAT THE 
THREAT OF SEVERE WILL CONTINUE TO RISE OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS ON 
THE EASTERN EDGES OF WATCH 430. DEVELOPMENT OF STORMS TO THE EAST OF 
ONGOING CONVECTION IS EXPECTED GIVEN THE ABUNDANT INSTABILITY THAT 
IS OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INCREASING LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE 
SHOWN BY THE RUC. INVERTED-V PROFILE OF RUC SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
DOWNBURST WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. THOUGH CAPE IS PLENTIFUL 
THE FREEZING LEVEL IS QUITE HIGH...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT HAIL SIZE. 
STORMS SHOULD WEAKEN QUICKLY WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. WILL 
INCLUDE A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD IN THE FORECAST TO COVER THE STORMS. 

AN MCV FROM ONGOING CONVECTION WILL CROSS THE AREA IN THE 
EVENING...SO WILL KEEP A CHANCE POP GOING AFTER 00Z. THE MID-UPPER 
RIDGE BECOMES MORE PROGRESSIVE TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...BUILDING BACK 
OVER THE REGION. DRY AND UNSEASONABLY HOT CONDITIONS WILL DOMINATE 
UNDER THE RIDGE TOMORROW. RECORD HIGHS OF 93 AT TRI...98 AND TYS AND

AND SW NC WHERE TOPOGRAPHY WILL ENHANCE LIFT DURING PEAK HEATING 
HOURS. MOSTLY DRY TUESDAY NIGHT AND FORECAST ABOUT THE SAME 
WEDNESDAY. A LITTLE DRIER AIR WILL WORK IN BEHIND DISSIPATING 
BOUNDARY MONDAY NIGHT SO LOWS UPPER 50S NORTH TO MID AND UPPER 60S 
SOUTH. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY A PERSISTENT FORECAST FOR HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 90S AND LOWS IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70 SOUTHERN VALLEY. 
THURSDAY RIDGE BEGINS TO WEAKEN WITH MOISTURE INCREASING ADDED POPS 
TO ALL AREAS WITH CHANCE POP MOUNTAINS. FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY 
FLATTENED OR WEAKENED RIDGE ALLOWS SEVERAL SHORTWAVES TO MOVE 
THROUGH WITH CHANCE POPS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HIGHS WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER DUE TO MORE CLOUDS AND RAINFALL.

534 
FXUS64 KMRX 051717 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
117 PM EDT SUN JUN 5 2011

.AVIATION...
GREATER INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON HAS INCREASED COVERAGE OF
CUMULUS CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA...AND WILL BRING SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS. HOWEVER THE
CONFIDENCE OF A STORM HITTING A TAF SITE IS LOW AT THIS TIME...AS
MOST ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY NEAR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. WILL MENTION
JUST CB FOR NOW. IF A STORM DOES AFFECT AN AIRPORT...STRONG WIND
GUSTS CAN BE EXPECTED. TRI HAD SOME MVFR FOG THIS MORNING...AND
THIS COULD OCCUR AGAIN...ESPECIALLY IF IT RAINS. WILL CONTINUE TO
CARRY MVFR FOG FOR A FEW HOURS THERE LATE TONIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

312 
FXUS64 KMRX 051412 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1012 AM EDT SUN JUN 5 2011

.DISCUSSION...
THE PERSISTENT HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE HAS SOMEWHAT LOOSENED ITS GRIP
OVER THE AREA AS IT RETROGRADES SLIGHTLY. THIS WILL ALLOW AN MCV
ASSOCIATED WITH ONGOING CONVECTION IN IL TO TRACK TOWARD THE AREA.
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF WEAKER SBCIN AND HIGHER DEWPOINTS
ACROSS SOUTH-CENTRAL KY TO EASTERN KY THIS MORNING. EXPECT
CONVECTION TO FIRE IN THIS AREA AS THE MCV APRROACHES THIS
AFTERNOON...MAINLY AFTER 18Z. NW MIDLEVEL FLOW WILL BRING THESE
STORMS INTO THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SW VA. SOME SLIGHT
ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS WILL BE MADE TO RAISE THEM IN THE PLATEAU...BUT
STILL STAYING IN THE CHANCE RANGE NORTH TO SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH AS
LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABILITY WILL LIMIT COVERAGE AND PRECIP
AMOUNTS. WILL ALSO MAKE SOME SLIGHT TEMPERATURE AND DEWPOINTS
ADJUSTMENTS BASED ON OBSERVED TRENDS AND LATEST GUIDANCE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

DGS

.AVIATION...RIDGE WILL WEAKEN A BIT TODAY AS WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY

933 
FXUS64 KMRX 050735
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT SUN JUN 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HEIGHTS WILL FALL A BIT TODAY AS 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WEAKENS.  WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL BRUSH AT 
LEAST NORTHERN AREAS...AND OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM CONVECTION TO OUR 
NORTH ALSO MAY HELP TO TRIGGER SOME CONVECTION TODAY.  SOUNDINGS 
LOOK MORE FAVORABLE THAN RECENT DAYS AS WELL...ALTHOUGH SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW MUCH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE.  
WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS NORTH...WITH POPS RANGING FROM SLIGHT CHANCE 
SOUTH TO HIGH CHANCE NORTH.  THERE IS SOME POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE 
STORMS...WILL CONTINUE MENTION IN HWO.  WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
EARLY TONIGHT...THEN DRY.  WILL BE HOT AGAIN TODAY.  RECORD HIGHS 
FOR TODAY ARE TRI 93...TYS 96...CHA 97...AND THE RECORD AT CHA 
APPEARS TO BE THE ONE MOST THREATENED.  WILL MENTION NEAR RECORD 
TEMPS IN SOUTHERN ZONES.   


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIMPS 
SOUTH TO NEAR THE GEORGIA BORDER EARLY MONDAY BEFORE WASHING OUT. 
MODELS INDICATE SLIGHTLY HIGHER MEAN RH ALONG WITH SOME DECENT 
INSTABILITY ACROSS SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA NEAR THE OLD BOUNDARY SO 
KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS AREA MONDAY. UPPER 
RIDGE BUILDS BACK ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY SUPPRESSING CONVECTION ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT MAY ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER MID 
WEEK. BY THURSDAY...MODEL FORECASTS SHOW A WEAKNESS DEVELOPING IN 
THE MASSIVE RIDGE OVER THE MID SOUTH WHICH MAY PROVIDE A SLIGHTLY 
IMPROVED OPPORTUNITY FOR CONVECTION SO APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES WHILE BROADBRUSHING SLIGHT CHANCE 
PROBABILITIES AREAWIDE ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS UPPER HEIGHTS 
CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY FALL AND A FRONTAL BOUNDARY MIGRATES SOUTH 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             97  69  93  67  94 /  20  20  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  93  67  91  63  92 /  30  20  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       93  66  92  63  93 /  30  20   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              91  59  88  56  90 /  40  20   0   0  10

894 
FXUS64 KMRX 050125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT SAT JUN 4 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
THE MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL BREAK DOWN 
TONIGHT...ALLOWING A SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO BRING A BETTER CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW. THE NAM SHOWS THE DEVELOPING 
CONVECTION OVER SE OH/NW WV CLIPPING OUR SW VIRGINIA COUNTIES LATE 
TONIGHT...BUT THIS SEEMS OVERDONE AND WILL STAY DRY TONIGHT. THE 
BEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL ARRIVE SUNDAY AFTERNOON WITH A 500 VORT MAX 
AND A 300 MB JET STREAK...WITH THE NORTHERN AREAS HAVING THE HIGHEST 
POP. CONVECTION SHOULD SPREAD SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE EVENING. LIMITED 
MOISTURE SUPPLY WILL KEEP POPS NO HIGHER THAN A CHANCE WITH QPF LESS 
THAN A QUARTER INCH. STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND ABUNDANT CAPE 
WILL BRING A THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS...WITH DOWNBURST WINDS BEING 
THE MAIN THREAT WITH LARGE HAIL POSSIBLE AS WELL. THE TROUGH AND JET 
STREAK MOVE AWAY FROM THE AREA SUNDAY EVENING...AND WITH THE LOSS OF 
INSTABILITY PRECIP SHOULD COME TO AN END BY MIDNIGHT.

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)... WEAK FRONT GETS ABSORBED INTO 
UPPER RIDGE AS IT MOVES SW MONDAY AND DRIER AIR MASS FROM OHIO 
VALLEY AND MID ATLANTIC STATES MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. SO 
STILL NO RAIN CHANCES ALTHOUGH COULD BE A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH AND WEST OF REGION. FROM TUESDAY ON MODELS 
SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT. ECMWF BUILDS RIDGE BACK ON TOP OF TN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THURSDAY SUPPRESSING CONVECTION BEFORE 
MOVING IT SOUTH AND WEST FRIDAY WHILE GFS KEEPS UPPER RIDGE CENTERED 
TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST DURING THE WHOLE EXTENDED PERIOD ALLOWING 
DISTURBANCES ROTATING AROUND THE RIDGE FROM THE GREAT LAKES AREA TO 
MOVE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM TUESDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. RIGHT NOW WILL KEEP CONVECTION IN THE MOUNTAIN AREAS 
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AND THEN IN ALL AREAS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
POPS ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE BUT MAY NEED TO INCREASE IF SYSTEMS TO THE 
NORTH BECOME MORE ORGANIZED. TEMPERATURES STAYING HOT SOUTHERN AND 
CENTRAL AREAS AND ONLY SLIGHTLY COOLER NE. SATURDAY COOLED HIGHS A 
FEW DEGREES ESPECIALLY EAST CENTRAL AND NE TN AND SW VA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  94  67  95  67 /   0  20  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  91  65  91  64 /   0  30  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  91  65  91  64 /  10  40  20  10  10

434 
FXUS64 KMRX 040659
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 AM EDT SAT JUN 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND
UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL DOMINATE OUR WEATHER TODAY. THE
RIDGE AXIS WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT WEST TONIGHT...AND A WEAK COLD FRONT
WILL SAG SOUTH TO AROUND THE OHIO RIVER BY 12Z. CANNOT RULE PRECIP
OUT TONIGHT ESPECIALLY NORTHERN ZONES...BUT EXPECT ANY PRECIP TO
STAY TO OUR NORTH SO WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. WILL MAKE A
FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...MAINLY TO BUMP UP SLIGHTLY. RECORD HIGHS
FOR TODAY ARE TRI 93...TYS 96...CHA 97. THE ONLY RECORD TEMP THAT
LOOKS LIKE IT MAY BE THREATENED IS AT CHA WHERE FORECAST HIGH IS
96...SO ONLY PLAN TO MENTION NEAR RECORD TEMPS IN SOUTHERN ZONES.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ON SUNDAY SHORT WAVELENGTH 
ENERGY WILL EFFECTIVELY CARVE AWAY AT THE NORTHEASTERN CORNER OF THE 
MASSIVE UPPER HIGH COVERING MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE 
NATION AS IT SHIFTS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. THE 
ACCOMPANYING SURFACE COOL FRONT WILL SLIP ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS PROVIDING A FOCUS FOR 
SCATTERED TO WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. KEPT THE 
LOW CHANCE CATEGORY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND A SMALL PART OF 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS THE MAJOR TERRAIN IN TENNESSEE 
BORDERING KENTUCKY AND NORTH CAROLINA. THE FRONT LOSES IDENTITY AND 
UPPER SUPPORT BY MONDAY AND LEFT POPS OUT AT THIS TIME. STAYED WITH 
A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY AS SUBSIDENCE AND SUPPRESSION WILL BE AT WORK AGAIN MID 
WEEK AS THE UPPER HIGH FULLY RE-ESTABLISHES ITSELF ACROSS THE 
EASTERN U.S. THE MODELS HINT AT ANOTHER SHORT WAVE DROPPING 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY 
FRIDAY SO MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP AREAWIDE FOR POSSIBLE 
CONVECTION. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
WHILE MAKING MINOR TWEAKS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
927 PM EDT FRI JUN 3 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE REGION PROVIDING A DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST 
OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR NORTH WILL SLIDE EASTWARD THROUGH 
TOMORROW...WHILE MID TO UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD OVER THE 
AREA. SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE WILL SUPPRESS CONVECTION 
TOMORROW...WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUING. OVERNIGHT LOWS 
HAVE BEEN CONSISTENTLY WARMER THAN GFS MOS GUIDANCE THE PAST FEW 
NIGHTS BY SEVERAL DEGREES...SO WILL GO WITH THE WARMER NAM MOS. 
HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW SHOULD STAY BELOW RECORD VALUES...RECORDS 
TOMORROW ARE TRI 93...TYS 96...CHA 97. HIGHS TOMORROW SHOULD PEAK A 
DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THESE RECORDS. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
STILL NOT MANY CHANGES IN OVERALL FORECAST FOR THE REMAINDER OF
THE WEEKEND AND NEXT WEEK. SATURDAY NIGHT THE RIDGE IS STRONG WITH
NO CONVECTION EXPECTED. SUNDAY HOWEVER WEAK FRONT DROPS DOWN FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY WITH INCREASING CLOUDS AND A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. HIGHEST CHANCES NE TN AND SW VA AND ALONG THE
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. RAIN CHANCES FROM LATE MORNING THROUGH LATE
EVENING. LOWS SLIGHTLY COOLER SUNDAY NIGHT THEN SATURDAY NIGHT
NORTHEAST WITH DRIER AIR SNEAKING IN FROM THE OHIO VALLEY AND
NORTHEAST STATES. RIDGE RETROGRADES SLIGHTLY SOUTHWEST SO COOLER
TEMPERATURES NE BUT ABOUT THE SAME SW. PATTERN VERY SIMILAR TUESDAY
THROUGH FRIDAY WITH FORECAST AREA ON EDGE OF LARGE UPPER LEVEL HIGH
CENTERED TO THE W AND SW AND OCCASIONAL IMPULSES MOVING AROUND
RIDGE BRINGING SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. NO CHANGE IN THE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURE PATTERN AS
WELL.

059 
FXUS64 KMRX 030724
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EDT FRI JUN 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING 
AGAIN OVER THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SHOULD SLIP TO OUR SOUTH EARLY TODAY...WITH SOME LOWER DEWPOINTS 
CONTINUING TO FILTER IN.  LOOKS LIKE FORECAST AREA SHOULD BE MAINLY 
DRY...WITH BEST CHANCE FOR ANY CONVECTION LIKELY TO BE SMOKIES AND 
SOUTHERN MOUNTAIN AREAS...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE 
TODAY...DRY ELSEWHERE.  WILL NOT ARGUE WITH MAV TEMPS FOR HIGHS 
TODAY...BUT WILL GENERALLY BUMP UP SLIGHTLY FOR LOWS TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DID NOT MAKE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. MODELS GENERALLY 
IN AGREEMENT WITH RIDGE STILL HOLDING STRONG FOR SATURDAY BUT SHORT 
WAVE MOVING OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE WILL HELP TO FLATTEN THE 
FEATURE WITH SOME RETROGRESSION EVIDENT BY SUNDAY. THE WAVE SPILLS 
OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN STATES WITH 
SURFACE COOL FRONT DROPPING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TO 
PROVIDE A FOCUS FOR SOME CONVECTION. THEREFORE MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS AND ADDED A LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR HIGHER TERRAIN 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MUCH OF THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH 
CAROLINA. KEPT THE DRY PERIOD ON MONDAY AND THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
AREAWIDE ON TUESDAY WITH ECMWF/GFS HINTING AT POSSIBILITY OF UPPER 
MIDWEST CONVECTION BUILDING SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
AT THIS TIME. NOT ENOUGH CERTAINTY BEYOND THIS TIMEFRAME TO CHANGE 
GOING FORECAST SO KEPT NORTH CAROLINA BORDER CONVECTION IN PLACE FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WHILE MAINTAINING A DRY REGIME ELSEWHERE. 
STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. DID NOT STRAY 
TOO FAR FROM MEX MOS MAX TEMP GUIDANCE DURING THE PERIOD EXCEPT TO 
TREND A LITTLE BELOW THE SUGGESTIONS FOR TRI MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 
WENT A FEW DEGREES ABOVE MIN TEMPS ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE PERIOD 
WHICH LOOK CLIMATOLOGICALLY DILUTED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

165 
FXUS64 KMRX 030231
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EDT THU JUN 2 2011

.DISCUSSION...THREAT OF ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER FOR SW NC. MIN 
TEMPS ON TRACK. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A FRONT HAS BECOME STATIONARY BETWEEN TYS AND TRI. THE ONLY EFFECT 
THIS FRONT HAS HAD IS TO LOWER DEWPOINTS INTO THE 50S NORTH...THUS 
LIMITING CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT THERE. FLOW OVER THE AREA IS DIFFLUENT 
AND THE LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE BOUNDARY IS SOUTH OF THE AREA...SO THE 
PRESENCE OF THE FRONT WILL NOT ASSIST FORCING FOR CONVECTION. SOME 
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER THE ELEVATED AREAS OF SW NC WILL BE POSSIBLE 
THROUGH THE EVENING. LOWER DEWPOINTS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF WILL 
LIKELY LIMIT THE DEVELOPMENT OF FOG TONIGHT. LOW TEMPS WILL BE A BIT 
COOLER NORTH...UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S...WITH MID TO UPPER 60S SOUTH. 
THIN CIRRUS FROM UPSTREAM CONVECTION WILL HAVE LITTLE IMPACT. THE 
STRONG RIDGE OVER NRN MS WILL REMAIN STATIONARY TOMORROW...SO A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST WILL BE FOLLOWED FOR FRIDAY...WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP IN THE EXTREME SW NC AND HIGH TEMPS IN THE MID 80S NORTH 
TO MID 90S SOUTH.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NOT MUCH CHANGE TO CURRENT EXTENDED FORECAST THROUGH NEXT WEEK.
UPPER RIDGE TO HOLD SATURDAY AND SO REMOVED SLIGHT CHANCE MOUNTAIN
AREAS. SUNDAY WEAK FRONT SLIDES SOUTHEAST ACROSS FORECAST AREA.
SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. SLIGHTLY
DRIER AIR MASS BUT NO SIGNIFICANT COOL DOWN TO CURRENT HOT
TEMPERATURES. MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE STRENGTHENS AGAIN. MODELS
SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH GFS SHOWING
RIDGE RETREATING TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST ALLOWING IMPULSES TO
WORK AROUND RIDGE INTO FORECAST AREA AND ECMWF SHOWING SUNDAYS
FRONT MOVING BACK NORTH TUESDAY WITH RIDGE STRENGTHENING WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY. PREFER ECMWF SOLUTION WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ONLY IN THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS AND SW
NC. HIGHS WILL BE GENERALLY LOWER TO MID 90S SOUTH AND UPPER 80S TO
LOWER 90S NORTH. LOWS UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S NORTH WHERE DRIER AIR
MASS WILL BE REINFORCED WITH WEAK FRONTS AND MID TO UPPER 60S
SOUTH.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  95  66  96  68 /  10  10   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  92  63  93  66 /  10  10   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  92  62  94  66 /  10   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              57  88  56  91  61 /  10   0   0  10  10

579 
FXUS64 KMRX 020802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EDT THU JUN 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMANAMTS OF A WEAK FRONT WILL
LINGER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN REGION OF THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT.
THE DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE
CWA SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE SOUTHERN ZONES. WITH
INSTABILITY INCREASING ALONG WITH THE LINGERING FRONT...MAY SEE A
FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING DURING THE AFTERNOON
AND EVENING HOURS. MOISTURE IS LIMITED...SO THUNDERSTORM
DEVELOPMENT SHOULD ALSO BE LIMITED TODAY AND TONIGHT. WILL SEE
UPPER CLOUDS ENTERING FROM UPSTREAM CONVECTION...BUT ABOVE NORMAL
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED AGAIN. COULD HAVE RECORD HIGHS BROKEN
AGAIN TODAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...GFS 
MODEL SHOWS THIS UPPER HIGH DRIFTING FURTHER TO THE WEST THAN THE 
ECMWF MODEL BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...RESULTING IN A STRONGER NORTHWEST 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE GFS 
MODEL THEN SUGGESTS THIS NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL BRING TWO 
WEAK COLD FRONTS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AND TUESDAY. 
WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH THESE FRONTS...WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED... 
WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. OVERALL...A 
PERSISTENT PATTERN OF HOT AND MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS WILL LINGER 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...WITH ONLY A SLIGHT COOL DOWN WITH 
EACH FRONTAL PASSAGE.

629 
FXUS64 KMRX 020200
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT WED JUN 1 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MINOR UPDATE TO DROP EVENING 
CONVECTION. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SHOWERS ARE DEVELOPING OVER ERN 
KY AND SRN WV...BUT ARE PRETTY SHORT-LIVED. ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY 
LINGER INTO THE EVENING ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN...BUT MOST SHOULD 
DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET. RUC MODEL SHOWS SHOWER ACTIVITY PERSISTING 
WELL AFTER 00Z...BUT THIS IS LIKELY OVERDONE. 

SURFACE COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PUSH SOUTHWARD
OVERNIGHT...REACHING OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES BY SUNRISE. AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT SHOULD LEAD TO SOME
LIGHT PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING...MUCH LIKE LAST NIGHT...MAINLY NORTH.
THE NAM SHOWS THE FRONT PUSHING SOUTH OF TRI IN THE MORNING...WHICH
SHOULD MEAN SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS THERE. THE FOCUS FOR CONVECTION
TOMORROW SHOULD SHIFT TO CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS WHERE LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE WILL BE GREATER. CAPPING INVERSION WILL BE WEAKER AT CHA
TOMORROW...SO WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THERE. ABUNDANT CAPE WILL MEAN
ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP COULD BE STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE. THE
850-700 MB RIDGE CENTERED OVER AL/GA WILL LIMIT MOISTURE
AVAILABILITY...SO QPF WILL BE LIGHT AND COVERAGE SCATTERED AT BEST.
TEMPS SHOULD TOP OUT A FEW DEGREES SHORT OF RECORD HIGHS...WHICH
ARE 91 AT TRI...98 AT TYS...AND 97 AT CHA.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE 
EXPECTED IN THE OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED.  MAIN 
FEATURE WILL REMAIN A STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE POSITIONED OVER THE 
EASTERN U.S.  AN OCCASIONAL WEAK BOUNDARY WILL TRACK ALONG THE 
PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE AND MAY AID BRIEF ISOLATED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  OTHERWISE...MAINLY 
DRY...HUMID AND UNSEASONABLY HOT THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  71  95  70  96  69 /  10  30   0  20  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    69  92  68  93  67 /  10  20   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            69  92  68  93  67 /  10  20   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   62  89  64  90  64 /  10  10  10  10  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1038 AM EDT WED JUN 1 2011

.DISCUSSION...
MORNING UPDATE WILL RAISE POPS SLIGHTLY IN NORTHERN AREAS.
COMPARING AREA 12Z RAOBS TO YESTERDAY...THERE IS SLIGHTLY MORE
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND SLIGHTLY LESS CONVECTIVE INHIBITION TO
OVERCOME...MOST NOTABLY IN THE RNK SOUNDINGS. RUC SOUNDINGS AGREE
THAT NORTHERN AREAS WILL HAVE VERY LITTLE CAP...WHILE SOUTHERN
AREAS WILL MAINTAIN A CAP. LARGE CAPE VALUES...STEEP LOW LEVEL
LAPSE RATES...AND LARGE LOW-TO- MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCE
INDICATE THAT ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP WILL BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE.
WEAK SHEAR AND HIGH FREEZING LEVELS SHOULD BE A LIMITING FACTOR FOR
HAIL...SO DOWNBURST WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. COVERAGE IS
EXPECTED TO BE SCATTERED NORTH AND ISOLATED SOUTH. TEMPERATURES
NEAR RECORD HIGHS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 010800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT WED JUN 1 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK FRONT IS EXPECTED TO
TRACK THROUGH THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE
REMAINS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA SO WILL KEEP THE
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN ZONES. WITH INSTABILITY INCREASING
ALONG WITH THE FRONT TRACKING THROUGH...MAY SEE A FEW STRONG TO
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS AND ACROSS
THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED WHICH
SHOULD LIMIT THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT.  ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES
ARE EXPECTED AGAIN. WILL LIKELY BREAK RECORD HIGHS AGAIN SO WILL
ADD RECORD WORDING AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE MID MS AND 
TN RIVER VALLEYS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH HOT AND MOSTLY 
DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUING OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. A WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE NORTHWARD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...AND COULD POSSIBLY TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION OVER MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. A 
WEAK COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH THE GFS MODEL INDICATING ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
QUICKLY MOVING INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT. WITH LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH THESE FRONTS AND THE 
UPPER-LEVEL HIGH CREATING SUBSIDENCE OVER THE REGION...WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WITH THESE FRONTS. AS FOR TEMPS...

020 
FXUS64 KMRX 311916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT TUE MAY 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...INTENSE SURFACE HEATING IS 
OVERPOWERING THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL HIGH OVER THE REGION ALLOWING A 
COUPLE OF SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM TO FORM OVER THE CAROLINA 
BORDER AREA AND ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. NEARING THE SUMMER 
SOLSTICE AND THEREFORE THERE IS PLENTY OF SUNSHINE LEFT THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR A FEW MORE THUNDERSTORMS SO STAYED WITH 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR MOUNTAIN CONVECTION EITHER SIDE OF THE 
GREAT VALLEY. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THE SOUTHERN CANADIAN UPPER 
TROUGH BUILDING EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TOWARD THE NORTHEASTERN 
U.S. ON WEDNESDAY. WEAK SURFACE COOL FRONT PROGGED TO MAKE SOME 
PROGRESS SOUTH TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NOT SO SURE IT WILL 
MAKE IT ALL THE WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...BUT CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS AHEAD OF THE FRONT MAY HAVE A 
CHANCE TO BUILD INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE IN 
SCATTERED FASHION SO KEPT A LOW CHANCE POP GOING HERE. OPTED FOR 
SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA AS RIDGE 
WEAKENS OR RETROGRADES A BIT. A WEAK BOUNDARY MAY BE LEFT BEHIND 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN THROUGH THURSDAY AND MAY SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR 
SCATTERED CONVECTION NORTH WITH MORE ISOLATED DEVELOPMENT SOUTH. THE 
HEAT CONTINUES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...ALTHOUGH BOUGHT INTO THE 
GUIDANCE TREND REDUCES THE MAX TEMP BY ABOUT A DEGREE EACH DAY. FOR 
MIN TEMPS WENT CLOSER TO THE MET MOS DUE TO THE UNREALISTIC 
APPEARANCE OF THE MAV NUMBERS IN THIS LATE SPRING HEAT WAVE WITH 
PLENTY OF MID 60 DEGREE SURFACE DEWPOINT AIR AROUND.   

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LAYER RIDGING REMAINS 
STRONG OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INTO THE WEEKEND. H85 TEMPS 
>=20C IN THE RIDGE BUBBLE. NEAR RECORD HIGH TEMPS WILL CONTINUE. 
LIGHT SURFACE WINDS AND WEAK STEERING FLOW. ISOLATED AFTN CONVECTION 
WILL POSSIBLY INITIATE OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. IF STORMS DEVELOP 
THEY WILL BE SLOW MOVING HEAVY RAINERS. UPPER RIDGE SUPPRESSES SOUTH 
WITH SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGGING INTO THE AREA LATE SUNDAY. 
DECENT CHANCE OF CONVECTION ALONG FRONT SUNDAY. CHANCE OF PCPN LESS 
CERTAIN FOR MON AND TUE DEPENDING HOW FAR SOUTH FRONT AND DRIER 
AIRMASS PROGRESSES.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT TUE MAY 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH 
A WARM AND VERY MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION (WHICH 
HAS BEEN SUPPRESSING CONVECTION FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS) WILL BE 
WEAKER TODAY...WHICH COULD ALLOW SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION TO FORM 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THESE SOUNDINGS 
ALSO REVEAL A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON... 
WITH AN INVERTED-V PROFILE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER AND DEEP LAYER OF 
DRY AIR IN THE MID LEVELS. THUS...THINK THERE WILL BE A SEVERE 
THREAT FOR SOME DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS AND LARGE HAIL WITH A FEW 
STORMS. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL REMAIN CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AGAIN TODAY...WHICH SHOULD CAUSE TEMPS TO RISE 
TO NEAR RECORD LEVELS FOR THIS DATE (CHA 95...TYS 93...OQT 92...TRI 
92). AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST...BUT WITH TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN ZONES. RIDGE BUILDS IN BUT MOISTURE 
LINGERING FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES ACROSS THE NORTHERN REGION. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL GO WITH 
ONLY LOW POPS FOR NOW. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE 
PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

U.S. IN THIS CONFIGURATION THERE WILL BE A SMALL CHANCE THAT

VALLEY AND MOVE INTO SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
SO PLACED 30 PERCENT POPS HERE WHILE OPTING FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE 
ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA AS THE PROTECTIVE RIDGE GETS 
KNOCKED DOWN JUST A BIT. THE HEAT WILL CONTINUE BOTH TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH MAX TEMPS A GOOD 10 TO 12 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DEEP LAYER RIDGING 
REMAINS OVER THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD. NEAR RECORD TEMPS WILL 
PERSIST INTO THE WEEKEND. ISOLATED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD SLOWLY 
INCREASE THROUGH THE PERIOD AS MOISTURE SLOWLY POOLS OVER THE REGION 
SOUTH OF AN APPROACHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
MOVE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY NIGHT. A 
SIGNIFICANT COOL DOWN IS NOT EXPECTED WITH THIS FRONT THOUGH 
HUMIDITIES WILL LIKELY BE LOWER EARLY NEXT WEEK.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN

AND TONIGHT...WITH A MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION AND SUBSIDENCE 
ALOFT SUPPRESSING MOST CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. HOWEVER...THIS CAP

MAY BE ABLE FORCE SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. THIS UPPER-LEVEL HIGH 
WILL ALSO CAUSE TEMPS TO RISE TO NEAR RECORD LEVELS FOR THIS DATE 
(CHA 95...TYS 94...OQT 92...TRI 91). AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY

WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.

NORMAL TEMP FORECAST THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD. STRONG 
UPPER RIDGE AT 500 MILLIBARS IS EXPECTED BY MODELS TO REMAIN IN 
CONTROL OF THE WEATHER PICTURE INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION. WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS THE UPPER RIDGE RETROGRADES SLIGHTLY WEST 
DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...BUT IS EXPECTED TO BUILD BACK IN FOR NEXT 
WEEKEND. 

A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO TRY TO MOVE SOUTH THROUGH THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BEFORE 
RETURNING BACK TO THE NORTH DUE TO RE-EMERGENCE OF THE MASSIVE UPPER 
RIDGE BY SATURDAY. BASICALLY KEPT SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS GOING 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS FRONT NEARS THE FORECAST AREA. CONTINUED 
WITH LOWERING OFF THREAT FOR THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AND INTO THE 
WEEKEND...AS UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD AND UPPER RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO GET 
STRONGER ACROSS THE REGION.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 PM EDT SUN MAY 29 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LOOKS LIKE SOME FLAT

MID NIGHT SHIFT MAY BE ABLE TO REMOVE POPS FOR MEMORIAL DAY...BUT I
WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE IN FOR NOW...MAINLY FOR THE ERN MTNS.
HIGHS WILL LIKELY TOP OUT IN THE MID 80S TO LOWER 90S OVER ALL BUT
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHO RHP (MURPHY NC) TEMP LOOKS
QUESTIONABLE (TOO WARM FOR NEARBY SITES?). ADD A COUPLE OF DEGREES
FOR MONDAY MAXES AND WE ARE AT RECORD HIGHS...SO ADDED RECORD
WORDING TO ZFPMRX. 

UPPER RIDGE AND MID LEVEL INVERSION SHOULD STILL BE QUITE STRONG
INTO TUESDAY...SO MOS POPS ARE PROBABLY TOO HIGH. WILL KEEP POPS IN
LOW SLIGHT CHANCE FOR HIGHER TERRAIN FOR NOW ON TUESDAY.  


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WELL ABOVE NORMAL HEAT 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH SOME MINOR ABATEMENT THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY AS THE UPPER RIDGE RETROGRADES SLIGHTLY WEST. WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPS SOUTH THROUGH THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TOWARD 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BEFORE RETURNING BACK TO THE NORTH 
DUE TO RE-EMERGENCE OF THE MASSIVE UPPER RIDGE. BASICALLY KEPT 
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS GOING WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS FRONT 
NEARS THE FORECAST AREA AND THEN DROP OFF THE THREAT FOR A 
THUNDERSTORM FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AS HEIGHTS BUILD.

THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY SO APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS WITH A LOW CHANCE POP FOR HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS DURING 
THIS PERIOD. KEPT SATURDAY DRY WITH SLIGHTLY LOWER DEWPOINT AIRMASS 
IN PLACE WITH A NICE SURFACE RIDGE KEEPING LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW 
DISPLACED FARTHER WEST ACROSS MID AND WEST TENNESSEE. HEAT WAVE 
CONTINUES INTO MID WEEK BEFORE TEMPS DROP BACK A FEW DEGREES BEHIND 
THE WEAK FRONT.

HOLIDAY WEEKEND!


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...EASTERN U.S. UPPER RIDGE 
WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO WEDNESDAY. 
LATER WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY THE MASSIVE HIGH BEGINS TO RETROGRADE 
BACK TO THE WEST WHILE A LONG WAVE TROUGH DROPS SLOWLY INTO THE 
NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
CONVECTION ONLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS THROUGH WEDNESDAY. AS 
THE UPPER LEVEL STEERING FLOW BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY...ALLOWED FOR 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY AS THE POSSIBILITY EXISTS FOR UPPER MIDWEST CONVECTION TO 
DROP SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON THE FRONT SIDE OF 
RETROGRADING RIDGE. THE HEAT WILL CERTAINLY BUILD IN THIS WEATHER 
REGIME AND STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
154 PM EDT FRI MAY 27 2011

.AVIATION...UPPER TROF WILL FINALLY EXIT THE APPALACHIANS BUT NOT
BEFORE GENERATING A COUPLE MORE SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM IN THE
VICINITY OF TRI EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. SATELLITE AND OBSERVATIONS
REVEAL THE LOWEST DECK IS SCATTERING OUT AT TYS AND CHA. ALL SITES
ARE EXPECTED TO BE VFR THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD EXCEPT AT TRI
WHERE APPLIED AN MVFR CEILING TONIGHT. HOWEVER...THERE IS A CHANCE THAT
FOG DEVELOPMENT TONIGHT WILL PRODUCE LOWER VISIBILITY THAN FORECAST
ESPECIALLY AT TRI. CLOUD COVER IS KEEPING TEMPERATURES LOWER HERE
AND EVAPORATION RATES ARE THEREFORE REDUCED THIS AFTERNOON. SO
WOULD EXPECT MORE FOG HERE TONIGHT. THE ONLY PROBLEM IS THE
RELATIVELY PERSISTANT LOW DECK AT TRI WHICH MAY KEEP FOG IN CHECK.

FXUS64 KMRX 271333
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 AM EDT FRI MAY 27 2011

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS CONTINUE THIS MORNING MAINLY OVER NE TN AND SW 
VA. THE WEAK COLD FRONT SEEMS TO BE STALLING OUT ACROSS EASTERN MOST 
PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA...AND IS PROGGED TO GRADUALLY DISSIPATE. 
12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW THAT THE UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH AXIS IS LOCATED OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS MORNING...
AND WILL SLOWLY LIFT E AND NE OUT OF THE REGION BY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON. 

MODIFIED 12Z OHX SOUNDING IS VERY STABLE FOR REACHING 70S TO LOWER 
80S...WHILE A MODIFIED 12Z RNK SOUNDING YIELDED JUST SLIGHT 
INSTABILITY (LESS THAN 500 J/KG CAPE). THUS...THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD 
BE VERY ISOLATED WITH BRUNT OF CONVECTION TO BE THESE LINGERING 
MORNING SHOWERS.

UPPER RIDGE IS SHOWN TO REALLY BUILD OVER THE SE STATES FOR THE 
HOLIDAY WEEKEND...BUT THE RIDGE MAY NOT BE SUPPRESSIVE ENOUGH TO 
KEEP MTNS DRY FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. 

PLAN TO FRESHEN ALL FORECAST GRIDS...WEB PRODUCTS AND ZFPMRX BY 11 
AM EDT.
