979 
FXUS64 KMRX 270655
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT FRI MAY 27 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING...BUT ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED TODAY AS 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SLOWLY MOVES ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
MODELS AGREE THAT THE BEST COVERAGE OF CONVECTION WILL BE OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS IN 
THESE AREAS. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO EVENTUALLY WASH OUT 
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT...WITH DRIER AIR SLOWLY FILTERING INTO 
THE REGION AFTER MIDNIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME SMALL DIFFERENCES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN STORY FOR THE LONG
TERM IS UPPER RIDGE WHICH BUILDS INTO THE APPALACHIAN REGION ON
SATURDAY AND MORE OR LESS PERSISTS THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE
PERIOD. THIS FEATURE IS EXPECTED TO PROVIDE GENERALLY DRY
CONDITIONS WITH TEMPS CLIMBING TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO. HAVE CONTINUED
TO CONFINE ANY DIURNAL CONVECTION TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS
SUBSIDENCE INDUCED BY UPPER RIDGE SHOULD INHIBIT CONVECTION
ELSEWHERE. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ALONG WITH SUPPORT FROM
MANY OF THE GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DEPICT UPPER RIDGE RETROGRADING
WESTWARD BY MID WEEK. IN ADDITION...THE GFS PROJECTS A WEAK COLD
FRONT PUSHING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE
WEDNESDAY IN RESULTING NORTHWEST FLOW. THIS MAY POTENTIALLY PRODUCE
MORE WIDESPREAD AND/OR ORGANIZED CONVECTION BY LATE WEDNESDAY.
HOWEVER...THE ECMWF MODEL DOES NOT DEPICT THIS SCENARIO. DUE TO
UNCERTAINTY...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES AT THIS TIME. FOR
TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX
GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 261946
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 PM EDT THU MAY 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...BUSY DAY WITH A MOIST/UNSTABLE
AIRMASS AHEAD OF THE SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT. AREAS THAT HEATED UP
AHEAD OF THE MORNING ACTIVITY HAVE SEEN LARGE HAIL...UP TO GOLF
BALL SIZE OR SLIGHTLY LARGER. SCATTERED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS
WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS...AND I WOULD EXPECT POSSIBLY
A NEW WATCH...ONCE SEVERE TSTM WATCH #379 EXPIRES AT 6PM EDT.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT NEAR A OHX TO HUN LINE
SO KEPT POPS AROUND 60 TO 80 PERCENT THROUGH MIDNIGHT...THEN LET
POPS DECREASE SLIGHTLY. NE AND E AREAS MAY KEEP LIKELY COVERAGE
EARLY ON FRIDAY...SO SLIGHT TWEAKS WERE MADE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...NOT A LOT OF TIME TO WORK ON FORECAST GRIDS FOR TONIGHT
AND FRIDAY...JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE IN LINE WITH LATEST
RADAR TRENDS AND NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THRU THURSDAY)...UPPER TROF EXITS VERY 
SLOWLY FRIDAY NIGHT SO MAINTAINED SLIGHT THROUGH SMALL CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. PRECIP 
FINALLY GONE BY THE WEEKEND AS MASSIVE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE 
EASTERN U.S. THE RIDGE EXPANDS IN COVERAGE AND STRENGTHENS THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY BEFORE RETREATING BACK TO THE WEST. RIDGING LEADS TO 
SUBSIDENCE AND DRYING SO KEPT MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD DRY FOR 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...THE MODELS DO INDICATE SOME 
INSTABILITY AVAILABLE FOR ISOLATED CONVECTION MONDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY AND THE BEST CHANCE THAT A STORM CAN FORM IN THIS 
ENVIRONMENT WILL BE OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN SO APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS EACH DAY IN THIS AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BECOME VERY WARM WITH 
HIGHS AROUND 10 TO 12 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. TRENDED TEMPS TOWARD MEX 
MOS GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
205 AM EDT THU MAY 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LINE OF STRONG-SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS PLATEAU WILL SLOWLY WEAKEN AS IT MOVES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY 12Z. 

A WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEY TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
MOVING INTO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT. RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 300MB 
JET WILL COMBINE WITH WEAK-MODERATE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING TO HELP 
REGENERATE CONVECTION LATER TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT. MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL BE AVAILABLE TO PRODUCE STRONG-SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS...INITIALLY OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND PLATEAU...THEN 
MOVE EAST ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS DUE TO MODERATELY STRONG 
BOUNDARY LAYER JET AND LARGE HAIL UP TO GOLFBALL SIZE. HOWEVER...CAN 
NOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED TORNADO WITH SIGNIFICANT TORNADO PARAMETER 
FAVORABLE ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY.  

WILL MAINTAIN NPW FOR THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 14Z GIVEN STRENGTH OF LOW
LEVEL JET.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES 
SLOWLY INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON FRI. SCATTERED CONVECTION 
CONTINUES INTO EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT. LAYER DRIES AS TROUGH AXIS SHIFTS 
EAST OF THE AREA. SOME CONVECTION MAY INITIATE OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF NE TN AND SW VA SAT BUT STORM MOTION SHOULD KEEP 
ACTIVITY JUST TO THE EAST OF MRX CWA SO LEFT POPS OUT OF SAT FOR 
NOW. RIDGE BUILDS OVER AREA INTO NEXT WEEK. TEMPS WILL CLIMB WITH 
EACH DAY. ISOLATED DIURNAL TSTMS POSSIBLE BUT CHANCE TO SMALL FOR 
MENTION. WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES SOUTH INTO THE AREA WED. 
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
CAN BE EXPECTED...WENT SLIGHTLY ABOVE MEX TEMP GUIDANCE.

THURSDAY AFTERNOON.  TIMING OF THUNDERSTORMS IN QUESTION SO FOR 
NOW...WILL ONLY MENTION CB AND VCTS.  HOWEVER...IF A STRONG STORM 
MOVES THROUGH A TAF SITE...EXPECT BRIEF MVFR CONDITIONS AND GUSTY 
THUNDERSTORM WINDS.

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

MOVEMENT OF THE STORMS IN WEST TN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT WED MAY 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS
SHOW LIMITED CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT THUS FAR...AND MOSTLY FLAT
SUGGESTING SOME SUPPRESSION. THIS SUPPRESSION PLUS LACK OF ANY
ORGANIZED AREAS OF CONVERGENCE THIS AFTERNOON...SUPPORTS VERY LOW
OR NO POP FOR REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON.

SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS AND DEEP MOISTURE CONVERGENCE ARE NOTED 
OVER WRN THIRD OF TN AND MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION. STRONG TO 
SEVERE CONVECTION PROGGED TO DEVELOP THOSE AREAS THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...THEN TRACK E OR NE OVERNIGHT. MODELS TEND TO ALLOW THIS
CONVECTION TO ENTER WRN AREAS BEFORE DAYBREAK THURSDAY...THEN
WEAKEN. FAR NE TN AND SW VA AREAS SHOULD STAY DRY...SO ADDED PATCHY
FOG TO THOSE AREAS OVERNIGHT...GIVEN MOIST AIRMASS/BOUNDARY LAYER.

HARD TO TIME AND ESTIMATE AMOUNT OF CONVECTIVE COVERAGE BY THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT I DID NUDGE POPS UP SLIGHTLY THAT PERIOD TO BETTER 
MESH WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. COULD GET CATEGORICAL COVERAGE BY 
THURSDAY EVENING AS COLD FRONT EASES EASTWARD...BUT HIGH END OF 
LIKELY FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKS FINE FOR NOW. 

DECREASING POPS FROM THE WEST ON FRIDAY FITS WELL WITH TIMING/TRACK 
OF COLD FRONT. OTHERWISE...GFS MOS TEMPS LOOKED GOOD AND CONSISTENT 
WITH PREVIOUS MIN/MAX TEMP GRIDS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS INDICATING
SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING INTO FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER
TROUGH EXITS THE AREA...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS. A
WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON SATURDAY. DEEPEST
MOISTURE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF AREA SO WILL KEEP LOW POPS
FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS IN BRINGING HOT AND
DRY WEATHER SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS INDICATING DIURNAL
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. BUT WILL
KEEP IT DRY FOR NOW. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED...
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 241835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT TUE MAY 24 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FORECAST SOUNDINGS CONTINUE 
TO DEPICT INSTABILITY PERSISTING INTO THE EVENING HOURS. THUS WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE EARLY HALF OF THE FIRST 
PERIOD. UPPER FLOW AMPLIFIES SOMEWHAT BY TOMORROW AS UPPER TROUGH 
ADVANCES FROM WEST. THIS SHOULD PUSH BEST DYNAMICS EVEN FARTHER 
NORTH. FORECAST SOUNDINGS FOR TOMORROW ALSO DEPICT FAIRLY 
SIGNIFICANT CAP WHICH SHOULD TEND TO INHIBIT DEVELOPMENT OF DIURNAL 
CONVECTION. THUS TENDED TO DOWNPLAY POPS FOR TOMORROW AFTERNOON... 
WITH ANY DIURNAL CONVECTION THAT DOES DEVELOP EXPECTED TO BE 
CONFINED MAINLY TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN. GUIDANCE TEMPS ARE GENERALLY 
CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. TENDED TO FAVOR A BLEND OF THE MET AND 
MAV GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MIDLEVEL RIDGING WILL SHIFT EAST OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST...AND A 
CLOSED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS TO THE 
LOWER GREAT LAKES AREA THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. MODEL TRENDS HAVE 
BEEN TOWARD A SLOWER SYSTEM. A STRONG LLJ DEVELOPS OVER THE AREA 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND WE COULD APPROACH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA IN 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING THE NIGHT...AND PERHAPS IN THE VALLEY WITH 
DAYTIME MIXING THURSDAY. A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH...FALLING 500 MB 
HEIGHTS...AND AN UPPER JET STREAK OVER KY SHOULD HELP INITIATE 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO OUR WEST THURSDAY AFTERNOON...MOVING 
EAST INTO OUR AREA IN THE EVENING. WITH THE SLOWER TIMING...THE 
HIGHEST POPS WILL BE AFTER 00Z FRIDAY. GIVEN THE STRONG 
UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND FIELD THERE WILL BE A THREAT OF SEVERE 
STORMS...MAINLY DOWNBURST WINDS. THE TRAILING COLD FRONT NEVER 
PUSHES ENTIRELY INTO OUR AREA...THE NAM SHOWS IT HANGING OVER MIDDLE 
TN THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE AREA ON FRIDAY.

A SECOND CLOSED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS AND UPPER GREAT LAKES ON SATURDAY...BUT MOST OF THE LIFT WITH 
THIS SYSTEM STAYS TO THE NORTH. THERE IS SOME UPPER DIVERGENCE AND 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION THAT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS NORTH AND A 
SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH. 

A MID-ATLANTIC RIDGE RETROGRADES THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT 
WEEK...SETTLING DIRECTLY OVER OUR AREA BY MONDAY. THIS SHOULD 
PROVIDE HOT AND DRY WEATHER...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES APPROACHING 
RECORD LEVELS IN THE LOW TO MID 90S.


&&

THE LINE OF CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN APPEARS TO BE WEAKENING... 
MODELS HINT AT MORE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT 
AS THIS UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE COOLS THE MID LEVELS AND CREATES A 
LITTLE MORE INSTABILITY ALOFT. IN ADDITION...THINK THAT SOME STORMS 
LATER TONIGHT COULD BECOME SEVERE WITH THIS ADDITIONAL INSTABILITY.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION CONVECTION 
AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
TRENDS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
758 PM EDT MON MAY 23 2011

.AVIATION...CONVECTIVE LINE ADVANCING EAST INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF
MIDDLE TENNESSEE EARLY THIS EVENING. EXPECT THE LINE TO AFFECT CHA
AT AROUND 04Z TYS AROUND 05Z AND TRI BY 06Z. USED PREVAILING
THUNDER ALL THREE SITES WITH AN MVFR REDUCTION IN HEAVIER RAIN
WITH THE CONVECTION FOR CHA AND TYS. FLIGHT CONDITIONS SHOULD
RETURN TO VFR AT TYS AND CHA BY 06-09Z BUT APPLIED SOME LIGHT FOG
AT TRI AROUND SUNRISE. THERE COULD BE SOME THUNDER AT TRI AND TYS
EARLIER IN THE AFTERNOON THAN RECENT DAYS AS AN IMPULSE SHIFTS EAST
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH DURING THE MORNING SO STAYED WITH VICINITY
TSRA FOR THESE TERMINALS.

547 
FXUS64 KMRX 231840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT MON MAY 23 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE EXPECTED TO 
THE OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PER MODEL 
CONSENSUS. LOW AMPLITUDE...GENERALLY SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW PROJECTED TO 
CONTINUE WITH EMBEDDED SHORT WAVES KICKING OFF POTENTIAL MCS 
ACTIVITY. BEST SUPPORT FOR CONVECTION REMAINS NORTH OF OUR CWA NEAR 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...THUS CONTINUE TO FAVOR A SOUTH TO NORTH POPS 
GRADIENT. FOR TEMPS...MAV GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE...AND 
GENERALLY GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST IN THE SHORT TERM WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT 
SLOWLY EAST OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
THIS WILL ALLOW FOR GREATER ADVECTION OF GULF MOISTURE INTO THE 
AREA. WE SHOULD REMAIN CAPPED ON WEDNESDAY...WITH JUST A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS POPPING UP WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. STRONGER LIFT 
SHOULD BE ABLE TO BREAK THE CAP LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY REGION. THE BEST LIFT 
WITH THE UPPER TROUGH CROSSES THURSDAY NIGHT...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS THAT PERIOD. A LLJ IN THE 40-50 KT RANGE AND MLCAPE IN THE 
1000-1500 J/KG RANGE MAY RESULT IN SOME SEVERE STORMS THURSDAY 
EVENING. SOME PRECIP CHANCES WITH THIS SYSTEM LINGER INTO FRIDAY AS 
IT IS SLOW MOVING AND MODELS TRENDS HAVE BEEN TOWARD A SLOWER 
SYSTEM. ANOTHER SYSTEM IS CLOSE ON ITS HEELS BUT A LITTLE FARTHER 
NORTH...WHICH SHOULD BRING CHANCE POPS TO NORTHERN AREAS ON 
SATURDAY. A BUILDING RIDGE WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER AND ABOVE-NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  89  66  89  67 /  30  20  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  86  64  88  67 /  50  40  20  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  87  65  88  67 /  50  50  20  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  85  60  87  61 /  40  60  30  20  10

903 
FXUS64 KMRX 230730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT MON MAY 23 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS REMAINS 
ACROSS THE REGION. HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. 
SOUTHWESTERLY LAYER FLOW PERSISTS IN THIS SCENARIO. UPPER IMPULSE 
MOVING EAST THROUGH NORTHERN TN VALLEY THIS MORNING. THIS WILL 
PROVIDE SUFFICIENT LIFT FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION EARLY 
TODAY...MAINLY NORTH OF I40. AIRMASS DESTABILIZES AGAIN THIS 
AFTERNOON. DEVELOPING SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST INTO WESTERN TN VLY 
LATER TODAY. THIS SETS UP UPPER DIVERGENCE ACROSS THE AREA. THIS 
COUPLED WITH THE UNSTABLE AIRMASS OFFERS A CHANCE FOR ANOTHER ROUND 
OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE CLIMO.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN OVERALL 
PATTERN FOR UNSETTLE WEATHER FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER... 
THERE CONTINUES TO BE MODEL DIFFERENCES IN TIMING AND POSITION OF 
THE FEATURES.  TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...A SERIES OF WEAK WAVES 
TRACKING ALONG A WEAK BOUNDARY STRETCHED ACROSS THE REGION...WILL 
ALLOW OCCASIONAL ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP AND 
MOVE THROUGH THE MRX CWA.  THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE THROUGH PRODUCING AN ORGANIZED LINE OF CONVECTION.  WITH MODEL 
DIFFERENCES...WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS OVER THE AREA FOR THE 
WEEKEND.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 221843
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT SUN MAY 22 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR SOUTH AND 
EAST WILL KEEP A MOISTER SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW INTO THE AREA.  WITH 
INCREASED MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY...EXPECT MORE IN THE WAY OF 
CONVECTION FOR THE SHORT TERM.  SOME AFTERNOON CONVECTION ALREADY 
FIRING OVER THE AREA...AND SPC HAS ISSUED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM 
WATCH FOR MUCH OF THE AREA THROUGH 01Z.  MODELS ALSO HINT AT SOME 
WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY PERHAPS BRINGING ADDITIONAL CONVECTION LATER 
TONIGHT.  WILL NOT TRY TO TIME CONVECTION AT THIS POINT...BUT WILL 
BROAD BRUSH MAINLY CHANCE POPS (EXCEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTH MON) 
THROUGH TOMORROW...WITH HIGHEST POPS NORTH AND NORTHWEST ZONES.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT TOO MUCH CHANGE NOTED 
IN LATEST MODEL/ENSEMBLE RUNS FROM PREVIOUS RUNS. A SERIES OF WEAK 
UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL CONTINUE TO RIPPLE THROUGH A 
LOW-AMPLITUDE FLOW AS A QUASI-STATIONARY SURFACE BOUNDARY LURKS JUST 
TO OUR NORTH THROUGH MID-WEEK. POTENTIALLY MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM 
STILL ON TRACK TO AFFECT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE 
WORK WEEK. STILL SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BETWEEN THE ECMWF 
AND GFS MODELS. TENDED TO FAVOR FASTER GFS SOLUTION SINCE IT HAS 
SUPPORT OF MOST OF THE GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

NIGHTFALL.

UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED WITH MODEL DIFFERENCES IN 
TIMING AND POSITION OF FEATURES.  EARLY IN THE PERIOD...A WEAK 
BOUNDARY WILL BE STRETCHED ACROSS THE REGION...MAINLY EXPECTED TO BE 
NORTH OF THE MRX AREA.  A SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES WILL TRACK THROUGH 
THE UPPER FLOW...AIDING CONVECTION.  AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP 
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORM FORECAST FOR MONDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  AROUND THE THURSDAY TIME FRAME...A COLD FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO PUSH THROUGH THE AREA FOR OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHING FOR THE WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 220145
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT SAT MAY 21 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED 
WARM FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR LOUISVILLE KY TO CROSSVILLE TO 
CHATTANOOGA. THIS WEAK WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE 
NORTHEAST TONIGHT...BRINGING MORE HUMID AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION ALONG THIS WARM FRONT 
OVER SOUTHEAST KY...WITH ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT INITIATING OVER THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.

THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION 
ISOLATED CONVECTION AND PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
MOUNTAIN RANGE. OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE 
ON TRACK AND WILL NOT CHANGE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

QUASI-STATIONARY SURFACE BOUNDARY LURKS JUST TO OUR NORTH PER MODEL

POTENTIALLY MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM STILL ON TRACK TO AFFECT THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE WORK WEEK. STILL TOO MUCH TIMING 
DISCREPANCIES TO PINPOINT ANY FURTHER AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE VERY MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE LOWERS THROUGH THE PERIOD.  HOWEVER...IT 
DOES LOOK LIKE WE WILL BE IN AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE 
EXTENDED WITH A SERIES OF FRONTS AND/OR SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH

IN QUESTION...WILL CONTINUE WITH CURRENT FORECAST OF 20 TO 30 POPS 
MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK

FAVOR MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART.

236 
FXUS64 KMRX 190804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU MAY 19 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...OHIO VALLEY UPPER LOW WILL 
SHIFT SLOWLY EAST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH THE PERIOD. STILL 
ANOTHER COUPLE LOBES OF VORTICITY TO ROTATE SOUTHEAST AROUND THE 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WITH POSSIBLE IMPACT OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE FIRST APPEARS TO BE DROPPING SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN KENTUCKY EARLY THIS MORNING AND WILL MAKE ITS 
WAY SOUTH AND EAST OF THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST BY 12-13Z. 
HOWEVER MODELS SHOW ANOTHER SHORT WAVE ROTATING INTO THIS AREA 
DURING THE AFTERNOON SO KEPT THE LOW/SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING FOR A 
SHOWER HERE. HIGHER PRESSURE WILL BE MOVING INTO THE REGION BY 
FRIDAY WHICH SHOULD BRING AN END TO THE CHANCE FOR RAIN AS WELL AS 
ALLOW FOR A RETURN TO TEMPERATURES MORE TYPICAL OF LATE SPRING. 
SPEAKING OF TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE HAS BEEN MUCH TOO WARM IN THIS 
ANOMALOUS REGIME AND IT LOOKS LIKE IT DESPERATELY WANTS TO RAPIDLY 
END THE EXTENDED COOL SPELL AGAIN TODAY AND FRIDAY. THEREFORE STAYED 
MUCH CLOSER TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE MET MOS GUIDANCE MAX 
TEMPS.   

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND 
SLOWLY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN WILL BE IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN CONUS 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THE NAM AND THE GFS DIFFER GREATLY ON 
SATURDAY...WITH THE NAM PRODUCING HIGH CHANCE POPS UNDER THE RIDGE 
AXIS WITH SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT. THE GFS IS DRY AND IS 
PREFERRED...BUT WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING SATURDAY TO 
MESH BETTER WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. WITH THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTING 
TO OUR EAST ON SUNDAY...A SW FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS. BUT A EAST-WEST 
SURFACE RIDGE AXIS NEAR THE GULF COAST LIMITS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ADVECTION. POPS LOOK TO BE SLIGHT CHANCES AT BEST...AND MAINLY 
DIURNAL. THE SURFACE RIDGE TO THE SOUTH BREAKS DOWN ON MONDAY...AND 
LOW PRESSURE TRACKING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL STRENGTHEN THE 
SOUTHERLY FLOW. POPS RISE INTO THE CHANCE RANGE FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. THE TREND OF INCREASING POPS CONTINUES INTO WEDNESDAY AS A 
STRONGER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS AND MS VALLEY. TEMPERATURES 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL RISE ABOVE NORMAL IN THE SW FLOW 
REGIME...WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S EACH DAY IN MOST SPOTS...AND APPROACH 
90 IN SOUTHERN AREAS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...THEN AS THE 850-700 MB RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST

WILL BE POSSIBLE. A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW PATTERN BEHIND THE RIDGE 
CONTINUES INTO MONDAY AND TUESDAY...PROVIDING ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS AND

THEN A TRANSITION TO JUST A BROAD SW FLOW ALOFT. NO STRONG FORCING

401 
FXUS64 KMRX 170720
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT TUE MAY 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A LARGE CYCLONIC CIRCULATION WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH MOST OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. 
THIS WILL MEAN CONTINUED CLOUDY AND COOL CONDITIONS WITH THE HIGHEST 
RAIN CHANCES NORTH THROUGH THURSDAY. THERE WILL BE A FAIRLY SHARP 
POP GRADIENT ACROSS THE AREA FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AS THE MOUNTAINS 
WILL HELP BLOCK ATLANTIC MOISTURE TRANSPORT...AND THE STRONGEST LIFT 
WILL BE IN THE 850 MB CONVERGENCE ZONE ACROSS NE TN/SW VA. POPS 
TODAY WILL RANGE FROM CATEGORICAL NORTH TO SLIGHT CHANCES SOUTH. THE 
GREATEST QPF WILL COME TODAY WHEN ISENTROPIC LIFT IS STRONGEST...BUT 
PRECIP SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT DUE TO THE 
LACK OF STRONG FORCING DIRECTLY UNDER THE UPPER LOW. POPS AND CLOUD 
COVER WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE AND TEMPS BEGIN TO WARM CLOSER TO 
NORMAL ON THURSDAY AS THE CENTER OF THE CIRCULATION DRIFTS TOWARD 
THE EAST. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD. STAYED IN
LINE WITH A BLEND OF THE SLIGHTLY MORE PROGRESSIVE GFS AND SLOWER
ECMWF WHICH BOTH INDICATE EVENTUAL DEPARTURE OF EASTERN STATES
UPPER LOW WITH AMPLIFIED RIDGE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. WENT AHEAD AND
PULLED SLIGHT CHANCE POP ON FRIDAY WITH SUBSIDENCE INCREASING IN
ASSOCIATION WITH THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES THROUGH GULF OF MEXICO
RIDGE. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON SATURDAY WITH
WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPING. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A GRADUAL
INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY SUNDAY AND MONDAY SO USED A
LOW CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION EACH DAYTIME PERIOD WITH A SLIGHT
CHANCE AT NIGHT. ADJUSTED TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO TOWARD THE NEW MEX
MOS WHICH KEEPS THE WARMING TREND IN PLACE WITH A RETURN TO MORE
INSOLATION AND LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW.


&&

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL 
SETTLE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THEN 
LIFT SLOWLY NORTH INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY. THIS 
WILL KEEP A MOSTLY CLOUDY AND COOL PERIOD WITH AT LEAST CHANCE POPS 
EARLY IN THE EXTENDED. POPS WILL FALL OFF TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY LATE 
THURSDAY...THEN HOPING FOR A BRIEF DRY AND MILDER PERIOD IF UPPER 
RIDGE DOES BUILD ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. FROM FRIDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND. 

THE UPPER RIDGING IS PROGGED TO FLATTEN OUT BY SATURDAY NIGHT OR 
SUNDAY...WITH SW TO S LOW LEVEL FLOW RETURNING. HOWEVER...MODELS ARE 
NOT IN STRONG AGREEMENT AND MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED...SO KEEPING POPS 
RATHER LOW FOR NOW FROM FRIDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. INCREASED POPS 
JUST SLIGHTLY DURING THESE PERIODS...GENERALLY TO MESH BETTER WITH 
ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. 16/12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS TRENDING A LITTLE WARMER 
THAN 16/00Z NUMBERS...BUT I STAYED CLOSER TO THE COOLER 00Z MAX 
TEMPS FOR NOW.

DURING THE DAY OR NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE 
WARMER THAN THE NAM NUMBERS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL 
GENERALLY FOLLOW A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

ROTATE WEAK DISTURBANCES INTO THE MRX CWA ON WEDNESDAY...SLOWLY

CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS. AN UPPER RIDGE BRIEFLY BUILDS IN FOR FRIDAY...PROVIDING A 
DRY PERIOD AND BEGINNING A WARMING TREND. THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE 
IN FOR THE WEEKEND.

SCATTERED SHOWERS UPSTREAM. THUS CHANCE POPS APPEARS APPROPRIATE.
TEMPS APPEAR REASONABLE BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS AND LATEST MODEL
GUIDANCE.

SHOWERS EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. THERE ARE SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES EACH DAY...SO WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL CONTINUE BRING IN BANDS OF SCATTERED SHOWERS INTO THE MRX CWA 
ON MONDAY. THE LOW WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...DECREASING THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS FROM 
SOUTH TO NORTH. BY WEDNESDAY...WILL ONLY SEE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS OVER FAR NORTHEAST LOCATIONS. AS THE LOW EXITS THE REGION... 
WEAK RIDGING EXPECTED OVER THE AREA FOR A DRYING AND WARMING TREND 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND COVERAGE OF CONVECTION.

SUNRISE. CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE IN THE
MID AFTERNOON AS AN UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. WILL
MENTION IN THE TAF AS VCTS FOR NOW.

&&

NC...NONE.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY EXTENDS

REMAINS BETWEEN BEST AVAILABLE MOISTURE. WELL ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES CONTINUE. AIRMASS BECOMES MODERATELY UNSTABLE FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON. PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. 
FRIDAYS TEMPERATURES WILL BE MODERATED BY CLOUD COVER AND CONVECTION.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL REMAIN IN AN 
UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  ON SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY AN UPPER LOW WILL BE MOVING INTO THE REGION AND CONTINUALLY 
ROTATE THROUGH A SERIES OF WEAK OF PLUSES ACROSS THE AREA.  THIS 
WILL BRING OCCASIONAL SHOWERS ACROSS THE MRX CWA FOR THE WEEKEND.  A 
SECOND UPPER LOW WILL PUSH IN ON MONDAY...CONTINUING A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS.  WILL SEE IMPROVING CONDITIONS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS THE 
UPPER LOW BEGINS TO PULL AWAY...HOWEVER...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE POSSIBLE...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR THURSDAY.

710 
FXUS64 KMRX 121451
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT THU MAY 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATE PLANNED. AFTERNOON CONVECTION CONDITIONAL ON 
BREAK DOWN OF CAP. WARM TEMPS JUST BELOW RECORDS. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AXIS OF UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE 
TO SLOWLY SHIFT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY PER 
MODEL AND SREF CONSENSUS. SUBSIDENCE INDUCED BY UPPER RIDGE SHOULD 
TEND TO SUPPRESS CONVECTION OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...BUT MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS PROJECT RATHER UNSTABLE 
ATMOSPHERE PERSISTING THROUGH THE DAY TODAY. THUS CANNOT COMPLETELY 
RULE OUT ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING... 
ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. UPPER RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST 
OF THE APPALACHIAN BY TONIGHT ALLOWING FLOW TO BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY 
AS AN UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE 
POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWA AS MOISTURE INCREASES WITH THE 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM 
MAV GUIDANCE. APPEARS TEMPS WILL AGAIN APPROACH BUT NOT QUITE REACH  
RECORD THIS AFTERNOON.


LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS STILL CONSISTENT 
WITH TIMING THE APPROACH OF THE UPPER LOW FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH HIGH 
POPS JUSTIFIED INTO AT LEAST SATURDAY NIGHT. I WAS TEMPTED TO GO 
WITH CATEGORICAL POPS (80 PERCENT OR HIGHER) FOR SATURDAY...BUT HELD 
OFF FOR NOW. OTHERWISE...NO CHOICE BUT TO KEEP SOME DEGREE OF POPS 
IN THROUGH TUESDAY...AS ANOTHER UPPER LOW DROPS INTO THE REGION BY 
MONDAY MORNING...TO REPLACE THE EXITING UPPER LOW/TROUGH ON SUNDAY. 
MOSTLY SHOWERS BY SUNDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY...AS MUCH COOLER AIR MOVES 
IN. DRY WEATHER COULD RETURN AS EARLY AS TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT 
CERTAINLY BY WEDNESDAY...AS WEAK UPPER RIDGE OR AT LEAST ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT RETURNS.

TEMP GRIDS LOOKED QUITE REASONABLE AND CLOSE TO 12/00Z GFSX MOS...
SO NOT MUCH MORE THAN A FEW TWEAKS MADE OVERALL. 


&&

448 
FXUS64 KMRX 111856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT WED MAY 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...WITH A SUMMER- 
LIKE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH HIGH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S. 
MSAS ANALYSIS INDICATES A STRONGLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT SOUNDINGS REVEAL A MID-LEVEL 
CAPPING INVERSION DUE TO AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE 
DEEP SOUTH AND TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS CAP WILL LIKELY KEEP CONVECTION 
SUPPRESSED FOR MOST OF THE AREA TONIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE 
POPS FOR THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE THIS 
MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION WILL BE WEAKER. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
SHOULD HELP TO KEEP THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY NEARLY STATIONARY OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THROUGH FRIDAY...WITH SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING NEAR IT THROUGH THE PERIOD. WILL GRADUALLY 
INCREASE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY SLOWLY APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE PERIOD...AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH MINS...WITH MAXES A LITTLE LOWER EACH 
SUCCESSIVE DAY AS CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES SLOWLY INCREASE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN AMPLIFIED PATTERN WILL 
CONTINUE INTO THE LONG TERM PERIOD AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BE 
REPLACED BY A MEAN TROF OVER THE EASTERN STATES. MODELS BASICALLY IN 
AGREEMENT UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD WHEN THE GFS WAS PREFERRED. 
INITIAL CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW SHIFTS EAST FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY TO THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND WEAKENS BUT 
A TRAILING UPPER LOW WILL BE DROPPING STEADILY SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS ON SUNDAY WITH ARRIVAL IN THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. BY 
12Z MONDAY. THE LOW WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TO THE SOUTHEASTERN 
ATLANTIC COAST BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. IN THIS PATTERN...THERE WILL BE 
A CHANCE OF RAIN EVERY PERIOD OF THE FORECAST UNTIL WEDNESDAY WHEN 
HEIGHTS FINALLY BEGIN BUILDING AGAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. 
COLD AIR ALOFT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AND A NICE 
SUPPLY OF MILD AND MOIST AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS WILL ALLOW FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION OVER THE WEEKEND. BY MONDAY...A SUFFICIENT 
INFLUX OF COOL CANADIAN AIR WILL LIMIT INSTABILITY AND STAYED WITH 
SHOWERS FOR PRECIP MONDAY AND TUESDAY. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE THE RULE THROUGH THE LONG TERM AND ADJUSTED TEMPS A LITTLE 
BELOW MEX MOS ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE PERIOD WHERE CLIMATOLOGY TUGS 
THE NUMBERS A LITTLE TOO HIGH IN THIS AMPLIFIED PATTERN.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     64  89  64  85  62 /  20  30  40  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN             64  89  64  85  62 /  20  30  40  50  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    57  86  57  82  56 /  30  30  40  50  50

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS CONTINUES TO SHOW A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST 
ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN...WITH A SUMMER-LIKE AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S. MODELS INDICATE THAT A 
MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY STRONGLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP 
AROUND THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...SO THINK SOME SEVERE CONVECTION WILL 
DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO 
REVEAL A MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...DUE TO AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH AND TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS CAP SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS ANY 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE AND ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE 
SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. EXPECT THE BEST COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION TO BE AROUND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO MAKE A FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO THE PRECIP WORDING...AND 
TO ADD A MENTION OF POSSIBLE SEVERE TSTORMS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN.

DEVELOPMENT. THUS ANTICIPATE VFR CONDITIONS TO GENERALLY PREVAIL
AT EACH TAF SITE. INCLUDED PERIODS OF MVFR AND IFR CONDITIONS
OVERNIGHT AT TRI DUE TO POTENTIAL FOG FORMATION.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT TUE MAY 10 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AIRMASS AROUND NEARBY DOPPLER
RADARS REMAINS QUITE STABLE THIS MORNING...SO HARD TO ACCEPT ANY
SHORT RANGE MODEL THAT DEVELOPS CONVECTION FOR OUR NE AREAS BY
DAYBREAK. THIS LENDS VALIDITY TO GFS MODEL...WITH AT LEAST
SCATTERED TSRA DEVELOPING OVER SW VA/NE TN TO ISOLATED TSRA OVER SE
TN/SW NC...BY EARLY THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS. BLENDED
MOS POPS LOOKED GOOD FOR ALL BUT FAR NE AREAS...WHERE I PUSHED POPS
UP TO LOW END OF LIKELY FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS MESHES
BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS OFFICES GRIDS TO OUR EAST. 

A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS WITH A WEAKENING CAP AS HIGHS TOP THE
80S AT MOST LOCATIONS. SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE STORMS OVER CENTRAL TN
VALLEY AND SMOKY MTNS NE INTO SW VA...WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE
HAIL THE MAIN THREATS. 

OTHERWISE...PATCHY AREAS OF FOG SEEM TO BE DEVELOPING AGAIN AT CHA
AND TYS...BUT THIS MAY BE LOCALIZED AND COULD BE COVERED IN SHORT
TERM FORECAST. MOS HIGHS HAVE BEEN RUNNING A FEW DEGREES TOO WARM
SO TRENDED CLOSER TO THE COOLER NWM MOS FOR HIGHS. HOWEVER...NAM
MOS MINS TONIGHT PROBABLY TOO WARM FOR TONIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GENERALLY UNSETTLED 
WEATHER IN THE OFFING THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD PER MODEL AND 
ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. UPPER FLOW WILL GRADUALLY TRANSITION FROM A 
NORTHWEST FLOW AROUND UPPER RIDGE TO SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AS UPPER 
TROUGH APPROACHES FROM WEST BY THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. WEAK 
DISTURBANCES AROUND UPPER RIDGE KEEPS THINGS UNSETTLED EARLY WHILE 
UPPER TROUGH WILL TRANSPORT ADDITIONAL MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE SECOND HALF OF THE LONG TERM. MODELS 
DIFFER QUITE A BIT WITH RESPECT TO TRACK OF UPPER LOW THAT DRIFTS 
THROUGH THE REGION BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. NEVERTHELESS...HAVE CONTINUED 
GENERALLY CHANCE POPS THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EDT MON MAY 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WILL BE MONITORING
NORTHWEST FLOW OVERNIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY. MODELS DIFFER SLIGHTLY
IN RELATION TO AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY AND CAPE VALUES AS PER
FORECAST SOUNDINGS THROUGH 00Z WED. AM LEANING TOWARD NAM SOLUTION
IN RELATION TO CAPE AND LI VALUES ALONG WITH LOWER WET BULB ZERO
VALUES ACROSS THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND INTO EVENING. WILL
BE UPPING POPS FOR TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY FOR ALL AREAS NORTH OF A SEQUATCHIE-
MCMINN COUNTY LINE. THIS WILL ACCOUNT FOR POTENTIAL TSRA
DEVELOPMENT ALONG NEARLY STATIONARY BOUNDARY DRAPED NORTHWEST-
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR TONIGHT...WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NORTH AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE COUNTIES...TRI CITIES AREA AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. WITH AMPLE MOISTURE AS EVIDENCED BY PWAT VALUES
INCREASING TUESDAY AFTERNOON...INSTABILITY...WITH LI VALUES -7 TO
-10 PROGGED ACROSS THE AREA...AND BOUNDARY IN PLACE...BELIEVE THAT
HIGH CHANCE POPS SHOULD BE THE ORDER AT THIS TIME. SLIGHT
PROBABILITY OF SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS THE AREA AS PER LATEST OUTLOOK
SHOULD SUFFICE FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
OVERALL AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL PATTERN...WITH UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD...BEING REPLACED BY TROUGHING BY THE 
WEEKEND.  HOWEVER...SOME DISAGREEMENT IN THE DETAILS...AND AS USUAL 
MODEL HANDLING OF SMALLER SHORT WAVE FEATURES LATER DURING THE 
LONGER RANGE TIME FRAME IS SUSPECT.  EARLY ON PATTERN OF UPPER RIDGE 
OVER THE AREA...BUT MODELS DEPICT SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY COMING OVER 
THE RIDGE WITH CONVECTION MAINLY NORTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA.  WILL 
KEEP HIGHEST POPS NORTH FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.  WITH 
UPPER TROUGH REPLACING RIDGE...WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES 
FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS...MAINLY 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER...TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

FXUS64 KMRX 090813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
413 AM EDT MON MAY 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SEEING A FEW PATCHES OF FOG 
DEVELOPING THIS MORNING...BUT NOT VERY SIGNIFICANT JUST YET. TEMPS A 
BIT WARMER ALOFT TODAY...AND WILL CONTINUE TO WARM AS UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION INTO MID WEEK. AIRMASS WILL BECOME UNSTABLE 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY PROGGED TO 
STRETCH FROM WRN KY SE TO SW NC. IN SPITE OF VERY LOW MOS POPS FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...I WILL KEEP OUR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MAINLY 
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. A WEAK IMPULSE WORKING AROUND OR THROUGH THE 
UPPER RIDGE MAY SPREAD MORE THAN ISOLATED CONVECTION IN BY TUESDAY 
MORNING...SOMETHING TO MONITOR FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...MAX TEMPS LOOK TO RISE A FEW DEGREES AGAIN TODAY...BUT I 
AM NOT CONVINCED THAT UPPER 80S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES WILL HAPPEN FOR 
MORE THAN A SPOT OR TWO ACROSS SE TN. MILDER MINS OR A BLEND FAVORED 
FOR TONIGHT'S MINS WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY
EXPECTED TO BE ACROSS NE SECTIONS WITH UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
CENTERED OVER THE EASTERN GULF COAST. WARM TEMPERATURES WILL MAKE
ATMOSPHERE UNSTABLE. AS A RESULT WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE WITH LARGE
HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. SHORT RANGE MODELS STRENGTHEN RIDGE WEDNESDAY
SO SLIGHTLY LESS CHANCE OF CONVECTION. NOT MUCH CHANGE THURSDAY
BUT BY THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY UPPER LEVEL LOW/TROUGH OVER CENTRAL
PLAINS INCREASES MOISTURE ACROSS TN VALLEY WITH BETTER CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS. KEPT HIGHS SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY. FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH CLOUDS AND BETTER RAIN
CHANCES HIGHS SHOULD BE MOSTLY 70S ABOUT TEN DEGREES COOLER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  64  89  65  90 /  10  10  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT SUN MAY 8 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SHIFT 
SOUTH THIS EVENING AND BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS MONDAY. UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS 
TONIGHT AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE TN VALLEY ON MONDAY. WIDELY 
SCATTERED CONVECTION NEAR FRONTAL BOUNDARY THIS EVENING. LATE NIGHT 
FOG MAINLY ALONG WATERWAYS. LOW TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL N OF FRONT 
AND ABOVE NORMAL ACROSS SOUTHERN MRX CWA. ISOLATED CONVECTION AGAIN 
POSSIBLE MONDAY MAINLY ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES WARM 
TO ABOVE NORMAL WITH ABUNDANT SUNSHINE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS ARE IN SIMILAR 
AGREEMENT IN BUILDING MID-UPPER RIDGE NORTHEAST INTO THE MID-SOUTH 
REGION THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN MUCH WARMER TEMPS 
ACROSS THE AREA...WITH SOME AREAS CLOSING IN OR AT 90 DEGREES BY 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY IN SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 

RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN BY LATE WEDNESDAY/EARLY
THURSDAY...AS A SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BETWEEN 12Z THURSDAY-00Z
FRIDAY TIME FRAME. HAVE UPPED POPS SLIGHTLY FOR FRIDAY...WITH
EXPECTED SCATTERED SHRA/TSRA MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
BETWEEN 12-18Z ON FRIDAY. 

PROGRESSIVE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT SHOULD SEND ANOTHER SHORTWAVE INTO
THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY 06Z SATURDAY...AND INTO
EAST TENNESSEE-SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BY 12Z SATURDAY. ECMWF IS MORE
PRONOUNCED IN PUSHING UPPER LOW SOUTHEAST INTO MISSOURI BY 12Z
SATURDAY...ALSO. BOTH MODELS ARE ALSO SIMILAR IN DRAPING FRONTAL
BOUNDARY SOUTHWEST-NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN
SATURDAY TO EARLY SUNDAY...WITH THE BOUNDARY PROGGED TO SHIFT
SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY. 

PASSAGE OF THE FRONT AND CHANCES FOR SCATTERED SHRA/TSRA FROM
FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY SHOULD RESULT IN MUCH COOLER TEMPS EVEN SLIGHTLY BELOW
CLIMO FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

1130 AM EDT SUN MAY 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. LOW CHANCE OF

NORTHWARD THIS MORNING...ALONG THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AIDED BY

REGION. MODELS EASE THE WEAK BOUNDARY SOUTHWARD TODAY WITH SLIGHT 
INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS LOOKED 
REASONABLE...WITH A FEW TWEAKS.

TRENDED TOWARD COOLER GFS MOS HIGHS OR A BLEND FOR TODAY. GFS MINS 
LOOKED TOO COOL FOR TONIGHT GIVEN WEAKNESS OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY. 
PATCHY AREAS OF FOG CERTAINLY POSSIBLE...IF SKIES AT LEAST PARTIALLY 
CLEAR OVERNIGHT.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK BOUNDARY FROM TODAY 
EXPECTED TO WEAKEN MONDAY AS RIDGING ALOFT BUILDS OVER FORECAST 
AREA. STILL EXPECT VERY WARM TEMPERATURES WITH ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS HIGHER ELEVATIONS. LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. WEAK UPPER LEVEL ENERGY ROTATING AROUND RIDGE AND 
INSTABILITY FROM HEATING WILL ALLOW SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP EACH DAY LOWER ELEVATIONS AND CHANCE 
MOUNTAINS AND NE PART OF FORECAST AREA. SOME THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE 
STRONG TO SEVERE BUT SEVERE THREAT ISOLATED. GFS MODEL BRINGS COLD 
FRONT CLOSE TO REGION THURSDAY AND MOVES THIS SYSTEM SLOWLY EAST 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ECMWF KEEPS RIDGE OVER AREA ONE MORE DAY BEFORE 
WEAKENING. WILL LEAVE FORECAST ALONE WITH CHANCE POPS THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY CLOSER TO GFS SOLUTION.  &&

WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION AND WEAKEN ON THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.
WILL KEEP IN LOW CHANCE POPS FOR NOW WITH THIS SYSTEM. ECMWF/GFS

CHANCE POPS FOR THE LAST PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. TEMPS LOOK

CEILING FOR BOTH TRI AND TYS. INSTABILITY WOULD APPEAR TO BE LACKING
SO FOR NOW WON'T INCLUDE TSRA OR VCTS.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE TO SHIFT EAST

THUNDER AFTER 06Z SUNDAY.  

OTHERWISE...MOS HIGHS LOOK QUITE REASONABLE FOR TODAY...THEN A BLEND 
OF COOLER GFS MOS WITH NAM MOS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SYSTEM IN NW FLOW WILL
CONTINUE ACROSS EXTREME NE AND EASTERN SECTIONS SUNDAY MORNING BUT
RIDGING ALOFT WILL KEEP SHOWERS LIMITED. INSTABILITY INCREASES WITH
HEATING SO ALL AREAS HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER SUNDAY AFTERNOON.
NO POPS SUNDAY NIGHT AS CONVECTION DIES DOWN DUE TO LOSS OF
HEATING. TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER SUNDAY. RIDGING EVEN
STRONGER MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES ABOUT 5
DEGREES WARMER IN THE 80S. SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY AS
SHORT WAVES MOVE SOUTHEAST AROUND RIDGE. BEST CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION WILL BE IN THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS AND EASTERN
MOUNTAINS. THURSDAY GFS SHOWS COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION
WITH UPPER TROUGH TO MOVE IN FRIDAY. ECMWF A DAY SLOWER WITH
SYSTEM. FOLLOWING FASTER GFS WITH HIGHER POPS THURSDAY AND COOLER
TEMPERATURES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...WEAK SURFACE TROUGH MOVING INTO

FEATURE WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND A CHANCE FOR 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS LATE IN THE DAY...MAINLY AFFECTING NW AREAS. 
TEMPERATURES REBOUND TO NEAR NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION PROJECTED TO REMAIN IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE BULK 
OF THE LONG TERM AS UPPER RIDGE AMPLIFIES OVER THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
VALLEY REGION. STILL SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS AMONG MODELS AS 
OUR REGION REMAINS ON THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF UPPER RIDGE. A SERIES 
OF SHORTWAVES PROJECTED TO TRANSLATE ALONG THIS PERIPHERY...BUT 
EXACT TRACK OF THESE FEATURES STILL UNCERTAIN. THUS...AGAIN HAVE NOT 
MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. A POTENTIALLY 
MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM MAY AFFECT THE AREA LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS 
AN UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST BUT 
TIMING DIFFERENCES AMONG MODELS AND WIDE SPREAD AMONG GEFS ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS MAKE THIS EVENT UNCERTAIN AS WELL. DUE TO HEIGHT RISES 
ASSOCIATED WITH AMPLIFYING UPPER RIDGE...TEMPS EXPECTED TO MODIFY TO 
WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EDT THU MAY 5 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SHIFT 
SE THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL STRENGTHEN 
TONIGHT AS IT MOVES EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT. UPPER LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE IN ADVANCE OF THE SHORT WAVE. LOW LEVEL 
THICKNESS WILL RISE AS SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST SO MIN TEMPS 
TONIGHT WILL BE WARMER THAN THIS MORNING. PRECIPITATION WILL ARRIVE 
EARLY FRIDAY WITH BULK OF ACTIVITY IN THE MORNING HOURS. ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE BUT TOO LOW FOR ZFP MENTION. UPPER TROUGH 
AXIS AND SURFACE REFLECTION WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS FRIDAY AFTERNOON WITH LINGERING SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS 
NE AREAS. CLOUDS AND PCPN WILL HOLD TEMPS TO BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SERIES OF WEAK 
SHORTWAVES PROJECTED TO AFFECT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM. TIMING AND TRACK OF THESE FEATURES STILL 
MURKY HOWEVER AS MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO SHOW SUBTLE 
DIFFERENCES. FIRST SHORTWAVE PASSES THROUGH THE REGION IN THE LATE 
SATURDAY THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY TIME FRAME. GREATEST EFFECT EXPECTED 
IN THE NORTHERN TIER OF THE CWA. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT UPPER 
RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD INTO THE REGION BY EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK. 
THE MODELS CONTINUE TO DIFFER ON PLACEMENT OF NEARLY STATIONARY 
BOUNDARY AND WEAK SHORTWAVE FEATURES TRAVERSING THE PERIPHERY OF 
UPPER RIDGE HOWEVER. GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT 
BOUNDARY BEING PUSHED GENERALLY EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WHILE THE 
EUROPEAN MODEL KEEPS BOUNDARY LURKING IN OUR GENERAL VICINITY. DUE 
TO UNCERTAINTY AND CONSENSUS OF MODELS...HAVE GENERALLY NOT MADE ANY 
MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. TEMPS EXPECTED TO CLIMB 
TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
IN. STAYED CLOSE TO MAV/MEX GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 AM EDT THU MAY 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER IN 
FOR SEASONALLY COLD READING THIS MORNING.  A FROST ADVISORY AND 
FREEZE WARNING WILL REMAIN IN AFFECT THROUGH 13Z.  OTHERWISE... 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE TODAY 
WITH WINDS SLOWLY SHIFTING SOUTHERLY ENDING COLD ADVECTION AND 
ALLOWING HIGHS TO REACH INTO THE 60S AND LOW 70S THIS AFTERNOON. THE 
SURFACE HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT WITH A WEAK SHORT 
WAVE APPROACHING THE AREA LATE.  COULD SEE CLOUDS BEGIN TO MOVE IN 
OVERNIGHT WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE A FEW SHOWERS MAY REACH INTO THE 
PLATEAU TOWARDS MORNING.  IT WILL BE ANOTHER COOL NIGHT TONIGHT WITH 
LOWS FALLING INTO THE 40S ACROSS MOST LOCATIONS. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN FOR THE LONG TERM...BUT 
STILL SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS.  SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
FORECAST TO SWING THOUGH ON FRIDAY...BRINGING SOME SHOWERS AND 
PERHAPS THUNDER...WITH HIGHEST POPS NORTH.  SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY...THEN ANOTHER SHORT WAVE WILL AFFECT 
MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS AGAIN.  WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY FORECAST TO SAG 
INTO THE REGION SAT NIGHT/SUNDAY...BUT HOW FAR SOUTH IT WILL MAKE IT 
IS STILL PROBLEMATIC.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS SAT 
NIGHT/SUNDAY...WITH HIGHEST POPS NORTH.  FORECAST UNCERTAINTY HIGH 
FOR LATTER PERIODS...AS MODELS HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES IN HOW STRONGLY 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN AND ALSO STRENGTH/TIMING OF ANY SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY COMING OVER THE RIDGE.  GIVEN UNCERTAINTY WILL NOT CHANGE 
MUCH FOR MON THROUGH WED...AS PREVIOUS FORECAST IS STILL IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH GFS DEPICTION.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT WED MAY 4 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE MID WEST...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER TO MID 30S ACROSS 
THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A FEW CLOUDS 
LINGERING OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...ASSOCIATED WITH AN 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MID ATLANTIC AND NORTHEAST 
REGION. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD COMPLETELY DIMINISH OVERNIGHT...AS THIS 
UPPER TROUGH SWINGS EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND HIGH PRESSURE 
SETTLES OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. WITH LIGHT WINDS AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT...EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING 
CONDITIONS WILL DEVELOP WITH MINS NEARING THE RECORD LOWS FOR THE 
5TH OF MAY: CHA 38...TYS 37...OQT 34...TRI 31. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION 'NEAR RECORD 
LOWS' AND LIGHT WINDS IN THE ZONE FORECASTS FOR TONIGHT. THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE.

TO SOUTHWEST OR WEST TO HELP WITH FLIGHT OPERATIONS. HOWEVER..THE

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS SHIFTING EAST

TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL. OUTLAYING VALLEY AREAS AND TN MNTS 
WILL SEE TEMPS APPROACH FREEZING BY DAYBREAK. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES REMAIN IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE BULK OF THE LONG 
TERM. HOWEVER...THERE ARE SOME DIFFERENCES ON THE TIMING AND TRACK 
OF A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES THAT TRANSLATE THROUGH OUR GENERAL 
AREA AND THUS RESULT IN SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH INDIVIDUAL EVENTS. 
HAVE GENERALLY NOT MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/ 
FORECAST DUE TO THIS UNCERTAINTY. ALSO TENDED TO SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT 
MEX GUIDANCE FOR MAX TEMPS IN THE SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIME 
FRAME BASED ON TRENDS IN THE GEFS ENSEMBLE DATA.

FXUS64 KMRX 040630
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 AM EDT WED MAY 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BAND OF LIGHT SHOWERS CONTINUES TO 
PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION. WITH THE CLEARING BEHIND THE EXITING COLD 
FRONT AND LIGHT WINDS...PATCHY FOG IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TOWARDS 
SUNRISE.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TODAY FOR MAINLY 
SUNNY...DRY WEATHER.  HOWEVER...AN UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH WILL 
ROTATE IN A FEW BANDS OF CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A STRAY LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWER OVER NORTHERN COUNTIES.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL 
OVER THE ENTIRE AREA TONIGHT FOR DRY CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT.  MUCH 
COOLER AIR IS MOVING IN TODAY AND AS A RESULT...AFTERNOON HIGHS WILL 
ONLY REACH INTO THE 60S ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN VALLEY.  THIS COOL AIR 
MASS REMAINS IN PLACE OVERNIGHT FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 30S AND 
LOW 40S.  A FEW LOCATIONS ACROSS OUR NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS COULD SEE 
TEMPERATURES DROP BELOW FREEZING AND A FREEZING WATCH REMAINS IN 
AFFECT FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT
AGREEMENT EARLY ON...BUT SOME DIVERGENCE IN SOLUTIONS BY THE
WEEKEND WITH THE CMC THE DRIEST AND ECMWF WETTEST. GFS SOLUTION
LOOKS LIKE A REASONABLE COMPROMISE...SO WILL LEAN TOWARD ITS
DEPICTION. THURSDAY SHOULD BE A DRY DAY...THEN SHORT WAVE ENERGY
DROPPING IN FROM THE NORTHWEST WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS
ESPECIALLY NORTH FRIDAY. WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY PROGGED TO BE IN THE
VICINITY OF OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT HOW FAR
SOUTH STILL NOT CLEAR. GFS HAS PRECIP MAINLY NORTH...SO PLAN TO
HAVE CHANCE POPS NORTH AND NO HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH.
UPPER RIDGE FORECAST TO BUILD IN MONDAY/TUESDAY TIME FRAME...WITH
WARMER TEMPS AND MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS. GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY
LOOK TO BE IN THE BALLPARK...SO NO MAJOR CHANGES.

389 
FXUS64 KMRX 031902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE MAY 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LARGE AREA OF RAIN SHOWERS 
MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND COLD FRONT. 
SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT BUT NO THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS 
FORECAST AREA SO FAR. PRESSURE RISES BEHIND FRONT BRINGING GUSTY 
WEST WINDS WITH FRONT AHEAD OF SHOWERS AS THE FRONT MOVES EAST. 
LARGE TEMPERATURE DROPS HAVE OCCURRED WITH THE FRONT SOME 20 DEGREES 
IN MOST PLACES. TEMPERATURES AT MID AFTERNOON IN THE COLD AIR MASS 
AND SHOWERS MID 40S CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TO 80 DEGREES AT TRI AND 
ANDREWS IN SW NORTH CAROLINA. MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS WILL MOVE THROUGH 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH SHOWERS CONTINUING NE FOR MOST 
OF THE NIGHT. WEDNESDAY MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES ESPECIALLY NE WHERE 
WRAP AROUND CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER TROUGH MOVING FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY TOWARDS THE MID ATLANTIC WILL LIKELY CONTINUE ALL DAY NE 
OF KNOXVILLE TENNESSEE. HIGHS SHOULD RANGE FROM LOWER 50S HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS SW VA TO THE MID TO UPPER 60S NEAR CHA AND SW NORTH 
CAROLINA.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH SHOWING A 
NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE EASTERN PART OF THE NATION 
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...THEY REVEAL SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE PROGRESSION OF SEVERAL UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES 
WITHIN THIS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. IN ADDITION...BOTH THE GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS ARE INCONSISTENT WITH THEIR PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS WITH 
THE TIMING OF THESE SHORT WAVES. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND 
TOWARDS THE MORE CONSISTENT ECMWF MODEL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
AND WILL TRY TO MAINTAIN SOME CONTINUITY WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. 
UNSEASONABLY COLD TEMPS WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...WITH AREAS OF FROST EXPECTED AS HIGH PRESSURE CREATES LIGHT 
WIND AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. ALSO...WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH FOR 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TN WHERE TEMPS WILL BE AROUND THE FREEZING MARK 
AROUND SUNRISE. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE REASONABLY CLOSE TO 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 031902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE MAY 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LARGE AREA OF RAIN SHOWERS 
MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND COLD FRONT. 
SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT BUT NO THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS 
FORECAST AREA SO FAR. PRESSURE RISES BEHIND FRONT BRINGING GUSTY 
WEST WINDS WITH FRONT AHEAD OF SHOWERS AS THE FRONT MOVES EAST. 
LARGE TEMPERATURE DROPS HAVE OCCURRED WITH THE FRONT SOME 20 DEGREES 
IN MOST PLACES. TEMPERATURES AT MID AFTERNOON IN THE COLD AIR MASS 
AND SHOWERS MID 40S CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TO 80 DEGREES AT TRI AND 
ANDREWS IN SW NORTH CAROLINA. MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS WILL MOVE THROUGH 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH SHOWERS CONTINUING NE FOR MOST 
OF THE NIGHT. WEDNESDAY MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES ESPECIALLY NE WHERE 
WRAP AROUND CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER TROUGH MOVING FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY TOWARDS THE MID ATLANTIC WILL LIKELY CONTINUE ALL DAY NE 
OF KNOXVILLE TENNESSEE. HIGHS SHOULD RANGE FROM LOWER 50S HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS SW VA TO THE MID TO UPPER 60S NEAR CHA AND SW NORTH 
CAROLINA.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH SHOWING A 
NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE EASTERN PART OF THE NATION 
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...THEY REVEAL SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE PROGRESSION OF SEVERAL UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES 
WITHIN THIS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. IN ADDITION...BOTH THE GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS ARE INCONSISTENT WITH THEIR PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS WITH 
THE TIMING OF THESE SHORT WAVES. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND 
TOWARDS THE MORE CONSISTENT ECMWF MODEL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
AND WILL TRY TO MAINTAIN SOME CONTINUITY WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. 
UNSEASONABLY COLD TEMPS WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...WITH AREAS OF FROST EXPECTED AS HIGH PRESSURE CREATES LIGHT 
WIND AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. ALSO...WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH FOR 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TN WHERE TEMPS WILL BE AROUND THE FREEZING MARK 
AROUND SUNRISE. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE REASONABLY CLOSE TO 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

1052 AM EDT TUE MAY 3 2011

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT ABOUT TO MOVE FROM THE PLATEAU COUNTIES TO
THE VALLEY AREAS WITH NUMEROUS SHOWERS MOVING INTO THE FORECAST
AREA. AIR MASS IS BECOMING SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE ACROSS EASTERN
SECTIONS WHERE SUNSHINE IS STILL OCCURRING. THUNDERSTORMS MAY
DEVELOP ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS BEFORE THE COOLER STABLE AIR BEHIND
THE FRONT MOVES IN. A FEW STORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE ACROSS EASTERN
SECTIONS WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL POSSIBLE BEFORE LATE
AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL BE STRONG FROM THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF THE FRONT SO
INCREASED WINDS FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS. GUSTS TO 35 TO POSSIBLY 4O
MILES PER HOUR WILL BE POSSIBLE. RAINFALL AMOUNTS UP TO ONE HALF
INCH PER HOUR POSSIBLE WITH STRONGER SHOWERS OR THUNDERSTORMS. MOST
AREAS WILL LIKELY HAVE A HALF INCH OR LESS WITH ISOLATED LOCATIONS
AROUND AN INCH BEFORE RAIN ENDS THIS EVENING. RAISED HIGH
TEMPERATURES MOST LOCATIONS WITH HIGHS OCCURRING BEFORE 18Z ALMOST
ALL LOCATIONS. TEMPERATURES ARE ALREADY DROPPING ON THE PLATEAU AND
WILL LOWER TO THE 50S AT MOST SPOTS BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON.

604 
FXUS64 KMRX 030140
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT MON MAY 2 2011

.DISCUSSION...MOST OF THE RADAR ACTIVITY TO THE WEST SHOULD CONTINUE 
TO BE WEST TONIGHT WITH BEST RAIN CHANCES HOLDING OFF UNTIL 
TUESDAY. WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODELS IN REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH AMPLIFICATION OF UPPER TROUGH OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST 
WHICH WILL NUDGE SURFACE BOUNDARY AND ACCOMPANYING PRECIP EASTWARD 
TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. APPEARS 
GREATEST IMPACT FROM THIS SYSTEM FOR OUR FORECAST AREA WILL BE 
DURING THE SECOND HALF OF TOMORROW...ALTHOUGH HAVE CONTINUED TO 
SLOWLY INCREASE POPS FROM WEST TO EAST OVERNIGHT AND TOMORROW 
MORNING. INSTABILITY NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE PER MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS...BUT PROBABLY CANNOT TOTALLY RULE OUT AT LEAST A FEW 
ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS...DEPENDING ON TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE. FOR 
TEMPS...GUIDANCE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOKS REASONABLE. 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.

LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH SHOWING A 
NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW PERSISTING THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE 
PERIOD OVER THE EASTERN PART OF THE NATION. HOWEVER...THEY REVEAL 
SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE PROGRESSION OF SEVERAL FAST-MOVING 
CLIPPER SYSTEMS IN THIS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. WILL GENERALLY TREND 
TOWARDS THE ECMWF'S TIMING...SINCE IT HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT THAN 
THE GFS MODEL. SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...AS AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE REGION. WITH UNSEASONABLY COLD 
TEMPS WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY...AS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL THEN 
QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... 
WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT TRIGGERING SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION OVER THE WEEKEND...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD 
FRONT TRIGGERING ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. AS FRO TEMPS..WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   63  65  40  68  40 /  50 100  60  10   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     63  67  39  63  40 /  40  90  80  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             62  63  39  63  40 /  50 100  70  20   0

550 
FXUS64 KMRX 020838
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EDT MON MAY 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED ACROSS 
THE FAR WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY EARLY THIS MORNING. AN UPPER TROUGH 
WILL STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES LATE TODAY AND TUESDAY 
HELPING TO PULL THE FRONT SLOWLY TOWARD THE PLATEAU THIS EVENING. 
AIRMASS WILL BECOME MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 500-1000 J/KG 
AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY. SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP ALONG 
AND JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND 
POSSIBLE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A FEW STORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE WITH THE 
GREATEST CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL UP TO QUARTER 
SIZE. 

THE BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT CONTINUE THE CHANCES OF CONVECTION WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES WEST AND SLIGHT POPS EAST.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...GENERALLLY TOOK A BLEND OF THE 
GFS/ECMWF FOR THE LONG TERM WHICH FEATURES A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
PATTERN EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH SLOW MOVING UPPER TROF INITIALLY 
EXTENDING FROM THE GREAT LAKES SOUTHWEST THROUGH THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
EARLY ON TUESDAY. AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL BE PROGRESSING 
STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AND CONVECTION 
SHOULD ACCOMPANY THE FRONT. MUCH OF THE CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN 
SUB-SEVERE BUT THERE IS A CHANCE THAT SOME OF THE STORMS THAT 
DEVELOP ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MAY BECOME 
SEVERE DUE TO BETTER SHEAR IN PROXIMITY TO A SURFACE LOW THAT WILL 
BE SHIFTING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS DURING THE 
DAY. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE 
FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT AND THE UPPER TROF WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT THE 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATES 
SOUTHEAST AROUND A DEVELOPING CLOSED LOW. THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH 
MOISTURE AND LIFT FOR A CHANCE OF SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY. NORTHERLY WINDS...CLOUDS AND 
POSSIBLE SHOWERS WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH ANOTHER COLD NIGHT IN STORE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHICH 
WILL END UP WITH MIN TEMPS ABOUT 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. A 
SLOW WARMING WILL BEGIN ON THURSDAY AS SUNSHINE RETURNS WITH SHORT 
WAVE RIDGING BUILDING EAST ACROSS THE AREA. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROF 
WITH SURFACE REFLECTION WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FROM 
EARLY FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY EVENING AND KEPT SLIGHT 
AND SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS FEATURE. 
ANOTHER BRIEF DRY PERIOD REMAINS IN THE FORECAST FROM LATE FRIDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY. HOWEVER...GFS/ECMWF/CANADIAN MODELS 
INDICATE YET ANOTHER SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM 
BUILDING RAPIDLY SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS DURING THE SUNDAY TIMEFRAME AND SO USED A LOW CHANCE 
POP FOR SUNDAY WHILE BRACKETING WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
EVENT ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN 
TIMING DURING THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             83  62  67  41  67 /  20  70  90  70  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  63  67  41  63 /  20  60  90  80  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       81  62  66  41  63 /  30  70  90  70  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              81  57  73  42  60 /  20  30  70  80  30

318 
FXUS64 KMRX 020134
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
934 PM EDT SUN MAY 1 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. RADAR INDICATING A 
FEW ECHOES TRACKING IN FROM THE WEST...BUT DRY BOUNDARY LEVEL SHOULD 
SUPPRESS ANY PRECIPITATION FOR MOST OF TONIGHT SO WILL KEEP A 
DRY FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALONG IT. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
THAT THE EARLIER PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
HAS DISSIPATED OVER THE FORECAST AREA. LAST NIGHT'S CONVECTIVE 
SCENARIO MAY REPEAT ITSELF AGAIN TONIGHT...BUT WILL ONLY MENTION 
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE MORNING ON MONDAY FOR NOW. THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
ON MONDAY...WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...EXPECT SOME SCATTERED 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IN THE AFTERNOON...WITH A FEW STORMS POSSIBLY 
BECOMING SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTH CENTRAL STATES MONDAY EVENING SLOWLY MOVES EAST 
THE NEXT TWO DAYS. THE COLD FRONT OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND MID MS 
VALLEY TODAY WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EAST AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
ATLANTIC STRENGTHENS AND A SURFACE WAVE MOVES UP ALONG THE FRONT 
MONDAY NIGHT. WILL ONLY HAVE GRADUAL INCREASE IN POPS MONDAY NIGHT. 
STRONG SHORTWAVE KICKS THROUGH MS VALLEY TUESDAY MORNING AND MOVES 
FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TUESDAY. NAM MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SHOW ATMOSPHERE MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH A LINE OF STORMS 
DEVELOPING MONDAY NIGHT AND MOVING FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. A FEW SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE 
IN THE MORNING WEST AND EASTERN SECTIONS EARLY AFTERNOON. HEAVY RAIN 
A POSSIBILITY WITH TUESDAYS CONVECTION SO LOCALIZED FLOODING COULD 
OCCUR PLATEAU AREAS. SHOWERS SHOULD END FROM WEST TO EAST TUESDAY 
NIGHT EARLY WEDNESDAY. UPPER LEVEL ENERGY AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE TROUGH BRINGS A FEW SHOWERS TO NE HALF WEDNESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY. A SERIES OF WEAKER 
SYSTEMS MOVE SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES FRIDAY WITH THE FIRST 
SYSTEM GRAZING SW VA AND NE TN FRIDAY AND THE NEXT SYSTEM A LITTLE 
STRONGER DEVELOPING A WARM FRONT ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND AFFECTING MAINLY NORTHERN SECTIONS SUNDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   61  82  62  70  43 /  10  20  40  80  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     59  80  61  72  45 /  10  20  30  80  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN             61  79  61  68  44 /  10  30  40  80  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    54  78  57  77  45 /  10  20  20  70  80 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 011421
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT SUN MAY 1 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT EXTENDING 
FROM NEAR CINCINNATI TO NEAR ASHEVILLE. AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT A 
PRE-FRONTAL LINE OF CONVECTION FROM THE MS RIVER VALLEY HAS MOVED 
ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS MORNING...BUT IT APPEARS THAT IT 
HAS SLOWED ITS EASTWARD MOVEMENT. MOST OF THIS RAIN SHOULD DIMINISH 
IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS...BUT ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY MAY 
REDEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON ALONG ITS OUTFLOW BOUNDARY AS THE AIR MASS 
BECOMES MARGINALLY UNSTABLE. SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS SHOULD DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WILL GENERALLY BE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING MAINLY TO LOWER POPS 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

322 
FXUS64 KMRX 010840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EDT SUN MAY 1 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN TO OUR 
EAST WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR WEST FOR THE SHORT TERM.  WILL SEE 
VARYING AMOUNTS OF HIGH/MID CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA. NOT MUCH 
INSTABILITY FOR OUR AREA...BUT CONVECTION TO OUR WEST MAY MANAGE TO 
MAKE IT INTO AT LEAST WESTERN PARTS OF OUR AREA...SO WILL INCLUDE  A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALL BUT FAR EASTERN ZONES 
TODAY.  MAV TEMPS AGAIN LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROF WILL BE 
MAKING THE JOURNEY FARTHER NORTHEAST THROUGH CANADA ON MONDAY 
LEAVING A SOUTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN VERY LIMITED EASTWARD PROGRESS OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
JUST WEST OF THE WFO MRX FORECAST AREA SO KEPT MOST AREAS DRY ON 
MONDAY WITH A SLIGHT OR SMALL CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. LATER MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY TRAILING 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY SWINGS EAST TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INDUCING 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE ON THE NEARLY STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER 
LOUISIANA. THE UPPER TROF ADVANCES STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN 
U.S. TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WHILE THE SURFACE LOW SHIFTS NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE LOW WILL DRAG THE COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. ADJUSTED THE 
POPS GRADUALLY HIGHER FROM MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AS 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVERSPREAD THE REGION. INSTABILITY APPEARS 
TO BE RATHER WEAK DURING THIS PERIOD SO CONVECTION LOOKS LIKE IT MAY 
REMAIN NON-SEVERE AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. UPPER 
TROF DEEPENS INTO A CLOSED LOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WITH 
SLOW NORTHEAST MOVEMENT ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. THROUGH 12Z 
THURSDAY. MODELS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY AS A SHORT 
WAVE TROF ROTATES SOUTHEAST AROUND THE UPPER LEVEL CIRCULATION. WAS 
ABLE TO KEEP THE DRY PERIOD WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT 
AS AN UPPER RIDGE TRAVERSES THE REGION. WENT WITH LOW CHANCE POPS 
NORTH WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTH FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT AS MODELS 
BRING ANOTHER UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. SYSTEM EXITS BY SATURDAY ALLOWING A 
RETURN TO SOME SUNSHINE FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST A LITTLE TRICKY MAINLY ON TUESDAY AS HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF PRESSES EAST WITH UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR 
BUILDING IN BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH INSOLATION LIMITING CLOUDS 
AND RAIN. MODELS SHOW A TIGHT TEMPERATURE GRADIENT WITH MUCH WARMER 
AIR NEAR THE APPALACHIANS AND COLDER AIR OVER THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. TEMPERATURES WILL BE AT LEAST TEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON 
WEDNESDAY AND THEN WILL REBOUND CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR THE REMAINDER 
OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  59  83  62  71 /  20  10  10  50  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  78  59  82  61  72 /  20  10  10  30  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       78  58  81  60  66 /  20  10  10  50  80

880 
FXUS64 KMRX 010125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT SAT APR 30 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING A DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTING 
EAST OF THE REGION TONIGHT...ALLOWING A COLD FRONT TO APPROACH FROM 
THE WEST.  THE RESULT WILL BE A QUIET NIGHT TONIGHT WITH HIGH THEN 
MID LEVEL CLOUDS INCREASING FROM THE WEST ON SUNDAY.  THE FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO REMAIN TO OUR WEST AND NORTH THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM...BUT A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD MOVE INTO OUR 
NORTHWESTERN LOCATIONS LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
MOVE SLOWLY EAST FROM THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES MONDAY TO THE EASTERN 
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY AND DEEPEN BY TUESDAY EVENING. A COLD FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL MOVE ONLY VERY SLOWLY SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
AS A RIDGE OVER THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD BLOCKS A MORE RAPID EASTWARD 
PASSAGE OF THE TROUGH AND FRONTAL SYSTEM. NAM MODEL IS SLOWER WITH 
MOVING THE FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA AND SHOW RIDGING HOLDING 
IT BACK UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TREND OF KEEPING POPS LOW 
MONDAY AND MOST OF THE MONDAY NIGHT. HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY EVENING. RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD NOT BE MUCH UNTIL 
TUESDAY EITHER. AIR MASS WILL BECOME UNSTABLE BOTH MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. STILL LOOKS LIKE A 
SHORT WAVE LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WILL BRING A SURFACE WAVE 
ALONG THE FRONT AND FINALLY SHIFT IT EAST WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL PREVAIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. 
ANOTHER TROUGH THOUGH NOT AS DEEP WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS TO THE REGION FRIDAY BUT WILL MOVE OUT QUICKLY WITH SATURDAY 
DRY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY BUT BECOME COOLER WITH 
RAIN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. COLD AIR ALOFT WEDNESDAY WILL MAKE FOR A 
COLD NIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TROUGH STAYS OVER EASTERN STATES 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING BELOW NORMAL.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  57  83  60  82  60 /  10  10  10  20  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    54  78  56  80  60 /  10  20  10  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN            54  78  56  79  58 /  10  20  10  20  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   50  75  53  80  58 /  10  20  10  10  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT SAT APR 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND UPPER 
RIDGE WILL SHIFT EAST DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. WILL SEE AN 
INCREASE IN MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS AS NEXT FRONTAL BOUNDARY DRAWS 
CLOSER...ESPECIALLY TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.      

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL LOW/TROF WILL 
LIFT SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS ON SUNDAY ARRIVING IN 
THE GREAT LAKES BY MONDAY. IN THIS PATTERN A COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL SLIP ONLY VERY SLOWLY SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS RIDGING 
OVER THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD BLOCKS MORE RAPID EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF 
THE TROF AND SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM. THIS WILL KEEP A RATHER TIGHT 
POP GRADIENT IN PLACE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE GREATEST 
CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN FARTHER 
SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. A TRAILING SHORT WAVE 
INITIALLY OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. WILL KICK THE SLOW MOVING UPPER 
TROF EASTWARD LATER MONDAY INTO TUESDAY DRIVING A WAVE OF LOW 
PRESSURE NORTHEAST FROM SOUTHERN TEXAS TO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST 
BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. KEPT THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS THE SURFACE WAVE DRAGS THE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. TRAILING UPPER LEVEL ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE REGION BEHIND THE COLD FRONT DURING THE 
FIRST HALF OF THE DAY WEDNESDAY AND APPLIED SOME WRAP AROUND SHOWERS 
MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR THIS 
POSSIBILITY. HIGH PRESSURE ALLOWS FOR A DRY WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT BUT YET ANOTHER UPPER TROF WITH ASSOCIATED FRONTAL 
SYSTEM BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE LATE WEEK FROPA.

348 
FXUS64 KMRX 300120
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT FRI APR 29 2011

.DISCUSSION...WINDS HAVE DECREASED. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. 
NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA TONIGHT...PROVIDING CLEAR SKIES AND COOL
TEMPERATURES. LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS...AND A FEW
SHELTERED VALLEY LOCATIONS COULD TOUCH THE UPPER 30S. WITH THE
RIDGE AXIS TO THE EAST ON SATURDAY...A SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW BEGINS
TO DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL WARM TEMPS INTO THE LOWER
80S IN THE TN VALLEY...WITH MID TO UPPER 70S ELSEWHERE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
ALOFT SHIFTS EASTWARD AS UPPER TROUGH ACROSS WESTERN STATES MOVES
INTO THE CENTRAL STATES. DEEP UPPER LOW ALONG THE CANADIAN BORDER
WILL MOVE NORTHEAST AND A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE MS VALLEY
SUNDAY. SHOWERS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP IN OHIO AND WESTERN TN VALLEYS
SATURDAY NIGHT AND THEN MOVE EAST INTO WESTERN AND NORTHERN
SECTIONS SUNDAY. THE AIR MASS WILL BECOME MARGINALLY UNSTABLE FOR
THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN
WILL BE LATER SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT.
MODELS SLOW THE FRONT DOWN MONDAY AND DEVELOP LOW PRESSURE ALONG
THE FRONT AS TROUGH DEEPENS OVER GREAT LAKES AND MS VALLEY. A
CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT AND THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY.
FRONT FINALLY MOVES FAR ENOUGH EAST THAT SHOWERS END TUESDAY NIGHT.
COOL HIGH PRESSURE SETS IN WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. TROUGH DEEPENS
THURSDAY WITH ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING FRIDAY AND A CHANCE FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO COLD AIR ALOFT WITH THIS LAST SYSTEM.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EDT THU APR 28 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. LOW CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS OVERNIGHT ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A MID-UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE PASSING OVER THE AREA TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY MORNING. COOLING 500 MB TEMPS WITH THE TROUGH WILL HELP 
GENERATE SOME SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHERN COUNTIES AFTER MIDNIGHT. LIFT 
IS NOT STRONG AND MOISTURE IS QUITE LIMITED...SO WILL HAVE JUST A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP. POPS END FRIDAY MORNING WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE 
700 MB TROUGH. 850 MB TEMPS DROP SLIGHTLY BEHIND THE TROUGH AXIS. 
LEANED TOWARD THE COOLER MAV GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS TOMORROW DUE TO THE 
WEAK COLD ADVECTION AND POTENTIAL FOR BROKEN CLOUD COVER NORTH 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY. 

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES RIGHT OVER FORECAST AREA SO CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED IN THE DRY 
AIR MASS. TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO BE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN TONIGHT 
BUT SEVERAL DEGREES NORTHEAST. THERE MAY BE SOME PATCHY FROST HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND HIGHER VALLEYS NE. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BRING 
WARMING TEMPERATURES SATURDAY. SOUTH WINDS SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BRING 
LOWS UP IN THE HIGHER EXPOSED LOCATIONS PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. 
SUNDAY A DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA IN SOUTHERN CANADA WITH TRAILING 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY. EXPECT INCREASED MOISTURE 
WITH A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INCREASING SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. THE COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH 
BY MONDAY NIGHT. IT MAY SLOW DOWN AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES UP ALONG THE 
FRONT. MUCH COOLER MONDAY WITH CLOUDS AND RAIN AND THEN BEHIND THE 
FRONT COLDER STILL WITH LINGERING SHOWERS. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK 
IN FOR WEDNESDAY THURSDAY.
