FXUS64 KMRX 280832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
432 AM EDT THU APR 28 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE FRONT IS EAST OF THE CWA. WITH
SOME LINGERING MOISTURE...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE CWA, NO THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TODAY. UPPER TROUGH
TRACKING THROUGH TONIGHT. WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES LOOKED
REASONABLE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT SO DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE EXTENDED FORECAST...AND SHOWS A QUIET PERIOD 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND UNTIL ANOTHER COLD FRONT ARRIVES EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE OHIO AND TN 
RIVER VALLEYS ON FRIDAY MORNING...BRINGING MOSTLY CLOUDS AND A FEW 
SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
THEN BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BRINGING 
COOLER BUT MORE NORMAL TEMPS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS ARE STILL SHOWING SOME INCONSISTENCIES WITH THE PROGRESSION 
OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT...BUT BOTH AGREE THAT IT WILL BE SLOW-MOVING 
AND SHOULD AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA IN THE SUNDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY 
TIME FRAME. ECMWF MODEL CONTINUES TO BE MORE AMPLIFIED WITH AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT...WHICH WOULD RESULT IN 
MORE RAINFALL (COMPARED TO THE GFS). BOTH MODELS AGREE THAT 
INSTABILITY WILL BE MARGINAL WITH THIS NEXT FRONT...SO THINK ANY 
SEVERE THREAT WITH IT WOULD BE MINIMAL. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
CLOSE TO THE GFS NUMBERS WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  47  76  46  80 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  47  71  46  78 /  10  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  46  71  46  78 /  10  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              68  43  68  40  76 /  30  20  10   0   0

926 
FXUS64 KMRX 271824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
224 PM EDT WED APR 27 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER REMAINS HIGH OVER PORTIONS OF THE AREA. 
MESOANALYSIS INDICATES THE BEST INSTABILITY IS LOCATED ACROSS AL/MS. 
AS A SURFACE LOW TRANSLATES FROM AR TO IN THIS EVENING...THIS AREA 
OF INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED TO LIFT NORTHEAST AS WELL. THE POSITION 
OF THE JET EXIT REGION OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL FURTHER 
ENHANCE LIFT. THIS WILL BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF STORMS TO THE AREA 
THIS EVENING. LOW LEVEL SHEAR WILL REMAIN FAVORABLE FOR SOME TORNADO 
POTENTIAL...ALONG WITH DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. 
ESTIMATE THE TIMING OF THIS NEXT ROUND WILL BE 23Z-06Z. 

SURFACE WIND OBSERVATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS HAVE BEEN IN THE UPPER 
END OF WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. MODELS SHOW A 50-60 KT SOUTHERLY LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL BE IN PLACE THIS EVENING...SO A HIGH WIND WARNING 
WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF TN. WILL ALSO EXTEND THE WIND
ADVISORY FOR THE REST OF THE AREA TO 06Z. WINDS SHOULD DROP OFF
WITH FROPA ONCE WINDS TURN MORE WESTERLY AFTER 06Z.

A GOOD PUSH OF COLD AIR FOLLOWS THE FRONT TOMORROW. AFTER SOME 
MORNING CLOUDS...WE SHOULD SEE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES BY AFTERNOON. 
TEMPS WILL BE BELOW NORMAL...WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S. THE 
PASSAGE OF AN UPPER TROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING WILL BRING 
A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS...AND KEEP TEMPS BELOW NORMAL FOR 
FRIDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE 40S THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL EARLY IN THE EXTENDED FOR QUIET WEATHER
THIS WEEKEND. A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH AROUND THE MONDAY TIME
FRAME FOR OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION DURING THE EXTENDED. THE
FRONT SLOWS DOWN TO OUR EAST AND WILL KEEP A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS
OVER EASTERN ZONES INTO TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR
WEDNESDAY. FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
110 PM EDT WED APR 27 2011

.AVIATION...
A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WILL THREATEN CHA WITHIN THE NEXT
HOUR...PRODUCING WIND GUSTS AROUND 50 KTS...POSSIBLY HIGHER IF THE
CORE OF THE STORM HITS THE AIRPORT. THIS LINE OF STORMS IS
PROJECTED TO CONTINUE NORTHEAST AND AFFECT TYS AROUND 1930Z...THEN
TRI AROUND 21Z...AND WEAKEN A BIT WITH TIME. ANOTHER ROUND OF
STORMS IS EXPECTED THIS EVENING AHEAD OF A STRONG COLD FRONT...IN
THE 00Z-04Z TIMEFRAME. WINDS WILL REMAIN GUSTY OUTSIDE OF
THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL...MAINLY FROM THE S TO SW. THE STORM THREAT
WILL END WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT BETWEEN 06-09Z...AND
WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST. CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES SHOULD
REMAIN VFR OUTSIDE OF THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 271404 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1004 AM EDT WED APR 27 2011

.DISCUSSION...
THE THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS AND TORNADOES WILL CONTINUE INTO THE
EVENING AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST AND AN UPPER JET
NOSES INTO NRN AL AND MIDDLE TN. CURRENT STORMS HAVE SHOWN AN
OVERALL WEAKENING TREND AS THEY HAVE MOVED EASTWARD...WITH THE
EXCEPTION OF THE TORNADIC STORM MOVING UP THE VALLEY. SATELLITE
SHOWS CLEARING BEHIND THESE STORMS...WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR THE
SURFACE INSTABILITY TO REBOUND THIS AFTERNOON. SUPERCELL AND
TORNADO PARAMETERS REMAIN FAVORABLE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING...AND LIFT WILL BE ENHANCED BY DIVERGENCE IN THE EXIT
REGION OF THE UPPER JET STREAK. EXPECT THIS SECOND ROUND OF STORMS
TO AFFECT THE AREA BETWEEN 22Z AND 04Z.

OVERALL...THE FORECAST GRIDS LOOK TO BE ON TRACK...SO NO UPDATE
WILL BE NEEDED.


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...LOUDON...
     MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH 
     SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST 
     GREENE...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SCOTT TN...
     SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...

622 
FXUS64 KMRX 270831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
431 AM EDT WED APR 27 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO TRACK
THROUGH THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. WITH STRONG DYNAMICS EXPECTED
WILL KEEP LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR TODAY AND CATEGORICAL POPS
FOR TONIGHT AS THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE CWA. CONDITIONS LOOK
FAVORABLE FOR STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FOR THIS AFTERNOON
AND EVENING. COULD SEE HEAVY RAIN WITH THE STORMS...BUT WITH THE
QUICK MOVEMENT...FLOODING SHOULD BE BRIEF. GRADIENT IS EXPECTED TO
INCREASE AS FRONT APPROACHES SO WILL LEAVE WIND ADVISORY GOING AS
IS. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED HIGH WITH THE PRECIPITATION EXPECTED
SO STAYED CLOSER FOR THE MET/MAV BLEND NUMBERS FOR TODAY. WITH THE
COOLER AIRMASS BEHIND THE FRONT...STAYED BELOW GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR
TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE EXTENDED FORECAST AND GENERALLY SHOW A QUIET PERIOD UNTIL 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS ON THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY MORNING...BRINGING 
MAINLY AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND...BRINGING COOLER BUT MORE NORMAL TEMPS FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS HAVE FINALLY COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
AND NOW AGREE THAT IT WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT. ECMWF MODEL REVEALS A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT...WHICH RESULTS IN A SLOWER EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION OF THE FRONT (COMPARED TO THE GFS) WITH SHOWERS 
LINGERING INTO TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS 
NUMBERS WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.


&&

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED TO LOWER POPS ACROSS THE FAR NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS...OTHERWISE...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. INCREASING ISENTROPIC
LIFT AND WEAKENING OF CIN ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ARE COMBINING
WITH THE MODERATE INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE WIDELY SCATTERED
CONVECTION OVER SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. AN AREA OF SEVERE STORMS OVER
NORTHERN MS AND WESTERN TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE TO PULL EASTWARD
AND MAY MOVE INTO THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE COUNTIES
EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST POPS THERE
FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT.

345 PM EDT TUE APR 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STAYED WITH GOOD CHANCE 
THROUGH LIKELY PROBABILITIES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
OVERNIGHT. THE MOST LIKELY SCENARIO IS FOR A MAJOR OUTBREAK OF 
SEVERE CONVECTION ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH THE 
EVENING HOURS. THE CONVECTION SHOULD CONTINUE EAST INTO MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE LATER TONIGHT BUT WILL WEAKEN TO SOME DEGREE AS IT SHIFTS 
EAST INTO WFO CWFA. THE CONVECTIVE LINE MAY PRODUCE SEVERE WIND 
GUSTS ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BUT MAY WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AS THE JET SUPPORT MOVES AWAY TO THE NORTH. THE 
STORM PREDICTION CENTER HAS CONTINUED TO FORECAST A LARGE MODERATE 
RISK OF SEVERE CONVECTION FROM NEAR LAKE ERIE SOUTH THROUGH ALL OF 
KENTUCKY AND MOST OF TENNESSEE INCLUDING ALMOST THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA. SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS ARE IN PLACE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
TORNADIC SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS AS VERY STRONG SHEAR WITH HIGH 
HELICITY IS EXPECTED ESPECIALLY ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. INSTABILITY WILL BE ADEQUATE CONSIDERING THE VERY STRONG SHEAR 
THAT WILL BE DEVELOPING. THE LINE OF SEVERE CONVECTION WILL MOVE 
ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATER IN THE AFTERNOON AND WILL CONTINUE 
EAST THROUGH THE EVENING. ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR WEDNESDAY AS A 
STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGION DURING THE DAY. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...DEEP CONVECTION AND 
SEVERE THREAT CONTINUES WEDNESDAY NIGHT. PWAT VALUES BRIEFLY IN 
EXCESS OF 1.50...AS AXIS OF BEST MOISTURE MOVES EAST OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHAINS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HEAVY RAINFALL IS EXPECTED BUT 
DURATION SHOULD FALL SHORT OF AREAL FLOODING SO WILL NOT ISSUE FLOOD 
WATCH WITH THIS PACKAGE. COLD FRONT WILL BE EAST OF AREA THU WITH 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS OVERHEAD. LAYER MOISTURE GREATLY REDUCED SO PCPN 
CHANCES CONFINED TO NE HIGHLANDS. THU TEMPS BELOW NORMAL. RIDGE 
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA FRI AND SAT WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND A 
WARM UP TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS BY SAT. BACKED OFF ON POPS AND RAISED 
TEMPS SUNDAY WITH LATEST MODEL SOLUTIONS SLOWING DOWN APPROACH OF 
NEXT COLD FRONT. BEST RAIN CHANCE APPEARS TO BE SUN NGT AND MONDAY. 
TEMPS COOL TO BELOW NORMAL EARLY NEXT WEEK.

686 
FXUS64 KMRX 260741
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT TUE APR 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY. A LINE OF PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN EARLY THIS 
MORNING IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST-NORTHEAST TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA...AND THE STRONGER DYNAMICS WITH ITS ASSOCIATED LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES NORTHWARD TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES REGION. 
WHILE THIS COLD FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO MAKE MUCH PROGRESS TO THE 
EAST TODAY...OUTFLOW FROM THIS CONVECTIVE LINE WILL LIKELY HELP TO 
TRIGGER A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
AFTER SUNRISE. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT SEVERE STORMS WILL AGAIN 
DEVELOP TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. IN ADDITION...MODELS INDICATE THAT 0-3 KM 
HELICITY VALUES WILL BE HIGHER (200-300 M2/S2) TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND FAVORABLE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW ISOLATED TORNADOES. THE 
GFS AND NAM MODELS ARE REVEALING DIFFERENT CONVECTIVE SCENARIOS FOR 
TONIGHT...WITH THE GFS MODEL INDICATING A STRONG CONVECTIVE LINE 
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH THE 
POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL. SINCE THIS POSSIBILITY IS 24 HOURS 
AWAY AND STILL UNCERTAIN...WILL NOT PLAN TO ISSUE ANY FLOOD WATCHES 
YET...AND WILL LET LATER SHIFTS DECIDE. MODEL SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO 
REVEAL AN INVERTED V PROFILE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER...WHICH SHOULD 
HELP TO CONTINUE THE THREAT FOR DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS WITH SOME 
STORMS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. OVERALL... 
WILL GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER WITH MAXES FOR TODAY WITH THE 
EXPECTED INCREASE IN CONVECTION AND CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WITH STRONG DYNAMICS EXPECTED 
WILL KEEP LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS ON WEDNESDAY AND CATEGORICAL 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH FROPA...COULD SEE STRONG TO SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. UPPER 
TROUGH TO THE NORTH WILL TRIGGER A FEW SHOWERS ON THURSDAY...BUT 
BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO ENTER THE SUNDAY AND LINGERS INTO 
MONDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 
&&

IS MOVING EAST AT ABOUT 30 MILES PER HOUR. IT SHOULD SPEED UP SOME
OVERNIGHT. MODELS MOVE IT TO MIDDLE TN LATE TONIGHT AND TO THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AROUND MORNING. HAVE LOWERED RAIN CHANCES EXCEPT
ALONG THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. MODIFIED TEMPERATURES AND
DEW POINTS IN THE GRIDS WHERE RAIN COOLED AIR DROPPED TEMPERATURES
AND RAISED DEW POINTS. SKIES SHOULD BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY BUT BECOME
OVERCAST LATE TONIGHT AS EXTENSIVE CLOUD SHIELD AHEAD OF THE LINE
OF STORMS REACH MIDDLE TENNESSEE.

FXUS64 KMRX 251914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT MON APR 25 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHOULD BE AN ACTIVE PERIOD 
AS TWO MAIN SHORT WAVE FEATURES MOVE NORTHEAST OUT OF THE LOWER AND 
MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION GOING EARLY THIS EVENING AS WEAK TO MODERATE 
INSTABILITY AND A NICE SOUTHERLY FLOW COULD ACTIVATE AN ISOLATED 
STORM IN SPOTS. TRIED TO ADJUST POPS A LITTLE HIGHER TOWARD DAYBREAK 
AS THERE WILL BE A CHANCE FOR OUTFLOW BOUNDARY DRIVEN SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM CURRENT SEVERE CONVECTION ON THE EASTERN EDGE OF 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO MAKE IT INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TUESDAY MORNING. APPLIED LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE WESTERN THIRD 
WITH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS REMAINDER OF THE VIEWING AREA FOR THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS AS STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WITH SUFFICIENT 
INSTABILITY WILL BE IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE MAIN EVENT EXPECTED ON 
WEDNESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY POWERFUL 90-100 KT UPPER LEVEL JET WILL BE 
ADVANCING ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. WHILE DEEP SURFACE LOW SWINGS 
NORTHEAST FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. 
THE LOW WILL PULL A STRONG COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY 
LATE AFTERNOON. THE STORM PREDICTION CENTER HAS PLACED MUCH OF THE 
MRX CWFA IN A MODERATE RISK FOR SEVERE CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY AS A 
50-60KT LOW LEVEL JET MOVES INTO THE REGION. 0-1KM HELICITY VALUES 
WILL BE MORE THAN SUFFICIENT (250-350 M2/S2) FOR ROTATING STORMS 
WITH ADEQUATE INSTABILITY. ADJUSTED HIGH PROBABILITIES FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS SLIGHTLY AHEAD IN TIME AS SEVERE CONVECTION MAY 
ARRIVE A LITTLE EARLIER THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED. STILL LOOKS LIKE 
SEVERE CONVECTION WILL BE ONGOING INTO THE EVENING HOURS WEDNESDAY 
AS COLD FRONT SHOULD NOT ADVANCE TO THE APPALACHIAN SPINE UNTIL LATE 
EVENING.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER TROUGH REMAINS 
NORTH OF THE AREA THURSDAY. POST FRONTAL NW FLOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE 
MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. BRIEF COOL PERIOD WHILE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION FROM THE WEST. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
DOMINATES AND LAYER HEIGHTS RISE FRI/SAT. GOOD WARM UP WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS. THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS A LONG REACHING COLD FRONT THAT 
IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TN VLY SUN BRINGING A GOOD 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ACROSS THE REGION. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIFFER ON 
EASTERN PROGRESSION OF COLD FRONT. THERE IS A CHANCE FRONT COULD 
HANG UP IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH AN INCREASE IN POPS IN 
LATER FORECAST PACKAGES.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

TODAY AND TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD KEEP THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY. MODELS INDICATE MORE MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR TODAY THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS. AS A RESULT...EXPECT ISOLATED 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS...WITH A 
FEW STORMS POSSIBLY BECOMING SEVERE DUE TO THE POTENTIAL FOR A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS. IN ADDITION...MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL

INCREASE THE THREAT FOR DAMAGING WINDS WITH A FEW STORMS. AS FOR

AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. OVERALL...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH TEMPS.

SYSTEM THAT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ON THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
TUESDAY. DEEPENING SURFACE LOW THAT WILL BE MOVING NORTHEAST INTO 
NORTHERN ILLINOIS BY 12Z TUESDAY...WILL DRAG AN INITIAL FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY INTO AND THROUGH THE AREA BY 18Z TUESDAY AS PER MODELS. FOR 
NOW...WILL WAIT ANOTHER RUN BEFORE COMPLETELY BUYING IN ON GFS MODEL 
DEPICTING A SECOND LINE OF SHRA/TSRA MOVING INTO THE AREA BY 12Z 
WEDNESDAY. NAM MODEL IS SLOWER AND DOESN'T HAVE AS MUCH OF A 
REFLECTION OF THIS SOLUTION. EITHER WAY...TSRA DEVELOPMENT POTENTIAL 
WITH INITIAL SYSTEM IS DEFINITELY POSSIBLE AND CURRENT FORECAST POPS 
IN THE 40-50 PERCENT RANGE FORECAST AREA WIDE LOOKS PRETTY GOOD FOR 
NOW.

STILL WILL BE SLIGHTLY UPPING PRECIP CHANCES FOR EARLY WEDNESDAY
MORNING. STRONG 850 MILLIBAR JET AXIS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
REGION ON WEDNESDAY...WITH AROUND A 60 KNOT JET INDICATED BY MODELS
AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS ACROSS THE AREA INDICATING 0-3 KM HELICITY 
VALUES APPROACHING 850 M2/S2 BY 03Z THURSDAY.

WILL BE HIGHLIGHTING SEVERE/ISOLATED TORNADO THREAT FOR AREA ON
WEB SITE AND IN UPCOMING HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK THIS MORNING TO
ACCOUNT FOR CONTINUED IMPRESSIVE AND EXPECTED SEVERE WEATHER
POTENTIAL ESPECIALLY FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...SPREADING EAST
ACROSS THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FROM THE WEST BY
THURSDAY...WITH DRY AND COOLER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED INTO THE
UPCOMING WEEKEND. THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO APPROACH THE
OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION BY 00Z SUNDAY...AND HAVE SLIGHTLY
BUMPED UP SHRA/TSRA CHANCES FOR THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY TO
ACCOUNT FOR THIS BETTER REFLECTION OF THE SYSTEM FROM THE LAST
COUPLE OF MODEL RUNS.

UPPER TROF AND SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM INTO THE FORECAST AREA A FEW

WEATHER THREAT MAY BE PUSHED MORE INTO THE PEAK HEATING PERIOD LATE 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING AS A LINE OF 
CONVECTION ADVANCES TO THE APPALACHIANS BY EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND MOISTURE 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF  
INTO THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR THURSDAY. TAPER POPS 
BACK LATER IN THE DAY THURSDAY WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A 
SHOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. KEPT A DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY AS RIDGING REPLACES THE COOL UPPER TROF. ANOTHER SYSTEM

CONVECTION ON SUNDAY FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. UNDERCUT MOS TEMPS FIRST

GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 240654
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT SUN APR 24 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
A MOIST AND UNSEASONABLY MILD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A 
BROAD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL REMAIN STAGNANT OVER THE MUCH OF THE 
NATION TODAY AND TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD KEEP THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND ITS ASSOCIATED CONVECTION NORTH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. IN ADDITION...MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A DRY AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER TODAY COMPARED TO YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS ARE COMING CLOSER TO 
AGREEMENT INITIALLY IN KEEPING FIRST FRONTAL BOUNDARY HELD TOGETHER 
AS IT MOVES THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND INTO EAST TENNESSEE DURING 
THE DAY ON TUESDAY. WILL UP POPS TO HIGH END OF CHANCE (50 PERCENT) 
FA-WIDE BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO ACCOUNT FOR SOLUTION OF MODELS. 
DECENT AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY...SO WILL KEEP IN CHANCE OF TSRA AREA 
WIDE. 

INITIAL UPPER LOW IS CONTINUED TO BE PROGGED TO MOVE QUICKLY TO THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION BY EARLY WEDNESDAY. A SECOND AND STRONGER UPPER 
LOW AT 500 MILLIBARS CONSISTENTLY HAS BEEN SHOWN BY GFS/NAM/ECMWF TO 
DROP FURTHER SOUTHWARD OUT OF THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN STATES INTO NORTH 
TEXAS AND EASTERN OKLAHOMA BY 06Z WEDNESDAY...AND IS PROGRESSIVELY 
SHOWN TO MOVE THROUGH ARKANSAS THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY BY 00Z 
THURSDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL PUSH A STRONG COLD FRONT LINED UP FROM 
BASICALLY SOUTH TO NORTH ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION 
FROM CVG-BNA-NORTHWEST ALABAMA BY 18Z WEDNESDAY...MOVING INTO 
EASTERN KENTUCKY AND EXTENDING SOUTHWARD THROUGH EAST TENNESSEE BY 
00Z THURSDAY. 

WITH BETTER UPPER DYNAMICS...STRONG COLD ADVECTION AND MODELS
CONSISTENT WITH AT LEAST A 50-60 KNOT LOW LEVEL JET MOVING INTO
EAST TENNESSEE BETWEEN 18Z-00Z TIME PERIOD ON WEDNESDAY...AM MORE 
CONCERNED ABOUT SEVERE THREAT WITH THAT SYSTEM. WILL BE HIGHLIGHTING 
MORE APPARENT SEVERE THREAT IN UPCOMING HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK 
EARLY THIS MORNING FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING FROM WEST TO EAST 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION 
BEHIND THIS STRONG SYSTEM...WITH COOLER TEMPS AND DRY WEATHER 
EXPECTED INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND.

FROM SIMILAR NAM/GFS MOS TEMPS.

GRADUALLY MOISTEN ON STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW MONDAY THROUGH THE

WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED CONVECTION ON THE MAJOR 
TERRAIN FEATURES ON MONDAY FOLLOWED BY SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF WILL 
BUILD EAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 00Z THURSDAY WHILE SURFACE 
COLD FRONT PRESSES STEADILY EAST ACROSS TENNESSEE. MAINTAINED LIKELY 
PROBABILITIES FOR STRONG CONVECTION WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHILE KEEPING 
SLIGHT THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS ON THURSDAY WITH 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND LIFT WRAPPING AROUND THE DEEP EASTERN U.S. 
UPPER TROF. ON SATURDAY...SLOWLY RISING HEIGHTS AND DRY ADVECTION 
WILL ALLOW FOR PLEASANT WEATHER WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

305 AM EDT SAT APR 23 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED WARM FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN 
KNOXVILLE AND THE TRI-CITIES...WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
MOVE NORTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE...AS A 
BROAD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS OVER MUCH OF THE NATION. THIS 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IS PROGGED TO REMAIN STAGNANT INTO TONIGHT... 
WHICH SHOULD KEEP THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
STATIONARY AND NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. WHILE THE MODELS INDICATE 
THAT MOST OF THE CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WITH THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST REA INTO TONIGHT...MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO 
INDICATE THAT THE MID LEVELS (BETWEEN 850 AND 500 MB) SHOULD BE 
FAIRLY WARM AND STABLE TODAY. THUS...CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD BE 
SUPPRESSED TODAY OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH MOST OF THE FRONTAL 
CONVECTION REMAINING NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM 
AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY SIMILAR 
AGREEMENT IN KEEPING UPPER RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND LIMITING 
SOUTHEAST MOVEMENT OF A FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. 
GFS/NAM/ECMWF MODELS ALL KEEP COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG AND NORTH 
OF THE OHIO RIVER ACROSS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND SOUTHERN INDIANA 
THROUGH 12Z MONDAY.

INITIAL UPPER LOW AT 500 MILLIBARS BY 12Z TUESDAY...SHOWS SIGNS OF
PUSHING NORTHEAST THROUGH THE UPPER PLAINS STATES...AND DRAGS THE
FIRST SYSTEM INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...BEFORE WEAKENING ACROSS
MIDDLE TENNESSEE. SECOND AND STRONGER UPPER LOW IS THEN PROGGED BY
MODELS TO PUSH SOUTHEAST THROUGH KANSAS TO OKLAHOMA BY 12Z
WEDNESDAY...AND THEN TO SOUTHEAST MISSOURI BY 00Z THURSDAY.

STRONG SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS BEEN SHOWN NOW BY THREE STRAIGHT MODEL 
RUNS TO MOVE QUICKLY FROM THE WEST TO EAST ACROSS WEST TO MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE BY 00Z THURSDAY...AND ON THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN 
06-12Z THURSDAY. AM BECOMING MORE CONCERNED ABOUT SEVERE THREAT FOR 
WEDNESDAY EVENING-EARLY THURSDAY TIME PERIOD DUE TO EXPECTED 
INCREASED SEVERE POTENTIAL AND CONSISTENCY OF MODEL RUNS FROM LAST 
NIGHT TO TONIGHT. THIS EVENT WILL BEAR WATCHING CLOSELY OVER THE 
NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT.

CURRENT FORECAST HAS A DECENT HANDLE ON PRECIP CHANCES FOR TUESDAY 
THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY...SO WILL LEAVE ALONE AT THIS TIME.
&&

STRATUS CLOUD DECK OVERNIGHT...WITH A WARM AND MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER
WITH LIGHT SOUTH WINDS BEHIND WARM FRONT.

AND QUITE WARM THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MOS TEMPS CLOSE AND GENERALLY
FOLLOWED...EXCEPT FOR SLIGHTLY FAVORING THE WARMER VALUES.
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION WILL REMAIN WITHIN THE PROTECTIVE INFLUENCE OF AN AMPLIFIED 
RIDGE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP CONVECTION 
LIMITED IN SCOPE WITH A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF DEVELOPMENT ON THE 
MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES. BY TUESDAY...ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES TO MOISTEN 
AND DESTABILIZE AS AN INITIAL SHORT WAVE SHIFTS NORTHEAST FROM THE 
PLAINS THROUGH THE MIDWEST BRINGING A FRONT CLOSE TO THE FORECAST 
AREA. STAYED IN A SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE MODE FOR CONVECTION FOR 
TUESDAY WHILE GRADUALLY INCREASING TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE INITIAL 
WAVE'S COOL FRONT DRAWS NEAR. THE NEXT SHORT WAVE BUILDS EAST INTO 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY MID DAY WEDNESDAY WITH THE MAIN EVENT 
OCCURRING ACROSS MRX CWFA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT 
DRIVES EAST TOWARD THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. RATHER STRONG SHORT 
WAVE WITH DECENT INSTABILITY SHOULD RESULT IN STRONG THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT WEDNESDAY NIGHT. AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF A LITTLE SLOW TO 
DEPART WITH ENOUGH MOISTURE AND ENERGY DROPPING INTO THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE TROF TO KEEP A SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON 
THURSDAY. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER GOING THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE 
MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA IN THIS PATTERN.

324 PM EDT THU APR 21 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CONVECTION FINALLY
POPPING OVER SW NC IN THE MAIN AREA OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE THIS

ACTIVITY ALONG THIS FEATURE IS MAINLY OVER AR AND MS...WITH
MOVEMENT SE. THIS COULD INHIBIT CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT NEAR OUR
REGION OVERNIGHT...THUS I WAS FORCED TO MAKE MAJOR DOWNWARD
ADJUSTMENTS TO OUR POP/WX GRIDS. HOWEVER...AS THE WARM FRONT LIFTS
NORTH OVERNIGHT...ISENTROPIC LIFT IS SHOWN TO DEVELOP OVER MIDDLE
TN AND SPREAD EAST WITH ELEVATED INSTABILITY PROGGED AS WELL.
THIS SEEMS TO LEAD TO BEST RAIN CHANCES BY FRIDAY MORNING AND
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE NRN PLATEAU...NE TN AND SW VA AREAS...SO I
KEPT POPS LIKELY FOR MOST OF THESE AREAS ON FRIDAY. CHANCE POPS
GENERALLY ELSEWHERE.

RAIN CHANCES FALL OFF SHARPLY BY FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE WARM FRONT
LIFTS NE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND MID ATLANTIC STATES. MOSTLY DRY
AND QUITE WARM ON SATURDAY...WITH VERY LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO
PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR BOTH FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.

MOS TEMPS REASONABLY CLOSE AND FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE DOMINANT FLOW 
PATTERN ALOFT WILL BE SOUTHWESTERLY WHICH LEADS TO A WARM EXTENDED 
PERIOD. SHORT WAVELENGTH TROUGH WILL SHIFT NORTHEAST FROM THE PLAINS 
EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK WITH PROGRESS INTO SOUTHEASTERN CANADA BY 12Z 
THURSDAY. DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO THE FORECAST KEEPING A 
NICE WARM AND DRY START TO THE WEEK FOR MOST AREAS. DID KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON MONDAY FOR SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH 
CAROLINA WITH GRADUALLY INCREASING CHANCE POPS TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE BIG SHORT WAVE FEATURE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE 
FRONTAL SYSTEM BUILD EAST ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TOWARD THE 
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. POSSIBILITY OF HEALTHY CONVECTIVE EPISODE 
LATER IN THE DAY WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS DEEP MOISTURE IS 
LIFTED AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. TWEAKED TEMPS A BIT ABOVE GUIDANCE 
AS A PLEASANT ABOVE NORMAL PERIOD IS EXPECTED DURING THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 200129
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT TUE APR 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A LINE OF STRONG CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF 
ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. THIS CONVECTION IS ALREADY CONGEALING 
INTO A SQUALL LINE...WHICH WILL LIKELY QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY LATER TONIGHT (MOST LIKELY FASTER THAN WHAT THE MODELS 
SUGGEST). WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING AND THE UPPER-LEVEL 
DYNAMICS MOVING NORTHEAST TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES REGION...THINK 
THAT THIS SQUALL LINE SHOULD WEAKEN LATER TONIGHT AS IT APPROACHES 
THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...MODELS STILL INDICATE SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA TOWARDS SUNRISE...SO 
THINK THAT SOME DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE WITH SOME STORMS BEFORE THEY TOTALLY 
FALL APART AGAINST THE MOUNTAINS. 

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS 
EVENING TO MENTION LIKELY POPS LATER TONIGHT...AND TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME SEVERE STORMS. OTHERWISE...REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK.

1005 AM EDT TUE APR 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST FOR TODAY APPEARS GENERALLY ON TRACK AND NO

IN INCREASINGLY ANTI-CYCLONIC SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AROUND UPPER

SCATTER OUT AS BETTER MIXING COMMENCES THIS AFTERNOON. FORECAST

ALTHOUGH MOISTURE PROFILE IS UNIMPRESSIVE. THUS PROBABLY CANNOT
COMPLETELY RULE OUT ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN SOME OF THE
HIGHEST TERRAIN. CURRENT FORECAST DEPICTS THIS OVERALL SCENARIO
WELL AND NO CHANGES ARE WARRANTED.


&&

016 
FXUS64 KMRX 190741
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 AM EDT TUE APR 19 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CAP AROUND 6500 FEET EARLY THIS 
MORNING. CLOUDS WILL LINGER UNTIL CAP BREAKS OUT DURING THE MORNING 
HOURS. WARM AIR ADVECTION REMAINS STRONG THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL TODAY AND TONIGHT INCLUDING THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ISOLATED BRIEF DURATION CONVECTION POSSIBLE 
ACROSS SW VA AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF E TN BUT MOST AREAS 
WILL REMAIN DRY. ONGOING CONVECTION WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS MIDDLE TN 
TONIGHT. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY INCREASE IN ITS EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION LATE TONIGHT AS STEERING FLOW VEERS AND INCREASES IN 
STRENGTH. TSTM ACTIVITY SHOULD REACH THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AROUND 5 
AM EDT (4 AM CDT). SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE WITH THE MAIN 
THREAT BEING DAMAGING WINDS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FRONTAL SYSTEM PLOWING
INTO AREA WEDNESDAY...THEN SLOWLY SETTLING IN OR NEAR SOUTHERN
PARTS OF CWA UNTIL FRIDAY WHEN IT LIFTS NORTHWARD. WITH FRONTAL
BOUNDARY CLOSER TO THE SOUTHERN AREAS...POPS WILL TREND HIGHER IN
THE SOUTH.

THEN MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH SWELLING MID AND UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF THAT WILL TEND TO DIVERT MOST ACTIVE 
WEATHER OFF TO OUR NORTH FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD 
AND KEEP THE FRONTAL BOUNDARIES TO THE NORTH.  HOWEVER...THE RIDGE 
IS NOT EXPECTED TO DOMINATE THE SCENE THIS FAR NORTH...SO AM LEAVING 
SOME LIGHT TO MODERATE POPS IN...WITH GENERALLY A LOWER TO HIGHER 
GRADIENT OF POPS SOUTH TO NORTH...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  

FOR TEMPS...HAVE COOLED OFF MAX TEMPS IN SOUTHERN AREAS FOR FIRST 
COUPLE OF DAYS DUE TO EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER...BUT HAVE BUMPED UP MAX 
TEMPS FOR THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS...AS RIDGE KEEPS WARM AIR IN 
PLACE...LOOKS LIKE MOS MAXES WERE TRENDING BACK TOWARD CLIMO TOWARD 
THE END OF THE GUIDANCE.  WENT VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON MIN TEMPS.

SEVERE THREAT FOR WEDNESDAY SEEMS LIKE IT WILL BE ON THE LOW END 
OVERALL...WOULD EXPECT TREND TO BE DOWNWARD AS OVERNIGHT CONVECTION 
PUSHES FARTHER INTO AREA. SLIGHT CHANCE THAT FRONT WILL BE SLOW 
ENOUGH TO ALLOW BUILD-UP AGAIN WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ALONG FRONT...BUT 
ONLY SOMETHING TO KEEP AN EYE ON AT THIS POINT.  WOULD EXPECT MAIN 
FOCUS TO BE FARTHER SOUTH OR EAST.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  64  81  57  77 /  10  40  70  60  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  62  79  56  75 /  10  40  70  40  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  63  80  54  73 /  10  40  70  40  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              85  55  80  50  71 /  10  20  70  30  20

FXUS64 KMRX 181855 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EDT MON APR 18 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS WILL REMAIN DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM. GOOD RETURN FLOW BETWEEN SURFACE HIGH AND TROUGH APPROACHING 
FROM THE NORTHWEST WILL PUSH TEMPS TOMORROW TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO. FOR 
TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR BLEND OF MAV/MET GUIDANCE VALUES TONIGHT AND 
FOLLOWED MAV GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY FOR TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES-NORTHEAST UNITED STATES TUESDAY NIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH
THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY. PLENTY OF INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...HOWEVER BEST DYNAMICS WILL
BE NORTH OF THE AREA.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL PULL
SOUTH INTO THE GULF COAST STATES...BUT SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE EAST
OF THE APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY WITH ANOTHER AREA OF CYCLOGENESIS
DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL-SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES. THE INCREASING
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL PULL BOUNDARY BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT WITH
ISENTROPIC LIFT...INCREASING INSTABILITY...AND WARM FRONT
CONVERGENCE PRODUCING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

SHORT-WAVE ACROSS THE PLAINS WILL LIFT NORTHEAST WITH A TRAILING
COLD FRONT PULLING ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY BEFORE STALLING.
WILL MAINTAIN SLIGHT POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND MONDAY GIVEN
EXPECTED INSTABILITY OVER THE AREA.

EXPECTED TO PUSH TO OUR SOUTH ON THURSDAY...THEN MOVE BACK INTO THE 
REGION THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  MODELS CONTINUE TO DIVERGE EVEN 
FURTHER FOR THE WEEKEND...SO FOR NOW KEPT US IN AN UNSETTLE WEATHER 
PATTERN AND CONTINUED 20 TO 30 POPS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  FOR 
TEMPERATURES... STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AFTER GENERAL
AGREEMENT AMONG MODELS THAT EARLY PORTION OF LONG TERM WILL BE
GENERALLY DRY AND PLEASANT...MODEL SOLUTIONS CONTINUE TO DIVERGE
THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM. THE ECMWF MODEL CONTINUES TO
DEPICT FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT APPROACHES THE REGION IN THE LATE
WEDNESDAY TO EARLY THURSDAY TIME FRAME WILL STALL OUT OVER OUR
GENERAL AREA WHILE THE GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT
FRONT WILL PUSH WELL SOUTH OF THE CWA. HAVE MORE OR LESS DISCOUNTED
THE ECMWF SOLUTION SINCE IT APPEARS TO BE THE OUTLIER...AND TENDED
TO FAVOR THE GFS SOLUTION. AS A RESULT...DID NOT MAKE ANY DRASTIC
CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST EXCEPT TO BUMP UP POPS TO
CHANCE SATURDAY NIGHT AS GFS...WITH SUPPORT FROM MOST GEFS ENSEMBLE
MEMBERS...DEPICTS STRONG COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE CWA
DURING THAT PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...STAYED CLOSE TO MAV/MEX GUIDANCE
FOR THE MOST PART.

876 
FXUS64 KMRX 170642
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EDT SUN APR 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
NE AWAY FROM THE AREA TODAY AND FLOW BECOMES ZONAL TONIGHT. WEAK 
POST FRONTAL TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY TODAY 
AND LOSE IDENTITY. LOW LEVEL FLOW SNAPS BACK TO SWRLY. AFTER COOL 
START AND SPOTTY SHOWERS EARLY TODAY...WARMING AND CLEARING TREND 
RETURNS. SW FLOW REMAINS UP SOME TONIGHT AND WILL LIKELY SEE RIDGE 
VALLEY SPLIT IN TEMPS OVERNIGHT. TEMP GUIDANCE CLOSE TODAY AND 
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN NORMAL. PREFER COOLER GFS VALLEY TEMPS TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY CONTINUES TO LOOK DRY 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTING EASTWARDS OUT OF THE REGION.  WILL MOVE 
INTO AN UNSETTLED PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED AS A SERIES 
OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY EFFECT THE AREA.  HOWEVER...MODEL CONSISTENCY 
REMAINS POOR FOR THIS PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE ON DETAILS IS LOW.  
INTRODUCED A FEW LOW POPS OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON TUESDAY AS A 
BOUNDARY SETTLES IN TO OUR NORTH.  MODELS DO SHOW SOME TRENDING 
TOWARDS A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY FOR OUR BEST CHANCE 
OF CONVECTION.  THIS FRONT SHOULD SETTLE TO OUR SOUTH ON THURSDAY 
THEN LIFT NORTH AS A WARM FRONT ON FRIDAY WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND.  AS A RESULT...HAVE KEEP POPS 
AT 20 TO 30 FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 PM EDT SAT APR 16 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE CAROLINA 
COAST...WITH A WEAK TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS CONTINUE TO REVEAL A FEW LIGHT 
SHOWERS OVER EASTERN KY AND SOUTHWEST VA...BUT THESE SHOWERS SHOULD 
DIMINISH SHORTLY AFTER THEIR ASSOCIATED UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE EXITS 
THE REGION. HIGH PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO BUILD ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY TONIGHT...BRINGING AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WHICH SHOULD BEGIN TO DECREASE FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST AFTER MIDNIGHT. ALTHOUGH TEMPS SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S IN 
MANY AREAS BY SUNRISE...A PERSISTENT WIND FLOW SHOULD PREVENT ANY 
FROST FORMATION.

WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS EVENING 
TO REMOVE THE WIND ADVISORY HEADLINE...AND TO MENTION DECREASING 
CLOUDINESS IN MOST AREAS. TEMPS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT 
CHANGE.

FXUS64 KMRX 161828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EDT SAT APR 16 2011


.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL PULL OUT OF 
THE REGION...AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. PRESSURE GRADIENT 
WILL RELAX THIS EVENING...ALLOWING STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS TO 
DIMINISH.  WILL ALLOW WIND ADVISORY TO CONTINUE THROUGH 01Z.  CLOUDS 
WILL DIMINISH FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY.  MAY 
BE A SHOWER NORTHERN HALF EARLY TONIGHT...SO WILL CARRY LOW POP 
THROUGH MIDNIGHT THERE. TEMPS WILL DIP INTO THE 30S IN MANY 
LOCATIONS...BUT WITH THE EXPECTED WIND/CLOUDS DOES NOT LOOK LIKE 
MUCH OF A THREAT FOR FROST.  SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL 
LIKELY DIP BELOW FREEZING...BUT AT THIS TIME DO NOT THINK IT 
WARRANTS A FREEZE WARNING.  JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.  


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EARLY PART OF THE
UPCOMING WORK WEEK CONTINUES TO LOOK DRY WITH TEMPS MODERATING TO
BACK ABOVE CLIMO PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. LATTER PORTIONS
OF THE LONG TERM MORE PROBLEMATIC HOWEVER AS MODEL SOLUTIONS
DIVERGE. THE ECMWF MODEL HAS BEEN CONSISTENT WITH BRINGING A WEST-
EAST ORIENTED SURFACE BOUNDARY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION
BY WEDNESDAY AND STALLING THE BOUNDARY OVER OUR GENERAL AREA ALONG
WITH ACCOMPANYING PRECIP. THE GFS HAS BEEN LESS CONSISTENT WITH
THIS BOUNDARY...NOW DEPICTING THAT IT WILL PUSH WELL SOUTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA FOR A TIME BEFORE RETURNING AS A WARM FRONT LATER IN
THE WEEK. EVEN THOUGH IT HAS BEEN LESS CONSISTENT...THE GFS HAS
SUPPORT FROM THE GEFS ENSEMBLES AND THE CANADIAN MODEL. DUE TO THE
LOW CONFIDENCE...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/
FORECAST FOR THOSE TIME PERIOD. DID HOWEVER REMOVE POPS FOR TUESDAY
AS MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING DRIER AND ARE NOW IN GENERAL AGREEMENT
WITH DRY CONDITIONS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED A BLEND OF
MAV/MET GUIDANCE FOR EARLY IN THE LONG TERM..AND DID NOT DEVIATE
MUCH FROM THE MEX GUIDANCE FOR THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG TERM.

310 AM EDT SAT APR 16 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST OF THE 
AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. MODERATE SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE ALONG AND 
EAST OF THE FRONT. THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER HAS ENDED. HIGH 
WINDS REMAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS NE AREAS EARLY. WINDS WILL RELAX 
BRIEFLY IN THE FRONTAL ZONE BUT INCREASE FROM THE SW ONCE AGAIN BY 
THIS AFTERNOON. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS FAIRLY TIGHT ACROSS TN 
VLY TODAY AS RELATIVELY DEEP OCCLUDED LOW MOVES INTO THE WESTERN 
GREAT LAKES. CLOUDS WILL THIN SOME BY MID MORNING BUT FILL BACK IN 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS THIS AFTN. SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL 
PERSIST ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS AND THE SMOKIES. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
BELOW NORMAL TODAY AND TONIGHT. READINGS IN THE 30S WILL BE COMMON 
TONIGHT BUT FREEZES ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIMITED TO THE VERY HIGH 
ELEVATIONS. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY FOR QUIET AND CALM WEATHER.  A WEAK BOUNDARY SETTLED INTO 
THE REGION...MAINLY REMAINING TO OUR NORTH FOR TUESDAY.  WITH 
INCREASE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...COULD SEE A OCCASIONAL SCATTERED 
SHOWERS DEVELOP OVER THE REGION.  THERE REMAINS SOME DIFFERENCES IN 
THE DETAILS FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...BUT OVERALL WILL BE IN AN 
UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN.  MAIN CONCERN WILL BE A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
MOVING INTO THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY.  IT WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
GENERAL AREA FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.  PRECIP WILL BE JUST 
OCCASIONAL SHOWERS BUT WILL KEEP 20 TO 30 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
916 PM EDT FRI APR 15 2011

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST IN GOOD SHAPE AS MASS OF SHOWERS
WITH EMBEDDED THUNDER CONTINUES TO MAKE EASTWARD PROGRESS ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA. APPEARS THAT DEEP SOUTHERN CONVECTION IS ROBBING
A PORTION OF THE GULF INFLOW INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIAN REGION.
ATMOSPHERE HAS BEEN VERY SLOW TO DESTABILIZE WITH LARGE AREA OF
RAIN COOLED AIR ACROSS MIDDLE AND EASTERN TENNESSEE. SATELLITE AND
RADAR IMAGERY REVEAL STRONGER LIFT WITH LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS JUST
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ACROSS WESTERN KENTUCKY/TENNESSEE. THIS
AREA WILL MOST LIKELY WEAKEN TO SOME DEGREE AS IT MOVES INTO THE
FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT. HOWEVER...THERE STILL MAY BE A STRONG
THUNDERSTORM IN THE LINE AND CONVECTION SHOULD BE ABLE TO KEEP SOME
GUSTY WIND GOING...SO WILL KEEP THE WIND PRODUCTS GOING OVERNIGHT.
WILL TWEAK SOME TEMPERATURE AND DEWPOINT FIELDS TO MATCH CURRENT
WEATHER.

ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA CURRENTLY
MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. RAIN COOLED AREA ACROSS MUCH OF
EASTERN TENNESSEE IS LIMITING INSTABILITY AND EXPECT MAINLY SHOWERS
ACROSS THE TAF SITES WITH A SMALL THREAT OF THUNDER. IT WILL TAKE A
LONG TIME FOR THE MAIN FRONTAL BAND OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS TO PROGRESS EAST ACROSS THE TAF SITES TONIGHT AND
THERE WILL STILL BE SOME SHOWERS OCCURRING FOR A PERIOD AT TRI
AFTER 12Z. DRY SLOT COULD ALLOW SKIES TO GO PARTLY CLOUDY DURING
THE MORNING ON SATURDAY FOLLOWED BY A BROKEN SC LAYER AS MOISTURE
AND LIFT WRAP AROUND UPPER LOW.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 151848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT FRI APR 15 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...CONVECTION HAS DIMINISHED 
THIS AFTERNOON AS IT HAS MOVED INTO OUR AREA...LEAVING MOSTLY 
SHOWERS AS INSTABILITY IS LACKING.  HOWEVER...EXPECT ADDITIONAL 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT...AND INSTABILITY SHOULD BE A LITTLE BETTER THIS 
EVENING/OVERNIGHT SO WITH STRONG WIND FIELDS AND SIGNIFICANT 
FORCING...STILL COULD BE SOME SEVERE STORMS ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND 
WEST ZONES.  LOW LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS EVEN MORE OVERNIGHT...AS DOES 
POTENTIAL FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES.  HAVE ALREADY SEEN WARNING LEVEL WINDS 
AT TIMES IN SOME OF THE NORMAL RISK AREAS...SO HIGH WIND WARNING 
LOOKS GOOD.  WHILE MANY VALLEY LOCATIONS MAY NOT SEE ADVISORY LEVEL 
WINDS OVERNIGHT...ENOUGH RISK FOR GUSTS TO 40 TO KEEP WIND ADVISORY 
GOING...AND WILL EXTEND TO 12Z TO MATCH WARNING.  PRECIP SHOULD 
RAPIDLY MOVE OUT EARLY SATURDAY...BUT MAY BE A FEW LINGERING 
SHOWERS.   WILL STILL BE ON THE WINDY SIDE SATURDAY...AND MAY NEED A 
WIND ADVISORY FOR AT LEAST PARTS OF THE AREA...BUT WILL HOLD OFF FOR 
NOW AND LET LATER SHIFTS TAKE ANOTHER LOOK.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE LONG TERM BUT DETAILS ARE STILL 
SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN. OTHER THAN A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS SATURDAY 
NIGHT IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AND HIGHER TERRAIN...EARLY PORTION 
OF LONG TERM APPEARS GENERALLY DRY WITH TEMPS SLOWLY MODERATING TO 
ABOVE CLIMO. SURFACE BOUNDARY APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA AND THEN 
STILL OVER THE AREA BY MID WORK WEEK WITH ACCOMPANYING MOISTURE AND 
SCATTERED PRECIP. APPEARS THINGS WILL REMAIN UNSETTLED WITH BOUNDARY 
MEANDERING AROUND THE AREA THROUGH THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG 
TERM. THUS HAVE CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
SEVERAL CONSECUTIVE PERIODS EVEN THOUGH PRECIP IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE 
CONTINUOUS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE APPRECIABLY FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTION OUT AHEAD OF WARM FRONT AS SHORT WAVE
ENERGY MOVES THROUGH OUT AHEAD OF MAIN SYSTEM. THIS CONVECTION HAS
BEEN WEAKENING AS IT MOVES IN...AND EXPECT THAT TREND TO CONTINUE
ESPECIALLY FOR ANY PRECIP THAT TRIES TO MOVE INTO CENTRAL/NORTHERN
VALLEY AREAS WHERE IT WILL FACE SIGNIFICANT DOWNSLOPING. AT THIS
POINT STILL LOOKS LIKE MAIN SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL HOLD OFF
UNTIL LATER...MAINLY THIS EVENING/NIGHT...ALTHOUGH CANNOT RULE
OUT SOMETHING EARLIER SOUTHWEST ZONES.  WILL KEEP POPS AS THEY
ARE. WINDS ALREADY GUSTING TO NEAR 50 IN SOME OF THE NORMALLY
FAVORED AREAS...SO HIGH WIND WARNING LOOKS GOOD. NOT CONFIDENT
ABOUT WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA BEING MET ELSEWHERE...BUT WILL LEAVE
IT UP FOR NOW. WILL ADJUST TEMPS UP IN DOWNSLOPE AREAS. UPDATE OUT
SOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 150742
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT FRI APR 15 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE 
NE THROUGH MO TODAY AND CONTINUES TO MOVE NE TONIGHT. GOOD DIVERGENCE SETS 
UP ALOFT OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY LOW 
LEVEL JET OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY SHIFTS INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT. VERY STRONG THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY EXPECTED 
TODAY SW OF THE MRX CWA. THIS ACTIVITY WILL APPROACH THE AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND MOVE INTO THE MRX CWA THIS EVENING. VERTICAL WIND 
PROFILES REMAIN MODERATELY STRONG THIS EVENING. THE AIRMASS SHOULD 
STABILIZE SOME PRIOR TO THE ONSET OF THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY. 
HOWEVER STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED THIS EVENING. 
DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. WINDS WILL DECREASE MOST 
LOCATIONS SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT BUT REMAIN STRONG IN THE MOUNTAINS 
OVERNIGHT. COLD AIR ADVECTION NOT VERY STRONG BEHIND FRONT. SHOWERS 
WILL CONTINUE EARLY SATURDAY AND PERSIST MUCH OF THE DAY ACROSS SW 
VA AND NE TN MNTS. TEMPERATURES WILL COOL TO A FEW DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL SATURDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS WILL 
LINGER OVER NORTHERN AREAS AS WRAP AROUND SHOWERS PULL AWAY FROM THE 
REGION SATURDAY NIGHT.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY AND BEGINS 
TO SHIFT EASTWARD ON MONDAY.  A WEAK BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH AND MOIST 
SOUTHERLY FLOW MAY GENERATE A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS THE MRX CWA MONDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.  A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED INTO THE AREA 
AROUND THE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY TIME FRAME...PROVIDING OUR BEST CHANCE 
OF CONVECTION FOR THE EXTENDED.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EDT THU APR 14 2011

.DISCUSSION...CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT SE TO CALM WINDS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...DEFINITELY THE CALM BEFORE THE STORMS (LATE FRIDAY). 
SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY IS LACKING FRIDAY AFTERNOON...BUT SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY IS NOTED BY FRIDAY EVENING FOR WESTERN PARTS OF 
OUR FORECAST AREA. STORMS MAY WEAKEN UPON REACHING NE TN AND SW VA 
LATE FRIDAY EVENING. 

FORECAST GRIDS RUNNING VERY CLOSE TO HOURLY OBSERVATIONS...SO NO 
UPDATES PLANNED FOR THIS EVENING. WILL LET HIGH WIND WATCH STAY A 
WATCH FOR NOW...AND LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT MAKE THE DECISION TO GO UP OR 
DOWN AS NEEDED (WARNING OR ADVISORY). LOW LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS 
ENOUGH TO WARRANT LLWS AT CHA TOWARD DAYBREAK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT THU APR 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR 
THE SHORT TERM AS HIGH PRESSURE RETREATS AND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM/COLD 
FRONT APPROACHES.  PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN...AND LOW LEVEL JET 
WILL STRENGTHEN FROM THE SOUTHEAST.  LOOKS LIKE CONDITIONS WILL 
START TO BECOME FAVORABLE FOR A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT LATE FRIDAY...SO 
HIGH WIND WATCH WILL CONTINUE.  DOWNSLOPING LIKELY WILL DELAY PRECIP 
ARRIVAL FOR CENTRAL/NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS.  WILL UNDERCUT MAV POPS 
ESPECIALLY DOWNSLOPE AREAS...AND WILL ALSO GO ABOVE MAV TEMPS IN 
THESE LOCATIONS FOR FRIDAY.  WILL ONLY MENTION THUNDER IN SOUTHERN 
AND WESTERN ZONES AS INSTABILITY LOOKS MINIMAL FURTHER NORTHEAST AND 
DOWNSLOPING SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS CONVECTION. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE 
LONG TERM IS THE STRONG SYSTEM THAT AFFECTS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE 
LATE FRIDAY TO EARLY SATURDAY TIME FRAME. LATEST MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS DEPICT GENERALLY UNIMPRESSIVE INSTABILITY BUT VERY STRONG 
VERTICAL WIND PROFILE. THIS SETUP APPEARS SIMILAR TO THIS PAST 
MONDAY EVENING'S EVENT ONLY WITH EVEN STRONGER WIND PROFILE. THUS 
SOME SEVERE WEATHER POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHERN ZONES AND 
PLATEAU AREA...ALTHOUGH LATE EVENING TO EARLY MORNING TIMING LESS 
FAVORABLE FOR THAT ASPECT. STRONG SURFACE WINDS ALSO A CONCERN AS 
FAVORABLE PROFILE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT SETS UP OVER THE FAVORED 
AREAS WITH 70+ KNOT LLJ...VEERING WIND PROFILE AND ELEVATED STABLE 
LAYER AROUND 850 MB PROJECTED. THUS WILL CONTINUE HIGH WIND WATCH 
THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.

OTHERWISE...SYSTEM PULLS OUT ON SATURDAY BUT LINGERING WRAP-AROUND 
MOISTURE WILL KEEP PRECIP POSSIBLE THROUGH THE DAY BEFORE TAPERING 
OFF SATURDAY NIGHT. AFTER A BRIEF RESPITE...A WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY 
WILL MEANDER AROUND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION RESULTING IN LOW 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WORK WEEK. FOR TEMPS... 
GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO MAV/MEX GUIDANCE AS ENSEMBLES DISPLAYED NO 
DISCERNIBLE TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 140745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT THU APR 14 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ANOTHER GREAT DAY IS IN STORE 
AS ZONAL FLOW ALOFT SPREADS A BIT OF CI ACROSS THE REGION WITH A 
SUFFICIENT AMOUNT OF EARLY SPRING SUNSHINE. LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW IN 
COMBINATION WITH INSOLATION SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE A FEW 
DEGREES ABOVE WEDNESDAY MAXES. MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
LATER TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL LOW MAKES ITS WAY FROM 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE OZARKS BY LATE AFTERNOON FRIDAY. SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE RATHER DEEP PARENT SYSTEM WILL PULL 
INCREASING MOISTURE OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO. SHOWERS WILL BECOME 
LIKELY ACROSS MUCH OF THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING 
THE DAY AS A WARM FRONT BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
INSTABILITY WILL INCREASE LEADING TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
THUNDERSTORMS...ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE AFTERNOON. STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMP BLEND FOR THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A STRONG UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY. A COLD FRONT WILL SWEEPS EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
FRIDAY NIGHT-EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A STRONG 
BOUNDARY LAYER JET (850MB WINDS OF 65KTS+) WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. GOOD SETUP FOR DOWNSLOPE MOUNTAIN WAVE WINDS IN 
THE ADJACENT FOOTHILLS...SUCH AS THE CAMP CREEK AREA. WINDS OF 70-80 
MPH WINDS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THESE AREAS...SO HAVE ISSUED A HIGH 
WIND WATCH FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...BEGINNING AT 21Z FRIDAY.

A SQUALL LINE OF STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE PLATEAU 
COUNTIES FRIDAY EVENING. MODELS SHOW WEDGE OF INSTABILITY PULLING UP 
INTO THE PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA. ALSO...STRONG SHEAR-HIGH HELICLITIES AS WELL WITH 
SIGNIFICANT TORNADO PARAMETERS FAVORABLE FOR TORNADOES. FOR THE REST 
OF THE AREA...MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS WITH 
THE LINE OF STORMS.

FOR SATURDAY...FRONT WILL MOVE EAST EARLY WITH A GOOD DEAL OF COLD 
AIR STRATO-CU ANTICIPATED AND AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN...ESPECIALLY FOR 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA AND MOUNTAINS.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...RIDGING WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH DRIER CONDITIONS AND MORE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...SURFACE HIGH WILL BE EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS WITH DEVELOPING SOUTHERLY WINDS PULLING MOISTURE AND 
WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE REGION. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND INCREASING 
INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ALMOST EACH DAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT WED APR 13 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)..SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA WILL SHIFT EAST AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES OVER THE REGION.  
SHOULD SEE SOME HIGH CLOUDS AROUND AT TIMES...BUT STILL MAINLY CLEAR 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.  TEMPS TONIGHT MAY GET LOW ENOUGH FOR SOME 
FROST...ESPECIALLY NORTHERN AREAS.  WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM 
MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS 
EAST THURSDAY NIGHT WITH WINDS ALOFT INCREASING FROM THE SOUTHEAST 
AS LOW PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
MOVES EAST TOWARD THE MS VALLEY. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR TO 
PARTLY CLOUDY BUT LOWS ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN TONIGHTS LOWS.
BIG CHANGES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER LOW 
DEVELOPS OVER MID MS VALLEY AND MOVES SLOWLY NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
BY SATURDAY. THE SURFACE LOW IS EXPECTED TO MOVE FROM MO FRIDAY 
MORNING INTO MI BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. STRONG WINDS ALOFT AND 
DESTABILIZATION OF THE ATMOSPHERE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WILL CAUSE 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE DURING THE DAY WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
INCREASING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY ACROSS THE WESTERN SECTIONS WILL 
ALLOW POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS THERE IN THE AFTERNOON. THE BEST CHANCE 
FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS LOOKS LIKE FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY 
EARLY MORNING HOURS AS A SQUALL LINE JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS. AFTER THAT THE STORMS SHOULD 
WEAKEN. RAIN CHANCES LINGER SATURDAY WITH WRAP AROUND COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WITH SLOW MOVING UPPER LOW. COULD EVEN BE SOME THUNDER NE 
IN THE AFTERNOON BUT HAVE NOT ADDED YET. SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SATURDAY THEN CLEARING SATURDAY NIGHT AND MOSTLY SUNNY SUNDAY WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE. MONDAY HIGH SHIFTS EAST WITH INCREASING CLOUDS BUT NO 
RAIN. FRONT TO THE NORTH ACROSS OHIO VALLEY MONDAY SHIFTS A LITTLE 
FARTHER SOUTH AS HIGH SHIFTS EAST. WITH INCREASED SOUTHERLY FLOW 
SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY. NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM WEST LATE WEDNESDAY OR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

ALREADY UP DON'T BELIEVE THIS WILL BE AN ISSUE. DRIER AIR AND HIGH
PRESSURE WILL KEEP VFR CONDITIONS IN PLACE UNTIL LATE TONIGHT WHEN
AIR AT THE SURFACE MAY BECOME SATURATED IN CALM WIND AND CLEAR SKY
ENVIRONMENT. KEPT THE VSBY HIGH END MVFR WHILE OPTING FOR A LOWER
MVFR REDUCTION AT TRI WHICH IS THE MORE LIKELY TERMINAL TO BE
AFFECTED BY FOG LATE TONIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 AM EDT WED APR 13 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES FURTHER 
AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA TODAY BUT NOT BEFORE GENERATING BKN-SCT 
SC ACROSS PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS 
WELL AS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. AS 
USUAL DIFFICULT TO SAY WHEN THE CLOUDS WILL BREAK BUT SATELLITE 
IMAGERY INDICATES THAT THE CLOUDS MAY NOT PERSIST TOO LONG AFTER 
DAYBREAK. THAT WOULD ALLOW FOR A RETURN TO NEARLY FULL SUNSHINE FOR 
THE ENTIRE AREA AS THE ONLY OTHER MOISTURE TO SPEAK OF WILL BE THIN 
CIRRUS CLOUDS BUILDING IN FROM THE MIDWEST OVER THE TOP OF A LOW 
AMPLITUDE UPPER RIDGE. TONIGHT CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHTER WIND WILL 
PRODUCE RATHER DECENT LONG WAVE RADIATION WITH TEMPS DROPPING INTO 
THE MID AND UPPER 30S ACROSS THE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS WHERE THERE 
COULD BE SOME PATCHY FROST FORMATION. ANOTHER GREAT DAY IN STORE ON 
THURSDAY WITH MORE SUNSHINE AS HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY DEPARTS WHILE 
THE REGION AWAITS THE ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER STRONG STORM SYSTEM FOR THE 
EARLY PART OF THE WEEKEND. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THURSDAY NIGHT WITH
RETURN OF GULF MOISTURE MOVING NORTH ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES
TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
MID-SECTION OF THE NATION WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING INTO
THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE FRIDAY...THEN ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. A BAND OF CONVECTION WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION
FRIDAY NIGHT. INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED...SO DO NOT EXPECT SEVERE
STORMS WITH THIS LINE. 

FOR SATURDAY...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A
GOOD DEAL OF COLD AIR STRATO-CU AND PERIODS OF LIGHT RAIN...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESS WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS
WITH WARM SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASING TEMPERATURES WELL INTO THE 70S
AND LOWER 80S.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT-WEDNESDAY MORNING...ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL
SWEEP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA PRODUCING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

POPS BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND ALSO KEEPING THURSDAY NIGHT MOSTLY DRY. NOT 
SURE HOW STRONG THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...GIVEN LOCATION OF THE UPPER LOW WELL TO OUR NW. 

KEPT POPS INTO SATURDAY NIGHT AS UPPER LOW TRACKS SLOWLY ENE AND OUT 
OF THE REGION BY SUNDAY. BOTH ECMWF AND GFS OFFER DRY WEATHER 
RETURNING FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT GFSX MOS CONTINUES TO 
FLUCTUATE CONSIDERABLY ON MAX TEMPS...NOW SHOWING MID 60S TO LOW 70S 
FOR SUNDAY HIGHS. MAINTAINED SOME CONSISTENCY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS 
AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS FOR NOW ON TEMPS.

UPPER LEVEL PATTERN DIFFERS QUITE A BIT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH 
GFS MODEL NOW DRY FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. THE FAVORED 00Z ECMWF 
BRINGS NEXT SYSTEM INTO THE REGION LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.
GIVEN THESE UNCERTAINTIES...I OPTED TO KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY...SIMILAR TO NEARBY GRIDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EDT TUE APR 12 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT IS MOVING
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEY. FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA BY DAYBREAK WITH UPPER
TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.
MODELS SHOW A DEFORMATION ZONE MOVING ACROSS KENTUCKY AND WESTERN-
MIDDLE TENNESSEE EARLY THIS MORNING...THEN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THIS MORNING-EARLY AFTERNOON. RADAR SHOWS AN AREA OF SHOWERS
ASSOCIATED WITH THE LIFT. THE DEFORMATION ZONE COMBINED WITH WEAK
INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN TWO-
THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA...MAINLY THIS MORNING.

AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST...BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW WILL BECOME 
NORTHWESTERLY PRODUCING UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
THROUGH THIS EVENING.

PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL CLOUDS REMAIN OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...
EXCEPT SOUTHERN COUNTIES...TODAY...THEN SLOWLY ERODE OVERNIGHT FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY. AREAS OF FROST IS POSSIBLE FOR THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...FAR EASTERN 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WEDNESDAY NIGHT-
THURSDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN 
AGREEMENT FOR THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST...ESPECIALLY BY 
SUNDAY/MONDAY BUT WENT A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF DEPICTION FOR 
THE LONG TERM. TRIED TO SLOW DOWN THE INTRODUCTION OF POPS TO SOME 
DEGREE THURSDAY NIGHT AS MODEL FORECASTS BRING ANOTHER UPPER LOW 
THROUGH THE PLAINS TOWARD THE MIDWEST STATES. ECMWF WAS SLOWER THAN 
THE GFS/CANADIAN AND KEPT THURSDAY NIGHT MOSTLY DRY AS SYSTEM WARM 
FRONT TRIES TO MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THE WARMER AIR 
RETURNS DURING THE DAY FRIDAY ALONG WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY SO KEPT THE MEDIUM CHANCE POPS GOING WHILE USING A 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST GRADIENT IN POP AWAITING THE MAIN EVENT 
FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT BUILDS INTO THE REGION. 
INCREASED POP TO LIKELY CATEGORY FOR THE NIGHT TIME CONVECTION. 
SLOWED DOWN THE DEPARTURE OF POST FRONTAL SHOWERS ON SATURDAY AS THE 
UPPER LOW/TROF SHIFTS SLOWLY NORTHEAST INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES 
AND UPPER OHIO VALLEY. DUE TO MODEL UNCERTAINTY DURING THE LAST 
COUPLE DAYS OF THE EXTENDED...DID NOT MAKE CHANGES TO THE FORECAST. 
JUST KEPT THE NICE DRY SUNDAY AWAITING ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROF FOR 
MONDAY. DID NOT CHANGE TEMP FORECAST TO ANY LARGE DEGREE JUST 
TWEAKED THE NUMBERS A BIT TOWARD THE NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

POPS IN GRIDS FOR NOW). WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE FOR MONDAY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN APR 10 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED WARM FRONT STRETCHING 
ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND THEN GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST 
AIR MASS WAS IN PLACE OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH TEMPS IN THE 80S 
OVER MOST AREAS. AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY WILL 
MOVE EAST TONIGHT...WITH A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT CONVECTION 
AHEAD OF THIS FRONT WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. WHILE INSTABILITY IS PROGGED TO BE 
MARGINAL AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A STRONG VEERING WIND FIELD ALONG WITH 
AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SHOULD COMBINE TO PRODUCE ANOTHER 
ROUND OF SEVERE WEATHER. GFS AND NAM MODELS ARE ALSO IN AGREEMENT 
THAT SOUTHWESTERLY 850 MB WINDS WILL BRING A GOOD FETCH OF GULF 
MOISTURE...SO WILL MENTION 'RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES' WORDING IN 
THE FORECAST FOR MONDAY EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
TUESDAY AND LOOK REASONABLE. FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL TREND TOWARDS 
A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR 
A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. MAIN CONCERN THIS 
EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT THAT PUSHES INTO THE REGION FOR FRIDAY 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH WILL CONTINUE TO 
ROTATE IN SCATTERED SHOWERS INTO SATURDAY...WITH BEST CHANCE OF POPS 
OVER NORTHERN AREAS. CONTINUE WARM FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED...THOUGH 
A BIT COOLER AIR FILTERS IN BEHIND FRIDAY/S SYSTEM FOR THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 PM EDT SAT APR 9 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING FROM 
WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND THEN SOUTHEAST OVER 
SOUTHERN WV AND NORTHWEST NC...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST 
(SUMMER-LIKE) AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MSAS ANALYSIS 
INDICATES THAT THE AIR MAS OVER THE FORECAST AREA HAS BECOME VERY 
UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON WITH LI'S BETWEEN -8 AND -10. OUTFLOW FROM A 
STRONG MCS OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL LIKELY TRIGGER SEVERE 
TSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. AN UPPER- 
LEVEL RIDGE IS THEN PROGGED TO BUILD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
LATER TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...CAPPING THE LOCAL AIR MASS AND 
BRINGING DRY BUT UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS (WITH NEAR RECORD 
HIGHS). MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THE 
NEXT COLD FRONT ON MONDAY...AND NOW INDICATE THAT CONVECTION SHOULD 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS. MODELS ALSO AGREE THAT INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK AHEAD OF THIS 
COLD FRONT...BUT STILL THINK SOME SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE POSSIBLE 
WITH A STRONG WIND FIELD EXPECTED ALONG WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MAXES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 
AS FOR MINS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS WHICH ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE HIGH DEWPOINT READINGS ALREADY IN PLACE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...FRONT EXITING THE REGION 
EARLY TUESDAY AND A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN AREAS 
EARLY.  OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR QUIET AND WARM 
WEATHER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES IN FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH THE ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW CONTINUING 
TO ROTATE IN SCATTERED SHOWERS INTO SATURDAY.  THERE REMAINS SOME 
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THIS SYSTEM SO CONFIDENCE LOW 
ON DETAILS.  WILL HAVE 20 TO 30 POPS IN PLACE FROM LATE THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY.  

&&

166 
FXUS64 KMRX 091359
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT SAT APR 9 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
EXTENDING FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND THEN 
SOUTHEAST OVER SOUTHERN WV AND NORTHWEST NC...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY 
WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALS THAT A STRONG MCS HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AND WAS 
INTENSIFYING AS IT MOVED EAST. THICKNESS VALUES...ALONG WITH THE 
ORIENTATION OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND EXPECTED INSTABILITY AXIS... 
SUGGESTS THAT THIS CONVECTIVE COMPLEX WILL BEGIN TO MOVE SOUTHEAST 
BY THIS AFTERNOON. WITH THIS CONVECTIVE COMPLEX EXPECTED TO MOVE 
THROUGH AT LEAST THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS...AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE WEATHER WILL 
LIKELY DEVELOP SINCE MODELS INDICATE THAT INSTABILITY LEVELS SHOULD 
BECOME MODERATELY STRONG TO POSSIBLY VERY STRONG THIS AFTERNOON.

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS 
MORNING TO EMPHASIZE THE SEVERE POSSIBILITIES THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
TO TWEAK TEMPS UPWARDS LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 090729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT SAT APR 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL BACK-DOOR INTO 
EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA TODAY PROVIDING A CONTINUED 
FOCUS FOR CONVECTION AS WELL AS LEFT OVER BOUNDARIES FROM CURRENT 
STORMS. MODELS ALSO SHOW A SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO 
AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THESE FEATURES COMBINED WITH MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL PRODUCE A GOOD CHANCE-LIKELY POPS TODAY. A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SEVERE STORMS WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING LARGE 
HAIL GIVEN WBZ AROUND 10500 FEET.

AS BOUNDARY LIFTS BACK NORTHEAST AND SHORT-WAVE AND DIVERGENCE ALOFT 
EXITS THE AREA...STORMS WILL DISSIPATE THIS EVENING GIVING WAY TO 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH PATCHY FOG.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE AREA 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER ON SUNDAY.  A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON 
MONDAY. CONDITIONS LOOK FAVORABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ON 
MONDAY. WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE AVAILABLE...BUMPED UP POPS TO LIKELY.  
COULD SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ON MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING INTO THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY. A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO 
FRIDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON FRIDAY WHEN THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE ARRIVES.  NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED FOR THE PERIOD.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

POPS IN HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY FOR NOW.  SURFACE HIGH IN CONTROL 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES IN AROUND THE

FXUS64 KMRX 080732
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EDT FRI APR 8 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS 
OHIO VALLEY EARLY THIS MORNING. SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH 
CEILINGS EXPECTED TO LOWER. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60 
WHICH IS MUCH WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT AND DEW POINTS ARE IN THE MID 
40S TO LOWER 50S...HIGHER AND INCREASING. A WEAK SHORT WAVES WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY FROM NW TO SE. SOUTHERLY FLOW BRINGING 
IN CLOUDS...AND AIR MASS BECOMING MODERATELY UNSTABLE DURING THE 
AFTERNOON WILL ALLOW FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DEVELOP...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS CLOSER TO THE 
BOUNDARY. MAV GUIDANCE LOOKS MORE REASONABLE THAN MET WITH LOWER 
POPS SOUTH AND HIGHER POPS NORTH. ACTIVITY HEAT DRIVEN SO TONIGHT 
RAIN CHANCES DECREASE HOWEVER AIRMASS EVEN MORE UNSTABLE. THINK 
ACTIVITY WILL BE ISOLATED AND MAINLY NE CWA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
FARTHER SOUTH SO HAVE VALLEYS DRY LATER TONIGHT. BOTH MAV AND MET 
HIGH TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL HAVE HIGHS LOWER 70S 
TO NEAR 80. TONIGHT LOWS STILL MILD MAINLY 50S TO NEAR 60. PER SPC 
STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER HEATING NEAR THE FRONT AND STRONGLY SHEARED 
ENVIRONMENT WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR ROTATING UPDRAFTS. SUPERCELLS 
POSSIBLE AS CONVECTION DEVELOPS. AS STORMS DEVELOP INTO CLUSTERS 
FLOW ALOFT WILL MOVE THEM SOUTHEAST AT  ABOUT 30 KNOTS AND WILL 
BRING THREAT FOR LARGE HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS AND A FEW TORNADOES. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA ON SATURDAY.  WITH INSTABILITY LINGERING...WILL PROBABLY 
SEE THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP ON SATURDAY.  COULD SEE A FEW STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS BRIEFLY ON SUNDAY BEFORE A FRONT 
TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY. CONDITIONS LOOK FAVORABLE ENOUGH 
FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ON MONDAY. COULD SEE A FEW STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS ON MONDAY AS WELL. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE 
AREA PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  A WARM FRONT 
TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON 
STRENGTH OR TIMING...WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS ON THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT THU APR 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A MILD AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT 
SOUTHWARD OVERNIGHT WITH A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS OCCURRING AHEAD OF 
IT. A PERSISTENT SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA OVERNIGHT...WHICH WILL HELP TO MOISTEN THE AIR MASS AND KEEP 
TEMPS UNSEASONABLY MILD OVERNIGHT. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS 
SOME HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME CLEARING FURTHER 
WEST OVER MIDDLE AND WEST TN. HOWEVER...THE OVERALL TREND TONIGHT 
WILL BE FOR INCREASING CLOUDINESS AS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHES 
THE FORECAST AREA.

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL...AND WILL NOT PLAN 
TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

FXUS64 KMRX 070658
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 AM EDT THU APR 7 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK RIDGE ALOFT WILL REMAIN
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. FAST WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL ALLOW HIGH LEVEL
CIRRO-STRATUS TODAY...AND SOME ALTO-STRATUS TONIGHT TO MOVE ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA. DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY LOW (30S-40S)
SINCE SURFACE RIDGING REMAINS OVER THE EASTERN GULF THROUGH THE
FORECAST PERIOD. LOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE MID 20S
TO NEAR 30 EXPECTED TODAY.

INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT LATE TONIGHT MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED-WIDELY
SCATTERED SHOWERS...BUT MOST LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN DRY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CAPPING INVERSION SHOWN
TO WEAKEN ON FRIDAY WITH LAPSE RATES STEEPENING BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
LEADING TO POSTIVE CAPE OF GREATER THAN 1000 J/KG. FRONTAL BOUNDARY
SHOWN TO STALL JUST TO OUR NORTH ACROSS ERN KY AND SW VA...WITH
FLOW ALOFT PUSHING MOST STORMS IN AN EASTERLY DIRECTION. HOWEVER...
FURTHER SOUTH ACROSS SRN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA I DON'T SEE AS
MUCH FOCUS FOR CONVECTION. INCREASED POPS TO AROUND 60 PERCENT OVER
NE AREAS...BUT KEPT A MUCH LOWER CHANCE POP ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC.

STILL UNSTABLE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...BUT SLIGHT
CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION LOOKS GOOD FOR
NOW. KEEPING SUNDAY DRY AND QUITE WARM...IN FACT LIKELY THE WARMEST
DAY OF THE YEAR FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

TIMING FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY SYSTEM WITH APPROACHING COLD
FRONT...STILL A BIT TRICKY AS ECMWF IS NOW MUCH SLOWER THAN GFS/NAM
SOLUTIONS. THUS...OPTED TO MAINTAIN CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS
FOR THIS SYSTEM. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY SHAPE UP TO BE DRY WITH
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO.

861 
FXUS64 KMRX 061832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT WED APR 6 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE SOUTHEAST COAST... 
WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND MID WEST. 
THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...AND THEN SLOWLY DRIFT 
INTO SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN BY FRIDAY NIGHT. A SOUTHERLY WIND 
FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BRINGING WARMER TEMPS EACH SUCCESSIVE DAY ALONG WITH 
INCREASING LEVELS OF MOISTURE. MODELS AGREE THAT SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AS THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SO WILL INCLUDE A 
CHANCE FOR TSTORMS ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH MAXES...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS. WILL GENERALLY 
TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE WITH MINS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS FAIRLY SIMILAR WITH 
LONG TERM DETAILS THROUGH SUNDAY BUT THEN DIVERGE DURING THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST. KEPT SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER AND 
POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM ON SATURDAY AS A WARM FRONT ADVANCES 
NORTHWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. UPPER HEIGHTS AMPLIFY 
NICELY ON SUNDAY WITH MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA IN THE WARM SECTOR 
FROM MID TO LATE AFTERNOON SATURDAY WELL INTO SUNDAY. MAINTAINED A 
DRY AND VERY WARM SUNDAY AS THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS IS EXPECTED TO BE 
IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION. THE CHANCE FOR CONVECTION INCREASES 
LATER SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS ANOTHER STRONG SPRING STORM SYSTEM 
BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. EXACT FRONTAL TIMING UNDETERMINED FOR 
THIS LATER PERIOD OF THE FORECAST BUT THE FRONT MAY BE EAST OF THE 
MOUNTAINS BY LATE AFTERNOON MONDAY SO DROPPED POPS BACK TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE MONDAY NIGHT AS THERE IS SOME INDICATION OF TRAILING SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY IN THE BACK SIDE OF DEPARTING UPPER TROF. MORE RIDGING 
WILL FOLLOW THIS SYSTEM INTO MID WEEK...THEREFORE REBOUNDING TEMPS 
AND SUNSHINE SHOULD RETURN. IT APPEARS THAT ANOTHER MID LATITUDE 
CYCLONE WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA AGAIN ON THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   46  76  56  81  63 /   0   0  20  40  20

OAK RIDGE, TN             45  75  55  80  62 /   0   0  20  40  20

MID WEST. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO STAY NORTH OF THE FORECAST

SKIES SHOULD BE THE RULE FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT HAVE ALREADY 
UPDATED THIS MORNING TO REMOVE FROST ADVISORY HEADLINE...AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO PERSIST

SUGGEST GOOD WARMING TREND FOR TODAY. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO MAV 
TEMP GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...KEPT SOME LOW POPS IN
FROM THURSDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY EVENING...MAINLY FOR POSSIBLE
DIURNAL CONVECTION. SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST AND WARM AIR ADVECTION
DEVELOPS WITH SOME WEAK INSTABILITY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BUT NOT
MUCH OF A FOCUS/TRIGGER. MAIN CONVECTIVE EVENT STILL APPEARS TO BE
LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...AHEAD OF ANOTHER POSSIBLY STRONG
COLD FRONT. GFS/NAM/ECMWF ALL OFFER SIMILAR TIMING...BUT FELT IT
WAS TOO EARLY TO GO ANY HIGHER THAN 30 PERCENT POPS SUNDAY NIGHT
AND 50 PERCENT POPS FOR MONDAY. PROBABLY TOO EARLY TO PLAY UP
SEVERE THREAT MUCH AT THIS POINT. 

OTHERWISE...LATEST GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE FROM 05/12Z
NUMBERS...SO LITTLE CHANGES WERE NEEDED...JUST A TWEAK OR TWO TO
FIT IN BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.
