FXUS64 KMRX 060120
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT TUE APR 5 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. DRIZZLE HAS ENDED AND 
CLOUDS SHOULD BE DECREASING. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CLOUDS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE 
CWA AS RIDGE BUILDS AS THE UPPER TROUGH EXITS THE AREA TONIGHT. COOL 
TEMPERATURES ANTICIPATED WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND LIGHT WIND. 
WILL KEEP THE FROST ADVISORY GOING AS IS. WILL ADD PATCHY FROST TO 
THE REMAINDER OF THE CWA WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 30S EXPECTED. 
STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES. SHOULD SEE WARMER 
TEMPERATURES ON WEDNESDAY AS RIDGE BUILDS IN. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR WEDNESDAY UNDER A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY. NO 
PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TONIGHT OR WEDNESDAY.    

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...ALTHOUGH 
STILL DIVERGING MORE TOWARD THE LATTER PERIODS. WARMING TREND WILL 
CONTINUE THURSDAY...AND SHOULD BE A DRY DAY AS LOW AMPLITUDE RIDGING 
CONTINUES OVER THE AREA.  FOR FRIDAY/SATURDAY TIME FRAME A WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SAG CLOSER TO OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES BEFORE 
LIFTING BACK NORTH....AND SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY MAY ALSO MOVE 
ACROSS...SO WILL HAVE TO CARRY LOW POPS LATE THU NIGHT THOUGH SAT.   
SHOULD BE DRY SUNDAY...THEN MORE SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT FORECAST TO 
MOVE THROUGH EARLY IN THE WEEK.  SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE TIMING OF 
THIS SYSTEM...AS GFS...ESPECIALLY 12Z RUN...FASTER THAN MOST OTHER 
GUIDANCE AND BRINGS IT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.  WILL LEAN TOWARD A 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER AND MORE CONSENSUS MONDAY TIMING...BUT WILL NEED 
CHANCE POPS BOTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  WILL GO DRY TUESDAY 
BEHIND THE FRONT.    


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT LOCATED ROUGHLY ALONG 
A MURPHY NC (RHP) TO GREENEVILLE TN (GCY) TO JUST EAST OF LONESOME 
PINE VA (LNP) AT 0730Z. SHOWERS CONTINUE ALONG AND EAST OF THE 
FRONT. KEPT POPS A BIT ABOVE MOS NUMBERS FOR TWO REASONS...1) TO 
MESH BETTER WITH NEIGHBORING NWS GRIDS FOR EARLY TODAY...AND 2) 
EXPECT SPOTTY TO SCATTERED SHOWERS TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE 700 TO 
500 MB TROUGH AXIS THIS MORNING. 850 MB TEMPS AND SURFACE TEMPS 
FALLING BEHIND THE FRONT...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER AND PARTIAL 
THICKNESSES MUCH TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW SHOWERS. MOS HIGHS CLOSE AND 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

CLEARING SKIES TONIGHT...BUT LINGERING LOW LEVEL (850 MB) RH COULD
KEEP A FEW CLOUDS AROUND NE TN AND SW VA AREAS. OTHERWISE...WINDS
DROP OFF AND MOS LOWS ARE COOL ENOUGH FOR AREAS OF FROST TO DEVELOP
BEFORE DAYBREAK WEDNESDAY. SMOKY MTNS AND NRN MTNS OF EAST TN WILL
DROP BELOW 3O DEGREES...BUT OUR FROST/FREEZE PROGRAM HAS NOT YET
STARTED IN THOSE AREAS. THUS...OPTED TO ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR
TONIGHT FOR SW VA COUNTIES AND MUCH OF NE TN. MOS MINS HAVE COME UP
A GOOD BIT FOR SW NC...SO DID NOT INCLUDE THAT AREA IN MY FROST
ADVISORY. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...QUITE RAPID WARM-UP 
IN STORE ON WEDNESDAY AS UPPER TROUGH PULLS OUT AND UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WITH SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT 
RISES AS THIS PROCESS UNFOLDS. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS 
IN FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS A SERIES OF WEAK DISTURBANCES 
TRANSLATES THROUGH THE AREA. NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM POISED TO 
APPROACH THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT MAJOR TIMING DIFFERENCE 
BETWEEN ECMWF AND GFS MODELS PRECLUDE PINPOINTING EXACT TIMING AT 
THIS POINT. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  34  69  42  73 /  20   0   0  10  10

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT HAS JUST PASSED TYS WITH TSRA LIKELY TO LAST 
FOR ANOTHER 45 MINUTES OR SO. WINDS HAVE BEEN BRIEFLY GUSTY AGAIN 
WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...THEN DROP OFF TO 15 KNOTS OR LESS. LOTS 
OF RUMBLES ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...BUT ALL THUNDER AND 
RAIN HAVE LIKELY ENDED AT CHA.

CEILINGS MAY DROP TO MVFR BRIEFLY AT CHA...AND WILL LIKELY STAY IN 
THE MVFR TO JUST ABOVE IFR FOR A FEW MORE HOURS AT BOTH TYS AND TRI.

OTHERWISE...THE TREND WILL BE FOR MUCH IMPROVEMENT IN FLYING 
CONDITIONS TOWARD DAYBREAK. SKIES SHOULD BE CLEARING LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH VFR CONDITIONS RETURNING THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

323 PM EDT MON APR 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH
THE AREA TONIGHT. SHOULD HAVE STRONG TO SEVERE WEATHER TONIGHT AS
FRONT HEADS THROUGH THE AREA. FRONT MOVING OUT OF THE LATE TONIGHT
WITH LESSER RAIN CHANCES FOR TUESDAY. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET ALSO
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH LATE EVENING...WILL LEAVE NPW FOR
WINDS GOING AS IS. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS. MUCH COOLER
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED ON TUESDAY BEHIND THE FRONT.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...ALTHOUGH DIVERGING MORE 
TOWARD THE LATTER PERIODS.  SHOULD BE A CHILLY NIGHT TUESDAY 
NIGHT...WITH TEMPS FALLING INTO THE UPPER 20S AND 30S MOST 
LOCATIONS.  MAY END UP NEEDING A FREEZE WARNINGS/FROST ADVISORIES IN 
AREAS WHERE FREEZE PROGRAM IS CURRENTLY ACTIVE...BUT NO ISSUANCE 
YET.   SHOULD BE DRY WED AND THU WITH A WARMING TREND...THEN THINGS 
LOOK MORE ACTIVE FOR THE WEEKEND.  MAY BE SOME DRY PERIODS IN THE 
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY TIME FRAME...BUT DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT THIS 
FAR OUT AS APPEARS WE WILL BE DEALING WITH SOME MINOR IMPULSES THAT 
MODELS HAVE A HARD TIME RESOLVING THAT FAR OUT...SO FOR NOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO CARRY LOW POPS ALL PERIODS.  MORE SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT 
FORECAST TO BE MOVING IN EARLY NEXT WEEK...ALTHOUGH QUITE A BIT OF 
TIMING UNCERTAINTY.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS MONDAY FOR NOW.

916 
FXUS64 KMRX 041435
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1035 AM EDT MON APR 4 2011

.DISCUSSION...LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS ENTERING WESTERN TN/WESTERN KY. 
WILL BUMP UP POPS A BIT FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. STILL A RISK FOR 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS LATER THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES...WINDS AND THE 
REST OF FORECAST ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG S TO SW WINDS ALREADY
TAKING SHAPE EARLY THIS MORNING AHEAD OF OUR WELL ADVERTISED SEVERE
WEATHER SYSTEM. SUSTAINED SPEEDS OF 20 TO 35 KNOTS AND GUSTS WELL
OVER 45 TO 55 KNOTS IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN AREAS...WHERE EVENING
SHIFT UPGRADED TO A HIGH WIND WARNING. EXPANDED OUR WIND ADVISORY
TO INCLUDE REMAINDER OF VALLEY/LOWER ELEVATIONS...WITH A START-UP
TIME AT 11 AM EDT TODAY. KEPT THE WIND ADVISORY/WARNING EXPIRING AT
8PM EDT (SINCE WE WILL LIKELY BE ISSUING SEVERAL SVR/POSSIBLY TOR
WARNINGS BY THEN). LATER SHIFTS CAN ADJUST THE ADVISORY/WARNING AS
NEEDED. 

OTHERWISE...MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON BULK OF THE STRONG TO
SEVERE STORMS TO REACH VALLEY LOCATIONS AND EASTWARD AREAS MAINLY 
AFTER 05/00Z...BUT I KEPT LIKELY POPS IN LATE THIS AFTERNOON FOR
OUR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREAS. ADDED WORDING OF STORMS MAY PRODUCE
DAMAGING WINDS AND HEAVY RAINFALL (SEE DAY ONE EXCESSIVE RAINFALL
OUTLOOK). 

TEMPS STARTING OUT EXTREMELY MILD WHERE STRONG WINDS ALOFT ARE
ALREADY MIXING DOWN TO THE SURFACE (NOTE 70 DEGREES AT TYS AT 3 AM
EDT). THUS...I NUDGED MAX TEMP GRID UP TO THE WARMER GFS MOS HIGHS 
WHICH SHOULD STAY A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR TODAY (CHA - 
88...TYS - 87...AND TRI - 82).

ONE FINAL CONCERN...LOW AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES WITH STRONG WINDS
WHICH COULD BE VERY NEAR RED FLAG CRITERIA FOR SMOKY MTN DISTRICT. 
WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS IN OUR HWO PRODUCT FOR NOW...AND LET DAY SHIFT 
MONITOR OR CHECK WITH FIRE MANAGEMENT FOLKS. WILL SEND OUT OUR SPS
PRODUCT FOR SEVERE THREAT ONE MORE TIME.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...BEHIND STRONG COLD FRONT 
SHOWERS END TUESDAY MORNING WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION DROPPING 
TEMPERATURES 20-25 DEGREES AS COLD HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES IN. TUESDAY 
NIGHT LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S WILL BRING ANOTHER FREEZE TO 
COLDER LOCATIONS AND FROST TO WARMER AREAS WEDNESDAY MORNING. THEN 
QUICK WARMING TREND THROUGH THURSDAY. HIGHS BACK TO NEAR SEASONAL 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY THURSDAY AND A WARM FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
FRIDAY. AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
INCREASE WILL ALLOW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP FRIDAY. 
FORECAST AREA REMAINS IN WARM SECTOR SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT SO KEPT 
RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE 
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY PERIOD.
&&

608 
FXUS64 KMRX 040802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EDT MON APR 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG S TO SW WINDS ALREADY
TAKING SHAPE EARLY THIS MORNING AHEAD OF OUR WELL ADVERTISED SEVERE
WEATHER SYSTEM. SUSTAINED SPEEDS OF 20 TO 35 KNOTS AND GUSTS WELL
OVER 45 TO 55 KNOTS IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN AREAS...WHERE EVENING
SHIFT UPGRADED TO A HIGH WIND WARNING. EXPANDED OUR WIND ADVISORY
TO INCLUDE REMAINDER OF VALLEY/LOWER ELEVATIONS...WITH A START-UP
TIME AT 11 AM EDT TODAY. KEPT THE WIND ADVISORY/WARNING EXPIRING AT
8PM EDT (SINCE WE WILL LIKELY BE ISSUING SEVERAL SVR/POSSIBLY TOR
WARNINGS BY THEN). LATER SHIFTS CAN ADJUST THE ADVISORY/WARNING AS
NEEDED. 

OTHERWISE...MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON BULK OF THE STRONG TO
SEVERE STORMS TO REACH VALLEY LOCATIONS AND EASTWARD AREAS MAINLY 
AFTER 05/00Z...BUT I KEPT LIKELY POPS IN LATE THIS AFTERNOON FOR
OUR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREAS. ADDED WORDING OF STORMS MAY PRODUCE
DAMAGING WINDS AND HEAVY RAINFALL (SEE DAY ONE EXCESSIVE RAINFALL
OUTLOOK). 

TEMPS STARTING OUT EXTREMELY MILD WHERE STRONG WINDS ALOFT ARE
ALREADY MIXING DOWN TO THE SURFACE (NOTE 70 DEGREES AT TYS AT 3 AM
EDT). THUS...I NUDGED MAX TEMP GRID UP TO THE WARMER GFS MOS HIGHS 
WHICH SHOULD STAY A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR TODAY (CHA - 
88...TYS - 87...AND TRI - 82).

ONE FINAL CONCERN...LOW AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES WITH STRONG WINDS
WHICH COULD BE VERY NEAR RED FLAG CRITERIA FOR SMOKY MTN DISTRICT. 
WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS IN OUR HWO PRODUCT FOR NOW...AND LET DAY SHIFT 
MONITOR OR CHECK WITH FIRE MANAGEMENT FOLKS. WILL SEND OUT OUR SPS
PRODUCT FOR SEVERE THREAT ONE MORE TIME.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...BEHIND STRONG COLD FRONT 
SHOWERS END TUESDAY MORNING WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION DROPPING 
TEMPERATURES 20-25 DEGREES AS COLD HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES IN. TUESDAY 
NIGHT LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S WILL BRING ANOTHER FREEZE TO 
COLDER LOCATIONS AND FROST TO WARMER AREAS WEDNESDAY MORNING. THEN 
QUICK WARMING TREND THROUGH THURSDAY. HIGHS BACK TO NEAR SEASONAL 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY THURSDAY AND A WARM FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
FRIDAY. AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY 
INCREASE WILL ALLOW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP FRIDAY. 
FORECAST AREA REMAINS IN WARM SECTOR SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT SO KEPT 
RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE 
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY PERIOD.
&&

INDICATE LLWS IS PRESENT UNDER A STRONG LLJ THAT WILL TRANSLATE
EAST TONIGHT. WINDS AROUND THE 2 KFT AGL LEVEL WILL BE AROUND 50
KTS...WITH SURFACE WINDS AROUND 10 KTS. DAYTIME MIXING OF THESE
WINDS DOWN TO THE SURFACE WILL RESULT IN WIND GUSTS TOMORROW AROUND
30-35 KTS. THUNDERSTORMS MAY BEGIN TO AFFECT THE TAF SITES LATE IN
THE PERIOD...AND WILL INCLUDE VCTS TO INDICATE THIS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT SUN APR 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO SHORT TERM 
FORECAST. MOSTLY CLEAR AND WARM TONIGHT. STRONG SYSTEM DEVELOPING 
OVER IA TODAY WILL MOVE NE INTO GREAT LAKES ON MONDAY. LOW LEVEL 
S-SW JET WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON. WINDY 
CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN TONIGHT ACROSS THE ELEVATED AREAS AND MIX DOWN 
INTO THE VALLEY EARLY MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BECOME VERY WARM BY 
EARLY AFTERNOON. PREFRONTAL CONVECTION WILL MARCH EAST ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY DURING THE DAY MONDAY AND REACH THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU BY LATE AFTERNOON. THE SEVERE THREAT CONTINUES FOR STRONG 
WINDS WITH ISOLATED TORNADOES POSSIBLE. THE BULK OF THE ACTIVITY IS 
EXPECTED TO BE LINEAR BUT EARLY SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT IS POSSIBLE.
THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AROUND 
MIDNIGHT. TEMPERATURES COOL TO BELOW NORMAL ON TUESDAY. POST FRONTAL 
SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL SLOWLY TAPER ACROSS NE AREAS BY TUE AFTN.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGE BUILDING IN 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. A FRONT 
ENTERS THE REGION ON FRIDAY SO KEPT LOW POPS FOR FRIDAY. WARM FRONT 
TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND LINGERS INTO SUNDAY...SO KEPT 
LOW POPS INTO SUNDAY.  TEMPERATURES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS FOR MOST 
OF THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 031457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SUN APR 3 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. TEMPS 
VARY FROM CHILLY 30S WHERE WINDS ARE CALM TO 40S ELSEWHERE. LOTS OF 
SUNSHINE ON TAP AND WE SHOULD BE ABLE TO REACH THE WARMER GFS MOS 
HIGHS.

KEPT TONIGHT DRY WITH SOME CLOUDS INCREASING LATE AHEAD OF OUR 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. SW GRADIENT REALLY STRENGTHENS IN THE 06Z
TO 12Z MONDAY PERIOD...WHICH LED ME TO GO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE THE
MILDEST MOS MINS. STRENGTH OF LOW LEVEL JET AND SURFACE PRESSURE
GRADIENT WARRANTS THE NEED FOR A WIND ADVISORY...FOR PLATEAU...SW
VA AND MTN AREAS...WITH STRONGEST GUSTS AT ELEVATIONS AT OR ABOVE
3000 FEET. WILL RUN ADVISORY THROUGH 8 PM EDT MONDAY.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DEEPENING AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MS 
VALLEY BACK INTO TX WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE NORTHEAST STATES AS THE 
COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. 
INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY FROM WEST TO EAST WITH 
THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING BOTH AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT WITH SUPERCELLS POSSIBLE AND A LINE OF STORMS FOLLOWING AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT MONDAY NIGHT. WIND ADVISORY FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL 
CONTINUE AT LEAST TO 00Z TUESDAY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT AND MAY HAVE TO 
BE EXTENDED INTO MONDAY EVENING. SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE 
WITH 24 HOUR RAINFALL AMOUNTS FROM MONDAY TO TUESDAY MORNING OF ONE 
TO TWO INCHES AND ONE HOUR FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES OF AROUND 1.5 
INCHES. MODELS FASTER WITH MONDAYS SYSTEM SO DROPPED RAIN CHANCES 
LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. MOST OF RAIN SHOWERS OVER EARLY 
TUESDAY EXCEPT ACROSS NE. TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT HIGH 
PRESSURE BRINGS BRIEF COOLER AND DRIER PERIOD. THURSDAY CLOUDS 
INCREASE AHEAD OF NEW DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
MAIN BAND OF PRECIPITATION TO STAY TO THE NORTH OVER OHIO VALLEY BUT 
AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY AS FORECAST AREA STAYS SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT.

&&

CONTINUE AT LEAST TO 00Z TUESDAY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT AND MAY HAVE
TO BE EXTENDED INTO MONDAY EVENING. SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE
WITH 24 HOUR RAINFALL AMOUNTS FROM MONDAY TO TUESDAY MORNING OF
ONE TO TWO INCHES AND ONE HOUR FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES OF
AROUND 1.5 INCHES. MODELS FASTER WITH MONDAYS SYSTEM SO DROPPED
RAIN CHANCES LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. MOST OF RAIN SHOWERS
OVER EARLY TUESDAY EXCEPT ACROSS NE. TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
WEDNESDAY NIGHT HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS BRIEF COOLER AND DRIER PERIOD.
THURSDAY CLOUDS INCREASE AHEAD OF NEW DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS. MAIN BAND OF PRECIPITATION TO STAY TO THE NORTH
OVER OHIO VALLEY BUT AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY AS FORECAST AREA STAYS SOUTH
OF THE WARM FRONT.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHOWER ACTIVITY OVER EXTREME

WILL ALSO DECREASE RAPIDLY TONIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES

TEMPERATURE ...MAINLY IN THE MID 30S TONIGHT. SW WINDS WILL INCREASE 
BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON WITH A GOOD WARM UP TO THE 70S. AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE THE GREAT LAKES SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL. COLD FRONT WILL EXTEND 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY SOUTHWEST INTO TEXAS. THE FRONT WILL MOVE 
EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY. STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE FRONT MONDAY AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT. A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS IS EXPECTED LATE MONDAY WITH THE MAIN 
THREATS BEING DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. ISOLATED TORNADOES 
POSSIBLE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT TRACKS 
THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES ON MONDAY NIGHT WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE ARRIVES. IT LOOKS 
FAVORABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT...COULD SEE STRONG STORMS OR 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ON MONDAY NIGHT. MODELS INDICATING LINGERING 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA...SO KEPT LOW POPS 
FOR EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT. RIDGE BUILDING IN SHOULD BRING DRY WEATHER 
FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON FRIDAY SO 
KEPT LOW POPS FOR FRIDAY. WARM FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY SO KEPT LOW POPS FOR SATURDAY AS WELL.

FXUS64 KMRX 021436
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT SAT APR 2 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. LIMITED MOISTURE BUT VERY STEEP 
LAPSE RATES OVER NE AREAS INTO THIS AFTN. LEFT ISOLATED SHOWERS IN 
FORECAST FOR THOSE AREAS. WINDS WILL INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON. VALLEY 
LOCATIONS WILL SEE SPEED APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA AND IF WARRANTED 
THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE EXPANDED TO THE VALLEYS OF EAST TN. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW 
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WILL PASS SE ACROSS NRN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE DAYBREAK. COLD 500 MB TEMPS (-24 TO -29 
DEGS C) AND LOW FREEZING LEVEL HAVE ALLOWED SMALL HAIL TO OCCUR 
FRIDAY EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. MOST RECENT REPORT WAS PEA TO DIME 
SIZE HAIL IN ONEIDA WITH A PASSING TSRA. SHORT TERM FORECAST COVERS 
THIS CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION.

WESTERLY WINDS ALREADY INCREASING INTO THE 15 TO 30 MPH WITH GUSTS 
UP TO 40 MPH...SO ALLOWED OUR WIND ADVISORY TO GO INTO EFFECT WITH 
THE MORNING ZONE PACKAGE.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK WITH SOME LINGERING 
SHOWERS THIS MORNING LIMITED TO NE AREAS. SNOW SHOWERS NOT MUCH OF A 
THREAT GIVEN LATEST SURFACE AND RUC MODEL TEMPS. 

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ACROSS PLATEAU AND SE TN/SW NC TODAY...AND I 
TRENDED WITH THE SIMILAR MOS HIGHS. CLEARING TONIGHT WITH DECREASING 
WINDS...WITH A BLEND OF MOS MINS CHOSEN OVER COLDER LOWS.  

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS 
WARMING AND DRYING TREND TO THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND INCREASING SOUTH TO 
SOUTHWEST WINDS. DEEPENING AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND COLD FRONT THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY SOUTHWEST INTO 
TEXAS WILL MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY AND TO THE EAST COAST BY 
TUESDAY. STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT MONDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. A LINE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS IS POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY WITH THE MAIN THREATS BEING 
DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. ISOLATED TORNADOES POSSIBLE. TUESDAY 
SHOWERS DECREASE BEHIND FRONT AND MUCH COOLER ABOUT 20 DEGREES. HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH WARMING TREND. A 
NEW SYSTEM BRINGS LOW PRESSURE AREA AND COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. 
&&

NORTHERN AREA BUT RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD REMAIN RELATIVELY LOW. 
FREEZING LEVEL WILL REMAIN ABOVE 3000 FEET SO SNOW FALL WILL BE 
LIMITED TO THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS WERE A QUICK INCH OR TWO IS 
POSSIBLE.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. UPPER 
JET AXIS SHIFTS NE ON SATURDAY. LARGE SURFACE LOW DEEPENS ALONG THE 
NE U.S. COAST. WESTERLY WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG ON SATURDAY ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO NEAR 
NORMAL. UPPER HEIGHTS RISE SAT NGT AND SUNDAY AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA. WARM TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES SUNDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.  A COLD FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON 
MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE ARRIVES. IT LOOKS 
FAVORABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT...COULD SEE STRONG STORMS ON 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MODELS INDICATING LINGERING MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA...SO KEPT LOW POPS FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT. RIDGE BUILDING IN SHOULD BRING DRY WEATHER FOR 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
458 AM EDT FRI APR 1 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLOUDS HANGING AROUND THIS MORNING 
WITH CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT OVER THE TN VALLEY. LATEST TEMPS WERE 
HOLDING IN THE MID AND UPPER 30S OVER NRN PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY 
AREAS...SO DROPPED THE FREEZE WARNING FOR THOSE AREAS. A FEW COLD 
SPOTS OVER SW VA AND NE TN...EVEN THOUGH CLOUDS LINGER THERE AS 
WELL...BUT SOME LOCATIONS MAY EXPERIENCE A HARD FREEZE BY DAYBREAK.

QPF IS PROGGED TO BE QUITE LIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS 
LOOK GOOD FOR TODAY. SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX TONIGHT MAY GENERATE SOME 
AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN...OR POSSIBLY SNOW OVER NE TN AND SW VA. 
PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT...WITH 
LITTLE CHANGES MADE. ANY SNOW ACCUMULATION LOOKS QUITE MINIMAL.

CLOUD COVER SHOULD INHIBIT REACHING THE WARMER MOS HIGHS AGAIN FOR 
TODAY...SO I STAYED CLOSE TO OR JUST BELOW THE COOLER HIGHS. MODELS 
DIFFER SLIGHTLY TONIGHT ON 850 MB TEMPS...AND A MOS BLEND WAS CLOSER 
TO PREVIOUS GRIDS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...PERSISTENT EASTERN
TROUGH FINALLY MOVES TO THE NORTHEAST SATURDAY TAKING LIGHT
PRECIPITATION WITH IT. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW EARLY ONLY
EXTREME NORTH. BRISK NW FLOW AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. MAY NEED
WIND ADVISORY HIGHER ELEVATIONS TOMORROW. FOLLOWED CLOSER TO COOLER
MAV GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL KEEP SKIES PARTLY
CLOUDY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT SATURDAY
NIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S. A STRONG WARMING TREND
SUNDAY. DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS MONDAY WILL MOVE INTO THE
TN VALLEY LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH
TUESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES OUT OF THE MS VALLEY THROUGH THE OHIO
VALLEY INTO THE NE STATES. STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE WARM TEMPERATURES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT THEN A
FEW DEGREES COOLER TUESDAY. COOLER TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY BEHIND FRONT WITH HIGH PRESSURE MOVING IN.

845 PM EDT THU MAR 31 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED ALONG 
THE SOUTH CAROLINA COAST...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH 
OF IT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SOME VERY LIGHT PRECIP OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA 
THIS EVENING...WITH SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT PRECIP FURTHER UPSTREAM 
OVER NORTHERN MIDDLE TN AND WESTERN KY. WITH A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH SLOWLY MOVING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...THINK IT 
WOULD BE BEST TO KEEP A LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE FORECAST 
AREAWIDE. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILE 
WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW IN AREAS THAT FALL CLOSE TO 
THE FREEZING MARK. WITH AN EXTENSIVE LAYER OF CLOUDS EXPECTED TO 
LINGER BENEATH A MID-LEVEL STABLE LAYER TONIGHT...THINK THAT TEMPS 
SHOULD HAVE A TOUGH TIME FALLING MUCH BELOW THE CURRENT READINGS 
(ESPECIALLY BELOW THE CURRENT DEWPOINTS WITH NOT MUCH DRY AIR 
ADVECTION EXPECTED). WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE FREEZE WARNING FOR 
OVERNIGHT SINCE TEMPS IN SOME AREAS ARE ALREADY CLOSE TO FREEZING... 
AND SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS SOME OCCASIONAL BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS 
FURTHER UPSTREAM OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION 
SOME SMALL POPS EVERYWHERE...AND TO REMOVE ANY EVENING WORDING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT THU MAR 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGING 
NE THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING. PATCHES OF LIGHT RAIN....SLEET AND 
SNOW WILL TAPER OFF AS TROUGH CONTINUES TO MOVE AWAY FROM THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATION. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST 
OVERNIGHT. LIGHT NORTHWEST FLOW WILL USHER IN WEAK COLD AIR 
ADVECTION. TEMPERATURES OFF TO A COLD START DONT HAVE FAR TO FALL TO 
REACH FREEZING BY FRIDAY MORNING. THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE ARE 
NOT CONSIDERED FOR A FREEZE WARNING AT THIS TIME OF YEAR. WIDESPREAD 
FREEZING TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
MRX CWA. THE SOUTHERN HALF MAY SEE LOCALIZED HARD FREEZES IN THE 
RURAL AREAS. THE UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO SHIFT NE ON FRI. A 
STRENGTHENING UPPER JET SHIFTS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY DRIVING A 
WEAK SURFACE TROUGH INTO THE AREA BY FRIDAY EVENING. ANOTHER ROUND 
OF PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE THROUGH FROM SW-NE ON FRI. THE RAIN WILL 
MIX WITH OR CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FRIDAY 
EVENING. THE JET AXIS SHIFTS NE EARLY SATURDAY AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO NEAR 
NORMAL BY SAT AFTN.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
TRACKING THROUGH THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED 
SO KEPT THE HIGHEST IN THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE CWA FOR SUNDAY 
AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  A COLD FRONT ENTER THE REGION ON MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY 
WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE ARRIVES. IT LOOKS FAVORABLE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT...COULD SEE STRONG STORMS ON MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY. MODELS INDICATING LINGERING MOISTURE ACROSS THE EASTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA...SO ADDED LOW POPS FOR THE NORTH.  HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVING BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY.

605 
FXUS64 KMRX 310644
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 AM EDT THU MAR 31 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH OVER THE REGION WITH 
A WEAK SHORT WAVE PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW DURING THE 
SHORT TERM.  MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING 
AND POSITION OF THE WAVE AND CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW.  BELIEVE MAIN BIT 
OF ENERGY WITH THE WAVE SHOULD TRACK TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST.  WITH 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE AND WEAK LIFT...EXPECT OCCASIONAL 
PATCHES OF DRIZZLE/SPRINKLES AND POSSIBLY AN ISOLATED LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWER.  BEST CHANCE OF RAINFALL WILL BE OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  LOW CLOUDS WILL STAY 
OVER THE AREA...LIMITING HEATING AND KEEPING TEMPERATURES BELOW 
NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD.  WITH COLD OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 
MOUNTAINS...ANY NIGHTTIME PRECIP COULD BE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS SOLUTIONS BEGINNING 
TO CONVERGE A BIT...SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE HAS RISEN CLOSER TO 
AVERAGE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD.  WEAK IMPULSE TO AFFECT THE AREA 
FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL CARRY LOW POPS BOTH PERIODS. 
THERMAL PROFILES LOOK COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME SNOW AT LEAST IN THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...BUT PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT.  
WEEKEND LOOKS MOSTLY DRY...THEN NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING 
EARLY IN THE WEEK. MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT THAT A SIGNIFICANT 
COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP THROUGH THE AREA SOMETIME DURING OR AROUND THE 
TUESDAY TIME FRAME.  WILL TRY TO REFINE TIMING OF THIS A 
BIT...LOWERING POPS MONDAY TO SLIGHT CHANCE AND RAISING TUESDAY TO 
LIKELY.  THIS STILL LOOKS LIKE A FAIRLY DYNAMIC SYSTEM...SO WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION THREAT OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS IN HWO.  WILL 
KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE FORECAST TO BE MOVING IN BEHIND 
THE FRONT.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             54  39  61  43  68 /  20  10  30  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  34  59  42  64 /  30  10  30  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  34  59  41  64 /  30  10  30  30  10

INDICATING THAT AREAS OF DRIZZLE WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP OVERNIGHT 
AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. THUS... 
WILL PLAN TO MENTION AREAS OF DRIZZLE AND FOG OVERNIGHT. ALTHOUGH 
TEMPS SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT... 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SEEM TO INDICATE THAT THE PRECIP INITIATION REGION 
SHOULD BE TOO WARM TO HAVE ANY ICE NUCLEATION FOR THE FORMATION OF 
SNOW. HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE SOME AREAS OF FREEZING DRIZZLE ABOVE 
2500 FEET WHERE TEMPS COULD FALL BELOW FREEZING. SINCE PRECIP 
AMOUNTS SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT OVERNIGHT...WILL PLAN TO MENTION 
FREEZING DRIZZLE IN THE ZONES WITHOUT ANY ADVISORY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CONFIDENCE REMAINS 
LOW THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM AS MODELS CONTINUE TO SUFFER FROM 
POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY AND POOR MODEL-TO-MODEL AGREEMENT. AS A 
RESULT...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. 
APPEARS MOST SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION IN THE MONDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY TIME FRAME. HOWEVER...EVEN 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...TIMING REMAINS UNCERTAIN AND GOING ANY HIGHER 
THAN HIGH CHANCE POPS IN ANY SPECIFIC PERIOD IS DUBIOUS. WENT WITH 
DRY FORECAST FOR NOW FOR THE WEDNESDAY PERIOD NEXT WEEK. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO MAV/MEX GUIDANCE WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF MONDAY AND TUESDAY MAX TEMPS WHICH WERE UNDERCUT 
SLIGHTLY BASED ON TRENDS IN THE GEFS ENSEMBLES.

1015 AM EDT WED MAR 30 2011

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO FIRST PERIOD. DEEP CONVECTION HAS 
MOVED OFF TO THE EAST THIS MORNING. MID LEVELS ARE DRYING OUT FOR 
THE REMAINDER OF THIS AFTERNOON. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH WILL MOVE 
EAST ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NW 
BEHIND THE TROUGH. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR STEADY FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF TODAY. SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH KY THIS 
AFTERNOON. PRECIPITATION CHANCES STILL REMAIN FAIRLY HIGH. CHARACTER 
OF PCPN WILL BE CONFINED TO LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH 
THROUGH THE MRX CWA DURING THE MORNING AND POSSIBLY EARLY AFTERNOON 
HOURS AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE REGION.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL HAVE POPS EARLY IN THE DAY AT 100 WITH POPS DECREASING 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER FAR EASTERN AND 
NORTHERN AREAS THIS EVENING...BUT OVERALL WILL SEE DRY CONDITIONS 
OVERNIGHT.  WILL KEEP TEMPS NEAR GUIDANCE.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODEL 
AGREEMENT/CONSISTENCY VERY POOR...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE MUCH LOWER 
THAN USUAL RIGHT FROM THE START OF THE PERIOD.  GFS SEEMS TO BE AN 
OUTLIER TO THE WEST WITH THE EAST COAST LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WHILE 
NAM MAY BE TOO FAR EAST/FAST...SO WILL LEAN TOWARD A GFS/NAM/SREF 
BLEND THU AND KEEP POPS ON THE LOW SIDE.  TIMING OF WEAK IMPULSES 
THU NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT TIME PERIOD ALSO PROBLEMATIC...SO 
THINK KEEPING SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS THOSE PERIODS BEST FOR 
NOW.  MAY BE SOME HIGHER ELEVATION SNOW DURING THE EARLY PERIODS 
GIVEN EXPECTED THERMAL PROFILES...BUT FOR NOW AM KEEPING POPS/QPF 
LOW.  WILL GO DRY SATURDAY AND MOST OF THE AREA SUNDAY. HIGHER 
CONFIDENCE THAT A SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE REGION LATE IN 
THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH DETAILS STILL HAZY..SO WILL BROADBRUSH SOME 
CHANCE POPS.

FXUS64 KMRX 291905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT TUE MAR 29 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE 
STRETCHED FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS SW THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY TO THE MID ATLANTIC. A STATIONARY FRONT LIES ALONG THE 
GULF COAST WEST INTO TEXAS. ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA HIGH PRESSURE 
HAS HELPED CLEAR SKIES ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA EXCEPT THE 
EXTREME SOUTH. DRIER AIR WAS NOTED NORTH WITH DEW POINTS IN THE 20S 
AND 30S WITH 40S SOUTH. A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH LIES OVER THE 
EASTERN TN VALLEY. QUIET PATTERN THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE SHORT LIVED 
AS CLOUDS INCREASE RAPIDLY TONIGHT AS SHORT WAVE TROUGH DIGS SOUTH 
AND EAST THROUGH MID MS AND OHIO VALLEYS THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS. 
LOW PRESSURE RIDES NE ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE SOUTH AND GETS 
CAUGHT UP INTO INVERTED TROUGH. ELEVATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE LATE 
TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MAINLY SOUTH OF I-40. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 
ABOUT ONE INCH ON AVERAGE NEXT 24 HOURS BUT HIGHER AMOUNTS WITH ANY 
THUNDERSTORMS. THIS MAY CAUSE NEW RISES ON SMALL STREAMS AND 
NUISANCE FLOODING IN URBAN AREAS. LOWS TONIGHT WILL LIKELY COME 
EARLY AND THEN STEADY OR SLOWLY RISE AS CLOUDS INCREASE DURING THE 
EVENING. SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY IN THE MORNING 
WITH DECREASING POPS DURING THE AFTERNOON. FOLLOWED THE LOWER MET 
GUIDANCE OR A FEW DEGREES LOWER FOR HIGHS DUE TO CLOUDS AND RAIN 
KEEPING TEMPERATURES DOWN.       

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE DEEPEN ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION THROUGH 
THE BEGINNING OF THE MEDIUM RANGE FORECAST.  A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVE 
WILL DIVE INTO THE UPPER TROUGH WITH ANOTHER WAVE RIDING UP THE 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL REMAIN 
SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST...BUT WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE POPS 
ESPECIALLY FOR THE EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. ENOUGH 
COLD AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA TO PRODUCE A MIXTURE OF RAIN/SNOW 
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR EASTERN 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND THURSDAY NIGHT. LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.

LAST IN SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING. AGAIN...VERTICAL PROFILES COLD 
ENOUGH FOR RAIN/SNOW FOR THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND FAR EAST TENNESSEE. 

UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EAST SEABOARD LIFTS NORTHEAST FOR THE WEEKEND 
ALLOWING RIDING ALOFT AND RETURN OF WARMER AIR FOR LATE SATURDAY 
INTO SUNDAY AS WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTHEAST. WILL CONTINUE WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO LIFTING OVER WARM 
FRONT...ESPECIALLY FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING.  

A FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT SHORT-WAVE WILL EJECT EAST-NORTHEAST ALONG WITH
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. COLD FRONT WILL PULL 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY 
MORNING. AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. WE WILL NEED TO MONITOR THIS POTENTIAL 
FOR THE FORECAST AREA.

&&

INTO OUR AREA FROM THE NORTH WILL GIVE WAY TO ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTHWEST.  SHOULD BE DRY TODAY...BUT 
RAIN WILL ARRIVE TONIGHT AS INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH DEVELOPS INTO 
OUR AREA AND FAVORABLE JET DYNAMICS SET UP.  WILL CARRY NEAR 100 
POPS ALL ZONES.  SOUNDINGS LOOK MORE FAVORABLE FOR SOME ELEVATED 
THUNDER SOUTHERN HALF...SO WILL INCLUDE IN THE FORECAST. MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT AND 
CONFIDENCE LOW FOR THE EXTENDED.  SHOULD BE IN AN UNSETTLED PATTERN 
EARLY ON.  ON WEDNESDAY...SHOWERS WILL BE EXITING THE AREA FROM WEST 
TO EAST THROUGH AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY.  SOME MODELS 
MOVE A SHORT WAVE THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY.  NOT 
CONFIDENT WITH THIS FEATURE AND HAVE TRENDED POPS DOWN A BIT.  A 
SERIES OF WEAK WAVES TRACK THROUGH THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
EARLY SATURDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW ON THESE AS WELL WITH TRACK POSSIBLY 
STAYING TO OUR NORTH.  WILL CONTINUE 20 TO 30 POPS FOR THIS PERIOD.  
WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE AREA FOR 
MONDAY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  65  53  62  47  64 /  10 100  80  30  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    62  48  58  44  58 /  10 100  80  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN            63  47  58  44  58 /  10 100  80  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   60  45  54  40  53 /  10 100  90  20  30 

&&

     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST 
     GREENE...SULLIVAN...WASHINGTON TN.

     FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...

TONIGHT...WHICH MAY INHIBIT FOG DEVELOPMENT. WILL CARRY MVFR
VIS...BUT CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH FOR VIS. MAY ALSO SEE SOME MVFR CIGS

WITH LOWERING CIGS.

306 
FXUS64 KMRX 290125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT MON MAR 28 2011

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS EXITING THE CWA. SHOULD HAVE A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY 
AND COLD TEMPERATURES TONIGHT. WILL LEAVE THE ONGOING WARNINGS AND 
ADVISORY AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. 
WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING/MIDNIGHT WORDING...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...LOW CLOUDS ARE HANGING AROUND 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON BUT ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY GET 
SCOURED OUT THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS AS DRIER AIR MASS WORKS IN FROM 
THE NW. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. CLOUDS HAVE HELD HIGH TEMPERATURES AT MID 
AFTERNOON INTO THE MID 40S TO MID 50S WITH HIGHER ELEVATIONS ONLY IN 
THE UPPER 30S. AS SKIES CLEAR TONIGHT AND WINDS ARE LIGHT FROST IS 
EXPECTED TO FORM. ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL ALSO BE IMPORTANT 
FOR FROST. SOME FOG WILL LIKELY BE OBSERVED ESPECIALLY NEAR MOISTURE 
SOURCES...LAKES AND RIVERS. ISSUING FREEZE WARNING NORTH AND FROST 
ADVISORY SOUTH DUE TO VEGETATION GROWTH FROM THE WARM TEMPERATURES 
EARLIER THIS MONTH. NOT AS CONFIDENT SOUTHERN AREAS FOR MUCH FROST 
WITH CLOUD COVER POSSIBLY LASTING LONGER THERE AND SOME HIGH CLOUDS 
COMING IN LATER TONIGHT.     

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN FEATURE THROUGH 
THE MEDIUM TERM FORECAST WILL BE AN UPPER TROUGH DEEPENING ACROSS 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL DIVE 
INTO THIS DEVELOPING UPPER TROUGH. 

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...A SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND GULF COAST STATES WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH SETTING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER ROUGH OF SHOWERS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH ENOUGH ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE A CHANCE 
OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.

THIS WAVE WILL BE QUICKLY REPLACED BY ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVING 
ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY PRODUCING A ROUND OF SHOWERS. A STRONG SHORT-WAVE MOVES 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.

UPPER TROUGH BEGINS TO LIFT NORTHEAST FOR THE WEEKEND WITH THE 
RETURN OF WARMER TEMPERATURES FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. MODELS SHOW A
COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE AREA FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. ECMWF
AND GFS DIFFER IN TIMING. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE END OF THE MEDIUM RANGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             39  65  53  62  47 /   0  20  90  80  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  36  64  48  58  44 /   0  10  90  80  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  63  48  58  43 /   0  20  90  80  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  60  42  56  40 /   0  10  90  90  30 

&&

NC...FROST ADVISORY FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FREEZE WARNING FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST 
     GREENE...SULLIVAN...WASHINGTON TN.

     FROST ADVISORY FROM 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ TO 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ 
     TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...

844 
FXUS64 KMRX 280749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EDT MON MAR 28 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FAST MOVING SHORT WAVE WILL EXIT 
THE AREA EARLY TODAY...AND ANY LINGERING PRECIP WILL QUICKLY END.
WILL CONTINUE THE SPS FOR A FEW MORE HOURS TO ADDRESS SOME MINOR SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL
REMAIN TO OUR NORTH WITH THE NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT WELL TO OUR
SOUTH THROUGH THE PERIOD. PERSISTENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL LINGER
THROUGH MUCH OF TODAY...AND CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW MUCH
CLEARING WILL OCCUR LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT AS STUBBORN LOW CLOUDS
MAY BE HARD TO GET RID OF. FOR NOW WILL SHOW AT LEAST SOME CLEARING
ESPECIALLY NORTH FURTHER FROM THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. HOW MUCH
CLEARING IS OF COURSE CRITICAL FOR LOW TEMPS TONIGHT. MAY BE COLD
ENOUGH FOR A FREEZE WARNING NORTHERN COUNTIES IF CLEARING
OCCURS...BUT LOOKS BORDERLINE SO NO ISSUANCE AT THIS TIME GIVEN
UNCERTAINTY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WENT A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE 
GFS FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. THE ATMOSPHERE APPEARS RELUCTANT TO 
ALLOW MORE SPRINGLIKE WEATHER TO BLOSSOM ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. 
WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF RIDGING UNTIL LATER IN THE WEEKEND. WE 
MIGHT SEE A LITTLE SUNSHINE ON TUESDAY AS THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS 
THE ARRIVAL OF A SHORT WAVE TROF DUE INTO THE REGION LATER TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THIS FEATURE MAY HAVE SOME INSTABILITY 
AVAILABLE FOR CONVECTION SO CONTINUED WITH MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR MAINLY THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
CATEGORICAL POPS LATER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. SYSTEM 
DEPARTS LATE AFTERNOON WITH A BRIEF PAUSE IN THE ACTION WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY UPPER TROF AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION WITH CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AS SEVERAL IMPULSES 
ROTATE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE DEEPENING UPPER TROF. APPLIED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR THE EXTREME NORTHEASTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA AS 
A FINAL SHORTWAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST IN CLIPPER FASHION ACROSS THE 
UPPER OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS LATER FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. DURING THE PERIOD THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING 
THE HIGHEST TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS 
SO APPLIED WHERE NECESSARY. ECMWF/GFS DIFFER ON LATE WEEKEND 
DEPICTION WITH THE ECMWF MUCH LESS OPTIMISTIC ON FINALLY ALLOWING 
FOR BUILDING HEIGHTS AND A WARMER SCENARIO FOR SUNDAY. WENT WITH THE 
PROGRESSIVE GFS WHICH MOVES THE OFFENDING COLD UPPER TROF OUT TO SEA 
FASTER THAN THE ECMWF.


&&

593 
FXUS64 KMRX 280140
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT SUN MAR 27 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING RAIN MOVING INTO THE CWA. WILL LEAVE 
CURRENT POPS AS IS. WITH THE FAST MOVING TROUGH...ONLY EXPECTING 
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. MOST AREAS SHOULD BE BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
REMOVE EVENING AND MIDNIGHT WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A FAST-MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CROSS THE AREA 
TONIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP...WITH SNOW IN SOME 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE MODELS SHOW AN AREA OF MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS 
PROVIDING GOOD LIFT BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. THE LATEST MODEL SOUNDINGS 
HAVE COME IN QUITE A BIT COOLER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WITH THE 
FREEZING LEVEL DROPPING TO AROUND 2 KFT ACROSS THE NORTH BEFORE THE 
PRECIP ENDS. TEMPERATURE PROFILES SHOW A DEEP NEAR-FREEZING 
ISOTHERMAL LAYER...SO THE POTENTIAL FOR ERROR IS HIGH AND CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW. SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS LOOK TO BE ISOLATED TO THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN...BUT COULD APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA 
OF OVER 2 INCHES. AT THIS TIME A SPS WILL BE ISSUED TO ADDRESS THE 
SNOW POTENTIAL. PRECIP SHOULD END QUICKLY MONDAY MORNING ONCE THE 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES TO THE EAST...WITH DECREASING CLOUDS THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A BREAK IN THE SUCCESSION OF SYSTEMS MONDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH
PRESSURE EXTENDING SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO THE
CAROLINA COAST. LOWS WILL BE NEAR FREEZING NE TN AND SW VA AND
HIGHER ELEVATIONS EASTERN MOUNTAINS. MAY NEED TO ISSUE A FREEZE
WARNING BY THE NEXT FORECAST CYCLE IF SKIES STAY CLEAR WITH NEXT
MODEL RUN AND ENOUGH AREA WILL BE BELOW FREEZING LATE MONDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY TUESDAY. CLOUDS INCREASE TUESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE ALONG
FRONT IN TEXAS AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING OUT OF THE ROCKIES MOVES
INTO THE PLAINS AND THEN OHIO VALLEY BY TUESDAY EVENING. LOW
PRESSURE AREA AND COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS BRING
FRONT THROUGH AROUND 18Z WEDNESDAY. THINK THIS MAY BE TOO FAST SO
HAVE INCREASED POPS LATER IN THE DAY. AIRMASS UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY. BRIEF DRYING WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THEN
MORE SHORTWAVE ENERGY COMES THROUGH TROUGH THAT SETS UP ACROSS THE
EASTERN STATES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. TROUGH EXITS THIS WEEKEND WITH
FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL AND HIGHER PRESSURE WITH WARMER DRIER
AIRMASS RAISING TEMPERATURES TO MORE SEASONAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  59  41  66  51 /  80  20   0  30  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  56  39  63  47 /  80  40   0  20  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  56  37  64  47 /  80  20   0  20  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              34  52  31  61  42 /  80  70   0  20  60

744 
FXUS64 KMRX 271917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EDT SUN MAR 27 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A FAST-MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CROSS THE AREA 
TONIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP...WITH SNOW IN SOME 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE MODELS SHOW AN AREA OF MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS 
PROVIDING GOOD LIFT BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. THE LATEST MODEL SOUNDINGS 
HAVE COME IN QUITE A BIT COOLER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WITH THE 
FREEZING LEVEL DROPPING TO AROUND 2 KFT ACROSS THE NORTH BEFORE THE 
PRECIP ENDS. TEMPERATURE PROFILES SHOW A DEEP NEAR-FREEZING 
ISOTHERMAL LAYER...SO THE POTENTIAL FOR ERROR IS HIGH AND CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW. SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS LOOK TO BE ISOLATED TO THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN...BUT COULD APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA 
OF OVER 2 INCHES. AT THIS TIME A SPS WILL BE ISSUED TO ADDRESS THE 
SNOW POTENTIAL. PRECIP SHOULD END QUICKLY MONDAY MORNING ONCE THE 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES TO THE EAST...WITH DECREASING CLOUDS THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A BREAK IN THE SUCCESSION OF SYSTEMS MONDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH
PRESSURE EXTENDING SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO THE
CAROLINA COAST. LOWS WILL BE NEAR FREEZING NE TN AND SW VA AND
HIGHER ELEVATIONS EASTERN MOUNTAINS. MAY NEED TO ISSUE A FREEZE
WARNING BY THE NEXT FORECAST CYCLE IF SKIES STAY CLEAR WITH NEXT
MODEL RUN AND ENOUGH AREA WILL BE BELOW FREEZING LATE MONDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY TUESDAY. CLOUDS INCREASE TUESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE ALONG
FRONT IN TEXAS AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING OUT OF THE ROCKIES MOVES
INTO THE PLAINS AND THEN OHIO VALLEY BY TUESDAY EVENING. LOW
PRESSURE AREA AND COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS BRING
FRONT THROUGH AROUND 18Z WEDNESDAY. THINK THIS MAY BE TOO FAST SO
HAVE INCREASED POPS LATER IN THE DAY. AIRMASS UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY. BRIEF DRYING WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THEN
MORE SHORTWAVE ENERGY COMES THROUGH TROUGH THAT SETS UP ACROSS THE
EASTERN STATES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. TROUGH EXITS THIS WEEKEND WITH
FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL AND HIGHER PRESSURE WITH WARMER DRIER
AIRMASS RAISING TEMPERATURES TO MORE SEASONAL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  59  41  66  51 /  80  20   0  30  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  56  39  63  47 /  80  40   0  20  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  56  37  64  47 /  80  20   0  20  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              34  52  31  61  42 /  80  70   0  20  60

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
109 PM EDT SUN MAR 27 2011

.AVIATION...
CLOUDS ARE HOLDING IN TIGHT ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. SOME
MODEL DATA SUGGESTS THAT THE CLOUDS WILL LIFT TO VFR THIS
EVENING...BUT THIS SEEMS DOUBTFUL AND WILL GO WITH A MORE
PESSIMISTIC CEILING FORECAST. EXPECT OVERCAST MVFR OR IFR CEILINGS
TO PERSIST PAST MIDNIGHT. AN UPPER TROUGH PASSES BY QUICKLY
OVERNIGHT...BRINGING A 4-5 HOUR WINDOW OF PRECIP THAT WILL LOWER
CIGS TO IFR AND VIS TO MVFR. SOME LIFR CONDITIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE
BUT PROBABLY NOT LAST LONG ENOUGH TO MENTION IN TAFS YET. THE
TROUGH PASSES TOMORROW MORNING...ALLOWING CIGS TO RISE TO MVFR
AGAIN.

MOISTURE THROUGH THE DAY...ESPECIALLY IN SOUTHERN AREAS. THE NAM IS
MORE PESSIMISTIC...KEEPING CLOUDS IN PLACE. GIVEN SATELLITE
TRENDS...WILL GO WITH SOME PARTIAL CLEARING THIS AFTERNOON. ONLY
SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST WILL BE NEEDED FOR THE UPDATE.

294 
FXUS64 KMRX 270815
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT SUN MAR 27 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE 
PULLING AWAY TODAY...BUT SOME FAST MOVING SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL 
SWING ACROSS THE AREA LATE TONIGHT.  MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL...BUT SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS ESPECIALLY TONIGHT.  
NAM KEEPS MOST PRECIP SOUTH TONIGHT...AND IS A BIT COLDER...WHILE 
GFS IS WARMER AND SPREADS MORE PRECIP NORTH.  GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY...WILL LEAN TOWARD A COMPROMISE...WITH CHANCE POPS NORTH 
AND LIKELY SOUTH AND CENTRAL LATE TONIGHT.  FREEZING LEVELS LIKELY 
TO BE LOW ENOUGH FOR SOME SNOW NORTHERN ZONES ESPECIALLY HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM. LOOKS LIKE SUB FREEZING TEMPS WILL NOT BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH 
IN AREAS WHERE THE FREEZE WARNING PROGRAM HAS STARTED TO WARRANT ANY 
FREEZE WARNINGS AT THIS TIME.     

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...QUITE AN ACTIVE PERIOD WITH 
AT LEAST THREE SYSTEMS GENERATING PRECIP IN FAST FLOW ALOFT. WEAK 
SHORT WAVE RAPIDLY MOVES AWAY TO THE EAST DURING THE MORNING ON 
MONDAY BUT NOT BEFORE PRODUCING A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS IN EXTREME 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS COLD AIR DROPS SOUTH BEHIND THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM TRAVERSING THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THIS MORNING. PRECIP SHOULD 
BE PRETTY MUCH GONE BY AFTERNOON AS THE SYSTEM RAPIDLY DEPARTS. KEPT 
MONDAY NIGHT DRY BUT SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL BE RIPPLING TOWARD THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AGAIN ON TUESDAY. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL ENCOURAGE 
A SURFACE LOW ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY DRAPED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
TIER TO MAKE A MOVE NORTH EAST FROM SOUTHEAST TEXAS TO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AND STAYED WITH A GRADUAL 
INCREASE IN POPS WITH POSSIBLE ISENTROPICALLY LIFTED SHOWERS LATER 
TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. APPLIED HIGHEST POPS 
AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH A SMALL CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION AS THE LOW PULLS A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA. WAS ABLE TO KEEP WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY AS THIS SYSTEM EXITS THE 
FORECAST AREA. BASICALLY KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST 
UNCHANGED DUE TO FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN MODEL SOLUTIONS 
FOR THIS PERIOD. GFS AND ECMWF VERY DISSIMILAR WITH A LATE WORK WEEK 
UPPER TROF SO KEPT SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY NIGHT WHILE MAINTAINING A DRY SATURDAY AS BOTH MODELS 
INDICATE DRIER NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WITH AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE 
APPROACHING FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. HAD TO TRIM SEVERAL 
DEGREES OFF MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  55  42  56  39  63 /  20  60  30   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  40  57  37  64 /  20  60  30   0  20

375 
FXUS64 KMRX 270144
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
944 PM EDT SAT MAR 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING AREA OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA. WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS 
IS. MODELS STILL INDICATING WEAK INSTABILITY ALONG THE SOUTHERN 
ZONES SO LEFT THUNDER IN THE FORECAST...BUT NO NEW SEVERE WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL 
UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
LOW PRESSURE TRACKING FROM THE OZARKS TO THE APPALACHIANS WILL 
SPREAD RAIN ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA TONIGHT. THE WARM FRONT WILL 
REMAIN JUST SOUTH OF OUR AREA...WHILE THE 850 MB FRONT WILL BE NEAR 
THE TN/VA BORDER. SO SURFACE BASED CONVECTION AND THE SEVERE THREAT 
WILL STAY SOUTH...BUT ELEVATED INSTABILITY WILL MEAN A GOOD CHANCE 
OF THUNDER ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. ON THE NORTHERN END...FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS SHOW A DEEP ISOTHERMAL LAYER THAT STAYS 2-4 DEGREES ABOVE 
FREEZING ALL NIGHT...SO NO FROZEN PRECIP ISSUES ARE EXPECTED. ONCE 
THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER TRACKS EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS SUNDAY 
MORNING...DRIER AIR ALOFT MOVES IN AND PRECIP CHANCES WILL TAPER OFF 
FROM WEST TO EAST...ENDING EVERYWHERE IN THE AFTERNOON. PLENTY OF 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL KEEP CLOUDY SKIES OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE 
DAY...AND WENT WITH TEMPERATURES ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
THE GFS AND NAM ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH PULLING ANOTHER WAVE ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING WITH AN INVERTED
SURFACE TROUGH. VERTICAL PROFILE LOOKS GOOD ENOUGH TO PRODUCE A
MIXTURE OF FREEZING RAIN...SLEET...AND SNOW ACROSS PARTS OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND POSSIBLY THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU.

A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
FOR MONDAY...BUT FAST ZONAL FLOW PULLS ANOTHER SYSTEM INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY LATE TUESDAY...TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. A 
NORTHERN STREAM WAVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY HELPS 
PULL A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. INVERTED TROUGH...
ISENTROPIC LIFT...AND DIRECT CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH NORTHERN 
STREAM UPPER JET WILL PRODUCE A GOOD CHANCE-LIKELY POPS. INSTABILITY 
LACKING SO WILL NOT INCLUDE THUNDER.  

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING...SURFACE RIDGING WILL 
PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS. MODELS SHOW A STRONGER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH 
MOVING ACROSS TEXAS INTO THE NORTHERN GULF FOR THE END OF THE MEDIUM 
RANGE. MOST OF THE MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS STAYS SOUTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  54  46  59  40 / 100  30  70  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  52  42  52  38 / 100  40  70  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  51  40  53  37 / 100  30  70  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  49  37  48  31 / 100  70  70  60  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1009 AM EDT SAT MAR 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...
MAIN AREA OF PRECIP ACROSS NORTHERN GA/AL IS OCCURRING JUST NORTH
OF A STATIONARY FRONT. THE RUC SHOWS ISENTROPIC LIFT AND
CONVERGENCE ZONE AROUND 925 MB WITH THIS PRECIP BAND. AS WE GO
THROUGH THE DAY...THIS ZONE OF LIFT MAKES VERY SLOW NORTHWARD
PROGRESS...AND DOES NOT MOVE INTO THE CENTRAL TN VALLEY UNTIL LATE
AFTERNOON. SO THE SOUTHERN AREAS WILL CONTINUE TO SEE THE GREATEST
PRECIP TODAY...WITH VERY LITTLE NORTH AND CENTRAL. WILL ADJUST POPS
WITH THE UPDATE TO SHARPEN THE GRADIENT BETWEEN TYS AND CHA.

499 
FXUS64 KMRX 260756
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EDT SAT MAR 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT FORECAST 
TO REMAIN SOUTH OF OUR AREA AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES ALONG IT.  SHOWERS 
WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREAS...WITH HEAVIEST PRECIP SOUTH WHERE 
FAVORABLE JET DYNAMICS SHOULD ENHANCE PRECIP TODAY.  APPEARS THERE 
MAY BE ENOUGH ELEVATED INSTABILITY FOR SOME THUNDER...BUT SEVERE 
THREAT SHOULD REMAIN MAINLY SOUTH OF OUR AREA IN THE WARM SECTOR.  
ISOLATED FLOODING CANNOT BE RULED OUT ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND PERHAPS 
CENTRAL AREAS...ALTHOUGH AT THIS POINT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT HEAVY 
RAIN WILL BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A FLOOD WATCH.  LOOKS LIKE 
FREEZING LEVELS WILL BE HIGH ENOUGH FOR A MAINLY RAIN EVENT...BUT 
WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SLEET LATE FOR SOME HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW 
VA.   

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE 
GFS FOR THIS PERIOD. FIRST WAVE WILL BE MOVING AWAY SUNDAY MORNING 
AND ADJUSTED POPS BACK THROUGH THE DAY TO ACCOUNT FOR SYSTEM 
DEPARTURE. ECMWF/NAM TRY TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT QPF ON MONDAY WITH A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING RAPIDLY EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. NOT TOO 
CONFIDENT IN SYSTEM'S ABILITY TO PRODUCE PRECIP IN DRIER ENVIRONMENT 
BEHIND LATE WEEKEND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SO KEPT THE FORECAST DRY 
HERE. WAS ABLE TO KEEP A DRY PERIOD GOING RIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING 
AS BRIEF PERIOD OF UPPER RIDGING GIVES WAY TO THE NEXT UPPER TROF 
AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW. GRADUALLY INCREASED POPS TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH MIDNIGHT AS SHORT WAVE TROF PRESSES EAST ACROSS 
THE UPPER MIDWEST WHILE DEEPENING SURFACE LOW DRAGS A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING. TRENDED POPS DOWN 
THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR POSSIBLE TIMING ERRORS IN 
DEPARTURE OF THIS MID LATITUDE CYCLONE. WAS ABLE TO ALLOW FOR 
ANOTHER DRY PERIOD WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING AS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AWAITS YET ANOTHER AMPLIFYING SYSTEM IN 
ACTIVE SPRING PATTERN. ECMWF/GFS A LITTLE DIFFERENT IN DEPICTION OF 
THIS FEATURE WITH THE GFS SLIGHTLY SLOWER AND STRONGER WITH 
DEEPENING UPPER TROF. TRENDED POPS FROM SLIGHT CHANCE ON THURSDAY TO 
MEDIUM CHANCE THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A GRADUAL DECREASING TREND IN POP 
ON FRIDAY. A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY AT THIS DISTANT PERIOD OF 
THE FOERCAST WITH THIS SYSTEM. WILL FINE TUNE DURING THE NEXT COUPLE 
DAYS.

.DISCUSSION...AREA OF LIGHT RAIN EXITING THE CWA...BUT MORE 
WIDESPREAD RAIN IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE LATER TONIGHT. WILL LEAVE 
CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
AN AREA OF RAIN OVER MIDDLE TN ASSOCIATED WITH A 500 MB VORT MAX AND 
UPPER JET STREAK WILL MOVE ACROSS OUR AREA THIS EVENING. THE MODELS 
DO NOT SEEM TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS PRECIP. TEMPS SHOULD 
REMAIN WARM ENOUGH TO PREVENT MUCH FROZEN PRECIP ACCUMULATIONS...BUT 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA COULD SEE A FEW SNOWFLAKES TONIGHT. 

MORE SIGNIFICANT LIFT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT 
AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES. POPS WILL RISE FROM CHANCE THIS 
EVENING TO LIKELY LATE TONIGHT AND CATEGORICAL TOMORROW. AS THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS INTO THE OZARKS...THE STRENGTHENING 40 KT LLJ 
PUSHES THE 850 MB FRONT TO THE TN/VA BORDER...BUT THE SURFACE WARM 
FRONT IS LIKELY TO STAY ACROSS AL/GA. THE RESULTING ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY WILL GIVE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT. SEVERE POTENTIAL SHOULD REMAIN SOUTH OF THE AREA IN 
THE WARM SECTOR. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW REMAINS FAIRLY ZONAL...SO 
FORCING FOR PRECIP WILL BE MAINLY BE ISENTROPIC LIFT AND THETA-E 
ADVECTION IN THE LOW TO MID LEVELS AHEAD OF THE SLOW-MOVING LOW. 
WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS CONTINUING THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...TAPERING OFF ON SUNDAY ONCE THE 850-700 MB TROUGH MOVES EAST 
OF THE MOUNTAINS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. THIS
WEEKENDS SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE AREA WITH WEAK RIDGING SURFACE
AND ALOFT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS. FOR
MONDAY NIGHT...SURFACE RIDGING MOVES EAST ALLOWING FOR RETURN OF
GULF MOISTURE OVER THE MISSISSIPPI AND WEST TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEYS
WITH INCREASING HIGH-MID LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE AND SURFACE WAVE WILL MOVE TOWARD THE OHIO 
AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT PRODUCING 
SHOWERS OVER MUCH OF THE AREA. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE OVER THE 
FAR SOUTHERN SECTIONS. FOR WEDNESDAY...SYSTEM MOVES EAST WITH 
GRADUAL CLEARING OF SKIES FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT.  

ANOTHER STRONGER SYSTEM APPROACHES/MOVES ACROSS THE AREA FOR 
THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 

OVERALL...AN UNSETTLED MEDIUM RANGE WITH A SERIES OF FAST MOVING 
SHORT-WAVES EFFECTING THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR TO SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  56  53  58  38 /  70 100 100  40  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  52  46  55  37 /  50  90 100  50  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  52  45  53  35 /  50  90 100  40  10

778 
FXUS64 KMRX 250811
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EDT FRI MAR 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
EXTEND INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH TODAY.  SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION TONIGHT AND A WARM FRONT WILL BEGIN 
LIFTING NORTH TOWARD THE AREA LATE.  SHOULD SEE QUITE A BIT OF SUN 
TODAY FOR A PERIOD ONCE ANY LINGERING LOW CLOUDS DEPART...BUT CLOUDS 
WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AGAIN LATER IN THE DAY.  BEST CHANCES FOR 
PRECIP WILL BE LATTER PART OF THE NIGHT IN THE SOUTHWEST CLOSER TO 
THE WARM FRONT...SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS THERE. WILL CARRY CHANCE 
CENTRAL AND ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE FAR NORTH IN SW VA.  FREEZING LEVELS 
FORECAST TO BE LOW ENOUGH FOR WINTRY PRECIP TO BE POSSIBLE HIGHER 
TERRAIN IN SW VA...BUT NOT MUCH PRECIP EXPECTED WITH ONLY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP...SO WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWER/SNOW 
SHOWER FOR SOME OF THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.   


.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FORECAST CONFIDENCE RATHER 
LOW LATER IN THIS PERIOD AS NUMEROUS LOWER AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVES 
MOVE RAPIDLY EAST IN FAST NEARLY ZONAL FLOW REGIME. THE FIRST 
FEATURE INDUCES A WAVE ON FRONTAL ZONE OVER THE SOUTHERN TIER LATE 
IN THE WORK WEEK WHICH PULLS A WARM FRONT TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENS 
FOR HIGH PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY WITH A 
POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA INSTABILITY INCREASES IN THE VICINITY OF THE BOUNDARY. ANOTHER 
WAVE DROPS IN LATER SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS COLDER AIR SPILLS 
IN BEHIND THE FRONTAL WAVE. THERE COULD EVEN BE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE SMOKIES SUNDAY NIGHT IN THIS PATTERN. WAS ABLE TO APPLY A 
DRY MONDAY WITH SHORT WAVE RIDGING AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. BY MID 
WEEK ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE MIDWEST DRIVING A 
SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. MAINTAINED SLIGHT THROUGH 
LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY FOR THIS FEATURE. BOTH THE GFS/ECMWF SHOW AN AMPLIFYING 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WITH ASSOCIATED WEATHER MOVING INTO THE EASTERN 
STATES AROUND THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. INTRODUCED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS SYSTEM. TRIED TO TREND 
MAX AND MIN TEMPS CLOSER TO NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

697 
FXUS64 KMRX 241839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EDT THU MAR 24 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
SATELLITE THIS AFTERNOON SHOWS EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER UPSTREAM TO 
NORTHERN OH. WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWING A STRONG INVERSION IN 
PLACE...EXPECT THAT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL REMAIN TRAPPED...AND 
CLOUDS WILL REMAIN BROKEN TO OVERCAST ALL NIGHT. AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS 
ARE IN THE MID-LOWER 30S...AND ARE NOT MUCH LOWER UPSTREAM. AS A 
RESULT...CURRENT FORECAST TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 20S NORTH ARE 
LIKELY TOO LOW...AND A HARD FREEZE WILL LIKELY NOT OCCUR. MOS 
GUIDANCE LOW TEMPS ARE AROUND 30 IN SW VA AND NE TN...AND WILL ADD A 
COUPLE DEGREES TO THIS. THE FREEZE WATCH WILL BE CANCELLED. ALTHOUGH 
THERE ARE SOME SHOWERS IN SW VA THIS AFTERNOON...THEY SHOULD BE GONE 
BY 00Z AS MOISTURE DEPTH AND LAPSE RATES DECREASE SO WILL NOT 
INCLUDE ANY POP FOR THE TONIGHT PERIOD.

DAYTIME MIXING SHOULD HELP ERODE THE CLOUDS IN THE MORNING...LEAVING 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR MUCH OF FRIDAY. A 500 MB VORT MAX APPROACHES 
FROM THE WEST LATE IN THE AFTERNOON...INCREASING MIDLEVEL CLOUDS AND 
PROVIDING SOME WEAK LIFT. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE 
PLATEAU COUNTIES LATE.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH PULLING A WARM FRONT BACK NORTH 
TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BEGINNING FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT. THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET COMBINED WITH ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AND FRONTOGENETIC FORCING ACROSS THE SOUTH WILL PRODUCE PERIODS 
OF RAIN. 

MODELS DIFFER ON EXACT PATH OF SURFACE WAVE ON FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY...BUT ENOUGH RETURN OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE A 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.  

FOR SUNDAY...SHORT-WAVE AND SURFACE LOW MOVES EAST WITH CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS DIMINSHING.

FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...ECMWF AND GFS GREATLY DIFFER ON HOW FAR 
SOUTH FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PULLED SOUTH AND INTENSITY OF NEXT 
SHORT-WAVE AND SURFACE LOW PULLING EAST OF THE ROCKIES.  CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW...BUT WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW THE GFS AND CONTINUE A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS FOR MAINLY THE SOUTHERN EARLY WEEK...THEN A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AREA-WIDE FOR WEDNESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             39  62  50  62  54 /   0  10  60  90  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  36  58  45  59  49 /   0  10  50  80  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  58  44  57  48 /   0  20  60  80  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              33  55  42  55  43 /  10  10  40  70  80

973 
FXUS64 KMRX 241338 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 AM EDT THU MAR 24 2011

.DISCUSSION...
LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION BELOW A STRONG MIDLEVEL INVERSION WILL
KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVER MUCH OF THE AREA TODAY. CLOUDS ARE
SPREADING SOUTHWARD...AND THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE INTO THE
AFTERNOON. THIS WILL LIMIT TEMPERATURES TO THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS.
SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS SW VA WILL ALSO PERSIST INTO THE
AFTERNOON. THE UPDATE WILL MAKE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUD COVER
AND TEMPERATURES...AND EXTEND THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP INTO THE
AFTERNOON. THE MAIN CONCERN FOR THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE
WILL BE HOW MUCH CLOUD COVER LINGERS INTO TONIGHT...WHICH WILL
IMPACT THE NEED FOR A FREEZE WARNING. WILL LEAVE THE WATCH
UNCHANGED FOR NOW.

&&

NC...NONE.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: HANCOCK...HAWKINS...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SULLIVAN...WASHINGTON TN.

007 
FXUS64 KMRX 240836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
436 AM EDT THU MAR 24 2011

.SHORT TERM(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING MOST OF THE 
PRECIPITATION IS OUT OF THE CWA AS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE HEADS OUT 
OF THE REGION.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE THIS MORNING BUT 
MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD BE DRY TODAY. LINGERING CLOUDS SHOULD HINDER 
TEMPERATURES FROM RISING MUCH TODAY. STAYED NEAR THE COOLER MAV 
NUMBERS FOR TODAY. NORTHWEST FLOW TONIGHT WILL BRING IN COOL 
TEMPERATURES.  MAY SEE FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA AND THE MOUNTAINS. SINCE THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHWEST VA ARE IN THE FREEZE PROGRAM...WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH 
FOR THOSE AREAS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE 
IN FAIR AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...BUT THEN BEGIN TO DIVERGE EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH THE TIMING 
OF ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. OVERALL...AN ACTIVE PATTERN IS 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH TWO SEPARATE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEKEND AND 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE DEEP SOUTH IS PROGGED 
TO MOVE NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ON FRIDAY...AND INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY INCREASE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS WARM FRONT...SO WILL SLOWLY INCREASE 
POPS FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY. AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT...CREATING SOME INSTABILITY OVER THE AREA AND A 
CHANCE FOR TSTORMS. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO BE A LITTLE 
STRONGER AND FURTHER NORTH WITH THIS SYSTEM THAN THE ECMWF 
MODEL...AND CONSEQUENTLY BRINGS THE WARM SECTOR (AND ITS RESULTING 
INSTABILITY) FURTHER NORTH OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT. 
THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF TSTORMS FOR SATURDAY...BUT 
ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY NIGHT. 

ECMWF MODEL CONTINUES TO SHOW ANOTHER STRONGER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
QUICKLY DEVELOPING OVER THE DEEP SOUTH DURING THE MONDAY/TUESDAY 
TIME FRAME...BUT THE GFS MODEL HAS SLOWED THIS SYSTEM DOWN (WITH A 
WEAKER SYSTEM) UNTIL THE TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME. FOR 
NOW...WILL PLAN TO MAINTAIN FORECAST CONTINUITY AND WILL KEEP A 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN THE MONDAY/TUESDAY TIME FRAME. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT WED MAR 23 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
QUICKLY DEVELOPING OVER NORTHERN MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. COOLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON WILL STEEPEN 
LAPSE RATES AND INCREASE THE THREAT OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS CAPABLE 
OF PRODUCING LARGE HAIL. DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE AS WELL AS 
WINDS ALOFT MAY BE FORCED TO THE SURFACE WITH STRONG DOWNDRAFTS. 
SURFACE WINDS FROM THE SW SHOULD MEAN A LESSER THREAT OF TORNADOES 
IN OUR AREA. 

CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
EVENING...TAPERING OFF BEFORE MIDNIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO 
THE AREA AND THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS MOVES TO THE EAST. GOOD COLD 
ADVECTION AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEHIND THE FRONT SHOULD MEAN HIGH 
TEMPS ONLY IN THE 50S TOMORROW UNDER MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD AIR WILL BE IN 
PLACE THURSDAY NIGHT AND OVERNIGHT LOWS COULD DIP BELOW FREEZING 
OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS...AND A FREEZE WARNING MAY BE NEEDED.  
OTHERWISE...WILL BE IN A RATHER UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN DURING THE 
EXTENDED.  HIGH PRESSURE THURSDAY NIGHT WILL GIVE WAY TO AN 
APPROACHING SHORT WAVE.  COULD SEE INITIAL SHOWERS PUSH INTO THE 
AREA LATE FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT.  A SECOND...STRONGER WAVE THEN A 
COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH FOR THE WEEKEND.  HAVE CONTINUED WITH 
LIKELY POPS SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE POPS FOR PART OF 
SUNDAY.  MODEL CONSISTENCY ON DETAILS DIMINISHES LATE IN THE 
PERIOD...BUT SHOULD HAVE A SERIES OF WEAK WAVES MOVING IN FOR MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY FOR CONTINUED 20 TO 30 POPS.  DRY ON WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 231332 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 AM EDT WED MAR 23 2011

.DISCUSSION...
A THREAT OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THIS
AFTERNOON...WITH THE GREATEST CHANCES ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE AREA. REGIONAL SOUNDINGS SHOW MIDLEVEL LAPSE RATES NEAR DRY
ADIABATIC AND WET-BULB ZERO HEIGHTS BELOW 10 KFT...SUGGESTING LARGE
HAIL POTENTIAL IS FAVORABLE. HOWEVER THE SOUNDINGS FROM RNK AND OHX
SHOW A SIGNIFICANT INVERSION THAT MUST BE OVERCOME BEFORE
CONVECTION INITIATES. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS WILL OCCUR ONCE THE
UPPER JET NOSES INTO THE AREA TO PROVIDE DIVERGENCE ALOFT...AROUND
18Z. THE TIME PERIOD OF THE BEST SEVERE THREAT LOOKS TO BE BETWEEN
19Z AND 00Z AS LOW LEVEL THETA-E AND CONVERGENCE PEAK AHEAD OF THE
COLD FRONT. HIGH LCL HEIGHTS AND UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND PROFILE
SUGGEST A MINIMAL THREAT OF TORNADOES...ALTHOUGH STRONG WINDS ALOFT
COULD PRODUCE SOME DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS WITH THE STRONGER
STORMS.

THE UPDATE WILL DELAY THE PRECIP SLIGHTLY. TEMPERATURES ARE
CURRENTLY RUNNING WELL ABOVE FORECAST...AND WILL NEED SOME
ADJUSTMENT.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT EXPECTED TO PASS

CONTINUE THE SPS GOING TO DISCUSS THE THREATS.  FRONT MAY LINGER IN 
THE EVENING HOURS SO WILL CONTINUE THE HIGHEST POPS GOING FOR OUR 
NORTHEASTERN ZONES. FOR TEMPERATURES...WITH THE CLOUDS AND RAIN 
EXPECTED...STAYED BELOW MAV GUIDANCE FOR TODAY. GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TONIGHT SIMILAR SO STAYED CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIR AGREEMENT 
WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK...ALTHOUGH 
THERE REMAINS SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. OVERALL... 
AN ACTIVE PATTERN IS EXPECTED...WITH TWO SEPARATE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. SOME LINGERING SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY IN THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...WITH A BRIEF LULL EXPECT BY THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY. SOME FREEZING TEMPS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA AND NORTHEAST TN THURSDAY NIGHT...SO MAY NEED TO ADDRESS THE 
POSSIBILITY OF FREEZE WARNINGS. A WARM FRONT QUICKLY RETURNS INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...AHEAD OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THE GFS MODEL IS A LITTLE STRONGER 
AND FURTHER NORTH WITH THIS SYSTEM THAN THE ECMWF MODEL...AND 
CONSEQUENTLY DEVELOPS MORE INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF TSTORMS FOR 
SATURDAY...BUT ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER STRONGER LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM THEN QUICKLY DEVELOPS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH DURING THE 
MONDAY/TUESDAY TIME FRAME...WITH BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
KEEPING THE CENTER OF THE MAIN LOW SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
TRACK SHOULD RESULT IN MOSTLY SHOWERS FOR THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
ANY SEVERE WEATHER REMAINING FURTHER SOUTH. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT TUE MAR 22 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...PLEASANT SEVENTY TO LOWER 
EIGHTY DEGREE WARMTH WILL SUFFER A SETBACK BY THURSDAY AS THE NICE 
RIDGE WITH EXTENDED PERIOD OF SOUTHERLY FLOW IS REPLACED BY AN UPPER 
TROF AND MUCH COLDER AIR. THE UPPER TROF WILL BUILD ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES LATER TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MAKING PROGRESS INTO THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. BY 12Z THURSDAY. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WITH 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE FROM THE MIDWEST INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BY 
MID EVENING. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP ALONG THIS 
BOUNDARY IN THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY DURING THE MORNING AND WILL MAKE 
THEIR WAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 19-23Z. SHEAR AND 
INSTABILITY WILL BE MORE THAN SUFFICIENT FOR SEVERE CONVECTION 
DURING THIS PERIOD SO WILL MAKE MENTION IN THE ZONES. THE MAIN 
THREATS WILL BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WIND AND LARGE HAIL. 
HOWEVER...THERE WILL BE A SMALL RISK FOR TORNADIC STORMS. TRAILING 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPPING THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER TROF 
WILL KEEP A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS GOING THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ALL THE WAY INTO THURSDAY 
MORNING FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. ANOTHER MILD 
NIGHT (FOR MARCH) IN STORE TONIGHT WITH 70 DEGREE PLUS WARMTH AGAIN 
DUE TO STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL SYSTEM ON 
WEDNESDAY. BY THURSDAY HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL EASILY BE 30 DEGREES 
COLDER THAN TODAY'S HIGHS. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WARM FRONT RETURNS TO 
TENNESSEE VALLEY ON FRIDAY. CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE WITH A CHANCE FOR 
PCPN FRI NGT. BOUGHT INTO SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY ON SAT. 
SURFACE LOW WILL TRACK EAST ALONG WARM FRONT WITH GOOD UPPER 
SUPPORT. SURFACE LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST OF THE 
AREA EARLY SUNDAY. POPS FOR SUNDAY MAY BE OVERDONE...ESPECIALLY IN 
THE AFTN. SHIFTED FORECAST TO STRONGER HIGH PRESSURE WITH DRIER AND 
COOLER CONDITIONS MONDAY. ANOTHER SIMILAR LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AROUND 
THE TUESDAY TIME FRAME. GFS APPEARS TO BE HAVING TROUBLE WITH THESE 
E PAC SYSTEMS. ENSEMBLES ARE FAIRLY SCATTERED TOWARD END OF 
FORECAST. STAYED CLOSE TO HPC SOLUTION WHICH IS CLOSE TO 22/00Z 
ECMWF.

OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER 
WEST VA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO STAY NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH ONLY SOME HIGH CLOUDS FROM 
THE FRONTAL CONVECTION EXPECTED TO AFFECT THE TAF SITES. GUSTY 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS SHOULD AGAIN DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AT KTRI AND 
KTYS...BUT WILL QUICKLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET. OVERALL...VFR 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF 
SITES.
&&

390 
FXUS64 KMRX 211855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON MAR 21 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
EASTERN CANADIAN PROVINCES IS STEERING COOLER AIR THROUGH THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. AND THE LEADING EDGE OF THE BOUNDARY SEPARATING 
PLEASANT 70 DEGREE WARMTH FROM CHILLY AIR IS SERVING AS A FOCUS FOR 
SOME SHOWERS AND EVEN A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY. THE BOUNDARY IS SLIPPING EVER SO SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE 
MIDWEST AND MAY EDGE CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE NORTHERN REACHES OF THE WFO 
MRX FORECAST AREA (SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA) FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A 
SHOWER TONIGHT SO KEPT THE SMALL POP FROM THE PREVIOUS ISSUANCE. THE 
BOUNDARY SHOULD GET A SHOVE BACK TO THE NORTH ON TUESDAY AS 
AMPLIFYING UPPER TROF HEADS EAST ACROSS THE NORTH CENTRAL STATES. 
WITH THE BOUNDARY AWAY TO THE NORTH AND A TIGHTENING PRESSURE 
GRADIENT ON TUESDAY...THE FORECAST SHOULD REMAIN DRY WITH A 
CONTINUATION OF THE PLEASANT ABOVE NORMAL WARMTH. BY WEDNESDAY THE 
UPPER TROF WILL HAVE MADE PROGRESS INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND A COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TWEAKED POPS FOR 
CONVECTION UP A BIT FOR WEDNESDAY WITH PRE FRONTAL TROF BUILDING IN 
DURING THE DAY. AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THERE IS A CHANCE FOR STRONG 
CONVECTION WITH SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY AND ADEQUATE SHEAR. STAYED 
CLOSE TO WARMER SIDE OF GUIDANCE TEMPS WITH STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW 
AIDING WARMTH DURING THE DAYTIME PERIODS AND HIGHER DEWPOINTS AND 
SOME CLOUDS KEEPING MIN TEMPS WELL ABOVE NORMAL AT NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LINGERING SHOWER 
ACTIVITY TAPERS OFF INTO THURSDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
WITH MODEST COLD AIR ADVECTION INTO FRI MORNING. WARM FRONT RETURNS 
FRIDAY AND ESTABLISHES ITSELF ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON 
SATURDAY. WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT SHOW MOVE DEVELOPING PCPN INTO THE 
AREA. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVE EAST ALONG WARM FRONT AND MOVES TO 
NEAR SW VA BY SUN MORNING. INCREASE IN CONVECTION WITH TSTMS 
POSSIBLE BY SAT NGT. LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES EASTWARD AND ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT MOVES SE THROUGH SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY SUNDAY. 
CONFIDENCE LOWERS TOWARD END OF FORECAST BUT GFS TURNING COOLER AND 
TRENDED EARLY NEXT WEEK COOLER.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             55  81  57  75  52 /   0   0   0  40  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  78  55  75  51 /   0   0   0  50  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       54  78  55  74  51 /   0   0   0  50  40
