FXUS64 KMRX 210650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT MON MAR 21 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM FRONT NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY OVER SOUTHERN OHIO 
AND WEST VIRGINIA. A WEAK COLD FRONT WAS ALSO LOCATED OVER THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY...AND IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THAT CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY ALONG THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD STAY NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA DUE TO ITS PROXIMITY TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THIS COLD 
FRONT WILL ALSO HELP TO STRENGTHEN THE PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...RESULTING IN BREEZY CONDITIONS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AFTER A DRY AND MILD START 
TO THE LONG TERM...CONDITIONS DETERIORATE BY MID WEEK AS AN UPPER 
TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION IN THE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY TIME FRAME. 
CONTINUED WITH IDEA OF CONVECTIVE NATURE TO PRECIP AS FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH THE AREA. ONLY MODEST RAINFALL AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED AT THIS 
TIME AS MAIN AREA OF PRECIP MOVES RAPIDLY THROUGH THE AREA AND 
ASSOCIATED MOISTURE IS SOMEWHAT LIMITED. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW FOLLOWS 
FRONTAL PASSAGE. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY...MAINLY 
CONFINED TO HIGHER TERRAIN. BRIEF DRY PERIOD DEPICTED THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM...OR EVEN SERIES OF 
SYSTEMS...APPROACHES. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE CONSIDERABLY BY THE 
WEEKEND PRECLUDING MUCH CONFIDENCE FOR THE END OF THE LONG TERM. 
THERE IS ENOUGH SUPPORT FROM GEFS ENSEMBLES TO WARRANT SLIGHT CHANCE 
TO CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.


&&

130 
FXUS64 KMRX 201920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT SUN MAR 20 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON 
HAS BEEN WELL TO OUR NORTH FROM THE SRN OHIO VALLEY SE ACROSS W VA.
DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE RECOVERED INTO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S ACROSS OUR 
FORECAST AREA...BUT WARM TEMPS ALOFT HAVE KEPT AIRMASS QUITE STABLE
EXCEPT FOR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREA WHERE LIFTED INDICES HAVE REACHED 
-2 TO -3 DEGREES CELSIUS. NAM 12KM AND RUC HINT AT WEAK CONVERGENCE 
LATE TONIGHT INTO SE TN AND SW NC...SO I ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THERE (WHICH ALSO MESHES BETTER WITH GSP CHANCE POPS TONIGHT).

ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO STRETCH OUT E-W TO OUR N...AND
POSSIBLY SAG TO NEAR SE KY AND SWRN VA MONDAY EVENING. KEPT SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE INTO MONDAY EVENING. OTHERWISE...DRY AND
QUITE WARM THROUGH THESE PERIODS...WITH RISING HEIGHTS ALOFT AND
WARM SW LOW LEVEL FLOW.

CLOUD COVER WILL MAX OUT AT NIGHT AND THEN SHOULD GIVE WAY TO A MIX 
OF CLOUDS AND SUNSHINE DAYTIME. THUS...FAVORED MILDER MINS AND 
WARMER MAXES. ALTHOUGH THESE ARE VERY WARM TEMPS...RECORD HIGHS ARE 
NOT IN JEOPARDY EITHER DAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROF SWINGS 
SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND INTO 
THE NORTHEASTERN STATES FROM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
FROPA WITH SYSTEM COLD FRONT OCCURS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND STAYED WITH 
CONVECTION FOR PRECIP TYPE WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH 
MODELS PROGGING SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY WITH THIS SYSTEM. UPPER TROF 
AMPLIFIES THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. ON THURSDAY AND A TRAILING 
SHORT WAVE MOVES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS GENERATING A FEW SHOWERS...SO KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS MAINLY FOR FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES. WAS ABLE TO KEEP 
THE FORECAST DRY THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD ON 
SATURDAY WITH RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE EASTERN STATES. NEXT UPPER 
TROF ADVANCES TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY SATURDAY EVENING AND 
APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AT THIS TIME WHILE ADJUSTING 
FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION ON SUNDAY AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES. RAISED POPS TO LOW CHANCE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

BEGIN TO DETERIORATE BY MID WEEK AS NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES. 
CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUED TO MENTION THUNDER. SYSTEM PULLS EAST BY LATE WORK WEEK 
WITH A CORRESPONDING DECREASE IN PRECIP CHANCES. MODELS HAVE BACKED 
OFF ON DEPICTING AMPLIFIED TROUGH DIGGING INTO THE EASTERN CONUS FOR 
THIS TIME PERIOD. THUS TEMPS DO NOT APPEAR TO BE AS COOL AS 
INITIALLY ANTICIPATED...AND NOW APPEAR WILL REMAIN AT LEAST NEAR 
CLIMO. ANOTHER POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY NEXT 
WEEKEND BUT TIMING HIGHLY UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME. THUS KEPT LATE 
PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM DRY FOR NOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID
NOT DEVIATE GREATLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY WILL BE 
AVAILABLE FOR CONVECTION SO KEPT THIS IDEA GOING. UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGHING WILL SET UP FOR BUSINESS ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER 
OF THE NATION THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AND THIS WILL BRING AN END TO THE 
PLEASANT 60-70 DEGREE WARMTH ENJOYED EARLIER IN THE WEEK. ALSO...HAD 
TO KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON THURSDAY WITH MOISTURE AND 
LIFT WITH ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THERE WILL BE ENOUGH COLD AIR IN PLACE 
THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR THE MENTION OF SNOW 
SHOWERS. WAS ABLE TO KEEP THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM DRY AS THE 
NEXT UPPER TROF TAKES A WHILE TO MAKE THE TRANSIT INTO THE EASTERN 
U.S.

THE POSSIBILITY OF TSTORMS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS REMAIN IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT A WEAK WEST-EAST ORIENTED FRONT WILL MEANDER THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND. FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO BE PUSHED BACK TO THE NORTH ON SUNDAY AS UPPER RIDGING 
BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN CONUS. NOT EXPECTING SIGNIFICANT RAIN
EVENT AT THIS TIME...BUT HAVE CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE
POPS OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA
DURING THIS TIME FRAME. WEAK UPPER RIDGING HOLDS ON THROUGH THE
EARLY PORTION OF THE WORK WEEK KEEPING PRECIP TO OUR NORTH BEFORE
FRONT SAGS BACK INTO THE REGION BY MID WEEK RESULTING IN LOW POPS
FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. UPPER FLOW CONFIGURATION CHANGES FOR
LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE EASTERN CONUS.
THE RESULTING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT AND FALLING HEIGHTS WILL
PUSH TEMPS BACK TO NEAR...AND POSSIBLY EVEN BELOW...CLIMO.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

SUCH AS TRI.

KEPT FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW...BUT ADDED MORE CLOUDINESS ACROSS NRN 
PLATEAU...NE TN AND SW VA AREAS. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN SLIGHTLY 
COOLER (STILL ABOVE CLIMO) MAX TEMPS FOR THOSE AREAS...WHILE CHA AND 
RHP FLIRT WITH THE 80 DEGREE MARK.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT

LIFT BACK NORTHEAST FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF
SHOWERS FOR MAINLY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA-NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR
FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL KEEP MONDAY AND
TUESDAY DRY. A SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND
GREAT LAKES FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. THIS WAVE WILL HELP PULL A
FRONT BACK INTO THE FORECAST BY WEDNESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS.

FXUS64 KMRX 161912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT WED MAR 16 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LINGERING CLOUD COVER THIS 
AFTERNOON IS THE MAIN CONCERN FOR TONIGHT...AS THESE CLOUDS HAVE 
HINDERED TEMPS FROM REACHING THE POTENTIAL 50S TO LOWER 60S THIS 
AFTERNOON. MOS DIFFERS BY SEVERAL DEGREES ON MINS TONIGHT...WITH 
COLDER MINS ONLY ACCEPTABLE IF CLOUDS TOTALLY CLEAR WITH CALM WINDS. 
THUS...HAVING TO SLOW DOWN THE CLOUD DISSIPATION LEADS ME TO GO MORE 
WITH A BLEND OF MOS MINS...ALSO FACTORING IN DEW POINT TEMPS 
UPSTREAM.

MUCH NICER SPRING DAY IN STORE FOR THE REGION THURSDAY...AS UPPER 
RIDGE BUILDS EAST AND SURFACE RIDGE BEGINS TO SLIP SE OF THE REGION.
THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR A NICE WARM-UP TO SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO.
EVEN WARMER HIGHS ON TAP FOR FRIDAY AS SW LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS 
BETWEEN THE SURFACE RIDGE TO OUR E-SE AND DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES. WARMER MOS MINS FAVORED IN HIGHER 
TERRAIN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND COOLER MOS IN SHELTERED NRN VALLEYS.
MOS HIGHS FOR FRIDAY ARE 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO AND LOOK GOOD.

HOWEVER...IN SPITE OF WARMING TEMPS...NO RECORD HIGHS EXPECTED 
EITHER DAY. RECORD HIGHS FOR THURSDAY ARE...CHA-84...TYS-80 AND 
TRI-78...THEN RECORD HIGHS FOR FRIDAY...CHA-83...TYS-80 AND TRI-78.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED...SO KEPT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING. A 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE 
REMAINS NORTH...SO KEPT SUNDAY DRY. RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN ON MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY...SO KEPT THE DRY FORECAST GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. A FRONT 
ENTERS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. WILL ADD LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS 
FOR WEDNESDAY. WARM TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD... 
STAYED MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF CWA DRY AND INCORPORATING SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTHEASTERN HALF. CONTINUED TO BE PESSIMISTIC 
WITH CLOUD COVER AS CLOUDS WILL LIKELY PERSIST UNTIL AFTER UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH SOMETIME TOMORROW MORNING. FOR 
TEMPS...GUIDANCE VALUES GENERALLY CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. DID 
NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE FIRMLY ENTRENCHED OVER THE GULF COAST THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE WEEK...DRIFTING SLIGHTLY EASTWARD EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
THIS WILL PROVIDE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD. THE EXCEPTION MAY BE SATURDAY WHEN A WEAK UPPER TROUGH 
PUSHES A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA. WITH THE RIDGE TO OUR 
SOUTH...MOISTURE WITH THE FRONT WILL BE LIMITED. WILL KEEP THE 
MENTION OF A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS GOING...BUT IT DOES NOT LOOK 
PROMISING. TEMPS COOL A BIT WITH THE FRONT ON SATURDAY...BUT REBOUND 
QUICKLY INTO THE 70S ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW 
THE RIDGE MOVING EAST AND A TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS ON TUESDAY...WILL 
BEGIN DAY 7 WITH A CHANCE POP.


&&

WEDNESDAY MORNING...WILL KEEP JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING NORTH 
INTO THAT PERIOD. NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW RISING TEMPERATURES IN 
THE 850-700 MB LAYER THAT KEEP LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED IN THE 
VALLEY FOR MUCH OF WEDNESDAY. THE GFS IS NOT AS STRONG WITH THIS 
INVERSION...BUT WILL TRIM GFS MOS TEMPS BACK A FEW DEGREES TO 
ACCOUNT FOR POTENTIALLY GREATER CLOUD COVER.

A DEEP RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY...SUPPLYING DRY 
WEATHER AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. UNDER SUNNY SKIES...HIGHS 
WILL REACH THE 70S BOTH DAYS IN THE VALLEY...WITH UPPER 70S POSSIBLE 
FRIDAY AROUND CHA. A DRY COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA 
SATURDAY...LOWERING TEMPS A BIT BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL. THIS FRONT 
LIFTS BACK TO THE NORTH ON SUNDAY AS A STRONG RIDGE DEVELOPS OVER 
THE ATLANTIC COAST. A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL PUSH TEMPS WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL AGAIN FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT SUN MAR 13 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WEAK FRONT WILL BE NEARLY 
STATIONARY IN THE VICINITY OF OUR SOUTHERN BORDER TONIGHT...THEN 
WILL BEGIN LIFTING NORTH AS A WAVE OF LOW PRESSURE APPROACHES.  
MODELS HAVE HAD A HARD TIME WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND STILL DO NOT 
AGREE ON THE DETAILS...SO THIS IS A LOWER THAN USUAL CONFIDENCE 
FORECAST FOR A SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
NORTH AND CENTRAL AND CHANCE SOUTH TONIGHT...THEN LIKELY NORTH AND 
CENTRAL WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS SOUTH ON MONDAY.  MOISTURE AND LIFT 
LOOK TO BE SOMEWHAT LIMITED...SO PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE ON THE 
LIGHT SIDE...WITH THE HIGHER VALUES NORTH.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM 
MAV TEMPS.    

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...TRACK OF SYSTEM EARLY IN 
THE LONG TERM STILL SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN...THUS TIMING OF MAIN PRECIP 
AXIS PROGRESSION AND DEPARTURE OF PRECIPITATION IN LIMBO. APPEARS AT 
THIS POINT THAT SYSTEM WILL TRACK TO OUR WEST AND NORTH LEADING TO A 
MAIN PRECIP AXIS PROGRESSING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY MORNING AS TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH. KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING AREA-WIDE ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY...BUT UNDERCUT CATEGORICAL MAV GUIDANCE POPS DUE TO THE 
TIMING UNCERTAINTY. MODEL SOLUTIONS START TO DIVERGE WITH RESPECT TO 
SYSTEM DEPARTURE...WITH THE NAM SHOWING THE SYSTEM PRETTY MUCH 
LOSING ITS INFLUENCE ON OUR REGION BY EARLY WEDNESDAY WHILE THE GFS 
HAS AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE ROTATING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING 
WITH LINGERING PRECIP. HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS CONFINED TO FAR 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS FOR THIS TIME PERIOD FOR NOW. BALANCE OF FORECAST 
STILL GENERALLY DRY PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS WITH WARMING 
TREND IN RESPONSE TO SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT RISES AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
INTO THE EASTERN CONUS. ANOTHER WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY SAGS INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE FRIDAY...BUT HAVE ONLY INTRODUCED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BASED ON ITS SIMILARITY TO CURRENT SURFACE FRONT 
OVER THE AREA WHICH HAS BEEN A NON-ISSUE SO FAR. GENERALLY DID NOT 
DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM.

SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH AND CHANCE SOUTH AND CENTRAL FOR SUNDAY.  
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS HAVE COME INTO 
SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO A MORE SIGNIFICANT WAVE 
THAT RIDES ALONG WEST-EAST ORIENTED BOUNDARY AND APPROACHES THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON MONDAY. MAIN ISSUE NOW IS HOW FAR 
SOUTH THE BOUNDARY WILL PROGRESS AND THUS THE EXACT TRACK OF THE 
WAVE. NAM STILL PUSHES BOUNDARY FARTHER SOUTH THAN THE ECMWF...GFS 
OR CANADIAN MODELS. TRACK OF SYSTEM WILL HAVE A PROFOUND EFFECT ON 
TEMPS ON MONDAY...WITH DRAMATIC DIFFERENCES IN GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR 
BOTH MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. TEND TO FAVOR GFS VALUES SINCE IT HAS 
MORE SUPPORT. KEPT BALANCE OF LONG TERM DRY FOR NOW IN SPITE OF 
ANOTHER WEAK BOUNDARY SAGGING INTO THE REGION BY LATE IN THE LONG 
TERM. APPEARS TEMPS WILL CLIMB TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY MID TO LATE 
WORK WEEK AS UPPER RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE REGION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST FRI MAR 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE TO SHORT TERM 
FORECAST. UPPER TROUGH AXIS EXITING AREA TO NE. FAIRLY STRONG
JET SEGMENT ON TROUGH WEST SIDE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA EARLY 
TODAY. CLOUD TOPS WARMING TO ABOVE -20C. FREEZING LEVEL WAS SLOW TO 
REACH VALLEY LOCATIONS. SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE MAINLY ACROSS N 
PART OF MRX CWA EARLY TODAY BUT ACCUMULATION SNOW WILL BE LIMITED 
MAINLY TO HIGHER ELEVATION. H85 WINDS WILL INCREASE SOME AND UPSLOPE 
AREAS WILL SEE SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS. FAVORABLE 
UPPER LOCATIONS MANY END UP WITH FAIRLY GOOD ACCUMULATIONS. WINTER 
ADVISORY FOR SW VA AND NE TN WILL LIKELY EXPIRE AT 5 AM EST. NORTH 
END OF SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST 
TODAY. SKIES WILL CLEAR MOST AREAS BY THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURE 
ADVECTION IS NEAR NEUTRAL. TONIGHT SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR AND 
WINDS WILL DROP OFF. TEMPS WILL BE BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
REGION ON SATURDAY.  HOWEVER...LITTLE MOISTURE OR ENERGY WITH THE 
FRONT AND EXPECT ONLY TO SEE A FEW BANDS ON CLOUDS MOVING THROUGH.  
THE FRONT SHOULD REMAIN ACROSS THE REGION AS A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES 
PUSH IN SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  BETTER MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED 
WITH THESE FEATURES AND SHOULD SEE SCATTERED SHOWERS DEVELOP ACROSS 
THE MRX CWA.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER IN TUESDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW 
FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  MODELS DO INDICATE A COUPLE OF WEAK 
WAVES MOVING THROUGH...MAINLY TO OUR NORTH WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  
FOR NOW WILL KEEP THINGS DRY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1230 AM EST FRI MAR 11 2011

.AVIATION...INTENSITY OF RADAR RETURNS REMAINS WEAK...SO DON'T 
ANTICIPATE MUCH OF A VISBY RESTRICTION AT TAF SITES WITH ANY STRAY 
-RA OR -SHSN OVERNIGHT. A BRISK WESTERLY WIND IS HELPING TO KEEP 
CEILINGS MOSTLY VFR...BUT TYS AND TRI COULD FALL BRIEFLY TO MVFR 
WITH ANY LIGHT PRECIPITATION THROUGH 12Z FRIDAY.

OTHERWISE...LOW CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY ERODE...AND SHOULD BE 
GONE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...LOOK FOR CLEARING SKIES AND LIGHT 
WINDS FOR THE 11/21Z TO 12/06Z PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
919 PM EST THU MAR 10 2011

.DISCUSSION...UPDATING AT MID-LATE EVENING BASED ON CALLS MADE
AROUND THE AREA. VAD WIND PROFILE AND SURFACE OBSERVATIONS SHOW
LESS NW UPSLOPE FLOW THAN NAM ADVERTISED...SO GETTING MAINLY
FLURRIES ACROSS WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES OF SW VA. ONLY HEAVY SNOW
(NO AMOUNT GIVEN) WAS REPORTED IN UNICOI COUNTY.

LATEST NAM SHOWS JUST AN INCH OR SO OF SNOW OVERNIGHT FOR WISE AND
RUSSELL COUNTIES...SO DOWNGRADING TO AN ADVISORY THERE...TO RUN
THRU 5AM LIKE THE OTHER WINTER WX ADVISORY. THIS ALSO MESHES MUCH
BETTER WITH NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES.

TEMPS AND POPS LOOKED GOOD OVERALL...LOWERED WINDS AND SHIFTED
DIRECTION TO WEST. OTHERWISE...UPDATE MAINLY TO FRESHEN THE WSW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
620 PM EST THU MAR 10 2011

.AVIATION...AREAS OF RAIN CONTINUE TO ROTATE SE ACROSS THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS...WITH A MIX OR MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. TAF SITE MOST LIKELY TO EXPERIENCE OCCASIONAL RAIN OR 
SNOW OVERNIGHT WILL BE TRI...ALONG WITH BRIEF PERIODS OF BETWEEN 
MVFR AND IFR CONDITIONS.

MVFR OR JUST BELOW FOR TYS OVERNIGHT...WHILE CHA SHOULD TREND UP TO 
LOW END OF VFR OVER THE NEXT 3 TO 6 HOURS. 

OTHERWISE...LOOK FOR CLOUDS TO LIFT AND DISSIPATE ON FRIDAY. 

&&

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL SHIFT 
EAST...AS COLDER AIR CONTINUES TO PUSH INTO THE AREA TONIGHT/EARLY 
FRIDAY.  RAIN SHOWERS AND SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO TRANSITION 
TO SNOW SHOWERS OVERNIGHT.   MODELS INDICATE STEEP ENOUGH LAPSE 
RATES ALONG WITH NORTHWEST FLOW AND FAIRLY DEEP MOISTURE FOR SOME 
SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS IN THE USUAL UPSLOPE LOCATIONS.  CURRENT 
WINTER STORM WARNINGS/WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES LOOK REASONABLE...SO 
WILL LEAVE AS IS.  EXPECT ACCUMULATIONS TO BE STRONGLY RELATED TO 
ELEVATION WITH THIS EVENT...ALTHOUGH MAY BE AT LEAST A LITTLE 
ACCUMULATION SOME VALLEY AREAS MAINLY IN THE WARNING/ADVISORY 
AREAS...AS SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD FALL TO NEAR FREEZING EVEN IN LOWER 
ELEVATION AREAS.  PRECIP SHOULD END SOUTH LATE TONIGHT AND 
EVERYWHERE BY LATE FRIDAY.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY PULLING ANOTHER WEAK FRONT SOUTHEAST INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY. LIMITED MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS WITH 
FRONT SO NO PRECIPITATION ANTICIPATED.  INCREASING CLOUDS EXPECTED 
WITH FROPA ON SATURDAY. FRONT HANGS UP ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUG MONDAY KEEPING CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. SOME LIGHT RAIN ANTICIPATED ALONG THE BOUNDARY BY SUNDAY NIGHT.
ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY WITH A BETTER CHANGE OF SHOWERS. ECMWF AND GFS ARE QUITE 
DIFFERENT WITH UPPER AND SURFACE FEATURES FOR TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY SO CONFIDENCE LEVEL IS LOW. WILL CALL FOR DRIER CONDITIONS
RETURNING FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS BOUNDARY PULLS SOUTHEAST.


&&

229 
FXUS64 KMRX 100943
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST THU MAR 10 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL SHOWERS WILL GRADUALLY 
SHIFT EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY TODAY WHILE 
DEEPENING UPPER TROF ADVANCES FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 
ENOUGH STRENGTHENING WILL OCCUR FOR A CLOSED 50H LOW TO APPROACH THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH SLOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. LIGHT RAIN WILL DEVELOP IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
THIS FEATURE INITIALLY BUT VERY COLD AIR ALOFT AND MORE THAN 
ADEQUATE LIFT WITH SOME INSTABILITY...THE RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND 
CHANGE TO SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER AS THE AFTERNOON PROGRESSES. THE WINTER STORM WATCH 
WAS UPGRADED TO A WARNING FOR HEAVY SNOW FOR THE AFTERNOON THROUGH 
MID MORNING FRIDAY WHERE SNOWFALL TOTALS MAY RANGE FROM 3 TO 6 
INCHES WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS AT ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5500 FEET. 
ADDED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR LIGHTER SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION ON 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NEAR THE KENTUCKY BORDER AS WELL AS THE LOWER 
ELEVATION AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THAT 
WERE NOT INCLUDED IN THE WINTER STORM WARNING. IN THESE AREAS...1-3 
INCH ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED BY LATE TONIGHT. BELIEVE ANY SNOWFALL 
WHICH OCCURS ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE WILL BE VERY LIGHT AND 
WILL ONLY HAVE A CHANCE TO STICK TO GRASSY SURFACES DUE TO SOMEWHAT 
MILDER TEMPERATURES. USED A SLOWLY FALLING TEMPERATURE SCHEME TODAY 
AS COLDER ADVECTS IN ON WESTERLY FLOW AND DESCENDS UNDERNEATH THE 
UPPER LEVEL CIRCULATION. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES 
UNDER THE CLOSED UPPER LOW ALONG WITH A 30+ KT UPSLOPE FLOW WILL 
KEEP SNOW SHOWERS GOING INTO FRIDAY. AN ADDITIONAL INCH OF SNOW MAY 
ACCUMULATE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS FRIDAY MORNING. DECREASING MOISTURE 
DEPTH AND INCREASING TEMPS ALOFT WILL BRING AN END TO THE SHOWERS 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 

WEAK MIDLEVEL RIDGING WILL PROVIDE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND 
SUB-FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN MOST SPOTS FRIDAY NIGHT. THE UPPER JET 
AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASS TO THE NORTH ON SATURDAY...WHICH WILL 
INCREASE MID-HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS BUT DRY LOW LEVELS WILL PREVENT ANY 
CHANCE OF PRECIP. 

SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF CONTINUE FOR DAYS 
4-7. THE GFS REMAINS RELATIVELY DRY...WHILE THE ECMWF SHOWS A CLOSED 
LOW CROSSING THE REGION MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE PREVIOUS 
FORECASTS HAVE LEANED MORE TOWARD THE ECMWF...AND THIS TREND WILL BE 
CONTINUED...KEEPING A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. SINCE CONFIDENCE IS LOW...FEW CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE 
FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EST WED MAR 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA 
TONIGHT...AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN. MAIN AREA OF RAIN EXITING...SO 
FLOOD WATCH WILL BE CANCELLED EARLY.  WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
DIMINISH...AND SHOULD FALL BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA EARLIER THAN 
EXPIRATION OF CURRENT ADVISORY...SO WILL SHORTEN EXPIRATION TIME.  
EXPECT SOME SHOWERS TONIGHT...AND WITH COLDER AIR MOVING IN LATER 
TONIGHT...MAY SEE SOME SNOW BEGIN TO MIX IN NEAR DAYBREAK OVER THE  
PLATEAU. WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV TEMPS FOR 
TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WITH MODERATELY STRONG NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC FLOW 
DEVELOPING. NAM AND GFS SHOW TEMPERATURES DROPPING FAIRLY QUICKLY 
THURSDAY BEHIND FROPA...WHICH OCCURS IN THE MORNING. SNOW LEVELS 
WILL DROP THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT TO THE VALLEY FLOOR. SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS OF 3 TO 6 INCHES ARE EXPECTED...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET 
MSL. HEAVIER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...SUCH 
AS MT LECONTE. WILL MAINTAIN WINTER STORM WATCH FOR CURRENT AREAS. 

THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHERN PLATEAU MAY 
ALSO EXPERIENCE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. THE RAIN WILL CHANGE TO 
SNOW ACROSS THE VALLEY THURSDAY EVENING...BUT LITTLE TO NO 
ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

FOR LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...RIDGING WILL CLEAR OUT THE CLOUD 
COVER...BUT ANOTHER NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES INTO NORTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT. ASSOCIATED WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
SATURDAY WITH NO PRECIPITATION ANTICIPATED. HOWEVER...WRAP-AROUND 
MOISTURE WILL GIVE SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA A CHANCE OF SHOWERS SATURDAY 
NIGHT.

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT CONFIDENCE ON TIMING IS LOW. WILL MAINTAIN LOW 
POPS FOR THIS SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1031 AM EST WED MAR 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...AREA OF RAIN OVER THE AREA...BUT BACK EDGE OF MORE
SIGNIFICANT RAINS ALREADY MOVING INTO FAR WESTERN AREAS. LOOKS LIKE
TIMING MAY BE A BIT SLOW IN CURRENT FORECAST...SO WILL SPEED THINGS
UP A BIT. ALSO...CONVECTION TO THE SOUTH SEEMS TO BE DISRUPTING
SOME MOISTURE TRANSPORT INTO OUR AREA...SO PRECIP AMOUNTS MAY BE
A LITTLE LESS THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT...BUT WITH GROUND ALREADY
QUITE WET FLOOD WATCH WILL CONTINUE. MAY NEED TO END THIS EARLIER
THAN CURRENT EXPIRATION...BUT SINCE WATER WILL BE SLOW TO SUBSIDE
EVEN IN AREAS WHERE RAIN WILL DIMINISH EARLIER...WILL LET FLOOD
WATCH STAY AS IS FOR NOW AND EVALUATE AGAIN LATER. WIND ADVISORY
STILL LOOKS GOOD. WILL MAKE A FEW TWEAKS TO THE DATABASE...BUT NO
MAJOR CHANGES PLANNED AT THIS TIME.  

.LONG TERM...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA THURSDAY WITH
MODERATELY STRONG NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC FLOW DEVELOPING. GOOD
OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND MOISTURE WILL PERSIST THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING.
TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY DROP THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WITH RAIN
CHANGING TO SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THURSDAY AND AREA-
WIDE BY THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS SHOW SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
FOR THE NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES TO WARRANT WINTER STORM WATCH
CRITERIA. HAVE ISSUED A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR THE FAR EASTERN
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE ACROSS THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND THE REST OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

BUILDS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

006 
FXUS64 KMRX 090834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST WED MAR 9 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG STORM SYSTEM ALREADY MAKING 
AN IMPACT ON THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WITH STRENGTHENING 
WINDS ALOFT AS LOW LEVEL JET PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
STAYED WITH THE WIND ADVISORY THROUGH THIS EVENING AS FRONTAL PUSH 
SHOULD BE ABLE TO MIX STRONG FLOW ALOFT TO THE SURFACE AS IT 
ADVANCES TOWARD THE MOUNTAINS. THE OTHER MAIN FEATURE IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE THE PROLONGED PERIOD OF HEAVY RAIN AS VERY 
HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER STREAMS NORTH INTO THE REGION. THE MOISTURE 
WILL BE EFFICIENTLY LIFTED IN A SCENARIO WHICH INCLUDES A LENGTHY 
PERIOD OF CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF A SLOW MOVING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WITH 
STRONG DIVERGENCE ALOFT IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF 120 KT JET. STAYED 
WITH A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA WHILE 
SHIFTING TO CATEGORICAL CONVECTIVE POPS FOR SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA LATER IN THE DAY AS NARROW INSTABILITY AXIS 
BUILDS EAST AHEAD OF SYSTEM COLD FRONT. AREAL PRECIP TOTALS WILL BE 
IN THE 1-2 INCH RANGE WITH LOCALIZED AMOUNTS CLOSE TO 3 INCHES 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE THE 
BEST COMBINATION OF MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE LOCATED. A FLOOD WATCH 
WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE EVENING DUE TO TIMING OF HEAVY RAIN 
IN PROXIMITY TO THE RECENT TWO WEEK PERIOD OF EXCESSIVE RAINFALL THE 
REGION HAS EXPERIENCED. MAX TEMPERATURE FORECAST COULD BE 
CHALLENGING AS USUAL WITH STRONG SOUTHERLY DOWNSLOPE FLOW POSSIBLY 
ALLOWING THE NORTHERN GREAT VALLEY TO BECOME A LITTLE WARMER THAN 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. USED A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL BECOME 
NEGATIVELY TILTED AND TRANSITION INTO A CLOSED LOW AS IT CROSSES THE 
APPALACHIANS ON THURSDAY. COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE 850 MB TROUGH ON 
THURSDAY WILL RESULT IN TEMPS NEARLY STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING 
THROUGH THE DAY. FALLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS WILL CREATE INSTABILITY FOR 
SHOWERS. BY THURDAY EVENING PRECIP WILL TRANSITION TO SNOW 
SHOWERS...WHICH WILL CONTINUE INTO FRIDAY MORNING. THE NAM PRODUCES 
WARNING-CRITERIA SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE MOUNTAINS...BUT THIS APPEARS 
OVERDONE AS THE GFS AND SREF SHOW MUCH LESS. A 25 KT NW FLOW WILL 
ENHANCE SNOW AMOUNTS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT THE LACK OF SYNOPTIC 
LIFT AND SMALL WINDOW OF ADEQUATE MOISTURE DEPTH SHOULD HELP LIMIT 
AMOUNTS TO ADVISORY LEVELS OR LOWER. TEMPS NEAR TO JUST ABOVE 
FREEZING WILL PREVENT MUCH ACCUMULATION IN VALLEY LOCATIONS. 

THE REST OF THE LONG TERM WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY UNCHANGED. A SERIES 
OF FAST-MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGHS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW 
NORMAL...BUT WITH MOISTURE LACKING WE SHOULD STAY DRY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE QUITE DIFFERENT FOR DAYS 6 AND 7...SO 
WILL LEAVE THE CURRENT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  44  49  34  54 / 100  50  40  20   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  43  48  32  49 / 100  60  50  40   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  43  46  32  51 / 100  60  50  40   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              57  46  52  30  45 / 100  80  70  70  20 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 081955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST TUE MAR 8 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...A STRONG COLD FRONT 
WILL PUSH THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE SHORT 
TERM.  INITIAL SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL MOVE IN OVERNIGHT WITH A LARGE 
BAND OF RAIN SHOWERS WITH SOME EMBEDDED HEAVY RAINFALL AND POSSIBLY 
A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER ON WEDNESDAY.  THE MAIN BAND OF RAIN WILL 
EXIT THE AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON BUT WILL CONTINUE TO SEE AREAS OF 
LIGHT TO MODERATE RAINFALL INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  WITH RECENT HEAVY 
RAINFALL COMBINED WITH PROJECTED RAIN FROM THE INCOMING SYSTEM... 
COULD SEE SOME FLOODING...MAINLY ACROSS NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS AND 
ALONG ALREADY HIGH RUNNING RIVERS.  A FLOOD WATCH WILL REMAIN IN 
EFFECT BEGINNING TONIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  ADDITIONALLY...A STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL ACCOMPANY THE 
FRONT AND WILL INCREASE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY.  WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO BECOME QUITE STRONG...REACHING 
ADVISORY CRITERIA ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS OF EAST TN AND 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OVER WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES IN VA.  A 
WIND ADVISORY HAVE BEEN ISSUED FOR THESE AREAS.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MOST ACTIVE PERIOD WILL BE 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...ON BACKSIDE OF EXITING SYSTEM. SOME 
CONCERN FOR A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION IN HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA AND 
NE TN...AS NW UPSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPS WITH SOME LINGERING MOISTURE 
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT (SREF PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1/4 TO 
1/3 INCH). 

THE PARTIAL THICKNESSES AND 850 MB TEMPS COOL ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY SNOW 
SHOWERS BY THURSDAY EVENING...SO I INCREASED OUR POPS TO LOW END OF 
LIKELY IN OUR TYPICALLY FAVORED AREAS. KEPT THE SNOW AMOUNTS MAINLY 
IN THE 1 TO 2 INCH RANGE FOR NOW...AS HPC WWD DAY 3 GRAPHIC HAS 
LOWERED AMOUNTS FROM PREVIOUS GRAPHIC. ALSO...NEIGHBORING NWS 
OFFICES ARE NOT HITTING THIS SNOW POTENTIAL VERY HARD AT THIS TIME.
WILL LET LATER SHIFTS MONITOR THIS WINTRY WEATHER EVENT...AS WIND 
AND FLOOD THREATS DOMINATE THE SHORT TERM PERIODS. I WILL UPDATE THE 
HWO PRODUCT AND ADD A MENTION OF LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE THURSDAY NIGHT.

DRY WEATHER LOOKS ON TRACK FOR FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT OR MONDAY
WITH A DRY COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE STILL ON TRACK FOR LATE SATURDAY. 
MODELS DIVERGE CONSIDERABLY FOR DAYS 6 AND 7...LEADING TO LOW 
CONFIDENCE FOR NOW. ECMWF TRAPS A WEAK UPPER LOW UNDER THE RIDGE 
THAT BUILDS OVER THE CENTRAL AND NRN PLAINS EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND
OFFERS A DRY FORECAST FOR BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 12Z GFS MODEL 
KEEPS THE PATTERN PROGRESSIVE WITH A SRN STREAM SHORT WAVE SPREADING 
RAIN/SHOWERS INTO THE TN VALLEY/SRN APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY INTO 
EARLY TUESDAY. FOR NOW...A COMPROMISE WITH BLENDED FORECAST GRIDS TO 
MESH WITH NEIGHBORS. 

FOR TEMPS...GFSX MOS HIGHS ON THURSDAY LOOK TO OCCUR EARLY THEN 
STEADY OR FALLING IN THE AFTERNOON...SO I TRENDED TOWARD OR BELOW 
THE COOLER HIGHS. OTHERWISE...GFSX MOS MAX AND MIN TEMPS WERE 
CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

PERIOD. APPLIED LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR AS LOW LEVEL JET SWINGS EAST
ACROSS THE REGION AROUND 03Z AND BEYOND.

FXUS64 KMRX 080800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST TUE MAR 8 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES WILL STRENGTHEN OVER 
THE PLAINS TODAY...THEN TRACK TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY. 
STRONG MOISTURE ADVECTION AHEAD OF THIS SLOW MOVING SYSTEM WILL 
RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL TOTALS TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. GIVEN THE PREVIOUS HEAVY RAIN ON SUNDAY WHICH RAISED RIVER 
LEVELS...FLOODING POTENTIAL LOOKS HIGH. 

PRECIP BEGINS THIS EVENING DUE TO ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MIDLEVEL 
MOISTURE ADVECTION. THE NAM BRINGS IN MUCH MORE PRECIP TONIGHT THAN 
THE GFS...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE LOWER GFS AMOUNTS AT ONSET. THE 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET PICKS UP TO 50 KTS AFTER MIDNIGHT...CREATING 
FAVORABLE MOUNTAIN WAVE CONDITIONS. THE NAM SHOWS THE LLJ UP TO 65 
KTS...BUT IT MAY BE OVERDONE AS THE GFS IS 10-20 KTS WEAKER. WILL 
ISSUE A WIND AVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS 
STARTING AT MIDNIGHT. THE HEAVIER PRECIP WILL ARRIVE AFTER 12Z WED 
AS THE UPPER JET BECOMES POSITIONED FROM CNTL KY TO MI...PLACING OUR 
AREA IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. WIDESPREAD RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
AROUND 2 INCHES WILL BE COMMON...WITH LOCALIZED AREAS UP TO 3 
INCHES. A FLOOD WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE ENTIRE AREA 12Z 
WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT THURSDAY. STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE ACTING ON 
SOME WEAK ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY GIVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSTMS 
SOUTH AND WEST. PRECIP BEGINS TO TAPER OFF WITH THE SURFACE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING THROUGH 
THURSDAY DUE TO A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH AND A 30 KT UPSLOPE WIND AT 
850 MB. PRECIP COULD BRIEFLY TRANSITION TO SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT 
BEFORE ENDING. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF THIS PERIOD OF THE
FORECAST EXCEPT FOR MONDAY/TUESDAY WHERE GFS TRIES TO BRING A STORM
SYSTEM INTO THE REGION FASTER THAN THE ECMWF. TRENDED TIMING OF
THIS FEATURE A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF APPLYING A SLIGHT CHANCE
POP FOR SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT. KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST
DRY WITH PROBABILITY JUST A LITTLE TOO LOW FOR MENTION. SATURDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING A SHORTWAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT
LAKES ON ITS WAY INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. AND A COLD FRONT WILL
ACCOMPANY THIS SYSTEM. AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS SUFFICIENT MOISTURE
WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE TO PRODUCE PRECIPITATION. AFTER THIS TROF
MOVES AWAY...SHORT WAVE RIDGING WILL ALLOW FOR A BIT OF A WARMING
TREND WITH SOME SUNSHINE FOR MONDAY. BASICALLY FOLLOWED PREVIOUS
TEMPERATURE FORECAST WITH ONLY MINOR CHANGES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  50  60  42  51 /  10  80 100  60  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  45  58  43  49 /  10  70 100  80  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  46  58  43  49 /  10  70 100  70  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              57  39  56  44  48 /  10  50 100  90  50 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     WIND ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT EST WEDNESDAY 
     NIGHT FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FLOOD WATCH FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...LOUDON...
     MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH 
     SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST 
     GREENE...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SCOTT TN...
     SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...
     UNION...WASHINGTON TN...WEST POLK.

     WIND ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT EST WEDNESDAY 
     NIGHT FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...JOHNSON...NW BLOUNT...
     NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...

     WISE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EST MON MAR 7 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE 
NORTHEAST AND AWAY FROM THE AREA TONIGHT ALLOWING THE APPROACH OF 
THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM.  HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INCREASE ON

THEREFORE...WILL SEE DRY CONDITIONS AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR 
THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...BRIEF DRY PERIOD ENDS 
ABRUPTLY WEDNESDAY AS THE NEXT UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND COLD FRONT 
APPROACH. BEST INSTABILITY WILL BE ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
STATES...BUT STRONG LOW LEVEL JET AND FORCING WILL CREATE ANOTHER 
ROUND OF SHOWERS...ENDING AS SOME SNOW SHOWERS FOR NRN AREAS 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. EVEN WITH CONVECTION ONGOING TO OUR 
SOUTH...SHOULD SEE AVERAGE RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES 
AGAIN...SO PROBABLY WILL BE NEEDING A FLOOD WATCH BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. STRENGTH OF LOW LEVEL JET SHOULD 
JUSTIFY A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR THOSE SAME 
PERIODS.

OTHERWISE...DRY FORECAST OVER THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY...ALTHO A DRY 
COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL OCCUR ON SATURDAY. GFSX TEMPS WERE FAIRLY 
CONSISTENT FROM 07/00Z TO 07/12Z AND MAX/MIN TEMPS WERE ADJUSTED 
SLIGHTLY IN LINE WITH THIS TREND...AND TO MESH WITH NWS NEIGHBORS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST MON MAR 7 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
OVERCAST LOW CLOUDS WILL PERSIST OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE
MORNING. THE RUC MODEL SEEMS TO HAVE THE BEST HANDLE ON THE
SITUATION...AND TI SHOWS CLOUDS DISSIPATING BY LATE MORNING AS THE
925-850 FLOW TURNS FROM NORTH TO NORTHEAST AND BOUNDARY LAYER
MIXING PICKS UP. HOWEVER THE WINDOW OF SUNSHINE LOOKS SMALL AS
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS INCREASE IN THE AFTERNOON IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN
APPROACHING UPPER JET. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN TEMPERATURES A BIT
BELOW NORMAL TODAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS AND LOWS
TONIGHT IN THE 30S.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY. A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE
REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WITH GOOD LIFT AND
MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS GOING FOR
BOTH WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SHOULD ALSO BE WINDY ON
WEDNESDAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS THE LOW LEVEL
JET PASSES. UPPER TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION
ON THURSDAY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS
OF THE CWA WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE LINGERS. HIGH PRESSURE
RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY. MODELS INDICATING A WEAK
TROUGHS TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. WITH ONLY
LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE. WILL KEEP A DRY FORECAST FOR THE
WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES GENERALLY NEAR NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

469 
FXUS64 KMRX 062026 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...ADDED EXTRA INFO FOR TUESDAY NIGHT
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST SUN MAR 6 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF 
THE APPALACHIANS...WITH PRECIP SLOWLY EXITING THE FORECAST AREA. 
TEMPS HAVE BEEN MUCH COLDER TODAY THAN FORECASTED...WITH THE PRECIP 
ALSO SLOWER TO EXIT THE REGION. THIS SCENARIO HAS RESULTED IN AREAS 
OF SNOW...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...AND THE 
MOUNTAINS. HAVE EXTENDED THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
UNTIL 4 PM...WHEN THE HEAVIER ACCUMULATING SNOW SHOULD HAVE EXITED 
THE FORECAST AREA. WILL LET THE FLOOD WATCH FOR NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA EXPIRE AT 4 PM AS WELL...SINCE ONLY LIGHT PRECIP IS 
EXPECTED THIS EVENING. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA 
OF CLOUDS LINGERING UPSTREAM OVER THE ENTIRE TN AND OHIO RIVER 
VALLEYS...SO WILL PLAN TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH SKY COVER. HIGH 
PRESSURE THEN BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR TONIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED. MODELS AGREE 
THAT LIGHT PRECIP AHEAD OF THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM (FOR THE MIDDLE OF 
THE WEEK) WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. 
IN ADDITION...NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE THAT A GOOD SCENARIO FOR 
THE DEVELOPMENT OF MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL DEVELOP ON TUESDAY NIGHT. 
WITH A STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 70 TO 75 KT) PROGGED BY BOTH MODELS 
TO BE LOCATED OVER SOUTHEAST KY...IT APPEARS THAT IT COULD BE A HIGH 
END EVENT WITH WIND GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 75 MPH IN THE FOOTHILLS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARD THE COOLER 
NUMBERS SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE TREND LATELY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE 
EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HAVE INCREASED POPS ON WEDNESDAY TO LIKELY AND 
CONTINUE WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE UPPER LOW TO 
OUR NORTH WILL CONTINUE TO PULL IN MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT INTO 
THURSDAY...KEEPING SOME POPS IN...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN AREAS. 
SURFACE HIGH BUILDS BACK IN FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD FOR DRY 
CONDITIONS. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     29  54  36  61  44 /  10   0   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             29  54  37  61  45 /  10   0   0   0  20

1130 AM EST SUN MAR 6 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH PRECIP SLOWLY EXITING THE FORECAST 
AREA. THERE HAVE BEEN REPORTS OF RAIN MIXED WITH SNOW AND SLEET ON 
THE BACK EDGE OF THE PRECIP...WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. THUS...HAVE ALREADY 
ISSUED A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS UNTIL EARLY 
THIS AFTERNOON...WHEN THE ACCUMULATING PRECIP SHOULD HAVE EXITED THE 
FORECAST AREA. HAVE ALREADY CANCELED THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE 
FLOOD WATCH...SINCE RAIN HAS EXITED WITH ONLY A FEW MINOR REPORTS OF 
FLOODING RECEIVED THIS MORNING.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST EARLIER THIS MORNING...BUT WILL 
PLAN TO UPDATE AGAIN TO LOWER MAXES...AND TO TWEAK PRECIP WORDING 
AND HEADLINES.

FRONTAL PASSAGE THIS MORNING...SUSTAINED AROUND 10-15 KTS WITH SOME
GUSTS AROUND 20-25 POSSIBLE. WINDS WILL DROP OFF AND SKIES WILL
CLEAR AROUND SUNSET.

443 AM EST SUN MAR 6 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE
AREA EARLY TODAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS DURING THE MORNING
HOURS. WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL CONTINUE THE FLOOD
WATCH UNTIL ITS NORMAL EXPIRATION TIME. WITH THE CLOUDS AND
RAIN...PROBABLY WON'T SEE TEMPERATURES RISE MUCH TODAY. STAYED
NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS TONIGHT. WITH
RIDGE BUILDING IN BY LATE TONIGHT..WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES
FOR THE EVENING HOURS. SHOULD SEE DECREASING CLOUDS TONIGHT. STAYED
NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS
THROUGH THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP
CHANCES POPS GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS. UPPER TRACKS IS EXPECTED TO
TRACK THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS
FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE
LINGERS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES GENERALLY NEAR NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST SAT MAR 5 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...WITH A SLOW-MOVING COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. 
TOWER DATA IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND FOOTHILLS CONTINUE TO REPORT 
WIND SPEEDS IN THE ADVISORY RANGE...SO WILL CONTINUE THE WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS THROUGH THE EVENING. A LARGE CONVECTIVE 
COMPLEX WAS OCCURRING ALONG THE GULF COAST...WHICH APPEARS TO BE 
LIMITING THE FLOW OF MOISTURE NORTHWARD FLOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS CONTINUE TO SHOW AN MORE SOLID AREA OF RAIN OVER MIDDLE 
TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...BUT ITS INTENSITY HAS DECREASED SOME 
THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS AGREE THAT AN AMPLIFYING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL GENERATE SOME MORE LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BUT 
WITH LIMITED INSTABILITY EXPECTED...IT APPEARS THAT A PROLONGED 
RAINFALL WILL BE THE RESULT FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING...WITH 
AMOUNTS BETWEEN ONE AND TWO INCHES (WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS 
POSSIBLE) ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL PLAN TO KEEP THE 
FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT...SINCE THE GROUND IS LIKELY STILL SATURATED 
FROM THE HEAVY RAINFALL EARLIER THIS WEEK. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT THIS RAIN WILL EXIT THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN 
CONTROL FOR TUESDAY. MAIN WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE EXTENDED WILL BE A 
COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. MODELS SHOW SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING. FOR NOW...HAVE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE ON WEDNESDAY AND INCREASED POPS TO HIGH CHANCE FOR 
THIS AND CONTINUED CHANCE POPS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. POPS LINGER 
INTO THURSDAY AS THE UPPER LOW SWINGS THROUGH TO OUR NORTH. SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDS BACK IN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 051505
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST SAT MAR 5 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ALONG 
THE EASTERN SEABOARD...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. 
TOWER DATA IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ARE REPORTING WIND SPEEDS IN 
THE ADVISORY RANGE...SO WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY FOR 
THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS THROUGH THIS EVENING. AREA RADARS SHOW 
SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH AN EXTENSIVE 
AREA OF RAIN WEST OF NASHVILLE AND CLOSER TO THE FRONT. THIS MORE 
SOLID AREA OF RAIN WILL SLOWLY MOVE EASTWARD TODAY...AND SHOULD 
START TO AFFECT THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY LATE AFTERNOON. A LARGE 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX WAS DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHERN LA...WHICH MAY 
EVENTUALLY HELP TO LIMIT THE NORTHWARD FLOW OF MOISTURE FROM THE 
GULF OF MEXICO THIS AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION...A DOWNSLOPING 
SOUTHEASTERLY WIND FLOW WILL LIKELY HELP TO SUPPRESS RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS FOR MOST OF THE 
DAY...UNTIL THIS EVENING WHEN THE AREA OF RAIN SHOULD GRADUALLY 
BECOME MORE SOLID AS THE FRONT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO TWEAK THE PRECIP WORDING...AND TO RAISE THE 
AFTERNOON TEMPS A LITTLE IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREA TO 
ACCOUNT FOR SOME ADIABATIC WARMING FROM THE DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEAST 
WINDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 050842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 AM EST SAT MAR 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE WITH STRONG
UPPER DYNAMICS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND 
TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. A STRONG 300MB
JET OF 130KTS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS
PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION
OF THE JET. THE STRONG DIRECT AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATION AROUND THE
JET WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING OVER THE AREA WITH ALL
MODELS SHOWING A WAVE DEVELOPING ALONG THE INCOMING FRONT. THIS
WAVE WILL HELP SLOW THE FRONT KEEPING THE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING
OVER THE AREA LONGER. CIRA TOTAL PRECIPITABLE WATER ESTIMATES SHOW
A TONGUE OF GULF MOSTURE MOVING NORTH INTO THE WESTERN TENNESSEE
AND OHIO VALLEYS WITH OVER 200 PERCENT OF NORMAL PWS.

THE ENHANCED LIFT WILL COMBINE WITH THE HIGH PWS TO PRODUCE PERIODS
OF HEAVY RAINFALL LATE TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. GIVEN THE
ALREADY SATURATED GROUND FROM THIS WEEK HEAVY RAINS...THE
ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINFALL WILL ONCE AGAIN INCREASE THE CONCERN FOR
FLOODING/FLASH FLOODING OVER THE AREA. HAVE ISSUED A FLOOD WATCH
FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FROM 21Z TODAY THROUGH 21Z SUNDAY.

SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY NOTED ACROSS THE AREA AS WELL...SO WILL
NOT RULE OUT A RUMBLE OF THUNDER LATE TODAY AND OVERNIGHT.

THE STRONG 850MB BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL REMAIN AHEAD OF THE FRONT
PRODUCING WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA WINDS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GFS MOS HIGHS AT
TRI AND TYS DUE TO DOWNSLOPING EFFECTS.
 
.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT. WITH RIDGE BUILDING IN BY LATE SUNDAY NIGHT..SO WILL 
KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT 
TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WILL 
KEEP CHANCES POPS GOING FOR BOTH PERIODS. UPPER TRACKS IS EXPECTED 
TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS 
FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE 
LINGERS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY.  
TEMPERATURES GENERALLY NEAR NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

363 
FXUS64 KMRX 042025
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST FRI MAR 4 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE COAST 
OF NEW ENGLAND...CREATING A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO BRING DEEPER 
MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WHICH WILL EVENTUALLY LEAD 
TO A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT INTO SATURDAY. 
SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS...A VEERING WIND PROFILE...AND A SIZABLE STABLE 
LAYER WILL DEVELOP OVER THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT...SO IT APPEARS THAT A 
MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT WILL DEVELOP AROUND THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR 
IMMEDIATE FOOTHILLS. THE BIG QUESTION INVOLVES HOW STRONG THESE 
WINDS WILL BECOME...SINCE THE STRONGEST 850 WINDS APPEAR TO BE FAR 
ENOUGH NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TO PRODUCE ONLY ADVISORY LEVEL 
WINDS. THUS...WILL ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR 
FOOTHILLS FOR TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY EVENING. 

MODELS DO NOT REVEAL MUCH INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF MOSTLY SHOWERS WITH ONLY A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS. IN ADDITION...DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS SHOULD KEEP 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS SUPPRESSED IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS 
AREAS ON SATURDAY...BUT THEN A WIDESPREAD RAIN AROUND AN INCH OR TWO 
SHOULD DEVELOP AREAWIDE BY SATURDAY NIGHT. SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC WILL LIKELY RECEIVE THE GREATEST AMOUNTS OF RAIN (TWO 
TO TWO AND A HALF INCHES BY SUNDAY NIGHT)...ALTHOUGH A CONVECTIVE 
COMPLEX COULD DEVELOP ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH ON SATURDAY WHICH WOULD 
CUT-OFF THE MOISTURE FLOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA AND RESULT IN 
SMALLER RAINFALL AMOUNTS THAN WHAT IS CURRENTLY BEING FORECASTED. 
WITH MINIMAL TSTORM ACTIVITY ALSO EXPECTED...DO NOT THINK THAT FLASH 
FLOODING WILL BE A PROBLEM ALTHOUGH SOME RIVER FLOODING MAY DEVELOP 
BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY DUE TO THE LONG DURATION OF THE EXPECTED 
RAINFALL. WILL HOLD OFF WITH ISSUING ANY FLOOD WATCHES AT THIS TIME 
UNTIL THE CONVECTIVE SCENARIO FURTHER SOUTH (AND ITS IMPLICATIONS 
FOR THE FORECAST AREA) BECOMES MORE CERTAIN. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT 
AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL TREND WARMER THAN GUIDANCE OVER CENTRAL 
AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...SINCE THE 
DOWNSLOPE SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS WILL LIKELY PRODUCE ADIABATIC WARMING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY FOR A BENIGN WEATHER PATTERN. MAIN 
WEATHER FEATURE THIS EXTENDED CONTINUES TO BE A COLD FRONT PROGGED 
INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. GOOD MOISTURE AND 
ENERGY WITH THE SYSTEM AND EXPECTED WIDESPREAD SHOWERS TO MOVE 
THROUGH. HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT WITH SHOWERS LINGER INTO THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK 
IN FOR FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

HELP TO DIMINISH THESE SHOWERS AS THEY APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO RAISE AFTERNOON TEMPS A LITTLE AND TO MAKE A

TODAY...THUS WENT ON THE WARMER SIDE OF GUIDANCE.

HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT DOWNSLOPE WINDS INTO THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE VALLEY WILL LIMIT SHOWER COVERAGE THERE.

SATURDAY. WINDS SHOULD INCREASE WITH THE FRONT SO IT SHOULD BE BREEZY 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. INSTABILITY IS WEAK SO SEVERE WEATHER

THIS. MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS FOR TYS AND TRI GIVEN EXPECTED
DOWNSLOPING...BUT LOWER CLOUDS SHOULD MOVE IN AT CHA. WILL KEEP AT
VFR LEVELS...BUT MVFR LEVELS AT CHA CERTAINLY CANNOT BE RULED OUT.


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

802 
FXUS64 KMRX 031937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST THU MAR 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NEW ENGLAND...WITH A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW 
WILL CONTINUE TO BRING DEEPER MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT...WHICH WILL EVENTUALLY LEAD TO A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT. AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY ALONG A COLD FRONT...WITH 
SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS AND A VEERING WIND PROFILE DEVELOPING OVER THE 
MOUNTAINS. IT APPEARS THAT A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT MAY DEVELOP AROUND 
THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FOOTHILLS ON FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING...BUT RIGHT NOW AM NOT SURE IF IT WILL BE ABLE TO 
PRODUCE WARNING-LEVEL WINDS. THE STRONGEST AXIS OF 850 MB WINDS WILL 
BE LOCATED OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WHICH MAY BE TOO FAR 
REMOVED FROM THE MOUNTAINS TO PRODUCE WARNING-LEVEL WINDS. ALSO... 
THE WIND PROFILE OVER THE MOUNTAINS DOES NOT NECESSARILY INCREASE 
VERY QUICKLY WITH HEIGHT...SO THINK THAT A WIND ADVISORY MAY SUFFICE 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING. 

MODELS DO NOT REVEAL MUCH INSTABILITY WITH THE SYSTEM ON SATURDAY... 
SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF MOSTLY SHOWERS WITH ONLY A CHANCE 
FOR TSTORMS. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEASTERLY 
WINDS MAY KEEP RAIN AMOUNTS SUPPRESSED IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
VALLEYS AREAS...ALTHOUGH A WIDESPREAD RAIN OF AN INCH OR TWO WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC. THESE SOUTHERN AREAS 
SHOULD BE ABLE TO HANDLE THIS AMOUNT OF RAIN WITHOUT ANY FLOODING... 
UNLESS THIS RAIN FALLS TOO QUICKLY. BUT WITH MINIMAL TSTORM ACTIVITY 
EXPECTED...IT DOES NOT APPEAR RIGHT NOW THAT FLOODING WILL BE A 
PROBLEM WITH THIS SYSTEM. ALSO...CONVECTION APPEARS TO BE MORE 
LIKELY TOWARDS THE GULF COASTAL AREAS ON SATURDAY...WHICH COULD CUT 
OFF THE MOISTURE FLOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA RESULTING IN SMALLER 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS THAN WHAT IS CURRENTLY BEING PROGGED BY THE MODELS. 
AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL TREND TOWARDS THE 
WARMER GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH 
DOWNSLOPE SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RESIDUAL SHOWERS WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AND OUT OF THE AREA ON SUNDAY AS A COLD FRONT 
PULLS AWAY. A DRIER...COOLER SURFACE HIGH MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT 
AND WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER MONDAY AND TUESDAY. WEAK RIDGING ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH A WEATHER SYSTEM MOVING IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY FOR OUR NEXT CHANGE OF SHOWERS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST THU MAR 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND EASTERN SEABOARD THE 
NEXT 24-36 HOURS. AIRMASS WILL REMAIN DRY WITH RELATIVE HUMIDITIES 
DROPPING TO THE UPPER 20S TO MIDDLE 30S THIS AFTERNOON. UPPER FLOW

MAINLY MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS OVERNIGHT. FOLLOWED GFS MOS 
TEMPERATURES CLOSELY FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FAVORED MODELS FOR THESE
PERIODS IS A BLEND OF OOZ GFS/18Z GEFS/12Z ECMWF. NRN AND SRN
STREAM ENERGY IS ADVERTISED AS REMAINING SEPARATE...WITH STILL SOME
MINOR DIFFERENCES IN SURFACE PATTERNS. SHOWERS DO NOT APPEAR LIKELY
TO DEVELOP UNTIL LATE FRIDAY NIGHT...SO PER COORDINATION...POPS
WERE LOWERED SLIGHTLY FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.

MAIN PERIOD OF RAIN IS SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...AS ELONGATED
SURFACE LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACH. HOWEVER...I EXPECT
MAINLY SHOWERS WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS...AS BEST INSTABILITY
WILL BE TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES. ALSO...UPPER
LEVEL PATTERNS SUGGEST BEST DYNAMICS WILL BE TO OUR NORTH AND
SOUTH AS WELL. GULF COAST CONVECTION USUALLY INHIBITS TSRA FOR TN
VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS...BUT HARD TO DISAGREE WITH MOS
CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS
SHOULD FALL IN THE 3/4 TO 1 1/2 INCH RANGE...MUCH LESS THAN OUR
MOST RECENT SYSTEM ON MONDAY.

OTHERWISE...DAY SEVEN (WEDNESDAY) IS TRENDING WETTER...SO NUDGED
POPS UP A BIT TO BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS. MINOR TWEAKS TO
TEMPS AND DEW POINTS IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST WED MAR 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER KENTUCKY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL ONLY 
A THIN LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB WITH THIS FRONT...WITH A MID-

ANY SHOWERS TO DEVELOP ALONG THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY AS IT BECOMES 
QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY 
DRIFTS EASTWARD OVER NEW ENGLAND ON THURSDAY...WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...LEADING TO A CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AS MOISTURE INCREASES. WILL MENTION LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
FRIDAY...WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS... 
NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS PERSISTENCE WITH MAXES.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS NOT DRASTICALLY 
DIFFERENT IN SOLUTIONS FOR THIS PERIOD AND DEPICT A PARTIALLY PHASED 
SET OF SHORTWAVE SYSTEMS...ONE OVER THE MIDWEST AND THE OTHER OVER 
THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S....PROGRESSING INTO THE EASTERN STATES ON 
SATURDAY. IT LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER RELATIVELY LENGTHY PERIOD OF SHOWERS 
WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION AS THE SURFACE SYSTEM SHIFTS ONLY 
SLOWLY EAST TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY EVENING. WILL HAVE 
TO WATCH THIS EVENT DUE TO THE RECENT HEFTY RAINS THE AREA HAS 
ENDURED DURING THE PAST COUPLE WEEKS. TRAILING ENERGY ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE NORTHERN SYSTEM MAY KEEP A FEW SHOWERS GOING THROUGH SUNDAY 
BEFORE WRAPPING UP LATER SUNDAY EVENING. MONDAY AND TUESDAY STILL 
APPEAR TO BE DRY AS UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD AHEAD OF YET ANOTHER HEALTHY 
STORM SYSTEM EMERGING OUT OF THE PLAINS WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. 
APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR 
UNCERTAINTY IN SYSTEM TIMING.

248 AM EST WED MAR 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO

MUCH FROM MAV VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...RIDGING OR ZONAL FLOW
THROUGH LATE FRIDAY SHOULD KEEP FORECAST DRY UNTIL THE WEEKEND.
MODEL SOLUTIONS DIFFER ON KEY FEATURES OF THE UPPER LEVELS FOR
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING...SUCH AS PHASING OF NRN AND SRN 
STREAM SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND AMPLITUDE OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH.
SURFACE FEATURES SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT...BUT SENSIBLE SOLUTION IS A
BLEND OF GFS/NAM/ECMWF/GEFS FOR NOW (PER HPC).

ELONGATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE LIKELY TO DEVELOP VICINITY OF MID
TO LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...WHICH WILL ALLOW MORE GULF COAST
CONVECTION TO OUR SOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT...CONSIDERABLY DIFFERENT THAN
THE SCENARIO FOR OUR STORMY WEATHER THIS MONDAY. GULF COAST
CONVECTION USUALLY INTERCEPTS SOME GULF MOISTURE AND INHIBITS
CONVECTION OVER OUR FORECAST AREA. THUS...I FAVORED JUST SLIGHT POP
INCREASES FOR NOW FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. LIKELY POPS LOOK
RIGHT ON TRACK FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT I THINK IT IS TOO EARLY TO
HIGHLIGHT SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS AT THIS POINT.

DRY FORECAST CONTINUED FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...AS 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION. SOUTHERLY FLOW IN THE LOW
LEVELS DEVELOPS QUICKLY...ALLOWING TEMPS TO RECOVER TO SEASONAL
VALUES.

WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND WHILE STILL EARLY IT APPEARS SEVERE STORMS 
MAY BE POSSIBLE.  WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION IN HWO.  NAM WANTS TO 
BREAK OUT PRECIP WELL AHEAD OF MAIN SYSTEM THU NIGHT/FRIDAY...BUT 
OTHER MODELS INCLUDING SREF LESS BULLISH ON THIS IDEA...SO WILL JUST

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LINGERING LOW CLOUDS GRADUALLY
BREAKING UP AS NORTH WINDS BRING IN DRIER AIRMASS. TEMPS WILL START
OUT ON THE MILD SIDE DUE TO WINDS AND CLOUDS OVERNIGHT...SO WENT
WITH OR A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE WARMER MOS HIGHS FOR TODAY.

CLEAR TONIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING IN...TO ALLOW
LIGHT WINDS WHICH FAVORS COOLER MOS MINS.

OTHERWISE...SEVERAL UPDATES TO FOLLOW ON A FEW AREA STREAMS...
WHICH ARE RISING SLIGHTLY DUE TO YESTERDAY'S HEAVY RAINFALL. STAY
TUNED FOR THESE RIVER PRODUCTS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE LONG
TERM IS THE NEXT SYSTEM WHICH APPROACHES IN THE LATE SATURDAY TO
EARLY SUNDAY TIME FRAME. EXTENDED-RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE IN
REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM...ALTHOUGH SOME ENSEMBLE
MEMBERS KEEP PRECIP LINGERING INTO MONDAY. AS SUCH...DID NOT MAKE
ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. 

REMAINDER OF LONG TERM GENERALLY DRY WITH NEAR OR ABOVE CLIMO
TEMPS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX
GUIDANCE ALTHOUGH DID UNDERCUT GUIDANCE SLIGHTLY FOR SUNDAY AND
MONDAY BASED ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS.

KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON
SATURDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS INTO SATURDAY. FRONT INDICATING
INSTABILITY WITH IT...SO ADDED THUNDER FOR SATURDAY. UPPER TROUGH
FOLLOWS ON SUNDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SUNDAY. DRY
WEATHER RETURN ON MONDAY. ABOVE TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR MOST THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

118 
FXUS64 KMRX 281422
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 AM EST MON FEB 28 2011

.DISCUSSION...LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ENTERING WESTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA. CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE 
MORNING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
DEFINITELY THE CALM BEFORE THE STORM THIS MORNING...WITH SEVERE
WEATHER PARAMETERS COMING TOGETHER FOR A STORMY AFTERNOON.
INSTABILITY AND SHEAR FAVOR A LINE OF SEVERE STORMS WITH ISOLATED
TORNADOES ALSO POSSIBLE. LESS THREAT OF HAIL THAN OTHER SEVERE
WEATHER TYPES...WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS SUPPORTING PREVIOUS FLOOD
WATCH.

SURFACE OBSERVATIONS SHOW VERY STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN THIS MORNING...ESPECIALLY ABOVE 2500 FEET...EASILY MEETING 
WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. THUS...NO CHANGES TO NPW FOR WIND ADVISORY 
IN AREAL COVERAGE OR TIMING. THESE STRONG WINDS HAVE MIXED DOWN JUST 
ENOUGH TO THE SURFACE TO ALLOW DENSE FOG ADVISORY TO BE CANCELLED AT 
THIS TIME. 

OTHERWISE...VERY MILD TEMPS IN THE 50S AND 60S...SO SHOULD BE ABLE 
TO REACH THE WARMER MOS HIGHS BEFORE STORMS DEVELOP. MINS TONIGHT 
ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY DUE TO SOME WINDS STAYING UP A BIT FOR MIXING. 

MANY PRODUCTS TO UPDATE...INCLUDING SPS FOR SEVERE WEATHER THREAT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES TO START OFF MARCH AND MUCH
COOLER TEMPERATURES TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY COOLER
AS HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE SETTLES OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS...LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S. HIGH PRESSURE
CONTINUES WEDNESDAY WITH REINFORCING DRY COOL FRONT. SUNNY
CONDITIONS AGAIN THURSDAY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER DAYS AND CONTINUED
COOL NIGHTS. NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM TO BEGIN TO AFFECT FORECAST AREA
FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST AND WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH INTO
OHIO VALLEY. MAIN SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS FRIDAY AND
MOIST AIR MASS MOVING INTO TN VALLEY WILL ALLOW SLIGHT CHANCE
SHOWERS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. COLD FRONT APPROACHES LATE SATURDAY
WITH CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. SYSTEM IS SLOW MOVING SO RAIN CHANCES
CONTINUE THROUGH SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
629 AM EST MON FEB 28 2011

.AVIATION...STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH REGION LATE TODAY.
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WINDS ARE NOW INCREASING FROM THE SW. CEILINGS
ARE LOWERING RIGHT NOW AND WILL DROP TO AROUND 2500 FEET BY AFTERNOON
AND EVENING. ADDED TEMPO GROUPS FOR THUNDERSTORMS AT TRI LATE THIS
MORNING AND LATE THIS AFTERNOON BUT ONLY ONE GROUP AT TYS AND CHA
DURING THE AFTERNOON. HAVE NOT ADDED HIGH WINDS OR LOW VISIBILITIES
YET WITH THE THUNDERSTORMS AS TIMING STILL NOT YET CLEAR. MVFR TO
IFR CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPECTED AS LINES MOVE THROUGH. CONDITIONS
SHOULD IMPROVE BY ABOUT 06Z TUESDAY.

SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

607 
FXUS64 KMRX 280535
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1235 AM EST MON FEB 28 2011

.AVIATION...ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS WILL TRACK OVER THE AREA AS A 
WARM FRONT SLOWLY PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION.  ADDITIONALLY...AREAS 
OF DENSE FOG HAVE DEVELOPED...BUT THIS SHOULD IMPROVE OVERNIGHT AS 
THE WARM FRONT CONTINUES TO LIFT AWAY FROM THE AREA...AIDED BY 
PASSING SHOWERS OVER THE NEXT 1 TO 3 HOURS. THE SHOWERS WILL MIX THE 
STRONGER WINDS ALOFT TO THE SURFACE AND HELP TO DISSIPATE THE FOG...
AS NOTED RECENTLY AT TYS. THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY WILL MOST LIKELY BE 
ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 4 AM EST.

THE MAIN CONCERN THIS TAF PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE A STRONG COLD FRONT 
THAT WILL SLIDE THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY.  AHEAD OF THIS FRONT... 
WINDS WILL INCREASE...BECOMING STRONG AND GUSTY WITH A LINE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING VERY STRONG WINDS...VERY HEAVY 
RAIN AND HAIL MOVING THROUGH.  AS A STORM MOVES ACROSS A TAF 
SITE...MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPECTED...BUT WILL LET 
LATER SHIFTS DETAIL WHEN THIS MIGHT HAPPEN...AND NOT CARRY TSTMS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
740 PM EST SUN FEB 27 2011

.DISCUSSION...PATCHY DENSE FOG IS DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA AS A WARM 
FRONT MOVES NORTH ACROSS THE REGION.  WILL CONTINUE TO SEE A FEW 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE EVENING...THOUGH THE BULK OF 
THIS ACTIVITY IS LIFTING NORTH OF THE AREA.  HOWEVER...AN 
ADVANCING COLD FRONT WILL BRING IN ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION 
TOWARDS MORNING.  WINDS WILL INCREASE...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN.  A WIND ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED...SEE MEMNPWMRX FOR 
DETAILS.  INITIAL CONVECTION OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT MAY MOVE IN 
TOWARDS MORNING.  SOME OF THESE STORMS WILL BE CAPABLE OF 
STRONG...GUSTY WINDS...VERY HEAVY RAIN AND HAIL.  THE MAIN LINE OF 
CONVECTION SHOULD MOVE THROUGH ON MONDAY AND IS EXPECTED TO CREATE 
VERY STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS.  ADDITIONALLY... HEAVY RAINFALL 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM COULD CAUSE SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING AND 
A FLOOD WATCH HAS ALSO BEEN ISSUED.  ALL HANDLED WELL IN THE CURRENT 
FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND ADD PATCHY FOG 
TO THE FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST SUN FEB 27 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP NEAR WARM FRONT THIS AFTERNOON. 
WARM FRONT AND UPPER SUPPORT PROGGED TO MOVE NORTH OF AREA TONIGHT. 
SOME BACK BUILDING HAS BEEN OCCURRING SO KEPT POPS RELATIVELY HIGH 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS THIS EVENING. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET DEVELOPS 
TONIGHT AND CONTINUES MONDAY. DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WITH GOOD 
MOISTURE TRANSPORT. PWATS VALUES INCREASE TO NEAR 200% NORMAL. DEW 
POINTS RISE TO NEAR 60. CAPE VALUES INCREASE TO A FEW HUNDRED J/KG 
EARLY MONDAY. THATS A GOOD SET UP FOR POTENTIALLY SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS AND HEAVY RAINFALL FOR LATE FEBRUARY. UPPER SHORT WAVE 
FILLING AS IT MOVES NORTHEAST THROUGH TN VALLEY MONDAY. JET SEGMENT 
EAST OF TROUGH REMAINS STRONG AS THIS FEATURE MOVES EAST INTO 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY EVENING. LAYER SHEAR VALUES ARE 
FAVORABLE FOR ONGOING CONVECTIVE LINE TO MAINTAIN STRONG TO SEVERE 
STRENGTH AS IT MOVES INTO MRX CWA MONDAY. HELICITY VALUES SUFFICIENT 
FOR ISOLATED TORNADO DEVELOPMENT. SPC HAS ELEVATED THE AREA INTO A 
MODERATE RISK FOR MONDAY. THURSDAYS RAINFALL AND THIS EVENINGS 
RAINFALL WILL PRIME NORTHERN AREAS OF MRX CWA FOR FLOODING. MOST THE 
OF THE STRONG ACTIVITY SHOULD MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BETWEEN 
6-10 PM EST. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN QUICKLY MONDAY NIGHT WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES NOT VERY 
COLD BEHIND FRONT. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE LINGERS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. A TROUGH 
ENTERS THE REGION ON FRIDAY. WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
EXPECTED...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY. A FRONT ENTERS 
THE REGION ON SATURDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE CHANCE POPS INTO SATURDAY. 
FRONT INDICATING INSTABILITY WITH IT...SO ADDED THUNDER FOR 
SATURDAY. UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS ON SUNDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
GOING FOR SUNDAY. ABOVE TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR MOST THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EST SUN FEB 27 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NOCTURNAL LOW LEVEL JET CREATING 
SOME GUSTY SW-W WINDS THIS MORNING...WHICH IS KEEPING TEMPS VERY 
MILD AROUND 2000 FEET AND UP. THESE WINDS WILL DECREASE QUICKLY 
AFTER DAYBREAK...SO NO ADVISORY FOR TODAY.

NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF CLOUDS YET AND THE WEAK WARM FRONT APPEARS TO 
BE IN THE VICINITY OF TN-KY STATE LINE TO ACROSS SW VA. THREAT OF 
CONVECTION FOR TODAY LOOKS MINIMAL...AND I TRENDED POPS TOWARD THE 
LOWER MOS POPS...AS DID ADJACENT NWS OFFICES AS WELL. CLOUDS WILL 
GRADUALLY INCREASE...BUT WARMER MOS HIGHS LOOK GOOD...BASED ON MOS 
BEING TOO COOL FOR HIGHS ON SATURDAY. 

SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE APPROACHING WESTERN MOST 
COUNTIES LATE TONIGHT...AND WINDY CONDITIONS SHOULD DEVELOP AHEAD OF 
CONVECTION BETWEEN 06Z AND 09Z MONDAY. STRENGTH OF SW LOW LEVEL JET 
SHOULD PRODUCE WIND ADVISORY SPEEDS/GUSTS FOR HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS
...AND LAST INTO MONDAY AFTERNOON GIVEN STRONG GRADIENT AHEAD OF AND 
BEHIND COLD FRONT. THE GUSTY WINDS AND LATE ARRIVAL OF CONVECTION 
FAVORS MILDER MOS MIN TEMPS FOR TONIGHT

NPW ISSUED FOR HIGHER TERRAIN OF E TN...SW VA AND SW NC AREAS...AND 
WILL ALSO CONSIDER UPDATING OUR SPS...OR HIGHLIGHT SEVERE THREAT FOR 
MONDAY IN THE HWO.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...EARLY MONDAY SHOWERS AND
POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. STRONG
SOUTHWEST WINDS OF ABOUT 50 TO 60 KNOTS AT 850 MB WILL KEEP WIND
ADVISORY GOING THROUGH THE DAY. POSSIBLE EARLY MORNING SQUALL LINE
WILL BE MOVING THROUGH WEST TN. THIS FEATURE WILL LIKELY WEAKEN
DURING THE MORNING AS IT NEARS THE PLATEAU AND THEN REDEVELOP
BETWEEN 18 AND 00Z. DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE MAIN THREAT. NCEP
FORECASTING RAINFALL AMOUNTS FROM ONE HALF TO ONE INCH POSSIBLE
MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF FORECAST AREA WITH
SHOWERS ENDING MAINLY BEFORE MIDNIGHT AND MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES.
A FEW SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE NE BEFORE PRECIPITATION ENDS. TUESDAY
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CLEAR SKIES AND SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. THIS
PATTERN SHOULD HOLD THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. GRADUAL INCREASE IN
MOISTURE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WITH NEW SYSTEM. BETTER CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDER SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST SAT FEB 26 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO SLIDE EAST OF THE AREA. A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH 
THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TONIGHT. SOME HIGH CLOUDS TONIGHT WITH 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE 
WARM FRONT AND MOVE TO THE EAST. AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM IS ALSO 
POSSIBLE SUNDAY WITH TEMPERATURES CLIMBING INTO THE 70S MOST AREAS. 
FAST MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE NORTHEAST FROM OK SUNDAY 
NIGHT.  THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE TO THE GREAT LAKES BY MONDAY MORNING. 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY MONDAY EVE. WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AND MOVE INTO THE EAST TENNESSEE 
VALLEY BY EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON. DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN 
THREAT. TEMPERATURES WILL RISE INTO THE 70S MOST AREAS AND SOUTHWEST 
WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG BEFORE THE ONSET OF THE STORMS. THE SHOWERS 
WILL TAPER OFF FAST MONDAY NIGHT FOLLOWED BY A FAIRLY FAST DROP IN 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. A TROUGH ENTERS 
THE REGION ON FRIDAY. WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON 
SATURDAY...WITH MOISTURE LINGERING WILL ADD CHANCE POPS FOR 
SATURDAY. FRONT INDICATING INSTABILITY WITH IT...SO ADDED THUNDER 
FOR SATURDAY. ABOVE TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR MOST THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EST SAT FEB 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND MID ATLANTIC STATES THIS MORNING WILL SLIP EASTWARD 
AS HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT BUILDS ACROSS THE SE STATES INTO SUNDAY. DRY 
WEATHER EXPECTED WITH COOL TEMPS THIS MORNING WARMING NICELY TO A 
FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMALS THIS AFTERNOON. SCATTERED TO BROKEN LOW 
CLOUDS OVER SW VA SHOULD CONTINUE TO DECREASE THROUGH DAYBREAK...SO 
I TRENDED TOWARD THE WARMER MOS HIGHS.

FOR TONIGHT...A VERY WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW GETS UNDERWAY 
LATE AS THE SURFACE HIGH MOVES EAST...BUT CLOUDS DON'T SEEM TO 
INCREASE MUCH UNTIL RIGHT BEFORE DAYBREAK. LACK OF CLOUDS WILL BE 
OFFSET BY WARMING 850 MB TEMPS...SO A BLEND OF MOS LOWS SEEMED BEST 
CHOICE FOR NOW.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MOISTURE INCREASES WITH WARM 
FRONT PASSING TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION AND LOW LEVEL MOIST SOUTH 
TO SOUTHWEST FLOW INCREASES SUNDAY. AIR MASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY 
UNSTABLE WITH SHOWERS DEVELOPING. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. TEMPERATURES MUCH WARMER SUNDAY AS WARM AIR 
SURGES NORTH. RAISED TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES TO FOLLOW CLOSE TO 
COOLER MAV GUIDANCE. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES 
NE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND THEN EASTERN 
CANADA. SOUTHWEST WINDS INCREASE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY NIGHT 
CONTINUING MONDAY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY WITH SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. SHOWERS END MONDAY 
NIGHT AND MUCH COLDER BY MORNING. LOWS IN THE 30S. HIGH PRESSURE 
TAKES CONTROL TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH NEAR AVERAGE LOWS IN THE 
30S AND HIGHS IN THE 50S. HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST FRIDAY WITH 
INCREASED MOISTURE RETURN FROM THE GULF. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
INTRODUCED FRIDAY.

DUE TO MOIST LOW LEVEL CONVERGENT FLOW. INCREASING MOISTURE AND 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES SUNDAY NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO 
MOVE IN THE AREA ON MONDAY. SINCE THERE IS RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE MODELS...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY. STRONG WINDS ARE 
EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT ALONG WITH POSSIBILITY OF FEW STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING WITH IT. THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA QUICKLY 
ON MONDAY NIGHT. WITH THE UPPER TROUGH ALSO EXITING QUICKLY...WILL 
KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. ANOTHER 
FRONT ENTERING THE REGION FRIDAY. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON 
TIMING...WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW. ABOVE TEMPERATURES EXPECTED

404 AM EST FRI FEB 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN EVENT WINDING DOWN THIS

HIGHEST ELEVATIONS WHERE OUR HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT.

WATCH WAS CANCELED AT THAT TIME. KEPT EXPIRATION TIME AT 10 AM EST
FOR HIGH WIND WARNING...AND THE WIND ADVISORY THROUGH 3 PM EST
TODAY.

PRE FIRST PERIOD OF ZFPMRX WILL COVER LINGERING CONVECTION...AND
I WILL MOST LIKELY UPDATE AGAIN AROUND 6AM OR SO...TO LOWER POPS
AND REMOVE ANY MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. MAX TEMPS TO OCCUR THIS
MORNING...THEN TEMPS MOSTLY IN THE 40S TO LOW OR MID 50S AS COLDER
AIR SPREADS IN.  

LITTLE TO NO CHANGES MADE FOR TONIGHT...EXCEPT TO TWEAK MIN TEMPS
UP A BIT IN LINE WITH 25/00Z MOS GUIDANCE AND NEIGHBORING OFFICES
GRIDS. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NOT MUCH TIME TO ANALZYE
THESE PERIODS...WITH THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING BY
SUNDAY. MOS POPS...ESPECIALLY NAM...HAVE INCREASED ON SUNDAY...BUT
THE SHOWERS SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT OR EARLY MONDAY...
IN LINE WITH ECMWF. THUS...I WILL DEFER ANY GRID CHANGES FOR SUNDAY
THROUGH MONDAY TO DAY SHIFT. LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES SUNDAY NIGHT
AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT...SO GUSTY WINDS AND A CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN.

TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY STILL LOOKS DRY WITH SURFACE AND UPPER
RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE REGION.
