NORTHWEST TN...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT STRETCHING EAST ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY AND BISECTING THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH WINDS DUE 
TO MOUNTAIN WAVES ARE CURRENTLY BEING REPORTED AROUND THE 
FOOTHILLS...WITH THE COVE MTN FIRE TOWER REPORTING WIND GUSTS UP TO 
71 MPH AND CAMP CREEK GUSTING UP TO 54 MPH. EXPECT THESE HIGH WINDS 
TO INCREASE FURTHER THROUGH THE NIGHT...SINCE MODELS INDICATE A VERY 
STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 70 TO 80 KT) ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT 
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A SQUALL LINE OF CONVECTION 
WAS OCCURRING ALONG THE COLD FRONT OVER WEST TN...AND EXPECT THIS 
CONVECTIVE LINE TO CONTINUE ADVANCING EASTWARD INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA LATER TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODELS STILL INDICATE THAT 
INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAKENING OVERNIGHT...BUT STILL EXPECT SOME 
STORMS TO PRODUCE DAMAGING WINDS DUE TO THE STRONG UPPER-LEVEL WINDS 
ALONG THE COLD FRONT.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO TWEAK THE 
TEMPS AND PRECIP WORDING ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

322 PM EST THU FEB 24 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...DEEPENING SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE MOVES NORTHEAST FROM AR THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. 
ONGOING PRECIPITATION ACROSS NORTHERN PART OF MRX CWA WILL LIFT 
NORTH THIS EVENING AS UPPER LIFT AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE MOVES 
DEEPER INTO KY. SOUTHERLY H85 JET INCREASES TO NEAR 80 KTS BRIEFLY 
TONIGHT IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT. ONGOING PREFRONTAL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY THIS EVENING AND 
INTO THE MRX CWA OVERNIGHT. SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SEVERE STORMS MAINLY 
ACROSS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WITH DAMAGING WINDS THE MAIN THREAT. 
SEVERAL HOURS BREAK BETWEEN TODAYS PCPN AND TONIGHTS CONVECTIVE 
LINE. THIS SHOULD HELP AVOID ANY FLOODING PROBLEMS. SOUTHERLY WINDS 
WILL PICK UP TONIGHT AS GRADIENT TIGHTENS NEAR THE SURFACE LOW. 
WINDS MAY RELAX BRIEFLY AFTER THE CONVECTION IN THE FRONTAL TROUGH 
BUT WILL SHIFT SW AND BECOME GUSTY FRI MORNING. SHOWERS SLOWLY TAPER 
OFF FRI MORNING. WINDS WILL SHIFT TOWARDS THE NW AND BACK OFF BY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON. COLD AIR ADVECTION NOT VERY STRONG FRI BUT DOES 
KICK IN FOR FRI NGT WHEN TEMPS FALL BACK TO BELOW FREEZING. SURFACE 
RIDGE OVER AREA FRI NGT SHIFTS EAST SAT WITH WARM UP TO ABOVE NORMAL 
AND DRY CONDITIONS.   

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORTWAVE IS 
EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH AREA ON SUNDAY. WITH AN INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL BUMP UP POPS A BIT FOR SUNDAY.  A COLD 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE IN THE AREA BY MONDAY. SINCE THERE IS 
RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE MODELS...WILL GO FOR LIKELY POPS 
FOR MONDAY. THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA QUICKLY ON MONDAY NIGHT. WITH 
THE UPPER TROUGH ALSO EXITING QUICKLY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY 
WEATHER FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. ABOVE TEMPERATURES EXPECTED 
FOR MOST THE EXTENDED PERIOD...STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 241550
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EST THU FEB 24 2011

.DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO RAISE POPS NORTHERN AREAS AND LOWER MAX TEMPS
ALL AREAS. BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE STALLING ALONG TN/KY 
BORDER. TRAINING ALONG BOUNDARY COULD CAUSE MINOR AND POSSIBLY MAJOR
FLOODING ACROSS SW VA. HIGH WIND WATCH WILL LIKELY BE UPDATED TO WARNING
FOR TONIGHT. ALSO WIND ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED ELSEWHERE. SON


.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARM FRONT LIFTING ACROSS THE 
REGION TODAY WILL BRING IN SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS.  THE MAIN BAND 
OF RAIN IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AND REMAIN TO OUR WEST AND 
NORTH...HOWEVER SHOULD SEE SOME ACTIVITY OVER THE AREA...ESPECIALLY 
FROM THE NORTHERN PLATEAU INTO SW VIRGINIA.  ADDITIONALLY...LOCALLY 
BREEZY CONDITIONS WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT.  OF GREATER CONCERN WILL 
BE A COLD FRONT PASSAGE TONIGHT.  THIS FRONT WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY 
A STRONG 850MB JET...WHICH WILL INCREASE WINDS ACROSS THE REGION.  
VERY STRONG WINDS ARE EXPECTED OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE WINDS OF 
25 TO 40 MPH AND GUSTS TO 60 MPH ARE POSSIBLE.  A HIGH WIND WATCH 
REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR THIS AREA.  ALSO...AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A BAND 
OF CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP.  A LINE SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE THROUGH OVERNIGHT.  THIS LINE WILL BE 
CAPABLE OF HEAVY RAIN AND IF IT CAN TAP INTO THE STRONG WINDS ALOFT 
COULD PRODUCE STRONG AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS HAVE COME INTO 
BETTER AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM...LEADING TO HIGHER 
CONFIDENCE THAN THIS TIME LAST NIGHT.  AFTER ANY LINGERING SHOWERS 
END FRIDAY...SHOULD BE DRY FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SAT NIGHT.  
ANOTHER POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM FORECAST TO AFFECT THE AREA 
IN THE SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME...AND WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A FAIRLY STRONG WIND FIELD MAY SEE SOME POTENTIAL FOR 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY TIME FRAME.  LOOKS 
LIKE HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY. GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT 
STRAY FAR.

250 
FXUS64 KMRX 240216
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST WED FEB 23 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH... 
GENERALLY STRETCHING FROM NEAR MEMPHIS SOUTHEASTWARD TO NEAR 
BIRMINGHAM AND SAVANNAH GA. A VERY DRY AIR MASS REMAINS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH LOCAL RADARS REVEALING ONLY VERY LIGHT SHOWERS 
WHICH ARE LIKELY EVAPORATING BEFORE REACHING THE GROUND. HOWEVER... 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN ARE LIKELY PRODUCING RAIN 
AT THE SURFACE...AND WILL LIKELY SPREAD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS. OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT 
APPEARS TO GENERALLY BE ON TRACK.

THE MAIN CONCERN FOR TONIGHT INVOLVES THE APPROACH OF THE STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ON THURSDAY NIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A 
SURFACE-BASED STABLE LAYER OVER THE MOUNTAINS AS SOUTHERLY WINDS 
INTENSIFIES THROUGHOUT THE DAY. A VERY STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 70 
TO 80 KT) IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER KY AFTER SUNSET THURSDAY 
NIGHT...WHICH WILL PRODUCE A GOOD SCENARIO FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
MOUNTAIN WAVES IN THE WESTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. IN 
FACT...IT APPEARS THAT THIS COULD BE A HIGH END EVENT WITH WIND 
GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 60 MPH OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR ADJACENT 
FOOTHILLS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A HIGH WIND WATCH FOR THESE 
AREAS BEGINNING LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH 
FRIDAY MORNING.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FRONT MOVES NORTH THROUGH THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY. UPPER HEIGHTS 
BUILD OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS STREAM ACROSS 
THE AREA. WENT ABOVE GUIDANCE ON MIN TEMPS TONIGHT. WEAK ISENTROPIC 
LIFT COULD BRING SOME PCPN INTO THE AREA MAINLY AFFECTING WESTERN 
AREA. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW INCREASES THROUGH THE LAYER THURSDAY AS 
UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. PWAT VALUES RISE TO NEAR
1.00 WHICH IS WELL ABOVE SEASONAL NORMAL. BEST UPPER LIFT WILL BE 
ALONG WARM FRONT WHICH IS PROGGED TO BE NORTHWEST OF MRX CWA. BEST 
FOCUS OF HEAVY RAIN SHOULD BE ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND KENTUCKY BUT 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL BE CLOSE TO THE ACTION AND SHIFT IN 
MODEL SOLUTION COULD RESULT IN A DETERIORATING FORECAST. SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORM THREAT FOR AREAS SW OF MRX CWA. VERY SMALL CHANCE THIS 
ACTIVITY COULD REACH SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AHEAD OF COLD FRONT 
LATE THURSDAY. INSTABILITY LIMITED AND SHEAR PARAMETERS DROP OFF AS 
DEEP CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA 
THURSDAY NIGHT. AGAIN SEVERE THREAT APPEARS LOW AT THIS TIME. PWAT 
VALUES PEAK NEAR 1.50 THURSDAY NIGHT WHICH IS VERY HIGH FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR. HEAVY RAINFALL LIKELY AS THE PREFRONTAL CONVECTION 
MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. MINOR FLOODING IS POSSIBLE BUT MOST 
AREAS SHOULD BE ABLE TO RECEIVE EXPECTED RAINFALL AMOUNTS. FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH ON FRIDAY. BULK OF PCPN SHOULD MOVE OFF EARLY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE STEADY OF FALL BY FRIDAY AFTN.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ANOTHER POTENTIALLY 
SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY 
LATE SUNDAY PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. SLIGHT DIFFERENCES IN 
TIMING PRECLUDE PINPOINTING EXACT ONSET AND DEPARTURE OF PRECIP 
ACCOMPANYING THIS SYSTEM AT THIS TIME. THUS HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE 
POPS FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. ALSO INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDER IN THE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY PERIODS AS COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE AREA. BALANCE OF FORECAST APPEARS DRY AT THIS TIME WITH 
TEMPS CONTINUING ABOVE CLIMO EARLY IN THE LONG TERM BEFORE DROPPING 
BACK TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  66  55  58  33 /  20  50 100  50  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  62  54  58  32 /  20  80 100  60  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  60  53  57  31 /  30  90 100  50  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST WED FEB 23 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. HIGH CLOUDS WILL 
STREAM INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. WINDS REMAIN LIGHT. TEMPS WILL
JUST NICELY THIS AFTERNOON. SON

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL 
TODAY FOR A TRANQUIL...WARM AFTERNOON.  A WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACHING 
THE AREA OVERNIGHT WILL INCREASE CLOUDS DURING THE EVENING WITH THE 
INITIAL BAND OF SHOWERS POSSIBLY PUSHING INTO THE AREA TOWARDS 
MORNING.  WILL KEEP POPS AT CHANCE WEST...SLIGHT CHANCE EAST JUST 
BEFORE SUNRISE AND AIR MASS SHOULD REMAIN STABLE ENOUGH FOR NO 
THUNDER.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD...BUT BEGIN TO DIVERGE LATE.   APPROACHING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK BY TO OUR WEST AND NORTH THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT...DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA THU 
NIGHT/EARLY FRIDAY.  THIS SYSTEM SHOULD BRING SOME SIGNIFICANT RAINS 
TO THE AREA...ALONG WITH THE CHANCE FOR SOME THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  LOW LEVEL JET WILL BE QUITE STRONG...AND SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT AS WELL. WINDS WILL BE FAIRLY 
STRONG AND GUSTY...AND WIND ADVISORIES MAY NEED TO BE ISSUED AS 
EVENT GETS CLOSER.  WILL MENTION IN HWO.  THINGS SHOULD DRY OUT FOR 
SATURDAY...BUT BY SUNDAY NEXT SYSTEM MAY BE APPROACHING.  MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES DIFFER IN TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH GFS QUICKER BY 
ABOUT 24 HOURS OVER THE SLOWER ECMWF...AND DIFFERENT ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
LENDING SUPPORT TO BOTH CAMPS.  WILL LEAN TOWARD THE GFS...BUT 
SPREAD POPS OUT A BIT GIVEN UNCERTAINTY.  MAY BE SOME THUNDER WITH 
THIS SYSTEM AS WELL...AND FOR NOW WILL INCLUDE MENTION FOR MONDAY.  
WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

137 
FXUS64 KMRX 221953
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST TUE FEB 22 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY PASSING 
THROUGH EASTERN KY AND SW VA THIS AFTERNOON. A FEW SPRINKLES 
POSSIBLE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON SW VA OTHERWISE DRY FOR THE NEXT 24 
HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND WEAK RIDGING ALOFT WILL 
ALLOW CLOUDS TO DECREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH TONIGHT. NE SECTIONS 
WILL HOLD ON TO CLOUDS FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT BEFORE CLEARING EARLY 
WEDNESDAY. LOWS MUCH COOLER TONIGHT NEAR TO JUST BELOW FREEZING. FOR 
WEDNESDAY SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY WITH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
THAN TODAY MID 50S TO MID 60S. MAV TEMPS LOOK GOOD TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY SO FORECAST CLOSE TO THEM.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE COMING 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN 
THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT THEN BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH THE EVOLUTION AND 
TIMING OF THE NEXT STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. A 
WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY 
LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...WITH MODELS IN AGREEMENT THAT A 
STRONG SOUTHERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW WILL DEVELOP AGAINST THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY AND PRODUCE THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 
THERE REMAINS SOME DISAGREEMENTS AMONG THE MODELS WITH THE EXACT 
PLACEMENT OF THIS WARM FRONT ON THURSDAY...BUT WILL GENERALLY GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS AREAWIDE. BY THURSDAY NIGHT...A STRONG LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT LIKELY CREATING AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE TSTORMS 
OVER THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY. WHILE THE MODELS 
AGREE THAT THE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL ONLY BE 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE ON THURSDAY NIGHT (PARTIALLY ATTRIBUTED TO THE 
LATE ARRIVAL OF THE COLD FRONT AFTER MIDNIGHT)...A STRONG 850 MB 
WIND FLOW ALONG THE FRONT MAY STILL CREATE SOME STRONG WIND GUSTS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS CONVECTIVE LINE. 

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND THEN MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY. ECMWF AND GFS MODELS REVEAL SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES 
WITH THIS NEXT SYSTEM...WITH THE GFS MODEL ALMOST 24 HOURS FASTER 
THAN THE ECMWF MODEL. BOTH MODELS AGREE THAT THIS SYSTEM COULD 
PRODUCE MORE INSTABILITY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THAN THE FIRST 
SYSTEM...SO WILL MENTION TSTORMS FOR BOTH MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THE TIMING DIFFERENCES. A WARM FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH 
THIS SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA FIRST...SOMETIME 
AROUND SUNDAY OR SUNDAY NIGHT. THUS...WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SEVERE 
TSTORMS WITH THE COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT...AND WITH THE SYSTEM 
FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS OF THE ENSEMBLE MEANS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

152 
FXUS64 KMRX 220229
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
928 PM EST MON FEB 21 2011

.DISCUSSION...RAIN TRACKING THROUGH MIDDLE TN ASSOIATED WITH THE 
FRONT.  CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD. WINDS SHOULD ALSO DECREASE TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST ALSO ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO 
REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AT MID AFTERNOON SKIES WERE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY AND WARM WITH A STRONG SOUTHWEST WIND AREA WIDE. WINDS 
AVERAGED 15 TO 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 35 MPH AND IN A FEW PLACES 
AROUND 40 MPH. THIS IS JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. TEMPERATURES 
HAD CLIMBED TO THE UPPER 50S HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO UPPER 60S AND 
LOWER 70S VALLEYS...ONLY A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR THE 
DATE. COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH THE CLOSEST 
SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS NORTHERN AND WESTERN KY. LOWERED AFTERNOON 
RAIN CHANCES BUT LEFT HIGHER POPS IN TONIGHT AS SHOWERS SHOULD 
DEVELOP DURING THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN BETWEEN ABOUT 3 AND 12Z WITH SHOWERS EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. RAINFALL AMOUNTS STILL LIGHT 
MAINLY ONE QUARTER INCH OR LESS. WINDS EXPECTED TO STAY STRONG AHEAD 
OF FRONT AND THEN DECREASE BEHIND THE FRONT AFTER MIDNIGHT. WILL 
INCLUDE LATE AFTERNOON WORDING WITH WINDS GUSTING TO 35 MPH UNTIL 
SUNSET. LOWS TONIGHT MOSTLY MID 40S TO LOWER 50S. HIGHS TUESDAY AS 
SKIES CLEAR ABOUT 10 DEGREES COOLER...STILL A A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR LATE FEBRUARY.      

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES DURING THE EXTENDED FORECAST WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THE 
LARGE-SCALE PATTERN...BUT GENERALLY AGREE THAT AN ACTIVE PATTERN 
WILL DEVELOP THIS WEEK WITH TWO SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA 
AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY AND SUNDAY/MONDAY TIME FRAMES. IT APPEARS 
THAT THE FIRST SYSTEM COULD PRODUCE AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE TSTORMS 
OVER WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...WITH THIS 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY THEN LIKELY CONGEALING INTO A LINE AS IT MOVES 
EASTWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT. GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS AGREE THAT A MORE STABLE AIR MASS WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT...SO EXPECT THIS CONVECTION TO WEAKEN 
AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...A STRONG 850 MB JET 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA MAY STILL CREATE SOME STRONG WIND GUSTS WITH 
THIS CONVECTIVE LINE. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE COLD FRONT. THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON 
SUNDAY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA AROUND SUNDAY NIGHT. THE LATEST ECMWF MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT 
THIS SYSTEM COULD PRODUCE MORE INSTABILITY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
THAN THE FIRST SYSTEM...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION SHOWERS SINCE 
THE GFS MODEL REVEALS A WEAKER SYSTEM AT THIS TIME. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS OF THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   49  61  33  63  42 /  60  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     48  56  32  61  39 /  70  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             46  56  32  61  40 /  60  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    45  54  30  58  33 /  70  10   0   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

309 
FXUS64 KMRX 212253
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
553 PM EST MON FEB 21 2011

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED TO REMOVE AFTERNOON PERIOD. NO OTHER CHANGES 
MADE AT THIS TIME.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AT MID AFTERNOON SKIES WERE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY AND WARM WITH A STRONG SOUTHWEST WIND AREA WIDE. WINDS 
AVERAGED 15 TO 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 35 MPH AND IN A FEW PLACES 
AROUND 40 MPH. THIS IS JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. TEMPERATURES 
HAD CLIMBED TO THE UPPER 50S HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO UPPER 60S AND 
LOWER 70S VALLEYS...ONLY A FEW DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR THE 
DATE. COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH THE CLOSEST 
SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS NORTHERN AND WESTERN KY. LOWERED AFTERNOON 
RAIN CHANCES BUT LEFT HIGHER POPS IN TONIGHT AS SHOWERS SHOULD 
DEVELOP DURING THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN BETWEEN ABOUT 3 AND 12Z WITH SHOWERS EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. RAINFALL AMOUNTS STILL LIGHT 
MAINLY ONE QUARTER INCH OR LESS. WINDS EXPECTED TO STAY STRONG AHEAD 
OF FRONT AND THEN DECREASE BEHIND THE FRONT AFTER MIDNIGHT. WILL 
INCLUDE LATE AFTERNOON WORDING WITH WINDS GUSTING TO 35 MPH UNTIL 
SUNSET. LOWS TONIGHT MOSTLY MID 40S TO LOWER 50S. HIGHS TUESDAY AS 
SKIES CLEAR ABOUT 10 DEGREES COOLER...STILL A A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR LATE FEBRUARY.      

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES DURING THE EXTENDED FORECAST WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THE 
LARGE-SCALE PATTERN...BUT GENERALLY AGREE THAT AN ACTIVE PATTERN 
WILL DEVELOP THIS WEEK WITH TWO SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA 
AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY AND SUNDAY/MONDAY TIME FRAMES. IT APPEARS 
THAT THE FIRST SYSTEM COULD PRODUCE AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE TSTORMS 
OVER WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...WITH THIS 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY THEN LIKELY CONGEALING INTO A LINE AS IT MOVES 
EASTWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT. GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS AGREE THAT A MORE STABLE AIR MASS WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT...SO EXPECT THIS CONVECTION TO WEAKEN 
AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...A STRONG 850 MB JET 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA MAY STILL CREATE SOME STRONG WIND GUSTS WITH 
THIS CONVECTIVE LINE. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE COLD FRONT. THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON 
SUNDAY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA AROUND SUNDAY NIGHT. THE LATEST ECMWF MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT 
THIS SYSTEM COULD PRODUCE MORE INSTABILITY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
THAN THE FIRST SYSTEM...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION SHOWERS SINCE 
THE GFS MODEL REVEALS A WEAKER SYSTEM AT THIS TIME. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS OF THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN             46  56  32  61  40 /  60  10   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EST MON FEB 21 2011

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT NOW MOVING INTO LOWER OHIO AND MID MS 
VALLEYS THIS MORNING. ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TEMPERATURES HAD A
WARM START AND ARE ALREADY IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S THIS MORNING.
WINDS FROM THE SOUTHWEST ARE ABOUT 15 TO 25 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS
ESPECIALLY AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BUT SHOULD DECREASE DURING THE
DAY BEFORE RISING AGAIN TONIGHT JUST AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. SKIES ARE
PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY NOW AND WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY BY
AFTERNOON ALL AREAS. REMOVED RAIN CHANCES FOR ALL BUT NORTHERN
SECTIONS THIS MORNING AND KEPT MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE THIS AFTERNOON.
WILL WAIT UNTIL NEXT HOURS TEMPERATURES BEFORE DECIDING WHETHER TO
RAISE HIGH TEMPERATURES A FEW MORE DEGREES. SOME LOCATIONS MAY
REACH LOWER 70S.

658 
FXUS64 KMRX 210821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 AM EST MON FEB 21 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL 
SWING ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT.  MOISTURE AND LIFT DO NOT LOOK ALL 
THAT IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO WILL GO HIGHER THAN MAV POPS...BUT 
STILL KEEP POPS IN THE 50 TO 70 RANGE FOR TONIGHT.  LOOKS LIKE BULK 
OF PRECIP WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL TONIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  LOW LEVEL JET FORECAST TO 
WEAKEN A BIT FOR TODAY...SO WILL NOT ISSUE ANY WIND ADVISORY AT THIS 
TIME.  HOWEVER...GUSTY SOUTHWEST WINDS CAN BE EXPECTED. WILL TWEAK 
TEMPS A BIT HIGHER THAN MAV NUMBERS MOST LOCATIONS FOR TODAY...BUT NO 
ARGUMENTS WITH MAV LOWS TONIGHT.     

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GENERALLY FAST ZONAL FLOW
WILL BE THE RULE DURING THE EXTENDED. A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. AFTER TODAY'S SYSTEM...NEXT WAVE
WILL PULL EAST THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. FRONTAL
PASSAGE EXPECTED FRIDAY WITH FAIRLY STRONG UPPER DYNAMICS
ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER JET AND FRONTOGENETIC FORCING. HAVE INCLUDED
ISOLATED THUNDER. ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE AREA BY
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS...POSSIBLY
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE SUNDAY NIGHT AS DYNAMICS WILL ALSO BE STRONG.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS CLOSELY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

929 
FXUS64 KMRX 210229
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
929 PM EST SUN FEB 20 2011

.DISCUSSION...SEEING ISOLATED STRONG GUSTY WINDS IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. WILL CHANGE WINDS ON A FEW GROUPS. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A WARM FRONT TO THE SOUTH AND WEST HAS BEEN MAKING SLOW NORTH AND 
EASTWARD PROGRESS...AND WILL MOVE INTO OUR AREA OVERNIGHT. MODELS 
HAVE BEEN TO FAST TO BRING THE FRONT NORTH...BUT WE SHOULD BEGIN TO 
SEE RISING DEWPOINTS AND POSSIBLY RISING TEMPS AFTER MIDNIGHT. A LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL STRENGTHEN OVERNIGHT AS LOW PRESSURE TRACKS INTO THE 
UPPER MS VALLEY. THE NAM HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY STRONGER WITH THE 850 
MB JET BY ABOUT 10 KTS THAN THE GFS. SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WILL APPROACH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA...BUT THE WIND DIRECTION ALOFT 
WILL BE SOUTHWEST AND NOT IDEAL FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES. WILL LEAN TOWARD 
THE GFS WINDS AND NOT ISSUE AN ADVISORY AT THE MOMENT. WE SHOULD 
STAY DRY UNTIL GREATER LIFT FOR RAIN SHOWERS COMES MONDAY AFTERNOON 
AS THE UPPER JET SHIFTS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. MOISTURE IS CONFINED 
TO A SHALLOW LAYER WITH DRY AIR ABOVE 700 MB...SO ANY PRECIP WILL BE 
LIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SHORT RANGE MODELS CONTINUE TO BRING FRONTAL SYSTEM TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT WITH LOW LEVEL WINDS INCREASING AGAIN 
WITH THE FRONT SHIFTING FROM THE SOUTHWEST TO WEST MONDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY TUESDAY. 850 MB WINDS ARE AROUND 50 KNOTS SO HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
MAY REQUIRE A WIND ADVISORY MONDAY NIGHT. BEST RAIN CHANCES MONDAY 
NIGHT WITH LIKELY FOR A TIME. RAINFALL AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE AROUND ONE 
QUARTER INCH OR LESS AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH. LOWS MONDAY NIGHT 
STILL MILD MAINLY 40S TO NEAR 50. COLD AIR ADVECTION STRONGER WITH 
NAM THAN GFS TUESDAY WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING IN THE MORNING. 
FOLLOWED CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM NUMBERS BUT DEPENDS ON HOW FAST 
SKIES CLEAR AND WINDS DIE DOWN. HIGH PRESSURE WILL LAST ABOUT 24 TO 
36 HOURS BEFORE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES. UPPER TROUGH ACROSS WESTERN 
STATES BRINGS IN COLDER TEMPERATURES THERE AT MID WEEK BUT TO THE 
EAST RIDGING OVER THE GULF KEEPS TEMPERATURES MILD ACROSS THE TN 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. MODELS FASTER THAN YESTERDAY WITH NEW 
SYSTEM THURSDAY AS LOW DEVELOPS ACROSS SOUTHERN PLAINS AND OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES. WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION OVER THE SOUTHEAST RAIN TO 
SPREAD INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY. DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA 
IS PROGGED TO MOVE BY TO THE NORTH AND WEST THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY. THIS SHOULD BRING A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF RAIN TO THE 
REGION. DRYING CONDITIONS SATURDAY AND ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVING IN 
SUNDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  69  45  56  33 /  10  20  60  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  68  44  51  31 /  10  20  60  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  67  44  50  31 /  10  30  60  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              42  68  41  50  26 /  10  20  60  20  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

649 
FXUS64 KMRX 201715 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1215 PM EST SUN FEB 20 2011

.AVIATION...
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE AFTERNOON
AND EVENING. SOME DRIER AIR ALOFT WILL MOVE IN TOWARD MIDNIGHT AND
SCATTER OUT THE CLOUDS. SOME MODELS INDICATE AN MVFR CEILING
DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT...OTHERS DO NOT. IF THIS DOES HAPPEN...IT IS
MOST LIKELY TO OCCUR AT CHA...BUT WILL JUST MENTION SCATTERED
CLOUDS AROUND 3 KFT FOR NOW AS CONFIDENCE IS LOW. LLWS WILL BE
POSSIBLE TONIGHT AS WELL...BUT THE SURFACE TO 2 KFT WIND SPEED
DIFFERENCE LOOKS MARGINAL FOR LLWS...SO WILL LEAVE IT OUT FOR NOW.
BROKEN CLOUDS ON THE VFR/MVFR MARGINS ARE MORE LIKELY TO DEVELOP
MONDAY MORNING AS A WARM FRONT LIFTS ACROSS THE AREA...SHIFTING
WINDS TO SOUTH.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

1009 AM EST SUN FEB 20 2011

.DISCUSSION...
RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS CENTRAL AND EASTERN KY ASSOCIATED WTIH AN AREA
OF ISENTROPIC LIFT ARE MOVING E-NE AND SHOULD REMAIN JUST NORTH OF
OUR AREA. A DRY FORECAST FOR TODAY LOOKS ON TRACK. THE FEW RETURNS
ON RADAR OVER OUR AREA ARE NOT REACHING THE GROUND...AND MODEL
SOUNDINGS INDICATE DRY LOW LEVEL AIR THROUGH THE DAY. A FRONT
REMAINS WELL TO OUR SOUTH...ACROSS SRN GA AND CNTL AL AND WEST TN.
THE NAM SEEMS TOO QUICK TO BRING THE FRONT NORTH...THE RUC KEEPS IT
NEARLY STATIONARY. WITH THE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER AND THE WARM
FRONT STAYING SOUTH...TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS WILL NEED A SLIGHT
DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENT FOR THE MORNING UPDATE.

933 
FXUS64 KMRX 200853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST SUN FEB 20 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR NORTH WILL 
SHIFT SOUTHEAST...ALLOWING WINDS TO TURN MORE SOUTHWESTERLY AND 
MOISTURE TO INCREASE.  SHOULD SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS...AND MAY 
EVEN BE A FEW SHOWERS WESTERN AND NORTHERN ZONES LATE TONIGHT.  LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE...AND WINDS MAY BE CLOSE TO WIND ADVISORY 
CRITERIA OVER A SOME OF THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS TONIGHT...BUT GIVEN 
POOR MODEL AGREEMENT ON STRENGTH OF LOW LEVEL JET WILL NOT ISSUE ANY 
WIND ADVISORY AT THIS TIME.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE 
ONCE AGAIN...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAKENING SHORT WAVE TROF 
WILL BE GLIDING FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY WHILE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW MAKES ITS WAY EAST 
THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY. COOLER AIR WILL SPILL SOUTH TOWARD 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION REQUIRING CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AS 
MOISTURE IS LIFTED AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THE BEST CHANCE FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT AND KEPT LIKELY POPS FOR 
THE LIGHT RAIN EVENT. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW WEAK TRAILING 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND AN INVERTED SURFACE TROF ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR TUESDAY WHICH WOULD IMPACT MAINLY 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THEREFORE 
MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR A LIGHT SHOWER PRIMARILY 
DURING THE MORNING ON TUESDAY. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS EAST FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND WITH THE DEPARTURE OF THE EARLY WEEK SHORT WAVE...WAS 
ABLE TO KEEP THE DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. THE NEXT UPPER TROF SWINGS OUT INTO THE MIDWEST ON THURSDAY 
WITH INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT SO STAYED 
WITH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS AT THIS TIME STEP WHILE MAINTAINING A HIGH 
CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AS A RELATIVELY STRONG COLD 
FRONT PRESSES THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON ITS WAY TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. APPARENTLY THIS BOUNDARY DOES NOT SHIFT SOUTH 
AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL LATER FRIDAY NIGHT SO KEPT THE 
MEDIUM AND LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY OF PRECIP GOING HERE WHILE STAYING 
WITH A DRY SATURDAY BEHIND THIS FEATURE. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

652 
FXUS64 KMRX 200229
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
929 PM EST SAT FEB 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. SHORTWAVE PROVIDING 
CLOUD COVER BUT NO PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
THE EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WILL BRING INCREASING 
SOUTHERLY COMPONENT TO THE LOW LEVEL FLOW. AS A RESULT...THE FRONT 
THAT HAS STALLED TO OUR SOUTH WILL LIFT BACK TO THE NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT TOMORROW. THE 850 MB RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS TO THE ATLANTIC 
COAST...AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL SPREAD CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA FROM 
SOUTH TO NORTH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TOMORROW MORNING. THIS WILL 
MAKE FOR A TRICKY TEMPERATURE FORECAST...BUT WILL LEAN A BIT ABOVE 
MOS GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TONIGHT AND HIGHS TOMORROW. THE LIFT LOOKS TOO 
WEAK AND MOISTURE TOO SHALLOW TO PRODUCE ANY PRECIP. ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS AS A LOW TRACKS INTO MO/IA. 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL BE BREEZY TOMORROW AS 925 MB WINDS INCREASE 
TO 25-30 KTS IN THE NAM IN WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...BUT SHOULD 
STAY BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA DURING THE DAY. VALLEY WINDS IN THE LEE 
OF THE MOUNTAINS SHOULD BE CONSIDERABLY LIGHTER WITH CLOUD COVER 
LIMITING DOWNWARD MIXING OF WINDS ALOFT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
WINDS INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY FROM THE SOUTHWEST AS LOW 
PRESSURE MOVES FROM THE MID MS VALLEY THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY TO THE MID ATLANTIC. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST STATES. MAY NEED WIND ADVISORY FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY 
SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY. USED MODIFIED NAM WINDS IN THE 
GRIDDED FORECAST. WITH WEAK WARM FRONT MOVING NORTH OF FORECAST AREA 
SUNDAY NIGHT SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP LATE ACROSS THE NW AS RIDGING HOLDS 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. WINDS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES UP IN THE 40S 
TO NEAR 50. MONDAY TEMPERATURES AGAIN WILL BE MILD. SHOWERS WILL 
MOVE IN GRADUALLY FROM THE NW. WINDS SHOULD DECREASE MONDAY NIGHT 
AND BECOME NW BEHIND COLD FRONT. TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER TUESDAY 
AND SKIES CLEARING AS HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL FROM THE NW. 
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY A NEW LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MOVES EAST. UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER THE 
WESTERN STATES. THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO PRODUCE MORE RAINFALL AND TAKE 
A COUPLE DAYS TO MOVE THROUGH. THERE COULD BE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT AS AIRMASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE. 
WILL NOT INCLUDE INTO FORECAST JUST YET.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  66  50  69  42 /   0  10  10  30  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  63  48  68  41 /  10  10  10  30  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  63  48  67  40 /  10  10  20  30  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              29  62  40  66  40 /   0  10  10  30  60

601 
FXUS64 KMRX 191505 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST SAT FEB 19 2011

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED SOUTH OF THE AREA WHILE HIGH PRESSURE IS
BUILDING IN FROM THE NORTH...BRINGING VERY DRY AIR TO THE REGION.
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN TODAY IS RELATIVE HUMIDITY...WHICH WILL
BOTTOM OUT IN THE TEENS IN NORTHERN SECTIONS AS DRIER AIR ALOFT
MIXES DOWN TO THE SURFACE...ENHANCING THE FIRE DANGER TODAY. MANY
LOCATIONS ALREADY ARE SEEING RH VALUES IN THE 20% RANGE. WINDS WILL
GENERALLY BE BETWEEN 6 AND 12 MPH...WITH THE HIGHER WIND SPEEDS IN
THAT RANGE BEING IN SW VA WHERE DEWPOINTS WILL BE LOWEST. WILL
EXPAND THE FIRE DANGER SPS TO INCLUDE THE SMOKIES. WILL UPDATE THE
TEMP/DEWPOINT GRIDS BASED ON LATEST OBS...BUT NO SIGNIFICANT
CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO THE ZONE FORECAST.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

851 
FXUS64 KMRX 190904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SAT FEB 19 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT HAS SAGGED TO 
OUR SOUTH...BUT WILL BEGIN MOVING BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT 
TONIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL EXTEND INTO OUR AREA FROM THE NORTH 
TODAY.  SHOULD SEE QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE TODAY...ESPECIALLY NORTH 
AND INTO CENTRAL AREAS...BUT CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AGAIN 
LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  WITH DRYER AIR MOVING IN TODAY AND MILD 
TEMPS...WILL SEE VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES...SO WILL 
CONTINUE SPS FOR FIRE DANGER.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE 
SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY SIMILAR 
DURING MUCH OF THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...SOLUTIONS DIVERGE BY 
THURSDAY/FRIDAY SO USED A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF AT 
THIS TIME. HEALTHY SHORT WAVE TROF WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
ADVANCES NORTHEAST FROM THE WESTERN PLAINS INTO THE MIDWEST ON 
SUNDAY WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION STRENGTHENING ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND 
EASTERN U.S. AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR SUNDAY IN AREA 
OF DEEPER MOISTURE AND STRONGER ISENTROPIC LIFT. THE UPPER TROF WILL 
CONTINUE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WHILE DRAGGING A SURFACE 
LOW THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY. MOISTURE ADVECTION/CONVERGENCE 
INCREASES AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND 
GRADUALLY INCREASE THE PROBABILITY OF PRECIP FROM CHANCE ON MONDAY 
TO LIKELY MONDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS 
FOR A SHOWER MAINLY TUESDAY MORNING AS WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY TRAILS 
BEHIND THE MAIN SYSTEM. KEPT THE PERIOD TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY BASICALLY DRY AS HIGHER PRESSURES MOVE IN FOR A PLEASANT 
MID WEEK PERIOD. THE NEXT SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE NORTHEAST OUT OF THE 
SOUTHWEST U.S. THURSDAY AND WILL ARRIVE IN THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY BY  
MID DAY FRIDAY. GRADUALLY RAISED POPS FROM SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE 
LATER THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT TO MEDIUM CHANCE BY 
FRIDAY AS THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT BUILDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS WERE NOT FAR FROM THE PREVIOUS LONG TERM 
FORECAST BUT TRIED TO ADJUST CLOSER TO THE NEW GUIDANCE WHERE 
APPROPRIATE.

753 
FXUS64 KMRX 190240
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EST FRI FEB 18 2011

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA. RAIN ENDED 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND TRI. CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD WITH DRIER 
WEATHER MOVING IN FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A COLD FRONT LOCATED OVER NORTHERN KY THIS AFTERNOON WILL PUSH INTO 
THE AREA TONIGHT. SOME RAIN SHOWERS ARE OBSERVED OVER WESTERN KY 
MOVING SOUTHEAST...SO A LOW CHANCE POP WILL BE KEPT ACROSS THE AREA 
THIS EVENING WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH AFTER MIDNIGHT. A ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT AND A LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE WILL KEEP THE SHOWERS LIGHT WITH 
JUST A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH EXPECTED. THE SURFACE FRONT WILL 
PUSH SOUTH OF THE AREA SATURDAY MORNING. HOWEVER THE 850 MB THETA-E 
GRADIENT REMAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TOMORROW...SO 
NORTHERN SECTIONS WILL LIKELY BE SUNNY WITH SOUTHERN AREAS BEING 
MOSTLY CLOUDY. RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE TEENS AND WINDS IN THE 
10-15 MPH RANGE WILL RESULT IN AN ENHANCED FIRE DANGER RISK IN 
NORTHERN SECTIONS TOMORROW AFTERNOON. AFTER CONSULTING WITH VA AND 
TN FORESTRY...A SPS WILL BE ISSUED TO ADDRESS THIS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
RIDGING AHEAD OF NEXT DEVELOPING SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS WILL KEEP AREA 
DRY SATURDAY NIGHT AND JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS SUNDAY AS 
WARM FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. MOST OF THE AREA WILL BE DRY BUT 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE NE SECTIONS IN THE AFTERNOON. LOW PRESSURE AREA 
WILL MOVE FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS SUNDAY TO THE MID MS VALLEY AND 
OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. MILD TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE 
SUNDAY WITH SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY 
MOISTURE INCREASES WITH SHOWERS SPREADING FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN MONDAY EVENING INTO EARLY 
TUESDAY. COULD BE A RUMBLE OF THUNDER LATE MONDAY BUT INSTABILITY 
WEAK. MUCH COOLER TUESDAY WITH SHOWERS MOVING OUT. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY. NEW TROUGH DEVELOPING 
OVER THE WESTERN STATES TO MOVE EAST INTO THE PLAINS THURSDAY AND TN 
VALLEY FRIDAY BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WARM TO ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

134 
FXUS64 KMRX 181956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST FRI FEB 18 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A COLD FRONT LOCATED OVER NORTHERN KY THIS AFTERNOON WILL PUSH INTO 
THE AREA TONIGHT. SOME RAIN SHOWERS ARE OBSERVED OVER WESTERN KY 
MOVING SOUTHEAST...SO A LOW CHANCE POP WILL BE KEPT ACROSS THE AREA 
THIS EVENING WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH AFTER MIDNIGHT. A ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT AND A LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE WILL KEEP THE SHOWERS LIGHT WITH 
JUST A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH EXPECTED. THE SURFACE FRONT WILL 
PUSH SOUTH OF THE AREA SATURDAY MORNING. HOWEVER THE 850 MB THETA-E 
GRADIENT REMAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TOMORROW...SO 
NORTHERN SECTIONS WILL LIKELY BE SUNNY WITH SOUTHERN AREAS BEING 
MOSTLY CLOUDY. RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE TEENS AND WINDS IN THE 
10-15 MPH RANGE WILL RESULT IN AN ENHANCED FIRE DANGER RISK IN 
NORTHERN SECTIONS TOMORROW AFTERNOON. AFTER CONSULTING WITH VA AND 
TN FORESTRY...A SPS WILL BE ISSUED TO ADDRESS THIS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
RIDGING AHEAD OF NEXT DEVELOPING SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS WILL KEEP AREA 
DRY SATURDAY NIGHT AND JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS SUNDAY AS 
WARM FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. MOST OF THE AREA WILL BE DRY BUT 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE NE SECTIONS IN THE AFTERNOON. LOW PRESSURE AREA 
WILL MOVE FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS SUNDAY TO THE MID MS VALLEY AND 
OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. MILD TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE 
SUNDAY WITH SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY 
MOISTURE INCREASES WITH SHOWERS SPREADING FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN MONDAY EVENING INTO EARLY 
TUESDAY. COULD BE A RUMBLE OF THUNDER LATE MONDAY BUT INSTABILITY 
WEAK. MUCH COOLER TUESDAY WITH SHOWERS MOVING OUT. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY. NEW TROUGH DEVELOPING 
OVER THE WESTERN STATES TO MOVE EAST INTO THE PLAINS THURSDAY AND TN 
VALLEY FRIDAY BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WARM TO ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  65  45  66  49 /  20   0  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  41  61  39  63  47 /  30   0  10  10  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1027 AM EST FRI FEB 18 2011

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSES PLACE A COLD FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL OHIO TO THE
LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS A MOIST LAYER UP
TO A STRONG INVERSION AROUND 720MB...THEN A VERY DRY LAYER ABOVE.
THE INVERSION AND THE LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL KEEP RAIN
SHOWERS LIGHT AND SCATTERED THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. LATEST NAM AND
RUC MODEL RUNS SHOW INCREASING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FLUX CONVERGENCE
INCREASING LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE FRONT
APPROACHES...SO WILL KEEP THE FORECAST OF CHANCE POPS GOING.
EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING SHOULD KEEP TEMPS
REASONABLY CLOSE TO THE CURRENT FORECAST...SO NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST FRI FEB 18 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA IN THE SHORT TERM.  MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW...AND 
FORCING LOOKS TO BE WEAK...SO WILL ONLY CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS TODAY INTO EARLY TONIGHT.  LOTS OF CLOUDS AROUND 
TODAY...THEN CLOUDS SHOULD DECREASE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH OVERNIGHT.  
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE BOTH 
PERIODS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF IN FAIRLY  
DECENT AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. KEPT SATURDAY DRY AS 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY DROPS FURTHER SOUTH AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ON SUNDAY FOR 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BUT REMOVED FARTHER SOUTHWEST 
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE AS MOISTURE 
AND LIFT RATHER LIMITED IN WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WHICH DEVELOPS 
IN RESPONSE TO AMLIFICATION OF THE UPPER HEIGHTS ACROSS THE PLAINS. 
TRIED TO TRIM BACK POPS A BIT SUNDAY NIGHT WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER MAINLY ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS FORECAST AREA 
AWAITS ARRIVAL OF PLAINS STATES UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT SO 
BUMPED UP POPS A BIT MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT. HELD ONTO THE WRAP 
AROUND MOISTURE/LIFT CONCEPT FOR TUESDAY AS ADDITIONAL SHORT 
WAVELENGTH ENERGY SPILLS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE EXITING TROF. THE 
FORECAST AREA SHOULD SEE A DRY PERIOD FROM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS DRY ADVECTION AND SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE 
REGION. ANOTHER UPPER TROF DRIVES NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
INTO THE MIDWEST ON THURSDAY SUPPORTING THE ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT ON FRIDAY. SYSTEM SPEED A LITTLE UNCERTAIN AT THIS DISTANT 
FORECAST PERIOD SO HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON 
THURSDAY FOR THIS FEATURE. 

&&

531 
FXUS64 KMRX 180305
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST THU FEB 17 2011

.DISCUSSION...TEMPS RUNNING A BIT WARM ALONG WEST EDGE OF CWA. 
RAISED MIN TEMPS WEST INCLUDING TYS/CHA A COUPLE OF DEGREES. 
OTHERWISE LIGHT WINDS WITH STREAMING CIRRUS. SON 

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
A COLD FRONT WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA IN THE SHORT TERM...MAINLY 
BETWEEN FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND MIDNIGHT. AN EAST-WEST RIDGE AXIS 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST WILL PREVENT DEEP MOISTURE FROM MAKING ITS WAY 
INTO THE TN VALLEY. IN ADDITION...WITH A ZONAL FLOW IN THE UPPER 
LEVELS AND THE UPPER JET POSITION WELL TO THE NORTH...FORCING FOR 
LIFT WILL BE MAINLY IN THE LOW LEVELS BELOW 700 MB. THIS SHOULD 
RESULT IN JUST LIGHT PRECIP AND CHANCE POPS FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. BEST CHANCES WILL BE NORTH AS THE MODELS SHOW WEAKENING LIFT 
AS THE FRONT PUSHES SOUTH. THE PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH MOVES THROUGH 
FRIDAY EVENING...WITH THE SURFACE FRONT MOVING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY 
NIGHT. TEMPERATURES AHEAD OF THE FRONT TOMORROW SHOULD WARM UP 
NICELY BEFORE CLOUDS INCREASE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...REACHING 
BETWEEN 65 AND 70 IN MOST SPOTS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
SATURDAY WILL BE A BRIEF DRY PERIOD WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
EASTERN STATES. WARM AIR ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE DEPARTING FRONT WILL 
BRING SHOWERS BACK INTO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS SUNDAY AND THEN AS A 
DEEPENING AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY 
MORE SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP IN THE MILD AIRMASS AHEAD OF THE SLOW 
MOVING COLD FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH COOLER TUESDAY WITH 
LINGERING SHOWERS AS A LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES ALONG THE FRONT AND 
PASSES INTO NC. MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY WEDNESDAY AND STAYING COOLER OR 
NEAR NORMAL. A NEW DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW OVER THE PLAINS STATES 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WILL SPREAD MOISTURE IN THE FORM OF 
LIGHT SHOWERS THURSDAY AND INCREASING BY THURSDAY NIGHT. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  70  47  66  46 /   0  20  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  67  44  64  42 /   0  20  30  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       46  65  43  64  42 /   0  30  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              43  65  37  60  36 /   0  50  30  10  10

226 
FXUS64 KMRX 170900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST THU FEB 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE REGION 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER TODAY. WITH THE MOSTLY SUNNY SKY AND THE 
SOUTHERLY WINDS EXPECTED...AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARMER 
THAN YESTERDAY. SO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES IS EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY.  
WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN PLACE. FRONT UPSTREAM SHOULD STAY WEST OF THE 
CWA...SO WILL KEEP TONIGHT DRY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED TONIGHT AS WELL. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE NUMBERS AGAIN FOR 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK...AND REVEAL A CONTINUATION OF UNSEASONABLY MILD CONDITIONS 
DESPITE THE PASSAGE OF A FEW COLD FRONTS. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...BUT WITH LIMITED 
MOISTURE. THUS...WILL MENTION ONLY CHANCE POPS FOR SOME SHOWERS INTO 
FRIDAY NIGHT AS THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL THEN RETURN NORTHWARD AS A WARM 
FRONT BY SUNDAY...AS DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS. WILL INTRODUCE SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY 
AND SUNDAY NIGHT...SINCE THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS INDICATE SOME VERY 
LIGHT PRECIP DUE TO WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
MODELS SHOW THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BECOMING ELONGATED OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY...AND THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS BEGIN TO 
DIVERGE SOMEWHAT WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THE LOW DURING THIS PERIOD. 
HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THAT A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON MONDAY...AND MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...SINCE THEY HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT LATELY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  46  68  45  67 /   0   0  20  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  45  67  44  65 /   0   0  20  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  45  67  44  65 /   0   0  30  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  43  65  37  63 /   0   0  30  40  10

FXUS64 KMRX 170229
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST WED FEB 16 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. MID LEVEL CLOUDS 
CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
TRANQUIL WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR THE SHORT TERM AS A MID/UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE 
STATIONARY OFF THE NC COAST. MODELS INDICATE THAT A SOUTHEASTERLY 
925 MB FLOW MAY BRING SOME LOW CLOUDS INTO SW NC AND SRN TN VALLEY 
TONIGHT. ANY CLOUDS SHOULD BECOME SCATTERED THROUGH THE MORNING WITH 
DAYTIME MIXING. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS TOMORROW AS LOW 
PRESSURE TRACKS ACROSS THE UPPER MS VALLEY REGION. SW WINDS IN THE 
10-15 MPH RANGE CAN BE EXPECTED. STAYED CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES...WHICH SHOULD REACH 65 TO 70 IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS 
TOMORROW.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A SERIES OF WEAK FRONTS MOVE THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE
EXTENDED PERIOD. EACH SHOWS LITTLE MOISTURE AVAILABLE AND LITTLE
ENERGY AND WILL ONLY GENERATE A FEW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT
SHOWERS. THE FIRST FRONT IS A WEAK COLD FRONT THAT WILL SLIDE
THROUGH THE AREA LATE FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT THEN
LIFTS NORTHWARD AS AN EVEN WEAKER WARM FRONT ON SATURDAY NIGHT.
WITH BOTH PASSES MOISTURE AND ENERGY LACKING AND HAVE KEPT POPS LOW
FRIDAY NIGHT AND HAVE LEFT SATURDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW. THE THIRD
FRONT MOVES IN QUICKLY AROUND THE MONDAY.MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME.
AGAIN...LITTLE MOISTURE OR ENERGY AVAILABLE WITH THE COLD FRONT FOR
ANOTHER ROUND OF ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS.

FXUS64 KMRX 160813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EST WED FEB 16 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO 
PASS ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE... 
WILL KEEP TODAY AND TONIGHT DRY. EXPECTING A FEW CLOUDS WITH THE 
DISTURBANCE...BUT STILL SHOULD SEE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES TODAY. 
RIDGE BUILDS BACK IN TONIGHT DECREASING CLOUDS. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TONIGHT AS WELL. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND 
REVEAL A CONTINUATION OF UNSEASONABLY MILD AND GENERALLY TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION LATE FRIDAY 
INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THE MODELS AGREEING THAT LIMITED MOISTURE 
WILL DEVELOP ALONG IT RESULTING IN A ONLY FEW SHOWERS. THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL THEN RETURN NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...AS DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS. LATEST ECMWF MODEL RUN INDICATES A CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS ON SUNDAY WITH THIS WARM FRONT...BUT THE GFS MODEL AND 
ENSEMBLES STILL INDICATE THAT THE PRECIP WITH THIS WARM FRONT WILL 
DEVELOP FURTHER NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL LEAVE THE 
SUNDAY FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION BY MONDAY...AND WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT 
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS COLD FRONT...RESULTING IN A ONLY 
FEW SHOWERS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

144 
FXUS64 KMRX 142002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST MON FEB 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...TWO MAIN CONCERNS. FIRST IS
THE LOW AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES...WHICH ARE IN THE 10S AND 20S THIS
AFTERNOON. COMBINED WITH THE BREEZY CONDITIONS ARE PRODUCING
DANGEROUS FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS. SECOND IS THE WINDY CONDITIONS
ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH AREA TOWER DATA SHOWING
GUSTS UP TO 40 MPH. WILL MAINTAIN BOTH RED FLAG WARNING FOR
CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA AND WIND ADVISORY FOR
THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 9 PM.

A COLD FRONT IS MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON.
ONLY EFFECTS FROM FROPA IS A WIND SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST. ALSO
EXPECT INCREASING LOW CLOUDS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR A COUPLE OF
HOURS THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES COOLER TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES 
EAST. UPPER HEIGHTS RISE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE WORK WEEK. DRY 
AND UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS STILL ON TRACK. WEAK FRONT DROPS 
INTO THE AREA AROUND FRI NGT. MOISTURE IS LIMITED. BACKED OFF SOME 
ON POPS. APPEARS FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH OF THE AREA WITH CONTINUED 
DRYING FOR THE LATER PART OF THE WEEKEND. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE 
WITH LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING NE THROUGH NATIONS MID SECTION 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MONDAY/MON NGT FAVORING SLOWER GFS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 AM EST MON FEB 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION...WITH ITS 
TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO AND 
MID MS RIVER VALLEYS. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH WESTERLY WINDS BECOMING STRONG AND GUSTY. 
WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS WHERE SUSTAINED 
WINDS SHOULD EXCEED THE 25 MPH THRESHOLD...ESPECIALLY AT ELEVATIONS 
ABOVE 2500 FEET. IN ADDITION...WILL UPGRADE THE FIRE WEATHER WATCH 
TO A RED FLAG WARNING OVER EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC...WHERE THESE STRONG 
WINDS SHOULD COMBINE WITH VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES TO PRODUCE AN 
EXTREME FIRE DANGER. WHILE RELATIVE HUMIDITIES AND WIND SPEEDS OVER 
THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA APPEAR TO REMAIN UNDER THE THRESHOLDS 
FOR A RED FLAG WARNING...WILL PLAN TO REISSUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THE INCREASED FIRE DANGER FOR TODAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN BOTH 
SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM BEFORE THE USUAL DIVERGENCE OF 
SOLUTIONS BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. GENERALLY DRY AND UNSEASONABLY 
WARM CONDITIONS STILL ON TRACK THROUGH THE WORK WEEK. A WEAK SHORT 
WAVE PASSES THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BUT IS NOT EXPECTED TO 
HAVE ANY SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON OUR AREA. A SERIES OF WEAK SYSTEMS 
APPROACHES BY LATE FRIDAY AND DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT TIMING 
BECOMES AN ISSUE AMONG MODELS AND ENSEMBLES WITH THESE FEATURES. THUS 
DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES FOR THAT TIME FRAME. FOR 
TEMPS...TENDED TO CONTINUE TREND OF GOING SLIGHTLY ABOVE MEX 
GUIDANCE FOR MID AND LATE WORK WEEK BASED ON POSITIVE HEIGHT 
ANOMALIES PROJECTED BY MEDIUM-RANGE MODELS AND GEFS ENSEMBLES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EST SUN FEB 13 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...DRY AND MILD WEATHER
REMAINS ON TAP FOR THESE PERIODS. MAIN CONCERN IS FIRE WEATHER
DANGER THREAT ON MONDAY...AS STRONG SW-W WINDS BLOW AHEAD OF A DRY
COLD FRONT. COORDINATED WITH FORESTRY OFFICIALS AND ADJACENT NWS
OFFICES...WITH A FIRE WEATHER WATCH POSTED FOR CHEROKEE AND CLAY
COUNTIES OF NC...AND AN SPS AGAIN TO HIGHLIGHT THE THREAT FOR OUR
TN AND SW VA DISTRICTS. 

MODELS PUSH DEW POINT TEMPS UP A BIT ON MONDAY AHEAD OF THIS FRONT 
BUT MIXING OUT LIKE MANY AREAS TODAY...COULD LEAD TO A FEW SPOTS
FALLING TO OR BELOW MIN RH CRITERIA. EXPECT SUSTAINED WIND SPEEDS
AS HIGH OR HIGHER THAN TODAY...WITH GUSTS TO AT LEAST 35 MPH
POSSIBLE. 

OTHERWISE...WINDS STAY UP TONIGHT AND AFFECT MINS TEMPS...SO
TRENDED TOWARD A BLEND OF MOS MINS. EXPECT WARM TEMPS AGAIN AHEAD
OF THE FRONT ON MONDAY...SO ANOTHER BLEND OR WARMER MOS CHOICE WAS
BEST. WINDS DIMINISH MONDAY NIGHT AND WE EXPERIENCE DRY AND
PLEASANT CONDITIONS...WITH SURFACE HIGH AND UPPER RIDGE IN CONTROL.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
CROSSES THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY WITH LITTLE FANFARE FOLLOWED 
BY A PERIOD OF RISING HEIGHTS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW 
FOR A CONTINUATION OF RATHER PLEASANT WEATHER WHICH FEATURES ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES WITH LITTLE CHANCE OF ANY PRECIPITATION. BY 
SATURDAY THE PATTERN STARTS TO BREAK DOWN AS AN UPPER TROF SHIFTS 
STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE MIDWEST AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. AS THIS 
HAPPENS A COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MAKE ITS WAY SLOWLY SOUTH INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY BEFORE STALLING OUT ON SUNDAY ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH. MOISTURE CONVERGENCE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA IN 
THE VICINITY OF THE FRONT LEADING TO THE POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER.
THEREFORE...ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. WENT 
ABOVE GUIDANCE TEMPS DUE TO THE EXPECTED MILD PATTERN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EST SUN FEB 13 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE GULF COAST...WITH A 
LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
A BROAD LOW PRESSURE AREA IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION TODAY...INCREASING THE PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. AS A RESULT...SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL BECOME GUSTY THIS 
AFTERNOON AND WILL BRING ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS UNDER FULL SUNSHINE. 
THESE WARMER TEMPS WILL RESULT IN LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES THIS 
AFTERNOON AS THE WINDS BECOME GUSTY...SO WILL REISSUE THE SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THE INCREASED FIRE DANGER. THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL BRING A WEAK COLD 
FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TONIGHT...WITH ONLY A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER EXPECTED. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN BOTH SINCE THIS 
HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE 
TO DEPICT GENERALLY DRY AND PLEASANT WEATHER CONDITIONS THROUGH THE 
LONG TERM. A WEAK NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE AND SURFACE COLD FRONT 
WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION LATE MONDAY...BUT THIS FEATURE HAS 
VIRTUALLY NO MOISTURE TO WORK WITH PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS. ANOTHER 
SHORT WAVE PASSES THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY BUT AGAIN HAS VIRTUALLY NO 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT. SIGNIFICANT UPPER RIDGE STILL PROJECTED 
TO BUILD INTO THE REGION BY LATE IN THE WORK WEEK...ASSURING TEMPS 
WILL REMAIN WELL ABOVE CLIMO. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR WARMER MET 
GUIDANCE EARLY IN THE LONG TERM BEFORE GENERALLY STAYING CLOSE TO 
MEX GUIDANCE LATER IN THE LONG TERM WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
WEDNESDAY'S AND FRIDAY'S MAX TEMPS WHICH WERE BUMPED UP SLIGHTLY 
BASED ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 130205
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST SAT FEB 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER WITH JUST A FEW HIGH CLOUDS PASSING 
OVER. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO 
CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...NOT A LOT TO DISCUSS FOR 
THESE PERIODS AS DRY WEATHER CONTINUES AND TEMPS WARM. LOW CLOUDS 
OVER SE KY AND SW VA HAVE DRIFTED EAST AND DISSIPATED...LEAVING 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. MAY SEE SOME HIGH CLOUDS PASS ACROSS NRN AREAS 
OVERNIGHT...AND WINDS MAY NOT DE-COUPLE COMPLETELY WITH SURFACE HIGH 
CENTERED TO OUR SOUTH. THUS...I FAVORED A BLEND OF MOS MINS OVER 
COOLER LOWS. OTHERWISE...WARMER MOS HIGHS WERE MORE CLOSELY FOLLOWED 
EACH DAY...AND A BLEND OF MOS AGAIN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.

MAIN CONCERN SUNDAY IS THE DRY CONDITIONS WITH BREEZY WESTERLY
WINDS...WITH STRONGEST WINDS LIKELY OVER SW VA...NRN MTNS OF E TN
AND SMOKY MTNS. THIS WILL CREATE AN INCREASED FIRE DANGER...WITH
THE LIMITING FACTOR BEING WHERE DEW POINTS MIX OUT TO IN THE
AFTERNOON. MOS PUSHES DEW POINT TEMPS UP BY 5 TO 10 DEGREES FROM
TODAY...WHICH WOULD KEEP MINIMUM RH VALUES ABOVE CRITERIA FOR A RED
FLAG WARNING. 

AFTER COORDINATION WITH VA AND TN FORESTRY DISTRICTS...WILL ISSUE
AN SPS FOR FIRE DANGER ON SUNDAY. GREATEST THREAT SEEMS TO BE SW VA
NRN MTNS AND SMOKY MTNS FOR NOW.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE PERIOD WITH INDICATION OF A VERY 
WEAK WAVE ON WEDNESDAY THAT MAY BRING A FEW CIRRUS CLOUDS TO THE 
AREA. OTHERWISE...THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN ALLOWS THE EASTERN U.S. TO 
ENJOY A FAIR WEATHER RIDGE RIGHT INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. 
THE GFS INDICATES THAT A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY BRINGING AN END TO THE STRING OF FAIR WEATHER 
DAYS. HOWEVER...DISCARDED THIS IDEA IN FAVOR OF THE ECMWF SOLUTION 
WHICH IS SLOWER TO BRING A THREAT OF RAIN TO THE AREA. ADJUSTED 
TEMPS ABOVE GUIDANCE NUMBERS IN THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 122008
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EST SAT FEB 12 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...NOT A LOT TO DISCUSS FOR
THESE PERIODS AS DRY WEATHER CONTINUES AND TEMPS WARM. LOW CLOUDS
OVER SE KY AND SW VA HAVE DRIFTED EAST AND DISSIPATED...LEAVING
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. MAY SEE SOME HIGH CLOUDS PASS ACROSS NRN AREAS
OVERNIGHT...AND WINDS MAY NOT DE-COUPLE COMPLETELY WITH SURFACE
HIGH CENTERED TO OUR SOUTH. THUS...I FAVORED A BLEND OF MOS MINS
OVER COOLER LOWS. OTHERWISE...WARMER MOS HIGHS WERE MORE CLOSELY
FOLLOWED EACH DAY...AND A BLEND OF MOS AGAIN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.

MAIN CONCERN SUNDAY IS THE DRY CONDITIONS WITH BREEZY WESTERLY
WINDS...WITH STRONGEST WINDS LIKELY OVER SW VA...NRN MTNS OF E TN
AND SMOKY MTNS. THIS WILL CREATE AN INCREASED FIRE DANGER...WITH
THE LIMITING FACTOR BEING WHERE DEW POINTS MIX OUT TO IN THE
AFTERNOON. MOS PUSHES DEW POINT TEMPS UP BY 5 TO 10 DEGREES FROM
TODAY...WHICH WOULD KEEP MINIMUM RH VALUES ABOVE CRITERIA FOR A RED
FLAG WARNING. 

AFTER COORDINATION WITH VA AND TN FORESTRY DISTRICTS...WILL ISSUE
AN SPS FOR FIRE DANGER ON SUNDAY. GREATEST THREAT SEEMS TO BE SW VA
NRN MTNS AND SMOKY MTNS FOR NOW.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE PERIOD WITH INDICATION OF A VERY 
WEAK WAVE ON WEDNESDAY THAT MAY BRING A FEW CIRRUS CLOUDS TO THE 
AREA. OTHERWISE...THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN ALLOWS THE EASTERN U.S. TO 
ENJOY A FAIR WEATHER RIDGE RIGHT INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. 
THE GFS INDICATES THAT A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY BRINGING AN END TO THE STRING OF FAIR WEATHER 
DAYS. HOWEVER...DISCARDED THIS IDEA IN FAVOR OF THE ECMWF SOLUTION 
WHICH IS SLOWER TO BRING A THREAT OF RAIN TO THE AREA. ADJUSTED 
TEMPS ABOVE GUIDANCE NUMBERS IN THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EST SAT FEB 12 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY...EXTENDING NORTHEASTWARD OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS SOME MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. MOST OF THE 
CLOUDINESS WITH THIS SHORT WAVE SHOULD STAY NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY...BUT WILL BE A LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS THROUGH TONIGHT. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT 
SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND LATELY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LONG TERM STILL APPEARS 
GENERALLY DRY WITH MODERATING TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD PER MODEL AND 
ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. THERE ARE A FEW WEAK SHORT WAVES WHICH WILL 
APPROACH THE REGION FROM TIME TO TIME...BUT NONE OF THESE APPEAR 
SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH TO WARRANT MENTION OF POPS. MODEL AGREEMENT 
DETERIORATES BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM WITH RESPECT TO UPPER FLOW 
PATTERN WITH THE ECMWF MODEL BUILDING AN IMPRESSIVE RIDGE OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS WITH HEIGHTS RISING TO VALUES MORE TYPICAL OF LATE 
SPRING. THE GFS MAINTAINS A MORE OR LESS ZONAL FLOW WITH LESS 
MAGNITUDE IN HEIGHT RISES. THE OPERATION GFS REPRESENTS THE COOLEST 
ENSEMBLE MEMBER HOWEVER...THUS BUMPED UP THE MEX GUIDANCE TEMPS 
A FEW DEGREES FOR NEXT FRIDAY. EVEN THAT MAY BE TOO COOL IF THE 
ECMWF VERIFIES. ALSO TENDED TO FAVOR WARMER MET GUIDANCE FOR MONDAY. 
OTHERWISE...DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

SUNDAY.

I TRENDED MORE WITH A MOS BLEND FOR TONIGHT'S MINS. 850 MB TEMPS
WARM THROUGH THE PERIOD AND WE SHOULD EASILY REACH THE WARMER MOS
HIGHS BY SUNDAY. OTHERWISE...MOS WAS CLOSE FOR SATURDAY HIGHS AND I
TRENDED TOWARD THE MILDER MOS MINS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...AS 850 MB
TEMPS WARM AND A SW-W LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THERE WILL BE A FINAL 
UPPER TROF PASSAGE EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING 
WITH A DRY COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE WHICH WILL KEEP THE FORECAST AREA IN 
A HOLDING PATTERN CONCERNING TEMPERATURES ON MONDAY. HOWEVER...THE 
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST GENERALLY FEATURES GRADUALLY BUILDING 
HEIGHTS. RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL ALLOW FOR A VERY 
PLEASANT WARMUP THROUGH THE WEEK. HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD MAKE IT 
INTO THE LOWER AND MIDDLE 60S BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS SOUTHERLY 
WINDS STRENGTHEN ON THE BACK SIDE OF A WESTERN ATLANTIC SURFACE 
HIGH. THE STORM TRACK WILL REMAIN TO THE NORTHWEST DURING THE LONG 
TERM WHICH WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY WITH A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE 
EXPECTED.

DOMINATE THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING 
OVER THE REGION LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT IT SHOULD ONLY BRING A 
SLIGHT INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT 
WITH A LIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW EXPECTED.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES REMAIN 
IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL 
THROUGH THE LONG TERM. TEMPERATURES SHOULD ALSO MODERATE AS UPPER 
FLOW TRANSITIONS FROM A NORTHWESTERLY CYCLONIC FLOW WITH A FEW 
EMBEDDED NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES TO A ZONAL OR EVEN 
SOUTHWESTERLY ANTICYCLONIC FLOW BY MID WEEK. THE NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORT WAVES DO NOT APPEAR TO HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE ASSOCIATED 
WITH THEM TO PRODUCE ANYTHING MORE THAT A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD 
COVER ALONG WITH A BRIEF SHOT OF COOLER AIR. NEVERTHELESS...AFTER A 
STILL-COOL SATURDAY...TEMPS SHOULD CLIMB TO ABOVE CLIMO AND STAY 
THERE THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID 
NOT DEVIATE FAR FROM MAV/MEX GUIDANCE.

WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR LIFTING SO KEPT A FEW CLOUDS IN BUT STAYED

FEATURE FOR TUESDAY AND THEN WARMING GETS UNDERWAY BY WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AS THE UPPER FLOW MAKES A GRADUAL TRANSITION TO

OBSCURING THE VIEW IN SEVERAL SPOTS. SNOW REPORTS CALLED IN OR 
OBTAINED FROM COCORAHS SHOWED AROUND 0.5 TO 2.0 INCHES SCATTERED 
ABOUT THE FORECAST AREA. MANY AREAS GOT A DUSTING UP TO 0.5 INCH.

FORECAST SHOULD BE ON TRACK FOR THIS AFTERNOON...AFTER LAST AREAS OF 
LOW CLOUDS DISSIPATE. SUNSHINE WILL BE OFFSET BY COLD AIR ADVECTION 
IN LOW LEVELS...AS NOTED FROM 850 MB UPPER AIR PLOT AND 12Z OHX/RNK 
SOUNDINGS. SOME LOW CLOUDS MAY ATTEMPT TO RE-ENTER SW NC AREA LATE 
TONIGHT AS LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES WEAK SE.

FORECAST AND GRIDS GENERALLY ON TRACK...BUT I PLAN TO FRESHEN GRIDS 
AROUND 11 AM AND UPDATE A FEW PRODUCTS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE COAST. THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST TODAY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. 
CURRENT RADAR TRENDS SHOW AN AREA OF LIGHT SNOW RAPIDLY DIMINISHING 
THIS MORNING...SO WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE WINTER WX ADVISORY EARLY. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS THE BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUD COVER AROUND 
THE MS RIVER...WITH MODELS INDICATING THAT VERY DRY AIR WILL FILTER 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...EXPECT DECREASING 
CLOUDINESS TODAY WITH TRANQUIL BUT COLD CONDITIONS INTO TONIGHT. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS FOR 
TONIGHT WITH GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING INTO THE AREA FOR BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE PERIOD. 
EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH DIGS DOWN INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
OF FRI NGT/SAT. SURFACE RIDGING SUPPRESSES AND SOME CLOUDS MOVE 
ACROSS NORTHERN MRX CWA. SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS BACK IN WEAKLY ON SUN. 
WEAK SURFACE FRONT MOVES SE THROUGH AREA MON. LIMITED MOISTURE BUT 
TRENDED TEMPS DOWN INTO EARLY TUE. THEN LAYER HEIGHTS BUILD AND 
WARMING TREND GETS UNDERWAY THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

.DISCUSSION...
SNOW REPORTS FROM MIDDLE TN AND EASTERN KY INDICATE ACCUMULATIONS
BETWEEN 1 AND 4 INCHES. RADAR TRENDS INDICATE PRECIPITAION
INTENSITY DECREASING AS IT MOVES EAST. SO FAR...REPORTS FROM EAST
TN AND SW VA HAVE BEEN BETWEEN A HALF AND 1.5 INCHES. THUS THE
FORECAST AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES LOOKS TO BE REASONABLY ON
TRACK...ALTHOUGH THE TIMING IS A BIT FASTER THAN EXPECTED.
EXTRAPOLATION OF THE BACK EDGE OF THE MAIN PRECIP AREA TAKES IT TO
OUR EASTERN BORDER BY MIDNIGHT...ALTHOUGH SOME LIGHT SNOW WILL
LINGER BEYOND THAT. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE PLANNED TO THE
CURRENT ADVISORY...BUT WILL UPDATE THE GRIDS TO LOWER POPS MORE
QUICKLY AND ADJUST TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EST WED FEB 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN WEATHER EVENT IS
STILL ON TAP FOR TONIGHT...AS UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES.
MUCH OF THE SNOW BAND FOR TODAY TO OUR W AND NW APPEARS TO BE
ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL JET DYNAMICS. THIS JET SUPPORT SEEMS TO
MOVE MAINLY ACROSS OUR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES OVER SE KY AND SW VA
OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...A BROAD AREA OF FORCING AND DIVERGENCE ALOFT
DOES DEVELOP OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY 03Z TO 09Z THURSDAY.
SOME LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE IS SUGGESTED OVER MAINLY SE TN INTO WRN
NC OVERNIGHT...WITH AT LEAST WEAK FRONTOGENESIS DEVELOPING IN THOSE
AREAS. 

THUS...OVERALL THE PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS AND WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY AREAS APPEARED TO BE ON TRACK...WITH JUST A TWEAK OR TWO
ON SNOW AMOUNTS AND AN INCREASE IN POPS UP TO NEAR 100 PERCENT.
SO...KEPT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS BELOW WARNING CRITERIA...WITH A BRIEF
MELT POSSIBLE EARLY THIS EVENING...BEFORE THE DRY LOW LEVELS COOL
AND SATURATE. COLD AIR ALOFT WILL PROVIDE GOOD SNOW GROWTH...BUT A
FAST TRACK EASTWARD LIMITS HOW LONG THE SNOW LASTS.

FOR THURSDAY...ACCEPTING A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION WHICH ABUNDANT
SUNSHINE WILL LIKELY MELT AWAY...SO TRENDED TOWARD COOLER HIGHS.
CHILLY THURSDAY NIGHT WITH TEMPS TO BEGIN A RECOVERY ON FRIDAY. 
GRIDS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WERE ON TRACK...AND CHANGED
VERY LITTLE FOR NOW. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
INTO THE AREA BRINGING MOSTLY DRY WEATHER FOR THE PERIOD. MODELS 
INDICATING A FEW RIPPLES RIDING OVER THE RIDGE ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY ONLY. II SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION 
ON TUESDAY. UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS EAST BY WEDNESDAY BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER. EXPECTING A WARMING TREND FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

SNOW FOR MAIN PRECIPITATION (PCPN) TYPE. LIQUID PCPN AMOUNTS SEEM TO 
STAY AROUND 0.15 INCH OVERALL WITH A POSSIBLE 0.20 INCH OVER SOME 
SRN SPOTS. THIS SHOULD KEEP SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE ADVISORY RANGE 
IN GENERAL...BUT I MAY TWEAK THE AMOUNTS FOR HIGHEST ELEVATIONS IN 
THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE JUST A BIT (MAYBE 1-4 INCHES IN THE SMOKIES). 

OTHERWISE...WILL CHECK HOURLY AND MAX TEMP GRIDS FOR TODAY...AND 
FRESHEN OUR GRIDS AND PRODUCTS BY AROUND 11 AM EST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST WED FEB 9 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE HIGH PLAINS AND EXTENDING 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH A DEVELOPING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER SOUTH TEXAS. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE ALONG THE GULF COASTAL REGION TODAY...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED MOISTURE SPREADING NORTHWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THIS EVENING. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT AROUND A TENTH TO POSSIBLY TWO-TENTHS OF AN INCH OF LIQUID- 
EQUIVALENT PRECIP SHOULD AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING... 
WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN ONE TO TWO INCHES OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS. 
SINCE TEMPS SHOULD QUICKLY FALL BELOW FREEZING AFTER SUNSET THIS 
EVENING...THINK THIS SNOWFALL COULD CREATE SLIPPERY ROAD CONDITIONS 
(ESPECIALLY UNTREATED ROADS). WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE 
A WINTER WX ADVISORY AREAWIDE FOR THIS EVENING...MENTIONING 1 TO 3 
INCHES OF SNOW POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THURSDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THE EXTENDED. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGING INTO THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY. WEAK MEAN TROUGH IN 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION. SHORT WAVE DIGS SE ON SAT BRINGING SOME 
CLOUDS TO NE AREAS BUT PCPN EXPECTED TO STAY N OF AREA. UPPER TROUGH 
DEEPENS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY. WEAK COLD FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH LATE MONDAY WITH LOW CHANCE FOR PCPN WITH SECONDARY 
SURFACE TROUGH ON TUE ACROSS SW VA/NE TN. COOL MORNINGS WITH DECENT 
WARM UP SUN AND MONDAY IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT.

944 
FXUS64 KMRX 081930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST TUE FEB 8 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...GENERALLY TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH MOST THE SHORT TERM AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT. A SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEM IS PROJECTED TO APPROACH LATE IN THE SHORT TERM...BUT 
NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACT IS EXPECTED DURING THIS TIME FRAME. 
NEVERTHELESS...HAVE BUMPED UP POPS TO CHANCE OVER VIRTUALLY ALL OF 
OUR CWA BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED COOLER 
MAV GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE GFS AND NAM HAVE CONVERGED IN THEIR GENERAL DEPICTIONS OF THE 
SYSTEM AFFECTING THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE DEPTH INCREASES 
QUICKLY AFTER 00Z THU AS THE 850 MB CIRCULATION MOVES INTO THE LOWER 
MS REGION. LARGE-SCALE QG FORCING IS GREATEST BETWEEN 00-06Z...WITH 
THE NAM SHOWING A FRONTOGENESIS ZONE PASSING OVER THE AREA IN THIS 
WINDOW. ALTHOUGH TIMING IS SIMILAR BETWEEN MODELS...NAM QPF AMOUNTS 
REMAIN MUCH HIGHER THAN THE GFS AND THE SREF AND HPC. THE NAM SNOWS 
ACCUMULATIONS OF 2-4 INCHES WHICH SEEM TOO HIGH GIVEN THAT LIFT IS 
NOT VERY STRONG AND THE FAST MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM...AND WILL GO 
WITH THE HPC GUIDANCE OF 1-2 INCHES ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. THE
MODEL TREND HAS BEEN TOWARD A FASTER SYSTEM...AND WILL DROP BACK
POPS ON THU MORNING TO A SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE. WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO
HIGHLIGHT THIS EVENT AS SOME LOCATIONS COULD APPROACH ADVISORY
CRITERIA.

THE REST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD LOOKS DRY. AN BROAD UPPER TROUGH 
OVER THE EASTERN CONUS WILL KEEP TEMPS BELOW NORMAL ON FRIDAY...THEN 
THE TROUGH MOVES OFF THE COAST ON SATURDAY...BRINGING WARMER TEMPS 
IN THE 50S FOR SUNDAY. THE GFS SHOWS ANOTHER DEEP TROUGH DROPPING 
ACROSS THE EAST COAST ON MONDAY...BUT THE ECMWF SHOWS A MUCH WEAKER 
SHORTWAVE WITH A STRONG RIDGE BEHIND IT. WILL AWAIT LATER MODEL RUNS 
BEFORE ANY DRASTIC CHANGES ARE MADE...AND WILL STICK TO TEMPS WITHIN 
A FEW DEGREES OF NORMAL FOR NOW.


&&

AREAWIDE BY SUNRISE...AM CONCERNED ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF BLACK 
ICE DEVELOPING IN SOME AREAS OVERNIGHT. THUS...WILL ALSO ISSUE A 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THIS CONCERN.

WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION THE ADVISORY...AND TO TWEAK 
TEMPS AND PRECIP WORDING ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

235 PM EST MON FEB 7 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND SURFACE 
COLD FRONT CURRENTLY MARCHING THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS FEATURE 
WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST WITH COLD FRONT PASSING THROUGH OUR
CWA FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. MOST OF THE DYNAMICS
WITH THIS SYSTEM EXPECTED TO STAY NORTH AND WEST OF OUR FORECAST
AREA. THUS PRECIP EXPECTED TO BE MAINLY LIGHT AND MOST OF THAT
SHOULD BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN WITH ONLY A BRIEF CHANGE-OVER TO SNOW
ON BACK EDGE OF PRECIP SHIELD. ANY ACCUMULATING SNOW SHOULD BE
LIGHT AND CONFINED MAINLY TO HIGHER TERRAIN WITH NO ACCUMULATIONS
EXPECTED IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL QUITE
RAPIDLY BEHIND FRONT INTO THE 20S BY MORNING. TUESDAY EXPECTED TO
BE DRY WITH TEMPS RETURNING TO BELOW CLIMO. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO
FAVOR SLIGHTLY COOLER MAV GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER TX ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND TRACKS 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MIDLEVEL 
ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL ENTER THE AREA 
WEDNESDAY...WHICH WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER...BUT WITH DRY LOW 
LEVEL AIR IT MAY TAKE SEVERAL MORE HOURS FOR PRECIP TO REACH THE 
GROUND. THE GFS IS QUICKER TO BRING IN PRECIP THAN THE NAM...WHICH 
HOLDS OFF PRECIP UNTIL AFTER 00Z THU. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE SLOWER 
NAM BUT KEEP A SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE POP IN NORTH AND WEST ON WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. STRONGER LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH FRONTOGENESIS AND THE UPPER 
JET WILL MOVE IN AFTER 00Z THU. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS WED NIGHT WITH 
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...GENERALLY 1 TO 2 INCHES. IF THE TRACK OF 
THE LOW IS FARTHER NORTH...AMOUNTS COULD BE HIGHER. PRECIP WILL END 
THURSDAY MORNING WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE 700 MB TROUGH AXIS. 

THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM WILL BE DRY WITH A GENERAL WARMING 
TREND. A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY..WHICH SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL. A WEAK UPPER 
RIDGE AND AN INCREASING SW FLOW SHOULD BRING TEMPERATURES TO NEAR OR 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.
