WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT. FREEZING LEVEL FALLS FAST AND EXPECT A FAST 
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW. PERIOD OF GOOD SNOWFALL WILL BE BRIEF AND 
ACCUMULATION WILL BE HINDERED BY MELTING AT SNOW ONSET. MOISTURE 
DROPS OFF AFTER COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH LOW RH IN THE SNOW GROWTH 
REGION. LIGHT SNOW ACCOMULATION ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN AREAS AS 
SNOW TAPERS OFF OVERNIGHT. TEMPS NEAR NORMAL AND CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS MAY 
LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN AREAS EARLY TUESDAY MORNING...OTHERWISE... 
SHOULD SEE IMPROVING CONDITIONS WITH CLEARING SKIES AND COOL 
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY.  MAIN SYSTEM ON CONCERN THIS 
EXTENDED PACKAGE CONTINUES TO BE A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM EXPECTED TO 
MOVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MODELS/RUNS STILL INDICATE 
DIFFERENCES IN DETAILS WITH THIS SYSTEM...ESPECIALLY IN REGARDS TO 
WHERE THE MAIN BAND OF PRECIP MOVES THROUGH.  WILL LIMIT LOW POPS TO 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH 
DECREASING POPS FOR THURSDAY.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH 
FOR A MOSTLY SNOW EVENT...THOUGH A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW IS POSSIBLE 
SOUTH.  MAIN QUESTION WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE WHERE THE MAIN BAND 
OF PRECIP TRACKS THROUGH.  STILL BELIEVE THIS BAND WILL STAY TO OUR 
SOUTH SO DO NOT EXPECT THIS WILL BE A SIGNIFICANT SNOW EVENT BUT 
WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR.  BEHIND THIS SYSTEM...UNSEASONABLY COOL 
AND DRY AIR MOVES IN FOR FRIDAY.  CONTINUED DRY WITH MODERATING 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE WEEKEND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  28  39  21  40 /  50  60  10  10  20

ON TRACK TO AFFECT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM. MONDAY'S SYSTEM WINDS DOWN MONDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH AREA CHANGING PRECIP TO ALL SNOW DURING THAT PERIOD. THIS 
DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A SIGNIFICANT SNOW EVENT AT THIS TIME...WITH 
MINOR ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. DETAILS 
OF SECOND SYSTEM STILL SOMEWHAT MURKY...BUT GENERAL MODEL CONSENSUS 
SHOWS MAIN EVENT WILL OCCUR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LATEST MODEL/ENSEMBLE 
RUNS SUGGEST MAIN PRECIP AXIS WILL REMAIN SOUTH AND QPFS GENERALLY 
PROJECTED TO BE QUITE LIGHT FOR OUR AREA. THUS NOT ANTICIPATING A 
MAJOR WINTER EVENT AT THIS TIME...ALTHOUGH MOST PRECIP WILL PROBABLY 
OCCUR AS SNOW. DID BUMP UP POPS SOMEWHAT TO LIKELY AREA-WIDE.

BALANCE OF FORECAST APPEARS DRY WITH TEMPS SLOWLY MODERATING FROM 
WELL BELOW CLIMO TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM. FOR 
TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER OF THE GUIDANCE VALUES.

FXUS64 KMRX 052033
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EST SAT FEB 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...SMALL SYSTEM THAT WAS OVER W AND MID TN THIS MORNING 
HAS LIFTED NEWD INTO KY THIS AFTERNOON.  THE LIFT WITH THIS SYSTEM IS 
MAINLY MISSING OUR CWA...LOOKS LIKE SOME PRECIP SCRAPING ACROSS OUR 
NORTHERN-MOST COUNTIES.  STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS ARE FILLING IN BEHIND 
COLD FRONT.  CLOUDS PARTIALLY SUSTAINED BY SURFACE HEATING...BUT 
STILL WILL BE SLOW TO MAKE THEIR WAY THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT.  
TRAJECTORY FORECASTS FOR 0-1 KM SHOW SOURCE REGION FOR SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AIR MASS IS FROM ARKLATEX REGION...CLEARING LINE JUST WEST 
OF MISS RIVER NOW...JUST ADVECTION OF THIS WOULD HAVE BACK EDGE OF 
CLOUDS NEAR KTYS BY 12Z...BUT WITH EROSION FROM ABOVE...WOULD THINK 
THAT BACK EDGE WILL BE ACCELERATING.  SUNDAY MORNING SHOULD SEE 
PLENTY OF SUN...BUT HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE 
ENCROACHING FROM THE WEST DURING THE AFTERNOON.  GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
TEMPS FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY LOOK PRETTY GOOD...WILL STICK CLOSE TO 
THEM.  GUSTY WINDS THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD SUBSIDE QUICKLY AS DOWNWARD 
TRANSPORT LESSENS WITH DECOUPLING OF BOUNDARY LAYER...AND PRESSURE 
GRADIENT RELAXES. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WHILE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO THE WEAK 
SYSTEM ON MONDAY...THE SYSTEM EXPECTED BY MID WEEK REMAINS LOW 
CONFIDENCE. A GREAT DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY STILL SURROUNDS THE TRACK... 
TIMING...INTENSITY...PRECIP TYPE AND EVEN QPF. LATEST MODEL RUNS 
SEEM TO HAVE SETTLED A BIT BETTER ON TIMING...MAINLY IN THE LATE 
WEDNESDAY TO EARLY THURSDAY TIME FRAME. BASED ON THE EXPECTED 
TIMING...ANTICIPATE THAT MOST OF THE PRECIP WILL OCCUR AS SNOW 
GENERALLY. THE MAIN UNCERTAINTY NOW APPEARS TO BE QPF AS MODELS HAVE 
BEEN BACKING OFF ON THIS PARAMETER IN LATEST RUNS. ONLY A FEW OF THE 
21 GEFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE NOW PROJECTING EVEN 0.15 INCH QPF FOR 
THAT TIME FRAME...WITH THE MORE SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS REMAINING SOUTH 
AND EAST. AT THIS TIME...ANY ATTEMPT AT TRYING TO QUANTIFY 
SIGNIFICANCE OF THIS SYSTEM WOULD BE WILD SPECULATION. WILL CONTINUE 
TO HIGHLIGHT IN HWO PRODUCT...BUT REMAIN INTENTIONALLY VAGUE 
REGARDING ITS POTENTIAL IMPACT.

THE MONDAY SYSTEM APPEARS WILL BE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT...AND A MINOR 
ONE AT THAT. THE PRECIP MAY BEGIN AND END AS SNOW OR MIXED PRECIP 
TYPE...BUT TEMPS WILL BE TOO WARM FOR ANYTHING SIGNIFICANT DURING 
THE DAY ON MONDAY. THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM APPEARS GENERALLY 
DRY ALBEIT WITH BELOW CLIMO TEMPS AT THIS POINT. TEMPS EXPECTED TO 
SLOWLY MODERATE TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM AS UPPER FLOW 
DEAMPLIFIES TO A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EST FRI FEB 4 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TO OUR 
WEST WILL LIFT NORTHEAST DURING THE PERIOD.  COLDER AIR WILL BEGIN 
PUSHING INTO OUR AREA ON SATURDAY. WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS TONIGHT 
ALL ZONES...BUT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THERE WILL BE A LOT OF PRECIP.  
JUST CHANCE POPS NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL AND SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH FOR 
SATURDAY...MAINLY IN THE MORNING.  SHOULD BE MAINLY RAIN...EXCEPT 
MAY BE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS 
COLDER AIR MOVES IN. NO MAJOR ARGUMENTS WITH MAV TEMPS...SO WILL 
STAY CLOSE.      


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AFTER A GENERALLY DRY 
AND QUIET WEEKEND...THINGS BECOME UNSETTLED FOR THE EARLY TO MIDDLE 
PORTION OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK AS A SERIES OF SYSTEMS AFFECT THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. FIRST SYSTEM APPROACHES ON MONDAY WITH 
THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS PASSING THROUGH LATE MONDAY-EARLY TUESDAY. 
THIS SYSTEM DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE SIGNIFICANT AT THIS TIME... 
ALTHOUGH SOME WINTERY PRECIP MAY PRECEDE IT EARLY MONDAY. NEXT 
SYSTEM IS MORE PROBLEMATIC AS MODELS CONTINUE TO DISAGREE ON THE 
TRACK...INTENSITY AND TIMING OF THE SYSTEM. GFS HAS DEPICTED THE 
GREATEST IMPACT FROM THIS FEATURE WITH POTENTIAL OF SIGNIFICANT 
SNOW. HOWEVER...ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS DEPICT A MORE AMPLIFIED 
TROUGH AND THUS A WARMER SCENARIO WHICH IMPLIES MORE OF A RAIN 
EVENT. GEFS ENSEMBLE SPREAD TOO GREAT TO PROVIDE MUCH HELP. THUS 
STILL TOO EARLY TO INFER POTENTIAL IMPACTS AT THIS TIME. DID BUMP UP 
POPS TO CHANCE FOR WED NIGHT HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO FAVOR 
BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST FRI FEB 4 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING 
OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS NE INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AREA TEMPERATURES HOVERING AROUND FREEZING 
THIS MORNING. DP/S REMAIN IN THE LOW 20 MOST AREAS. STRENGTHENING 
UPPER JET FROM TX TO TN VALLEY TODAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL REDEVELOP 
EARLY TODAY. INITIAL SHIELD OF PCPN WILL BE FALLING INTO RELATIVELY 
DRY LOW LEVEL AIRMASS. FOR THIS REASON LEFT WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY 
IN PLACE FOR POTENTIAL OF ICY CONDITIONS WITH EVAPORATIVE COOLING 
EARLY. WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH WHEN BULK OF 
WIDESPREAD PCPN MOVES NE INTO THE AREA. FREEZING LEVEL RISES QUICKLY 
TO ABOVE 5000 FEET. AFTERNOON PCPN WILL BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN. 
LEANED ON THE HIGH SIDE OF TEMPERATURES FOR THIS AFTERNOON. LITTLE 
CHANGE IN THE TONIGHT PERIOD. ONGOING PCPN AS UPPER JET CORE SLOWLY 
SHIFTS EAST IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TEMPS FALL SLOWLY 
OVERNIGHT. PCPN MAY END AS LIGHT SNOW ACROSS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE 
TONIGHT. CONTINUED ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER 
OVER THE AREA ON SATURDAY...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN LOCATIONS...AS 
FRIDAY/S SYSTEM PULLS AWAY.  WILL BRIEFLY BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS ON 
SUNDAY.  MODEL AND RUN CONSISTENCY BECOME QUITE POOR FOR THE REST OF 
THE EXTENDED.  A SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH AROUND THE MONDAY TIME FRAME 
AND WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS.  WITH EXPECTED TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE...SHOULD SEE SNOW EARLY IN THE DAY CHANGE OVER TO RAIN BY 
AFTERNOON AND SWITCH BACK TO SNOW MONDAY NIGHT.  SHOWERS LINGERING 
INTO TUESDAY SHOULD REMAIN SNOW AS COOLER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THE 
SYSTEM.  CONFIDENCE DECREASES EVEN FURTHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
PERIOD...BUT MODEL TRENDING TOWARD BRINGING IN ANOTHER SYSTEM AROUND 
WEDNESDAY.  HAVE ADDED LOW POPS ACROSS THE AREA FOR THIS

LOWER 20S ACROSS THE BULK OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO EVAPORATIVE

ALOFT.

THE ADVISORY AREA TOWARD 09Z...NAM NOTHING UNTIL AFTER 12Z...AND GFS 
MOST AGRESSIVE IN PUSHING PCPN JUST NORTH OF I-40 BETWEEN 09-12Z. 

THUS...THE BEST COURSE IS TO CONTINUE THE ADVISORY AND LET MIDNIGHT 
SHIFT MONITOR THE SPREAD OF PCPN NE OVERNIGHT...AND WHAT TYPE.

321 
FXUS64 KMRX 031925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EST THU FEB 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
DEVELOPING IN THE GULF WILL TRACK NORTHEAST DURING THE PERIOD.  THIS 
WILL PUSH MOISTURE INTO OUR REGION OVERNIGHT AND ESPECIALLY FRIDAY.  
WHILE THIS DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A BIG PRECIP PRODUCER...PRECIP TYPE IS 
VERY PROBLEMATIC AS PRECIP MOVES IN TONIGHT/EARLY FRIDAY.  MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE IT WILL BE TOO WARM ALOFT FOR ANY SNOW...BUT HAVE 
NOTED THAT SOME VERY LIGHT SNOW HAS BRIEFLY OCCURRED FURTHER SOUTHWEST 
ON THE LEADING EDGE...AS EVAPORATIVE COOLING TEMPORARILY COOLS THE 
COLUMN. OTHER THAN SOME LIGHT SNOW OR SLEET EARLY...PRECIP SHOULD BE 
FALLING AS ALL LIQUID...BUT WITH SURFACE TEMPS POSSIBLY BELOW 
FREEZING LATE TONIGHT/EARLY FRIDAY...SOME AREAS MAY SEE SOME LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN AS WELL.  LOOKS LIKE PRECIP WILL CHANGE TO ALL RAIN BY 
AFTERNOON AS TEMPS CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE.  WHILE IT DOES NOT LOOK 
LIKE ANY WINTRY PRECIP WILL ACCUMULATE MUCH...ANY FREEZING RAIN IS 
OF COURSE A SIGNIFICANT CONCERN.  GIVEN UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW 
WIDESPREAD ANY PROBLEMS MAY BE...WILL NOT ISSUE ANY WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY AT THIS TIME AND WILL JUST CONTINUE SPS.  HOWEVER...THIS 
SITUATION WILL OBVIOUSLY HAVE TO BE MONITORED CLOSELY...AS THE 
POTENTIAL EXISTS FOR MORE SIGNIFICANT PROBLEMS.     

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...CONFIDENCE VERY LOW FOR 
LATTER PORTION OF LONG TERM AS MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO 
SUFFER FROM POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY IN ADDITION TO GENERAL 
DISAGREEMENT AMONG THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS. ENSEMBLES EXHIBIT 
UNUSUALLY WIDE SPREAD AMONG MEMBERS. THERE IS GENERAL AGREEMENT ON 
LONG WAVE TROUGH BECOMING ESTABLISHED OVER THE EASTERN TWO-THIRDS OF 
THE CONUS. THE PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF INDIVIDUAL SHORT WAVES 
PROGRESSING THROUGH THIS LONG WAVE FLOW PRECLUDES ANY CERTAINTY WITH 
RESPECT TO TIMING HOWEVER. THUS HAVE MADE VERY FEW CHANGES TO 
PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST.

MODELS ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT TOMORROW'S SYSTEM WILL 
PULL OUT OF THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. STILL ANTICIPATING MAINLY RAIN AS 
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS DEPICT ABOVE FREEZING TEMPS TO NEAR 700 MB. 
TRAILING UPPER TROUGH PASSES JUST NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA ON 
SATURDAY. MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY BEFORE MODEL DISCREPANCIES ARISE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             32  41  35  44  28 /  70 100  70  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  41  34  46  27 /  40 100  80  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       29  40  34  47  26 /  30 100  80  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              25  42  34  46  23 /  10  90  90  40  10

847 
FXUS64 KMRX 030912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST THU FEB 3 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ANOTHER DRY DAY EXPECTED TODAY 
WITH SOME SUNSHINE...ALTHOUGH CIRRUS WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA AS MOISTURE STREAMS NORTHEAST AHEAD OF 
SOUTHWESTERN U.S. UPPER TROF. THE TROF/CLOSED LOW WILL MOVE SLOWLY 
EAST TODAY EVENTUALLY BUILDING INTO CENTRAL TEXAS BY 12Z FRIDAY. 
MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY DEEPEN AHEAD OF THE TROF OVERRIDING COOLER 
SUB FREEZING AIR ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE THAT PRECIP THAT DEVELOPS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH TONIGHT 
SHOULD BE IN THE FORM OF SNOW. AS TEMPERATURES SLOWLY RISE WITH 
INCREASING WARM AIR ADVECTION...RAIN WILL BECOME MIXED WITH THE SNOW 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THE PRECIP 
SHOULD FALL MAINLY AS SNOW ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA 
HOWEVER...LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED ACROSS MOST OF THE 
AREA AS QPF SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT IN THIS REGION PRIOR TO 12Z FRI. 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA MAY SEE A DUSTING 
TO AS MUCH AS ONE INCH WITH THE HIGHER ONE INCH TOTALS MORE LIKELY 
OCCURRING IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN.   

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE MODELS HAVE TRENDED 
FASTER FOR THE FRIDAY-SATURDAY SYSTEM. CATEGORICAL POPS WILL SPREAD 
ACROSS THE AREA FROM SOUTH TO NORTH FRIDAY MORNING...MAINLY AS SNOW 
BUT CHANGING TO RAIN THROUGH THE MORNING AS DEEP WARM ADVECTION 
ENSUES. SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE FRIDAY 
MORNING...AN INCH OR LESS EVEN IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE STRONGEST 
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER JET DYNAMICS OCCURS FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...BY THEN PRECIP IS ALL RAIN. LIFT AND MOISTURE DEPTH 
DECREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT AS WE ARE IN THE DRY SLOT 
DIRECTLY UNDER THE UPPER JET. POPS DROP BACK TO A CHANCE SATURDAY 
MORNING WITH THE LACK OF MOISTURE IN THE ICE NUCLEATION ZONE...AND 
WE COULD SEE JUST DRIZZLE MUCH OF THE DAY. MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER JET 
TO OUR EAST WILL END PRECIP BY 00Z SUNDAY. 

SUNDAY LOOKS TO BE DRY WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES BEFORE THE NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES FOR MONDAY. GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH A DEEP TROUGH BEING POSITIONED OVER THE EASTERN CONUS 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. PRECIP AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...FOLLOWED BY A STRONG PUNCH OF COLD AIR FOR 
TUESDAY. EXPECT HIGHS ONLY IN THE 30S TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WITH 
LOWS IN THE TEENS.

FXUS64 KMRX 022014
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST WED FEB 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO 
OUR NORTHEAST WILL CONTINUE TO PULL AWAY...AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN FROM THE WEST.  COLDER AIR PUSH WILL WANE OVERNIGHT...AND GUSTY 
WINDS WILL DIMINISH.  LOWER CLOUDS WILL DIMINISH DURING THE SHORT 
TERM...BUT WE WILL SEE INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
SYSTEM.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE PERIOD...SO 
WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A SOUTHERN CLOSED LOW OVER WESTERN MEXICO MOVES EAST FRIDAY AND
THEN IS PICKED UP BY SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS AND MERGES WITH IT
SATURDAY. MOISTURE WILL LIFT NORTHWARD AND SPREAD PRECIPITATION
INTO SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE
THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL SHOW
A DEEP NEAR-FREEZING ISOTHERMAL LAYER AT THE ONSET OF PRECIP...SO
THERE MAY BE SOME MIXED PRECIPITATION WITH LIGHT SLEET...FREEZING
RAIN AND SNOW BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN AS WARM ADVECTION INCREASES
FRIDAY. QPF AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY MORNING AND TEMPERATURES MOSTLY CLOSE TO FREEZING SO DO NOT
EXPECT ANY SIGNIFICANT TRAVEL PROBLEMS. THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES
EAST SLOWLY SO HIGH PRECIPITATION CHANCES CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY
NIGHT. TEMPERATURES FRIDAY NIGHT WILL DROP INTO THE LOWER TO MID
30S...WITH THE RAIN CONTINUING BUT MAY CHANGE TO SNOW LATE FRIDAY
NIGHT OR EARLY SATURDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES THROUGH. NAM
MODEL KEEPS WARM AIR OVER REGION THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT LOWERING
FREEZING LEVELS SATURDAY MORNING WITH GFS A LITTLE QUICKER WITH
COLDER AIR MOVING IN. NO ACCUMULATION FRIDAY NIGHT EXPECTED EXCEPT
MAYBE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. SATURDAY POSSIBLE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS
NORTHEAST AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS. LATE SATURDAY THIS SYSTEM MOVES
OUT AND HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE REST OF THE WEEKEND.
SUNDAY A NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND DIGS
UPPER TROUGH SOUTH INTO TEXAS. A NEW COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE
REGION MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WITH
HIGHS IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S. HOWEVER TUESDAY THE SYSTEM WILL
SPREAD PRECIPITATION INTO THE REGION WITH RAIN LIKELY CHANGING TO
SNOW BY TUESDAY EVENING AND A MUCH COLDER AIR MASS WITH ORIGINS IN
WESTERN CANADA TAKING OVER WEDNESDAY.

241 
FXUS64 KMRX 020936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST WED FEB 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DEEP LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES 
TO SHIFT STEADILY NORTHEAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY. THE 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT IS NEARING THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. PLACED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTHEAST 
CORNER OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR POSSIBLE SPRINKLES NEAR THE 
DEPARTING FRONT EARLY THIS MORNING. MASS OF LOW CLOUDS FOLLOWS IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT BUT WESTERLY FLOW MAY LEAD TO SOME BREAKS IN THE 
GREAT VALLEY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE MODELS 
ALLOW FOR DRY ADVECTION THROUGH THE DAY. KEPT THE WIND PRODUCTS 
GOING AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT STILL RATHER STRONG BUT SHOULD RELAX 
BY MID DAY. MAX TEMP FORECAST WILL BE A LITTLE CHALLENGING WITH 
TREMENDOUS TEMPERATURE GRADIENT APPROACHING THROUGH MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE. TRIED TO TIME THE CHILLY ARRIVAL WITH THE KNOWLEDGE OF 
THE IMPEDING IMPACTS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE ARCTIC AIRMASS 
MAY NOT ALLOW FOR MUCH MOVEMENT IN TEMPERATURE TODAY ONCE THE FRIGID 
STUFF SPILLS ACROSS THE PLATEAU. A MUCH COLDER NIGHT IS IN STORE 
TONIGHT WITH MIN TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.   

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A SOUTHERN STREAM CLOSED LOW 
OVER THE DESERT SW GETS PICKED UP BY THE NORTHERN STREAM OVER THE 
PLAINS ON FRIDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND UPPER DIVERGENCE IN THE JET 
ENTRANCE REGION WILL SPREAD PRECIP INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
AREA BEGINNING FRIDAY MORNING. MODELS SOUNDINGS SHOW A DEEP 
NEAR-FREEZING ISOTHERMAL LAYER AT THE ONSET OF PRECIP...SO IT MAY 
BEGIN AS SNOW BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN AS WARM ADVECTION INCREASES 
THROUGH THE DAY. EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE UPPER TROUGH IS 
SLOW...SO CATEGORICAL TO LIKELY POPS WILL REMAIN IN THE AREA THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT. LIFT IS NOT STRONG WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND SURFACE 
CYCLOGENESIS IS ILL-DEFINED...SO QPF SHOULD BE RELATIVELY MODEST. 
ALTHOUGH SURFACE TEMPS FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BE IN THE MID 30S...A DEEP 
ABOVE-FREEZING LAYER SHOULD KEEP THE PRECIP ALL RAIN UNTIL IT ENDS 
ON SATURDAY WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS.

A BROAD UPPER TROUGH REMAINS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH MONDAY. 
WHILE WEAK SHORTWAVES WITHIN THE BROAD TROUGH MAY AFFECT THE 
AREA...CONFIDENCE IN MODEL DETAILS IS TOO LOW TO MENTION ANY PRECIP 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL KEEP THESE DAYS DRY WITH TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL. A MORE AMPLIFIED TROUGH IS SHOWN BY THE GFS AND ECMWF 
TO AFFECT THE AREA ON TUESDAY. WILL INCLUDE CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS WITH THIS SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. A SUBSTANTIALLY 
COLDER AIR MASS APPEARS TO FOLLOW THIS TROUGH FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 012000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST TUE FEB 1 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
POISED TO MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT.  
AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATE COLD FRONT...A LARGE AREA OF RAIN 
SHOWERS...POSSIBLY WITH SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER...WILL PUSH ACROSS THE 
MRX CWA FOR CATEGORICAL POPS.  TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WARM ENOUGH 
FOR AN ALL RAIN EVENT.  OF GREATER CONCERN WILL BE STRONG WINDS 
ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT.  WINDS WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY 
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  WIND GUSTS AT HIGHER POINTS IN THE TN VALLEY 
COULD SEE 40 MPH.  THE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS SHOULD SEE 
SUSTAINED WINDS OF 20 TO 30 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 50 TO 60 MPH.  A WIND 
ADVISORY AND A HIGH WIND WARNING WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT OVERNIGHT.  
CONDITIONS IMPROVE ON WEDNESDAY...WINDS WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH BUT 
REMAIN GUSTY THROUGH THE DAY.  DRIER...COOLER AIR MOVES IN FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MORE THAN A FEW 
DEGREES DURING THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT AND CONTINUITY FOR THIS PACKAGE...WITH TWO MAIN SYSTEMS 
EXPECTED. A SRN STREAM SYSTEM WILL SPREAD PRECIPITATION (MOSTLY RAIN 
INITIALLY) NORTHWARD ON FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH VERY FEW 
DIFFERENCES AMONGST THE NAM/GFS/ECMWF MODELS. POPS WERE INCREASED 
FOR THIS SYSTEM TO BE IN LINE WITH NEIGHBORS TO OUR WEST...SOUTH AND 
EAST. KEPT POPS AROUND SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SW VA FOR NOW. 

MOISTURE DIMINISHES AS COLD AIR ADVECTS IN ON SATURDAY...AND OUR
PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED GOOD WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WEST AND CHANCE 
POPS EAST. I CHOSE TO STAY A BIT BELOW GFSX MOS FOR MAX TEMPS 
SATURDAY. DON'T EXPECT MUCH SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL WITH THIS SYSTEM.

OTHER SYSTEM WILL BE THE UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT EARLY NEXT WEEK 
WHICH MODELS CONTINUE TO SLOW DOWN. THIS SYSTEM HAS THE POTENTIAL TO 
BE MORE SIGNIFICANT AND TAP INTO GULF MOISTURE...WITH BETTER LIFT 
AND STRONGER COLD AIR ADVECTION. TIMING FOR THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO BE 
MOSTLY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. TRENDED CLOSER TO NWS NEIGHBORS 
TEMP GRIDS AND NOT AS COLD AS THE GFSX MOS...AS ECMWF WOULD BRING 
COLDER AIR IN NOT QUITE AS SOON AS DAY 7.  

&&

651 AM EST TUE FEB 1 2011

.AVIATION...STRONG STORM SYSTEM WITH DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE CENTER
MAKING ITS WAY TOWARD THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY THIS
MORNING. TYS AND TRI ARE ENJOYING VFR CONDITIONS BUT LOWER CEILINGS
ARE LURKING TO THE SOUTHWEST. LOW STRATUS DECK ASSOCIATED WITH
IMPRESSIVE WEDGE ON LOW LEVEL SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW HAS BEEN IN PLACE
AT CHA FOR SEVERAL HOURS AND WITH MOISTURE INCREASING FROM THE
SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF THE DEEP LOW FLIGHT CONDITIONS SHOULD STAY MVFR
PRIOR TO THE WORST FLIGHT CONDITIONS ARRIVING AT 22Z WITH THE
APPROACH OF SYSTEM COLD FRONT. PLACED SOME HINTS OF CONVECTION IN
THE FORECAST FOR CHA WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDER AT TYS WITH
WORST CONDITIONS OCCURRING AT 00Z HERE. DOWNSLOPING FLOW AT TRI MAY
ALLOW FOR VFR FLIGHT DEEP INTO THE AFTERNOON BEFORE WORST FLIGHT
CONDITIONS DEVELOP TOWARD 03Z. FROPA WILL RANGE FROM AROUND 02Z AT
CHA TO 07Z AT TRI. STRONGEST WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH POWERFUL LOW
LEVEL JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TERMINALS FROM AROUND 22Z TO AROUND
07Z CREATING MOUNTAIN WAVE CONDITIONS. LLWS WAS USED TO HIGHLIGHT
THE THREAT.

012 
FXUS64 KMRX 010902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EST TUE FEB 1 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE TRACKING FROM TX TO THE OHIO 
VALLEY REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE PRIMARY CONCERN FOR OUR AREA 
WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE HIGH WINDS. AS THE LOW MOVES INTO WEST TN
LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AN IDEAL SETUP FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL
DEVELOP AND CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT. WIND GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 70
MPH CAN BE EXPECTED IN THE MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS. A HIGH
WIND WARNING WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE COUNTIES CURRENTLY IN A WATCH.
ALL OTHER COUNTIES WILL BE IN A WIND ADVISORY. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO
A MORE SW DIRECTION LATE TONIGHT...ENDING THE MOUNTAIN WAVE
POTENTIAL...BUT A STRONG SYNOPTIC PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL KEEP AT
LEAST ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS IN THE AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING.
WILL EXTEND THE END TIME OF THE WARNING AND ADVISORY TO 18Z
WEDNESDAY.

SOME LIGHT SCATTERED RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE MORNING. STRONG THETA-E ADVECTION WILL SPREAD 
ADDITIONAL RAIN INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. 
THE PERIOD OF GREATEST QG FORCING OVER OUR AREA WILL BE BETWEEN 00Z 
AND 09Z TONIGHT...AND MODELS INDICATE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY WILL 
BE PRESENT. CAPE VALUES ABOVE 800 MB WILL BE IN THE 100-200 RANGE 
TONIGHT...AND LOW LEVEL THETA-E RISES TO 320 K IN SOUTHERN SECTIONS. 
WILL HAVE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH TO A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH.

A SHARP FROPA WILL OCCUR BETWEEN 09Z AND 15Z WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...QUICKLY ENDING PRECIP CHANCES. STRONG COLD ADVECTION ON 
THE HEELS OF THE FRONT WILL MEAN FALLING TEMPS THROUGH THE DAY. A 
NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT THURSDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WILL KEEP 
THE AREA DRY WITH TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
ADJUSTED POPS A LITTLE HIGHER FOR FRIDAY AS MODELS IN A LITTLE
BETTER AGREEMENT CONCERNING SHORTWAVE TROF SHIFTING EAST ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS DURING THE DAY AND ON ITS WAY THROUGH THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 12Z SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE
WILL BE ON THE INCREASE WHILE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVES NORTHEAST
FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO INTO THE CAROLINAS. HAD TO APPLY SOME LIGHT
SNOW FRIDAY MORNING WITH PRECIP COMING IN OVER THE TOP OF INITIALLY
SUBFREEZING AIR. WENT WITH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AS
MORE SHORTWAVE ENERGY DROPS INTO THE BASE OF GRADUALLY EASTWARD
MIGRATING LONG WAVE TROF. COLDER AIR WILL BE SPILLING IN BEHIND THE
DEPARTING TROF AND RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. A FINAL SHORTWAVE BUILDS ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON SATURDAY SO HAD TO KEEP A SLIGHT
THROUGH LOW CHANCE POP FOR RAIN/SNOW AND HELD ONTO SOME OROGRAPHIC
SNOW FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH
CAROLINA BORDER THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN THE
APPROXIMATE 30 HOUR PERIOD FREE FROM PRECIPITATION SUNDAY INTO MID
DAY MONDAY BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM DRIVES EAST TOWARD THE REGION.
USED SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA FOR MONDAY BUT THE BULK OF THE SYSTEM MAY HOLD OFF UNTIL
MONDAY NIGHT SO APPLIED THE LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION
FOR THIS FINAL 12 HOUR PERIOD OF THE LONG TERM.

&&

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES PLANNED. WEAK UPPER RIDGE IS BUILDING INTO

PROBABLY CANNOT BE RULED OUT OVERNIGHT EITHER WITH VERY MOIST

CURRENTLY CONFIGURED AS LATEST MODEL DATA CONTINUE TO SUGGEST
CONDITIONS GENERALLY FAVORABLE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT TOMORROW
NIGHT. OVERALL...FORECAST ON TRACK AND NO CHANGES WARRANTED AT THIS
TIME.

FXUS64 KMRX 312001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST MON JAN 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...A FEW ISOLATED LIGHT 
RAIN SHOWERS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION OVERNIGHT AS A WEAK AREA 
OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS THROUGH THE CAROLINAS.  THE MAIN WEATHER 
MAKER OF THE SHORT TERM WILL BE A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT.  STRONG SOUTH WINDS WILL DEVELOP OVER THE AREA AS THE 
FRONT APPROACHES.  THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL SEE WINDS OF 25 TO 40 
MPH WITH GUSTS OF 50 TO 60 MPH.  A HIGH WIND WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT FOR THESE AREAS.  LOWER ELEVATIONS SHOULD HAVE 
WINDS OF 15 TO 25 MPH WITH STRONGER GUSTS.  A LARGE BAND OF RAIN 
WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT FOR CATEGORICAL POPS.  THE 
STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BRING IN WARM AIR...WHICH 
WILL KEEP TUESDAY NIGHT PRECIP AS RAIN AT ALL BUT THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LINGERING RAIN OR SNOW 
CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY BEHIND EXITING FRONT AND WINDS MAY STAY NEAR 
ADVISORY CRITERIA BEFORE NOON. ADJUSTED TEMP GRIDS TO REFLECT STEADY 
OR FALLING TEMPS IN THE AFTERNOON. 

UPPER TROUGH TO OUR WEST MAY LEAD TO ANOTHER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION 
BY FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...PER LATEST SHORT AND MEDIUM RANGE 
MODELS. TRIED TO LIMIT TO SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR NOW...AND 
KEEP AS MANY PERIODS DRY AS POSSIBLE (THURSDAY-THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT-SUNDAY NIGHT). FOR NEW DAY 7 (MONDAY)...MODELS AND 
GFSX MOS TRENDING WETTER...AHEAD OF ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT.
GEM AND ECMWF SHOW SURFACE LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE FRONT...MOVING NE 
FROM THE WRN GULF/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION (AS HAS OCCURRED 
LATELY). STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR OUT WITH MINOR DIFFERENCES 
WITH GFS.

710 
FXUS64 KMRX 310905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST MON JAN 31 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A MID/UPPER LEVEL TROUGH PASSING TO OUR SOUTH IS BRINGING LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWERS TO NORTHERN AL AND GA. THESE SHOWERS WILL LIKELY AFFECT 
EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. AS THE TROUGH 
MOVES EAST RAIN CHANCES WILL DECREASE...BUT MODELS INDICATE NEAR 
SATURATION UP TO 700 MB PERSISTING THROUGH THE DAY DUE TO A 
SOUTHERLY FLOW OF MOISTURE. THUS WILL HAVE CLOUDY SKIES AND CHANCE 
TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS CONTINUING THROUGH THE DAY. THE LACK OF LIFT 
WILL MEAN QPF WILL BE VERY LIGHT...LESS THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH. 
CONFIDENCE IN THE MAX TEMP FORECAST IS LOW AS THERE IS A LARGE 
SPREAD IN MOS GUIDANCE...BUT EXPECT THAT OVERCAST CLOUDS WILL 
PREVENT MORE THAN A 10 DEGREE RISE IN TEMPS FROM CURRENT OBS...SO 
LEANED TOWARD THE COOLER SIDE. MOISTURE DEPTH DECREASES SLIGHTLY 
TONIGHT WITH SLIGHT RIDGING ALOFT...SO PRECIP CHANCES LOWER TO JUST 
A SLIGHT CHANCE. THE HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS SHOWN BY THE 00Z GFS 
MOS FOR TONIGHT LOOK WAY TOO HIGH GIVEN THE LACK OF LIFT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON
TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE POPS FOR BOTH
DAYS WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN THE BEST LIFT
AND MOISTURE SHOULD ARRIVE. A STRONG LOW LEVEL JET IS ALSO
EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT WITH THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS RECEIVING THE
STRONGEST WINDS ON TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. WINDS SHOULD DECREASE ON
WEDNESDAY. FAIRLY WARM TEMPERATURES SHOULD LIMIT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
DURING THE NIGHTTIME HOURS TO MAINLY THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. HIGH
PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. A SHORTWAVE
TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE AND
LIFT STAY MAINLY TO THE EAST OF THE CWA SO WILL CARRY ONLY SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. WITH THE COLDER TEMPERATURES...THERE WILL BE A
BETTER CHANCE FOR SNOW ON FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED.
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY. WARM TEMPERATURES AT THE START OF THE PERIOD THEN COOLING
OFF BY THE END...BUT MEX GUIDANCE NUMBERS MAY BE ON THE HIGH SIDE
SO STAYED CLOSER TO HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

373 
FXUS64 KMRX 302013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SUN JAN 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG 
THE NORTHERN TN BORDER...WITH SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS AGAIN CREATING 
UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO LINGER AROUND THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
TUESDAY...HELPING (ALONG WITH UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES) TO TRIGGER 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. MODELS 
ARE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY...WHICH IS 
PROGGED TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT. IT APPEARS 
THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL CREATE A GOOD SCENARIO FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
MOUNTAIN WAVES...AND IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT IT COULD BE A HIGH 
END EVENT WITH DAMAGING WINDS IN EXCESS OF 60 MPH FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
AND THEIR IMMEDIATE FOOTHILLS. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE 
A STRONG SOUTHERLY 850 MB JET (AROUND 70 KT) MOVING ACROSS THE AREA 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH A FAIRLY STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER (UP TO 750 
MB) AND A VEERING WIND PROFILE THAT INCREASES WITH HEIGHT. WILL ALSO 
PLAN TO MENTION A CHANCE FOR TSTORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND TUESDAY NIGHT...SINCE THE 
STRONG DYNAMICS OF THIS SYSTEM COULD COMBINE WITH SOME ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM 
AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS CONTINUE TO REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY WITH MAXES. WILL PLAN TO TREND 
TOWARDS WARMER TEMPS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...SINCE BOTH SETS OF 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS HAVE BEEN TOO LOW WITH MAXES RECENTLY. ALTHOUGH 
MINS HAVE BEEN LOWER THAN GUIDANCE NUMBERS RECENTLY...WILL NOT TREND 
COOLER THAN GUIDANCE MINS SINCE DEWPOINTS HAVE RISEN WELL INTO THE 
40S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AS A COLD FRONT EXITS THE REGION. COOLER 
AIR PUSHING IN BEHIND THE FRONT WILL ALLOW LINGERING RAIN SHOWERS TO 
MIX WITH SNOW...BUT LIMITED MOISTURE AND COVERAGE AT THIS POINT WILL 
SIGNIFICANTLY MINIMIZE THE CHANCE OF ACCUMULATIONS. DRIER...COOLER 
AIR SETTLES IN FOR THURSDAY. A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE SLIDES 
THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH ON FRIDAY. MAIN MOISTURE AND ENERGY STAY SOUTH 
BUT COULD SEE ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT.  DRY 
CONDITIONS RETURN FOR THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   44  60  46  62  38 /  40  50  40  60  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     40  58  42  62  40 /  20  40  40  60  90

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY

LONDON KY TO BECKLEY WV LINE. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO

UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS ZONAL. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...BUT THINK THAT 
HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE LOWER 
MS RIVER VALLEY WILL LIKELY START TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON. SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...SO THINK THAT MAXES SHOULD BE A 
LITTLE WARMER THAN GUIDANCE FOR THE THIRD STRAIGHT DAY.

THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO RAISE MAXES 
A LITTLE...AND TO MENTION PARTLY SUNNY SKIES EVERYWHERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EST SUN JAN 30 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
ADAS OBJECTIVE SURFACE TEMP/DEWPOINT ANALYSIS INDICATES A WEAK FRONT 
LOCATED EAST-WEST NEAR THE TN/KY BORDER. HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
SOUTH-CENTRAL CANADA AND LOW PRESSURE OVER TX WILL BE NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH TODAY...SO EXPECT THIS FRONT TO JUST MEANDER 
SLIGHTLY FROM ITS CURRENT POSITION. THIS SHOULD MEAN WARM 
TEMPERATURES AGAIN TODAY...WITH SOME UPPER 60S SOUTH TO MID/UPPER 
50S NORTH. THE CANADIAN HIGH MOVES EAST TONIGHT...WHICH MAY PUSH THE 
FRONT A BIT SOUTH...IMPACTING OUR NORTHERN AREAS WITH LOW CLOUDS AND 
COOLER TEMPERATURES. MEANWHILE A MID-UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IN THE 
SOUTHERN STREAM WILL TRACK ACROSS LA/MS/AL TONIGHT. THE BEST LIFT 
STAYS SOUTH...BUT SOME UPPER DIVERGENCE AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ADVECTION WILL BRING CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE TONIGHT IN 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH
THE REGION ON MONDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR MONDAY
WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS EXPECTED. RAIN MAY CHANGE TO SNOW ON
MONDAY MORNING. BUT IT SHOULD BE LIMITED TO MAINLY THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND SHOULD CHANGE BACK TO ALL RAIN BY THE AFTERNOON. A
FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO WEDNESDAY. WILL
CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH DAYS WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON
TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN THE BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE SHOULD ARRIVE. FAIRLY
WARM TEMPERATURES SHOULD LIMIT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS DURING THE
NIGHTTIME HOURS TO MAINLY THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.  HIGH PRESSURE
RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS
THROUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY. MOISTURE AND LIFT STAY MAINLY TO THE
EAST OF THE CWA SO WILL CARRY ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. WITH
THE COLDER TEMPERATURES...THERE WILL BE A BETTER CHANCE FOR SNOW ON
FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY. WARM TEMPERATURES AT THE START
OF THE PERIOD THEN COOLING OFF BY THE END...BUT MEX GUIDANCE NUMBERS
MAY BE ON THE HIGH SIDE SO STAYED CLOSER TO HPC GUIDANCE FOR
TEMPERATURES.

THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH FOR MONDAY...MOISTURE AND ENERGY LIMITED AND 
WILL KEEP POPS SLIGHT CHANCE. MAIN SYSTEM MOVES IN FOR TUESDAY AND 
WILL CONTINUE TO EFFECT THE REGION INTO WEDNESDAY. DEEP MOISTURE AND 
DECENT LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM AND HAVE KEPT HIGH CHANCE

VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE TONIGHT...BRINGING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
CLOUDINESS WITH SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE BULK OF THE 
MOISTURE WITH THIS COLD FRONT WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...AND THINK THAT AROUND AN INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA. TEMPS SHOULD 
NOT DROP MUCH BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT...WITH A WARMING TREND ACTUALLY 
DEVELOPING ON SATURDAY AS WINDS BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER WEAK FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS NUMBERS APPEAR TO BE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WILL BE BETWEEN WEATHER 
SYSTEMS SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. WILL MOVE INTO AN 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE MIDDLE PART OF THE EXTENDED. AN 
APPROACHING WEATHER SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER... 
AND COULD BRING IN SOME INITIAL LIGHT PRECIP LATE. CONFIDENCE 
REMAINS LOW ON THE TRACK AND TIMING OF WEATHER FEATURES MID WEEK. A 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO PUSH THROUGH AROUND THE TUESDAY TIME FRAME... 
AND THIS MAY PHASE IN WITH A LOW MOVING IN FROM THE SOUTH... 
CONTINUING CHANCE PRECIP THROUGH WEDNESDAY. AT THIS POINT... 
OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES LOOK BORDERLINE FOR RAIN OR SNOW AND WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A MIX WORDING IN ZONE PACKAGE. THE SYSTEM SHOULD PULL 
AWAY FROM THE REGION FOR DRY CONDITIONS ON THURSDAY.
&&

TRACK.

WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW STRATO-CU REMAINS ACROSS THE

NORTHERN STREAM SH0RT-WAVE MOVING TOWARD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. 
THIS WAVE WILL PRODUCE AN AREA OF MAINLY LIGHT SNOW...POSSIBLY
MIXED WITH RAIN LATE TONIGHT-FRIDAY MORNING. THE AREA OF
PRECIPITATION WILL MAINLY EFFECT SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. LITTLE TO NO
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...EXCEPT FOR UP TO 1 INCH ACROSS THE HIGH KNOB
AREA TOWARD DAYBREAK.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
NOT QUITE EAST OF THE REGION AT 12Z FRIDAY...WITH A WEAK SURFACE 
TROUGH AXIS ALSO TO PASS. HOWEVER...I CAN'T SEE MUCH PRECIPITATION 
REACHING AS FAR SOUTH AS SRN VALLEY AND SW NC...SO TOOK OUT POPS FOR 
THOSE AREAS ON FRIDAY. KEPT FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING DRY 
FOR NOW...AS THE NW FLOW ALOFT FLATTENS OUT TO A MORE ZONAL LOOK.
SRN AREAS STAY WARMER DUE GENERALLY TO LESS CLOUDS AND WARMER 850 MB 
TEMPS. 

HOWEVER...GFS AND OTHER MEDIUM TO LONG RANGE MODELS ARE SHOWING YET 
ANOTHER GULF COAST LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING ON MONDAY...THEN 
TRACKING E OR NE TOWARD THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. GFS...
ECMWF AND GEM INDICATE SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW AND MOSTLY RAIN 
SHOWERS INTO EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT. KEPT A POSSIBLE RAIN/SNOW SHOWER 
MIX FOR EARLY WEDNESDAY...AS IT IS MUCH TOO FAR OUT TO TRY TO 
DETERMINE WHAT THE TRACK MAY TURN OUT TO BE. OF COURSE...THIS WAS A 
SHIFT AWAY FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS AND REQUIRED SOME EDITS TO SEVERAL 
GRIDS...AFTER COORDINATION WITH ADJACENT NWS OFFICES.

AREA BELOW 2500 FEET. AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT THE BACK EDGE OF THE

MTNS...SO WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES FOR CENTRAL 
EAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...BUT LET THE WINTER STORM WARNING CONTINUE 
FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 7 PM. WILL ALSO DOWNGRADE 
THE WARNING ACROSS NORTHEAST TN TO AN ADVISORY FOR THE REST OF THE 
AFTERNOON...SINCE WARM SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF 
ACCUMULATIONS WITH THE LINGERING SNOWFALL. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A QUICK-MOVING 'CLIPPER' SYSTEM WILL BRING ANOTHER 
CHANCE FOR LIGHT SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN FOR LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE FAIRLY LIMITED 
RIGHT NOW...SO WILL ONLY MENTION CHANCE POPS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND 
GFS NUMBERS APPEAR TO BE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DIFFICULT TO BELIEVE BUT 
WE MAY BE ABLE TO ENJOY A TWO DAY PERIOD COMPLETE WITH ZERO PRECIP 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE TRANSITIONS FROM NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT TO A ZONAL CONFIGURATION. ECMWF SHOWS A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
FEATURE POSSIBLY IMPACTING THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT WITH SOME 
LIGHT PRECIP. ENERGY CONTINUES TO DROP INTO A DEEPENING CENTRAL U.S. 
UPPER TROF ON TUESDAY WHILE THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM DRAGS A COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT. APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW 
TUESDAY WITH SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT AT THIS TIME BECAUSE MODELS STILL 
HAVE NOT CONVERGED ON A SOLUTION. FORECAST A DRY WEDNESDAY BEHIND 
THIS SYSTEM. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO THE NEW MEX MOS TEMP 
GUIDANCE WITH THE EXCEPTION OF WEDNESDAY. UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TEMPS BY 
SEVERAL DEGREES ON WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EST WED JAN 26 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN ELONGATED AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
OVER THE CAROLINAS...WHICH EXTENDS NORTHWARD ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA. SURFACE TEMPS REMAIN WARM IN THE GREAT TN VALLEY 
(GENERALLY IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S)...WITH MOSTLY RAIN STILL 
BEING REPORTED. THIS RAIN HAS CHANGED TO SNOW ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND 
MIDDLE TN...WITH THE BACK EDGE OF THIS PRECIP AREA STILL WEST OF THE 
PLATEAU. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL LOW (CURRENTLY 
CENTERED OVER THE MOUNTAINS) HAS COOLED THE VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO THAT SNOW SHOULD BE OCCURRING ACROSS 
MOST OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO 
SNOW ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS (BELOW 2500 FEET) LATER THIS 
MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON...BUT WITH TEMPS REMAINING IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 30S...THIS SNOWFALL SHOULD HAVE A TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING IN 
THE VALLEYS (ESPECIALLY ON THE ROADWAYS). 

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO MAINLY FRESHEN UP 
THE WORDING...BUT WILL NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE 
FORECAST OR ADVISORY/WARNING CONFIGURATION.

152 
FXUS64 KMRX 260800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST WED JAN 26 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO TRACK 
EASTWARD THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH PRECIP TRANSITIONING TO 
SNOW ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE FEATURE. ANTICIPATE THIS PROGRESSION TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD WITH THE RAIN SLOWLY TRANSITIONING 
TO SNOW AS THIS PROCESS UNFOLDS. EXPECT THE TRANSITION TO SNOW TO 
COMMENCE EARLIER IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS TEMPS ALOFT COOL TO BELOW 
FREEZING. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON HOW MUCH SNOW WILL ACCUMULATE IN 
THE VALLEY LOCATIONS AS TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING 
AT THE SURFACE THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY BEFORE COOLING BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. NEVERTHELESS...WILL CONTINUE ADVISORIES/WARNINGS AS 
CURRENTLY CONFIGURED AS CRITERIA AMOUNTS CANNOT BE RULED OUT 
ESPECIALLY AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SNOW MELT FOR A GOOD PART OF THE DAY
AND ANY LIGHTER QPF THAN THOUGHT EARLIER...COULD CUT ACTUAL SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS IN HALF FOR ADVISORY AREAS...AS WELL AS THE LOWER
ELEVATIONS OF THE WARNING AREAS. 

MOISTURE CUTS OFF RATHER QUICKLY BEHIND DEPARTING SYSTEM IN THE 
SECOND PERIOD. THUS HAVE CUT BACK POPS IN VALLEY LOCATIONS. TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO COOL AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SETS IN. FOR 
TEMPS...MET/MAV GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSE AND LOOKS REASONABLE. 
GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...WEATHER PATTERN SETTLES
DOWN CONSIDERABLY FOR THESE PERIODS...BUT PATTERN IS RATHER NOISY
AND UNCERTAIN FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WITH A TRACE EVENT OF SOME
SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES POSSIBLE THOSE DAYS. MAINTAINED CONTINUITY
WITH SOME CLOUDS...BUT POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT FOR DAYS 6 AND 7.

I DID NUDGE POPS UP ACROSS EXTREME NE AREAS LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
INTO FRIDAY MORNING. MODELS HINT AT A VERY WEAK UPPER LEVEL
DISTURBANCE PASSING ESE IN THE W TO NW FLOW ALOFT. HOWEVER...I
DON'T SEE THIS AS ANY TYPE OF A NW FLOW ALOFT EVENT...GIVEN LOW
LEVEL WIND DIRECTION AND HARDLY ANY STEEP LAPSE RATES/INSTABILITY.
THIS WOULD MAINLY AFFECT SW VA AND THE NE TIP OF E TN.

ONE OTHER MINOR CHANGE WAS TO TWEAK TEMPS FOR FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY
WITH MODELS SHOWING SOME LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION (UP TO 850 MB
LEVEL) ACROSS SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHILE NRN AREAS
EXPERIENCE MORE CLOUDS AND NEUTRAL OR WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  24  41  28  46 /  80  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  21  37  24  43 / 100  10  10  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1241 AM EST WED JAN 26 2011

.AVIATION...PRECIPITATION (NEARLY ALL RAIN) STARTING TO INCREASE 
FROM THE SOUTH AT THIS TIME...AND DRY AREAS SUCH AS SW VA AND NE TN 
WILL SEE SOME RAIN SHORTLY. LOW CEILINGS AND VISBYS OVER NE AL/NW GA
INTO SE TN WILL ADVECT NE AND GRADUALLY AFFECT TYS AND TRI. 

CHANGEOVER TO SNOW WILL BE SEVERAL HOURS...MOST LIKELY AFTER 12Z AT 
TYS AND AFTER 14Z AT TRI. CEILINGS AND VISBYS COULD ACTUALY LIFT A 
BIT AS SURFACE WINDS SWITCH TO WESTERLY AND INCREASE. HOWEVER...NOT 
A GOOD DAY FOR AVIATION AS IFR TO LIFR CONDITIONS ARE ON TAP...WITH
AN IMPROVEMENT LATE AT CHA AND TYS...BUT MORE LIKE AFTER 06Z 
THURSDAY FOR TRI.

FXUS64 KMRX 260141 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
841 PM EST TUE JAN 25 2011

.DISCUSSION...
SOME ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE NEEDED TO THE TIMING OF THE ADVISORY FOR
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO SNOW AMOUNTS.
THE CHANGEOVER FROM RAIN TO SNOW IN THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL
OCCUR SEVERAL HOURS BEFORE MOST OF THE VALLEY...AS THE NAM
INDICATES A 1500 FT DROP IN THE FREEZING LEVEL BETWEEN 09Z AND 12Z
THERE. THE REST OF THE AREA WILL LIKELY CHANGE TO SNOW BETWEEN 12Z
AND 15Z. THE AXIS OF GREATEST LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH MIDLEVEL
FRONTOGENESIS WILL PASS OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA DURING
THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES WILL BE HOVERING RIGHT AROUND OR JUST ABOVE
FREEZING FOR MUCH OF THE DAY TOMORROW OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS...SO
WHILE SNOWFALL RATES MAY BE MODERATE TO HEAVY AT TIMES...SURFACE
MELTING WILL HELP LIMIT ACCUMULATIONS ON THE GROUND. WILL CUT A
LITTLE OFF THE HIGH END OF FORECAST SNOW AMOUNTS...WITH A MAXIMUM
OF 6 POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA. THE UPDATED WSW
WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
645 PM EST TUE JAN 25 2011

.AVIATION...
TYS AND TRI APPEAR TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DOWNSLOPE WINDS OFF
THE MOUNTAINS...KEEPING CEILINGS IN THE VFR RANGE. EXPECT THIS TO
PERSIST FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS UNTIL THE FLOW ALOFT TURNS TO A
MORE WESTERLY DIRECTION BETWEEN 09Z AND 12Z. IFR CEILINGS SHOULD
BECOME PREDOMINANT THEN. THIS TIME PERIOD SHOULD ALSO MARK A
TRANITION OF PRECIPITATION FROM LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE TO SNOW.
HEAVIEST SNOW WILL BE AT TRI...REDUCING VISIBILITIES TO LIFR AT
TIMES. AT CHA...CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES WILL BE PREDOMINANTLY IFR
THROUGH THE NIGHT AND TOMORROW MORNING...THEN RISE TO MVFR IN THE
AFTERNOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 252035
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EST TUE JAN 25 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...AN AREA OF PRESSURE 
TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. KEEP WILL 
CATEGORICAL POPS IN FOR TONIGHT AND LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY. RAIN SHOULD SWITCH TO SNOW LATE TONIGHT BUT BEST 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL WEDNESDAY. WILL GO WITH A 
WARNING FOR WEDNESDAY FOR NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS AND ADVISORY FOR THE MOST OF THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA.  
DRIER WEATHER RETURN ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  STAYED NEAR MAV GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LONG TERM PERIOD OVERALL 
IS A LOWER THAN AVERAGE CONFIDENCE FORECAST.  ONE REASON IS THE LACK 
OF GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT/CONSISTENCY AND ANOTHER IS THAT WE ARE 
MAINLY DEALING WITH LOWER AMPLITUDE SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW 
THAT THE MODELS HAVE A HARDER TIME HANDLING ESPECIALLY AT LONGER 
TIME RANGES.  UPSHOT IS THAT WHILE THERE MAY BE SOME LIGHT PRECIP AT 
DIFFERENT TIMES DURING THE PERIOD...WILL KEEP THINGS DRY EXCEPT FOR 
NORTH THU NIGHT/EARLY FRIDAY FOR THE FIRST OF THESE WEAK IMPULSES.  
WILL GENERALLY NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS FOR THE LONG TERM.

377 
FXUS64 KMRX 251445
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EST TUE JAN 25 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING LIGHT RAIN MOVING FROM THE SOUTH. 
SURFACE OBSERVATIONS ABOVE FREEZING...SO MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION FOR 
TODAY SHOULD BE MAINLY RAIN.  WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS AS IS.  
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CONFIDENCE HIGHER FOR
WEATHER TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS UNDERWAY OVER
THE WRN GULF COAST REGION THIS MORNING. I LIKE THE WAY THE GFS
SPREADS A LARGE AREA OF RAIN NE TODAY...SO TRENDED WITH THE HIGHER
GFS POPS OVER LOWER NAM MOS. NO BIG THREAT OF WINTRY PCPN THIS
MORNING...AS 08Z TEMPS WERE VERY MILD ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST
AREA...BUT A CHANCE OF SNOW WORDING IS IN THE FORECAST WHERE
APPROPRIATE.  

SE FLOW DEVELOPS TONIGHT AND THERE MAY BE A BRIEF DRY SLOT THIS
EVENING...PARTIALLY ASSOCIATED WITH DOWNSLOPING INTO PARTS OF THE
VALLEY. AS LOW LIFTS NE...THE RAIN WILL SPREAD OVER THE ENTIRE
FORECAST AREA. FORECAST GRIDS MORE IN LINE WITH GFS BLENDED WITH
GEM AND SREF PER HPC DISCUSSIONS. NAM WAS SLOWER IN ADVECTING COLD
AIR IN ON WEDNESDAY...BUT NOT FOLLOWED. MAIN PCPN TYPE TONIGHT
STAYS RAIN...ALTHO FAR NW PLATEAU AREAS INTO LEE AND WISE COUNTIES
COULD MIX WITH SNOW LATE. CHANGING TO SNOW AFTER 15 TO 18Z
WEDNESDAY...AND THERE MAY BE A BRIEF PERIOD WITH SOME TYPE OTHER
THAN RAIN/SNOW.

ALTHOUGH I STILL HAVE MAJOR CONCERNS WITH SOME SNOW MELTING ON
WEDNESDAY...THE SREF QPF AMOUNTS (AFTER AIRMASS COOLS SUFFICIENTLY
FOR SNOW) SUGGEST POSSIBLE 2 TO 5 OR 3 TO 6 INCH SNOW AMOUNTS BY
WEDNESDAY EVENING ACROSS SW VA...NRN AND SMOKY MTNS OF E TN. THUS  
AFTER COORDINATION WITH NWS NEIGHBORS...I HAVE POSTED A WINTER STORM 
WATCH FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 1 AM EST THURSDAY MORNING. THIS IS 
SOMEWHAT IN LINE WITH HPC INTERNAL SNOW AMOUNT GRAPHICS FOR THIS 
EVENT...WITH SOME ALLOWANCE FOR POSSIBILITY OF DIFFERENT TIMING AND 
ALSO EARLY SNOW MELT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER FLOW OVER 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY BEHIND DEPARTING 
UPPER LOW. NORTHWEST FLOW ALONG WITH MINOR SHORT WAVES EXPECTED TO 
KEEP UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY GOING IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN INTO 
EARLY FRIDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE BY THE WEEKEND...BUT GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT UPPER FLOW WILL DEAMPLIFY INTO A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW. DUE 
TO UNCERTAINTY...DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXTENDED 
GRIDS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  36  41  24  41 /  80 100  80  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              46  35  43  22  38 /  60 100 100  60  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
632 AM EST TUE JAN 25 2011

.AVIATION...RAIN FINALLY REACHING THE SURFACE INTO SE TN AROUND CHA
AND EXPECT THIS LIGHT RAIN TO WORK SLOWLY NE THIS MORNING...AND 
EVENTUALLY FALL AT TYS AND TRI. HOWEVER...VFR CONDITIONS WILL LAST 
FOR SEVERAL HOURS...THEN START TO PLUNGE INTO MVFR AT CHA IN THE 
AFTERNOON...AND EVENING HOURS AT TYS AND TRI. 

AIRMASS GETS REALLY SATURATED OVER THE LAST 6 TO 9 HOURS...WITH IFR 
TO LIFR CONDITIONS DEVELOPING AS LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE CONTINUES TO 
FALL.

165 
FXUS64 KMRX 242013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EST MON JAN 24 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AN AREA OF PRESSURE IS EXPECTED 
TO APPROACH THE AREA TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING 
WITH THE NAM THE SLOWEST AND FURTHEST SOUTH.  WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT  
CHANCE FOR TONIGHT AND ANY THING THAT FALLS SHOULD BE LIGHT WITH THE 
DRY LOW LEVELS IN PLACE. THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE APPROACHES ON 
TUESDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE SOUTH...WHERE THE 
DEEPEST MOISTURE AND LIFT ARRIVES. FAIRLY WARM ON TUESDAY. SO ANY 
SNOW ACCUMULATION SHOULD BE LIGHT AND MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...BUT IT SHOULD MELT BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS. STAYED NEAR 
MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...VERY DIFFICULT 
FORECAST FOR THE TUE NIGHT AND WED TIME FRAME.  MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT THAT A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK NORTHEAST FROM THE 
GULF COAST AREA TO OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST.  AT THIS POINT IT 
LOOKS LIKE THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE MAINLY RAIN EVEN OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...AS MODEL THERMAL PROFILES SHOW 
DEEP ABOVE FREEZING AIR.  THINGS GET TRICKIER FOR WEDNESDAY AS THE 
SURFACE LOW WILL BE FURTHER EAST.  COLDER AIR WILL START TO FILTER 
IN...AND THE MODELS...ESPECIALLY THE GFS...HINT AT A PERIOD OF  
STRONG LIFT AND ASSOCIATED DYNAMIC COOLING.  THIS SHOULD CHANGE THE 
PRECIP OVER TO ALL SNOW OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT IN THE VALLEY 
STILL A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY WHETHER THE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL COOL 
ENOUGH FOR SNOW...AND ESPECIALLY ANY ACCUMULATION.  FOR NOW WILL 
INCLUDE RAIN OR SNOW IN THE FORECAST.  SNOW AMOUNTS MAY BE ENOUGH 
FOR WARNING CRITERIA IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT STILL FOURTH 
PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO ISSUE A WATCH...SO FOR NOW 
WILL CONTINUE SPS OUTLOOK.  AFTER THIS MAIN SYSTEM...APPEARS THERE 
WILL BE SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THAT MAY BRING SOME 
LIGHT PRECIP...BUT TIMING STILL RATHER UNCERTAIN GIVEN MODEL 
DIFFERENCES.  WILL CARRY SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH THU AND WHOLE 
AREA SAT FOR NOW.   


&&

208 
FXUS64 KMRX 241500
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST MON JAN 24 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A FEW CLOUDS BUT NO PRECIPITATION. IT 
SHOULD REMAIN DRY THE REST OF TODAY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING.  
NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...JET STREAM ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING WITH SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT ENHANCING CLOUDS A 
BIT...AND CREATING A FEW SPOTS OF VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION IN THE 
FORM OF LIGHT SNOW/FLURRIES OR SPOTS OF LIGHT RAIN WHERE SURFACE 
TEMPS AND 850 MB TEMPS HAVE WARMED ENOUGH (MURPHY NC - RHP). NAM 
MODEL SHOWS THIS LIFT WEAKENING OR EXITING FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING...SO I LIMITED POPS TO 20 PERCENT OR LESS AND JUST UP TO 15Z 
TODAY. MODELS AND MOS HAVE OVERDONE THE AMOUNT OF CLOUDS DURING THE 
DAY LATELY...SO I ALLOWED FOR SOME PARTIAL CLEARING IN THE AFTERNOON 
ESPECIALLY FOR VALLEY AND EASTERN AREAS. THE SUNSHINE SHOULD HELP 
TEMPS TO WARM TO NEAR SIMILAR MOS HIGHS...WHICH WILL ACTUALLY BE 
QUITE CLOSE TO SEASONAL NORMALS FOR A CHANGE.

FOR TONIGHT...HPC GUIDANCE FAVORING A 00Z GFS/00Z ECMWF COMPROMISE 
WITH LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
REGION. MODELS HAVE SHOWN LITTLE AGREEMENT OR CONTINUITY FROM RUN TO 
RUN...BUT THIS COMPROMISE SHOULD KEEP MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION 
(PCPN) OUT OF OUR REGION UNTIL LATER ON TUESDAY (MOVING IN FROM THE 
SOUTH). SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS AND MAY KEEP HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AS WARM OR WARMER THAN VALLEY...AS PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID 
ALREADY REFLECTED. 

WE PLAN TO ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT...ALTHO THERE REMAINS A 
GOOD DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY ON HOW MUCH SNOW OCCURS AND WHEN. THE GFS 
WITH ECMWF BLEND SEEMS TO LIMIT MOST SNOW ACCUMULATION TO DAYTIME 
HOURS WEDNESDAY...A RATHER SHORT PERIOD OF TIME...SO FORECAST GRIDS 
REFLECT THIS THINKING WITH A LITTLE LESS SNOWFALL TOTALS THAN BEFORE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MADE SOME CHANGES WITH THE
TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY PART OF THE FORECAST. SLOWED THE TIMING
OF THE COLDER AIR MASS WITH NO SIGNIFICANT SNOW UNTIL LATE TUESDAY
NIGHT OR WEDNESDAY MORNING. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS COMING MORE IN
LINE WITH DEVELOPMENT OF MAIN SYSTEM TUESDAY TAKING SHAPE ALONG THE
CENTRAL GULF COAST. THE SURFACE LOW MOVES EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST
TUESDAY AND THEN DEEPENS AS IT MOVES NE ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST
WEDNESDAY. PRECIPITATION WILL INCREASE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT
AND AS COLDER AIR WRAPS INTO THE DEEPENING SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW WITH LIGHT SNOWFALL AMOUNTS IN
THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AND SEVERAL INCHES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE ENDING WEDNESDAY NIGHT IN
THE SOUTH AND CONTINUING SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT
AS TROUGHING DEVELOPS ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES AND SHORTWAVE
ENERGY MOVES SOUTHEAST INTO THE REGION.

HIGHER PRESSURE WILL STILL BE OVER THE MID ATLANTIC TUESDAY
MORNING WITH DRY AIR MASS EXTENDING SOUTHWEST INTO THE NORTHERN PART
OF THE FORECAST AREA. LIGHT PRECIPITATION MAY BE OVER THE SOUTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA IN THE FORM OF A LITTLE SNOW EARLY
TUESDAY ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE GULF SYSTEM BEFORE CHANGING TO
RAIN AS WARMING TEMPERATURES FROM SOUTHERLY FLOW AROUND THE SURFACE
LOW BRINGS TEMPERATURES UP INTO THE 40S TO NEAR 50. FREEZING LEVELS
EXPECTED TO BE 6 TO 8 THOUSAND FEET SO EVEN AT HIGHEST ELEVATIONS
MOSTLY RAIN. TUESDAY NIGHT THE MORE DEVELOPED SYSTEM WILL START TO
WRAP IN COLDER AIR WITH LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE BY
MORNING HIGHER ELEVATIONS. LOWS WEDNESDAY MORNING MOSTLY LOW TO MID
30S. WEDNESDAY DROPPED KEPT HIGHS ON THE COLD SIDE BUT STILL HIGH
ENOUGH THAT MOST LOCATIONS WILL SEE ONLY LIGHT SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATIONS...LESS THAN ONE INCH. HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 OR
3000 FEET SHOULD SEE MORE SNOW WITH TEMPERATURES STAYING AT
FREEZING OR BELOW. PRECIPITATION SHOULD END IN THE AFTERNOON IN THE
SOUTH BUT CONTINUE MOUNTAINS AND NORTH OVERNIGHT. SO THE HIGHEST
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE THERE. AS ANOTHER IMPULSE MOVES SOUTHEAST
FROM THE MIDWEST THURSDAY SOME MORE LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE. SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY WITH NW FLOW TO CONTINUE AND TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL
SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN AND SNOW ARE STILL IN FORECAST. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  31  48  35  42 /  20  20  60  90  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  28  46  34  39 /  20  10  50  80  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  28  46  31  39 /  20  20  50  80  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  23  46  33  37 /  20  10  30  70  90 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AND LOWER AGAIN FROM THE SW BEFORE DAYBREAK TUESDAY. HOWEVER...THINK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EST SUN JAN 23 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGING REMAINS ALONG AND EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. A WEAKENING SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST THROUGH THE AREA EARLY 
MONDAY. CLOUDS WILL THICKEN OVERNIGHT. SLIGHT CHANCE OF VERY LIGHT 
SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES INTO MONDAY MORNING. UPPER TROUGH DIGS SE 
INTO TX BY TUE MORNING. WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT SETS UP WITH LIGHT SNOW 
POSSIBLE ACROSS WESTERN AREAS MONDAY NIGHT. MODELS SOLUTIONS DIVERGE 
TUESDAY AS UPPER LOW BEGINS TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS RVR VLY TUE. 
INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH DEVELOPS NE THROUGH THE DEEP SOUTH INTO THE 
TN RVR VLY. DEFORMATION ZONE TAKES SHAPE NEAR SOUTHERN MRX CWA. 
OVERALL MODEL SOLUTIONS COMING IN SLOWER FOR TUESDAY. TUE FORECAST 
TRIMMED TO BE DRIER AND A BIT WARMER EXPECTING LIGHT SNOW AND RAIN 
TO CHANGE TO ALL RAIN BY TUE AFTN. EXCEPTION BEING THE VERY HIGHEST 
PEAKS OF THE SMOKIES WHERE PCPN MAY STAY ALL SNOW.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. KEPT 
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING 
WHEN THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT ARRIVES.  BASED ON 
TEMPERATURES...RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW ON TUESDAY NIGHT. BASED ON 
THE TRACK OF THE LOW...COULD SEE SNOW ACCUMULATING ON TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ON TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT LOW SHOULD BE EXITING THE AREA. UPPER TROUGH 
ENTERING THE REGION THURSDAY SO WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY. 
UPPER LOW TRACKS TO THE NORTH WITH SOME MOISTURE LINGERING...WILL 
ADD LOW CHANCES FOR SATURDAY. A FRONT FOLLOWS ON SUNDAY SO WILL ADD 
LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY. MEX GUIDANCE GENERALLY ON THE HIGH 
SIDE...STAYED NEAR HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 231609
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SUN JAN 23 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. GOOD PERIODS OF SUNSHINE THIS MORNING
BUT MID AND HIGH CLOUDS ON TRACK TO MOVE INTO THE AREA. ABOVE 
FREEZING TEMPS IN STORE FOR THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS LOWER ELEVATIONS.
SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VARYING AMOUNTS OF MOSTLY MID AND 
HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING EASTWARD ACROSS THE REGION IN THE W-NW FLOW 
ALOFT. I WOULD NOT RULE OUT A FEW BREAKS OF SUNSHINE LATER TODAY 
...BUT TEMPS WILL LIKELY REMAIN AT LEAST 5 DEGREES OR SO BELOW 
NORMAL. SIMILAR MOS HIGHS LOOKED REASONABLE AND WERE CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED.

SHORT RANGE MODELS TRENDING MOSTLY DRY FOR TONIGHT...ALTHO ECMWF 
STILL SUPPORTS VERY LOW POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT. DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM FOR TUESDAY GENERALLY SLOWER TO EVOLVE...AND I SEE THREAT OF 
ANY MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION NO HIGHER THAN 20 PERCENT. LOWERED POPS 
SLIGHTLY TO STAY LESS THAN CHANCE. CLOUDS AND WEAK SW LOW LEVEL FLOW 
FAVOR MILDER MOS MINS WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID 
ATLANTIC AND SOUTHEAST STATES WILL SLOWLY SHIFT EAST MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT. TWO WEATHER SYSTEMS WILL BEGIN AFFECTING THE REGION 
MONDAY. A NORTHERN SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES 
AND A LOW PRESSURE AREA FORMING ALONG THE TEXAS COAST. THE NORTHERN 
SYSTEM WILL BRING SOME MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION WITH A WEAK WARM 
FRONT WHICH SHOULD DEVELOP A LITTLE LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW EARLY MONDAY. 
NAM/ECMWF DEVELOPS THE SOUTHERN SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL GULF STATES 
MONDAY NIGHT AND THEN INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY TUESDAY. DEEPENING 
LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES OFF THE COAST BY WEDNESDAY AND THEN UP THE 
EAST COAST. THE TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW WILL INFLUENCE THE SNOWFALL 
AMOUNTS. SO THERE STILL IS UNCERTAINTY WITH AMOUNTS TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY. LOWERED POPS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AND RAISED 
TEMPERATURES MONDAY AND TUESDAY. NO SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL EXPECTED 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AND ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS TUESDAY. SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND MOUNTAINS SHOULD HAVE THE 
HIGHEST SNOWFALL AMOUNTS. PRECIPITATION WILL DECREASE FROM SW TO NE 
WEDNESDAY BUT SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS AND 
MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AS FLOW SWITCHES TO THE NW. 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY CONTINUES ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY WITH LOW POPS. FRIDAY AND SATURDAY LOOK DRY AS UPPER TROUGH 
MOVES EAST.  &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  26  48  31  44 /  10  20  20  10  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  26  47  31  43 /  10  20  20  10  70

TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. WILL BUMP UP 
POPS TO LIKELY FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT ARRIVES.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR  
WEDNESDAY. BASED ON TEMPERATURES...RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW ON 
BOTH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT. FAIRLY WARM ON MONDAY NIGHT SO 
THE BEST CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE ON TUESDAY NIGHT. 
UPPER TROUGH ENTERING THE REGION THURSDAY SO WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE 
POPS FOR THURSDAY. MOISTURE LINGERS IN THE NORTH ON BOTH FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...BUT WILL KEEP BOTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW. MEX 
GUIDANCE ON THE HIGHER SIDE...STAYED NEAR HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES

959 
FXUS64 KMRX 221605
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SAT JAN 22 2011

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL PASS EAST 
THROUGH THE REGION LATE THIS MORNING...WITH CLOUDS DECREASING AND 
GIVING WAY TO AT LEAST PARTIAL SUNSHINE THIS AFTERNOON. I CAN'T 
IMAGINE MUCH SNOW COVER LEFT TODAY TO BE MELTED...BASED ON LAST 
VISIBLE SATELLITE PIC FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...MAX TEMP FOR 
TODAY WAS NUDGED UP CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND.

UPPER FLOW FLATTENS TONIGHT WITH SOME TROUGHING UPSTREAM OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS TOWARD DAYBREAK SUNDAY...SO MID AND HIGH CLOUDS ARE 
LIKELY TO INCREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT. THESE CLOUDS MAKE MIN TEMP 
FORECAST TRICKY (SIMILAR TO CLOUD COVER EFFECTS THIS MORNING). BEST 
CHOICE WAS A BLEND OF MOS MINS BETWEEN THE COLDER GFS MOS AND 
SLIGHTLY NOT AS COLD NAM MOS. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER FLOW SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT IS MORE ZONAL WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER EASTERN STATES INCLUDING 
THE SOUTHEAST. WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
MOVING INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY WILL INCREASE MOISTURE GRADUALLY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY SUNDAY. SUNDAY 
NIGHT THIS FIRST SYSTEM WEAKENS BUT WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SNOW FOR THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MONDAY TROUGH 
DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN STATES WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY DROPPING 
SOUTH FROM THE MIDWEST INTO THE OHIO AND TN VALLEY LATE MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 40S LOWER 
ELEVATIONS AND 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WINDS INCREASING FROM THE 
SOUTH. PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE MIXED WITH NO SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
MONDAY. MONDAY PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS INCREASED WITH LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS BY TUESDAY MORNING MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MODELS 
GET SYSTEM MORE DEVELOPED TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WITH NAM/ECMWF 
DEVELOPING LOW ALONG CENTRAL GULF COAST SHIFTING TO THE ATLANTIC AND 
DEEPENING RAPIDLY AS IT MOVES NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. THIS 
COULD MEAN SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY 
EVENING CONTINUING INTO WEDNESDAY. EXPECTING COLDER TEMPERATURES 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LATER SHIFTS WILL NEED TO 
EXAMINE THIS PERIOD CLOSELY ESPECIALLY WITH SNOWFALL AMOUNTS. 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND NE STORM WILL KEEP CLOUDS AND SNOW 
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES POSSIBLE THROUGH THURSDAY WITH DRYING FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  23  44  29  45 /   0   0  10  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  36  21  39  25  45 /   0   0  10  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  21  39  25  44 /   0   0  10  20  30

TEMPERATURE RECOVERY WITH GOOD MINUTES OF SUNSHINE SAT. MID AND HIGH 
LEVEL CLOUDS RETURN SAT NGT AND SUNDAY. IMPROVING TEMPS REMAIN BELOW 
NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY...WITH GOOD LIFT AND MOISTURE WITH 
THE FEATURE...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY. ANOTHER AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  
WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BASED 
ON TEMPERATURES...RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW ON BOTH MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT. FAIRLY WARM ON MONDAY NIGHT SO THE BEST CHANCE 
FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE ON TUESDAY NIGHT. UPPER TROUGH 
ENTERING THE REGION THURSDAY SO WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR  
THURSDAY. MOISTURE LINGERS INTO FRIDAY...BUT WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY 
FOR NOW. MEX GUIDANCE ON THE HIGHER SIDE...STAYED NEAR HPC GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

ECMWF AND GFS DEVELOP A CLOSED LOW OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY
TUESDAY MORNING. THIS UPPER LOW MOVES EAST TO THE EAST COAST AND
DEEPENS BECOMING A MAJOR STORM. COLDER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND IT AND
SO EXPECT COLDER TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. SHORTWAVE
ENERGY MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AROUND SYSTEM IN THE
NORTHEAST WILL KEEP CHANCES OF RAIN AND SNOW THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

998 
FXUS64 KMRX 210145
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST THU JAN 20 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER WEST 
VA...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWARD GENERALLY 
ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS. TEMPS WERE STILL IN THE UPPER 
30S TO LOWER 40S ACROSS A LARGE PART OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT HAVE 
FALLEN BELOW FREEZING ON THE PLATEAU AND AREAS FURTHER WEST. AS A 
RESULT OF THESE WARM TEMPS...THE INITIAL PRECIP HAS BEEN MOSTLY 
RAIN OR SLEET...BUT THIS RAIN/SLEET SHOULD QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW AS 
COLDER AIR CONTINUES TO QUICKLY ADVECT INTO THE REGION. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT THE BULK OF THE PRECIP WILL OCCUR BEFORE MIDNIGHT... 
WHICH SEEMS TO AGREE WITH THE CURRENT TRENDS ON AREA RADARS. LATEST 
RUC AND GFS MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE VERTICAL THERMAL 
PROFILE WILL REMAIN COLD ENOUGH OVERNIGHT FOR MOSTLY SNOW. THUS... 
WILL PLAN TO REMOVE THE MENTION OF PATCHY FREEZING DRIZZLE TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. HOWEVER...WITH TEMPS RAPIDLY FALLING BELOW FREEZING...THINK 
THAT ROADWAYS COULD STILL BECOME ICY OVERNIGHT DUE TO THE FREEZING 
OF ANY LINGERING MOISTURE ON THE ROADS.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO FRESHEN UP THE 
WORDING OF THE PRECIP TIMING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING 
TO THE LATEST TRENDS. WILL LEAVE THE ADVISORY AREA THE SAME FOR NOW. 
FOR THOSE AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE ADVISORY...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION MAINLY AN INCH OF SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST THU JAN 20 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE WAVE CONTINUES TO 
TAKE SHAPE OVER NE/TN SW/VA THIS AFTERNOON. UPPER TROUGH REMAINS 
WEST OF TN PRESENTLY. GOOD LIFT ALONG JET STREAK RESULTING IN LARGE 
SWATH OF MAINLY SNOW ALONG AND NORTH OF TN BORDER. THIS ACTIVITY 
WILL MOVE INTO MRX CWA LATER THIS EVENING A UPPER TROUGH MARCHES 
EAST. BEST LIFT OVER CWA WILL BE AROUND 21/03Z. LEADING EDGE OF PCPN 
WILL BE INITIALLY MIXED WITH RAIN THIS EVENING. FREEZING LEVEL 
PLUMMETS AFT 21/00Z WHEN PERIODS OF MODERATE SNOWFALL CAN BE 
EXPECTED WITH BEST CHANCE FOR ACCUMULATION NORTH OF I-40. NOT MUCH 
RH IN THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE AND LAYER MOISTURE FALLS OFF RAPIDLY 
AFT 21/06Z. INITIALLY WARM SURFACE TEMPS AN DROP OFF OF MID LEVEL 
MOISTURE EASE CONCERNS SOMEWHAT FOR HEAVY SNOWFALL. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION VERY STRONG OVERNIGHT. LINGERING MOISTURE >=-10C WILL 
LIKELY RESULT IN PATCHES OF FREEZING DRIZZLE SINCE SURFACE TEMPS 
WILL BE IN THE 20S. HOLD ON TO PCPN A BIT LONGER THAN MODELS WHICH 
ARE VERY FAST AT ENDING PCPN BY AROUND 7 AM. FRIDAYS MAX TEMPS WILL 
BE SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AND THE MIN TEMP WONT BE REALIZED UNTIL 
AFTER THE NORMAL POST SUNRISE TIME. UNDERCUT FRI MAX TEMPS MAINLY 
DUE TO CURRENT UPSTREAM OBS. TEMPERATURE STEADY AT BEST. COLD FRI 
NGT. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE AREA EARLY SAT. 
EXPECTING ONLY CLOUDS WITH THIS SYSTEM.   

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER ON SUNDAY. AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS INTO 
THE AREA ON MONDAY...WITH GOOD LIFT AND MOISTURE WITH THE 
FEATURE...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY. UPPER LOW TRACKS 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY. 
BASED ON TEMPERATURES...RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW ON BOTH MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT. FAIRLY WARM ON MONDAY NIGHT SO THE BEST 
CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD EB ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATION 
WITH A BETTER CHANCE ON TUESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE LINGERING ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA...BUT WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY FOR NOW. 
FRONT APPROACHING ON THURSDAY. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON 
TIMING...WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW. MEX GUIDANCE ON THE HIGHER 
SIDE...STAYED NEAR HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT IN 
THE SHORT TERM ON APPROACHING SYSTEM.  WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF 
THE SYSTEM TODAY WILL KEEP CLOUDS IN PLACE AS TEMPERATURES WARM INTO 
THE 40S AND LOW 50S.  A COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH QUICKLY TONIGHT.  
FALLING TEMPERATURES AND AN ASSOCIATED BAND OF SNOW WILL SLIDE THROUGH 
THE AREA OVERNIGHT.  A WARM GROUND WILL LIMIT INITIAL SNOW 
ACCUMULATION BUT BRIEF HEAVY SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED TO GENERATE SOME 
ACCUMULATION.  WILL CONTINUE THE SPS FOR SNOWFALL. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT NOT VERY 
GOOD FOR THE LONG TERM...AND GFS HAVING SIGNIFICANT RUN TO RUN 
VARIATION...SO CONFIDENCE LOWER THAN USUAL OVERALL.  DOES NOT LOOK 
LIKE A VERY GOOD SETUP FOR COLD ADVECTION SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY...SO 
WILL JUST CARRY LOW POPS IN MOUNTAINS FOR THE MORNING.  GFS A BIT OF 
AN OUTLIER IN HANDLING SHORT WAVE ENERGY ON FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY.  
WILL GO WITH THE DRY NAM/SREF/ECMWF SOLUTIONS WHICH GOES ALONG WITH 
CURRENT PRECIP FREE WEEKEND.  HOWEVER...WILL BEEF UP CLOUDS A BIT.  
MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE 
REGION EARLY IN THE WEEK...BUT POOR AGREEMENT ON THE DETAILS.  WILL 
KEEP THINGS BROADBRUSHED FOR NOW WITH CHANCE POPS MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT.  PRECIP TYPE STILL UNCERTAIN AS WELL...SO WILL 
CONTINUE MENTION OF RAIN OR SNOW.  WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY FOR 
NOW.

A BRIEF PERIOD OF MODERATE SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT. INITIALLY 
WARM SURFACE TEMPERATURES SHOULD HINDER SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. FAST 
MOVING SYSTEM EXITS THE AREA EARLY ON FRIDAY. STRONG COLD AIR 
ADVECTION FRIDAY WITH TEMPS STEADY OR FALLING DURING THE DAY. MAX 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR MIDNIGHT WITH BELOW FREEZING TEMPS 
AREAWIDE DURING THE DAY FRIDAY.   

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE UPCOMING WEEKEND...DEPICTING 
GENERALLY DRY WEATHER ALBEIT SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO TEMPS. MODELS ALSO 
AGREE THAT THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK. 
CONTINUED WITH MIXED PRECIP AS TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO RANGE NEAR 
CLIMO. BALANCE OF FORECAST STILL LOW CONFIDENCE AS MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES DETERIORATE INTO GENERAL DISAGREEMENT. AS SUCH...DID NOT 
MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST.

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE FOR TODAY. LIGHT PCPN WILL LINGER INTO

AREAS THIS AFTN. TEMPERATURES NEAR STEADY DURING DAY LIGHT HOURS.
SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT CONTINUING IT/S 
SLOW PROGRESSION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  WILL SEE 
ASSOCIATED PATCHY DRIZZLE THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING.  AS COOLER AIR 
FILTERS IN...HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND FAR NORTHERN LOCATIONS COULD SEE 
DRIZZLE MIX WITH OR CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES.  ANY 
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE MINIMAL AND CONFINED TO THE HIGHEST TERRAIN.  
ALL PRECIP SHOULD END BY LATE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON AS THE 
FRONT EXITS THE AREA.  BEHIND THE FRONT...SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER 
AIR WILL MOVE IN...ALLOWING CLOUDS COVER TO DIMINISH AND OVERNIGHT 
TEMPERATURES TO FALL BELOW FREEZING.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT AGREEMENT WANES LATER 
IN THE PERIOD.  UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN AND COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF PRECIP 
WITH THIS MAINLY THURSDAY NIGHT.  MODEL THERMAL PROFILES SUPPORT 
SNOW FOR MUCH OF THIS EVENT HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT LOWER ELEVATIONS 
SHOULD START AS RAIN THEN TRANSITION TO SNOW.  LOOKS LIKE PRECIP 
AMOUNTS WILL BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE...AND WITH SOME OF THIS TO FALL AS 
RAIN DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A MAJOR SNOW EVENT AT THIS TIME.  ANOTHER 
SHORT WAVE IS FORECAST TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND OR 
SATURDAY...BUT MODELS LOOK DRY WITH THIS SO WILL NOT INCLUDE PRECIP 
AT THIS TIME.  NEXT SYSTEM FORECAST TO AFFECT THE AREA EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...BUT MODELS DO NOT AGREE WELL ON TIMING OR OTHER DETAILS...SO 
WILL JUST KEEP LOW POPS FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  PRECIP TYPE 
STILL VERY QUESTIONABLE THAT FAR OUT.
