948 
FXUS64 KMRX 182000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST TUE JAN 18 2011

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A COLD RAIN HAS SPREAD ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 
EXTREME NORTHEAST CORNER...BUT THIS AREA WILL SEE LIGHT RAIN IN THE 
NEXT HOUR. TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN STEADY IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S 
WITH DEW POINTS RISING TO THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN LIGHT LESS THAN ONE TENTH OF AN INCH PER HOUR... 
WITH TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS POSSIBLY AS HIGH AS ONE HALF INCH 
ESTIMATED BY RADAR BUT MORE LIKELY ONE QUARTER INCH OR LESS. CURRENT 
SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOWS STEADY RAIN TO CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY 
EVENING AND THEN TAPER OFF FROM SW TO NE. BACK EDGE OF RAIN ON OHX 
RADAR NEAR NASHVILLE. GFS FASTER WITH MOVING PRECIPITATION OUT 
TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY WITH NAM SLIGHTLY SLOWER. LOW PRESSURE 
AREA NOW ACROSS EASTERN LAKES INTO WESTERN KY WITH COLD FRONT STILL 
ACROSS WESTERN TN WHERE TEMPERATURES ARE STILL IN THE UPPER 40S. 
COLDER AIR MASS BACK ACROSS IL AND MO AND EXPECTED TO REACH FORECAST 
AREA LATE TONIGHT OR WEDNESDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY FALL 
VERY SLOWLY TONIGHT AND STAY JUST ABOVE FREEZING EXCEPT HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. AS FREEZING LEVELS DROP LATE TONIGHT A LITTLE SNOW IS 
POSSIBLE AND POSSIBLY FREEZING DRIZZLE/RAIN EARLY WEDNESDAY BEFORE 
PRECIPITATION ENDS. DO NOT THINK THERE WILL BE ANY ICING PROBLEMS 
TONIGHT OR WEDNESDAY. EXPECT ONE INCH OR LESS OF SNOW IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. WEDNESDAY AS DRIER COLDER AIR MASS MOVES IN SKIES SHOULD 
BECOME SUNNY TO PARTLY SUNNY WEST AND CENTRAL SECTIONS BUT BE SLOW 
TO CLEAR NE. TEMPERATURES SIMILAR TO TODAYS...BUT A FEW DEGREES 
COLDER NE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND SHOW A COLD FRONT AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING 
THE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY PERIOD WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
AFFECTING THE AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK. WHILE THE GFS AND NAM MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT...THEY ARE REVEALING SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN THE VERTICAL 
THERMAL PROFILE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...THE COLDER GFS 
MODEL REVEALS MORE SNOW THAN THE WARMER NAM MODEL. TEMPS ARE 
EXPECTED TO WARM INTO THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S AHEAD OF THIS FRONT 
BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION MOSTLY RAIN IN THE 
EVENING BUT CHANGING TO SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT. WITH THIS COLD FRONT 
EXPECTED TO QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT ANY 
POTENTIAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING SHOULD BE 
ON THE LIGHT SIDE (AROUND 1 TO 3 INCHES). BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT WITH VERY 
LIMITED AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A DRY 
FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AROUND THE 
TN/OHIO RIVER VALLEYS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WHICH COULD LINGER OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NOT MENTION IN FORECAST FOR NOW.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV 
TEMPS.

SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...BUT 
MAY SEE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING OVER THE FAR NORTHERN AND 
EASTERN AREAS INTO THE MORNING.  WILL BRIEFLY BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS 
FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE FIRST PART OF THURSDAY.  THE NEXT 
SYSTEM...A COLD FRONT...MOVES IN LATE THURSDAY OR THURSDAY NIGHT.  
DEEP MOISTURE...GOOD DYNAMICS AND MUCH COOLER AIR ACCOMPANIES THE 
SYSTEM.  WILL CONTINUE THE HIGH CHANCE POPS OVERNIGHT AS ASSOCIATED 
RAIN SHOWERS CHANGE OVER TO SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT.  COULD SEE SOME 
SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE AREA AS THE FRONT SLIDES THROUGH.   
SOME RESIDUAL SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO FRIDAY WITH TEMPERATURES 
STRUGGLING TO REACH THE LOWER 30S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.  A WARMING 
AND DRYING TREND EXPECTED FOR THE WEEKEND.  THERE IS A QUESTION FOR 
MONDAY WITH MODELS TRENDED TOWARD BRINGINGANOTHER COLD FRONT THROUGH 
THE REGION.  FOR NOW...HAVE LEFT THINGS DRY UNTIL HIGHER CONFIDENCE 
WITH TIMING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  45  35  47  30  52 / 100  50  10   0  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    46  35  44  28  49 /  90  70  10   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            45  34  43  28  49 /  90  60  10   0  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   45  33  41  26  45 /  80  80  30   0  20

129 
FXUS64 KMRX 180228
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
928 PM EST MON JAN 17 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING 1 BATCH OF ISOLATED LIGHT RAIN 
EXITING THE CWA WITH ANOTHER BATCH OF LIGHT RAIN ENTERING FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST. WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS IS. TEMPERATURES ON TRACK... 
SHOULD BE ALL RAIN AND NO FREEZING RAIN TONIGHT. REST OF FORECAST ON 
TRACK TOO. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MID CLOUD DECK CONTINUED ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPERATURES RISING FROM THE LOWER 30S TO MID 
40S THIS AFTERNOON. AREA RADARS SHOWED LIGHT RAIN MAINLY TO THE WEST 
OVER MIDDLE TN AND EASTERN KY WITH EASTERN TN VALLEY DRY. A LOW 
PRESSURE AREA LIES TO THE SOUTH OVER THE EASTERN GULF AND FLORIDA 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NE STATES AND ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE AREA 
ACROSS IOWA. LOW PRESSURE WILL STAY TO THE SOUTH AND THE LOW OVER 
IOWA WILL MOVE EAST SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES 
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. A COLD FRONT ACCOMPANYING IT WILL MOVE INTO THE 
TN VALLEY TUESDAY AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z WEDNESDAY. 
CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT BUT RAIN WILL BE SPOTTY WITH LIGHT TO 
TRACE AMOUNTS UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING AS FRONT APPROACHES. GFS TOO 
AGGRESSIVE WITH RAINFALL SO HOLDING POPS BACK TONIGHT MORE SIMILAR 
TO NAM/SREF MODELS. BOTH NAM/GFS DROPPING TEMPERATURES BELOW 
FREEZING NE TN AND SW VA BUT PREFER TO GO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
GUIDANCE. COULD BE SOME TRACE FREEZING RAIN TONIGHT EXTREME NE TN 
VALLEYS AND SW VA WHERE COLD AIR MAY STILL BE TRAPPED BUT NOT 
SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH OR WOULD LAST LONG ENOUGH TO MENTION IN ZONES. 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS IN MOUNTAINS MAY SEE A LITTLE SNOW WITH FREEZING 
LEVELS NEAR TOPS OF MOUNTAINS. HOWEVER CURRENT TEMPERATURE AT COVE 
MOUNTAIN AT 4000 FEET 40 DEGREES SO WILL LEAVE OUT OF FORECAST. 
TUESDAY TEMPERATURES WILL BE SIMILAR TO TODAYS...LOWER TO MID 40S 
WITH RAIN INCREASING DURING THE DAY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND SHOW MAINLY A PAIR OF 
SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT/FRIDAY. ON TUESDAY NIGHT...A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL BRING A WEAK OCCLUDED FRONT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL THE BOUNDARY LAYER OF MOISTURE 
BECOMING SHALLOWER OVER THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING...RESULTING IN THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING RAIN 
INSTEAD OF SNOW AS THE PRECIP INITIATION REGION WARMS TO AROUND -5 
DEGREES CELSIUS. THUS...WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF A WINTRY MIX 
OF RAIN...FREEZING RAIN AND SNOW FOR LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. ANOTHER STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL THEN QUICKLY 
MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT... 
BRINGING A GOOD CHANCE FOR SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. WHILE 
BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL A DECENT AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
WITH THIS COLD FRONT...IT SHOULD MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY. THEREAFTER...BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL 
ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT WITH VERY LIMITED AMOUNTS OF 
MOISTURE. THUS...WILL MENTION A DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   35  47  34  46  30 /  50  90  40   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     33  45  33  44  28 /  30  80  60  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             34  45  33  44  28 /  40  80  60  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    33  46  32  40  26 /  40  80  80  30   0

140 
FXUS64 KMRX 170932
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST MON JAN 17 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT IN 
DEPICTION OF WEAK LOW PRESSURE THAT MOVES BY WELL TO OUR SOUTH 
TODAY/EARLY TONIGHT...WITH NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING LATE TONIGHT.  
HOWEVER...THEY DIFFER IN THE DETAILS.  GFS MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE IN 
BRINGING PRECIP INTO OUR AREA...BUT IS NOT HANDLING CURRENT PRECIP 
VERY WELL.  NAM/SREF SOLUTION SLOWER. IN FACT...00Z NAM HAS MUCH OF 
OUR AREA BASICALLY PRECIP FREE BOTH PERIODS.  WILL GO WITH MORE OF A 
BLENDED SOLUTION GIVEN UNCERTAINTY...WITH CHANCE POPS BOTH PERIODS 
EXCEPT LIKELY FAR WESTERN ZONES LATE TONIGHT. SOME RISK FOR FREEZING 
RAIN IN A FEW AREAS LATE TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST...ALTHOUGH 
FOR NOW PLAN TO GO WITH CURRENT FORECAST IDEA OF NO FREEZING 
PRECIP.  ALSO LOOKS LIKE FREEZING LEVEL MAY BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO 
HIGHEST MOUNTAIN PEAKS FOR SOME SNOW.  WILL INCLUDE THIS POSSIBILITY 
IN FORECAST FOR THESE HIGH MOUNTAIN PEAKS...BUT ANY PRECIP SHOULD BE 
QUITE LIGHT.   WILL GENERALLY GO NEAR MAV TEMPS TODAY...SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE FOR TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL DEEPEN 
INTO THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION ON TUESDAY AS IT IS SUPPLIED 
WITH A HEALTHY AMOUNT OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY. ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY DRAGGING A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATER IN THE DAY AND DURING THE EVENING. 
CATEGORICAL PROBABILITIES FOR RAIN WILL FADE TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE 
SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE SHIFT EAST. RAIN SHOWERS 
CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS WITH SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE TENNESSEE 
STATE LINE SOUTH TO THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. PERHAPS SOME LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE IN THESE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS WEDNESDAY 
MORNING BEFORE FADING AWAY. MODELS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT FOR LATER 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AS AN ALBERTA CLIPPER AND ANOTHER SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT WAVE MOVE ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. TO THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD BY FRIDAY EVENING. LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER LIGHT PRECIP EVENT 
WITH SOME RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY 
BEFORE ENDING. PULLED THE NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS OUT OF THE 
FORECAST ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH LATE FORECAST PERIOD MODEL 
SOLUTIONS NOT QUITE AS OPTIMISTIC FOR SUCH AN EVENT. STAYED 
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE EXCEPT FOR THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS WELL AS MAX TEMPS ON SUNDAY. DURING THESE PERIOD 
UNDERCUT THE SUGGESTED NUMBERS BY SEVERAL DEGREES.

113 
FXUS64 KMRX 170220
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST SUN JAN 16 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION PROVIDING A DRY FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND 
THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...
VORT MAXES OVER WEST TX AND THE TX COAST WILL MERGE TONIGHT IN THE 
NORTHERN GULF TONIGHT...THEN TRACK EASTWARD. MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS 
TROUGH WILL OVERSPREAD A SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE REGION TO BRING 
LIGHT PRECIP IN THE TN VALLEY DURING THE DAY MONDAY. MODELS HAVE 
BEEN SHOWING TOO MUCH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE OVER OUR AREA 
TODAY...SUGGESTING THAT THE ONSET OF PRECIP WILL BE AFTER SUNRISE 
TOMORROW. LARGE-SCALE LIFT IS WEAK AND LOW LEVELS REMAIN DRY...SO 
PRECIP WILL BE LIGHT. 

STRONGER LIFT AND BETTER PRECIP CHANCES WILL COME LATE MONDAY NIGHT 
AND INTO TUESDAY AS AN UPPER JET DIVES ACROSS THE PLAINS AND INTO 
THE DEEP SOUTH. DIVERGENCE IN THE LEFT EXIT REGION OF THE JET AND 
GOOD WARM ADVECTION AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT WILL PROVIDE CATEGORICAL 
POPS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. PRECIP WILL TAPER OFF TUESDAY NIGHT 
AS THE UPPER TROUGH AND JET PASS TO OUR EAST. PRECIP TRANSITIONS TO
SNOW AS COLD ADVECTION IN A NORTHWEST FLOW KICKS IN. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL CONTINUES WEDNESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE AREA
DEEPENS ALONG THE NE COAST AND UPPER TROUGH MOVES OUT. DO NOT
EXPECT MUCH ACCUMULATION WEDNESDAY BUT TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH
COOLER GENERALLY MID 30S TO MID 40S. AS FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY THERE WILL BE A BRIEF DRY PERIOD UNTIL
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN STATES AND LOW
PRESSURE DEVELOPING ALONG THE WESTERN GULF BRINGS A COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. PRECIPITATION TO SPREAD INTO REGION BY LATE
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT EARLY FRIDAY. GFS WARMER THAN ECMWF
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL STAY
MOSTLY IN THE 40S AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM SO RAIN THURSDAY CHANGING TO
RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AND BECOMING SNOW SHOWERS
FRIDAY AS FLOW COMES IN FROM THE NW WITH MUCH COLDER AIR MASS.
FOLLOWING COLDEST MOS NUMBERS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT LATEST ECMWF SHOWS MORE SHORT WAVE
ENERGY MOVING ACROSS FORECAST AREA SO ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SNOW
SATURDAY AS TEMPERATURES REMAIN COLD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             32  45  36  48  32 /  10  60  80  80  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  32  44  35  47  31 /  10  50  80  80  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  45  36  47  31 /  10  50  80  80  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              27  41  34  46  31 /  10  30  80  80  50

AS THE UPPER TROUGH AND JET PASS TO OUR EAST. PRECIP TRANISIONS TO
SNOW AS COLD ADVECTION IN A NORTHWEST FLOW KICKS IN. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL CONTINUES WEDNESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE AREA
DEEPENS ALONG THE NE COAST AND UPPER TROUGH MOVES OUT. DO NOT
EXPECT MUCH ACCUMULATION WEDNESDAY BUT TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH
COOLER GENERALLY MID 30S TO MID 40S. AS FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY THERE WILL BE A BRIEF DRY PERIOD UNTIL
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN STATES AND LOW
PRESSURE DEVELOPING ALONG THE WESTERN GULF BRINGS A COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. PRECIPITATION TO SPREAD INTO REGION BY LATE
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT EARLY FRIDAY. GFS WARMER THAN ECMWF
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL STAY
MOSTLY IN THE 40S AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM SO RAIN THURSDAY CHANGING TO
RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AND BECOMING SNOW SHOWERS
FRIDAY AS FLOW COMES IN FROM THE NW WITH MUCH COLDER AIR MASS.
FOLLOWING COLDEST MOS NUMBERS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT LATEST ECMWF SHOWS MORE SHORT WAVE
ENERGY MOVING ACROSS FORECAST AREA SO ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SNOW
SATURDAY AS TEMPERATURES REMAIN COLD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             32  45  36  48  32 /  10  60  80  80  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  32  44  35  47  31 /  10  50  80  80  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  45  36  47  31 /  10  50  80  80  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              27  41  34  46  31 /  10  30  80  80  50

GUIDANCE SUGGESTS MVFR CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR. AGAIN...CONFIDENCE IN
THIS HAPPENING IS TOO LOW AT THIS TIME TO MENTION IN TAFS.

762 
FXUS64 KMRX 160917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SUN JAN 16 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)....WEAKENING COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
INTO THE AREA BEFORE DISSIPATING.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
INCREASE...BUT FORCING WILL BE LACKING.  HAVE SEEN NO OBSERVATIONS 
OF ANY PRECIP IN AREAS WHERE GFS HAD VERY LIGHT QPF...SO WILL GO 
MORE WITH THE DRIER NAM/SREF SOLUTION AND REMOVE MENTION OF 
DRIZZLE.  NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING TONIGHT. GFS TRIES TO BRING LIGHT 
QPF INTO WESTERN AREAS BEFORE 12Z...BUT NAM DRY AND HPC KEEPS ALL 
PRECIP WELL TO OUR SOUTHWEST.  WILL LEAN TOWARD SLOWER SOLUTION AND 
HAVE A MAINLY DRY FORECAST FOR TONIGHT...WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FAR WESTERN ZONES LATE. PRECIP TYPE MAY BE CLOSE AS LOW LEVEL 
TEMPS LIKELY TO BE NEAR FREEZING...SO WILL MENTION BOTH FREEZING 
RAIN AND RAIN. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.   

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS NOT AS CLOSE IN 
DEPICTION OF THE LONG TERM AS I WOULD LIKE TO SEE...ESPECIALLY 
WITHIN THE FIRST 48-72 HOURS. THE WRF/ECMWF ARE SIMILAR IN SLOWER 
ARRIVAL OF DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT FOR MONDAY WITH LESS IMPACT FROM 
INITIAL DEEP SOUTH SHORT WAVE AS FORECAST AREA AWAITS HIGHER 
PROBABILITY NORTHERN SYSTEM ON TUESDAY DROPPING SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
WESTERN LAKES THROUGH THE MIDWEST AND EVENTUALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT. DID SOME MINOR ADJUSTING OF THE TWO DAY 
EVENT TRYING TO HOLD BACK POPS FOR RAIN FROM EAST THROUGH WEST 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR SLIGHTLY BETTER TIME 
RESOLUTION ON SHORT WAVE IMPACTS. HELD ONTO THE NORTHWEST FLOW 
SNOWFALL REGIME FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS ENERGY BUILDS 
THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF DEPARTING UPPER TROF. MODEL SOLUTION 
DIVERGENCE CONTINUES LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH 
TIMING...POSITION...STRENGTH OF SHORT WAVE FOR THE THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY TIME FRAME. TRIED TO JUST STAY THE COURSE HERE WITH SLIGHT 
AND SMALL CHANCE POPS WITH THE RAIN/SNOW MIX CONCEPT TRANSITIONING 
INTO A NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW REGIME AS ARCTIC AIR SPILLS SOUTH LATE IN 
THE WEEK. DUE TO INCREASING UNCERTAINTY AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD...JUST KEPT SATURDAY DRY AWAITING BETTER MODEL AGREEMENT IN 
THE NEXT FEW RUNS. THE TEMPERATURE SCHEME WILL PROBABLY NEED SOME 
FUTURE ADJUSTING WITH THE ECMWF NOT SO EXCITED ABOUT AN ARCTIC 
INTRUSION THIS FAR SOUTH WHILE THE GFS IS MORE ENTHUSIASTIC WITH A 
RETURN APPEARANCE OF THE FRIGID AIR.

167 
FXUS64 KMRX 160225
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EST SAT JAN 15 2011

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING NO PRECIPITATION DETECTED IN THE CWA 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT YET. WILL CURRENT POPS AND WEATHER TYPE AS IS. 
BUT ANY PRECIPITATION THAT FALLS WILL BE LIGHT AND PATCHY. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
FRONT OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY WILL MOVE SOUTHWARD INTO OUR AREA 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE CONFINED TO BEHIND 
THE FRONT BASED ON UPSTREAM OBS...WITH JUST MID LEVEL CLOUDS AHEAD OF 
IT. THE MOISTURE BEHIND THE FRONT IS CONFINED TO A VERY SHALLOW 
LAYER...NOTED IN THE 12Z ILX SOUNDING. NAM AND GFS FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS OVER OUR AREA SHOW MOISTURE REMAINING BELOW 800 MB...WELL 
BELOW THE LEVEL NEEDED FOR ICE NUCLEATION. LIFT IS VERY WEAK AS 
WELL. THIS SUGGESTS A DRIZZLE/FREEZING DRIZZLE SCENARIO. THUS WILL 
REMOVE POPS FOR TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...JUST MENTIONING DRIZZLE AND 
FREEZING DRIZZLE. WITH OVERCAST CLOUDS ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA ALL 
DAY...WENT BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES TOMORROW...MID 30S TO 
LOWER 40S. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
SUNDAY NIGHT NAM MODEL KEEPS FORECAST AREA DRY AND GFS BRINGS A 
LITTLE DEEPER MOISTURE INTO SOUTHWEST SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA WITH 
TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW FREEZING BEFORE 
SUNRISE MONDAY. MENTIONED SLIGHT CHANCE MIXTURE OF RAIN...FREEZING 
RAIN AND SNOW UNTIL MID MORNING MONDAY. DO NOT THINK ANY ICING WILL 
OCCUR AS WARMER TEMPERATURES TODAY AND SUNDAY WILL HAVE ROADS WARMER 
AND LOWS WILL ONLY BE AROUND 30 TO LOWER 30S. MAIN WEATHER STORY 
THOUGH WILL BE WEAKENING SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY SPREADING 
MOISTURE SLOWLY NORTHEAST INTO THE TN VALLEY AS STRONGER NORTHERN 
SYSTEM MOVES OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND MOVES INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES BY MONDAY NIGHT...EARLY TUESDAY. WILL LIKELY GET EASTERLY TO 
SOUTHEAST FLOW INITIALLY WHICH SHOULD LIMIT RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
NORTHERN SECTIONS THROUGH AT LEAST LATE MONDAY. NAM SHOWS NOT MUCH 
PRECIPITATION UNTIL TUESDAY WITH GFS STRONGER WITH SOUTHERN PART OF 
SYSTEM MONDAY AND THEN DEVELOPING SECONDARY SURFACE LOW TUESDAY OVER 
LOWER MS VALLEY...AS UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER SOUTH CENTRAL 
STATES...BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF RAIN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
CHANGING TO SNOW BEFORE PRECIPITATION ENDS WEDNESDAY. KEPT HIGHEST 
RAIN CHANCES MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY BEFORE DECREASING CHANCES 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH RAIN SHOWERS CHANGING TO SNOW 
SHOWERS IN COLDER AIR MASS. THURSDAY IN THE FAST MOVING NW FLOW 
ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN AND SNOW WITH ARCTIC AIR MASS SETTLING IN AND 
MUCH COLDER AND DRIER THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND.       

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SAT JAN 15 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION WILL 
GIVE WAY TO A WEAKENING COLD FRONT THAT WILL PUSH IN TONIGHT.  
LIMITED MOISTURE AND FORCING WITH THIS WEAK FRONT...SO EXPECT VERY 
LITTLE IN THE WAY OF PRECIP...WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  WILL 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH...AND KEEP REMAINDER OF THE AREA 
PRECIP FREE TONIGHT.  PRECIP TYPE FOR ANY PRECIP THAT DOES FALL IS 
PROBLEMATIC.  MAY NOT BE COLD ENOUGH IN THE CLOUD LAYER TO SUPPORT 
ICE CRYSTALLIZATION...SO MAY BE ONLY VERY LIGHT RAIN/FREEZING RAIN.  
HOWEVER...GIVEN UNCERTAINTY...WILL MENTION SNOW POSSIBILITY AS 
WELL.  AGAIN...VERY LITTLE PRECIP EXPECTED.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
PRECIP ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ON 
SUNDAY AS WEAKENING IMPULSE SLIDES EAST SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. NOT MUCH OF AN EVENT WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE SO JUST KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE FREEZING RAIN OR 
SNOW CONCEPT GOING HERE DURING THE MORNING WITH COLD OVERNIGHT MIN 
TEMPS. THANKS TO BETTER MODEL RESOLUTION DUE TO PROXIMITY OF NEXT 
EVENT...WAS ABLE TO REMOVE THE SUNDAY NIGHT POP FOR ALMOST THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. ECMWF/GFS BRING SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE INTO THE 
SOUTHEASTERN STATES ON MONDAY WHILE NORTHERN STREAM UPPER LEVEL JET 
STRENGTHENS ON THE BACK SIDE OF CENTRAL U.S. TROUGH. DEEPER LIFT AND 
MOISTURE AND WILL BE AVAILABLE AS THIS AMPLIFYING SYSTEM DRIVES EAST 
TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY SO 
HELD ONTO LIKELY POPS FOR THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. IT APPEARS 
PRECIP DOESN'T GET STARTED UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY FOR THE COLDEST 
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA INCLUDING SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE SO DID NOT HAVE TO APPLY WINTERY MIX HERE DUE TO EXPECTED 
WARMING BY AFTERNOON. WILL CHECK PRECIP TIMING IN LATER ZONE 
ISSUANCE TO SEE IF THIS CHANGES. COLDER AIR SPILLS INTO THE REGION 
AGAIN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY FOR A PERIOD OF NORTHWEST FLOW 
SNOW SHOWER ACTION. NOT MUCH OF A BREAK BEFORE NEXT UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH PRESSES EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH ASSOCIATED ARCTIC 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. LOOKS LIKE A RAIN/SNOW MIX ON THE FRONT SIDE WITH 
SNOW SHOWERS BUILDING IN BEHIND LATE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AS 
THE FRIGID AIRMASS STREAMS SOUTHEAST. KEPT A FEW MOUNTAIN SNOW 
SHOWERS GOING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ON FRIDAY.

WARMING TO THE AREA. AN UPPER LEVEL JET STREAK AND WEAK SHORTWAVE
TROUGH WILL BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDS TONIGHT...OTHERWISE MOSTLY SUNNY
SKIES CAN BE EXPECTED. CLOUDS MAY BE INCREASING LATE IN THE DAY
TOMORROW AS A WEAK UPPER TROUGH SAGS SOUTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.
WENT WITH THE COOLER GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES TONIGHT IN
THE TEENS AND LOW 20S...BUT SHAVED A COUPLE DEGREES OF GFS MOS FOR
HIGHS TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAKENING SYSTEM
OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY IS LOOKING EVEN WEAKER TODAY
AND WILL SAG INTO THE NORTHERN FORECAST AREA EARLY SUNDAY AND THEN
WEAKENING AND MOVING EAST LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. EXPECT A
FEW SPRINKLES...LIGHT SNOW AND POSSIBLY MIXED WITH LIGHT FREEZING
RAIN OR DRIZZLE ACROSS EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA AND NORTHERN PLATEAU
MAINLY EARLY SUNDAY. LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT WITH CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS
AND STARTING OUT FROM WARMER HIGHS WILL ONLY COOL INTO THE MID 20S
TO AROUND FREEZING AND MAY ACTUALLY WARM A FEW DEGREES OVERNIGHT.
SUNDAY THE LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE BUT TEMPERATURES WILL
STAY ABOVE FREEZING. SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER TEXAS SUNDAY WILL
SPREAD MORE SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY
NIGHT AND JOIN WITH MORE DEVELOPED NORTHERN SYSTEM OVER THE
NORTHERN PLAINS AS IT MOVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY
TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR PRECIPITATION TO BE
MOSTLY RAIN. BIG DIFFERENCE WITH RAINFALL AMOUNTS WITH ECMWF MODEL
SHOWING AROUND ONE HALF INCH OF RAIN TUESDAY AND GFS SHOWING HEAVY
RAIN ON THE PLATEAU OF AROUND TWO INCHES TO ABOUT ONE INCH IN THE
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. AFTER THIS SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH TUESDAY WRAP
AROUND MOISTURE IN COLDER AIR MASS WILL BRING SNOW SHOWERS TO AT
LEAST THE NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER
QUICK MOVING SYSTEM THURSDAY WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF MAINLY
SNOW BY THURSDAY NIGHT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             21  43  30  43  32 /   0   0  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  20  42  29  43  29 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       20  41  28  43  29 /   0   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              19  41  26  39  26 /   0   0  20  20  10 

&&

NC...NONE.

366 
FXUS64 KMRX 140915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST FRI JAN 14 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
REGION WILL SHIFT SOUTHEAST DURING THE PERIOD.  SOME VERY WEAK SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY WILL BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDS ESPECIALLY TONIGHT...BUT 
OVERALL SHOULD BE A TRANQUIL SHORT TERM PERIOD.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE FOR TODAY...BUT WILL TWEAK UP A BIT MOST LOCATIONS 
FOR TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST 
CONTAINS A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY...MAINLY MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...DUE TO MODEL DIFFERENCES. WENT CLOSER TO THE NATIONAL 
CENTER PREFERENCE FOR A SOLUTION CLOSER TO THE ECMWF. THE WEEKEND 
FORECAST FEATURES A LOW AMPLITUDE WAVE THAT DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
CANADA ON ITS WAY ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. THE 
WAVE ENCOURAGES A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO DRIFT SOUTH THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. MAINTAINED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR SOME RAIN/SNOW BUT TRIMMED COVERAGE AS THIS SYSTEM 
DOES NOT HAVE MUCH IN THE WAY OF LIFT AND MOISTURE FOR PRECIPITATION 
PRODUCTION. IMPROVED CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION DEVELOP BY THE 
BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK AND CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY AS A COUPLE 
SHORT WAVELENGTH TROUGHS AMPLIFY WEST OF THE REGION AND MAKE THEIR 
WAY ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. BY MID WEEK. THE SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE 
EMERGES FIRST DRIVING A SURFACE LOW FROM THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH FROM 12Z MONDAY TO 12Z TUESDAY. 
TRAILING BEHIND THIS FEATURE WILL BE A STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM WAVE 
AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM WHICH PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN 
U.S. 12Z TUESDAY TO 12Z WEDNESDAY. KEPT POPS RELATIVELY HIGH WITH 
THE BEST LIKLIEHOOD FOR RAIN INCREASING LATER IN THE DAY MONDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AS ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF THE 
SOUTHERN WAVE. STAYED WITH THE WINTERY MIX IDEA FOR SUNDAY NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY AS THIS SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER A CHILLY LOW LEVEL AIRMASS. 
AS POPS DECREASE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING TRANSITIONED 
THE PRECIP FROM RAIN SHOWERS TO SNOW SHOWERS IN THE STANDARD SHIFT 
TO OROGRAPHICALLY ENHANCED SNOW IN THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MOST OF THE REGION SHOULD 
ENJOY A DRY WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS THE AREA COMES UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF HIGHER PRESSURE. ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES BELOW MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE AS ECMWF INDICATES ANOTHER SURGE OF POLAR AIR CHARGES 
SOUTHWARD ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BEHIND THE 
EARLY WEEK STORM SYSTEM.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  23  44  30  42 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  23  42  28  42 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  23  41  27  43 /   0   0   0  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              32  20  41  25  39 /   0   0   0  20  20

639 
FXUS64 KMRX 140218
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST THU JAN 13 2011

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO LOWER CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A FEW FLURRIES WILL LINGER INTO THE EVENING HOURS ACROSS NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA...BUT NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED AS MOISTURE 
DEPTH DECREASES THROUGH THE EVENING. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SETTLE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...WITH AN INCREASINGLY ANTICYCLONIC 
FLOW ALOFT. MIDLEVEL WARMING WILL STRENGTHEN AN INVERSION IN THE 
925-850 MB LAYER TONIGHT. MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW THIS INVERSION MAY 
GIVE BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS TONIGHT...MAINLY NORTH. DAYTIME 
HEATING TOMORROW SHOULD MIX THESE CLOUDS OUT IN THE 
MORNING...ALLOWING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES TO WARM TEMPS INTO THE 30S. 

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT BUT SHOULD BE
SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER THAN TONIGHT. A WARMING TREND SATURDAY AS
WINDS BECOME SOUTHWEST AS HIGH SHIFTS EAST. TEMPERATURES SHOULD
WARM ABOVE FREEZING EXCEPT POSSIBLY IN THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS WHERE
THERE IS CONSIDERABLE SNOW COVER. FORECAST MODELS BRING A WEAK COLD
FRONT INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT...AND IT MOVES LITTLE
AND WEAKENS MORE SUNDAY. MODELS SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO SHOW A
SHALLOW SATURATED LAYER BELOW 850 MB. ONLY EXPECT A LITTLE PRECIP
SATURDAY NIGHT BUT WITH SURFACE TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW
FREEZING THERE WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME FREEZING RAIN LATE
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING. WITH MORE CLOUDS TEMPERATURES
WILL FALL SLOWER SUNDAY NIGHT BUT THERE STILL MAY BE A LITTLE
FREEZING PRECIPITATION IN THE COLDER HIGHER ELEVATION VALLEYS
BEFORE PRECIPITATION CHANGES TO ALL RAIN MONDAY.

GFS AND ECMWF MODELS THEN SHOW LOWER PRESSURE DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
PLAINS SUNDAY AND BRING UP GULF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. GFS IS STRONGER AND MORE DEVELOPED WITH SYSTEM THAN THE
ECMWF BUT BOTH WARM REGION INTO THE 40S TO NEAR 50 MONDAY AND
TUESDAY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOW LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH THE GFS
SHOWING A COUPLE INCHES WITH THE SYSTEM AND ECMWF ONLY ABOUT ONE
HALF INCH. STILL KEEPING JUST RAIN IN THE FORECAST MONDAY AND
TUESDAY...CHANGING TO SNOW OVERNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY
AS A COLD FRONT BRINGS COLDER AIR MASS INTO REGION. HIGHER PRESSURE
BUILDS INTO THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY HOWEVER A WEAK
UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM WILL MOVE BY TO THE NORTH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY
THURSDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             13  37  20  43  30 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  14  36  21  42  27 /   0   0   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       14  36  21  41  27 /   0   0   0   0  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              13  34  19  41  25 /  10   0   0   0  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.AVIATION...

AFTERNOON AT TYS...AND REMAIN SCATTERED AT CHA. TRI WILL REMAIN
PREDOMINANTLY MVFR...AND SCATTERED SNOW FLURRIES MAY LOWER
VISIBILITIES TO MVFR AT TIMES. ALL SITES SHOULD SEE MVFR CEILINGS
RETURN LATER TONIGHT AS THE BOUNDARY LAYER COOLS BENEATH A STRONG
INVERSION ALOFT. GREATER SCATTERING OUT OF CLOUDS SHOULD COME LATE
IN THE TAF PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 131450 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EST THU JAN 13 2011

.DISCUSSION...
AREA SOUNDINGS AT 12Z FROM OHX AND ILN SUGGEST A TREND OF
DECREASING MOISTURE AND WARMING TEMPERATURES ALOFT THROUGH THE
DAY...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN DECREASING SNOW SHOWERS THIS
AFTERNOON. UPSLOPE WIND COMPONENT ALSO DECREASES TO LESS THAN 20
KTS AT 850 MB...SO MOUNTAIN LOCATIONS SHOULD NOT SEE MUCH MORE
ACCUMULATION TODAY. THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE ALLOWED TO
EXPIRE AT 11 AM. SOME MINOR WORDING CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE
FORECAST...BUT FOR THE MOST PART IT LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK.

&&

NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

660 
FXUS64 KMRX 130900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST THU JAN 13 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING SNOW HAS
DECREASE AS THE SHORTWAVE EXITS THE AREA SO CANCELLED THE WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. BUT MODELS STILL INDICATING
AN UPSLOPE CONDITIONS INTO THE MORNING HOURS...SO EXTENDED THE
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING FOR THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 11 AM THIS
MORNING. ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD LESS THAN 3 INCHES
AND MAINLY OVER THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING
DRY WEATHER FOR TONIGHT. MORE COLD WEATHER EXPECTED TODAY AND
TONIGHT. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH A WARMING TREND 
DEVELOPING. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON SATURDAY NIGHT...AND BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OR DISSIPATE 
AROUND THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY. MODELS SOUNDINGS REVEAL A 
SHALLOW SATURATED LAYER GENERALLY BELOW 850 MB...WITH THE PRECIP 
INITIATION REGION RIGHT AROUND -5 CELSIUS WHERE PRECIP MAY BEGIN AS 
EITHER RAIN OR SNOW. WITH SURFACE TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW 
FREEZING BY SUNDAY MORNING...THINK THERE WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME FREEZING DRIZZLE LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING...BUT 
MODELS AGREE THAT THIS PRECIP SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT. GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS THEN REVEAL SOME LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH THE LARGE-SCALE 
PATTERN FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED 
TO DEVELOP OVER THE PLAINS ON SUNDAY...WHICH WILL DEVELOP A SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SOMEWHERE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS OR LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN IS FARTHER NORTH THAN THE ECMWF 
MODEL WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS SURFACE LOW...AND IS CONSEQUENTLY 
WARMER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THAN THE ECMWF. SINCE BOTH MODELS HAVE 
BEEN INCONSISTENT WITH THEIR SOLUTIONS IN THE PAST FEW DAYS...WILL 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO MODELS AND BASICALLY CONTINUE WITH THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST OF RAIN FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...CHANGING TO SNOW 
TUESDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE MORE CONSISTENT ENSEMBLE MEANS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD... WHICH ARE COOLER THAN THE GFS 
NUMBERS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  14  38  23  43 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  28  13  36  22  41 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       28  13  37  22  42 /  20   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              26  12  35  20  40 /  40   0   0   0   0 

&&

     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY

208 
FXUS64 KMRX 130246
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
943 PM EST WED JAN 12 2011

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATE PLANNED. DRIER AND COLDER AIR FILTERING INTO 
THE AREA. SNOW SHOWERS ARE FAIRLY LIGHT BUT INCREASED SNOW/LIQUID 
RATIO WILL ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE ADVISORY AREAS.
SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST ALONG WITH
THE POLAR JET OVER NRN AL/GA/SC WILL MEAN A PERSISTENT COLD N-NW
FLOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE
GENERATED BY STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES...WITH UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT
IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A LACK OF LARGE-SCALE LIFT SHOULD KEEP
ACCUMULATIONS VERY LIGHT OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. THE CURRENT
ADVISORY FOR SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS UNTIL 7 AM THURSDAY WILL
BE MAINTAINED. 

WHILE VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL NOT SEE MUCH ADDITIONAL SNOW 
ACCUMULATION...ROADS WILL REMAIN ICY AND SLICK TONIGHT WITH 
TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE TEENS IN MOST SPOTS. HIGHS WILL 
REMAIN BELOW FREEZING AGAIN TOMORROW...BUT THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH 
SUN IN THE AFTERNOON TO HELP IMPROVE ROAD CONDITIONS IN MOST SPOTS.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH IN 
CONTROL EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH THE MAIN STORM TRACK TO OUR NORTH.  
THIS WILL PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS AND MODERATING TEMPERATURES FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  WILL TRANSITION INTO A MORE UNSETTLE WEATHER 
PATTERN SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS 
EXPECTED TO SLIDE INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY...A WEATHER DISTURBANCE 
MOVES THROUGH MONDAY...THEN A COLD FRONT PUSHES IN AROUND TUESDAY OR 
TUESDAY NIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN ONCE AGAIN FOR WEDNESDAY.  
HOWEVER...THERE CONTINUES TO BE DIFFERENCES IN MODELS AND CONFIDENCE 
REMAINS LOW FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE EXTENDED.  OVERALL...MADE FEW 
CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST WITH LOW POPS SUNDAY...CHANCE POPS 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AND DRY ON WEDNESDAY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.


&&

AREA...MAINLY NORTH...BUT WITH A LACK OF LARGE-SCALE LIFT...MOST
ACCUMULATIONS TODAY WILL BE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE ADVISORY FOR
THE TN VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT

CONTINUED AS IS THROUGH TONIGHT.

015 
FXUS64 KMRX 120911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EST WED JAN 12 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING SCATTERED TO
NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TO
NORTH. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AND
MOUNTAINS. WITH SOME LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE EXPECTED TO BRING
ADDITIONAL ALONG WITH SOME SNOW ON THE GROUND...WILL EXTEND THE
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE PLATEAU AND THE VALLEY UNTIL NOON
TODAY. WILL CONTINUE THE ADVISORY GOING FOR THE MOUNTAINS AS IS.
THE HIGHEST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE IN UPSLOPE AREAS. LOW
PRESSURE EXITS THE REGION TONIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES
FOR THE EVENING HOURS. SHOULD BREEZY TODAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE
MOUNTAINS...BUT BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA, BELOW SEASONAL
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TODAY AND AND TONIGHT. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ALONG
THE EAST COAST WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON THURSDAY. AS A RESULT...SOME UPSLOPE
SNOW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY LINGER OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA...BUT THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH BY
THURSDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE REGION FOR
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH A WARMING TREND DEVELOPING. BOTH THE GFS
AND ECMWF MODELS THEN REVEAL SOME INCONSISTENCIES FROM RUN TO RUN
WITH THE HANDLING OF THE LARGE-SCALE PATTERN FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.
RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TN
RIVER VALLEY BY SATURDAY NIGHT...AND BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND
THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY. MODELS SOUNDINGS REVEAL A SHALLOW
MOIST LAYER GENERALLY BELOW 850 MB...WHICH WOULD SUGGEST THE
POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING DRIZZLE FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
MORNING. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER
THE PLAINS ON SUNDAY...WHICH WOULD CREATE A WARM AIR ADVECTION
PATTERN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY ALONG WITH A
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THUS...WILL MENTION
MOSTLY RAIN FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...BUT THIS RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO
SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA.
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE MORE CONSISTENT ENSEMBLE
MEANS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE A LITTLE COOLER
THAN THE GFS NUMBERS.

&&

635 
FXUS64 KMRX 111955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST TUE JAN 11 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT MOVING
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WITH WINDS BECOMING WESTERLY WITH COLD
AIR ADECTION INCREASING BY EARLY THIS EVENING. LIGHT SNOW AND/OR
FLURRIES CAN BE EXPECTED AREA-WIDE THROUGH THIS EVENING..ESPECIALLY
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. WILL CONTINUE WITH ADVISORY AREA-WIDE.
MAIN CONCERN FOR OVERNIGHT IS REFREEZE OF SNOW AND ICE ON SECONDARY
ROADS...BRIDGES AND OVERPASSES. POTENTIAL OF BLACK ICE FOR THE
OVERNIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING.

NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS OVERNIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND CONTINUES
THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. A WEAK TO MODERATE EVENT IS ANTICIPATED
WITH 3 TO 6 INCHES ANTICIPATED OVER 36 HOURS...SO WILL LET CURRENT
ADVISORY CONTINUE.

INCREASING NORTHWEST WINDS WILL ALSO PRODUCE LOW WIND CHILL
READINGS IN THE MOUNTAINS...BUT JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA
(AROUND 5 BELOW).

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)... WEAK UPSLOPE CONDITION 
CONTINUES EARLY THURSDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE LOW POPS ACROSS SW VA. 
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WARM UP SLOWLY TO NEAR NORMAL. A FRONT MOVES SE 
ENTERING THE REGION ON SUNDAY. LIGHT SNOW EARLY WILL CHANGE TO RAIN. 
FRONT HANGS UP AROUND SOUTHERN EDGE OF CWA. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE 
POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. PRECIP TYPE QUESTIONABLE SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY. BELIEVE DOMINATE TYPE WILL BE LIQUID. SHORT WAVE 
WILL APPROACH FROM THE WEST ALONG BOTTOM OF BROAD U.S. TROUGH. MODEL 
AND ENSEMBLE SOLUTIONS BEGIN TO SPREAD FOR NEXT WEEK. SURFACE LOW 
WILL DEVELOP VCNTY TX AND MOVE NE INTO TN VALLEY BY TUE. WIDESPREAD 
LIQUID PCPN WILL OVERTAKE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. RAIN MAY 
CHANGE TO SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT. STAYED A BIT BELOW MEX TEMPERATURES 
AND LEANED MORE TOWARD HPC GUIDANCE.

1224 PM EST TUE JAN 11 2011

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT CONTINUES TO PRODUCE AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW...FREEZING 
DRIZZLE...AND DRIZZLE. AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGHTHIS AFTERNOON 
PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO ALL LIGHT SNOW. INITIALLY AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT CONDITIONS ARE CURRENTLY IFR AT BOTH TRI AND TYS...BUT WITH 
FROPA CEILINGS WILL BECOME MVFR WITH CEILINGS AROUND 1500-2000FT. 
CEILING WILL SLOWLY CLIMB OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING TO 
VFR CONDITIONS AT CHA. 

PERIODS OF LIGHT SNOW REDUCING VISIBILITIES TO 2 TO 4 MILES ARE 
EXPECTED AT MAINLY TRI AND TYS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

WINDS WILL BECOMING WEST TO SOUTHWEST SUSTAINED AT 10-15KTS WITH 
GUSTS TO 22KTS AFTER FROPA THIS AFTERNOON.

1040 AM EST TUE JAN 11 2011

UPDATED TO EXTEND ADVISORIES.

.DISCUSSION...WEAK TO MODERATE ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF AN
APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A LIGHT WINTRY MIX
OVER THE FORECAST AREA (SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE). A LOT OF
REPORTS OF ICE COVERED ROADWAYS WITH NUMEROUS TRAFFIC ACCIDENTS.
MODELS SHOW THE LIGHT PRECIPITATION CONTINUING AREA-WIDE THROUGH
THIS EVENING...SO HAVE EXTENDED ADVISORY AREA-WIDE THROUGH 00Z. 

DUE TO NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC FLOW DEVELOPING TONIGHT AND CONTINUING
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT HAVE EXTENDED ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY.
SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WITH THE NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL WILL BE BETWEEN 4
AND 8 INCHES...BUT WILL BE OVER A 36 HOURS TIME-FRAME...SO WILL
KEEP AS AN ADVISORY.

LOWERED HIGHS TODAY A DEGREE OR TWO.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST TUE JAN 11 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT STRETCHING SOUTHEAST ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND AL. 
AREA RADARS CURRENTLY REVEAL SOME PATCHY LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WHICH WAS REPORTED EARLIER AS FREEZING DRIZZLE AT 
CHA. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL CONTINUE TO 
BE POSSIBLE UNTIL AFTER SUNRISE...WHEN THE COLD FRONT BRINGS COLDER 
AIR INTO THE REGION (ESPECIALLY IN THE UPPER LEVELS). AFTER FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...IT APPEARS THAT PRECIP SHOULD MOSTLY BE IN THE FORM OF 
SNOW. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY 
LIMITED TODAY...WITH A WESTERLY WIND FLOW THAT WILL NOT BE 
PARTICULARLY IDEAL FOR UPSLOPE PRECIP ENHANCEMENTS IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. THUS...WILL MENTION CHANCE POPS FOR MOST AREAS THROUGH 
TONIGHT. WILL ALSO CONTINUE THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES FOR 
TODAY...AND WILL MENTION SOME LIGHT SNOW AND ICE ACCUMULATIONS 
POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER 
OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC WHERE SNOW COVER SHOULD LIMIT ANY 
WARMING.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH 
THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE HIGHEST POPS FOR THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA AND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE LINGERS ALONG WITH THE UPSLOPE CONDITIONS. COULD SEE 
ANOTHER 1-2 INCHES OF SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON 
WEDNESDAY. SHORTWAVE EXITS THE AREA BY THURSDAY BUT STILL A WEAK 
UPSLOPE CONDITION SO WILL CONTINUE THE LOW POPS INTO THURSDAY BUT 
ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL SHOULD BE LIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS PROVIDING 
DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. A FRONT ENTERING THE REGION ON 
SUNDAY AND LINGERS INTO MONDAY. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH 
PERIODS. BASED ON TEMPERATURES...RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW ON BOTH 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT THEN SWITCH BACK TO RAIN BY BOTH 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY AFTERNOON. SHOULD SEE A WARMING TREND 
FOR PERIOD. STAYED A BIT BELOW MEX TEMPERATURES AND LEANED MORE 
TOWARD HPC GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EST MON JAN 10 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE IS MOVING 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM WAVE...CURRENTLY 
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...MOVING SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY. 
THE NORTHERN STEAM WAVE WILL ALLOW THE BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS TO VEER 
TO THE SOUTH PRODUCING ISENTROPIC LIFT. THE AREA OF PRECPITATION 
OVER NORTHEAST AL...EAST TENNESSEE...AND NORTHERN GEORGIA IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE ISENTROPIC LIFT...WHICH WILL CONTINUE THROUGH 
TUESDAY MORNING.

VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE WARMS ENOUGH THAT WE LOSE THE DENDRITIC 
SNOW GROWTH...SO PRECIPITATION WILL TRANSITION TO MORE SLEET AND 
FREEZING DRIZZLE OVERNIGHT. WILL DROP THE WARNINGS...BUT INCLUDE ALL 
AREAS UNDER A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH 18Z...AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA THROUGH 00Z TUESDAY.

FRONT WITH NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA LATE 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL FOLLOW MOS MINS...BUT WILL 
UNDERCUT HIGHS FOR THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA DUE TO SNOW COVER.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CONTINUES TO EXIT TO THE NORTHEAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD. NORTHWEST 
FLOW EVENT SETS UP. H85 NW WINDS AROUND 40 KNOTS WITH SUFFICIENT 
MOISTURE IN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION. UPSLOPE SNOWFALL EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE INTO EARLY THU. VALLEY AREAS WILL SEE SOME SCATTERED 
ACTIVITY BUT NO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED. UPSLOPE AREAS 
EXPECTED TO SEE AN ADDITIONAL 3-5 INCHES BY WED NGT. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES SE ACROSS THE AREA THU THROUGH EARLY SAT. MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS SKIRT THE AREA FRI IN NW FLOW ALOFT. WARM AIR ADVECTION GETS 
GOING SAT WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW UNDERWAY. REMAINDER OF FORECAST WITH 
LOW CONFIDENCE. COUNTING ON BEST CHANCE OF RAIN ON SUNDAY WITH COLD 
FRONTAL PASSAGE. FRONT SHOULD STALL SE OF AREA ON MONDAY. STRONG 
SHORT WAVE POSSIBLE FROM THE W ON MONDAY AND COULD BRING QUICK 
RETURN OF PCPN ALONG SURFACE WAVE INTO TN VLY. TEMPS BELOW NORMAL 
UNTIL BRIEFLY PRIOR TO WEEKEND FRONT.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EST MON JAN 10 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE AREA NEAR THE MOUTH OF THE MS RIVER...WITH AN INVERTED 
TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH OF IT INTO MIDDLE TN. AREA RADARS REVEAL AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF SNOW MOVING NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH SOME CONVECTIVE SNOWFALL OBSERVED EARLIER 
ACROSS NORTHERN AL. NAM MODEL INDICATES SOME INSTABILITY OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN EARLY THIS MORNING...AND THEN MOVES IT EAST INTO THE 
CAROLINAS AFTER SUNRISE. THIS INSTABILITY WILL LIKELY ENHANCE SNOW 
TOTALS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...SO WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION 8 TO 12 INCHES IN THESE AREAS (INCLUDING THE MOUNTAINS). 
OTHERWISE...WILL MAINTAIN THE CURRENT ADVISORY/WARNING CONFIGURATION 
SINCE MODELS AGREE THAT PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL DECREASE QUICKLY TO THE 
NORTH OF THE WARNING AREAS. MODEL SOUNDINGS NOW INDICATE A COOLER 
VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILE FOR TODAY...BUT STILL INDICATE SOME 850 MB 
WARMING BY THE AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT. ALSO...THE PRECIP INITIATION 
REGION APPEARS TO LOWER BELOW -5 CELSIUS...SO AM WORRIED THAT SNOW 
MAY CHANGE TO RAIN TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...IT APPEARS THAT SNOW MAY 
MIX WITH SLEET THIS AFTERNOON...AND FREEZING RAIN BY TONIGHT. WITH 
THIS IN MIND...WILL EXTEND THE ADVISORIES/WARNINGS FOR THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TONIGHT...AND WILL ISSUE AN 
ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VA FOR TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL COMPROMISE WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS CONTINUE 
TO DEPICT A TRANSITION TO UPSLOPE EVENT THROUGH MUCH OF THE BALANCE 
OF THE WORK WEEK AS UPPER LOW SLOWLY MIGRATES THROUGH THE LOWER 
GREAT LAKES. CONTINUED DRY PERIOD FOR LATE WORK WEEK INTO EARLY 
WEEKEND AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO DEPICT VERY 
DIVERSE SOLUTIONS FOR NEXT WEEKEND...THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST. FOR TEMPS... 
CONTINUED THE TREND OF GENERALLY UNDERCUTTING GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 092033
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EST SUN JAN 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...09/12Z MODELS SEEM TO
HAVE TRENDED A BIT COLDER...ESPECIALLY VIEWING NAM SOUNDINGS. THE
AMOUNT OF WARMING IN THE LOW LEVELS IS LESS...AND COULD BE RATHER
INSIGNIFICANT. A MORE INTERESTING FEATURE...WHICH COULD ACTUALLY
HINDER SNOW AMOUNTS...IS THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME E-SE DOWNSLOPE FLOW
INTO THE CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY COUNTIES. THUS...I KEPT SOME
WORDING AS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN OR SLEET MIXING IN THE
AFTERNOON. I OPTED TO UPGRADE THE WATCH AREA FOR ROANE...LOUDON...
BLOUNT AND SEVIER COUNTIES TO A WARNING...AND REST OF THE WATCH
AREAS NORTH OF I-40 TO A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY...WHERE MODEL QPF
IS MUCH LESS. 

PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WERE GENERALLY ON TRACK...WITH A FEW
ADJUSTMENTS. I KEPT POPS RATHER HIGH FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY
MORNING FOR SW VA AND PARTS OF NE TN...AS UPPER LOW APPROACHES FROM
THE NW. THIS COULD PRODUCE ADVISORY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR SW VA
AND NE TN...BUT AFTER MONDAY NIGHT AND THIS FIRST SYSTEM HAS PASSED
THE REGION. LATER SHIFTS CAN LOOK INTO THIS A BIT MORE.

OTHERWISE...MAIN MOS ADJUSTMENT WAS TO UNDERCUT MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT
GIVEN THE DRY DEW POINT TEMPS...AND SOME EVAPORATIVE COOLING WHICH
SHOULD OCCUR AS PRECIPITATION DEVELOPS LATE TONIGHT. SNOW COVER
MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WOULD ALSO FAVOR COOLER THAN MOS FOR HIGHS
EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LOW SHIFTS SLOWLY 
EAST FROM THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT TO OFF THE NEW ENGLAND 
COAST BY 00Z THU WITH TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPPING IN BEHIND 
THE DEPARTING LOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. LEFT THIS PERIOD OF 
THE FORECAST BASICALLY UNCHANGED AS THIS WILL BE A PERIOD OF MAINLY 
OROGRAPHIC SNOWFALL IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME THAT FAVORS THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
THE FAR EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. MAINTAINED THE DRY FORECAST FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AS CHILLY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. MODEL SOLUTIONS 
DIVERGE BY THE WEEKEND BUT GENERALLY AGREE THAT AN UPPER TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA WITH 
IMPACT MAINLY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. KEPT SLIGHT AND LOW 
CHANCE POPS GOING DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME RANGE. 
TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE WARM ENOUGH DURING THIS PERIOD TO KEEP SOME 
SNOW OUT OF THE FORECAST. ONCE AGAIN UNDERCUT MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE 
DURING THE LONG TERM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION 
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1004 AM EST SUN JAN 9 2011

.DISCUSSION...STARTING OUT COLD UNDER SUNNY SKIES THIS MORNING WITH
CLOUDS SPREADING QUICKLY NE AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER SE TX. AFTER A CHILLY START IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TO 
TEENS...HOURLY TEMPS AND DEW POINTS ARE RUNNING QUITE CLOSE TO 
FORECAST GRIDS. THUS...FORECAST FOR TODAY LOOKS ON TRACK. 

I WILL UPDATE OUR WSW PRODUCT BY 11 TO 1130 AM EST...AFTER VIEWING 
SOME 12Z MODEL DATA. 09/06Z MODEL RUNS HINT AT JUST ENOUGH LOW LEVEL 
WARMING TO LET RAIN AND/OR SLEET MIX WITH THE SNOW OVER PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. ALSO...ENSEMBLES SHOW 0.15 INCH LIQUID QPF LINE 
PUSHING JUST FAR ENOUGH NORTH TO AFFECT AREAS NORTH OF I-40...SO 
BEST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS STILL APPEAR TO BE SOUTH OF I-40. SW VA 
WOULD APPEAR TO GET MUCH LESS MOISTURE...AND SHOULD BE MORE AFFECTED 
BY THE UPPER LOW LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. 

LEANING TOWARD JUST A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR E TN AREAS NORTH 
OF I-40 WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE...AND OF COURSE THE WARNING AREAS 
WOULD REMAIN UNCHANGED.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE AREA CENTERED 
OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS 
EXTENDING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER SOUTH TEXAS WILL BRING INCREASING HIGH CLOUDINESS OVER THE TAF 
SITES TODAY...WITH CEILINGS GRADUALLY LOWERING THROUGHOUT THE TAF 
PERIOD. HOWEVER...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED UNTIL 
LATER TONIGHT WHEN SOME MVFR VISIBILITIES DUE TO SNOW SHOULD DEVELOP.

794 
FXUS64 KMRX 090801 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED DEFINITION OF SHORT TERM
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST SUN JAN 9 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE AREA CENTERED OVER THE UPPER 
MS RIVER VALLEY... WITH ITS VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS EXTENDING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER 
SOUTH TEXAS IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST TODAY ACROSS THE GULF COASTAL 
REGION...AND WILL BRING INCREASING HIGH CLOUDINESS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGHOUT THE DAY. AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
EXTENDING NORTH OF THE LOW SHOULD HELP TO INCREASE PRECIP OVER THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY IN THE FORM OF SNOW LATER TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
LATEST RUNS OF BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS ARE NOW WARMER WITH THE 
VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILE OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR MONDAY...WITH A 
WARMER AND POTENTIALLY ABOVE FREEZING 850 MB LAYER SPREADING FURTHER 
NORTHWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. BOTH MODELS INDICATE THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SNOW MIXING WITH SLEET ON MONDAY...WITH THE WARMER 
GFS MODEL EVEN INDICATING THE POSSIBILITY OF A CHANGEOVER TO RAIN BY 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...WILL PLAN TO KEEP THE WINTER STORM WATCH IN 
EFFECT OVER CENTRAL EAST TN AND NORTHEAST TN (NO UPGRADE 
YET)...WHERE THERE STILL REMAINS SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE AMOUNT OF 
SNOW THAT WILL BE ABLE TO ACCUMULATE DUE TO WARMING CONCERNS AND THE 
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE THAT ULTIMATELY MAKES IT THIS FAR NORTH. 
HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO UPGRADE THE WATCH TO A WARNING ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST NC...AND THE SMOKIES WHERE SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS APPEAR TO BE MORE PROBABLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
BECOMES SITUATED ON SOUTHERN PERIPHERY OF UPPER LOW AS IT MIGRATES 
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES EARLY IN THE LONG TERM. THIS WILL KEEP AREA 
SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHERN TIER. UPPER LOW 
DEPARTS AND WEAK UPPER RIDGING BUILDS IN BY LATE WORK WEEK RESULTING 
IN GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS. POOR AGREEMENT AMONG MEDIUM-RANGE 
MODELS AND WIDE SPREAD AMONG ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PRECLUDE MUCH 
CONFIDENCE IN SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES LATE IN THE LONG TERM. THUS DID 
NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST FOR 
THAT TIME FRAME. FOR TEMPS...CONTINUED TO UNDERCUT MAV/MEX
GUIDANCE SLIGHTLY THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   35  27  34  30  40 /   0  90 100  40  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     30  24  34  29  38 /   0  70  90  60  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN             30  24  34  29  39 /   0  70  90  60  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    25  19  35  27  38 /   0  40  80  70  40 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 PM EST MONDAY 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT EST /11 PM CST/ TONIGHT TO 7 
     PM EST /6 PM CST/ MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     EAST POLK...HAMILTON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST 
     MONROE...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST MONROE...WEST POLK.

900 PM EST SAT JAN 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...CLOUD COVER HAS DECREASED SIGNIFICANTLY THE LAST FEW

FLURRIES ACROSS THE REGION. KEEPING SNOW SHOWER WORDING UNTIL
MIDNIGHT HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF VIRGINIA AND EAST TN. TEMPERATURES
HAVE DROPPED FASTER THAN INDICATED IN THE GRIDS AND WILL LOWER
MINIMUM TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE BOARD AROUND 3 DEGREES. WINDS HAVE
DECREASED AS WELL SO WIND CHILL READINGS JUST ABOVE ADVISORY
CRITERIA. REISSUE OF WINTER STORM WATCH WITH NO CHANGES TO CURRENT
WATCH. UPDATE OUT SOON.

907 
FXUS64 KMRX 082039
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 PM EST SAT JAN 8 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...PRECIPITATION WINDING DOWN
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN THIS AFTERNOON...SO OPTED TO LET ADVISORIES
AND WARNINGS EXPIRE AT 4 PM EST. DECREASING CLOUDS IN GENERAL
OVERNIGHT AND CHILLY. WIND CHILL VALUES MAY DIP JUST BELOW -5
DEGREES OVER HIGHEST TERRAIN OF NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA...BUT JUST A
FEW PIXELS. SO...WITH SO MUCH WINTER WEATHER ONGOING AND OUTLOOKED 
I CHOSE NOT TO ISSUE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY...FOR SUCH A MARGINALLY
MET EVENT. 

OTHERWISE...MODELS ARE FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH GULF COAST SYSTEM
...SO JUST A FEW ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE TO GRIDS. I DID SPREAD THE
WATCH NORTH TO INCLUDE ALL OF E TN...WITH A LATER START AND END
TIME. SNOW AMOUNTS IN GRIDS AND WSW SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS FORECAST.
MOS TEMPS AND POPS WERE CLOSE FOR ALL 4 PERIODS AND CLOSELY
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...INITIAL SHORT WAVE
WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE CENTER WILL BE MOVING
NORTHEAST ALONG THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC COAST MONDAY NIGHT.
CONTINUED TREND OF PUSHING HIGHER POPS FOR SNOW NORTH ACROSS THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS DEEPER MOISTURE/LIFT SHIFTS
NORTHEAST TOWARD THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES. AT THE SAME
TIME...SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL BE MOVING RAPIDLY EAST INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY AND MODELS SHOW A SECONDARY AREA OF LOW PRESSURE
STRENGTHENING ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE BY 12Z TUESDAY IN RESPONSE.
THIS PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS ONLY SLOWLY EAST DURING THE DAY SO HELD
ONTO MEDIUM CHANCE THROUGH LIKELY POPS FOR SNOW FROM SOUTH TO
NORTH. TRENDED THE EVENT INTO A NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC SNOW
MACHINE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHICH FAVORS THE
MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF EAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. MAINTAINED THE DRY PERIOD FOR
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BUT HAD TO USE SOME SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS
FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM MAY BRING MAINLY RAIN
SHOWERS TO THE AREA BUT HAD TO USE SOME SNOW SHOWER WORDING DUE TO
UNCERTAINTY WITH TEMPERATURE PROFILE SO FAR OUT IN THE FORECAST
PERIOD. UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES ALL THE WAY THROUGH
SATURDAY.


&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 AM EST SAT JAN 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...
BANDS OF SNOW SHOWERS ORIENTED EAST TO WEST ACROSS THE CENTRAL PARTS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA HAVE BEEN PRODUCING A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION. 
THESE BANDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WHICH THE 
NAM12 KM MODEL SHOWS QUITE WELL...AND THIS FORCING SHOULD BE SOUTH 
OF THE AREA (OR WEAKEN) BY EARLY AFTERNOON. EXPECT SOME UPSLOPE SNOW 
SHOWERS TO CONTINUE IN THE WARNING AREAS...AS NAM12 SHOWS SOME 
INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON WITH POSITIVE CAPES OF 30 TO 60 J/KG... 
AND ABOUT 25 KNOTS OF W-NW LOW LEVEL FLOW. 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS 
SHOW A COLD TEMPERATURE PROFILE...WITH SATURATED COLUMN PLENTY COLD 
ENOUGH AT THE TOP FOR GOOD SNOW GROWTH. 

ALL THIS INDICATES CURRENT FORECAST IS ON TRACK...BUT WILL FRESHEN 
AND UPDATE GRIDS BEFORE NOON...AND ALSO END THE WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORIES AT THAT TIME.

I DO SEE THE NEED FOR A WIND CHILL ADVISORY WITH THE AFTERNOON 
PACKAGE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT. ALSO...MAIN FOCUS WILL BE 
ON SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY SYSTEM...STAY TUNED! 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

525 AM EST SAT JAN 8 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED AREAS OF LIGHT SNOW EXTENDING 
UPSTREAM INTO THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT 
SNOW ACTIVITY WILL LINGER FOR SEVERAL MORE HOURS THIS MORNING BEFORE 
GRADUALLY ENDING. THUS...HAVE DECIDED TO EXTEND THE ADVISORIES UNTIL 
NOON TODAY TO BETTER MATCH THE ADVISORIES FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES. 
WILL PLAN TO LEAVE THE CENTRAL AREAS OF THE GREAT TN VALLEY OUT OF 
AN ADVISORY...SINCE CALLS TO SEVERAL OF THESE COUNTIES REVEALED ONLY 
A DUSTING OF SNOW WITH NO TRAVEL PROBLEMS. THINK THAT ANY ADDITIONAL 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THESE AREAS THIS MORNING SHOULD BE AROUND AN INCH 
OR LESS.

712 
FXUS64 KMRX 080745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST SAT JAN 8 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH AN ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE AREA CENTERED OVER THE 
HIGH PLAINS. A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE MID ATLANTIC STATES 
TODAY...AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SOME SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS 
MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS THE UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THUS...WILL PLAN 
TO KEEP THE ADVISORIES/WARNINGS IN EFFECT UNTIL THEY ARE SCHEDULED 
TO EXPIRE. THIS UPPER LOW WILL ALSO CREATE BREEZY WESTERLY WINDS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH SOME BITTER WIND CHILL VALUES 
BELOW ZERO POSSIBLE IN THE NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS LATER TONIGHT. IN 
FACT...WIND CHILL VALUES MAY DROP BELOW THE ADVISORY CRITERIA OF -5 
LATE TONIGHT...BUT WILL LET DAY SHIFT DECIDE IF AN ADVISORY WILL BE 
NEEDED SINCE THESE VALUES MAY BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME SLIGHT 
DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE LONG TERM 
CONTINUES TO BE POTENTIAL SIGNIFICANT WINTER SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES 
FROM THE SOUTHWEST SUNDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUES INTO MONDAY. MODELS IN 
RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO TIMING...BUT LESS SO WITH 
QPF WHICH IS CRUCIAL FOR DETERMINING POTENTIAL SNOW AMOUNTS. MODEL 
CONSENSUS IS THAT SOUTHERN TIER WILL RECEIVE GREATEST QPF WITH MODEL 
AVERAGE QPF IN THE 0.5 TO 0.75 INCH RANGE. WITH THE EXPECTATION THAT 
VIRTUALLY ALL OF THIS PRECIP WILL OCCUR AS SNOW...WILL ISSUE WINTER 
STORM WATCH FOR OUR SOUTHERN TIER AND SMOKY MOUNTAIN ZONES.

THIS SYSTEM WRAPS UP BY LATE MONDAY WITH WIDESPREAD SYNOPTIC SNOW 
TAPERING TO SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH MID WORK WEEK AS UPPER LEVEL LOW 
MIGRATES THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES REGION. KEPT LATE WORK WEEK DRY AS 
WEAK UPPER RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN CONUS. FOR TEMPS... 
TENDED TO UNDERCUT MEX GUIDANCE THROUGH MIDWEEK SINCE MOST ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS DEPICT LOWER HEIGHTS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
THAN OPERATIONAL GFS.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1024 PM EST FRI JAN 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT HAS MOVED EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS TAKING
THE STEADY PRECIPITATION WITH IT AND UPPER FLOW HAS BECOME
NORTHWEST WITH SNOW SHOWERS NOW MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. COLDER AIR STILL LAGGING BEHIND THE FRONT AND
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 30S TO NEAR 40 SOUTH AND LOWER 30S AND
COLDER NORTHEAST AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. HAVE DROPPED SEVERAL MORE COUNTIES FROM ADVISORY
BUT LEFT NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS
WHERE MORE SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY IS LIKELY UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING.
ONLY EXPECTING AROUND ONE TO POSSIBLY TWO INCHES AT THE HIGHEST
ELEVATIONS IN ADVISORY AREAS TONIGHT. IN THE WARNING AREAS SNOWFALL
WILL BE 2 INCHES OR MORE AS NW FLOW KICKS IN...THEN DECREASING
SATURDAY. DID NOT ADJUST LOWS AS COLD AIR ADVECTION BEGINNING TO
LOWER TEMPERATURES BY MID EVENING. WINDS HAVE DECREASED A LITTLE AS
PRESSURE GRADIENT HAS RELAXED SOME FROM BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE
EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS AND ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TO HIGH PRESSURE
IN THE PLAINS. SOME BREAKS OCCURRED IN THE CLOUD DECK BUT ARE NOW
FILLING IN AGAIN AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATES AROUND LARGE UPPER
LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     FOLLOWING ZONES: CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...EAST POLK...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST 
     GREENE...SCOTT TN...SULLIVAN...WASHINGTON TN.

.AVIATION...LOW PRESSURE LIES JUST TO THE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS
AND COLD AIR MASS MOVING INTO EAST TN THIS EVENING. WINDS WILL BE
STRONG AT CHA ANOTHER HOUR AND AT TYS THE NEXT FEW HOURS AS HIGHER
PRESSURE FILTERS IN. HIGHER CEILINGS AT CHA AND TYS WILL SLOWLY
DROP AS LOW CLOUDS MOVE IN AND REACH MVFR CONDITIONS BY ABOUT 06Z.
CHA MAY NOT SEE MUCH PRECIPITATION BUT SCATTERED RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS
WILL CONTINUE AT TYS THROUGH THE EVENING. TRI WILL SEE VSBY
INCREASE AS THE SNOW SHOWERS BECOME LIGHTER...BUT CEILINGS WILL
REMAIN AT THE LOW END OF IFR FLIGHT. AS PRECIPITATION ENDS SATURDAY
MORNING AT TRI CEILINGS WILL SLOWLY RISE TO VFR BY MID AFTERNOON
AND AROUND 16-18Z AT TYS AND CHA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
615 PM EST FRI JAN 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...WARMING IN THE VALLEY DUE TO MIXING HAS MELTED THE 
SNOW AND CHANGED IT TO RAIN OR RAIN AND SNOW FROM AROUND I-40 SOUTH. 
EVEN WITH COLD AIR MOVING INTO THE REGION TONIGHT AND CHANGING BACK 
TO SNOW PRECIPITATION EXPECTED TO TAPER OFF THIS EVENING AND 
ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF FORMER 
ADVISORY AREA. STILL EXPECT SNOW SHOWERS BUT GENERALLY LESS THAN AN 
INCH IN MOST OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY. NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NORTHERN 
VALLEY AREAS COLDER AND EXPECT A LITTLE MORE ACCUMULATION AND MORE 
PROBLEMS ON ROADWAYS LATER THIS EVENING OR AFTER MIDNIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 071951
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EST FRI JAN 7 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE TEMPS BARELY BELOW
FREEZING OVER SWRN VA TO AS WARM AS LOWER 50S TODAY AT CHA...HAVE
MELTED AWAY MUCH OF WHAT SNOW HAS FALLEN...WITH RAIN OVER SE TN
INTO SRN MOST COUNTIES OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY...WHERE SMALL WARM AIR
INTRUSION HAS BEEN NOTED. COLD AIR ADVECTION KICKS IN EARLY THIS
EVENING IN THE 925 TO 850 MB LAYER...AND ANOTHER STRONG VORT MAX IS
POISED TO SWEEP SE ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT. THUS...I HAVE NOT
GIVEN UP ON SOME ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL INTO SATURDAY.

OPTED TO CONTINUE OUR WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AND WARNING AREAS AS
PREVIOUSLY DEFINED...WITH AROUND 2 INCHES OR SO CHOPPED OFF OF THE
TOTAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS. SYNOPTIC FORCING GIVES WAY TO UPSLOPE SNOW
SHOWERS ON SATURDAY...WITH SOME MINIMAL INSTABILITY SUGGESTED...SO
A LIGHT ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION COULD PUSH TOTALS UP TO LOWER END
OF WARNING CRITERIA IN THOSE AREAS BY 21Z SATURDAY.

OTHERWISE...MOS MINS WERE AROUND 5 TO 7 DEGREES TOO COOL LAST
NIGHT...BUT MOS DOES NOT LOOK AS FAR OFF FOR TONIGHT...ALTHO I DID
TREND A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE COOLER GFS MINS. CAN'T SEE TEMPS
WARMING TOO MUCH ON SATURDAY...SO I FAVORED THE COOLER GFS MAXES. 
QUITE CHILLY SATURDAY NIGHT AND A WIND CHILL ADVISORY MIGHT BE
REQUIRED FOR THE MOUNTAIN ZONES. DRY AND BEST DAY WILL BE SUNDAY 
BUT CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH AHEAD OF THE POTENT GULF
COAST LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SOUTHWESTERN U.S. UPPER 
LOW OPENS UP WHILE SWINGING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER TROF WILL BE ON THE MOVE FROM THE WESTERN 
GULF OF MEXICO TO THE SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC COAST BY 00Z TUESDAY. 
RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE WILL BE LIFTED NORTH AND EAST OF THE LOW 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND WITH SUFFICIENTLY COLD AIR IN 
PLACE...PRECIPITATION WILL FALL AS SNOW INITIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN ACROSS 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY. PROBABILITY OF SNOW 
WILL REMAIN FAIRLY HIGH INTO TUESDAY AS ANOTHER SHORT WAVE SHIFTS 
EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC REGION. EXACT 
SYSTEM TRACK AND AVAILABILITY TO BETTER LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE 
STILL IN QUESTION AT THIS TIME. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THAT SEVERAL 
INCHES OF SNOW ARE POSSIBLE...WITH HIGHER ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS DUE TO BETTER PROXIMITY TO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. SURFACE 
LOW AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE. CONTINUED WITH IDEA OF LOWER POPS WHICH 
FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES ON WEDNESDAY AS LONG WAVE TROF 
STRENGTHENS ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. OROGRAPHIC COLD AIR 
ADVECTION SNOWS SHOULD WRAP UP BY THURSDAY AND RIDGING BUILDS EAST 
ALLOWING FOR (HOPEFULLY) TWO PRECIPITATION FREE DAYS TO END THE WORK 
WEEK. MEX MOS TEMPERATURES WERE WAY TOO WARM SO UNDERCUT ACROSS THE 
BOARD IN THIS COLD REGIME.

.AVIATION...SHORT WAVE TROF PRODUCING SCT TO NUMEROUS SNOW SHOWERS

WHILE CHA ONLY HAS A BROKEN AC DECK. THIS GENERAL TREND SHOULD
CONTINUE THROUGH ABOUT 00Z SATURDAY. AFTER THIS...CONDITIONS WILL
LIKELY DETERIORATE TO MVFR FLIGHT AT CHA AND TYS DUE TO CEILING.
TRI WILL SEE VSBY INCREASE AS THE SNOW SHOWERS BECOME LIGHTER...BUT
CEILINGS WILL REMAIN AROUND THE LOW END OF IFR FLIGHT. IT SHOULD BE
A LITTLE BETTER DAY SATURDAY BUT IT MAY TAKE SEVERAL HOURS FOR THE
LOWER CEILINGS TO MIX OUT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
918 AM EST FRI JAN 7 2011

.DISCUSSION...LIGHT PRECIPITATION (PCPN) FALLING GENERALLY ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...IN THE FORM OF SNOW EXCEPT 
FOR EXTREME SRN AREAS. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE ENOUGH WARMING OVER 
THOSE AREAS TO KEEP A MIX WITH RAIN A POSSIBILITY...EVEN AS FAR 
NORTH AS TYS. ACTUAL 12Z SOUNDINGS FROM OHX AND RNK SUPPORT SNOW 
WITH TOP OF SATURATED COLUMN COLD ENOUGH FOR GOOD SNOW GROWTH (-15 
DEGS C OR COLDER). RUC MODEL PICKS UP ANOTHER VORT MAX TO BE 
APPROACHING FROM THE NW LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND NAM/GFS ALSO 
INDICATE SOME HEAVIER QPF DEVELOPING INTO THE EVENING HOURS.

THUS...CURRENT ADVISORY/WARNING SCENARIO LOOKS ON TRACK. SURFACE 
TEMPS STAYING ABOVE FREEZING TODAY...PLUS A MIX WITH RAIN...WHICH 
SHOULD KEEP SNOW ACCUMULATIONS BELOW WARNING CRITERIA IN OUR 
ADVISORY AREAS. WILL KEEP SRN MOST COUNTIES OF E TN OUT OF THE 
ADVISORY FOR NOW. NOT A LOT OF SNOW REPORTS IN JUST YET...BUT LOOKS 
LIKE AROUND AN INCH OR SO OF NEW SNOW THUS FAR. 

PLAN TO TWEAK HOURLY TEMPS AND MAX TEMPS IF NEEDED...WITH UPDATED 
PRODUCTS BY OR BEFORE 11 AM EST.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS AND SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH AN AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS LOW IS PROGGED TO 
TRACK ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MILD TEMPS IN THE 
40S SOUTH OF IT AND TEMPS REMAINING IN THE 30S NORTH OF IT. THUS... 
IT APPEARS THAT SNOW WILL CONTINUE AT KTRI...WITH A RAIN/SNOW 
MIXTURE AT KTYS...AND MOSTLY RAIN AT KCHA. CEILINGS/VISIBILITIES 
SHOULD GRADUALLY LOWER INTO THE MVFR RANGES BY LATE MORNING AND INTO 
THE AFTERNOON...AS PRECIP GRADUALLY INTENSIFIES WITH THE PASSAGE OF 
THE LOW. EXPECT SOME TEMPORARY IFR CONDITIONS TO BE POSSIBLE WITH 
THE HEAVIER PRECIP DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON HOURS.

FXUS64 KMRX 070752
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 AM EST FRI JAN 7 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS AND THE 
SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY. AREA RADARS CURRENTLY REVEAL SOME PATCHY VERY LIGHT 
SNOW (OR FLURRIES) OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT PRECIP INTENSITY 
WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE AS THE DAY PROGRESSES. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT THIS SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
BY LATE MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS...WITH MILD TEMPS IN THE 
40S SOUTH OF IT AND TEMPS REMAINING IN THE 30S NORTH OF IT. THUS... 
IT APPEARS THAT LIGHT SNOW WILL CHANGE TO RAIN ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TN...WITH A SNOW/RAIN MIX OVER CENTRAL EAST TN (BUT GENERALLY SOUTH 
OF A CROSSVILLE TO KNOXVILLE TO SEVIERVILLE LINE). NAM MODEL REVEALS 
THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER CENTRAL EAST TN 
TODAY...WHICH COULD HELP TO ENHANCE PRECIP AMOUNTS. BUT WITH TEMPS 
POSSIBLY RISING INTO THE UPPER 30S OVER CENTRAL EAST TN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON...WILL PLAN TO KEEP THE CURRENT SNOW FORECAST OF 2 TO 5 
INCHES UNCHANGED. WITH A CHANGEOVER TO RAIN LOOKING MORE LIKELY OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN...WILL PLAN TO MENTION ONLY 1 TO 3 INCHES OF SNOW ALONG 
THE SOUTHERN END OF THE CURRENT ADVISORY. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY AND SINK SOUTHWARD 
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA BY TONIGHT...WHICH WILL CAUSE THE SNOW 
ACTIVITY TO BECOME MORE SHOWERY (SCATTERED) AND CONCENTRATED MORE 
TOWARDS THE UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS WITH THE 
EXTENSIVE PRECIP AND CLOUD COVER EXPECTED.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS IN REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM. EVENT WINDS DOWN ON 
SATURDAY BUT IS FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM BY 
EARLY MONDAY. THE INTENSITY OF THIS SYSTEM IS STILL SOMEWHAT 
UNCERTAIN. MODELS AND MOST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS GENERALLY KEEP BULK OF 
MOISTURE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT THIS IS 
SYNOPTICALLY QUITE SIMILAR TO THE EVENT OF THIS PAST WEDNESDAY. 
MODELS THEN INDICATE UPPER LOW WILL MEANDER THROUGH THE LOWER GREAT 
LAKES WITH ITS PROXIMITY KEEPING THINGS POTENTIALLY UNSETTLED 
THROUGH MID WORK WEEK. TENDED TO BE A LITTLE PESSIMISTIC WITH TEMPS 
AS IT APPEARS THEY WILL REMAIN WELL BELOW CLIMO IN NEGATIVE HEIGHT 
ANOMALY REGIME.

1255 AM EST FRI JAN 7 2011

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
NORTHERN TN BORDER...WITH AREA RADARS REVEALING SOME SCATTERED VERY 
LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION TODAY...AND IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP A SURFACE LOW OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY BY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS SURFACE LOW IS EXPECTED TO 
TRACK ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MILD TEMPS IN THE 
40S SOUTH OF IT AND TEMPS IN THE 30S NORTH OF IT. THUS...IT APPEARS 
THAT SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE LATER TODAY AT KTRI AND KTYS...WITH 
MOSTLY RAIN AT KCHA. CEILINGS/VISIBILITIES SHOULD GRADUALLY LOWER 
INTO THE MVFR RANGES BY LATE MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON...WITH SOME 
IFR CONDITIONS EXPECTED AT KTRI AND KTYS WITH THE HEAVIER SNOW IN 
THE AFTERNOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 070200 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST THU JAN 6 2011

.DISCUSSION...
A VORT MAX SWINGING ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING IS PRODUCING SOME
LIGHT SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. BEHIND THIS VORT
MAX...THERE IS SOME DRYING ALOFT AS SEEN IN IR SATELLITE CLOUD TOP
TEMPS...SO THERE MAY BE A LULL IN PRECIP AFTER THIS FIRST ROUND.
DEEPER MOISTURE REACHES THE AREA TOWARD 09Z WITH NEAR SATURATION
THROUGH THE ENTIRE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE SEEN IN MODEL SOUNDINGS. SO
THE CURRENT FORECAST OF CHANCE POPS FOLLOWED BY LIKELY POPS LATE
TONIGHT LOOKS GOOD...SO NO UPDATE IS PLANNED AT THIS TIME.
FORECAST PRECIP AMOUNTS APPEAR REASONABLE...AND THE
ADVISORY/WARNING AREAS WILL NOT BE CHANGED.

&&
