102 
FXUS64 KMRX 062011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST THU JAN 6 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CLOUDS FILLING BACK IN
RATHER QUICKLY THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE 
(SEEN ON SATELLITE PICS ROTATING SE INTO SE MO AND SRN IL). MODELS
WERE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON SNOW DEVELOPING TOWARD MIDNIGHT AS THIS
FEATURE SWEEPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY. NAM MODEL SHOWED A
BREAK FOR EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT GFS MORE CONTINUOUS WITH LIGHT
SNOW OR SNOW SHOWERS INTO SATURDAY. SENSIBLE FORECAST IS FOR A
POTENTIAL BRIEF BREAK...THEN ANOTHER SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX SHOULD DROP
ACROSS THE REGION. OPTED TO END THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY BY
SATURDAY MORNING...AS SATURDAY LOOKS LIKE A SNOW SHOWER UPSLOPE
EVENT. THIS COULD KEEP ACCUMULATING SNOWS THROUGH SATURDAY
AFTERNOON FOR THE WARNING AREAS...SO CARRIED WARNING OUT TO 21Z
SATURDAY.

STAYED CLOSE TO OR JUST BELOW THE COOLER MAX TEMPS EACH DAY...
WITH MOS MINS CLOSE AND REASONABLE. FOR POPS...CHOSE TO GO WITH
THE HIGHEST POPS OR A LITTLE ABOVE IN THE ADVISORY AND WARNING
AREAS. WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT DECIDE IF EXTREME SRN VALLEY
COUNTIES OF E TN NEED TO BE ADDED TO THE ADVISORY.

OTHERWISE...THANKS TO ALL NWS OFFICES FOR CHAT/COORDINATION...
AND TO OHX FOR BACKING US UP OVERNIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...ACTIVE FORECAST 
PERIOD WITH MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF SOUTHERN PLAINS 
SHORT WAVE TROF MAKING PROGRESS SUNDAY INTO MONDAY ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
WITH THIS SYSTEM HUGS THE GULF COAST WITH AN INVERTED TROF EXTENDING 
BACK ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. THE STAGE IS SET FOR MORE SNOW AS DEEP 
MOISTURE COMPLIMENTS OF THE PACIFIC OCEAN AND THE GULF OF MEXICO 
WILL BE LIFTED ACROSS THE FRIGID SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THIS 
WAVE ROUNDS THE CORNER AND HEADS UP THE EAST COAST WITH THE INVERTED 
SURFACE TROF REMAINING ANCHORED BACK TO THE WEST ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS SYSTEM HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE SEVERAL INCHES OF 
SNOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND SNOWFALL MAY CONTINUE WELL INTO 
TUESDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM FOLLOWS THE INITIAL MID LATITUDE 
CYCLONE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. WILL CONTINUE TO WATCH MODEL DEPICTION 
OF THESE SYSTEMS DURING THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS TO BETTER RESOLVE 
QUESTIONS ABOUT SYSTEM STRENGTH...MOISTURE DEPTH AND STORM TRACK BUT 
IT APPEARS THAT THE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT PERIOD COULD 
BE RATHER SIGNIFICANT IN TERMS OF ACCUMULATING SNOW. HELD ONTO A 
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL REGIME THROUGH WEDNESDAY WHICH FAVORS THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES AS OROGRAPHICS BECOME THE MAIN SOURCE OF 
LIFT AT THIS TIME. WAS ABLE TO KEEP THURSDAY DRY AT THIS POINT BUT 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE NOT TOO HIGH THIS FAR OUT IN THE PERIOD. TRENDED 
TEMPS A LITTLE BELOW NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE WITH PREDOMINANT NORTHWEST 
FLOW AND EXPECTED SNOW COVER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NASHVILLE TN
343 AM EST THU JAN 6 2011

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDINESS AND SNOW SHOWERS STILL IN PLACE ACROSS EASTERN
PORTIONS OF THE CWA THIS MORNING. SHOULD SEE PARTIAL CLEARING WITH
THE PRECIP ENDING BEFORE MIDDAY. TEMPS SHOULD THEN WARM UP TO JUST
BELOW SEASONAL LEVELS FOR HIGHS. WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY THROUGH 7 AM FOR THE FAR EASTERN REACHES OF THE CWA.

UPPER IMPULSE OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST WILL RACE SOUTHEASTWARD AND 
BRING A GOOD CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS TO THE AREA TONIGHT. LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE BUT IT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A 
SIGNIFICANT EVENT. THE DISTURBANCE WILL USHER IN COLDER AIR FOR THE 
NEXT FEW DAYS AS LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS LINGER THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. 

IN THE EXT FCST...MODELS CONSISTENT WITH THE TRACKING OF A SFC LOW 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF. UPPER ENERGY ALSO SLATED TO GET INVOLVED 
AS A DEEP NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH PROVIDES ADDITIONAL SUPPORT. 
CURRENT FCST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK WITH SNOW CHANCES GENERALLY IN 
THE CHC CATEGORY. SYSTEM WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED AS THE DGEX...EURO 
AND GFS SOLUTIONS ARE ALL ON BOARD WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR A 
SIGNIFICANT WINTER WEATHER EVENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE EVENT IS 
STILL SEVERAL DAYS OFF SO FOR NOW...WILL JUST CONTINUE WITH THE 
CHANCES FOR SNOW. 

FOR THE EXT TEMPS...BELOW NORMAL VALUES TO PREVAIL...PARTICULARLY 
WITH THE MAX TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
857 PM EST WED JAN 5 2011

.DISCUSSION...
ISENTROPIC LIFT AND DIVERGENCE IN A JET ENTRANCE REGION HAVE MOVED
EASTWARD...BRINGING AND END TO MOST OF THE PRECIP IN OUR AREA.
UPSTREAM...ANOTHER VORT MAX NEAR THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY IS
APPROACHING THE AREA...AND THIS WILL KEEP SOME SCATTERED TO
ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE AREA THROUGH MIDNIGHT. OVERCAST
CLOUDS THROUGH THE NIGHT SHOULD MEAN TEMPERATURES WILL NOT DROP TOO
MUCH FROM CURRENT VALUES IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S...SO SOME
MELTING OF SNOW COVER IN THE VALLEY WILL OCCUR AND PRIMARY ROADS
SHOULD NOT GET TOO ICY.

ONLY MINOR TWEAKS WILL BE NEEDED TO THE CURRENT FORECAST. THE
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS WILL BE MAINTAINED FOR
ONGOING SNOWFALL WITH A TOTAL OF 1-3 INCHES OVERNIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 PM EST WED JAN 5 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...PRECIPITATION CONTINUES TO 
SPREAD EAST FROM MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL THIS AFTERNOON...IN THE FORM 
OF MAINLY LIGHT RAIN ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC...WITH SOME SLEET NOTED 
AT TYS RECENTLY. EXPECT A MIX OF RAIN...SLEET OR SNOW AS YOU WORK NE 
INTO CENTRAL VALLEY/SMOKIES...THEN MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW FOR EXTREME NE 
TN AND SW VA...BASED ON MODEL THICKNESSES AND SURFACE/LOW LEVEL 
TEMPS. 

SOME ENHANCEMENT NOTED ON IR SATELLITE PICS OVER PLATEAU...WITH THE 
RUC/GFS/ECMWF SHOWING SIMILAR QPF FOR TONIGHT...WHICH LENDS SUPPORT 
TO A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MOST OF OUR ERN MTNS ALONG THE 
TN-NC LINE. WILL KEEP THE ADVISORY CONFINED TO THOSE AREAS...AS 
TEMPS ARE GENERALLY TOO WARM FOR MUCH IF ANY ACCUMULATION ON PLATEAU 
AND ACROSS THE VALLEY...FOR THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON. FORCING ... 
(MAINLY ISENTROPIC LIFT WITH SOME JET DYNAMICS)...IS WEAKEST ACROSS 
SW VA AND NE TN...SO I DON'T SEE THE LIKELIHOOD OF A SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATION IN THOSE AREAS. ALSO...SURFACE TEMPS IN THE MID TO
UPPER 30S OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS WILL CAUSE MUCH OF THE SNOW
TO MELT INITIALLY. 

THURSDAY OFFERS A BRIEF BREAK IN THE WINTRY WEATHER...ALTHO CLOUDS 
MAY INCREASE RATHER QUICKLY IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS...AHEAD OF A 
STRONGER SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX IN THE STRENGTHENING NW FLOW ALOFT. I 
FAVORED THE COOLER MAX TEMPS THURSDAY BASED ON THESE CLOUDS. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY BRINGING SNOW AND 
RAIN TO THE AREA. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  AREA 
OF LOW PRESSURE TO THE NORTH BRINGING CHANCE FOR SNOW AND RAIN FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH AGAIN NEAR THE LOW. AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR THE 
PERIOD.  MOISTURE LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY...BUT WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY 
DRY FOR NOW.  GENERALLY STAYED BELOW MEX GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES... 
CLOSER TO HPC TEMPERATURES.

AND 40S BEFORE PRECIPITATION STARTS. FREEZING LEVELS WILL RISE TO
AROUND 5000 FEET BY AFTERNOON. AS SURFACE LOW SHIFTS EAST LATER
TONIGHT COLDER AIR WILL DROP SNOW LEVELS TO NEAR THE SURFACE. ONLY
EXPECTING A FEW TENTHS OF SNOWFALL IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BUT

SHOULD BE ABOVE FREEZING LOWER ELEVATIONS SOUTH TO A FEW DEGREES
BELOW FREEZING NORTH SO ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD NOT AFFECT ROADS MUCH
WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

THROUGH THE EXTENDED. MAIN CHANGE WAS TO ADJUST TEMPERATURES 
DOWNWARD. THURSDAY LOOKS DRY FOR THE AREA WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
TO OUR EAST AND A DRY W-NW FLOW ALOFT. NORTHWEST FLOW SHOWER EVENT 
SETS UP FOR FRIDAY WITH STRONG JET SEGMENT DIVING INTO TN VLY. UPPER 
TROF AXIS SHIFTS EAST SATURDAY AND MOISTURE BECOMES LIMITED. CUT OFF 
LOW DRIFTING THROUGH THE SW U.S. WILL BEGIN TO IMPACT AREA ON 
SUNDAY. MODELS NOT IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT. NORTHERN EXTENT OF 
INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AND DEVELOPING SURFACE WAVE/LOW WILL 
DETERMINE PRECIP TYPE AND EXTENT SUNDAY AND ESPECIALLY SUN NIGHT. 
LOW WILL TRACK EAST MOST LIKELY S OF MRX CWA MONDAY WITH CONTINUED 
CHC OF PCPN. LOW WILL BE EAST OF AREA TUE SETTING UP ANOTHER FLOW 
FLOW EVENT. AVAILABLE MOISTURE APPEARS LIMITED AT THIS TIME.

FXUS64 KMRX 031935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST MON JAN 3 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...TRANQUIL WEATHER PERSISTS 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS UPPER LEVEL FLOW REMAINS GENERALLY ZONAL 
AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ANCHORED OVER THE REGION. A WEAK 
UPPER WAVE/SURFACE COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION TUESDAY MORNING...BUT WEAK DYNAMICS AND LIMITED 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM SHOULD PRECLUDE ANYTHING OTHER 
THAN A BRIEF INCREASE IN MID-LEVEL CLOUDS. FOR TEMPS...MAV GUIDANCE 
APPEARS REASONABLE AND GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THOSE 
VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A ZONAL FLOW OVER THE SOUTHEAST BECOMES A BIT MORE AMPLIFIED ON 
WEDNESDAY AS A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA FROM THE 
WEST. BECAUSE OF THE ZONAL FLOW AHEAD OF THE TROUGH...MOST OF THE 
MOISTURE STAYS TO OUR SOUTH...BUT THE NAM AND THE CANADIAN PUT OUT 
SOME LIGHT QPF IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. THE CURRENT 
FORECAST CARRIES A SLIGHT CHANCE POP WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY BE 
A BIT GENEROUS...BUT WILL KEEP IT GOING FOR LACK OF CONFIDENCE TO 
REMOVE IT.

A CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL SIT AND SPIN OVER THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES 
REGION THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. A JET STREAK OVER CENTRAL CANADA 
WILL DIVE SOUTHEASTWARD AROUND THE LOW...BRINGING A SURGE OF ARCTIC 
AIR AND A CHANNELED VORT MAX OUR WAY THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS SHOULD 
BRING A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS...MAINLY TO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
AREA. A FAVORABLE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN DEVELOPS ON FRIDAY WITH 
VERY COLD AIR ALOFT CREATING STEEP LAPSE RATES AND 850 MB WINDS FROM 
THE NW AT 30-40 KTS. THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH 
THIS PATTERN...HOWEVER THE OPERATIONAL GFS DOES NOT HAVE MUCH 
SUPPORT FROM GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS...SO CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ENOUGH 
FOR JUST CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. 

A SLIGHT WARMING TREND CAN BE EXPECTED FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY 
AS A RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA...BUT TEMPS LOOK TO REMAIN BELOW 
NORMAL EACH DAY AS THE CLOSED LOW LINGERS OFF THE CANADIAN 
MARITIMES. WHILE THE GFS AND ECMWF APPEAR VERY DIFFERENT WITH THE 
DETAILS ON MONDAY...THEY BOTH INDICATE AN AMPLIFIED FLOW ALOFT AND A 
SYSTEM AFFECTING OUR AREA ON MONDAY. WILL INTRODUCE MONDAY WITH A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
700 AM EST MON JAN 3 2011

.AVIATION...HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP FLIGHT CONDITIONS VFR THROUGH 
THE TAF PERIOD. LIGHT NE WINDS WILL BECOME SW LATER HALF OF THE 
PERIOD.

SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA. VERY DRY CONDITIONS. WEAK WARM 
AIR ADVECTION TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL. 

LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODEL AND RUN CONSISTENCY 
REMAINS VERY POOR AND CONFIDENCE REMAINS VERY LOW THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.  GENERAL PATTERN LOOKS TO HAVE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT EARLY IN 
THE PERIOD...THEN TRANSITIONING INTO A DIGGING TROUGH BY THE END.  A 
SERIES OF SHORT WAVES ARE EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH THE GENERAL 
REGION...HOWEVER...TIMING...STRENGTH AND POSITION OF THESE WAVES ARE 
IN FLUX FROM MODEL TO MODEL AND RUN TO RUN.  NONE OF THE WAVES 
APPEAR TO BE PARTICULAR STRONG AND THEREFORE...HAVE NOT MADE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED.  THIS LEAVES LOW POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...LINGERING OVER NORTHERN AREAS IN THURSDAY...AND 
KEPT THINGS DRY THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EST SUN JAN 2 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE OUR 
WEATHER FOR THE SHORT TERM.  ANY LINGERING LOW CLOUDS WILL QUICKLY 
CLEAR OUT...THEN SHOULD HAVE A CLEAR NIGHT TONIGHT AND PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE ON MONDAY.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST A 
FEW MINOR TWEAKS.   


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT CONTINUES 
TO DETERIORATE WITH TIME THROUGH THE LONG TERM LEADING TO A 
LOWER-THAN-AVERAGE CONFIDENCE FORECAST. WIDE ENSEMBLE MEMBER SPREAD 
PRECLUDES MUCH HELP FROM THAT SOURCE. AT ANY RATE...MODELS GENERALLY 
DEPICT WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HAVE CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR THAT PERIOD AND BUMPED POPS UP TO LOW CHANCE FOR SOUTHERN 
TIER ZONES. THIS DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A SIGNIFICANT EVENT HOWEVER. 
BALANCE OF LONG TERM APPEARS GENERALLY DRY WITH SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS 
AS HEIGHTS FALL IN RESPONSE TO TROUGH DIGGING IN THE EASTER CONUS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
223 AM EST SUN JAN 2 2011

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER JET AXIS WILL MOVE EAST

PRESSURE RIDGE AXIS WILL BUILD IN FROM THE WEST AND BECOME CENTERED
OVER THE AREA LATE TONIGHT. LOW CLOUDS AND LIGHT PCPN WILL MOVE EAST 
OF AREA EARLY TODAY. SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR. GOOD COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL KEEP TEMPS NEARLY STEADY TODAY AND CONTINUE TO DROP 
TO BELOW NORMAL TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN EARLY 
IN THE EXTENDED WITH ZONAL FLOW MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  A MINOR 
IMPULSE SLIDES THROUGH AROUND TUESDAY BUT ONLY EXPECT AN OCCASIONAL 
BAND OF CLOUDS IN RESPONSE.  MODELS BEGINNING TO COME TOGETHER 
SOMEWHAT WITH AN APPROACHING SYSTEM AROUND THE WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT/THURSDAY PERIOD...HOWEVER...RUN CONSISTENCY IS QUITE POOR AND 
CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON BOTH TIMING AND DETAILS.  SO...HAVE 
TRENDED THE FORECAST TOWARDS THIS AND ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT ONLY.  THERE REMAINS SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN 
MODELS FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...THOUGH SOME SHOW AN UPPER LOW 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION BRINGING SOME LIGHT PRECIP INTO THE 
AREA.  FOR NOW...WILL LEAVE THIS PERIOD DRY...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO 
EVALUATE AS MODELS GET BETTER HANDLE ON THIS.

FXUS64 KMRX 020144
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST SAT JAN 1 2011

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR WEST OF THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED POST-FRONTAL 
SHOWERS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL PART OF THE NATION CONTINUES TO BRING SOME 
LIFT ACROSS THE REGION. MODELS AGREE THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL 
CONTINUE TO TRIGGER SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT SHOWERS OVERNIGHT...SO 
WILL LEAVE AT LEAST A SMALL POP IN THE FORECAST FOR MOST AREAS 
OVERNIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE VERTICAL THERMAL 
PROFILE SHOULD REMAIN WARM ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY RAIN ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO LOWER POPS AND TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME 
PATCHY FOG OVERNIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 012026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EST SAT JAN 1 2011

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE 
REGION...AND DRIER AIR WILL BEGIN MOVING IN.  LOOKS LIKE COLD AIR 
WILL NOT MOVE IN FAST ENOUGH FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT WINTRY PRECIP...AS 
PRECIP SHOULD END BEFORE MOST AREAS SEE ANY SUB FREEZING TEMPS.  
CANNOT RULE OUT SOME FREEZING DRIZZLE OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
LATE...BUT WILL NOT MENTION FOR NOW.  WINDS DIMINISHING...SO PLAN TO 
ALLOW WIND ADVISORIES/WARNINGS TO EXPIRE AT 21Z.  SHOULD SEE A 
DECREASE IN CLOUDS LATER TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST...WITH QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE SHORT TERM. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL ON TRACK FOR 
GENERALLY DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS TO PERSIST THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM AS UPPER FLOW REMAINS MORE OR LESS ZONAL. THE GFS AND CANADIAN 
GEM DEPICT WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE PRODUCING SOME LIGHT QPFS 
IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY THURSDAY...BUT THIS IS NOT 
SUPPORTED BY THE ECMWF AND HAS SUPPORT FROM ONLY A FEW OF THE GEFS 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. BASED ON GENERAL DISAGREEMENT AMONG THE MODELS... 
POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCE AND WIDE SPREAD AMONG ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS...HAVE NOT MADE ANY CHANGES TO DRY FORECAST FOR THAT PERIOD. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MAV/MEX 
GUIDANCE.


&&

THE EXCEPTION WHERE RAINFALL IS POSSIBLE THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD.

JET INCREASING IN STRENGTH IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND WILL PEAK 
AROUND 01/18Z ALONG THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EAST MIDDLE 
TN. STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS BEING OBSERVED ACROSS THE HIGH ELEVATIONS 
OVERNIGHT AND WILL CONTINUE TODAY. RADAR AND SATELLITE PICS INDICATE 
SOME DOWNSLOPING OCCURRING AND EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TODAY. WENT ON 
THE HIGH SIDE OF MOS TEMP GUIDANCE ACCOUNTING FOR DOWNSLOPING. THIS 
PATTERN SHOULD ALSO KEEP PCPN AMOUNTS DOWN SOME EARLY TODAY ACROSS 
NE AREAS. THETA-E RIDGE WILL CONTINUE NORTH INTO MIDDLE TN THIS 
MORNING. LOW LEVEL FRONTOGENESIS IMPRESSIVE AS SYSTEM APPROACHES 
EARLY TODAY BUT LESSENS BY THIS AFTERNOON. PRECIPITABLE WATER WELL 
ABOVE NORMAL. SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO 
REMAINS STRONG. THIS COUPLED WITH DEEP CONVECTION UPSTREAM OF MRX 
CWA TODAY SHOULD AID IN KEEPING FLOOD THREAT OF MRX CWA AT BAY. THE 
EXCEPTION BEING ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHICH COULD SEE A MORE 
PROLONGED RAINFALL EVENT. THE BEST FORCING AND DEEPEST CONVECTION 
EXPECTED TO BE INTO HEART OF EAST TN AROUND MID DAY. INSTABILITY IS 
WEAK AND OTHER SEVERE PARAMETERS NOT THAT IMPRESSIVE SO SEVERE 
THREAT APPEARS SMALL BUT SOME THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE THIS MORNING 
WITH STRONG WINDS THE GREATEST THREAT. THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THIS AFTERNOON. COLD AIR ADVECTION POTENT BEHIND THE FRONT TEMPS 
WILL FALL HARD IN THE TONIGHT PERIOD. PCPN WILL MOVE QUICKLY EAST OF 
THE AREA.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL TRANSITION INTO A DRY 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED WITH FLOW ALOFT BECOMING ZONAL.  A 
COUPLE OF DISTURBANCES TRACKING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WILL MOVE AN 
OCCASIONAL BAND OF CLOUDS THROUGH.  THE FIRST OF THE DISTURBANCES 
SLIDES THROUGH ON TUESDAY...ANOTHER ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND 
POSSIBLY A THIRD ON FRIDAY.  AT THIS TIME...NONE OF THESE SYSTEMS 
LOOK STRONG ENOUGH OVER THE MRX CWA TO GENERATE ANY PRECIP.  SO FOR 
NOW...WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.


&&
